3.description: Call me old-fashioned, but I like smaller bars "where everyone knows your name".  First visit tonight and you can tell this is the type of bar where you can become a regular.If you like to listen to rap or hip-hop, this is not your bar.  The bar is full of country music and classic rock (with some 80s hairband to mix it up).  The bartender/owner is very polite and attentive.My friend and I had a blast and will definitely be back.Notes:They take credit cardsFree popcornJukebox and game system

1.description: This bar is true Chicago. Located on a quiet residential streets of bungalows and wide lawns, Newark Nook is a bar in a 100+ year old home. I met some friends there on a Sunday night for drinks, so the place was pretty slow, but they still had some hot dog fixings out from an earlier buffet and hand-printed posters advertising a Christmas party at the bar the night before. The ladies' bathroom has a remarkable selection of lotions and hairsprays (some look like they might be from the 80s). I give the Newark Nook 4 stars because it's important that places like this exist. It's family-owned, community-supported and has history and longevity. But, like the city I call home and love, it is flawed - sometimes even cringe-worthily so. The bartender was responsive - definitely not rude. But he certainly wasn't welcoming, warm or friendly. Even though I'm a northsider and my two friends are Norwood Parkers born and bred, we felt like outsiders. The back walls are covered in framed photos of cops - mainly of cops in riot gear. Some of cops in riot gear clashing with protesters. My favorite was the photo of a line of cops with shields and batons and a caption reading "Welcome to Chicago. Now sit down and shut up." So this probably isn't the place to wear your "I Can't Breathe" shirt or reminisce about your Occupy Chicago days. I hope Newark Nook sticks around but, like a lot of Chicago neighborhoods, it's rooted in a time and place and attitude that should evolve.

2.description: Great Staff and prices. Best bar in the area. Loooove. Love the neighborhood. Can't get any better than this!

9.description: What a dying breed this place is.  Which is too bad, because I love places like this! Like what? Read on my friends, read on....First and foremost, there isn't some tool pressing ' play next' each time they go up to the jukebox... only to skip my song to play "Tonight's gonna be a good night'  for the 45th time.Second, your beer will be refilled instantly and you will like it.You get to choose where you want to sit...and you're left alone.No pushy or non-attentive servers...Definitely hit this place up if you're in the neighborhood and show some support!Perfect place for the nights you want to go out but don't want to see anyone. You know exactly what I mean.

10.description: the beer specials are pretty good,but they will treat you like a second class citizen if you are not a member of a police department,how stupid is that,i stopped going there.

4.description: What a great neighborhood place! The beer is ice-cold always, and the best specials around. A nice mom and.pop place to hang out and not be bothered. It's always filled with neighbors and city workers. free WiFi is a plus. Huge Blackhawks/Bears supporters. Great internet jukebox.

6.description: Great little neighborhood bar.  I've on been here about three times played darts in the back & free popcorn! Also, ladies check out the bathroom about 8+ lotions & perfumes.  Great service every time. A bucket of Millers just $10!!

12.description: Great bar where you can just go and relax.

5.description: They don't make then like this anymore...a Chicago neighborhood tavern, actually in the middle of a quiet , affluent residential block. Great place for ladies who don't wanna be bothered. Small place, good for games, whatever your sport. Service can be indifferent, but not offensive. Lots of Chicago firemen, but they are not hard to drink with.

13.description: Love this bar, can't wait to watch a bears game here.  I feel like I'm on vacation. No douchebags, just normal local people, great drink specials, and awesome owners.

11.description: If you're looking for a quiet, out of the way not updated bar, this is it. This is NOT the kind of place for people who like to go out to be seen. This bar is on a residential street, and is probably meant for neighborhood folks. There is a sign on the inside of the exit door that states that you must respect the neighbors and leave quietly. This was a last stop for us before going home, and was a nice change from the loud college kids that were at the previous places. The crowd was mature, and laid back. I can't say that I would make this a weekly stop, however, if I wanted to go out for a drink and not be hassled, I might go here. Sometimes, low key is just what I need.

8.description: I used to live around the corner from this place years ago and was glad to have a cold one here. Neighborhood taverns like this are dying all over Chicagoland due to changing times. Keep them going by stopping in and buying a few rounds.

0.description: An awesome neighborhood bar. The neighborhood here is filled with police officers and firefighters so this is inevitably a cop/firefighter bar. They have a good selection of beer and all the liquor you could possibly need. It's an old school neighborhood dive bar - no food, cleanliness is okay. All in all, still a kick ass bar to watch the game. Plenty of tvs.

7.description: Never going back. Bartender was rude, the place smelled, and my beer was old and skunked.

3.description: I have been going to this nail salon for years.  The owner, Anna, keeps an immaculate shop and everything is always spotless.  No gross-out factor here--this place is amazing! Anna gives the BEST pedicures in the world that reshape your toes and nails, and the polish lasts for seriously a month.  The other women that work here are incredible as well, and you truly won't be disappointed.  Manicures are also amazing--they last for weeks without chipping, and the polish is perfection.  Call ahead, they are usually busy!For the extra $5 or $10--you will be thrilled.  Their nail polishes are always the newest colors, and new bottles.  No thick, icky, polish here.  They are top notch in every area.  Love this place!!!

1.description: I would like to express my wonderful experience in this salon. The woman here are extremely efficient and talented. Nothing but professionalism and kindness. Anna and her girls are outstanding. I have been getting my nails done for over 20 years and these girls are definitely one of the best. Call ahead always booked. Always on time and very respectful to all clients. You will not be disappointed tell your friends and make it a regular visit.

2.description: DO NOT GO HERE!  Inexperienced and unprofessional nail technicians.  I walked out after she could not even file my nails straight across and she was gripping my hand upwards trying to file.  Considering the cost of a manicure is $22 ($7 above the average), I would NEVER spend my money here.  I went to Sophie and she was awful, I am glad I walked out when I did and did not spend a dime here.

0.description: I've been going here for years. They give the best pedicures! Never rushed and an awesome foot and leg massage too.

3.description: Went there to get cough medicine for my Dad because he was sick. Got some Tussin and they asked for an ID. Was upset because I had to walk all the way back but it was understandable. They can't sell it without an ID, then those are the rules. However, I come back with an ID and I get TWO cashiers checking it. Like I'm going to use a fake ID to get a bottle of Tussin. Whatever, annoying but not the kicker. I get my change back and hurry home to give my dad the medicine. Find out the change is off by 10$. Just very unpleasant for no reason. :/

1.description: BEWARE! Pharmacy staff are really incompetent! They have given the wrong prescriptions to my family - not once but TWICE! They dispensed a FORMER prescription to an elderly family member - who was unaware that they had done this. They gave blood pressure medicine in the wrong dosage which can have terrible consequences - Thank God we discovered the mistake in time. They are extremely busy and obviously can't handle the volume correctly. Don't take the risk - Find another pharmacy and be safe! Medicine is too important not to.

2.description: Love my pharmacy! No matter how busy it is the staff always makes it a great experience!

5.description: This store has the worst pharmacy staff.  They are incompetent, disorganized and rude.  I have had nothing but issues with the staff not filling prescriptions properly, being very slow with long wait times in the drive thru and total lack of basic common sense and courtesy from the staff.  It's a shame because the location is great and they are 24 hours.

6.description: I have not ever dealt with such incompetence with obtaining a script.  One day a tech says one thing the next day another tech says, "Sign the forms then wait 48 hours.."  I asked, "WHAT?"     There is NO delivery service.  I am tired of it...

7.description: On 8/20/13 my 11 yr old son and his friends were in there buying a soda and the African American supervisor told them to get their "Klu Klux Klan outta there, you only have a few more days before school starts and you don't need to be in here..." Both the store mgr and district mgr were alerted. The store mgr never apologized and replied, "I'll take care of it and what else?' What else?? Really?? The supervisor-Brenda was not fired and still works there. I requested a written formal apology and over a month later, I'm still waiting for that apology.  I'm taking my business AWAY FROM ALL CVS!!!

8.description: For one, open 24 hours/365 days per year. The pharmacy staff is very organized and helpful. The store is neat, organized, and clean. The are well stocked. My favorite CVS ever!

0.description: The best part of coming to this CVS store on Leap Day was finding out that someone mad stuffed toys out of the different emoji and the best one is the Poop emoji-which had arms and legs! Service was quick and my cousin did find a beverage to drink!

4.description: I stopped here the other day because I needed stamps and I cannot abide waiting in line at the post office. Now, I live across the street from a Walgreens, but of course, it is a crappy Walgreens and they are always out of stamps, so I grab them when the opportunity strikes.This CVS is large, very clean and very well organized unlike my crappy Walgreens. I wish I had more time to check this one out, but I was in a bit of a rush. I did pick up a few plants from the tent that is set up in the parking lot. (My crappy Walgreens only has garbage and rude people in its lot). CVS had both flowers and veggies ready for planting. I even got some Brussels Sprouts to add to my garden.What I really like was that everything was so neatly organized in the store. It had a crisp look to it. I think they could benefit from a bit brighter lighting, but if this store was a bit closer to home, it would be a regular stop for sure.

58.description: After moving to Norwood park, my wife and I had to find some new "go-to" restaurants to order from. We chose this one based on grub hub reviews and it's the one! Haven't had a dish yet that wasn't exceptional, and the crab Rangoon is a regular for us

56.description: Three words: Crunchy California Roll!It is a Cali Roll that they fry in tempura!!! Oh my god! To die for!!!Great food, and the prices are pretty good too.

29.description: I recently discovered this place after moving to the neighborhood months ago, and I was thrilled!  My old neighborhood was flooded with sushi places and I was constantly craving it with no place to go.  After finding Bangkok Belly on Yelp, I immediately had to try it, and was happy to find that it was as good as the reviews said it was.  The ambiance isn't the greatest, it's a tiny place without much decor, but the food definitely makes up for that.  I haven't tried their Thai food yet, but plan on it very soon!  And it's BYOB, which is always a great bonus!

42.description: Great food and excellent service!!! One of my favorite spots for me & my girl... We love this place!!!

23.description: Just ordered pad Thai and red dragon roll. It was all completely flavorless. I ended up throwing almost all of it away. It was a complete waste of money.

47.description: I had a dentist visit in the area. I yelp this place before and finally I tried it.It was around lunch time I got a salmon lunch special that comes with miso and sea weed, additional spicy tako roll, and some nigiri sushi.All I can say are good things the stuff was very nice the sushi itself tasted very fresh, the rolls where right size. And my to go lunch was packed very well. This place is great for lunch dinner and takeouts. I wish I have it around the corner.

8.description: I have NO complaints about this restaurant.  Clean, attractive and great food - what more can you ask for?  I had the basil chicken and it was a large portion and had great flavor and very crisp fresh veggies.  My mom (never had Thai before) tried the Pad Thai and I was really impressed - not at all bland, which I think is typical for pad thai, and it had large pieces of chicken instead of those weird 'grated' looking chicken bits I usually see in that dish.  My sis in law had the veggie panang curry and said it was outstanding.  Finished it off w/ Thai iced coffee that was DELICIOUS.  Close to my house, cute shopping right around the restaurant - I will be back!

31.description: After seeing the good reviews from Yelp and UrbanSpoon I had to try Bangkok Belly, unfortunately I did not read all the reviews. I ordered the Pad Thai; rookie mistake. Tiny noodles and the added chicken was scarce. My girlfriend had the crunchy shrimp and spicy tuna, we both have had better. The best thing here is the crab rangoon, the sauce along with it was awesome. Maybe we chose the wrong items but either way my last time at Bangkok Belly was my last time. Happy Eating People!

34.description: This restaurant has an attractive little dining room and a nice lunch menu. However, my pad see ew tasted burned. Not sure how that's possible, but I was unimpressed.

16.description: I will start by saying i never actually ate the food here. My experience was soured by a sole phone call to place an order for pick up. I visited the website, took a look at the menu, and my husband and I picked some sushi to order. He calls, tells her our order, and then asks to redeem the coupon offered on their menu website - free crab rangoons with a certain dollar amount purchase. The person taking the order tells us that the coupon is no longer valid. "It's still on your website," we say, but the lady would not budge. We ended up cancelling our order.I know it wasn't a huge deal, but it just irked me that they restaurant wouldn't honor it's own coupon on its own website. I understand the menu may be out of date, but then at least honor the deal to a new customer, and then change your online menu.Perhaps I'll give this place a try again one day, but for now, no Bangkok Belly for me.

13.description: Just wanted to write an update as its been a while since I wrote my original review.  Bangkok belly continues to be our once a week go to for nearby sushi thats not super pricey.  Our absolute staple order is : Godzilla roll, Ocean fire Roll, and Edamame.  Our favorite appetizer is the crab rangoon.  We usually order takeout and save this for dessert at the end. We will definately continue to order from here :)

11.description: This is  the perfect neighborhood dining experience.The food is delicious. The staff are nice and helpful. The selection is great. The space, while small, is cute and homey. The prices are fair.

39.description: I went here for an early dinner with my niece on June 17. It has been to darn hot for me to cook on the bar-b-q grill. We decided to give this place a shot after reading the Yelp reviews. I got the impression that maybe the Yelpers who reviewed this place are "locals" from the area (or perhaps work close to the area) or they haven't really tried super incredible Asian food.  Oh, but I digress. Let's get down to the review now.  I ordered the chicken and pineapple fried rice for $8 (was worth maybe $6). They also have another location in Park Ridge, IL.My niece ordered three different sushi dishes. She said they were very, very good. I cannot rate the sushi because I didn't have any, and I was not offered any to "taste." Her sushi was brought out within five minutes. On the other hand, my food did not arrive at the same time. My niece was half-way through with her sushi by the time my food arrived. Not cool. My food tasted like it had been cooked in burned stale oil. It had a nasty burned taste to it which I couldn't stomach. I was starting to feel sick, so I stopped eating. It had a very bad taste and it left a horrible after-taste. Awful. Quantity over quality drives this restaurant. I don't think they will be around for more than one or two more years -- if they are lucky. Our Server came over twice because she must have noticed that I wasn't eating my dinner. She asked, "Is everything okay?" How do you answer that question without offending her. Maybe I should have said it tasted like burned oil, but I didn't want to be rude since our Server was very sweet. I smiled. I asked for a "to go" box. My niece told her I didn't like my food because it had a funny taste. She said, "Oh, it's probably the curry -- I don't like curry -- maybe it was the curry." Again, I smiled. I didn't say a word. Believe me, it was NOT the curry!!! Then, I thought maybe she will not charge me for it, because I only took three forkfuls of rice. I barely touched the food and she obviously noticed. Well, I got nailed for the entire amount (even though I barely touched it). I took it home and gave it to my husband who will eat anything. Really. He has a cast-iron stomach. I wondered if she would have charged me the full amount if I told her I didn't want to take it home with me. Whatever (with sarcasm)!The restaurant has lime green walls, with a long wooden bench against the wall. It has nine tables for parties of two or four. The aesthetics are worthy of two stars. It is the kind of place where you eat fast, because you want to get the hell out of there. I noticed they still have some Christmas decorations up (green garland), and three large gold stars in the window. They are probably the same people who leave up their Christmas lights year-round -- never take them down. The glass windows are large, but it was dark and dingy inside the restaurant (even though it was a sunny, bright day). The light fixtures consist of off-white squared-shaped paper lanterns hanging above several tables. I was really, really disappointed with what I ordered. Thus, I rate it with ONE star. My final rating is TWO stars, because we had no issues parking in this area and found a legal spot in front of the restaurant. However, service is worthy of THREE stars. Would I come back here again? Did I like the food? I am sure you can guess the answers to these questions! (with sarcasm)BTW, my niece liked the sushi that she ordered. She had three different kinds of sushi and it was $20 (excluding tip). I thought it was a bit pricey. Come on! This is not the Butterfly Sushi restaurant. I wouldn't know what her sushi tasted like, because she never offered any to me. Yeah, whatever. Also, I didn't bother to ask her "can I have some of your sushi" even though my tummy was roaring and growling with hunger. My evening ended with me going to Mariano's and purchasing dinner for myself. It was spicy salmon sushi which was made fresh and before my eyes. You cannot beat the sushi at Mariano's -- really, really fresh and quality ingredients are used in every roll. This restaurant is located in an odd location -- right next door to the State Farm Insurance Co. This is not a very exciting area of the city. Nothing.  Dead. Boring. Rating this joint with four or five stars is like rating a New York City rat (the size of a freakin' cat) with four or five stars.

37.description: I have both eaten in and ordered delivery.. the service when dining in was fine... we came in for a book club meeting/dinner so there was a table of 8 of us.  It was very quiet and no other customers dining in.   Everyone was very happy with their meal. Let me skip to the chase - I love their crab rangoon.  Its just lighter and creamier than what I have had before.  LOVE.  My delivery experience was equally positive.   I ordered online and they were very quick in delivery times and the food was still steaming hot.     Pad Thai was very good!

0.description: This is a cute little place located Norwood Park. I usually order for take out or delivery but the decor at Bankok Belly is pretty cool with a sushi bar to boot! Its also BYOB!The food always tastes fresh and made to order. We uaually get the usual stuff (curries, pad see eiw, pad thai, tom yum soup, etc. We really enjoy all of it. The only thing is that i almost always indicate that i want my order to be spicy and it only comes mildly spicy...if at all spicy. Thank goodness I have spices at home to doctor it up to my preferred spice level. The people who work there are really nice and the service is fast.  The prices are reasonable and very easy to get to with ample street parking. Writing this review is making me want to order some takeout from them!

38.description: Ok so we decided to have some Thai cousins and since we love in the area and like local places we ended up ordering teriyaki chicken with some salad and crab Rangoon. And must I say as soon as my fiancée opened her meal all she got was some chicken on white rice with teriyaki sauce poured all over it. Crab Rangoon tasted ok and the egg rolls were ok. Miso soup tasted like a package that you'd get from Dominick's diluted with hot water. All and all we are not going to make another visit to the restaurant. Thanks but no thanks

51.description: Had Philly Role, Big Pad Thai and Red Curry - very good taste.  Restaurant is very clean and our waitress was very friendly.  Prices were on par with most Thai about $8 per entree.

27.description: Great food, arrived like it was just cooked. Very hot and fresh. Ordered Pad Thai and Basil Chicken.

32.description: Great neighborhood place.  I have done both carry out and dine in, and it is always fresh and flavorful.  The lunch special is great, and so is the Tom Kha soup.

54.description: I will start by saying i never actually ate the food here. My experience was soured by a sole phone call to place an order for pick up. I visited the website, took a look at the menu, and my husband and I picked some sushi to order. He calls, tells her our order, and then asks to redeem the coupon offered on their menu website - free crab rangoons with a certain dollar amount purchase. The person taking the order tells us that the coupon is no longer valid. "It's still on your website," we say, but the lady would not budge. We ended up cancelling our order.I know it wasn't a huge deal, but it just irked me that they restaurant wouldn't honor it's own coupon on its own website. I understand the menu may be out of date, but then at least honor the deal to a new customer, and then change your online menu.Perhaps I'll give this place a try again one day, but for now, no Bangkok Belly for me.

48.description: The food is excellent. The only negative about the experience is that the server isn't very personable. It seems as though it's painful for her to crack a smile or to say "you're welcome" after you say "thank you".

44.description: Have to say this place has AMAZING sushi. If you're looking for a change of pace in food, this is place to be.The other thing that is awesome, is the cozy enviroment they setup.Overall, great food, and happy addition to Norwood Park.

24.description: Best Thai you'll get on this side of town. It's nothing spectacular, but it's also not Panda Express! Staff is polite. The crab rangoon is always great, as well as the pad Thai and Thai fried rice. Had the orange chicken once and it was not awesome. I now stick to the more traditional choices.

7.description: Crab Rangoon: delicious Sushi: decent/edible Pad Thai: Horribleand idk how they screw this one up but the chicken fried rice smells like dog food and has a really odd taste. Not good. But, they deliver.

49.description: Tried to order the Vegan Egg Roll starter but the server told us they weren't actually vegan. We walked out.

40.description: Quick pickup service and great value. Good mix of sushi and thai options. BYOB dine-in can't be beat.

53.description: I feel so bad leaving a poor review because the people here are so nice! We ordered two sushi roles (spider roll & dragon roll), a mango smoothie, and a salad. Not impressed for a $40 meal. Bummed out that we won't be ordering from here again. Maybe their entrees are better!

30.description: Cheap delivery charge. Food was what we expected. The lemon iced tea is liquid crack!

46.description: Went in there around 7:30 with my boyfriend and it was empty. Our server was very friendly. We ordered two soups (the thai noodle boat soup) and one thai chicken fried rice. It was very delicious, we we're happy with the food. We'll definitely be coming back.

1.description: I visited Chicago this past weekend and my sister took me out to Bangkok Belly for my last meal in Chicago.  We were looking for something simply low key, delicious and not very expensive and we found ourselves in a warm welcoming, cozy and cute dinning room of Bangkok.As a native of Thailand, what strikes me first is the crude hand written writings in Thai on the back walls - most are playful, some are childish and many are plain fun that brought me a smile. They have a large but manageable menu.  We ordered in Thai, tempura appetizer, seafood fried rice and Thai boat noodle.  Shrimp and Vegetables tempura came quickly.  It was crunchy and the accompanying dipping sauce was just right.  The main course timely came later and they nailed it!  The seafood fried rice was seasoned evenly with nam prik prao sauce and white pepper.  The seafood was fresh and generously portioned.  The Thai boat noodles had also delicious broth.  Long, thin rice noodle was cooked perfectly.  The beef was slightly hard but flavorful.  Both of these dishes are my favorites to order back home in Thailand and Bangkok belly did a great job!Coming from Washington DC where Thai food is now a rising trend in fine dining.  I wish we would have more restaurants like Bangkok Belly in Norwood Park where it feels like eating casually in a small cafe in Thailand, not over the top but serves delicious food prepared fresh, taste close to home, and doesn't break my bank that I can go a few times a week.  BYOB is a big plus!

55.description: Tried Thai food here several times and I'm always impressed.  Pad see eiw ( stir-fried noodle with sweet soy sauce) and Pad thai do taste like what you would get in Bangkok! YUMMY!   The decor is cute and casaul, service is vey friendly and you get lots of food for the price.  This will definitely be my go-to place to fix my Thai craving.  Must try!

9.description: Went there with 5 friends on a trip that I took from Texas. We randomly wanted Thai and drove around till we found a place that was sit down and open. The restaurant is small but absolutely beautiful and cozy and BYOB is always a plus. The menu is very reasonably priced as well and the plating of our food was exquisite.I started off trying one of my friend's Crab Rangoons. It was no overly stuffed but was also not lacking in any stuffing or flavor. I paid $6 for six goldenCalifornia rolls as my appetizer. This was a roll with cucumber, crab avacado and deep fried. It was warm but not hot, and it wasn't sticky or mushy. They rolls were all hand made, and since we had a large party, it took a while to get our food. After that I had the garlic chicken which, I think was $8. The garlic was not overpowering and there was an even amount of chicken, veggies, sauce and rice on the plate for the entree.Such good food for such a great price and excellent service. I would definitely return if I am in that area again one day.

26.description: Recently moved from area with a lot of thai places to choose from. I'm SO glad to have this restaurant nearby! It's small but modern and very friendly. We have only tried the sushi which was great! Can't wait to try the thai.

25.description: Sitting here right now! Sweet little place. My 5 yr old daughter loved the pineapple fried rice...."cashew!!!" The sashimi and rolls tasted fresh. Love the decor and attentive server.  Try it!

12.description: If I could give it less than a star, I would. Food was bland. Food from Siam Thai is way better. Not even comparable. Food had barely any flavor. Sushi had a weird taste.

59.description: Had a couple orders from here.  I love the curry flavors in the pineapple fried rice, the pad thai isnt as good as Elephant but most of the items that I've had were good.  Its another choice when Elephant Thai or Siam Treasure are closed.Choose order by phone as an option vs online ordering.

21.description: Crab Rangoon: delicious Sushi: decent/edible Pad Thai: Horribleand idk how they screw this one up but the chicken fried rice smells like dog food and has a really odd taste. Not good. But, they deliver.

17.description: After seeing the good reviews from Yelp and UrbanSpoon I had to try Bangkok Belly, unfortunately I did not read all the reviews. I ordered the Pad Thai; rookie mistake. Tiny noodles and the added chicken was scarce. My girlfriend had the crunchy shrimp and spicy tuna, we both have had better. The best thing here is the crab rangoon, the sauce along with it was awesome. Maybe we chose the wrong items but either way my last time at Bangkok Belly was my last time. Happy Eating People!

10.description: a friend of mine in chicago highly recommended this place after i mentioned that i would be moving to chicago. i made it here on a trip to secure my new place, and i left highly satisfied with the overall dining experience. i started off with crab rangoon, and i was amazingly surprised with the flavor. the touch of pepper added a kick of spice which gave it a unique taste. size-wise, they were hugh, and hugh with the stuffing not the thick shell. i had a chance to also try their potstickers, and i liked it that they were pan-fried. i couldn't say anything about their thai cuisine because i only tried their sushi rolls. but seriously, their rolls were amazing, especially "sashimi roll" with all assorted fish rolled together which make each bite nothing but perfect.the wait staff was very nice and friendly. the ambience was also very pleasant: not too big, quiet and clean.definitely i was hooked! see you soon, sashimi roll!!!!

5.description: Had the Bangkok Belly Platter D 25 pieces of chefs choice.  Over all the fish quality was pretty fair but the portions where a bit small.  The presentation was good and found the fish selection to be decent.  I defiantly have had been sashimi but the price was pretty good for the quantity.   The platter came with soup miso soup which again nothing exciting but not bad.Also its a bit of a pain to find the place as the signage for it wasn't the best.

3.description: First time there - tried a good sampling of things on their menu. Thai Scallop appetizer, Japanese seaweed salad, sushi rolls,  and Thai noodles with seafood. All were excellent. Nice little cozy restaurant - great friendly service. Nice to have Bangkok Belly so close to  home - we'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu soon !

35.description: This is our go to delivery place. My girlfriend and I even have a usual order. I love their crab rangoon. Their peanut sauce is amazing and their chicken satay is yummy. Their Pad Thai is the BEST in the area. I would highly recommend them. They are always super friendly and delivery is usually fairly quick. A total win!

19.description: The BEST Pad Thai ever!!!Love this little restaurant in Norwood Park. Great service, great decor, and seriously amazing food.

28.description: The BEST Pad Thai ever!!!Love this little restaurant in Norwood Park. Great service, great decor, and seriously amazing food.

45.description: I go here about two or three times a month, and never had a bad experience. The food is great, and the service is always friendly. There are a lot of options to choose from, from more traditional rolls to deep-fried sushi (surprisingly good!), along with a decent selection of Thai dishes. The sushi is delicious, but not as high-quality as some places. I don't mean that as a knock, just a warning.

33.description: There are so many option to choose from! The fried tofu, vegan egg rolls, and tofu pad tai are simply magnificent! I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone in the area!

43.description: I freaking love this place. We stopped doing take out because they are so nice to our toddler daughter whenever we come.  Plus, BYOB, baby!We take out of town visitors here, and they always rave.For the love of God, order the Mexican roll.  So tasty!

2.description: Want to start out by saying how rude the waitress was when we walked in. My girlfriend and I just ordered, waited 10 minutes for what looked like was made since lunch. I ordered the red dragon and spicy California roll, she got salmon sashimi. Spicy California roll was okay, but the other stuff is not fresh at all. Made my girlfriend throw up, definitely would not recommend eating there. Going back tomorrow to get my money back

18.description: This place is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. The interior is cozy and the service is always great. The staff have always been very courteous. The food here is excellent. The Pad Thai is excellent. But what really impresses me is their sushi. They have some great rolls and it adds variety to the menu. We order delivery from this place several times a month and are always pleased with the accuracy, promptness, and taste of the order.

41.description: Placing the order online for pickup was effortless. Nicely packaged to bring home. I had Tom Kha soup  and it was far from what  I have had at other restaurants. The aromas of ginger and lime leaves were missing and for some reason it was way too sweet. I also ordered the fresh spring rolls and they tasted like nothing (no basil), the sauce was a corn starchy concoction that smelled like a cleaning product. The cucumber salad was different it was cut into wedges  and didn't have a chance to absorb the juices which again was super sweet.  The saving grace were the assorted rolls, I had  California, spicy salmon very flavorful. Felt like I went to two different places.

52.description: BAD SERVICE!!!! I like their food but have ordered from them so many times (delivery) and was really pissed off when they charge me a dollar extra for extra sprouts and onion on my pad thai...was ok with paying it even though I find it petty since both are super cheap. I expect to get what I pay for though and I didn't. When I called back to let them know, I just wanted them to say they would correct it next time. They said that they added it and hung up....won't be ordering from them again!

50.description: Ordered from GrubHub...food was ready on time and the rolls were great. Awesome food for a good price. A hidden gem on Northwest Highway! Looking forward to trying their other rolls.

4.description: Very good food and service. We started with the Crab Rangoon based on Yelp recommendations and it was spot on. More flavorful then any I've ever had, amazing! My girls had miso soup and it was packed full of tofu and seaweed which I love. My husband had the Tom Kha soup which he said was very good. For our main entrees I had the garlic chicken which rarely impresses me anywhere. Here it was pack full of flavor. My husband liked the Pad See Eiw and said it was very good but he did which the noodles were a bit crispier. My girls shared the combination fried rice and it was full of flavor and lots of meat. Would highly recommend this place.

6.description: Loved EVERYTHING I tried off the menu..and the sushi rolls were excellent as well!!..A very quaint "mom and pop" restaurant. ..quiet and homelike atmosphere.  Now if only you can get the waitress to smile.. (always seems depressed )..lol..I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT. ...

22.description: This place is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. The interior is cozy and the service is always great. The staff have always been very courteous. The food here is excellent. The Pad Thai is excellent. But what really impresses me is their sushi. They have some great rolls and it adds variety to the menu. We order delivery from this place several times a month and are always pleased with the accuracy, promptness, and taste of the order.

15.description: Ordered carryout many times.  Food is fast, fresh and consistently good.  It's great having a local place that serves fresh sushi.  I've tried out unfamiliar dishes and I've never been disappointed.

57.description: Don't ever order anything by delivery.  Was told an hour, no one called and an hour and half later food finally shows.  No call or heads up of delayed delivery.

20.description: Went there with 5 friends on a trip that I took from Texas. We randomly wanted Thai and drove around till we found a place that was sit down and open. The restaurant is small but absolutely beautiful and cozy and BYOB is always a plus. The menu is very reasonably priced as well and the plating of our food was exquisite.I started off trying one of my friend's Crab Rangoons. It was no overly stuffed but was also not lacking in any stuffing or flavor. I paid $6 for six goldenCalifornia rolls as my appetizer. This was a roll with cucumber, crab avacado and deep fried. It was warm but not hot, and it wasn't sticky or mushy. They rolls were all hand made, and since we had a large party, it took a while to get our food. After that I had the garlic chicken which, I think was $8. The garlic was not overpowering and there was an even amount of chicken, veggies, sauce and rice on the plate for the entree.Such good food for such a great price and excellent service. I would definitely return if I am in that area again one day.

36.description: Bangkok Belly - 7/25/2014 The service is AWESOME!!! The food was decent we had the California Roll and the Vegetable Eggrolls as appetizers and then the Pad Thai and Pad See Eiw. I am of course comparing it to other Thai restaurants that I've been to and this food was decent, but not phenomenal like I had heard. The decor is simple and the chairs are comfortable.

14.description: Great place to come with family and friends. I've been here a few times and it's always been good. The service is good but I really would love for the waitress to be more fluent in English. The bathroom is one of the best I've seen in a restaurant in the city.

58.description: My wife and I tried it over the weekend and were pleased.  Open, airy atmosphere, decent beer selection and good food.  Nice to have another go to restaurant in the area.  Will be back.

56.description: Great place! Impressive selection of excellent beers on tap. Delicious food - burgers are outstanding, and spot on service. Look forward to going back!

29.description: Chucky Cheese? Too many kids. Drinks were good. Ffsh and chips and salads not good. Service was good. No need for me to go back.

42.description: Great place for drinks and dinner, with a couple looking for a lively atmosphere, to groups. Our group tonight had four friends, and subsequent groups of 10, 12, and 20 came in on a Tuesday night. Even though the waitstaff wasn't expecting the place to fill up on a Tuesday night, they handled it like pros. While there are plenty of craft beers to be found here, I was here just under a year ago and the craft beer list was largely unchanged, so I would prefer to see a little more variety/rotation. Our food was amazing. From our appetizers of calamari as large as small/med onion rings, to the pulled pork and cheddar fritters -- yes, pulled pork in a ball mixed with cheddar cheese and deep fried with bbq dipping sauce. Highly recommend either or both. For entrees our party had 1/2 lb Bacon Cheeseburger (solid), Steak Salad (amazing), Pulled Pork/Burger on a flatbread (amazing), and a Pulled Pork Sandwich (excellent). Celebratory chocolate/hazelnut cake with raspberry sauce, candied walnuts, and whipped cream. Yum! In addition to the good food and drinks, we prolonged our celebration night for four hours. Julie, our server was as attentive as she was charming, and a good sport to the antics of 40-something year old juveniles. While this was my return trip (brick oven pizza also highly recommended), the other three were first-timers and all said they would return. One even took a Pulled Pork/Burger and fries to go!

23.description: The first time I went here my family really enjoyed it.  The pizzas were tasty, the patio was comfortable, and they had a nice children's menu.  My one complaint was that the waitress had no idea about the beer on tap.  We asked what they had on one of their rotating handles and she simply said "I dont know."  but she didnt go and ask.... we asked her about another kind of beer and again... it was an "I dont know."  Strange.  But we liked the atmosphere and food enough to come back a week later.  This time we had a terrible experience.  We went in on a Tuesday at 5pm with 2 kids.  It took 15 minutes to get our first beer.  The waitress completely forgot the kids drinks until after the food arrived.  When the pizza arrived after 40  minutes, she had put in the wrong kind of pizza.  We ordered another beer and that took another 20 minutes to get.  Everyone was getting really cranky and annoyed and we just wanted to get out of there.  We ate quickly and asked for the bill which took another 20 minutes to get.  This is unacceptable.  The waitress also had no idea about items on the menu.  I was going to ask a soup of the day and asked what was in it, and she didnt know and didnt find out.  She also had no idea about the beer list.  Frustrated that this place has potential but needs to really work on their game and wait staff.

47.description: Went here last Saturday for dinner around 6:30pm. Finding parking wasn't easy with the snowstorm we recently had, and the parking lot they have is so small it only fits about 10 cars. The good news is that there was no wait at all to be seated, the staff was very nice, and the restaurant was very spacious. I liked the ambiance, minus the screaming children at the table next to ours. That, of course, isn't the restaurant's fault. There were a lot of families here with kids, which is understandable since it's one of the only modern restaurants in Norwood Park. I kind of expected it to be more like the Garage or a bar in Edison Park that was geared a little more towards the 20's crowd, though - a bar that just happened to serve good food - so that caught me a little off guard. The music was a little weird for a bar, too, they were playing oldies but goodies from Jason Mraz and the Fray. May have just been for the dinner hours? The bar menu was pretty decent, they have 20 or so beers on tap. $6 for a 16oz. craft beer... Didn't seem too much more expensive than Bar Louie or Park Tavern. My husband ordered a beer flight for $8 which was cheaper than most places we've been to.For food, we ordered the Spinach & Artichoke Dip appetizer, which was delicious. The pita bread was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. You can tell it didn't just come out of a box. For dinner, I ordered the Blackened Tilapia Tacos. The tilapia was seasoned and cooked perfectly! I would absolutely order again. My husband really enjoyed his Buffalo Chicken Wrap, too. Overall, we had a great experience here, and our check was at least $10 cheaper than it is when we visit the restaurants in Rosemont, for food that is 100x better than those restaurants. It'll likely become our go-to!

8.description: We came to Iron Horse last Friday after trying to find a place that would accommodate all appetites and dietary restrictions.  That, and it's been on my list of places to try for about six months.We were seated right away with no wait at 7pm.  The restaurant was busy, but not packed.  The décor is a bit eclectic, country bar on a few booths, a 70's disco club corner, kids pizza area... an interesting hodge-podge.Our server was friendly, awesome, and on-point.  I'm really sad I don't remember his name.  Younger guy, glasses, hawks shirt.  He was attentive but not overbearing, made great suggestions, and kept our drinks full.I ordered the fish and chips, seeing that they were semolina crusted walleye and not the standard beer battered cod.  It was really delicious, and I'm really happy with the choice I made.  Looking around the restaurant, the burgers and pizzas also looked delicious.I will be sure to come back again to try a pizza from the wood-burning oven!

31.description: Always a pleasure - the food is good and they have a rotating IBW on tap which is a current favorite.Food is normally between decent and pretty good.They have a counter in the back where kids can play with pizza dough and the guys making pizzas will make the dough for them. this I think is the best bread they have.The giardinara is another hidden gem- it's fantasic. They never give you enough veggies though so you end up with a cup of oil. I mixed my oil with the green goddess dressing in my side salad which made that even better.The sandwiches so far have been pretty good. I still need to try the entrees and the pizza.

34.description: We came to Iron Horse Ale House as an alternative to a similar Edison Park eatery. Our party of five was seated promptly on a Friday night. We ordered 3 different sandwiches/ burgers a hot dog for our toddler and our older son had the pizza. Everything we had was great!!! I ordered a cheeseburger medium and that's exactly the way it was received. The pizza was amazing.  All of our food was served fresh and hot. Prices are reasonable and our server was outstanding. She was attentive, personable and friendly. We'll definitely be back and this time my kids will try the make your own pizza. They did a good job putting the menu together it had a very good variety without being overwhelming. The IPA selection was good as well.

16.description: I normally don't post reviews but WOW!!! I enjoyed the open faced meatball sandwich with a delicious side of fresh cut fries. But I'd have to say the food was topped by the fantastic service I received from my waitress, excuse me server, Alyssa. Her welcoming personality and in depth knowledge of the menu made this one of the most satisfying dinning experiences I've had the pleasure of enjoying in a too long. Kudos Iron Horse and double Kudos Alyssa!!!

13.description: You need to stop in and check out their Christmas decorations.  Gets you in the spirit!  Well done!

11.description: Went there last Saturday night for a birthday outing and have NEVER met a RUDER more UNPROFESSIONAL manager in my life!  He royally lit us up 2 minutes after walking in and sitting down in a booth.  He just went on and on and on.  He came out swinging droning on and on in a tirade.  It was so out of line it was almost comical.  Who talks to customers like that?!  After his little rant WE GOT UP AND WALKED OUT! (Joe and Kevin - I have no idea where you found this guy but he's killing your business.) WE WILL NEVER GO BACK TO IRON HORSE! Our money was better spent at another place.  Went up the street to THE CURRAGH where the service was quick and pleasant, the food was delicious and the entertainment was excellent. Everything Iron Horse is not.

39.description: My husband and I were looking for a brewery, but also wanted some good pizza.  So glad we found this place on Yelp!  We went there yesterday evening for dinner around 6:30. There weren't many other patrons there when we first arrived.  We were seated right away in a table against the wall with a bench seat.  We ordered a couple of draft porters from Revolution which were very tasty!  The beer list was extensive, as was the bourbon/whiskey list, and list of other cocktails and wine.  There was a lot from which to choose! We tried the pulled pork and cheddar fritters to start.  They were not what we were expecting, they came out in the shape of a ball (like a hushpuppy), but the flavor was pretty good.  We then decided to try a couple of different 12" pizzas.  We ordered the Arugala and the Italian.  The crust was thin, crispy around the edges and had great flavor!  The italian sausage on the one pizza had wonderful flavor that added to the overall taste of the pizza without being overwhleming.  The Arugala pizza was a much milder flavor profile but was enhanced nicely with some grated parma and oregano.  I would have liked to have seen a little more proscuitto on it though.  They went a little skimpy with that ingredient and very heavy on the arugala.All in all this was a great experience in an awesome atmosphere.  They did a nice job on the interior of this place.  It was very clean, good for groups and kids, and had tons of TVs that the waitresses seemed ok with changing to accommodate folks sitting in close proximity.  By the time we left here around 8:30, the place was packed!

37.description: New ale house in town. Very busy on a Friday night, but instead of fighting the traffic from O'Hare into town, we decided to try this spot. Open about a year, it has good ambience in a building that was once a fire house. The ceiling was especially  interesting in design and construction, as was the pizza oven that had a turntable built in!  Long bar with many beer selections. Interesting variety of tables - high, low, long and short.  Service was hectic, but server was great.  BBQ wings were flavorable, juicy and cooked perfectly.  Salad with chicken was standard faire, Margarita pizza -tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, parmesan, pecorino, evoo, and basil came to table cold, was sent back for a replacement.  Four cheese  - Tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, asiago, provolone, fontina, evoo was not hot either, but consumed anyway.  The "Smokin' Piggy" Burger - Grilled 1/2 pound burger with smoked mozzarella piggy-backed with house made bbq pulled pork and tabasco fried onions, served on brick oven bun was delicious. Four stars would be deserved if the food was hot when served.  Manager came to the table and asked so was told, and offered to discount the food and was apologetic. I think this will be a very successful place, and a good stop even if the traffic is not troublesome.

0.description: Never had anything but good service here - ask for Stacey! She's the best. Also, stick to the pizza. I've had their other food and the pizza is always better than other options. And get the garlic crust!

38.description: Food was good but there were about 25 children running around unattended. This was at night during March madness. Not a child environment. I am all about family friendly but this was not appropriate. If you want a nice bar to have a drink with a friend, try another place. This is a family place, not a bar. Of that's what you are looking for, go for it.

51.description: I like that this is the only place in the area that reminds you that you're still in the city of Chicago and also helps you forget you're in a weird incestuous bubble of a neighborhood where everyone knows each other, is related to each other, and/or has one of three careers. Great cocktails & good menu

27.description: Place is great!  The service and staff are very friendly. And the place is great with kids. The smashed meatball sandwich is unique and delicious. Highly recommended this bar/restaurant setting.

32.description: This place may very well turn into my regular neighborhood pizza spot. Im not a fan of calamari but the bf ordered it and said it was decent and it was a nice size portion.  Great service and I like how they have an area for the kids to play with pizza dough! WIll be back again to try other items on the menu!

54.description: We'll be back.  Nice ambiance.  We were sold on everything but the service.  It wasn't terrible, but slightly unwelcoming.  Reminded me of a Boston bar where the servers are cold and unemotional.  Beer selection was slightly pricey, but comparable to other high-end/suburban bars.  If they had more weekday specials, we'd add it to our list of regular spots.

48.description: The food was great and so was the atmosphere, I will definitely be back!

44.description: Craft beer is something you don't really find in Norwood park. That's why I was excited when Iron Horse opened up.  I've been here a few times since and haven't been disappointed.  There are a bunch of great options on tap for those that want a little something more than Miller lite.  The food has been great too.  I've tried a few different pizzas and all have been solid.  The decor has a pretty cool look to it as well, everything inside feels pretty open and you can tell a lot of work went into it before it opened.   If you're in Norwood park this is the bar to be at for drinks and food.

24.description: Patio & overall ambiance - 4.5 starsFood - 3.5 starsService - 2.5 starsManagement - 1.5 starsI was so excited when I walked in; the place looked cute and the patio was a delightful oasis on a warm summer's evening. The server seemed pleasant enough. We ordered a Moscow Mule that was essentially an $8 ginger beer. I realize vodka doesn't have a powerful flavor, but there was zero evidence of its presence (both in terms of flavor and buzz-factor). The waitress seemed rather annoyed that my friend and I intended to socialize a bit before ordering food. It was 8PM on a Wednesday, so it's not like we were camping during peak time.  She kept pressuring us to order food, but once the food had been delivered, there was very minimal follow-up.I overheard an exchange with the apparent manager where a table inquired as to how long the patio could stay open. He advised that legally they could stay open until midnight, but obviously, they'd only stay open if it was worth their while (which I guess means if they determine that they're making enough money). I definitely understand, but at that point, there were still about 20 people on the patio at it was 9:30PM (the posted hours indicate a 2AM closing).My friend and I decided to relocate inside to have one drink before heading out. The place had definitely thinned out but there were a few other people at the bar. We sat and sat and sat with empty glasses in front of us while the sour-pussed bartender kept cleaning the bar and ignoring us. After a solid 5-10 minutes, I asked if they were still open and if we could order 1 more round. She utterly refused to smile, even though we were smiling from ear to ear anytime we made a request.The manager started lingering close to us at the end of the bar. We mentioned that we liked the place overall, but had been a bit disappointed with our service. A well-trained professional manager probably would have apologized, asked what they could have done differently, or could have offered to buy our beers. Instead, he explained that he keeps an eye on how long it takes for a customer to order another round and we had been sitting for about 45 minutes without buying product. Um, pardon me? First of all, your bartender was not providing service. Secondly, if you're hanging out at a bar for several hours, you probably shouldn't be ordering drinks every 20 minutes. Lastly, there were 2 of us and we had already spent over $120 in the place. Bottom line: If you want to go and spend your money in a place that treats their customers like walking ATMs, go to the Iron Horse. For me, I'd prefer to spend my time (and money) supporting businesses whose goal is to provide their customers with an enjoyable, hospitable experience.

7.description: Always a pleasure - the food is good and they have a rotating IBW on tap which is a current favorite.Food is normally between decent and pretty good.They have a counter in the back where kids can play with pizza dough and the guys making pizzas will make the dough for them. this I think is the best bread they have.The giardinara is another hidden gem- it's fantasic. They never give you enough veggies though so you end up with a cup of oil. I mixed my oil with the green goddess dressing in my side salad which made that even better.The sandwiches so far have been pretty good. I still need to try the entrees and the pizza.

49.description: Stopped in to try out a new place while in the neighborhood, and I'm so glad we did. Tried a little of a lot! The pizzas are outstanding, the beer selection is good, the burgers were great too, but I think the pizza was better. I love the atmosphere and the staff too. Overall, this was a great find for us, and I envy those who live closer to it!

40.description: Great food and beer but not impressed with the service! Their beer selection was awesome and we loved the pizza. Our issue was with our server(s) who were missing at times and overbearing at others. The real issue is that after messing up our pizza order, we ended up with a second pizza but it seemed our server wanted to be compensated. When the bill came, we left a 13% tip based on the spotty service and she actually came back and said "well, I didn't include the tip", essentially asking for more money. I have never had that happen...and was shocked that after a mistake and subpar service,  she would ask for more money. We added to the tip and felt it would be best to just warn other yelpers of this issue. Overall,  great food and beer just not thrilled with the servers.

53.description: Nice ambiance. Good food. POOR service and mixed drinks WITHOUT alcohol in them (not what I wished for).  When server (Julie F) was informed the drink was either absent alcohol or was watered down, she responded by saying it wasn't up to her, it was up to the bar tender and did nothing to follow up or correct the problem. So for me...one and DONE.

30.description: Great pizza and salads and beer selections. The staff are friendly and I've never had a bad experience here. Plenty of tv's to watch if you're looking for a spot to watch the game.

46.description: Just took the family for the first time and it was great. Food was incredible. Atmosphere was awesome with tons of tvs. Giving the kids the option to "make" pizzas is genius. We will definitely be back.

1.description: Really disappointed. I had high expectations but unfortunately this place just didn't make the cut. Just returned from dinner with my fiancé and we both agreed to never dine in here again. Don't get me wrong ,food was okay and all, but the service was complete crap. It was so terrible it was almost comical. My fiancé and I were the ONLY people sitting at the bar and after sitting down we immediately realized we made a big mistake. Bartenders looked at us (I'm talking to you Patricia & Trina)and turned away immediately. They looked completely annoyed that we were sitting bar side. After watching them standing around and socializing with each other for 5 minutes, we finally got menus.As we were waiting to place our order, my fiancé asks the bartender if she had any special ale recommendations, since ya know it's an ale house! She only mentioned one type of beer. (Sigh. Fail) She sets our drinks down and disappears before we could even order our food. It took over 5 minutes before I could get the other bartenders attention because she wouldn't look at us. We had no idea what was going on, or the slightest clue who was serving us at that point. We finally get her attention and ask if we could order and hallelujah it's a miracle ,we get our order in.Pizza is definitely pretty tasty. Food came out in about 15 minutes. Looked good and tasted yummy. However, not  ONCE did either Patricia or Trina come by to ask how everything was, how things tasted, or ask if we needed anything else. I got my glass of water refilled one time by one of them without asking, but that's about it. Overall I won't be back to dine in, nor will I be rushing for some take out. I left feeling like I had a really crappy awkward dining experience with 2 of the most poorly trained & unfriendliest servers I've had In years. Good vibes are everything and this place just doesn't  have it.  FYI****:  The pack of cigarettes and lighter next to the cash register isn't a good look. It felt like I was sitting in a dive bar.

55.description: I somehow found myself back here after another place didn't work out.  We shared a pizza and a pasta dish.  The pasta was pretty great, so maybe this place can grow on me after all.

9.description: My husband and I were looking for a brewery, but also wanted some good pizza.  So glad we found this place on Yelp!  We went there yesterday evening for dinner around 6:30. There weren't many other patrons there when we first arrived.  We were seated right away in a table against the wall with a bench seat.  We ordered a couple of draft porters from Revolution which were very tasty!  The beer list was extensive, as was the bourbon/whiskey list, and list of other cocktails and wine.  There was a lot from which to choose! We tried the pulled pork and cheddar fritters to start.  They were not what we were expecting, they came out in the shape of a ball (like a hushpuppy), but the flavor was pretty good.  We then decided to try a couple of different 12" pizzas.  We ordered the Arugala and the Italian.  The crust was thin, crispy around the edges and had great flavor!  The italian sausage on the one pizza had wonderful flavor that added to the overall taste of the pizza without being overwhleming.  The Arugala pizza was a much milder flavor profile but was enhanced nicely with some grated parma and oregano.  I would have liked to have seen a little more proscuitto on it though.  They went a little skimpy with that ingredient and very heavy on the arugala.All in all this was a great experience in an awesome atmosphere.  They did a nice job on the interior of this place.  It was very clean, good for groups and kids, and had tons of TVs that the waitresses seemed ok with changing to accommodate folks sitting in close proximity.  By the time we left here around 8:30, the place was packed!

26.description: I really want to like this place, but they just make it so hard!  Went for dinner tonight - a very warm summer evening and they had their big floor to ceiling window/doors wide open.  If the heat didn't get to you, the bugs landing on your food did - flies, mosquito's, gnat's!  I thought the little old man at the table next to us was going to pass out from the heat!  We diplomatically and politely mentioned it to the gentleman that appeared to be the manager, and he did shut the doors and turn on the air, but he never came to check on us or apologize!  Our waitress was fantastic and the food we were able to eat (without bugs landing on it) was very good!  Typically it's the service that is the issue with this place, but tonight it was a poor management decision!

25.description: Excellent service, outdoor patio, great music, and we all thought our meals were delicious.  Great atmosphere!

12.description: Place is great!  The service and staff are very friendly. And the place is great with kids. The smashed meatball sandwich is unique and delicious. Highly recommended this bar/restaurant setting.

59.description: Have had drinks at this bar and they've been decent... Good... But appetizers with late night drinks are seriously lacking... Ordered two different ones and was sorely disappointed.

21.description: Amazing food, great service! The only annoying thing is the little kids running around, but hey the poor parents need to go out too...so I get it. It can get very busy on the week ends, but that's a good sign.

17.description: Really good beer selection. I order the beer flights and just ask the server to give me the new beers that come in. They are always changing up certain handles, but keeping the staples everyone likes to drink. The servers are very nice, sometimes the place is understaffed, so orders can take a little longer than expected. I love coming here, especially in the summer when I can sit outside.

10.description: Went here last Saturday for dinner around 6:30pm. Finding parking wasn't easy with the snowstorm we recently had, and the parking lot they have is so small it only fits about 10 cars. The good news is that there was no wait at all to be seated, the staff was very nice, and the restaurant was very spacious. I liked the ambiance, minus the screaming children at the table next to ours. That, of course, isn't the restaurant's fault. There were a lot of families here with kids, which is understandable since it's one of the only modern restaurants in Norwood Park. I kind of expected it to be more like the Garage or a bar in Edison Park that was geared a little more towards the 20's crowd, though - a bar that just happened to serve good food - so that caught me a little off guard. The music was a little weird for a bar, too, they were playing oldies but goodies from Jason Mraz and the Fray. May have just been for the dinner hours? The bar menu was pretty decent, they have 20 or so beers on tap. $6 for a 16oz. craft beer... Didn't seem too much more expensive than Bar Louie or Park Tavern. My husband ordered a beer flight for $8 which was cheaper than most places we've been to.For food, we ordered the Spinach & Artichoke Dip appetizer, which was delicious. The pita bread was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. You can tell it didn't just come out of a box. For dinner, I ordered the Blackened Tilapia Tacos. The tilapia was seasoned and cooked perfectly! I would absolutely order again. My husband really enjoyed his Buffalo Chicken Wrap, too. Overall, we had a great experience here, and our check was at least $10 cheaper than it is when we visit the restaurants in Rosemont, for food that is 100x better than those restaurants. It'll likely become our go-to!

5.description: We picked this spot as it was a mid-point.  It was more bar(ish) than anything else.  I wasn't sure what to expect but it was a cozy local bar with amazing food.  The only thing it was too spacious, i think the ceiling was too high but it was a cute little place.  Our waitress was super nice, I would say one of the nicest i have seen in a while. some people should not be working in that field, she makes them look like they need an attitude adjustment(that's how nice she was!!!)

3.description: The craft beer selection was actually pretty good but the down side is this place is too family friendly to drink at.  There are kids running around all over the place.  The food was ok, not great.I got the BBQ wings which tasted like every other bars "homemade" BBQ sauce.  Not too original. I then had a chicken sandwich which wasn't anything special with the only bad pickle I've ever had, I didn't even know bad pickles existed. They have some gluten-free pizza, so if your into that probably one of the only reasons to go.Or come here if you have young children, looked like they were able to play with the dough and maybe make or help make pizza.

35.description: The beer selection here is great!  A balanced selection of different types of craft beers.  The wood burning oven makes yummy pizzas (try the arugula)!  They also have a nice patio on the side of the building (no street noise).  Service is always great and would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone! Kids welcome :)

19.description: Patio & overall ambiance - 4.5 starsFood - 3.5 starsService - 2.5 starsManagement - 1.5 starsI was so excited when I walked in; the place looked cute and the patio was a delightful oasis on a warm summer's evening. The server seemed pleasant enough. We ordered a Moscow Mule that was essentially an $8 ginger beer. I realize vodka doesn't have a powerful flavor, but there was zero evidence of its presence (both in terms of flavor and buzz-factor). The waitress seemed rather annoyed that my friend and I intended to socialize a bit before ordering food. It was 8PM on a Wednesday, so it's not like we were camping during peak time.  She kept pressuring us to order food, but once the food had been delivered, there was very minimal follow-up.I overheard an exchange with the apparent manager where a table inquired as to how long the patio could stay open. He advised that legally they could stay open until midnight, but obviously, they'd only stay open if it was worth their while (which I guess means if they determine that they're making enough money). I definitely understand, but at that point, there were still about 20 people on the patio at it was 9:30PM (the posted hours indicate a 2AM closing).My friend and I decided to relocate inside to have one drink before heading out. The place had definitely thinned out but there were a few other people at the bar. We sat and sat and sat with empty glasses in front of us while the sour-pussed bartender kept cleaning the bar and ignoring us. After a solid 5-10 minutes, I asked if they were still open and if we could order 1 more round. She utterly refused to smile, even though we were smiling from ear to ear anytime we made a request.The manager started lingering close to us at the end of the bar. We mentioned that we liked the place overall, but had been a bit disappointed with our service. A well-trained professional manager probably would have apologized, asked what they could have done differently, or could have offered to buy our beers. Instead, he explained that he keeps an eye on how long it takes for a customer to order another round and we had been sitting for about 45 minutes without buying product. Um, pardon me? First of all, your bartender was not providing service. Secondly, if you're hanging out at a bar for several hours, you probably shouldn't be ordering drinks every 20 minutes. Lastly, there were 2 of us and we had already spent over $120 in the place. Bottom line: If you want to go and spend your money in a place that treats their customers like walking ATMs, go to the Iron Horse. For me, I'd prefer to spend my time (and money) supporting businesses whose goal is to provide their customers with an enjoyable, hospitable experience.

28.description: I like it. I like it a lot.Industrial chic invades Edison Park. The food is good and sometimes great. The beer selection is pretty wide, although the wine menu is lacking.Great for groups and a departure from the darker closed in bars one normally finds. Open space at its finest. I came on an overcast day and can only imagine how this place looks in the sunlight and moonlight as well.They have a bar set aside to the east side of the place. Great to catch a quick drink and appetizers. Plenty of TVs as well.I kept wondering what kind of factory/industrial building this was. One day I'll ask.One downfall of this place is that it has a terrible sound system. Music sounds like that heard when listening from under the water. They got to fix that shit

45.description: We came to Iron Horse last Friday after trying to find a place that would accommodate all appetites and dietary restrictions.  That, and it's been on my list of places to try for about six months.We were seated right away with no wait at 7pm.  The restaurant was busy, but not packed.  The décor is a bit eclectic, country bar on a few booths, a 70's disco club corner, kids pizza area... an interesting hodge-podge.Our server was friendly, awesome, and on-point.  I'm really sad I don't remember his name.  Younger guy, glasses, hawks shirt.  He was attentive but not overbearing, made great suggestions, and kept our drinks full.I ordered the fish and chips, seeing that they were semolina crusted walleye and not the standard beer battered cod.  It was really delicious, and I'm really happy with the choice I made.  Looking around the restaurant, the burgers and pizzas also looked delicious.I will be sure to come back again to try a pizza from the wood-burning oven!

33.description: Ate here for the first time this week. My friends ordered pizza but I wanted to try the burger. Their pizza was fine, but my burger, ordered medium, was raw on the inside. Not pink- it was cold and completely uncooked. So I had it taken back. It later reappeared- not a new burger but the same burger, grilled a little longer. Another few bites to discover that it was still undercooked! Cold ground beef. The waitress said that "this is our medium," which I'm sure it was not (at least I hope not!), and it totally wasn't her fault. She was gracious and took it off the ticket without me even having to bring it up, but I won't be eating here again.

43.description: This is a great neighborhood place to bring kids or hang out with friends.  Solid food with a nice beer selection.  I'll be back.

2.description: Iron Horse Ale House was great My first time my fiancée second time food was great waitress was awesome drinks were ok ..... We will be going back.

18.description: The food was very good - My wife had the pizza with arugula, etc., and it was tasty, nicely done, good crust (although just a little thick for neapolitan style pizza - e.g. Da Nella or Spacca Napoli - but then again, Iron Horse isn't trying to be them...).  I had the Smokin' Piggy burger - delicious, served medium-rare like I asked.  Different bun... seemed kind of like pizza dough  baked as a bun - nice, chewy, much better than the typical burger bun.Decent selection of craft beers on tap - could be a little more diverse, but I found a couple I liked (IPA fan...).  Lots more beers by bottle.Service was great.  Nice to have this place close to home - too bad it took us so long to discover it.  We'll be back!

41.description: I was there on Saturday evening with a large group of 19 adults/kids.  One adult and one child we were with have celiac disease and need to be extremely careful with how the food is prepared.  The manager could not have been more helpful, offering for the chef to come out if they had any questions.  Our server was fantastic and gave my friend's son plastic gloves, so that he could play with the pizza dough along with his friends.  My friends were so happy and impressed they have a restaurant they can go to and not worry!!  Awesome evening and food was delish!!

52.description: Had our holiday party at #IronHorseChgo Ale House and have to say we had exceptional service & the pizza and salad were awesome! Try the arugula pizza-yum, bbque and meat lovers pizza also got great reviews.

50.description: We haven't been here since the place opened over a year ago. So glad we decided to give it a try again. The menu's changed for the better. The food and ambiance were good. But it's a little too much with that guy walking around trying to clean up tables. I know he's helping out the servers but he's cleaning up while your still eating or finishing up. A little overbearing. Almost like you're being rushed to turn the table over.

4.description: I like it. I like it a lot.Industrial chic invades Edison Park. The food is good and sometimes great. The beer selection is pretty wide, although the wine menu is lacking.Great for groups and a departure from the darker closed in bars one normally finds. Open space at its finest. I came on an overcast day and can only imagine how this place looks in the sunlight and moonlight as well.They have a bar set aside to the east side of the place. Great to catch a quick drink and appetizers. Plenty of TVs as well.I kept wondering what kind of factory/industrial building this was. One day I'll ask.One downfall of this place is that it has a terrible sound system. Music sounds like that heard when listening from under the water. They got to fix that shit

6.description: I really wish I could give this place a negative review. First of all let's start with the hostess situation. Why is it in such an awkward place? Why do the people working have such a bad attitude? The service was bad. Went with two friends and received my pizza about 20 minutes after my friends received theirs. The waitress didn't even apologize. Mistakes happen but at least acknowledge it. Pizza wasn't even fully cooked because I am assuming they were in a rush. I would not return to this place and wouldn't recommend it to anyone else. Horrible!

22.description: My wife and I have frequented Iron Horse Ale House since it opened, and have never been disappointed.  The food, service, and ambiance have always been great, and we seem to always talk about our next visit.  The outdoor patio is perfect on a warm summer night.  They have a decent draught beer selection, a pretty good pizza, and... what else does one need???  It's also a nice place to catch a game.  Overall, a very nice experience!

15.description: I wouldn't write a review if they weren't consistently bad. Tonight we sat at the bar and were ignored for over 10 minutes. We then moved to a table where we sat 10 more minutes with multiple waitresses blowing by us. It wasn't until I stopped one they they said "there is no waitress here anymore" that we found out. This is not the first time this has happened. We have sat and waited for anyone to help us many times before. This place could be great. It isn't.  Do yourself a favor and go the extra mile to Edison Park. Lots of great, friendly bars there.

57.description: This is a suburban bar -- way more spacious and barn-like than most bars in the city, and good for groups. Not intimate, not dark, and quite loud on a weekend evening. The service was good, not amazing, and the food was above average. The drinks were a bit on the weak side but there was a decent selection of beer. All in all, if I were meeting friends here, I'd be ok with it, but I wouldn't suggest it myself. I prefer a less anonymous bar.

20.description: The food was very good - My wife had the pizza with arugula, etc., and it was tasty, nicely done, good crust (although just a little thick for neapolitan style pizza - e.g. Da Nella or Spacca Napoli - but then again, Iron Horse isn't trying to be them...).  I had the Smokin' Piggy burger - delicious, served medium-rare like I asked.  Different bun... seemed kind of like pizza dough  baked as a bun - nice, chewy, much better than the typical burger bun.Decent selection of craft beers on tap - could be a little more diverse, but I found a couple I liked (IPA fan...).  Lots more beers by bottle.Service was great.  Nice to have this place close to home - too bad it took us so long to discover it.  We'll be back!

36.description: Great beer list. I had the tilapia tacos which were amazing. The patio was beautiful, we were here last weekend. Its very clean, family friendly, and the pizza oven is defiantly something to see! I will be back!

14.description: Decent atmosphere and lots of menu items looked good. I'm giving it a not so great rating because I ordered a salad and it was awful. It was supposed to come with chicken and they put 3 small tidbits of what appeared to be deli sliced chicken on it. When I asked what happened to the chicken, they asked me if I wanted "extra" chicken. They came out with 1 ounce of chicken that appeared to be canned or something. Very gross. My friend's turkey burger looked like a frozen patty as well. If I return, I'll have to do the pizza because it did look good. The atmosphere was nice and the decor is modern.
