I guess trying to order healthier options there is a mistake. :(

28.description: Awesome place! I've been looking for a decent barber around here for the past few years and finally stumbled upon this place. Young guys, professional, great cuts for a great price. What more can you ask for? I walked right in and sat in the chair. The cut was very good. The price was $5 because it was my first cut and will be $10 from now on. That's a good price. It sure beats Hair Cuttery for $17, old man barber shops for $14, and barber who has a great personality, but cuts my short hair crooked for $12 (who cuts hair crooked?) Anyway, this is now my place.

1.description: The haircut wasn't bad. I don't have anything bad to say about the girl who cut my hair. However, I wasn't happy that the owner wouldn't honor the price special posted on their window it says they have on Monday's and Tuesdays. It says that first time customers can get their hair cut for $5. I get my hair cut and go to pay and the owner says $13.  I reference the sign on their window.  He tells me I have been here before. Huh? I have never stepped foot in this place. I wasn't happy and I paid the $13.  You guys should just take that ad down if you aren't going to honor it.

9.description: The best hair cut on the northwest side. Doesn't matter who's chair you sit in you will be pleased with the cut. Been going here for about 7 years always on point.

29.description: I started getting my haircuts here 2 yrs ago and there was no going back to the old barbers. They ask how you want it and they cut it so if your hair is receding, like mine, it will look best that it can. So they give your haircut alot of thought as they cut. I appreciate that.

23.description: Not only do you get a pretty good cut at a very decent price, but the customer service here is amazing. George and Sam are two brothers who know what they're doing whether it's a fade, trim, eye brows, or lining, they do an awesome job.For $10 you get your hair cut to your liking, and they use a single blade to line you up and clean your neck. (Everywhere else I have gone charge extra for this)First time hair cut for $5 isn't a bad deal either.All in all, this place is awesome. I have already sent over a handful of my friends and they have been regulars since.

5.description: I got my eyebrows done there & they literally took it off, I told him I wanted a clean up & he cut it! I'm so mad right now , I was going to cry . Please don't get your brows done there , they'll make it look like a straight line . My brows were fine , they just needed a clean up but he took literally half of it off . Please don't go there unless you want your eyebrows gone( and no I'm not over exaggerating)

25.description: First haircut I got from this place was great! I used to drive farther to Fade by Tom or to any around there. I suggest you go to this one if you're closer. I didn't have to wait for a haircut and it was a Friday! Usually other places gets packed because it's the weekend and guys want to look good for the ladies when they go out (don't deny it, you know you're guilty of this). Besides the nice haircut and being near, it's also about the whole place. It's tidy; waiting area is very nice, got good magazines to read if ever you have to wait (maybe 5 mins). Came here during one of the hottest days in Chicago 7/6/12, but the place was cool, unlike other places where the A/C units seems to be giving up due to the extreme summer heat (getting over-worked), not working, or just plain non-existent. You'd be sweating really hard like you ran in the Olympics if you wait at other places.It also comes down to the barbers. Like I said, first haircut I had was very nice, nothing to complain about [got a faux hawk ;)] and I actually went there not knowing what kind of haircut to get. The barber (George) was great. He really gets to know customers, but not intrusive like others. overall, it was a great experience and would come back again. . . And did I say first haircut for new customer is $5? =)

12.description: I had a very enjoyable experience at this place. I called ahead and when I came, i sat down  in their nicely air conditioned sitting area and waited my turn. The man cut 2 guys in an half an hour were as my old barber took 45 minutes to do a buzz cut! When my turn came, I was nicely asked to have a seat and I got the hair cut. George was very meticulous, careful, and seemed to  be OCD about keeping the barber seat area clean! He used those old style razor things to clean up my neck and even put some Nivea to areas the razor would touch. Plus, the man can do a taper!

21.description: A great hidden treasure!  If you're on the Northwest side and are looking for someone to cut your hair...I recommend these guys!  My previous barber had retired...thanks Rosario for 28 years!  I've tried other places but nothing was consistent....and now I found George and Sam! You can't go wrong for a great cut and for $5 for your first visit.  My cut was exactly the way I wanted it.  Everything to the shears, trim and razor blade clean up...George did an awesome job!  The shop was clean and welcoming!  George and Sam were very personable and friendly!  Thank you George and Sam!I will be back!- Jestton

16.description: If you are looking for a stylish hair cut, look elsewhere. These guys may do a good job for a buzz cut, but if you are looking to get your hair parted, an under cut, or a comb over look else were.   Went there twice and was not happy with my hair cut.

17.description: I will never go back there again. I referred this man so many customers. He knows it too. And what happens? He treated me so disrespectfully in the end. Here's my attempt of a long story short.The first time I came in, I tried to tip him but he said no my tip is for you to come back. So I came back with several different people because I liked him so much. My fiancé  would always leave him $5 tips for his $5/$10 hair cut! So one day, I come in at 530 and waited a bit over an hour patiently. They closes at 7 just so you know. Got in the chair at about 640. Hair cut is finished. I go to pay. I know he takes visa because of his sign. I decide to use my visa gift card. He is like we don't take these. I'm like ok you have a sign that clearly says visa. Gives me a huge attitude ' oh! What am I going to do with this?? Nothing! I made nothing.! It's a gift card! I'm like ok I'll go across to the street to chase and get you cash. This guy had the NERVE to tell me to look at the time were closed! I was in such shock. He had the audacity to tell me that after everything I did for him. I'm sure my fiances tips have added up some where to compensate for the temporary issue I even told him I'd come back the next day.I wish there were negative stars. None would suffice, but 1 will have to do in order to voice my opinion.

10.description: Brought my 15month old in for a cut and they did a great job!  Patient, quick and a really nice cut.  Took my 4 year old and my husband back later and they did a great job with both of them as well!  Fast service- three people working so we didn't wait at all.  Very clean salon, will definitely come back!

11.description: These guys always do a great job at a very fair price!  They are genuinely nice guys who are always kind to my children. This is the only place I go for a haircut. And it's a nice added touch that it includes shaving the neck.  Just go here!

26.description: VERY IMPRESSIVE!  Walked right in and sat down.  Got my haircut from George himself, and he is a perfectionist.  As a guy that got buzz cuts growing up, I switched as I got older to buzz cuts on the sides, and scissors on top.  Most places don't do it well for guys, but George didn't miss a beat and it looks great.  Definitely a regular customer now.

27.description: AWESOME! George does the most amazing threading eye brows in Chicago and Sam does my husband hair cut since 2008. Never expensive, amazing customer service! these guys know how to make their business!!  love you guys!!

0.description: Found George & S on Yelp while visiting from RI and badly in need of a haircut. I walked in on Saturday afternoon and was immediately seated in a chair.  I'm sorry that I didn't get the name of the woman that cut my hair because my haircut is the best I have had in years. That fact that the cost was much lower than I typically pay back home is a welcome bonus! Going forward, I think I may plan my visits to Chicago to coincide with my need for a haircut.

20.description: I recently moved to the neighborhood and needed a place to get a haircut. Found Geroge & S here and decided to give them a shot and boy, I'm glad I did. I won't be going anywhere else again. These guys know how to take care of their customers and do a fantastic job. I've never been so satisfied with a haircut.

19.description: A great hidden treasure!  If you're on the Northwest side and are looking for someone to cut your hair...I recommend these guys!  My previous barber had retired...thanks Rosario for 28 years!  I've tried other places but nothing was consistent....and now I found George and Sam! You can't go wrong for a great cut and for $5 for your first visit.  My cut was exactly the way I wanted it.  Everything to the shears, trim and razor blade clean up...George did an awesome job!  The shop was clean and welcoming!  George and Sam were very personable and friendly!  Thank you George and Sam!I will be back!- Jestton

2.description: George and Sam are tremendously wonderful men. They are so kind and make you feel like family when you come here. They have such patience when servicing children as well. I bring both my boys here and they never fail on providing great service :)I am always satisfied with the cuts my boys receive. Great place overall, not to mention affordable!

18.description: Not only do you get a pretty good cut at a very decent price, but the customer service here is amazing. George and Sam are two brothers who know what they're doing whether it's a fade, trim, eye brows, or lining, they do an awesome job.For $10 you get your hair cut to your liking, and they use a single blade to line you up and clean your neck. (Everywhere else I have gone charge extra for this)First time hair cut for $5 isn't a bad deal either.All in all, this place is awesome. I have already sent over a handful of my friends and they have been regulars since.

13.description: Best place in the neighborhood for a haircut. These guys know what there doing and are the best at it.

4.description: Will always come here ... great gentlemen .. George and Sam you guys are they best at what you do. I thank you for numerous years of service . TOP NOTCHI've been getting cleaned up here for years and my son love this place also we will continue to be loyal as you are to us ...       J&J Duran

24.description: I took my 18 month old son in here for his second haircut.  He was so awful at his first cut that I had procrastinated much too long.  The lady who cut his hair today mistook him for a girl at first.  We all giggled a bit at my embarrassed insistence that he was, indeed, a boy----I had waited MUCH too long!!!  Anyhow, she began with the shears, per my request, and he proceeded to scream...............and scream.............and scream.  She just kept at it, being as gentle, yet fast, as she could be.  She tried to distract him, as did I, to no avail.Another fellow who works there (one of the nicest people in the world, I'm guessing), came over to assist.  He tried making the baby laugh, he tried giving him safe things to play with, etc.  But what finally worked (albeit briefly) was when he showed my son pictures of HIS son of a similar age.  It really made me smile.  This man (I wish I had gotten his name) was so kind that he was wiping my sons messy face for him while he wailed.  :')  That is so sweet!  How many strangers will wipe your kid's snot for them???  Not many.I looooooved this place!  First time boy's/men's cuts at $5.  I tipped $10 bc of how patient, kind and thoughtful they were.  You really should go here!  Tip them well!!!  They deserve it!LOVE LOVE LOVE George & S!!!!!  Thank you very much for your wonderful service!

6.description: I love this place - I've been getting my hair cut for years even after moving away. Sam and George are good guys and do an excellent, quick job. I can't speak for women's cuts, but they do a great job on men's hair. And all of this for $10. Worth the drive.

22.description: Moved from downtown to northwest side and needed to find new barber.   I went to George & s before Christmas because I needed a cut before I saw family.  I was nervous about going someplace new because I had my hair cut by the same person every six weeks downtown since 2005. I told Sam what i wanted, he listened, he worked, i was thrilled.   I went to Sam again last week and everything is perfect.

15.description: For two months I bounced around Chicago looking for a good barber that would listen to exactly what your trying to do with your hair.  Super cuts and great clips are full of people who look like they never cut hair in their lives and just do what they think your hair should look like.  George and Sam ask exactly what you want and confirm with you.  George gives good tips about what the hair will look like in a week or two to help me plan.  I would recommend George's to any girl or guy who cares about their hair!

7.description: The one and only place i get my hair cut sam does my hair and hes always  consistent  and friendly  they take there time on every customer  and treat everyone  like a VIP 100prcnt  of the time and only 10 bucks you cant beat that these brothers  know what there doing and  they even do eye brow threading too mens women's  and kids they do it all

8.description: Great place, excellent price. George and Sam are the best! I've been coming here for quite sometime and have never left dissatisfied. They always know exactly how my hair should be and greet me as soon as I walk in the door.

30.description: George and his brother Sam are the primary stylists here and they both do a great job cutting hair. They sometimes have others working there but I have never had my hair cut by anyone else. I usually get my hair cut by Sam every two weeks. He is awesome and uses a straight razor for the neckline and by the ears. I've been going there for about two years now. It's nice because if you're not in the mood to talk they don't talk, but if you want to have a conversation they are great to talk to. The place is clean and well lit. I think they are from Libya, and they do woman's, children's and men's hair. My five year-old goes there too and she always gets a lollipop after her cut (she even gets one when she's with me for my hair cut). The best part is the price. Your first cut is $5 and after that it's just $10. I was going to the Hair Cuttery before here and they would charge me something like $17 to cut my hair (badly- they always leave you with hair all over yourself, and the cut is different every time even if you go to the same person). Then you're expected to tip them?!?!?!?I usually give Sam a $5 tip because it's cheap, fast, and he does a good. Plenty of parking, its next to a 7-eleven and a gyros place.

3.description: Best guys and gal to cut your hair!  Very consistent and reasonable. I highly recommend this shop!

14.description: These guys are amazing!! Both Sam and George are great at cutting hair and are extremely nice!! I have been going here ever since they opened and I will never go any place else. Trust me and go here!! They take their time with every client and their price can't be beat!!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

28.description: I'm not crazy about this place but my boyfriend is. The sauce is bland and so is the sausage. Honestly I only ate their pizza once and hated it. My bf on the other hand can't get enough of it. I suggest to give it a chance bc you may be lucky and like it

1.description: I've ordered from here twice and both times it was bad. I can't even remember what I had the first time but the second time it was a Gyros plate.Do. Not. Order. The. Gyros.Entirely too similar too Steakums brand sliced meat. Awful, rubbery, gross. I can't help thinking that it's the same thing you get at Jewel in the Take Me, Make Me type in the coolers.Before you say not to order gyros from a pizza joint....I've had some of my favorite gyros from pizza joints. This was just bad.

9.description: I'm all about supporting local business but will defiantly not be ordering from this place again. Called to order a pizza, nothing crazy just a simple pizza. Delivery time quoted at 45 minutes. No problem as this is pretty standard even if you only live four blocks away, which I do. So an hour rolls on by... Getting pretty hungry by now so I call just to make sure there is no issues and the delivery driver has my correct address. The young women was polite and apologized as they apparently had to many deliveries and only one driver on staff. Not really my problem but she assured me that it had left already and was on its way. An hour and 35 minutes later my pizza arrives. It's defiantly not fresh, slightly warm and kind of rubbery. So I called again and to politely bring my problem to the attention of the establishment. A different persons answers, this time a man. I bring him up to speed on the situation and his first reply is... It hasn't been an hour and a half. Me: um... Yes it has. Him: well you ordered at 6 right? Me: actually at 5:55,and it is now shortly after 7:30 correct? Him: well I can give you a free appetizer next time you order I guess. Me: I don't want a appetizer, and I don't really think I should have to pay full price for a cold pizza after an hour and a half wait when I live four blocks away from you. Him: well I can give you a free appetizer. Me: can I speak with your manager or owner? Him: he will be back in ten minutes, I will have him call you.. Abruptly hangs up the phone on me. Guess what...that call back has yet to materialize. P.S. Been almost a week now.

29.description: This is probably about a 3.5 star review but the following factors bump it up to 4,1) Great customer service2) They're open til 4am on the weekend.3) They pretty much deliver anywhereThe thin crust pizza is good, tangy sauce, flaky crust, and good toppings. The breaded steak sandwiches are surprisingly good. They have excellent steak fries. The pan pizza is good as well, for an unusual but good twist try it with gyro meat yes that's a topping here! My favorite is the calzone, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Cheesy and they don't skimp with the filling. And a nice big cup of marinara on the side. To me this is a good late night joint and certain things are very good here. Should also note that a friend told me the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo is very good here, but that's word of mouth more than anything. If you're up for some good late night eats and within seemingly a five mile radius this place is definitely worth a try.

23.description: Waaaay too greasy. Great thing is that it's open very late.

5.description: I never been to this Chicago's pizza location because I always thought it was on Elston and it was really dead as it was almost 11:30 at night but the service is fast place was clean we only waited 5 minutes for a slice and it was nice to try someplace new. I grabbed a menu which has some coupons in it and I want to try may be delivering it from in their area or range of delivery.

31.description: The good thing are the crazy hours....open late.  The bad part is the crazy prices...a bit high for the quality you get.

25.description: The pizza here used to be pretty darn good (like ten years ago.) I have ordered a couple of times in the last couple of years and it now sucks pretty bad. The only thing keeping the place from getting one star from me is they have late hours of operation and delivery. I doubt I will order from this place again.

12.description: Fried chicken was delicious. The only problem, it was a very small chicken and for nearly $10.00.not worth it. cole slaw bland, garlic bread bland

21.description: Great pizza. Over priced. Never ate in here so not sure how it is inside. I love how late they are open. For that price I think my pizza should be larger. Especially if paying for extra ingrediants at that price.

16.description: Used to be great back in the day. Changed their management, lost all of their good food. This place is now disgusting. Rude customer service. Don't know how to run a business. I wouldn't bother ordering from here. Their food is super subpar.

17.description: I had a rather tough day and ordered chicken and rice soup to start off my meal....BEST EVER!!  It was JUST what I needed to feel better.  Delivered FAST and HOT. THANK YOU!

10.description: Husband and I order from here frequently, if we are ordering out. Sometimes a basic turkey sandwich with fries, sometimes gyros, pasta, pizza... I like their fries, the bread they use for the turkey sandwiches and I love how late they're open and the driver is always super nice. Very solid 3 stars & a great place for finding dinner quick any evening or a late night binge after consuming...oh you know what I mean.

11.description: I have recently tried their fried combo their marinara sauce for dipping is really good it comes with a ranch sauce also. And they cut the vegetables properly it not like a long stringy pieces of zucchini it's mozzarella sticks sizes of zucchini deep fried, mushrooms,and  mozzarella sticks its really good I highly recommend it obviously it's late night food it's not gourmet but it is good

26.description: I ordered a gyro from here one night - it was surprisingly excellent.  Maybe the other menu items instead of the pizza are the way to go.

27.description: When it comes to Pizza in this area of the city there are a ton of great choices and I don't think you could go wrong with any of them.  I have a number of favorites and I tend to order a certain type of topping from each place.Chikago Pizzaria is my Sausage and Pepperoni place to go.  Their crust, cheese and sauce compliment the sausage and the pep just great.Of all the places in the area this one I tag as a Guys pizza joint.  If I've got the guys over for a sporting event or card game then I default to Chikago and I have a number of picky friends and yet they all enjoy this pizza.  Goes great with a cold beer and the Bears on TV.  Though the Bears can give you indigestion sometimes.

0.description: Ordered at 1 am food hot on time and good sized portions.  Had steak qusadillas, bbq beef, minestrone soup , carrot cake and cheese cake .Driver was courteous. Bbq beef uses a bbq sause that is tangy and along tge line of an open pit taste. In other words not a,sweet thick type like baby rays. The bread was very good, not hard, not mushy. Nice size and cut in half already. I could only eat half. Soup was very good. Qusidillas were plentiful and fresh. Will order again. Helps that they are late nite and good on top of that.

20.description: This pizza joint is a gem of a find.  It's obvious the cook must have worked for Giordano's because their thick and thin crust pizza's are identical.  Still though, the pizza is pretty damned awesome.

19.description: Waaaay too greasy. Great thing is that it's open very late.

33.description: Everyone has their favorite neighborhood pizza place, and this is mine. It's good pizza. Not amazing, but excellent local Pizza. The plain cheese thin crust pie isn't greasy or have an inordinant amount of herbs or other weirdness in the sauce. The crust is crisp around the edge, warm and chewy in the middle. It's a very solid pizza. But what's really nice is the stuffed crust, something very poorly done at a lot of places in chicago(Giordano's, I'm looking at you) despite chicago's reputation for excellent deep dish pizza. The sauce on the stuffed crust is bright red, not  dark red or (ugh) reddish brown without too many seasonings, but enough to take the tang out of the tomato. The crust is crisp and chewy, and thick enough to accomodate the ingredients, so that you don't end up with an insane drippy mess(again, Giordano's I'm looking at you). In fact, that's another huge plus about this place; the pizza is good cold and reheats fairly well.Take my advice, don't get the other stuff on the menu; it's fairly uninspired. It's a pizza place, go and get a pizza. If you live out this way, Call in, stop by and pick up a pie. You won't regret it. And you'll come back.

2.description: Don't just go for location, hours etc. The food is not great. Pizza overdone, not sure what they really are..Mexican Italian or? I think you can satisfy your cravings elsewhere.

32.description: There really isn't anything stellar about the fare here.  What's amazing is HOW LATE this place is open!I used to live in Jeff Park, and the ex factor and I looooved coming home after the bars closed, ordering up some grub and watching some bad tv or B grade movie.The beef sammiches and greek salad are pretty good, and the thin crust 'za isn't bad either!

18.description: I always get the XL BBQ Pizza! It's loaded with so much meat!!! What's nice is that it's open till 3am on most days-sometimes they don't pickup even when it's before 230am.

13.description: Ordered a pizza for delivery. I was told it would take 30 minutes, the pizza showed up after more than an hour and a half. I called about three times while I waited and each time I was told "He's on his way!"When I finally got the pizza, it was okay as far as cold pizza goes.

4.description: Fair price and open late! I can't say the absolute BEST pizza in Chicago but definitely some of the best pizza on the northwest side for the price. If you are in the area, its worth a TRY! A generous amount of sauce and cheese, their pizza is always consistent and delicious. Reliability is key!I would also recommend their BBQ beef sandwich but stay away from the aju sauce, a tad too salty. Cant forget their special offer...after saving 15 receipts, you get a FREE pizza. They have my vote!

24.description: Two words: Gyro Pizza. It's always my go-to, along with a side of Fried Ravioli. The service is top notch and they're open till 4am...again, 4AM!!! Location is on a high-traffic turn (Elston turning into Milwaukee), but parking can be found. I also agree with the comment below regarding the breaded Steak Sandwich, now that gets 5-stars.

6.description: I decided to grub hub my order because I do not like dealing with the girl that answers the phone. When I called to ask where my food was (already 30 minutes late) she told me "you're not the only one ordering, we're very busy tonight".  I understand that, but is that a way to respond to a paying customer?  Please know that the food is great and the delivery staff is awesome but this girl... is extremely rude and snappy on the phone. What a great person to be taking orders! When I asked her name she said it was Melissa, when I told her the delivery person called her by a different name, she then changed it to Diana. Yet.... That's not the name the driver called her by. Reading all of the reviews about this girl, everybody is 100% right, she is very rude and arrogant and should be taken off of the phone immediately.

22.description: Well wat can i say good food but dissapointed with the place ever since moving in the area i would go here for pizza till a couple of days ago wen i dined in. It was around 10 at night sat down with family and there was a drunk dude behind saying dumb stuff nobody told him to stop mayb cuz he was waiting for food then gets up to our table like we knoe the dude it was kool went away then goes again and puts a bag a chips in our table like wtf really. All these workers or owners standing there not saying nothing very unprofessional then we finally get our food. And bam. The lady drops a wing in her carry tray kool no problem but then she grabs it from there with her bare hand from tray to my ladies plate.lmao very unsanitary. Makes me wonder wat else dont they drop and put bak  on a plate. Not a word from any of them saying sorry for the disturbance with the guy or our food we didnt say nothing paid and left but thas one less customer that will go. As much as like there pizza dont wonna sit and wonder if they dropped any of these and put it bak on our order. NO WAY. Thanks. But will never go bak !!!!!!! Mostly for that insanitary thing she did they use dirty rags to clean then use them to carry dirty dishes bak. Yuck. !!!!! Unsanitary and unprofessional !!!!

15.description: Horrible quality, over-priced food, but they're open super late, so it's one of those places one chooses out of desperation.

7.description: I used to love ordering pizza from Chikagos  a few years ago. Pizza was delicious and service was good, too bad all that's changed. The last few times we ordered from here ,pizza took over an hour and a half and ended up canceling the order more than one occasion. Not to mention they have a terribly rude employee by the name of Velia who I had to deal with on more than one occasion. Had it not been for her I would of probably switched from delivery to pick up. Won't stand for terrible, rude customer service for mediocre pizza. I'd rather go to Jewel and purchase a Digiorno pizza than spend another penny in this place.

8.description: Used to be our favorite pizza place. We received a pizza with hardly any sauce on it.  We have ordered here hundreds of times in the past.  I brought the pizza back to them to show them as they didn't believe me in the phone. They insisted the amount of sauce was correct. I requested a refund . We ordered two more times succesfully and on the third order we were told they wouldn't deliver to us any longer. Must be nice to turn business away. I've still got 20 receipts at home.

30.description: Great for super late night delivery  food on the northside. Lots on the menu .Pizza is pretty good. We found that extra cheese enhances it. Eggplant sandwich is good, wings are decent and they have a really good chicken Cesar and spinach salads. Soups are good too (Italian wedding rocks)...Italian sausage good...just DON'T do the gyros or the Italian Beef. If your doing entrees the POPPY ROMANO WITH CHICKEN is awesome! Actually all of the specialty pasta dishes are really good. Suprisingly I know!  All in all, consistency is there......don't forget to ask for a free liter of pop at the end of your order.

3.description: Wish I could give 0 stars. Disgusting food. Italian place serving Mexican food? I think you need to rethink your menu and focus on perfecting one type of food before moving onto another. Dont bother. Theres a McDonalds right next door that can satisfy your food cravings for significantly cheaper.

14.description: We ordered delivery and were told our food would arrive by 8:05 pm. At 8:25 we called again and were told our food would arrive within 15 minutes. At 8:45, we called again. Finally, nearly an hour late, our food arrived, lukewarm. We called to complain and were offered a 25% discount. Horrible experienced, sure to be followed by indigestion.

12.description: Oh no, say it ain't so!The other night looking for a specific dish (coconut walnut shrimp) my significant other and I went to New China Buffet. Upon a quick phone call we were told they did carry such dish, but they said they had it named coconut shrimp. Being enthusiastic and hopeful we made our way to the restaurant. First turn off: it was a nice 60 degree evening, and as soon as we stepped into the restaurant we were greeted by a warmer 75-80 degree warm front. Seriously, can we turn on the A/C?$10.00 per person, drinks and dessert included. Second turn off: the restaurant is totally outdated, wall paper is very funky, and the booths have terrible spring like seats. I thought I was back in the early 80s.The food was sub par, some of the dishes lacked flavor and texture (ex. the hot and sour soup, fried octopus, crab rangoon) the coconut shrimp, salmon, beef and broccoli, dumplings, and desserts were OK. The highlight of this restaurant is that they actually have a bottle of Sriracha Hot Sauce at each table.Overall, my personal opinion is that I would probably only go here again if I was short on time, and was really not in the mood to drive any further. Other than that, I'd go somewhere else.

3.description: Disappointment. . Place was empty.. wings were super dry and overfried.. fried rice was a different style than other buffets (it had bits of pork and beef?) Which I wasn't a fan of, Walnut shrimp had too much mayo... Most of the food was warm and not hot.. sushi was dry and didn't taste good.. A lot of free parking in the lot..

1.description: Ok, I understand most China buffets aren't great and some are sketchy as hell. But THIS one is the WORST ONE I've ever been to. This is dinner time, the food looks like it's from 2015, taste like it's from 2012, and I'm praying to the stomach gods I don't get sick from this. I would of taken photos, but I'm sure my camera would of broke. The food, COLD, OLD, unrecognizable and barely edible for my neighborhood possum. I rarely leave bad reviews, but this place should close. Or get a visit from the health department.

2.description: I did not enjoy this visit! The food doesn't look inviting. I am not impressed. I asked the lady if they will bring out shrimp, at which she told me that dinner starts at 3:30... I walked in the place at 3:15. It's 3:36 and they still have not brought out other food. I asked since I've come at 3:15 you will stop me from taking shrimp and they said yes, you have to pay more. Now how is that normal? The moment I walked in she should have told me that I will be charged more if I stayed half an hour more.

9.description: I don't normally write reviews but this time I feel like I have to say something. If I can save just one person 10 dollars it will have been worth it. This place is just awful. I've never seen greasier food. Everything they have out is swimming in oil. They have the smallest unpeeled fried shrimp. I saw people laboriously peeling the fried batter off the shrimp then peeling off the shell all for the smallest amount of meat I've ever seen. They also had something they are calling mini lobster. They were actually fried crayfish ... and they were mini crayfish at that. These crayfish were so small I can guarantee there was no meat in them.Why does a Chinese buffet have french fries, onion rings, garlic bread and HAM TACOS? The onion rings were terrible. They were obviously fried in oil at the wrong temperature. Desserts weren't bad. The only problem is when I was at the dessert table there was a large green fly landing on all of the fruit. I will say that the soft serve ice cream was nice.Service was terrible and clientèle was very low class. One guy couldn't bother putting on a shirt for dinner. I would never go back to this place again. I had to vent all of my frustrations because I'd hate to see other innocent victims get hurt.

10.description: I love Chinese Buffets. Delicious food and usually always hot. Even have some pretty good sushi rolls. This place has lots of choices of ice cream and even a capuccino machine. :oExactly $10 with tax.

4.description: Food was very good with a large variety to choose from. Price was perfect, all you can eat with drink included (with free refills) for under $10.00 per person.

6.description: This buffet used to be full every single day, it all changed when the Buffet by the hip renovated. I still think that this buffet has better food. Need a tray of food when going to a party? (I usually get a tray of salt pepper shrimp from here)

0.description: It's a China Buffet people!  Hello!  I give it 5 Stars, but 5 Star dining it ain't!Upon walking in, you will be greeted at the cash register by young children who must be the children of the owners (someone call DCFS please!).  Seriously though, you can tell this is a family run place.  I just hope those girls are getting their homework done.  They will happily ring you up for $10, yes that's $10 for ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT of Chinese deliciousness.Oh crab rangoon, egg rolls, chicken skewers, chef's special, beef with broccoli: How I Love You!The decor is seedy and dumpy.  If you stay too long, you will get depressed.  They have one guy who busses the tables.  He is there every day at every time, no matter when I go.  He might sleep in the back room.  You should always leave him some $.The clientele is 90% foreign.  Eastern Europeans seem to love this place.  They all may need triple bypass surgery in a few years, but the food sure is good.  And cheap.I saved the best for last.  ICE CREAM.  There are troughs of ice cream in all sorts of delicious flavors.  Superman (spelled Supperman), Moose Tracks, and Coconut are the best.  PLUS a help-yourself soft serve machine.  If I lived closer, I would pay $10 just for the ice cream.All in all, the most amazing land of deliciousness you can find in the city of Chicago.  Better than Alinea and Next combined.  Go here and enjoy, you will thank me later!

5.description: Its a all you can eat. That should tell you thr food may be suspect. And it is here. Some of it was ok. I don't remember what any of the names of what i ate were. Its a buffet, i just slopped things on my plate. Its almost worth the price just to see the pitiful excuse of pizza they have there. Ugh I've never seen anything else like it. Its like a chef boyardee pizza kit. There is a few pluses, tons of seating, pop was good, fruit was good. That is all. Oh and they have a bathroom. So if you need to urinate, want a cold fountain pepsi, fancy a piece of fruit, you will be overjoyed.

13.description: With same price, this Buffet provides very limited choice of foods. No small Lobster, No Baby Squid, which you can expect more expensive than other things. With same price, some other buffet in this city provides both above. And it seems that they run out of workers. No one come to take away dishes and there are 6 empty already used dishes left in front of me. The chef perform waiter's role some times. The only thing good here is baked cakes, breads, and cookies. They taste better than those baked by other Asian buffet's.

11.description: I frankly dislike any china buffets, but this one has a special ugly place in my heart. It is sooo gross. Their food is insulting. It's cold, dry, and tasteless. I labeled it as a food crime. It's swimming in a pool of grease. Unless you enjoy seeing your food float, I recommend that you save yourself the $12 and skip this place.

8.description: These Chinese buffets are scattered throughout the metro area. They are all pretty much the same. This one may be a little below average. The place seemed to do a steady local business.Typical selection of fried and sauced Chinese dishes, It seemed all the dishes involved a brown sauce. It would have been nice to see a bland chicken dish or vegetables.It seems they do a good business consistency from the local populace - that may be a negative because there is no incentive to change or improve. If you're in the vicinity and need a quick, cheap meal, then go for it.And of course there's the obligatory soft serve ice cream machine.

14.description: This place is horrible! I've been here twice , forced twice both times evryone left unhappy. You are better off spending the time to find another one. Food was dry, old, and tasted bad. The tables are old, dirty, and the place smells. We asked for our money back after 10 minutes of trying to make it a good place, they refused to give us back any money. My wife and I left hungry and pissed we just lost all that money. Go some place else!

7.description: first off...lets not go into this with high expectations ppl...its a buffet...its chinese...and its a chainnow that being said...not all of their food is subpar...is it what ud get ordering from a decent mom n pop shop...no...but if u go close to opening time or happen to stalk them and figure out when food gets changed then some of it is pretty decentnoms i wasnt really thrilled with...fried rice and noodles

0.description: Love this place.  Dropped by the other day and it was closed - very closed.  Looks "gone."  Can anyone confirm?  I hope not -- its a treasure.  Great coffee and atmosphere.  And cool stuff too! If gone - it will be missed!

29.description: A friend and I went there to get a Mani-Pedi. The girls, both of them, took around 20 minutes to set their station up and we had already been waiting for an hour. Not only that but it took them a good 2 hours to do our mani-pedi, and my friend's manicure looked like it had been done by a 5 year old. I kept guiding the girl that was doing mine so my hands were still passable. It's a bit cheaper than regular places- what with it being a school and all- but definitely not worth it if you end up spending over 3 hours and the result is that bad. Overall, a pretty disappointing experience. I would not recommend it to anyone even if you get a free service.

42.description: I actually go to this school in the Harlem location and I have to say that this is the best school out there. Very structured and it teaches profesionalism. If you want to be become somone big in this industry you should come to this school. I have to say something about my teacher Ms Laura, she is absolutely the best teacher ever. She cares so much about her students, she is always there whenever we need her, she will teach you the skill to succeed, and all  she needs from you is passion. She will make sure you are prepared for clients. She makes the class interesting and studying theory is much easier.

23.description: Went for a wash/blow dry. Terrible. The girl had no idea how to shampoo hair, and used her to nails to "scrub" my scalp! OUCH! Additionally, I don't think she completely rinsed out the conditioner! Then, when I thought the worst of the pain was over, it got worse. While blowdrying my hair, she used a very small round brush, and pulled my hair so incredibly tight from my scalp, I could've cried. Then towards the end, she just started brushing my hair down, to dry it, as opposed to using the round brush to lift and dry my hair. I understand she was a student, but there was no technique being used. She also barely said two words to me, which is fine, but didn't even ask my what kind of blowout I wanted. Not a fan of this very painful experience.

47.description: I visited the Glenbard Heights location.Keep in mind that a visit to a beauty school, uh, beauty university, requires TIME.  I had time.  I had highlights, a hair trim, manicure and pedicure.The highlights were perfect.  A salon would charge $150 and they usually don't get it right.  My student was graduating in a month and was pretty competent.  Her teacher did make a few cuts to the trim and it really was nice.The pedicure was good.  She took her time with my feet.  Same with my manicure.  The ony negative was that the student applied the polish too thick and it didn't last.The school was pretty upscale for a beauty school, uh, university.  For $68, I had a nice afternoon.  The cashier did push the $25 'membership' that included discounts and guaranteed appointments even as she told me that I had to call at least a week ahead for an appointment.

8.description: I came in looking to get a BLOW OUT and a MANICURE and was pleasantly surprised how nice people were. Although the women doing my hair and nails were students, I didn't find them to be any less then professional. I was pleasantly surprised by my experience and look forward to going back. I don't want to delete my review from 7/30/2014 because I want people to see that Tricoci has in fact made an improvement since my first experience. Keep up the good work.

31.description: I went here on 2-18-12 because I got a groupon for haircut and highlights for $35.  Never again will I go back.  I was there a total of 4 hours for a simple haircut and highlights.  I think this was the first time the stylist I had actually had a client.  My highlights turned out orange, brassy and completely uneven.  Then for the haircut she didn't even cut the front of my hair. My hair was practically dry on it's own because she took so long cutting it.  The supervisors were great until the end when they looked at me and said, "oh I think the color looks great."  The color didn't even match remotely to what I had before.  I understand it's a school and there is a learning curve.  However, when you see that the stylist is taking waaaaaay too long and doesn't know how to color, the supervisor should step in and take over.  I had low expectations because I didn't know what to expect but I didn't expect this bad.  I don't even trust going back there for them to correct it.

34.description: Note to yourself:   Students are doing your hair, they will mess up and you will not get a refund.  I had peekaboo highlights done, but when she did them the highlights looked like my current color.  My cut ended up being uneven.  Even worst it took almost 4 hours just for peekaboos and a cut.  Never again!  Now I have to go get my hair fixed at a real salon...You get what you pay for.

16.description: They are NOT open on Wednesdays!!!  Do not trust the Hours listed here.  Call first!!!

13.description: Went to go in to get full foil lowlights and never have I been so impressed and happy with my hair! It was a Saturday morning and busy, yet I was seated right away. The student stylist was better than any experience I've had with a regular hairstylist at another salon. She really listened to what I wanted and the outcome was much better than I ever expected! I have been getting compliments on my hair every since and it looks exactly as I had hoped. I will be most definitely coming back for more!

11.description: I had a great experience here! The students and other staff were nothing but polite and professional. I got beautiful highlights and a great haircut, and I was impressed with the time and attention that was taken with my services. I'll defiantly go back again.

39.description: Where o where to begin with this place?!  I was initially pondering on whether or not to even write a review but I do suppose the way my girlfriend was jipstanged (urban dictionary it) deserves a suitable response.I drop my girlfriend off at this place so that she could get her roots touched up and new highlights.  I had some errands to run so I was off.  An hour goes by... nothing... 2 hours... nothing.... 3 hours... a phone call from her... she stated that they were almost done, another hour passes.  Ok seriously its almost time for my class and its the first day.  I drive over there to pick her up.  She is still not done.She was passed over to another student mid highlights and the student realized that the previous student she had left the highlights in too long.  The student put in a toner, which I suppose is to lessen the brightness of the blonde highlights.  This took another 20 minutes.  When her hair was done, the student blow dried a small portion of her hair so that my gf could get a look at what it would actually look like.  I was in a rush to get to class, so I paid little attention to her hair color.  We rush off to my class, I am too late for my class and decide that we should get my gf's hair cut.  We go into my hair stylists salon and she takes one look at my gf's hair and starts pointing out all of the mistakes that were made.  First off, I realized my gf didn't receive highlights, they turned her whole head blonde!  And to top that off there were partial blond streaks in the back of her head.  There is no way that she would have found that out, unless her hair was being cut by someone honest.  The same piece of hair would be as follows: roots still showing, a streak of blonde that was about 2 inches long and then a different hair color.  Absolutely appalling!  This was all over the back of her head, underneath the dirty blondish color that was considered to be the cover up for the students lack of experience.Ok so we call Tricoci University, talk to Chauncey.  She states as long as my gf comes in she will refund her money and apologizes over the phone.  We go in to meet with Chauncey.  She meets with us and we describe the issues that were having, this was in front of other customers.  She apparently decides that she needs two other instructors to be with her in order to proceed with a refund.  They all see the mistakes that were made to my gf's hair and then say, ok we will be right back.  The three disappear into another room.  We are left outside waiting for like 10 minutes, wondering what are these people doing.  They reappear and ask us to enter an office.  All three of them and the two of us.  The two supervisors standing tall on both sides of the desk in a feeble attempt to intimidate us (what a laugh). We sit down and the actual consulting supervisor, she had short blonde curly hair, attempts to put words in my girl friends mouth by saying that in the original consultation my gf wanted to be more blonde!  My gf quickly disagrees and states to her that she NEVER said that at all.  The CB (curly blonde) smirks and says "then there was a miscommunication."  Is it not your job lady to listen to what customers want, otherwise why are you in this business.  This is responded to by Chauncey stating "well we think your hair is beautiful."  First off, who really cares what you think about someone elses hair color or style.  It is not YOUR hair, so what are you doing trying to give your opinion on how someone else feels about their hair!  Secondly, they state that because it is a school they would either refund 50% back or they would try to fix it.   In what other business is there a 50% refund.  I do not expect one of my patrons to come into my restaurant, explain to my server what they want, the server brings out a dish completely different and expect that patron to not only eat it but also pay for half.  I would either fix their meal or not charge them. The curly haired blonde seemed snarky and rude as she continued to fondle my gf's hair making comments that seemed to be obviously not in laymans terms.  She was speaking in tricoci code or hair stylists terms. They state "we will make sure that one of our senior students who is about to graduate will do your hair."  Umm... Lady two of your so-called senior students are the ones who did exactly THIS!  The sheer audacity of these people.  She just got her hair ruined by you, and on top of that it took four and a half hours for them to ruin it, now you are asking that she come in and wait another 4 and a half hours for one of your "top students" to perform the job.  You are admitting fault but only half???  THis makes no sense.  My gf was going to go in and get it fixed, however after some thought, she should just go to a professional.  People who actually care about customers.  This places prices may be low but so is there professionalism and customer service.  I will definitely be calling corporate!

37.description: I've stopped by here twice and I've had great service. The 2nd time I stopped by I really had a great time and when I tried to schedule another appointment with the same girl who colored and cut my hair they wouldn't tell me if she was available on the day I wanted to go. So sad because service was great and I really wanted to continue going but I won't be going back. Thanks for the fabulous 2 services.

0.description: Skyler did an amazing job dying and cutting my hair! Super friendly and did exactly what I wanted! I will definitely be going to her from now on

38.description: only come here for their facials. the price is extremely reasonable and you feel relaxed.i wouldn't go for any hair coloring though because the product they use burns your scalp.  i thought i was me but when i talked to my friend who goes there also for facials only told me she experienced the same thing when she had her hair colored.  her testimony attested my own experience. so if you want a nice inexpensive facial this is the palce to go!

51.description: I would say no to the haircuts... I have gotten 1 good and then 1 very scary when the stylist told me he.. and I quote... "likes to time himself" to see how fast he can do hair cuts. I walked out and burst into tears, it was awful. However, the facials are amazing!! Totally worth it! Parking isn't that great around there with lots of permit parking. Get there early to park in front of the salon.

27.description: I went two days ago to get my hair cut and colored. The color looks great. It took 4 hours, which felt like a lot but it was worth it. Unfortunately I got there late so there wasn't time for my cut. My fault not theirs.  Ill be going back for her to finish the cut on Tuesday. All in all the girls were great.

32.description: November 2: The darkness falls around me.  I hear a torture cry, a wail of torment. Then I realize it is coming from a hair stylist's chair-- a woman's highlights, ravaged.  They call my name.  I sit in the chair and, before I know it, the tortured cry is my own.  The only thing worse than getting a bad haircut is getting a SLOW, (money-draining), bad haircut.I weep for what I have lost.

54.description: Needed to get my highlights done again and didn't have the money to pay my usual stylists $150.My friend suggested this place after she had services done here and she had 50% off coupons also known as the "buddy pass" SCORE!!!! I took a day off to come here on a weekday and arrived around 11am, was told by the receptionist that there would be an hour wait. I was expecting this, but the place looked practically empty.  My "student stylist" came out a little after 12.  Took me to the back and looked my hair over.  We didn't start off well.. he was questioning what type of shampoo I use and how it's bad for your hair and then complained that I used a flat iron that day.. so I wasn't too happy with him. He told me what he was going to do, how much it would cost and brought out colors for me to pick.  then his teacher came by, he told her what he would do, she approved and he began to work.  I did get a little nervous when he began to put the highlights in foil and didn't put the all over color on first..( I was used to having it done that way at my usual salon)..i questioned it, he explained and all was well.  My hair was washed and then on to the cut.. don't be nervous about getting a cut, the teacher comes to check it before they dry your hair and will fix it, if they make a mistake.  I asked for an inch off and got a little more cut off, but no big deal.. I have long hair.  He took his time cutting and drying my hair even though it was past his time to be there.  I didn't leave until about 4:50 and they close at 4:30 for an hour break. He was a lot nicer after our first meeting.. so he got a nice tip.. ha ha Overall, I was pleased with my hair and the price.  With the "buddy pass" I paid $51 for color,full head of  highlights, toner, cut and style.

48.description: First off, I would like to say that my review is the average rating I would give this place given my two very different experiences. The first time I came to tricoci, I was there for a full leg waxing. Aside from the constant comments made by the instructor about how awesome it is to wax rather than shave and feeling like I was hearing some random sales pitch about the salon every time the instructor was observing, I would say the experience was fine. The student I had was very nice and helpful. Overall, I would say that my experience was 4-star worthy. However, my haricut was a different. I understand that this is a learning environment but someone needs to teach these students how to take care of their customers and LISTEN to them. Perhaps its not fair to rate the salon based off of my experience of this one individual. However, for me, it was all wrong from the very beginning to the very end. First, she didn't care to know my name or at least tell me hers. The whole time I was getting my hair washed (the part of the hair cut that I love the best) I was practically being deafened by all the water in my freaking ears. She did not say a WORD to me for almost the entire time I was getting my cut.  She was supposed to ask me to feel my hair after a 1/2 inch in order to gage how much more to take off but that certainly didn't happen. She didn't ask how I wanted it to styled. At the end, she walked me to the front, said bye and then left. Maybe I expect too much, but I feel as though customer service is a huge part of running and working a salon and that was a skill that seemed to be underemphasized in my case.I guess its just your luck in these cases!I'm going with 2-stars, bc I have certainly experience better.

44.description: I WARN YOU DO NOT ATTEND THIS SCHOOL THEY WASTED MY TIME AND MONEY When I was there we wasted time cleaning they don't have janitors. They had us cleaning most of the time instead of learning. I had to massage fat lady's necks and shoulders. I wanted to become a Esthetician not a Massage Therapist. No one told me that you had to massage people or do Brazilian bikini waxes. The instructor brought her friend in do demonstrate a Brazilian bikini wax she was naked and we saw her whole body. I didn't know this was what was part of the curriculum. I signed up to learn about skin care. The instructor threatened me about the massages. I didn't sign up to massage fat Lady's shoulders and necks for one hour. I had to waste so much time learning it and i had to keep using massage cream because the lady was drying up and the instructor was breathing down my neck. They never have nail openings. They do not know how to do high lights. I brought my friend in to get her hair colored and they messed it up and it took them hours and hours to correct simple mistakes. the receptionist Michelle Papish was not professional at all many people complain about her. Tricoci claims to be so high end but they hire very unprofessional people that are very cold and do not care about their job, students and customers. The CEO emailed me about my comment but still refused to help me they want me to pay 40% of the tuition even though I been there only a week and they took me in late. They are only located in Illinois they lie and say they are all over the country they are not. They are in the business of ripping you off. They have no compassion for their students. Their staff is lazy and not organized. The instructor Jamie Nelson is a lousy instructor. They had me sign up for full time and later on told me its better for financial aid if I start the program part time. Its a recession and they are charging $12,000.00 for the Esthetics's program and $ 21,000.00 for Cosmetology. Go to Pivot Point they professional, international and less expensive than pathetic Tricoci. There was nothing wrong with my attendance the CEO is trying to defend his pathetic school so he can round up more customers so they can rip off more innocent young people. I always came on time. I came in at 8 AM and left after 5 PM. Tricoci discouraged me in this field. I don't want them to destroy another young persons dreams. Schools are suppose to care about their students and try to fix the situation but Tricoci wants money. T

24.description: I thought I could come in for a partial highlight touch-up and cut. My normal hairstylist is on vacation and I badly needed my hair done. My sister, my husband, and myslef all came in (my sister and I were getting the exact samething done and my husband a simple cut). First, it took over an hour and half just to cut my husbands hair. Then, they gave me to a girl who had NEVER done foils before and was asking the instructor literally every 10 minutes if she was doing it right. By the time she was done foiling, my hair looked like foil had expolded in it. My sister was right behind me, and hers looked neat and professional. It took THREE AND A HALF HOURS for me to get partial highlights and a wash. She started at 6 and I finally walked out at 9:30pm. Mind you with NO cut or even a blowdry. (My sister was able to have her highlights and haircut with a blow dry). I told them several times that I had a child at home, but the instructor didn't really seem to care. She flippedly gave me a card for 20% off a hair cut. NOT HAPPENING. I understand they're students, but its terrible that the instructors don't pay more attention. Next time I will just wait til my hairstylst comes back from vacation

7.description: I have been here several times in the past and it's always been great.  Today however was awful.  I  am giving three stars because the color and cut ended up looking good but the process it took was horrible.  I was there for 5 1/2 hours - for a cut and color with highlights.  I've had this done there before and it does take longer because they are students but never 5 1/2 hours.  My stylist was Dominicka - she kept wandering off in the middle of doing my hair and I would have no idea where she went or why.  And although the end result was good she was by far the sloppiest stylist I've ever had, even for a student.  She dripped color all over the book I was reading, she dropped it on my pants, my hand and it was all over my face - and not the normal amount along your hairline - it was on my cheeks and chin as well.  Washing my hair she dripped shampoo in my eye, sprayed inside both of my ears with the water hose and got conditioner in my ear.  After she rinsed me she wandered off again and I sat there dripping for 5 minutes - I even looked at another student and asked if she knew where she went and she had no idea.  When I asked for a towel to wipe my eye - she handed me a wet, used towel.  I had wanted to get another service done but I couldn't because it was so late by the time we were done.  I told her I prefer to wear my hair curly because it's naturally curly and she proceeded to blow dry it straight.  I stopped her and mentioned it again and she said she had to blow dry it for the teacher to grade it....what?  That doesn't even make sense.  I would like to say I will go back because my other experiences have been good but I'm just not sure at this point.  If she had at least apologized or seems the least bit regretful that she had damaged my belongings and actually hurt me to the point my eye was red, swollen and tearing up I wouldn't be so angered by it.  Time will tell - hopefully they will at least give some training on customer service and people skills to the students instead of just technical skills.

49.description: Where can I take my BFF for her birthday to relax because she needs it? Where can I relax in the process but not have to pay a grip? Let me look up schools on Yelp that offer spa services...Lo and Behold....Tricoci University saved the day! We made our appts for 9:30am. When we got there I was a little worried because I saw all of these people standing around waiting so I am like please don't tell me they just make appts but its still first come first serve. It was totally not that way at all. If you have an appt they will call you immediately it just so happen that ALL those people that were there was walk ins for hair appts. My friend and I both got the Salt Glow, Seaweed Wrap, Back Facial, Facial, and Eye and Lip Treatments. OMG it was the best $131.00 I have ever spent!!!! Tina did all of my services and let me tell you she graduates Oct 14th and she did one of the best facials I have ever had....I am still glowing. She talked to me about my skin and made suggestions which I was grateful for. She had such a great personality and just really seemed to love the fact that she was taking care of someone and making them feel good. My friend had Kelly. At the end of the appt they were cracking jokes with each other and laughing. My friend said she really really enjoyed it. She said the facial and back facial put her to sleep both times. She said Kelly made her feel totally and completely relaxed. Again for $131.00 for the both of us it was well worth it!!!!!! I am definitely going back !!!!!

40.description: If you have a lot of time, and are willing to let students practice on you, Tricoci School of Beauty may be your cup of tea. There, I had my first facial ever. It was interesting. It began with a questionnaire about my skin regimen. How was I to know SOAP was the enemy?  Within the first few minutes,  I was told that I probably should see a dermatologist. Although it probably is true, it wasn't what I expected to hear. My skin is pretty good, all things considered. They have different kinds of facials for different skin types. I was asked what I considered my problem areas...my guess is that most people without major problems have no idea what problems they have (or, this is their job to tell me my skin needs extra assistance...). On to the facial....it was good, in a no frills way. There was soothing music, but the room is spartan, with many treatment tables all in one room - yes, it is a school, not a spa!  Frankly, since I'd never had a facial before and didn't know what one includes, I'm not sure if mine was fabulous, routine, or sub-par, but it was pleasant. If I had gone to a top notch spa, I may have felt more pampered. At the end of my facial, I was shown products that I could use to keep my skin at it's best. I'm sure they are great products, but they were high end products which were a bit out of my reach. Maybe next time. (One note on the facial room - Mario Tricoci university - PLEASE clean the ceiling filters!  All of us are looking up to a dusty ceiling that has black grime and dust along the air system...).  I know this happens, and it's not a big deal, but it would be more appealing if this wasn't noticeable.  I also had a manicure. The price point is the same as one of those no appointment nail places, but you won't zip in and out, if that is a priority. I like to use my own polish, but they have to use OPI, as they are sponsors of the school. I miss using my own polish, because within hours of a manicure, I invariably chip the polish. It's a lot easier if I have a back-up polish at home to do one nail than the entire manicure. I did chip the polish off several nails only 3 hours after I left!  I had to totally remove it after 2 days (usually I only get a few chips during the entire week after a manicure).  I am not sure if this is due to the student who was new, or the polish, but this is the first time this has ever happened to me (and I do get manicures/pedicures routinely and never have an issue).  The students are very pleasant, and want to do well, especially as they are graded for each client. They do hair cuts and coloring as well. As in any school, you may be paired up with the best student in the class or the worst. These students have to put in a certain amount of hours to finish the program. Invariably, you probably will run up against a student who is merely going through the motions....ie...step one, step two, etc, until the finish line. It may take a while for some students to catch on to the notion that their future career is not just based on doing the service, and all the steps required, but that his/her attitude, appearance, and genuine desire to make someone feel better, look better, is just as important. Those students who can put themselves in their client's shoes, give a little extra, make the effort to be personable, and truly want that client to enjoy the experience, will be rewarded both now and in the future, with higher tips and return clients.If you have ample time, patience, don't need frills and understand that these are supervised students who aren't yet professionals, try Tricoci beauty school. Remember, though, that sometimes things aren't perfect and this is not luxurious. The manicure section is off in the back, and some instructors review other areas of the school/students, so they have to make a special effort to come into the back.  This wasn't an issue for me, but if a student needed help, it may take a bit longer.  In any case, you'll be part of someone's training, so there may be pluses and minuses. Tricoci is an interesting eye opener of what it takes to learn the business of beauty. It's worth a try if you have the time.

53.description: I've been once and plan to go back a second time soon.  First time I went for a cut and full hi-lite.  I was able to go on a weeknight the first time and got there about 5:15 (they open at 5:30) and just made the cut.  The 2 people that came in after me left and came back and others were turned away completely.  I waited until about 6:30 for my service to begin and didn't get out of there until almost 9:30.  It was a long time but you have to expect that with students.   I paid less than $70 for both so it was worth the wait.  They do not take appointments so you need to get there early or plan to be there for awhile (less 1 star).  The student I had was really good (I let her cut off 5 inches of my hair!).   I had a bad experience at Aveda w/color & hi-lites but felt much more comfortable with the instructors here (they listened to me - what a concept!).

30.description: Some months ago, I purchased a Groupon for 2 mani/pedis for $30.00.  The first time was somewhat uneventful, even though the whole process took 3 hours (even with an appointment).Since the deal was expiring this month, I had an appointment for my 2nd mani/pedi.  After waiting 45 minutes I was finally taken to the nail spa to start the pedicure.  The room was busy with about 4 or 5 other clients getting nail services.  First a teacher came in to look over my toenails and said she was concerned about 2 of them.  Then she goes and gets a supervisor who interrogated me non-stop and confirmed that I have high blood pressure loud enough for the whole room to hear.  She asked me where I got my last mani/pedi and I answered that I got it there.  Then she asked me where I regularly go (which is really not her business).  She then started asking about some whitish marks on a couple of toenails and is suggesting that it is bacteria or something.  And the questions went on and on, yet the first time I was not interrogated like this and it was only less than a month before.   I felt totally embarrassed and humiliated with these other people sitting there listening to this. I had just been to the doctor that week for my annual physical and she examined my feet and found absolutely nothing wrong with them.When I began to show my impatience because she was embarrassing me, she went and got the manager, who came and told me that we would go and talk in her office.  I put my shoes and socks back on and gathered my belongings.  Instead, she and this supervisor walk me to the front desk amid a crowded waiting room and gave me a refund that I had paid Groupon when I purchased it.  The moral of the story is that it depends who takes care of you there and if you express your displeasure about anything at all, they want to boot you out.  Only thing to their credit is that they refunded my $15.00.  I then took my refund and went to the salon I normally went to, but have never been so embarrassed in my entire life.

46.description: I go here regularly for cuts and highlights.  You can get a salon quality service for less than half the cost.  The student's instructors come by frequently during the service to make sure it's being done right, which is comforting.  Make sure that you have plenty of time to spare, as they take much longer than a regular salon.  They don't take appointments (well, they do...but for a fee, and who wants to pay for that).  But if you arrive early you should get seen right away.  I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes, even on a busy day.  The only real complaint I have is that the water pressure and temperature control at the sinks really sucks.  And if you're like me and have flat fly-away hair, you'll need to ask them to use product on your hair, otherwise they will just blow it out without using product.

1.description: I went to have my roots touched up---  a second visit.,  (The first visit was satisfactory. )    The girl did not bother to match the dye solution (selected during my first visit) with my current hair shade/color.  Neither did the "supervisor."  As she applied the color, I could see the shade was too light, much lighter than the rest of my hair color,  but thought it might darken as it "set."  After all, they were the "professionals."  Turned out I spent approximately 5 hours for this visit as they had to do the whole thing over again.  Wow!After all that, not even a "complimentary  offering."

55.description: Great place to get salon service on the cheap.  Everything's done by the Tricoci students, but they know what they're doing.  If you don't like paying $120 for a cut and color, I recommend it.

9.description: So NOT worth the Groupon!!! Betsy answering the phone and working the front desk- nightmare. She checks me in and never tells anyone I'm there waiting. 40 min later I ask how much longer this is going to be, she snips with attitude that I can obviously see HOW busy SHE is. Really?? This is about you Betsy? Ugh!! Never again.

26.description: I have been to the salon many times and gotten fabulous service! My newest experience was beyond that my color, cut, blow dry and manicure was done by Jacquline Triveri. Fab, professional and so great at what she has chosen to do. Look out when she is done! What a great personality. She gave me exactly what I wanted and I felt and looked great. She wanted to give me that kind of experience. Make you appointments now so you can experience you desire.Ro v.

25.description: Today was my first and last visit to Tricoci University. I had an appointment at 1:00 for full foil highlights and a cut. I fully understand that I was not going to a salon,  but rather a school and I would likely not be in and out. I expected to spend 3 to 4 hours there, but after over 5 hours later I still hadn't even started on the haircut.    I do want to say that Tania, the student that did my highlights was delightful. She was extremely professional, and I didn't mind at all that she took her time to make sure my hair turned out perfect. It was when Tania had finished with the highlights that I began to regret going there. Tania had passed me over to another very pleasant student for my haircut. As she was combing out my hair the teacher, Ms. Char, came over to inform us that there was a meeting starting, so I would have to pay for my highlights and wait in the waiting area until the meeting was over in 30 minutes. She didn't apologize or acknowledge that this was obviously an inconvenience to me. Tania and the other student were very apologetic and said they had never seen this happen before.   I was slightly bothered by this, especially seeing as my hair was still wet and it had already been over 4 hours, but went to the counter to pay for the highlights. When I got to the counter I noticed that my bag, a Louis Vuitton bag that was a gift from my fiancé had hair dye on one side. Since it's a light colored bag, it was quite noticeable.  Tania tried removing the dye with no success. I know accidents can happen, but I was disheartened none the less. I sat down to wait until 5:30 when the meeting was supposed to be over. I was concerned that my hair was drying and curling, as my hair is naturally curly. I was worried this would effect the cut, but there was nothing I could do. 5:30 came and went, and at 6:00 I finally decided to leave.  My hair was completely dry at that point, and no one had come by to apologize for the much longer wait than what I had expected. I was so disenchanted with the Tricoci Univesity's way of treating people that I figured it was best to not stick around to see how the cut would go and I let the girl at the desk know to please cancel the remainder of my appointment.

12.description: I went here to get an ombre coloring done on my hair.  the teacher went on to tell me that it would not be a problem and would be so easy because I had virgin hair.  Was she wrong!!!  they left bleach on my hair for 3 HOURS!!!!  they washed it and said it looks so good and I don't need a toner- yea right (I'm Mexican and Italian- def need a toner!!)  I looked like a pumpkin head.. had to come back and get toner put on and they charged me for all of it... it looked like sh*t!!!  I ended up going the next day to T and G Salon, and they did a great a job!!!

21.description: I came here for a mani-pedi and was a little disappointed. I gave 3 stars because I know its a school and I mean, you get what you pay for. I honestly was expecting a little something more maybe because of the Tricoci name. When I arrived I was told to take a seat and wait, I waited for 10 minutes if not more then the girl who was going to take care of me came and introduced herself and told me to wait while she preps the room. That was probably about another 10 minutes if not more. The person who did my mani-pedi was a very sweet lady and it actually came out good BUT I didn't like the fact that they don't cut your cuticles and they don't trim your nails down (isn't that one of the main points of getting this service done?) So i feel like I pretty much paid someone to do something I could have done myself in reality. If you are teaching these students to work in a real salon they should do everything a real salon does as well, just my opinion.UPDATE: I went back (bought a Groupon for 2 mani pedis-used the last one) and it was even worse than the first time I went. At this point I'm convinced it is not the students fault that they suck (sorry). I have noticed it is lack of teachers being around and not even there assisting or watching what these girls are doing. This time they had way more nail polishes to choose from BUT the colors I chose were almost empty and was chunky and my nails looked terrible. The worse part is the student was going to let me walk out with my nails looking like crap and i told her to do another color so she did. She did a completely different routine than the first girl which proves these girls are not being trained properly (in the nail dept at least). I hate to be so mean because i know the girls are students and learning but if you have people coming in paying for these services you need to give them the service they are paying for. It was a clear bad job that any nail tech would say it was a horrible job and after she took me to the teacher to get approved the teacher took a 2 second glance at my nails and gave her 100%! I couldn't believe it. If she actually took a minute to look at my nails she wouldn't have gotten 100%. Seems like a fun environment to be in but you shouldn't pass students just because you like them, people are paying to be here and it shouldn't take over 2 hours for a mani-pedi especially if I got there early and she took me right on time this time. I definitely will not return here ever again.

17.description: I went here today and was surprised how nice the salon is inside considering it's a school. The spa area was very calm and relaxing. I got a great glow body scrub and soothing facial from Trish and will definitely be back. The only downside is there skin are products were a tad expensive $38 for a travel set and $38 for eye pads.

10.description: Not recomended for mani or pedi. My no chip mani came off literally in a day and my feet were over scrapped. Yes they had free nail polish offer and I felt still overpaid for what I received..
