Wish would hv just went to regular nail salon.Their hair color service is best I ever had anywhere..Trisha nd teacher were outstanding.

5.description: My 2nd trip in to See Brittany again after what a great job she did last time.  I promise you this girl is going to be a Super star. She explains all options and treatments in full,  asks your input as well and is pleasant and attentive.   Very informed and creative. Makes you feel like it's a special day out for you ( which I rarely get with 3 kids ) .  I will follow this girl where ever she goes.  In my 50 Yrs on this earth I have finally found the perfect hair stylist.  Thank you  Brittany, you have a client for life.  Everyone needs to ask for her - you will not be disappointed.  Just call ahead she is booked by many.

3.description: I saw a Groupon for a $15 cut and condition and after cutting my hair myself and needing it evened out, I said why not. I've been to schools before; Pivot Point and Aveda, so I realized two things:1) Don't go in with any fancy requests! Remember, these are students! They are still LEARNING while working on clients, and2) Be prepared for your service to take longer.Those things said, I didn't think I could go wrong with a very basic hair cut, and I was right. My stylist, "Kenny" was very professional and thorough. She seemed a bit nervous, yet at every turn she asked me questions to make sure I was comfortable, and that was she giving me just what I wanted. She called over her teachers twice, which I appreciated.After she blow dried my very curly hair straight, she flat ironed it at no additional charge, and I was VERY pleased. All in all it took 2 hours, but I couldn't be happier! Best $15 I've spent in a long time...and with a coupon for a future service, I will definitely be back.

35.description: I went in on a Wednesday morning.  There was no wait.  Lisa B. cut my hair. She was a really cute young girl and very personable.   I think she will be there through the end of the summer.  I am really really happy with the haircut!  I used to go to the Mario Tricoci on Michigan Avenue and pay $75 for my hair cuts  and this one only cost me $18!!    The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 is because it did take me about 2 hours from start to finish.  I was aware that it would take some time from other yelp reviews that I had read.  They have to stop during each step to have a supervisor step in and check everything.  They had a sheet they were graded on and the supervisors had to check off the sheet, like a point system.  Anyways, other than that I am very pleased!  (They used Redkin products for anyone who wanted to know.)

19.description: I recently went in to have my hair colored. I always get my hair cut and I have nothing to complain about but this is the first time I am writing because OMG!!!!! Now, I recently lost about 147 lbs thinking when I saw the people I haven't seen in awhile it would be the topic of conversation. Well, it was mentioned here and there but all they could talk about was how AMAZING my hair looked :) I have to agree. I had Lia as my stylist and since going there I have never really remembered a name but I will be sure to remember hers and request her as long as I possible can. She did amazing. My own mother told me it is the best I have ever looked. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!!!

28.description: Well I went on a Wednesday at 5:00pm and the girl at the desk said they dont start to take appointments until 6, so come back at 550. I did, and they called my name at 6. My girl was very nice, a little shy and definately in need of confidence. But she listened to what I wanted and did exactly that. Her instructor did the final dry cut of just taking off a little of the dry ends on my layers that are growing out. He did a great job.So I got a great trim and conditioning treatment at at least half the cost of the real deal and that is fantastic.Heres my problem with this university. It was a little run down. I went there when it first opened, and now it is REally run down. Doors broken of hair stylist station. I was moved from one rinse bowl to another , mid shampooing, because the bowl was clogged and filling up as she was washing my hair. Gross. So we had to move me dripping wet to another bowl, and NO ONE cared, the instructors just kept walking around looking at the students to make sure they aren't texting, instead of caring about the facility. Also, I dont know why the girls are learning old lady roller sets, I saw at least 10 students doing those old lady rollers thingys that they are going to give perms to. Its 2012, that style is going to be obsolete in 5 years because I dont know what Lady , 50 and over, will ever want that hair style. And I ask the girl if they learn how to do extentions,, and she said no, that it was an extra class that was not offered at that facility. Really? Why arent they teaching their students MODERN hair styling, and things women really want?

45.description: I've been going here for almost a year now and I enjoy going and supporting young hair stylists. I have very curly long hair and I always thought I had to go to a high-end salon but every time I did that they never knew what to do with my hair. Keep in mind I only go to Tricoci University for haircuts and not styling and they know what their doing. At the end of the cut they always confirm with the teacher/manager to make sure it was done correct and customer is happy. It works for me.

33.description: I went there last summer for a haircut. I very carefully explained to the student exactly what I wanted. She was doing a great job, but then the teacher came over and told her she was doing it all wrong. Without asking me what I wanted, the teacher took over and cut my hair completely different than how I asked. I hated it so much that I was embarrassed to leave the place. I couldn't believe that the teacher, who was supposedly the expert, didn't even bother to ask me what I wanted.

43.description: This school can't do hair at all!! I had my highlights done here by a girl named Lindsey. she was cold, didn't talk or make conversation, she gave me a good house keeping magazine even though I'm a 21 year old and don't  have a house yet. I was insulted. I don't look old either. Anyway, she did a terrible job on the highlights. she kept running away and left me waiting too long with the foils in my hair some started to fall out.I was so glad none of my hair fell out. She didn't follow the directions and what I had asked for. Her supervisor or teacher had to keep telling her what to do. Also she made the highlights too far from my roots. I'm not going to school for hair and I could have done a better job and applied a damn foil. I didn't even  tip this girl because she was so terrible. Also the receptionist at the front desk was rude, and did not greet me when I came in. I am used to being attended to and welcomed when I enter a salon or a beauty school. She also gave me an attitude when I was paying and didn't say thank you. This girl is suppose to be representing this school and doing a bad job. honestly I will never attend this place for any services or go here for school. Tricoci University YOU SUCK!

2.description: Brought my 86 yr. old Mother here for a perm which she desperately wanted. Everyone was great and staff was very helpful and friendly as well as being very professional. The young lady by the name of Rebecca, took excellent care of her and did a fantastic job, which made my Mother very happy. She definitely wants to come back in the future for regular styling when ready.

18.description: I came here for a mani-pedi and was a little disappointed. I gave 3 stars because I know its a school and I mean, you get what you pay for. I honestly was expecting a little something more maybe because of the Tricoci name. When I arrived I was told to take a seat and wait, I waited for 10 minutes if not more then the girl who was going to take care of me came and introduced herself and told me to wait while she preps the room. That was probably about another 10 minutes if not more. The person who did my mani-pedi was a very sweet lady and it actually came out good BUT I didn't like the fact that they don't cut your cuticles and they don't trim your nails down (isn't that one of the main points of getting this service done?) So i feel like I pretty much paid someone to do something I could have done myself in reality. If you are teaching these students to work in a real salon they should do everything a real salon does as well, just my opinion.UPDATE: I went back (bought a Groupon for 2 mani pedis-used the last one) and it was even worse than the first time I went. At this point I'm convinced it is not the students fault that they suck (sorry). I have noticed it is lack of teachers being around and not even there assisting or watching what these girls are doing. This time they had way more nail polishes to choose from BUT the colors I chose were almost empty and was chunky and my nails looked terrible. The worse part is the student was going to let me walk out with my nails looking like crap and i told her to do another color so she did. She did a completely different routine than the first girl which proves these girls are not being trained properly (in the nail dept at least). I hate to be so mean because i know the girls are students and learning but if you have people coming in paying for these services you need to give them the service they are paying for. It was a clear bad job that any nail tech would say it was a horrible job and after she took me to the teacher to get approved the teacher took a 2 second glance at my nails and gave her 100%! I couldn't believe it. If she actually took a minute to look at my nails she wouldn't have gotten 100%. Seems like a fun environment to be in but you shouldn't pass students just because you like them, people are paying to be here and it shouldn't take over 2 hours for a mani-pedi especially if I got there early and she took me right on time this time. I definitely will not return here ever again.

41.description: Up one star...for excellent Total Quality Management and customer service.The wonderful management team took the extra time and effort to reach out to me after reading my Yelp review, which I was very appreciated of. It shows a lot when they're contacting me personally asking what they can do to serve me better and giving me an opportunity to come back. A must...SEAWEED BODY WRAP. They take ace bandages soaked in seaweed and wrap them all over your body. The session took about an hour altogether. My skin looked so kissably fresh I wouldn't be surprised if I found myself going regularly. Carmen was very attentive and did an exceptional job making sure I was satisfied with my first-ever seaweed body wrap. I brought a friend with me to get her hair highlighted and cut. The only problem with her hair stylist though was she didn't thoroughly listen to exactly what my friend wanted. My friend wanted it cut a certain length, but her stylist disagreed and kind of went her own way of doing things. Eventually the teacher came around and re-cut my friend's hair but the time it took for all that to happen was unbearably long. I shall return for hair services myself and will update accordingly!

52.description: 2011 Update:The quality of your visit to Tricoci University really depends on the student you get and instructors that check their work. Today was probably my 4th time (I average about once a year) and decided my last review was too heavily biased on a really good experience. So I made an appointment for myself today and set aside 4 hours to have everything done(it ended up taking about 3 1/2 hours). It's important to come mentally prepared that it's going to take awhile because they are students and they're learning, that's a given. My hair is past my shoulder and I wanted a cut and color. After I told the stylist what I wanted in terms of color, she started prepping and mixing and had the instructor sign off on the work to be done. She was very quiet, I guessed she was probably new to the program. About 2 hours in the color had been applied, I had been rinsed and now I was headed back to the chair for the cut. The thing that kills me is that she never asked me what kind of haircut I wanted. When she had the scissors already in her hand, she asked me how much I wanted off. I told her an inch. She worked silently on my haircut, the instructor came by to check on her every half hour or so. I had already decided that I didn't want to try anything new, I just thought it was funny that she just assumed that I wanted the same cut. At the end of the 3 1/2 hours, my hair was cut, dried and styled with a round brush(i think iron or curling is extra). I was pleased with the cut, but I noticed in the mirror's reflection that the color had not come out as evenly as it has in the past, I could see my natural color and it almost looked like low-lites. No one mentioned it, and I just sort of let it go. I really wanted to get out of that chair, and part of me wasn't sure if maybe I was just imagining it.  For $50 and a longer than usual amount of time in the chair, I got a nice cut and color. I do agree with other  reviewers when they say that the atmosphere is less than professional, it often feels sorority-esque. There's a lot of excessive socializing and discussing classes, even with clients in the chair. And today I think they had some sort of styling contest that everyone was cheering about. I think the instructors should check in on their students more than they do, and maybe give them a little more guidance than what I experienced today, not just signatures on their sheets. For example, I think my experience would have been better if she had asked me what I wanted in a haircut, asked if I liked that cut she gave me, if I wanted something changed, or if I wanted my fringe trimmed. Overall, I'm satisfied but I think that new stylists need more help with their clients than what they're given. _____________________________________________________All i can say is "wow". I went this morning for a haircut when the place opened at 9:30 and I waited about five minutes for a stylist. I wasn't sure what to expect from a student haircut, but for $17 ($12 for shorter than shoulder length) dollars I was willing to try. My stylist, Paulina, was very friendly and professional and even told me a little about what it was like going to school there. I was worried since my hair was super long and i wanted to take a lot off, but she was very methodical and careful with it, occasionally asking for advice from one of the teachers. There were about 3 teachers that walked around and supervised the students while they worked. Because it was basically dead in there, one of the teachers was watching her most of the time while she worked. When it came time for the "fringe" (i didn't know there was another word for bangs), she brought the teacher over so that she could get it just the way i wanted it. i was thankful she didn't pretend that she could do everything, when she needed help she asked for it. The teacher was very professional and my fringe turned out beautifully(she was even able to work with my cowlick). I guess at the end the teachers normally will check the work to make sure everything is right, but she didnt have to because she was watching and could see that it was a beautiful cut :) i think i made it out of there in a little  under 2 hours, so its not a quick process--they're learning, after all. And i'm sure mine took longer than usual since i had so much hair. I was so happy with my cut and style that it felt pretty criminal paying only $17 so i left her a big tip. I left the salon feeling so happy and pretty ^_^ I would highly recommend this place, it's easy on the wallet and quality service to boot. I think next time I'll be more adventurous and try a color or something.

50.description: In Between visits to Salons I like to come here for a shampoo and blow out . It takes a VERY long time so don't plan your schedule around your visit here. Multiply the time you usually spend in the salon by 2 and that is probably pretty accurate.I understand that they are students and I give credit for effort BUT if you plan to be a successful stylist you're going to have to step up your game a bit. Shampoo and blow-dry clocking in at near three hours?!  On a brighter note, I saw a few people leaving with great cuts so if you're trustworthy then go for it...I will leave that to the Pro's.Most of the teachers do a great job at offering guidance to the students, but some of them just stand around although some students are visibly distressed.If you really truly need something done to your hair and you can't do it or you're flat broke then check this place out otherwise I strongly suggest an actual salon.

4.description: I went to get my haircut for the first time at triccoci, the receptionist was a nice, kind person who assigned me to a young lady named Karina de la Torre and she granted me with exceptional service, she offered me a drink when she arrived and shook my hand, not to mention the fantastic haircut she game me, truly an amazing job. I will be coming to get my haircut with her more often!

6.description: If you want a facial go to NANCY!!! She is graduating soon, so get her while she is their, she listens to your needs and has great suggestions to keep your skin  looking great. I  have seen her twice and I cant wait for my next appointment! My friend noticed how much better my skin was looking and I told her about Nancy and needless to say my friend has an appointment to see her this week!! I cant say enough about her she is very welcoming and makes you feel comfortable. I had the back facial and that was great as well. I will be doing the chemical peel soon!!! Thank you NANCY!!! Oh and a shout out to Ms. Toni she is a great mentor! :)

22.description: My experiences have been very hit or miss here. I don't think a lot of guys get haircuts here, so many of the workers are not familiar with how to cut men's hair. However, I have had some ladies cut my hair very well. Very recently, a guy named Edwin cut my hair. He knew what he was doing, and he was very competent. If you're a guy and are getting a haircut here, I would recommend going to him, because I was very happy with the result. I've been here many times (maybe 10-15), have had a lot of different cuts, and I've colored my hair twice here. I strongly recommend asking for someone that has more experience. The employees are students and some of them have been there longer than others. A couple times I've gone there and it took 2 hours for just a haircut which is ridiculous, but other times I've had an amazing experience. It's very cheap which is why I keep coming back, but I would bring in a picture and be specific with what you want done along with asking for someone with more experience. Pros: Cheap service, polite staff, and generally good haircuts. Cons: Have had bad haircuts with long waits a few times, and the students come and go fairly quickly. Someone you saw last year won't be there this year, but that's the nature of this place. It is a school and the students don't stay there forever.

15.description: I had an excellent experience here last week. It was my  first time here and I got a haircut from Dana. She did a phenomenal job! I have a lot of trouble finding good stylists who are not outrageously expensive. Not only was the salon affordable, Dana was fantastic. She knew what she was doing. She was professional, fun, and vibrant. The entire staff was great. Teachers regularly help the students and check up on customers. The entire staff is very friendly. I felt like I was getting pampered. I have long hair and I got long layers. For shampoo, blow dry, and a hair cut, it was $18. I've paid a $100 for the quality haircut that Dana gave me. I strongly recommend the salon and Dana!

20.description: Facial was ok!!!But mani pedi terrible i could have done this myself.Very dissapointed

36.description: If you told me the lovely woman who gave me a salt glow rub, the seaweed wrap, and the most amazing facial I have ever had-was a student, I wouldn't believe. Ebonie was extremely professional-the experience was so positive, I gave her a hug @ the end!I can't wait to go back and get another facial/additional services before she graduates!

14.description: I just got back from getting a touch up that took three hours. I did not have my hair dried and left with a wet head. The girl put the dye on and it was to stay on for  45 minutes. After about 50 minutes the receptionist came to rinse out my hair. An student came and continued. The first student came back and I left with a wet head. When I got home I realized that there was still dye in my hair and had to rewash. I have to say that some of the girls were good. My advise is to be selective when you go in and make an appointment with someone that cares. I expected more from a Mario salon.

1.description: I drove past for years with good intentions to one day stop in and take a look around. Today I finally stopped and walked away with six great finds and a new friend. Mark, the shop owner is the friendliest man you will ever meet! I wish I had gone in earlier, I'll definitely be back!

0.description: This is an adorable little store!   I am not at all a fan of "used furniture stores"....antiques, yes, but not "used"...just reeks of rummage sales, and my broke college days.At any rate, the other morning, I was jogging (yes, I exercise) past this little place and saw the most adorable table!   Mesmerized, I found myself in the store...chatting with this sweet older couple...buying over $100 worth of used...yes, USED furniture.  But, I looove it! They have a great selection...some things look antiquish, while others are more retro...but, I am now addicted.  They're always getting new items, so you have to stop in at least bi-weekly.
She is the  best!! Friendly  and personable haircut... Hit her up! cheap too!

28.description: I purchased a groupon and went here to get highlights and a cut. I went somewhere a few days before and the lady had messed up my hair color terribly, it was awful. I went here on a whim after purchasing the groupon to correct the color and it turned out great. Veronica, the owner, fixed my hair. She had wonderful suggestions and gave me the best hair cut I've ever gotten.  Very happy with the end result.

1.description: This continues to be my go to spot. Veronica wasn't available (she's awesome!) when I booked last week so I saw Ana (who is also fabulous), I believe that's her name. She is leveled at the highest level so she does charge a bit more. Love my subtle darker highlights. She worked with my faded bayalage to create something that flowed and looks so fresh! Their new talent is Maya who I hear is also good, and her services cost less. The one less star is for the hair washing I experienced--just make sure you do it with one of the stylists :-) that's all! Book early because these salon divas are so talented!

9.description: I went to Kahlo because of a Groupon -  and will be back again because of Anna, who is an amazing stylist.  Like you, I first checked Yelp before purchasing the Groupon and saw  a large enough number of reviews that I thought it must be legit. When I first walked in I was a little concerned because it isn't the fanciest place.  When I walked out - almost three hours later - it was with a haircut and color that I just love and that still looks great 3 weeks later.   Anna was meticulous - she kept finessing and I couldn't quite understand what she was doing that was taking so long!  But now I have a haircut that looks great whether I wash it and go, or spend 5 minutes styling it for a totally different look. So Kahlo is my new go-to salon.  The only thing I would change about it is the music - it was relentless R&B and I'm not a fan. So next time I will wear ear plugs - but I will be back again and again.Highly recommend!

29.description: I'm very disappointed. When I walked out of Kahlo....My hair looked really good, I even posted it on Facebook, saying I just got a really great haircut.  It wasn't until the next day when I washed and tried to fixed it myself!  She thinned it out more on one side than the other and it is very obvious.  Not to mention when I sat down in her chair, I told her I had a Keratin Treatment a week ago... any stylist knows you don't use Sulfate shampoo... I"m 99.9% sure she used sulfate shampoo, my hair is not the same,  I will not return to this salon.

23.description: I've been in Chicago for ten years but never really committed to a hairdresser.  Since I don't usually heat-style my hair, I can go a long time without a cut.  So I bounce around, following recommendations, having a friend cut it, whatever.  Because I live SO CLOSE to Kahlo, I couldn't turn down the Groupon deal for a conditioning treatment and cut.  Miriam was my stylist, and I will definitely go back to her in the future.  First of all, she listened attentively while I explained my hair (very thick and complex, with different textures in different spots) and I gave her the rundown on former styles and what worked/didn't work.  I gave her free reign to pick a style, and she explained what she would do and why it would suit me.  I felt listened to - awesome!She took her time with the cut and explained why she was doing certain things, which was another nice touch.  We had good conversation throughout, another nice touch.  What I really appreciated was how thorough she was: She showed my the "end result" before styling it, since I explained I usually just scrunch my wet hair and that's it.  Miriam made sure I was happy since that's how it would look every day, then blew it out so we could see how everything lay, and then consulted with me on whether I liked it as is (a bit edgy) or if I wanted to soften it up a bit.  I opted to her have her soften it up, another 15 minutes or so of cutting.  She really took the time to give me a cut that was right for me, especially looking it over and then continuing to cut after it was dried and styled.The appointment was about 90 minutes, part of which was the conditioning treatment, but still longer than expected.  I never felt rushed though - and maybe I'm repeating myself - it was so nice to feel like her priority was to give me the right cut.

5.description: I WOULD RATE THIS PLACE 200 STARS IF I COULD!!! Veronica is hands down the best stylist I have ever had. I've paid much more money at places in the city and they weren't HALF as good as Veronica. I will never use another salon again!!My sister went into Kahlo (Veronica was her stylist as well) when she got a horrible hair cut at another place (some place she went to in the city). She saw a Groupon for Kahlo Salon and thought maybe they could fix up the mess. They did! She absolutely loved her haircut! She told me about Kahlo and the Groupon was still up so I bought one as well. My Groupon was $29 for a haircut and Moroccanoil deep conditioning treatment. There was an option for highlights as well but I didn't get them. On Saturday I went into Kahlo and the places SCREAMS class! They offer food, water, and coffee right away, and the whole place is elegant, clean, and stylish looking. I waited for only 2 minutes and then Veronica introduced herself and sat me down. Not only was she the sweetest person ever, but she really took the time to get to know my hair! I know that sounds ridiculous, but it made all the difference. She learned exactly what I wanted and what my problem area's are, and fixed them one by one. I got the Morrocanoil deep conditioning treatment, a trim, and long layers. My hair hasn't felt this alive since I was a kid. I told her I was celebrating my dads birthday party that night by having my whole family come over, and out of the goodness of her heart she blow dried and straightened my hair for free!!! This woman just blew me away! I will be a loyal customer until the end of my days! Thank you Veronica and Kahlo Salon! See you in 2 months!

31.description: I had a cut and color with Veronica last month and she was great! I used a youswoop coupon, but the prices are unbeatable either way. Veronica gave me a nice cut and suggested I color my roots only and use a gloss over the rest of my hair to keep it healthy. The gloss treatment was only $20. My hair had been pretty dry due to years of dying, but it looks shiny and healthy again, finally!The salon is super cute and pays tribute to Frida Kahlo. Veronica owns and operates the salon. Ladies, come out and support your fellow ladies!

25.description: I was introduced to Kahlo Salon from Groupon.  I purchased a Groupon for a haircut with Morrocanoil deep conditioning treatment for $29.  I had no trouble setting up an appointment which was nice.  The only option for parking is on the street fyi.  The woman who did my hair sat down and went through a full consultation of what I was looking for.  She seemed very knowledgeable about different layer styles and products.  The shampoo/ conditioning was nice, but the Morrocanoil deep conditioning treatment didn't seem like anything special.  She said she would leave it in for 5 min, but it was maybe 1 min when she began the rinse.  The actual haircut was pretty quick and again it seemed pretty standard. On my way out I was told about their referral program.  I am satisfied with the results so I would definitely consider coming back.

12.description: Veronica is AMAZING! She fixed my hair after receiving a horrible cut elsewhere. I had been going to a high-end downtown salon for years, but after the birth of my daughter I needed a more budget-friendly salon. I first went to Veronica after purchasing a Groupon. She gave me a great cut and I went back a second time, but still wanted to see what else was out there. I then tried out a small hole-in-the-wall salon close to my home and received the worst haircut I have ever had (I asked for a trim and got what I would call the "Rachel" cut)!! I have thick, curly hair (that was long) and it takes a certain expertise to cut and style it correctly. I went back to Veronica to fix my hair and she had to cut it short to fix the mess the other stylist made, but she gave me the cutest long layered bob. I had been growing out my hair for 3 years and was devestated it had to be cut short, but after the style Veronica gave me I am actually happy I had the bad hair cut as I now LOVE my new do! I am now a loyal customer to Veronica! Oh, and did I mention her prices are very reasonable?! So if you are in the market for a new stylist definitely check out Kahlo Salon!

37.description: For years I struggled to find a good - professional, dependable and friendly hair stylist.   My sister recommended Veronica three years ago and I couldn't be happier with the results and her great personality. I used to dread a hair cut appointment, now I make them 6 weeks in advance and I always look forward to them. I appreciate Veronica's skills, professionalism and how respectful  she is of my time.Now that Veronica has ventured as entrepreneur and opened her own salon, I wish her all the best.  She deserves it!

21.description: Mariam is absolutely the best!So personable and love chatting with her. She knows how to cut hair And color too!Very reasonable price! Parking is located outside the salon (one hour parking-no meter) but I was there for almost 2 hours and didn't get a ticket LOL!!

16.description: I'm so glad to see other reviewers comment on Anna.  I followed her here from Aqua in Edgebrook.  She is great for cut, color, eyebrows, love her.  She is conservative in her judgement, because she understands that your hair is a huge deal to most of us.  She is great at suggesting styling tips and education on hair in general.  She takes her time, she is a perfectionist, but I've gotten used to that and am glad to have someone who takes such pains to do a great job!

17.description: Love love love this place. Been coming here since last year and Ana never disappoints! Went from long hair to a slick bob and now a funky chopped cut like Lisa Rhinna and I love it! They are all so sweet and professional. Always a good experience and I highly recommend them!

10.description: I love this place! I walked in a mess and walked out gorgeous! I love my new look and very reasonable prices. Thank you!

11.description: This review is long overdue. I came here on a Groupon about two years ago and have been going back ever since.  Tatiana is my stylist and I cannot say enough great things about her.   She talks you through the whole process and asks for your input, but always makes suggestions that will benefit you.  I have had cuts, color, special occasion do's and most recently I got the Brazilian Blow Out, which I absolutely love.  I will also say that everyone at the salon is very nice.   The salon itself is a cute and inviting place.  I am not a very patient person and I typically get antsy when I am sitting at a salon, but not here.  It's really comfortable and they offer coffee, tea and spa water.   I really love this place and I'm so glad I gave it a chance.   I am from the area and am happy to support local businesses.  They do that, too.  There are a few other businesses on the same block and they seem to support each other, which is really nice.  This is my first Yelp review and it couldn't go to a more deserving place.  Check them out, you will not be disappointed!

26.description: I purchased the groupon deal for a hair cut, deep conditioning and full highlights.  It was quick and easy to make my appointment over the phone.  The salon is nicely decorated and spacious with a great atmosphere.  My stylist was Tatiana.  This was my first time every highlighting or coloring my hair, so I was a little nervous.  Tatiana not only listened to what I was looking for, but made suggestions that were very helpful.  She explained all the steps to me and made sure I always felt at ease throughout the entire process.  She was very professional, friendly and has a great personality.  My hair came out looking amazing with the highlights and cut.  It was exactly what I was looking for.  I definitely will be coming back to her for my follow up appointments.

27.description: Went to Kahlo with a Groupon this weekend.  It took over a month to get a Saturday appointment,)both my daughter and I had Groupons and wanted our appointments together) and the day after we initially scheduled the appointment they called us and wanted to change the time, we told them we had to have the early time.  Then 2 days before, after waiting over a month, they called to confirm, we confirmed and then they called us back to come in earlier.  No problem, we went in earlier, and the place was closed, we waited about 10 minutes before anyone showed up.  Both my daughter and I had cut, deep conditioner and full highlights.  Our hair came out ok, nothing to really say Oh, I am definitely going back!!!!  In the middle of our color, there was no hot water!!!!!  The place was rather cool to begin with and it was really cold outside, so I felt chilled the rest of the day, after having cold water rinse with each process.  I also noticed the atmosphere is nice, however it is noisy in there.  It is one big open space, like a hair cuttery, no privacy, and you are squeezed together, so everyone can hear each others conversation.  Go back, definitely not!!!

35.description: I was very hopeful when I found this salon on Yelp and read all of the positive reviews. However, I was very much mistaken. As most women know, hair is an extremely important part of one's appearance. Even if we may not be feeling attractive or without makeup, hair can make or break the situation. Apparently, the employees of Kahlo Salon do not understand this fact.I have been looking for a salon ever since my friend moved away. She was my hair dresser and by the way, an amazing one. All I was looking for was a trim and to get my roots done - this means matching your roots to the rest of your hair. That being said, my roots do not match the rest of my hair AT ALL. At the salon, I saw a slight difference but due to the dim light, I did not fully see how horrible it looked until I got home. My roots literally look orange and the rest of my hair is blond with low-lights. Devon was the name of the girl that attempted to do my hair. She seemed like a very nice person and we talked a bit, but she clearly did not know what she was doing. I told her my friend used to do my hair and she asked me if I knew the brand and number of the dye. Obviously, hair stylists should be able to look in their color book and match up the color. I was never asked this question before. I should have known then to get up and leave, but I was still hopeful from the Yelp reviews that she would do a good job. She told me that she has been a hair stylist for a couple of years and I am appalled that she still has not learned anything. The only decent thing she did was trimming my hair, which does not say much.On top of that, the receptionist at Kahlo Salon was unbelievably rude. She seemed nice at first when she offered me something to drink, but as soon as it was time to pay up, that all changed. I had bough a YouSwoop deal for this salon and the receptionist rolled her eyes and sighed when I had not printed the coupon. Who prints coupons nowadays in the age of smart phones? Why waste paper? The number was clearly visible on my phone. There was also another customer ahead of me who was also appalled. Finally, she took our numbers down and then, she charged me the wrong amount at first and if I had not pointed it out, I would have paid far less. Then, she asked me to say out loud how much I would like to tip!Now, I am forced to go to another salon and fix this mess on my head. I would never trust these "hairstylists" to do this for me. Please do yourself a favor and avoid this place. I wish someone else had written a truthful review before I booked an appointment. You're welcome!

8.description: I love Kahlo!  Veronica is the best- I've been seeing her for ages and was so excited when she opened her own place.  This salon is a real gem- I always feel so pampered when I leave the salon.Veronica listens to what I am asking for, but will also give great ideas and suggestions.  Getting bangs was one of the best decisions I made all year!  If you are looking for a salon with dedicated, friendly staff who are talented and hard working, this is your place!  The local art being showcased, and the warm and inviting environment are the icing on the cake!

0.description: Today I went to Kahlo salon for the first time. This was the best experience I have ever had getting my hair done.I walked in, the salon was very stylish and clean. I was greeted immediately at the door when I walked in and offered a beverage. Nice touch. I had an appointment and my stylist, the amazing Ana, was available right at my scheduled time. I received a partial highlight and cut. First, to talk about my partial, Ana was extremely quick and meticulous when applying foils. I have a good amount of hair and she knocked it out in no time at all. She did have another client at the same time who had color processing at the same time. She displayed some serious time management skills: during my highlight the other client had color processing, she had her assistant shampoo and tone her. Shortly after she was done with my foils. While I was processing, she cut, blow dried and styled the other client while her assistant shampooed my hair and applied a gloss. She made us both feel like important and valued clients. You can tell that she really values her clients perception of herself and her business. I have not had that great of an experience at any salon EVER. Ana is an amazing stylist who puts forth high quality work every single time. Extremely well worth every penny. I've been looking for "my stylist" for the past three years and I'm happy to say I've found her! I will be back!

38.description: My wife has had Veronica cut her hair for a few years and now she has opened her own salon. She is incredibly philanthropic as well. Definitely a great person and place to visit for a haircut and style.

20.description: I tried this business for the first time with a Groupon.  Anna did an amazing job.  I would like to go back, but am a little concerned about the prices without a Groupon.  Be sure to bring cash as you can not tip on your credit card (per the sign posted).

19.description: I went in for the first time just after they opened their doors. They were in the neighborhood, and i was in need of a new hairdresser.  I got lucky, Miriam was available at the time so I saw her.  I have been going there ever since. Miriam is awesome. Always does a consult to make sure we are on the same page and then goes to work. I have always been very happy and I always get compliments on my hair.

33.description: Veronica  has been cutting and highlighting my hair for a few years now at another salon and now at her own place.  I am always pleased with her work. The salon is friendly and relaxed. Easy to park on the street too.

2.description: This place is great! Tatiana was so nice and helpful and you can definitely tell she loves what she does. I was nervous to see what my hair would come out to but she did an amazing job! She also gave me plenty of tips on how to keep my hair healthy. And all the stylists really knew their clients and what they wanted. Would definitely recommend coming here!

34.description: I first learned about Kahlo Salon from YouSwoop, and I bought a package for a cut and style, single process color, and partial highlight.  I was very impressed with the warm atmosphere of the salon and the services that I recieved. Veronica was my stylist and she was great! She was very knowledgeable about what would make my hair look its best while staying true to the color and the style that i wanted.I will definitely return to Kahlo Salon. Thanks!

32.description: Went to Kahlo with on line certificates. I had gotten as a gift. Came at the right time as I was in desperate need of a cut and color. Made an appiontment got in within the same week. Read other reviews on yelp and felt good about my decision. My appoinment was with Devon. She was friendly and talked me through it all. We talked color and cut. She applied my color and followed through with a great cut. I just asked for a trim and refreshed layers. She also discussed products she was applying. Seemed like she was a perfectionist. I got there about 5pm and didnt leave til 7pm. However I much appreciated her attention to detail. Service menu prices are average. They arent pushy and trying to sell you stuff. Friendly, adorable space. I walked out with glossy well cut hair. No one ever cheats on their hairdresser but why not be naughty and have a back up. I will def pay Kahlo another visit.

18.description: I've been in Chicago for ten years but never really committed to a hairdresser.  Since I don't usually heat-style my hair, I can go a long time without a cut.  So I bounce around, following recommendations, having a friend cut it, whatever.  Because I live SO CLOSE to Kahlo, I couldn't turn down the Groupon deal for a conditioning treatment and cut.  Miriam was my stylist, and I will definitely go back to her in the future.  First of all, she listened attentively while I explained my hair (very thick and complex, with different textures in different spots) and I gave her the rundown on former styles and what worked/didn't work.  I gave her free reign to pick a style, and she explained what she would do and why it would suit me.  I felt listened to - awesome!She took her time with the cut and explained why she was doing certain things, which was another nice touch.  We had good conversation throughout, another nice touch.  What I really appreciated was how thorough she was: She showed my the "end result" before styling it, since I explained I usually just scrunch my wet hair and that's it.  Miriam made sure I was happy since that's how it would look every day, then blew it out so we could see how everything lay, and then consulted with me on whether I liked it as is (a bit edgy) or if I wanted to soften it up a bit.  I opted to her have her soften it up, another 15 minutes or so of cutting.  She really took the time to give me a cut that was right for me, especially looking it over and then continuing to cut after it was dried and styled.The appointment was about 90 minutes, part of which was the conditioning treatment, but still longer than expected.  I never felt rushed though - and maybe I'm repeating myself - it was so nice to feel like her priority was to give me the right cut.

13.description: I first went to this salon because I was new to the neighborhood and needed a new hairdresser.  I was very pleased with the great job Ana did with my coloring and my cut when I decided to go from long hair to medium hair.  She really listened to what I wanted and made it happen without a problem.  She also does a great job waxing my eyebrows!  The only tip I can offer is to make sure you plan well in advance when you want to go in if you're only free nights and weekends, because they can get pretty busy!  Parallel parking on busy Milwaukee ave can be a pain sometimes, but I've always been able to find a spot on the same block.  Highly recommended!

4.description: I've hit the hair salon jackpot! Three visits in almost a year and I have loved every visit. My original visit was due to a Groupon I saw and I'm have never been more greatful to Groupon :)My hair has had the pleasure of having Miriam for both color and cut. The first time I went, it felt like I have been going to her for years. She's friendly, funny and most importantly knows what she's doing. Both color and cut are always on point. Ten minutes after leaving her today, I was immediately complimented on my hair! But, it's not just Miriam that makes Kahlo so great. From the receptionist to the other stylist, everyone is so nice! If I ever have a hair emergency and Miriam is not available, I have no doubt any of the other ladies can step in and fill her shoes! Seriously, everyone should check this place out!!

24.description: I should mention - I come here almost every 6 weeks or so and have never felt let down. The cost of haircare at Kahlo is a small price to pay for how long they have kept my hair looking FABULOUS! My very long, luxurious hair is a point of pride for me and for what Kahlo charges, it's a bargain! Additionally, for my loyalty and for checking in on Facebook, I gain points that I can save up for a discount. Everything about this place is worth coming to - the atmosphere, the service, the professionalism and the feeling you get when you leave looking like a million bucks! This place also supports local artists - you can see their cool art all over the walls. Did I mention complimentary sweets and beverages? Yeah, this salon rocks.

6.description: This place is awesome! I went here because of a groupon and have gone back plenty of times since. Miriam is so wonderful! She listens to what you want and then gives it to you! If she doesn't think it's a good look she will give you advice as to how it can work. She's seriously the reason I go back. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The prices aren't too bad and the art on the wall is fun. Love this place!

22.description: I have to say that this was the best first visit to a salon that I have had in a long time. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. There is water, coffee and treats to snack on during the appointment. I had bought a Groupon, called the salon was was able to get in for the very next day. My cut, treatment and partial highlights was with Tatiana. She was great in picking out the color for my highlights and really listened when I explained how color works on my hair (I'm a natural red head and it always fades fast/turns orange). It was great that Tatiana was very familiar with curly hair and made knowledgeable recommendations during the cut. Overall, this was a wonderful experience and I will definitely be back.

15.description: Well i started coming here because of a groupon that was a gift. Ever since then when i know im going to be in that area i try to make an appointment.  All stylist are great very very welcoming, the decor is fantastic with art from local artist that you can actually purchase. They have complimentary coffee,  wine or even beer while you wait, lol which i love. Veronica and Graciela have been wonderful since the beginning thanks a lot to the whole kahlo salon.

7.description: Mariam is absolutely the best!So personable and love chatting with her. She knows how to cut hair And color too!Very reasonable price! Parking is located outside the salon (one hour parking-no meter) but I was there for almost 2 hours and didn't get a ticket LOL!!

36.description: I've known Tatiana foreverrrrrr... and all I have to say is that for the past 3 years no one has touched my hair other than her and I refuse to let anyone else touch it.... She has kept me looking good and I tend to keep going to her wherever she goes to stay looking good.... Veronica I just met but she does amazingggggg spray brush make-up and I will definitely let her do make-up on me anytime she wants..... Thanks girlies for making us look fabulous!!!! ;)

30.description: I've been to Kahlo a couple times now and love the place!  They use Redken products and their prices are very reasonable.  Tatiana cut and highlighted my hair.  She was a perfectionist when it came to the cut!! Love her!  I also opted for the Redken Chemistry treatment that left my hair silky smooth!!  It did wonders on my color treated hair and lasts wash after wash!  I would (and have) recommend this salon!  They are so nice and accomodating there.  They've gone out of their way to fit me in for my appointment and even sent me a card in the mail congratulating me on the birth of my son.  I've felt comfortable there and that is what I was looking for in a neighborhood salon.  I am very particular when it comes to my hair and I was glad to find a salon in the area that competes with with the high end salon on Michigan Ave that I've gone to for years!  They are experienced, they listen to you and pay attention to detail.  I've walked out each time feeling good and looking great!  I can't wait to go back and go a little lighter in time for the summer!

3.description: Tatiana is the best! She is a color expert and a pleasure to work with. I recently moved and still drive 45 min out of my way to see her. I won't trust my hair to anyone else! The salon is clean and modern with great service and friendly ladies. Good coffee and music too!

14.description: I told my stylist that I don't want short hair... Left the place with short hair. To clarify, my hair doesn't look horrible and the staff seemed super nice - just not happy with the amount taken off which is a huge deal for me. I'll be more specific next time. I might come back.

0.description: Two days ago I had a heart procedure to unblock an artery. So what did I do the day before? What any sensible woman would do (after confession): I got a haircut. If the two stents had not been successful, as they appear to have been, I would have been facing another open heart surgery, with all the attendant anxiety. The stents alone had been stressful enough! So it had been a painful week. Nevertheless, I was sitting this morning in front of my mirror, getting dressed, and all I could think of was, Darn, that's one great haircut! Which is what several folks in the heart lab had already said, as I was wheeled from one station to another and gradually but surely stripped of every element of style except the hair on my head: wow, great haircut! Then they covered it up with one of those paper things, but still!Because Renata came through. She was undaunted by my request that she give me a haircut that would at least look good in a hospital bed if not a mortuary. She didn't even raise an eyebrow. She didn't even blink. She just waxed my own brows perfectly--and youthfully, something no other eyebrow specialist seems to be able to achieve. And the haircut I sported to my hospital ordeal cheered me, and as any person can tell you, it really can make all the difference in handling a challenge, any kind of challenge at all. So I was sincerely grateful this morning for the help, and thought of leaving a Yelp review. Bottom line: Renata, the owner of Magic Fingers, about five feet four and not so many pounds, has some serious haircutting skills, and besides that, the heart of a lion. Bring her anything, she won't flinch, she'll just make you look good for a sensible price.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Curly Hair, Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Jean was kind and facial services were good but the receptionists customer service goes without redemption. My appointment was made over the phone.  Confirmation e-mail had conflicting time/date.  When I called to confirm date/time she was verbally abusive.

1.description: First time customer and chose the Ultherapy treatment. There was no pain, and no visible marks...and within three weeks I was receiving compliments about how good my skin looked. I would highly recommend her

2.description: I just called as a first time client that the person who answered was so rude and not helpful. I felt like they didn't even want my business.

5.description: I'm actually really surprised by the 2-star review. Jean Borelli is one of the best medical estheticians I've ever been to. Her background and education are so important in providing the level of consistency and care. I have had several treatments at her office, including glycolic peel, SilkPeel Dermalinfusion, and the always satisfying Laser Genesis treatment. Jean's committment and quality are evident and she is an absolute hoot and joy to work with. Her services are available by appointment only, but she is accomodating and has a very friendly, approachable work sense. She really understands the provider-patient relationship.Her prices are very reasonable, her motto to make it affordable to the average person. Unlike many spas downtown that tout crazy good results and a heavy penalty on the pocketbook, Jean Borelli and Medical Aesthetics, Ltd. actually deliver at a fraction of the cost.I highly recommend Medical Aesthetics for the variety of services offered.

6.description: I have been going to Jean Borelli at Medical Esthetics for a few years now.  She does both my Botox and several skin treatments, including the Silk Peel (which I love!!!).  She is very skilled, professional and always a pleasure.  My skin looks and feels better than it has in years.  I am also using the Jan Marini skin care line which is doing wonders for my skin's texture and tone.  I have recommended Medical Esthetics to several friends and ALL have become very happy clients!

7.description: After going somewhere else for laser-hair removal, the tech was astonished at the fact that practically all my hair grew back after six sessions (and thousands of dollars!) Apparently, a lot depends on the type of laser that is used. Medical Aesthetics uses IPL which is the cheapest and least effective. Don't waste your money and ask questions.

8.description: I went here for a silk peel, and I did not like it at all. It was not a pleasant experience, and I did not see any improvement in my skin.

0.description: Absolutely love this place. When I'm feeling like I need a little rejuvenation, I pick up the phone and call Jean. I love going here, this place has a warm, homey feel and Jean will give you just what you need. Recently got my first silk peel (I jumped in head first with Juvederm before anything), and my skin looks and feels amazing. My husband just told me my face looks better than ever, and I feel great. They don't try to up sell you; in fact once you get on the mailing list you'll get exactly one email a month detailing their awesome specials. This is my happy place. I hope if you're reading this, you check it out and feel the same way I do.

4.description: Medical aesthetics is AMAZING!! I love love love jean Borrelli! She is so funny and her prices are so reasonable. The decor and the whole experience is the best. I am definitely coming back!!!! Jean is great with all ages and sells the perfect products including makeup, products and so much more!!! This is definitely the place to go!!!

3.description: This was a pretty small Irish bar in a neighborhood with some competition. It has a small stage and great irish beer imports. There was heavy Irish accents and that is what you want going to an Irish bar. A pretty authentic Irish bar. Now if it were only located in an actual Irish neighborhood

1.description: I can't believe I've been a Chicagoan my whole life and never been here. If you're looking for a northside bar that won't disappoint, skip Moretti's, skip the Garage down the street and come here. Stuccoed, stone and wood paneled walls, a beautiful rectangular bar in the center, cozy lighting and kind staff all contribute towards a warm, inviting atmosphere. On a Friday night, there was a good mix of regulars and outsiders like us who had just stumbled in. All were made to feel welcome. Drinks are affordable and they even had a selection of European candies - 3 for $5 - along the back wall. Also has a jukebox and darts. This will be my go-to place when I need to meet friends in the area.

2.description: KISS ME, I'M NOT IRISH...So a friend and I were looking for a place to go before a Blackhawks game. Since he lived on the north side he suggested that there is place near his house that he always goes to. I figured why not. We parked in the bank parking lot across the street from this place. My friend said he needed to go to the cash station so I headed for the bar on my own.The moment I walked in, I noticed that everyone at the bar turned to take a look at who was entering their place. I grabbed a seat across from the regulars. I told the bartender that I was expecting a friend to show up as well and that she may even know him. She asked who it was and I told her, Jokingly she gave me a hard time. The moment that my friend came through the door it felt like an episode of Cheers. Instead of Norm, everyone called out his name "George". They all asked him a question which George came back with a witty answer. It was perfect, I felt at home. He then introduced me to the bartender and gave me a brief history of the bar and how it got it's name. There are three partners that own the place and that they come from three counties in Ireland. Sounds like a good name to me.I have to say that I enjoyed my couple of beers here. I started off with a Harp and then went with a Guinness which was a terrific pour. I don't live near here but next time I'm in the neighborhood I will definitely stop in for a cold one or two or three.

5.description: Great Irish pub. Now that the smoking ban is in place, even better. If there are 20 people at the bar, 18 of them have Irish accents. Eileen is a great bartender and always takes care of us. Gets pretty crowded on the weekends.

0.description: A perfect Irish pub.  You walk in and feel the warmth of wood and the crackle of conversation.   You may have had good Guinness at a few places, but you have never had it like you do here.  The bartenders pour it slowly, with patience, until it has reached its perfect level.  And it is worth every second and every penny (though the amount of pennies you pay is very reasonable).  Like music?  Come here at nights or on the weekends.  You'll see traditional music and rock, a wonderful blend of old and new.  Learn words to some Irish rebel songs, though, so that you can join the crowd in singing along. Oh yeah- that's the kicker: prepare to lose yourself among the accents, the brogues, thick as Guinness.  You'll hear dirty jokes and great stories, and hear the regulars bandy back and forth.   As the name implies, the owners are from three different counties in Ireland.  If you aren't familiar, counties in Ireland are the standards for identities and for rivalries.  So while watching soccer or hurling or Gaelic football, all of which draw a lively and enjoyable crowd, the place will be torn depending on whose county is playing whom- or who just feels like irritating the boys from Mayo.  This isn't a bar where you'll have to shout over the Top 40s while pounding Coors Light (though they do have a full arrangement of domestic and imported, and indeed the Irish there drink mostly domestic).  It is a place for conversation, for laughs, for friendly service where they treat you as family.  It is impossible for me to say enough good things about the Counties.  Go there, and raise one to the Auld Sod.

4.description: A great Irish bar, mostly full of of-the-boat Irish stopping in after work or out on a weekend night.  Weekends usually has some pretty good music on their stage, and the people behind the bar are some of the nicest in the city.  Not too huge, and a little dark, but this place certainly does have a bit of charm.

0.description: A hidden gem! Great stuff that you won't see anywhere else. Staff always very helpful and pleasant. Definitely a place to stop in and  shop.

3.description: My #1 go to pharmacy  there always  busy but they seem to have a staff thats knowledgeable  and knows there stuff i started going here when all the other ones kept making mistakes over and over

1.description: The pharmacy here is the worst. No one in line but my screaming baby's prescription can't be filled for 25 minutes? And rude pharmacy staff that seems not to care. Perhaps you need to learn how to properly staff your store....

2.description: there is an employee there that needs to learn customer service skills and maybe help his co workers out more...Robert is horrible. So many of us dread walking in there and dealing with him. He puts on a good front for 'certain' people but he is a true "eddie haskal"...has zero people skills...is rude and abrubt. I have watched him hide out in certain aisle when they are calling for help up front  and overheard him telling someone, "I am not helping him ( Raheel) or her (Denise) out. Fire this dude. However, Denise, Donna, James, Sue in Pharmacy are fabulous!!! Only reason I go back. The Pharmacy needs to learn when to call for backup at register. lines for RX have been down the aisles and they do not feel it is necessary to call for help. I had to step out of line, and ask for a Manager to add  a few more people to assist at register in Pharmacy, just to expedite and get it moving.  Poor management...Jose needs to learn the language a little bit better, who is a manager, i guess. Ask him for help and he just mumbles and walks away confused. Get your shit together Walgreens!!!

5.description: Great place to stock up on Pedialyte before a weekend of partying because they always have it in stock. They have great seasonal clearance deals at the end of every holiday and everything in the store is super easy to find, plus they are opened on holidays. The store is very clean and the employees are super friendly and helpful if I have any questions. The Walgreens app makes it super easy to see which stores have items I want in stock and you don't have to bring your rewards card with you because on the app you can just press the rewards button and hold it up for the cashier to scan it.

6.description: The ladies working in cosmetics are the best! They're always genuinely interested in what they're doing, eager to help and GREAT at finding good deals! These girls are the best and I feel they really live up to their job title and Walgreens friendly neighborhood reputation. Another great employee is the (manager?) in the pharmacy dept. Anyway- he's a larger guy, dark hair and baldish on top. See him for all your needs! He's caring and very knowledgeable. Also has always been very patient when I've had insurance issues, which I don't tend to hand too well and get fussy with ;( but he remains polite at all times and I never feel rushed! However, I have a HUGE gripe with other employees in the pharmacy. Two younger women in particular- they need to review HIPAA desperately! These two have no idea how to be discreet or confidential with medical information! They will loudly shout out to their coworkers what prescription I'm needing to pick up or waiting on. WOAH! I've complained before, but these two just don't catch on. I'm not ashamed of anything I'm prescribed, but the point is that my medications don't need to be hollered out for everyone to hear! Privacy, people! Take a cue from your coworkers and hush up sometimes!

7.description: Absolutely the worst run pharmacy in the city!  The lines are always ridiculous and no one seems to care at all.  Heading to another local Walgreens.  The additional time spent will be worth not being aggravated.

8.description: This is probably one of the best Walgreens I've ever been to. It's huge and always very clean and well put together... even during Christmas which is a rarity. I applaud the staff for being extra helpful and the pharmacy is top notch. I come here a couple of times a week at the least and will continue to do so. Also, for the ladies-the store manager is a total hottie!!!

0.description: I was pleased by the fact that they carried those Lays Do Me a Flavor bags of chips...i cant think of anything else out of the ordinary compared to other Walgreens stores...ioh this store is 24 hrs open! Service at check out was ok and prices are not bad either...

4.description: ZERO STARS!!!! This is the worst pharmacy I have ever been to. After waiting for a prescription for 45 minutes, with only one person in front of me, I went up to the window to check the statues. It had been sitting there ready for pick up all along. No one called out to even let me know. Then I get home and get the medicine ready to give to my 4 year old son and the directions state to give him 2.5 tablets by mouth twice a day for five days. That's five tablets a day. The only problem is that they only gave him 5 tablets. So I call his doctor and they say his prescription is only a half tablet twice a day for five days. Long story short, if I wasn't an attentive person my son could have overdosed by their rookie mistakes. I called and got some pathetic response as to how mistakes happen and they can just reprint the label for me. REALLY, you almost cause my son to overdose on medication and all you say is I can give you a new label. Some body needs to loose a certification over this!!!!!!!!

0.description: TOP FIVE REASONS why...When I want to personally bring someone fresh cut flowers (with or without  vase) this is the place I go to:1.  Excellent selection of fresh, colorful flowers (and vases).2.  You CANNOT beat the prices at ANY florist.3.  The young girls working in this floral department are absolute sweethearts (always helpful, informative, patient and darling)4.  Open 24/7.5.  Its less than five minutes from my house.Last night, I needed a bouquet for my youngest daughter, for her high school performance in "Bye-Bye-Birdie"."Nancy" helped me put together a large and beautiful yellow-white-peach-orange bouquet of mixed flowers (including roses) for under $20.00!! Even wrapped it with orange ribbon-beautiful!I've been there on several previous occasions and have NEVER been disappointed or failed to impress the recipient of the flowers!

28.description: Breakfast skillets are really good and priced right.  Place is small and crowded so service is a little weak but the girls are real nice.

1.description: We found this place by accident and we're glad we did!!I had a wrap that was really good and big enough that I didn't finish it!Outdoor sidewalk dining is small but if you can get a table it's still enjoyable!Our server was a young girl who was very friendly and attentive. The place was packed and there were several takeout orders picked up. I'd say it's a good find!

39.description: Best breakfast on the northwest side.  The food is delicious and they give you large portions.   The only draw back is the waitstaff.  I have been there several times and I always have to get up to get more coffee or butter of find out where my toast is.  And this is a small place - it is irritating.

9.description: Strawberry crepes were amazing. Orange juice was fresh and delicious. I got delivery. Which was great,  and didn't even have to call because they are in grubhub. Sweet breakfast that I really enjoyed.

29.description: Great food and great service. The menu is ginormous. Will come back for sure.

23.description: Best breakfast on the NW side!

5.description: Saying edible dog food is a disservice to what my dog eats.  The only thing worse than overcharged food is sevice you get on the phone.  Every delivery order is messed up and when you ask to get it fixed they refer you to Grubhub because the retards that work there rather put 18 ketchups with your order than get it right. The orange juice is the only thing that's worth getting here. Biscuits and Gravy frozen and with bag gravy and can sausage, skillets with cheese harder than talcott. Avoid at all costs. $32 order for those 2 things. Look at the reviews, everything from the last year will tell you everything you need to know.

31.description: You can tell they take pride in their food from the way it looks and tastes. Everytime I go here I am pleasantly surprised. The veggies were cooked to perfection, the pancakes were just sweet enough and the coffee always hits the spot. The staff are superkind and attentive.  This is definitely in my top five diners in Chicago.

25.description: All I wanted for lunch was breakfast, and I got it! They delivered to my work place in a quicker time than expected. Everything arrived hot, fresh and correct! I made a few changes to my omelet (adding cheese and getting other sides), they didn't forget anything, which is shocking! They even threw in things I forgot to ask for like napkins, silverware, and ketchup. Over all I am EXTREMELY pleased in their excellent attention to detail, delicious food, and of course the fact that they deliver!

12.description: I come here for breakfast any chance I get. Best breakfast around if you love that diner experience like me. Great prices and great food. All the people have always been very nice. Just love this place!

37.description: This is a cute little place located right down the street from Resurrection Hospital -so, if you have been visiting medical facilities lately like I have (long story), and don't want to eat hospital food, this is a cute little place to get your breakfast or lunch on. The staff was fast, friendly and the food was good! It's just about 15 minutes from where I live in Chicago so I would consider going back even if I'm not going to the hospital!

21.description: This place is not bad. I don't see the big deal about the breakfast. I didn't find them that much better than other dinners but they do have a great patty melt and Rubin so right there it gets my vote. Nice people, fast friendly service, so I will visit again when I am in the mood for a good patty melt.

16.description: The Irish breakfast was tasty but you have to ask for a side of baked beans to make it complete.  Otherwise, it was really good.  Seating was a breeze on a Sunday morning.  I will say the pricing is kinda unique.  I've never seen items given such exact prices (the Irish breakfast was priced at $9.53).We'll be coming back for sure...

17.description: Not sure why people seem to love this place so much. Maybe their taste buds have dulled from a lifetime of smoking. I can sum up my experience in one word - Crummy.I had the lucky grill skillet with scrambled eggs. The eggs and potatoes were fine, but the bacon was flavorless and the sausage tasted like it had been frozen for a year. I'm quite certain the vegetables were also frozen.As for my toast, the middle of one side had some dark lines on it, but the edges and the entire reverse side were barely toasted at all. The decor is simply depressing.The service was adequate, but it seemed like none of the staff really wanted to be there. And I couldn't tell if there was as manager present. Lucky Grill gave me no reason to return. There are a lot of better places to go for breakfast.

10.description: Went yesterday (11/1/14) at 3:40 PM to meet a group that was already there. The hours posted on yelp stated that they were open until 8pm. As soon as we entered the snippy waitress addressed us (2 adults and 2 children) that they closed at 4pm. We indicated that the website stated otherwise and were given no apologies but that the cook had closed down the gril. A party came in behind us with 4 people and were told the same thing. So while our other friends sat and ate we left starving. I have never heard of a restaurant where you entered 20 minutes before close refusing service! I always loved Lucky Grill and have been going for a long time. But sadly never again. What horrible service. Its not like we were ordering anything that would take long and would have been out of there quick. Also I am a very good tipper and that waitress lost out big time. Very disappointed. We ordered Dinos Pizz on Higgins and it was awesome!

11.description: A decent little diner in a unassuming location with pretty standard diner fare.  I've been meaning to go here since we live so close, but since they recently had a Groupon and we have no kitchen due to remodeling we decided last night was out "Lucky" night.I got a burger, DH got a patty melt and we got a child's breakfast.  One waitress for the whole restaurant means we waited a little bit to place our order, but she was very friendly.  Food was prepared in a respectable amount of time and was served hot.  Meals came with soup which was quickly brought and simple but tasty.The patrons behind us said the breakfasts are the best, so we will be back for that soon.... we have 2 more Groupons to use, but we would go back anyhow.  Prices were pretty standard for a diner.Restaurant was slightly dirty, but with one wait person she probably doesn't have a chance to tidy up too often.  Nothing that grossed me out, just an observation.

26.description: I have enjoyed going to Lucky Grill for years, starting with Lucky Grill#1 on Milwaukee Avenue.  Lucky 2 is close to work, so I tend to go here now. I love the Irish breakfast at Lucky Grill, I always have leftovers and another meal the next day. Another yelper mentioned the lack of Soda Bread, and that is okay as there is so much other food and items with the meal.  I prefer brown bread to soda bread anyway. Service is fast, prices are good, but it is so hard to get in on the weekends and the place is small. I love the soups and sandwiches as well.  I left off one star because the only thing I don't like is the coffee, it is too weak.  Lucky Grill ramp up the coffee for that 5th star.

27.description: Four stars?  Really?  I weep for Chicago if the lucky is the best breakfast place in this area...I like diners; I like greasy spoons; I like home-style cooking; I love breakfast food.  This place should've been a holy grail.  Instead it was holy meh.Sat in a booth (had a huge worn-out crater in the middle; sitting on either side, I felt like I was being sucked toward a black hole), and was promptly greeted by waitress who offered coffee.  I accepted.Browsed the menu and decided on an omelet with the side of pancakes ("Breakfast Club #4).  A glass of water and my coffee appeared; I placed my order.Just as I was taking a sip of coffee, the entire row of booths that I was sitting in shifted violently; an extremely large man was trying to wedge himself into one of the booths, and with every heave, he was literally moving 3 other booths' worth of people.  Everyone took notice, except for the rotund fellow... He just kept grunting and shoving himself into the booth.Ok... that was fun.Waitress refilled coffee and said the food would be out in a bit.Food arrived within 10 minutes of placing the order.  The omelet was over-cooked; I'm not a huge fan of a wet omelet, but this one was literally crispy.  The "hash browns" were really American fries - big "chips" of charred potatoes; there were far too many in the omelet.  Onion and peppers were nearly absent.  I've never had a dry, crispy, taste-devoid omelet in my life... until today.The side of pancakes were nicely cooked, but tasted like cardboard.  The imitation syrup was another strike.  I love me some pancakes, but these were inedible.  Whomever said they were "sweet enough" must have been referring to the high-fructose corn syrup "syrup" because the actual pancakes were dreadful.And, the coffee wasn't anything to talk about, so strike three.Lucky Grill = FAILFood = 1.75 starsService = 3 starsValue = 2 stars (inexpensive, but I'd rather have eaten at McDonalds, and I hate McDs)MISC = 2 starsTo top off the visit, I overheard the large gentleman placing his order, and almost had a grabber myself... two cheeseburgers with fried onions, french fries, coke, and a bowl of broccoli cheese soup.  Yikes.

35.description: On Sunday (Nov. 7) a friend and I were looking for somewhere to eat breakfast. We were driving aimlessly and saw a small line waiting to dine at Lucky Grill (a nondescript sign read Lucky Grill - Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner). We figured it must be good so we decided to give it a try. After a brief wait we were quickly assigned a table. We were served our coffee and never had to ask for a top off. I liked that. I ordered a skillet and my friend ordered one of the combo breakfasts. The food was very good. I like the diner ambiance and unpretentious feel of the place. The food is very good, the service was on point and an overall good value. I will be back.

8.description: Walk in, sit anywhere you like. Parking might be a bit hard to find I suggest park on Canfield.I had the Irish skillet, food arrived quick. Good quantity, taste good ( I'm not too much of a breakfast person) , taste a bit mild to me so I added salt and Tabasco sauce. I'd say its better than ihop at about the same price. I'd like to come back and try the other dishes.

0.description: I ordered food from this restaurant a lot of times. Delivery is always fast... food is warm and delicious. They deserve 5 stars. I don't know who can write those bad reviews. Their breakfasts are awesome. You won't be disappointed. And delivery guy is always very nice

38.description: Best breakfast on the northwest side... The Latin Skillet is unmatched in the city. Also they offer traditional breakfast and lunch as well as irish breakfast. If you're in the hood and looking for a good meal stop at Lucky's.

20.description: Our house was bombarded with menus from this place.  Seriously, two menus on our front door, one on our side door and one on our back gate.  We figured if they were that serious about distributing menus that we should give them a try.  So glad we did!  I had a corned beef hash skillet with a mini waffle.  I ordered the eggs basted and they were cooked perfectly.  Most of the time when I order basted eggs the yolks are completely hard, these were PERFECT.  The mini waffles were yum, an excellent toast substitution.  We were there with a table of 5 and everyone loved their breakfasts.  This might be our new go-to spot!
