19.description: Discovered this gem of a restaurant is right in my neighborhood.  The skillets are amazing. I've also been here for lunch. The patty melt was great. Loved the onion rings. Looking forward to sampling the entire menu. My wife and I decided to make this our Saturday morning breakfast place.

33.description: It's easy to pass by this greasy spoon (it's got a pretty nondescript storefront and is tucked away between a barber shop and a dance studio), but if you can find it and avoid the breakfast crowd, you'll find it's definitely worth stopping in.  The atmosphere of the diner is very laid back and welcoming, though it's pretty small and I can imagine it must feel pretty claustrophobic when the breakfast crowd is swarming the place; we went at 630 on a Saturday, so we were the only ones there (and we still got fast, friendly service).  The menu is huge and features an interesting mix of items for CRAZY cheap (most entrees were between 7-10 dollars and portions were quite large).  Soups are made fresh every day, there are daily specials, and a pretty good selection of desserts.  While the Lucky Grill seems to be, at heart, a traditional Irish breakfast-ery and features the usual fare-- black pudding & white pudding, corned beef, w/e else Irish people eat (...potatoes?)-- there are also some intriguing selections that I'll definitely try upon my return.   Corned beef skillet? Done.  Enormous breakfast combos?  You got it.  Pizza omelet? A-WHA?! You'd better believe I'ma try that.When my small group went, we tried some standard breakfast items, which were pretty well received.  I got the Irish breakfast, which came with two black puddings, two white puddings, a hefty slab of Irish bacon, two eggs (any style), and toast.  All of this was served upon a tasty bed of thick-cut hash browns and it all cost around $8.  A friend of mine got a skillet of some sort which was similarly huge and apparently delicious.  I'm excited to go back and try more, and perhaps even venture in to experience the breakfast rush.  Giving this a 4-star rating for now as I haven't fully immersed myself in what this place has to offer.

2.description: Large menu. Quick service. Good prices.

34.description: Best breakfast ever. Home cooking, plus a warm and lovely vibe. Will positively return.

32.description: I love diners. Lucky Grill is a nice and little local gem. Nothing from the outside really draws your eye to the restaurant so you would have to be specifically looking for a place to eat. It's not a bad looking place by any means though. You can park on the street or find a spot in the little private lot behind the restaurant. The inside is somewhat small: there are a few tables, booths, and little bar stool area. Pretty much any place with neon signs on the window is a winner in my book. The menu is surprisingly gigantic. There are pages and pages of various foods but the highlight (for me) is the breakfast menu. I've had several items and I've been satisfied every time. Classic items can be found, like a Denver omelet or bacon & eggs. If you want something different then why not try the chili omelet or latin skillet (which includes such ingredients like chorizo, jalapenos, etc). Want burgers, sandwiches, or gyros? Come over here and try 'em out then! This place has something for everyone at very reasonable prices. If I had to say an average price, I would say a meal would cost you ~$7.00. I love this place so much that I plan to have everything on the menu at least once. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is cozy, and the food is great.

18.description: I have been here many times, i think they have the best skillets in the city, but then i have also learned their homemade soup is fantastic and now I would add their Cobb Salad is fantastic a well. So in review, great breakfast, the soup its over the top, the salad i had today was really fresh, and oh yeah the waitress Nicole is cute and friendly. This pretty well covers it. Every one should cover this place a try

13.description: Four stars?  Really?  I weep for Chicago if the lucky is the best breakfast place in this area...I like diners; I like greasy spoons; I like home-style cooking; I love breakfast food.  This place should've been a holy grail.  Instead it was holy meh.Sat in a booth (had a huge worn-out crater in the middle; sitting on either side, I felt like I was being sucked toward a black hole), and was promptly greeted by waitress who offered coffee.  I accepted.Browsed the menu and decided on an omelet with the side of pancakes ("Breakfast Club #4).  A glass of water and my coffee appeared; I placed my order.Just as I was taking a sip of coffee, the entire row of booths that I was sitting in shifted violently; an extremely large man was trying to wedge himself into one of the booths, and with every heave, he was literally moving 3 other booths' worth of people.  Everyone took notice, except for the rotund fellow... He just kept grunting and shoving himself into the booth.Ok... that was fun.Waitress refilled coffee and said the food would be out in a bit.Food arrived within 10 minutes of placing the order.  The omelet was over-cooked; I'm not a huge fan of a wet omelet, but this one was literally crispy.  The "hash browns" were really American fries - big "chips" of charred potatoes; there were far too many in the omelet.  Onion and peppers were nearly absent.  I've never had a dry, crispy, taste-devoid omelet in my life... until today.The side of pancakes were nicely cooked, but tasted like cardboard.  The imitation syrup was another strike.  I love me some pancakes, but these were inedible.  Whomever said they were "sweet enough" must have been referring to the high-fructose corn syrup "syrup" because the actual pancakes were dreadful.And, the coffee wasn't anything to talk about, so strike three.Lucky Grill = FAILFood = 1.75 starsService = 3 starsValue = 2 stars (inexpensive, but I'd rather have eaten at McDonalds, and I hate McDs)MISC = 2 starsTo top off the visit, I overheard the large gentleman placing his order, and almost had a grabber myself... two cheeseburgers with fried onions, french fries, coke, and a bowl of broccoli cheese soup.  Yikes.

4.description: Possibly the worst pancakes I've had. Bland weird aftertaste. The hashbrowns were pretty much mashed potatoes no type of crisp texture.Coffee was bad. I was so hoping to find the classic diner food breakfast, this place sure did disappoint. Over priced for subpar food.

24.description: Lucky Grill is a pretty standard diner.  I have only come here for breakfast.  I like their skillet options and the portions are huge! My recent visit I ordered a skillet with chorizzo- more spicy than I'm used to from other diners.  I liked that they offered toast, pancake, or a waffle as a side.  I dislike that they have packaged syrup in the same bowl as the jelly packets.  That sounds ridiculous, but there is something about the presentation of a jar full of syrup. There is a little guilt that comes along with opening multiple syrup containers...just saying.  The service is nothing special and the setup is a typical diner- booths, tables, counter seating.

6.description: STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!! We waited 2 hours for our food, then called to see where it could possibly be (ordered pancakes and eggs!!).... Rude woman on the phone said "sorry we got busy" and hung up!! We asked for order to be cancelled because it hadnt even left for DELIVERY when we called. On top of THAT, the f&*!ers still charged us!!!!!! Unacceptable!

22.description: The Irish breakfast was tasty but you have to ask for a side of baked beans to make it complete.  Otherwise, it was really good.  Seating was a breeze on a Sunday morning.  I will say the pricing is kinda unique.  I've never seen items given such exact prices (the Irish breakfast was priced at $9.53).We'll be coming back for sure...

15.description: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE!Seriously THE BEST hollandaise sauce ever!!!! Their eggs benedict rocks!!!In fact, EVERY single time we have eaten here, which has been very often, the food is delicious and fresh. They have homemade soups that are amazing! Super friendly service and home-like feel. Will continue to come back here time and time again! Thanks Lucky Grill for wonderful service and fantastic food!!!

40.description: Good weekend breakfast if you time it right, as it is a small place and it is often full.  Good prices, good quality, good service, good people.  As yet, I have had no PM dining experiences.  Plentiful free parking, on and off street.

7.description: Our house was bombarded with menus from this place.  Seriously, two menus on our front door, one on our side door and one on our back gate.  We figured if they were that serious about distributing menus that we should give them a try.  So glad we did!  I had a corned beef hash skillet with a mini waffle.  I ordered the eggs basted and they were cooked perfectly.  Most of the time when I order basted eggs the yolks are completely hard, these were PERFECT.  The mini waffles were yum, an excellent toast substitution.  We were there with a table of 5 and everyone loved their breakfasts.  This might be our new go-to spot!

36.description: Very cute little place.  I've only had breakfast there, but it was hot and good!  I love my bacon very crispy and I didn't have to send it back at all.  The wait staff is young, but they weren't too bad keeping my cup filled with coffee, provided the restaurant wasn't filled to the brim.

30.description: Big menu selection: probably about 30 different burgers/sandwiches in total, so it was kind of intimidating. They also have a decent looking breakfast selection and other dinners besides sandwiches.The amount of food you get for the price is pretty fair. I had the monte cristo deluxe, which means it was the sandwich + fries/onion rings/fruit + coleslaw + pickle spear + soup + a dinner roll. They give you a good amount of soup, too, probably a bit over a cup. The roll was a bit chewy, but really good. As for the sandwich, it was really good, though the turkey was a bit tough. My mom had the tuna salad in avocado, and she got a surprising amount of food. You get half an avocado + probably 1.5 cups of tuna salad, and then practically a small fruit salad (watermelon, honey dew, pear, peach, pineapple) and a scoop of cottage cheese and a little cup of jello, PLUS two slices of toast, PLUS soup. All that for just under 10 bucks. We took half home, there was just so much to eat.I'll definitely be returning to try more of their sandwiches or maybe something off their breakfast menu.

3.description: I honestly was really disappointed when we went some time back. The first time we went was wonderful and when we went to go in we didn't see the sign on the door that had changed hours until 3pm. We had gotten there around 2:30 and was told as we went to walk in, the door barely open that they were closed. No sorry no explanation just Were closed. The staff that my boyfriend and I saw were just standing at the counter talking and didn't seem pleased to see us. A simple hey sorry we changed hours would have been fine but nope just a We're closed and a very unpleasant look on her face. We ended up going else where and as of now have no intention on going back. I get it that it was on our part that we didn't see the sign on the door but she really didn't need to be rude about it.

14.description: wife and I each had a skillet. Mine was absolutely delicious. Our little guys devoured their mickey mouse pancakes at a rate that made others wonder if we ever feed them.would go back there for breakfast, without hesitation. can't speak to lunch of dinner but i'm sure it satisfies the belly but leaves the intellect with pangs of guilt.

1.description: So, on Saturday during another bout with Old Man Winter I wasfeeling bored/restless and decided to get myself out.. somewhere.Now, why in the hell I decided to travel all the way out to Harlem -FosterShopping Center is unbeknownst to me, I guess I was feeling nostalgicsince I hadn't been to or seen this place for like 10 years.So, I was hoping that this Shopping Center had made some improvementsthrough the years, because from what I remembered 10 years ago therewas not much there, obviously my memory was correct because I stayedaway for 10 years!Okay, what I found after my 10 year hiatus..A Jewel Anchor Store where the Burlington Coat factory used to be..A Chinese all you can eat buffet..A Mani-Pedi PlaceAnd,, Bugonia and Trouble's fave spot for me to shop.. Drum Roll PleasePet Supplies Plus.This Shopping Center also has the hugest of parking lots, not sure why,didn't look as though a quarter of it was filled...Oh, but the find of all finds was a great little bakery(review to follow)Oh, a Baker's Square, when you just gotta have a piece of pie!So, I am now 52, and the only reason I would ever come back here wouldbe for the great little bakery I was lucky enough to discover..But, gotta say, I was hoping that in 10 years time things had changed/improved for the better here..From what I could see it hasn't..Kind of like time standing still..And, in some cases that may be a good thing..But, not here, and that's sad....

2.description: I often visit the Pet Supplies Plus and Jewel at Harlem Foster.  The parking is good and location is very convenient.  The Baker Square is excellent also!

0.description: You will find pretty much everything you need here!!  Groceries, a gym, pet store, bank, etc.  I can't complain at all about getting to go to one place for all my errands.

1.description: Best neighborhood bar ever! Owner Steve (and wife Irene) is a classic one-eyed American with Eastern European stubborness that tells it like it is. If you want a martini and a pinki finger salute, this isn't the place for you. But if you want old-school, good hearted bar stool debate, without the Southside BS that may end up in a fist fight, this is where you want to be. The service is phenominal and the prices make it worth the visit. If you are in Niles, go to Yacko's (formerly known as Babe's).I get there every chance I can!

0.description: This is my favorite place to have a few beers after riding the North Branch bike trail. I used to live in this neighborhood years ago and this place and the Newark Nook are the last two real neighborhood taverns you'll find on the NW Side. Spend your money where real people own the joint and work the bar!

3.description: Had to share the great service I got with the Stamp KingSo, I'd decided that I wanted to use a mix of vintage stamps to reach the $0.71 2oz postage needed for my wedding invites. I searched a number of vendors for vintage stamps- Etsy, Ebay and other online stores- and was frustrated by the price. I noticed (not surprisingly) that many love, heart, wedding and floral stamps were even more expensive.I decided to see if I could find a local shop that might have a good selection. I called ahead to check if they had the stamps I was looking for- I had the "scott" number from my searching but was open to other suggestions as well. I shared what I was looking for and planned to visit the store over the weekend.I stopped in the owner (Charles, I think) had notes from our short call and had pulled a few things. There was another appointment in the store so it might be worth setting up time with him.I hoped for a Wisconsin (my home state) and West Virginia (Fiancee's home state) stamps paired with a heart/love/flowers. He knew SO much about the stamp options we had, and gave his opinion when asked. We were in the store about 30min total.We were able to get an awesome mix of state stamps paired with a "love" stamp. We also decided to get vintage postage for our reply cards- Charles was a great help locating some options for us! We ended up spending an additional $40 (vs. buying new stamps) for our 110 invites.My fiancee enjoyed meeting him, too. It's a bit of a trek- off the Harlem Blue line stop but there was plenty of parking.One note- cash only!

1.description: Stamp King provides the most personalized, attentive, and patient customer service I have ever received. Both employees were happy to help and spent more than enough time helping me accomplish what I set out to do -- plus found some really cool stamp sets for me that I wasn't expecting! I'd highly recommend this spot to anyone!

2.description: Stamp King stayed after hours for two hours helping me pick up the stamps I needed to start my collection. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable, and patient. I will make this my go-to place for any stamp needs. Also would highly recommend this store for a beginner or advanced stamp collector.

9.description: This guy has everything for stamp collectors.  My husband inherited a couple of collections and he wants to organize them properly and value them, etc.  Everything we needed was here -- the little paper covers that you staple, the plastic binder sheets, the valuation books, etc.Tip: bring cash as that is what is accepted.  If not, you need to get cash from a local ATM that charges fees or come back, so make sure you have cash on hand.Transit: Walking distance from Harlem Blue Line station.  Otherwise take Higgins bus.

10.description: A pure gem.I made a bit of a drive to get here with my wife and 6 year old son. As a novice collector I was hoping to get some tips and advice as well as purchase some stamps. Well, I was absolutely blown away by the personal experience we received from Mr. Berg. He not only took the time to teach me more about this hobby, he made sure my wife and son were included too! You could not ask for a kinder and more patient person. He loves what he does, and he is a fair dealer too. I expect to spend more of my money here and love every minute of it!

4.description: This is a hidden gem. I went there to buy some holiday stamps to use to mail out my holiday cards. The owner was so helpful and knowledgeable.  There are so many stamps to choose from, which is a good problem to have. I highly recommend this store to fulfill your special occasion mailings. Unique stamps add a little something special to envelopes and your friends will enjoy the special touch.

6.description: BAD for coins!  I read many fine reviews about this place and I suspect for engaged couples looking for invitation stamps or stamp collectors he could be your man. IF you are looking at selling coins I would avoid this shop!  I had old silver and received MUCH lower quotes than Niles Coin Shop.  I also received much lower bids on collectible coins - in some cases by 50% or more than 2 other local shops.  The owner is pleasant and has a nice patient demeanor so I do not want to be overly negative or insulting.  If you want stamps and patient service then this is your place.  If you are dealing with coins try somewhere else first (or after) and you will probably find a larger and definitely more competitive selection!

11.description: Excellent stamp and coin shop.I recently visited this shop to sell my grandmother's huge stamp collection.  The owner was very polite, honest, fair, and a true gentleman too.  He was exceptionally happy to see me and spent hours going through the boxes of stamps.  All and all, it was a very pleasant experience.  I would recommend this shop for collectors as it has a very nice inventory as well as he can order virtually anything.  I also recommend this store for people who want to sell their stamp and coin collections as this shop is very fair and honest.  Finally, if you are in the area and need a stamp to mail something, this store sells current postage stamps.

5.description: I found this shop on Yelp when looking for a store in Chicago to get vintage stamps for my Save the Dates--I'm so glad I did!The store was a trek for me--about an hour each way--but TOTALLY worth it.  I spent over 2 hours in the store going through books of stamps, and laying out various combinations.  The owner of the store and his counterpart were patient, funny and kind.  I left feeling like they were old friends.I ended up getting a combination of 3 stamps for each of my 100 STD's, and the owner went through his archives to dig up everything I needed. I am so pleased with the experience that I can't wait to go back when I send out my invitations.  For anyone looking for vintage stamps for their invitation suite...look no further!

7.description: Went to liquidate my/siblings stamp collection. Charles is honest about which stamps are worth more just to use as postage and was very patient with going through several stock books, albums, first day covers, and then bins of just used stamps. Sure I didn't get that much (but I didn't have any real rares) but I got great stories and an update on an old hobby of mine. Recommend you make an appointment and stick to it...or call to reschedule...otherwise you may need to wait as he attend to other appointments while you wait.

8.description: Some of the best moments in life are the times where you find something (a business, a practice, or even a person) that defies today's flashy, materialistic, selfish, and money-hungry status.  For example, seeing an old man driving his '78 Ford, when clearly it has been his daily driver for over thirty years and not some shiny souped-up hot rod.  It might be rusty, it might make funny noises, and it might drive slow, but it's REAL.  Sure, he could easily buy a new car, and then another new car in a few years, and then another (assuming he's still alive of course).  But he doesn't care for standard GPS, AUX port, or even air conditioning.  He probably worked his tail off for that car in 1978 and wants to drive it into his grave.  Give him $30,000 and a new car would be the last thing on his mind.Enter Stamp King, a full-service stamp store up on the far Northwest Side.  The store is located on a fairly busy stretch of Higgins Ave, just east of Harlem.  It is a most unassuming storefront; the fact that I have driven past this place for years and never noticed it is shameful.  A former stamp collector and current coin collector, I decided to stop by today to check it out.  I couldn't imagine a store that specializes in stamps and stamp supplies.  To me, stamp collecting died decades ago.  Hobby and coin shops don't even buy or sell stamps anymore because they are not commodities like gold and silver.  Couple that with this recession we are currently in, and I figured I'd be walking into a blank space.Instead, I was buzzed in and was surprised to find a customer in the store talking stamps with the owner (whose name is Charles).  They were working a deal for a stamp valued at eight dollars- the owner offered three dollars due to some particular condition issue, and the stamp owner tried driving the price to five.  This went on for at least ten minutes.  I tell you, stamp people are tenacious.  I know how it is with coins but I had no idea things were so particular when it came to stamps.  While they were wheeling and dealing, I decided to browse the store, a small, cluttered shop filled with stamp albums, on shelves, stacked, and behind glass; bins of commemorative sheets, plastic baggies of assorted foreign stamps priced to entice the youngest of collectors.  I love places like this.  You can feel the passion in the air, the smell, the sounds...like an old book store or antique shop, except there is something very characteristic about a stamp store (which I haven't been able to place my finger on yet).  Once the customer left, the owner asked me very kindly if there was anything I was looking for in particular.  I told him I was just looking, but that I was surprised to have never noticed this shop in all the years I had been traveling up and down Higgins.  We ended up talking for at least twenty minutes about stamps- the current market, mainly, and he explained to me why people don't "get it" when he offers less than face value for some random old stamp.  Surely, he has had this talk with countless others, and yet here he was, chatting with a complete stranger, a first-time customer who looks nothing like a stamp collector (or a coin collector for that matter).  Sporting a curly white mustache and a big grin, this man certainly is one of those unique individuals who probably could be doing something else for a living.  Instead, he continues doing what he's done for the last 20+ years, taking pride in his stamp shop and setting an example for a lot of people, who instead are out there striving to make as much money as they can, so that they can buy a big shiny house, a big shiny SUV, a trendy mixed-breed dog, and of course pay someone to walk and pick up after the dog.I will definitely be back, as I've got unfinished business (some stamps that have been sitting around here not being appreciated).  Anyone who collects stamps, wants to collect stamps (it's fun, I promise), or used to collect stamps and either wants to start over again or sell their old collection, needs to go see Charles at Stamp King.  A real honest, dare I say "blast from the past" shop.

0.description: We had an amazing experience with the Stamp King this spring.We were looking for vintage stamps to use on our wedding invitations. My wife had been looking around on Etsy and eBay, but couldn't find the right stamps (or enough of them) at good prices. We found the Stamp King on Yelp, she gave him a call, and he set up an appointment with us.We took the Blue Line to his store, where he met with us for about an hour or two. He knew exactly what we were looking for and he offered better prices than we found anywhere else. More than that, he was patient, knowledgeable, and eager to help. For a few of the stamps, he needed to order them -- he called us immediately after they arrived.Truly stellar customer service. You will love the Stamp King.

3.description: I ordered a High Life bottle, a Coors Light bottle, an MGD Light, and a shot of Jack - How much do you think it was?...Started talking to the patrons, there's Jan (she's the Mayor), Matt who shows up every night at 11, and a whole cast of characters that are very amicable and up for a game of 6' bar pool.  The bartender is Eastern European and very nice (I can't remember her name).My girlfriend and I didn't even know this place was there because there isn't any signage whatsoever.  I will definitely go back to this extreme dive bar.  The facilities were surprisingly clean, the bar was a hot cashmere marble colored Formica, and the ceiling had a really cool painting on it.  It looked like the altar at church.SO, if you're looking for cheap drinks, hospitable people, and some random conversation, stop in at Mary's. ...$8.50 is what that first round cost.

1.description: One of the longest standing establishments in the area! From the outside you wouldn't know there is a bar, the inside has a full hand painted mural on the wall and hand made/welded furnishings on the interior.The beer is cheap, the atmosphere is a bit older, and the people are great! It's a local bar that everyone in the neighborhood seems to visit. Everyone is like a big family in here, it may be a little awkward coming in as an outsider, but I learned that they'll welcome you and start talking away like you've known everyone for ages.Overall, a great small bar with amazing prices. Hard to find, but well worth it.

2.description: First of all let me say that you could drive past this building everyday and still not see it. Only at night time are you able to even tell there is a bar built into this collage of law offices.Mary Place is full of character ill give them that, but its mostly old cranky men who look up when a new face walks in the door, and besides from the cheap beer and drinks, the bartender is a dime piece.Besides from watching 65+ year old lady dance at a bar and listen to lady Gaga and rub up on everyone in the place i enjoyed my night there.Would i come back, yes, would i recommend it NOOOO

0.description: Three dollar shots and  $2.25 domestic bottles. Can't beat that. The new bartender Lynette on Sunday's is learning and a lot of fun  I hear she also works down at Paturno's on Central and Milwaukee.  Mary's is a great neighborhood dive.

3.description: I wasn't sure if I should risk going to such an inexpensive salon, but I am so happy that I did. The same people are always there and they are very experienced. They do great with both color and hair cuts, for both men AND women. I no longer go to other salons. LOVE THEM!!  Call ahead as this is a tiny salon and it's very popular among the locals. Calling ahead will ensure you aren't stuck waiting when it's a busy day. I never waited more than 20 minutes though. The people are very nice and they remembered me after my first visit. Women's hair cuts are only $11. Men are $8. Please give them a generous tip to compensate for the low price. I can't imagine how they can make a descent living charging so little.

1.description: Easy & quick. There can get busy. Used to charge $8 for kids (same as men's cut) & now up to $11 (same price for ladies). Lollipops at front register for kids.  Friendly staff. The young skinny brunette euro gal seems to always be alittle bothered that my kids can't keep as still as a corpse, while in the chair, but what can i do.

2.description: This place was busy and awesome.  I have long hair and was looking for a change.  I got an beautiful quality cut and all over color, and the value was terrific.It is obvious that they have many loyal customers as they have been in their current location for 17 years and have earned a following.  I will definitely be back, and I am not easily impressed.

5.description: Quick and professional, yet you feel like you're supporting a local, family-owned business. Both sons and my husband walk there for a great $8 haircut. Can't comment on the women's cuts or services, but if you're a guy on a quick schedule, this is the place to go. Really friendly shop with a nice neighborhood vibe. Cash only!

0.description: A good haircut at a great price. Locally owned neighborhood stylists. They may be small, but they're attentive to your needs-it's a very friendly place to get a haircut for men, women and children.

4.description: Very inexpensive, quick, and professional. The location is quite small and cozy. It caters mostly to an older clientele, but they were still very courteous to me as a younger person. And, again, I can't possibly emphasize - the price is so good that I don't see how they possibly can afford it.

58.description: This Bar Louie is stuffed in the corner of a hotel but it is actually quite big. The interior décor is decent and follows the company theme. They also have an outside area that I have not been seated at so I am not sure how it is set up. The food and drinks at regular price seem to be a bit high but that is a theme among all Bar Louies. If you eat and drink off the specials or during happy hours it is cost effective to go here.The food has always been good and what I expected. I have been here for dinner, events, and after work functions; they always seem to be staffed accordingly. The service has always been good.  The parking in front of the restaurant is sparse but they do have a parking garage. Getting from the parking garage to the restaurant is weird and unmarked. You might want to push for the concealed carry in Chicago if you frequent this parking lot.They don't have bathrooms in the actual restaurant so you have to go to the hotel lobby and that totally sucks. All in all, I am happy to have a Bar Louie near home and I will be back...

56.description: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn attached to this restaurant a couple of weeks ago on vacation. We ate at Bar Louie our first night there and had a wonderful experience.Service:Our waiter was absolutely fantastic. He was extremely kind and seemed pretty down to earth. He also knew a lot about the menu and about bar items. Food:The food was pretty good for the most part. Neither of us could complain about either of our meals.

29.description: Since I stayed at the Holiday Inn without a car I had many meals here. First off the place is pretty spacious so no worries about getting a table when you walk in. The place is dark with a bunch of booths, tables, and bar seating. All the staff are young 20s-30s. Decent service. BREAKFAST:First off, they offer regular breakfast items or buffet in the morning. They open at 6am despite what a lot of the advertisement and whatnot says. I've only had the buffet because I was always in a rush. Although it didn't look like it took too long for the food to arrive. Buffet consists of: scrambled eggs, potatoes with green peppers & onions, bacon/sausage, either french toast or pancakes, cut up fruit, toast/bagels, cereal, and orange juice. They'll ask you right away if you want coffee. I thought breakfast was pretty decent. Great way to start off the day! DINNER:BLT Wedgeiceberg lettuce, bacon, tomato, onion, egg, blue cheese crumbles, blue cheese dressing, house vinaigrette - at first I thought there wasn't enough dressing and told my waiter to bring me more but there was enough. It is a mixture of two different dressings. If you are picky about your dressings please inquire. Overall, not bad. One weekdays, they have half-off select appetizers from 4-7pm!Bruschetta Pomodorotomato, basil, garlic, olive oil, parmesan crostinis available with shrimp - Comes with like 12 pieces of hard-slightly burnt bread. The actual bruschette was really good. I liked it! If only the bread was tastier. Cheese Quesadillapepper jack, cheddar, sour cream, pico de gallo, guacamole - This is decently good. The guacamole was a bit dark in color... the pico de gallo is a tad spicy fyiThere's big screens surrounding the entire restaurant if you are dire need of watching some game.

42.description: This Bar Louie location is walking distance from my office so it's a frequent choice for lunch or a drink after work.The ambiance is somewhat different than other BL locations I've been to - it is inside the Holiday Inn hotel but manages to maintain its own identity and doesn't feel like your typical hotel restaurant/bar.The menu is the same and the food is comfortably consistent - Chop Chop Salac and Grilled Veggie Wraps are my favs and I don't think I've ever had anything else here but those two items.The service can be spotty, mostly because they don't have enough staff during an unpredictably busy lunch rush.I love the patio dining option - which really is a blessing on a warm summer day when it seems they have the air conditioning set on 50 degrees!

23.description: The food here is awesome, and the service is the bomb.

47.description: My two star rating is afforded only because the food it self was OK. The service...forget about it. It was some of the worst staff in every category.We had a group of old friends gathering after a wake and decided on Bar Louie O'Hare because it was near the funeral home. We all asked our server Christina for seperate checks as it was just easier in the long run.To begin with, our server takes drink orders from a friend, my wife, and myself. She then moves on to another table and begins to take their drink order. Ok, fair enough. However, she then spends the next 10 minutes taking their food orders. No drinks yet for us even when my friend had brought it to her attention. No response. After 15 minutes since taking our order, another male server heads towards us with a tray of drinks but surprise! They are drinks for the table that ordered after us. No drinks. No water. No service for us.After a good 20 minute wait for our drinks, Christina takes our food order. She counldn't tell me waht goes on their cheesburgers. Her response was, "The regular things you get, you know." I then decide to give a specific order of "just lettuce,pickle, tomato and put it all on the side." I figured if things went wrong at least it wouldn't be ON my burger. And she says, "Oh, so you want everything?" NO! I want it with what I asked you for.When our food finally arrives, some orders are wrong, Fries instead of mac and cheese, No quessadias, etc. My burger came with onion and other items on the burger. When I informed the male server that it had come with items I didn't want on it, he says out loud while walking away laughing, "Yeah, we did that to make you mad." No apoligy. No can I fix that for you. No service.Although the food was OK for the most part, the service was horrible. From waiting for our drinks, taking food orders and being served additional drinks, it was the worst I have experienced in a long time. When it came time for our bills, everyone looked up at each other in dibelief as our server asked each and every one of us what we had ordered and scribbled it down again. The bills arrived and she was still confused.Paying the bills also seemed like an ordeal for her. In one instance, our friends $29 billed was swiped and charged up as $69. All of our bills (even though added separately) also were charged an automatic 18% gratuity which was way more then any of them deserved. It is our observation that either Christina is the worst waitress ever or simply very inexperienced with no training or guidance which in that case, is managements fault. The attitude of the staff is poor and indifferent which makes the experience at Bar Louie O'Hare less than enjoyable or memorable. It is not on my list of repeats. The sad thing is the staff doesn't even realize how poor their service is.

8.description: My best friend works in the hospitality industry close to O'hare so this was the go to spot after work to get a bite to eat and some drinks. We've always had great service! The bartenders are so down to earth and know us every time we come in. The spinach artichoke dip is incredibly delicious by the way :P

31.description: For a Holiday Inn, I was extremely happy to find one of these restaurants!  Food is fine but the music is wayyyyy to loud, hence 3 stars.  Other than that, clean facility with solid food.  great drink menu to relax from traveling too.

34.description: Convenient to the Blue line it's my go to place with friends.Good food, attentive wait staff, clean, full bar and decent pricing.I've never had a negative experience there.Plenty of space for larger groups and several TV's.I'm there once every couple of months.

16.description: We came here for drinks after a particularly bad day at work. Service was quick and drinks were really great. After our first drink, our server let us know that there was a shift change and introduced us to our new server. I'm so glad he let us know so that we were able to close out with him and reopen a tab with our new server. Both were great and really let us have a pleasant experience without crowding us.

13.description: If you're staying at the Holiday Inn and don't want to go outside, you'll probably end up here, otherwise...skip it. The other 60+ reviewers have it right.Unfriendly and/or pushy bartenders, bland food, overpriced beer. The hostess was cute, that's why Bar Louie is gifted 2 stars instead of a single.

11.description: Since I stayed at the Holiday Inn without a car I had many meals here. First off the place is pretty spacious so no worries about getting a table when you walk in. The place is dark with a bunch of booths, tables, and bar seating. All the staff are young 20s-30s. Decent service. BREAKFAST:First off, they offer regular breakfast items or buffet in the morning. They open at 6am despite what a lot of the advertisement and whatnot says. I've only had the buffet because I was always in a rush. Although it didn't look like it took too long for the food to arrive. Buffet consists of: scrambled eggs, potatoes with green peppers & onions, bacon/sausage, either french toast or pancakes, cut up fruit, toast/bagels, cereal, and orange juice. They'll ask you right away if you want coffee. I thought breakfast was pretty decent. Great way to start off the day! DINNER:BLT Wedgeiceberg lettuce, bacon, tomato, onion, egg, blue cheese crumbles, blue cheese dressing, house vinaigrette - at first I thought there wasn't enough dressing and told my waiter to bring me more but there was enough. It is a mixture of two different dressings. If you are picky about your dressings please inquire. Overall, not bad. One weekdays, they have half-off select appetizers from 4-7pm!Bruschetta Pomodorotomato, basil, garlic, olive oil, parmesan crostinis available with shrimp - Comes with like 12 pieces of hard-slightly burnt bread. The actual bruschette was really good. I liked it! If only the bread was tastier. Cheese Quesadillapepper jack, cheddar, sour cream, pico de gallo, guacamole - This is decently good. The guacamole was a bit dark in color... the pico de gallo is a tad spicy fyiThere's big screens surrounding the entire restaurant if you are dire need of watching some game.

39.description: I always have a good time here when I'm with friends. they have a good drink and food menu. also am amazing beer selection. also the staff is friendly amd fun to be around incase the people I'm woth temd to get boring.

37.description: Mediocre food, typical bar ambiance. Has nice flat screen TVs, the chicken wings weren't that great. Trying the buffalo flatbread tonight. Hope I don't get sick. Guess it's ok if you had to come because you're stuck at hotel without a car, otherwise I'm pretty sure this great city offers nicer eateries.

0.description: This is a great local bar.  Folks from my office come here for lunch. Pretty good food and great service. I've only been here for lunch once.  I usually come out for drinks, appetizers and dinner.  One of the better beer menus in the area.  They regularly rotate what they serve. This time out we tried the several seasonal they had.  Our favorite was the Brothers. They have a happy hour special with cheaper drinks and appetizers.  The spicy boneless wings are great.  The flatbreads are all very good.  My favorite is the calamari.  This is a great place and the service is always exceptional. When the weather is nice, they have outdoor seating.

38.description: Awesome food, great service and lots of tvsStayed at Holiday inn on business and got take out.  Awesome sliders and then ate in for lunch next day. Great prices and great portions.  Great environment and lots of pretty servers.

51.description: They play obnoxious top 40 music at this place... however, there are 5,000 televisions so that's pretty awesome. Do not order the Brie, Orange, and Blackberry salad. Tempting... I know... but don't do it; trust me. The shrimp quesadilla tasted like every other shrimp quesadilla with frozen shrimp I've ever had in my life... delicious.3 stars because this place is exactly what you'd expect of it... a great place to go for happy hour to drink with some friends when you can't think of anything better to do...

27.description: Good food, good beer!  The music was a little bit too loud for conversation.

32.description: I had 2 cocktails at Bar Louie last night after checking in to the attached Holiday Inn. The "Rat Pack" martini was delicious and I followed it up with a Bloody Louie (Bloody Mary made with Absolut Peppar and Guinness Stout). They were exactly what I needed after driving more than 3 hours in from Springfield! I did think the music was TOO LOUD for a Monday night and finally took my second drink back to my room to relax. I probably would have had a third if the music was at a lower level. I hate to sound like a grandma but as a business traveler it was genuinely annoying. I would still return next time I am in town!

54.description: Decided to take my husband here since he never been to bar Louie. We had calamari which was re heated, drinks was okay, and burgers was good. I wouldn't come back again place needs to be more organized. Our waiter was great but the hostess had no clue on what she was doing.

48.description: I've been to the O'hare location a few times. I have always found the service to be good. The appetizers have always tasted good as well. If all you want is a simple place to have some drinks and appetizers while watching a game or UFC event then this place does the job. I give Bar Louie O'hare, 7.5 Louie's out of 10.

44.description: Again go in and the place in only 25% full you would think you would get good service.    The answer is no placed orders and 2 came back wrong from what we asked for.   How about refills at lest no bc the server only came by only by once every 25 mins.   Only reason 1 star is bc the food.  Will not go back for a while to give them there one last chance.

24.description: Do not order the shrimp and avocado plate. Amongst all the old lettuce I find a dead fly on my plate mixed in with the dressing. Our server Jessica acted like she was doing me a favor by removing the item from our bill. Very poor quality of service, where do they find these people I swear.

7.description: Decided to have a drink before bed and a bit of food. Ordered the calamari and meatballs. Both were pretty meh. The calamari was small enough that one person would burn through it in a few bites, and the meatballs were very spicy. The drinks on the other hand, were very strong which is a good thing. No one likes watered down beverages and in that regard, they don't disappoint. Service was a bit slow, which was weird since it seemed like there were a lot of servers and not that many customers.

49.description: This is a nice place. Good food and good drink. The only reason I give it 4 stars now is because they bumped up the prices. No more $5 buckets which sucks, but $2 beers isn't terrible either.

40.description: Went today.Had crispy calamari,(NOT) very undercooked and not good,Chopped salad ok.Trio of chips ok! Pot pie soup very good. We were in a hurry or would of sent back the calamari.But our biggest complaint is being in this business is the server did not bring any change back just bills,that is not cool.OOPS SORRY do that a dozen times a day and  guess what your tips sure do add up.I hope this is not a regular policy.No mgr to ask. Maybe will try the bar next time and see my change.

53.description: The first bartender (female) was great. Too bad I didn't catch her name, then our tab was taken over by Kristin. What a shame. She called a customer a bitch and was screaming across the bar for everyone to hear, then, with only 4 people in the bar it took nearly 18 minutes to make 2 drinks... That's ridiculous! The other customers were not being served at the time, it was the fact that she was socializing with the other staff that took her so long. To end the night,  it took nearly 10 minutes to get our bill when asked for, AGAIN, nobody being served, she just could not stop talking to her co-workers and flirting with them. After the Credit Card was laid down, yet again, she could not stop running her mouth. Kristin alone made my decision to never return here.

30.description: Went for lunch today.  The bar was full do to the world cup,  but that was no excuse for the poor service. We ordered our food before the lunch crowd came in. .30 min later we were trying to hunt down the waitress to find out what happened to our food. . She brought us our appetizer, chicken nachos.   The Guacamole was brown and the chips were soggy.. the cheese had a film on top. . The waitress just walked a way. . We were waiting fir get to come back. . But after 20 min. . She did not return.  We had to go find her to tell her about our horrible nachos.  Needless to say we didn't have to pay.  They were just not prepared for the crowd. .. but outside the bar they were advertising. ."headquarters for the world cup" my coworker had even called ahead 2 weeks prior, letting them knowhe wad bringing a big crowd.  :(

46.description: Great food and a lot of beers on tap!

1.description: "Eh" could really summarize my thoughts on this Bar Louie.We were staying at the Holiday Inn and after getting back late-ish at night really wanted something to eat. I had a huge craving for fries so I didn't really care what else was next to them. I ordered the BLTT- bacon, lettuce, tomato, and turkey. The sandwich was great and very large, too. I wish that had been what I was craving to have. The fries were...Not good. Undercooked, soggy, and very bland.Our waiter was friendly and quick. The person who greeted us at the door almost made it seem as though we were inconveniencing her at her own job..It's good as far as a hotel restaurant goes. Outside of that, though... Eh.

55.description: Not a bad spot, but the service can be better. Takes a while to order a drink.

9.description: Came in for drinks with friends and family and the drinks where horrible , the Bacardi and Coke was water down Manhattan was just plain bad , and the service was awful this specific location I do not recommend

26.description: For a place attached to a hotel it is very nice.. They have a huge beer selection and a happy hour they run from 4-7 every day. They also have 5$ burgers. Every day they run a different drink special. I got the chicken quesadilla and crispy calamari with a beer for $20... Not bad.

25.description: I really like this spot.I'm staying at the Holiday Inn and this restaurant is attached to the hotel. It kind of put you in the mindset of a Chilli's or Bennigan's. I went twice. The first time I ordered the BLTT (bacon lettuce tomato turkey). OMG. That was so good. The next night I had a burger. I didn't think it was all that great. But maybe it was just that particular burger that wasn't that good. The service here was great , and both times the waitresses were so friendly. I notice that they are really crowded for happy hour. M-F for happy hour they have half off appetizers. And each day there are different drink specials. It's really a cool spot to hang alone or with friends.

12.description: For a place attached to a hotel it is very nice.. They have a huge beer selection and a happy hour they run from 4-7 every day. They also have 5$ burgers. Every day they run a different drink special. I got the chicken quesadilla and crispy calamari with a beer for $20... Not bad.

59.description: I wanted to like this place. Came here about a month ago. Food was good, huge beer selection. BUT! So slow, and NOT because it's busy. The night we were there only about 4 tables had patrons. Still, waitress would bring a beer then disappear for an hour. Decided to give it a second chance. Went in on Super Bowl Sunday. About 5 tables had patrons, maybe 4 people at the bar. Walked in and --- sat there for 20 minutes. No one even made eye contact, and certainly no one bothered to say,  "Be right with you."We left and went to Mullen's down the road.We won't be back.

21.description: If you're staying at the Holiday Inn and don't want to go outside, you'll probably end up here, otherwise...skip it. The other 60+ reviewers have it right.Unfriendly and/or pushy bartenders, bland food, overpriced beer. The hostess was cute, that's why Bar Louie is gifted 2 stars instead of a single.

17.description: Great selection of tap beers. Waitress Kristina was great. Food was tasty and significantly portioned. :)

10.description: It's been a while since I've been here and their drink menu is phenomenal and many of them taste great. Love the atmosphere.I will definitely need to come back again to eat because this visit reminded me why I used to be such a regular

5.description: It's a bar/restaurant in hotel, but it is one of the better ones I've been too. On its own Louie's not bad, maybe a notch above Applebees. Its typical American fare, burgers, sandwiches, flatbread, salads and some decent happy hour specials. ordered veggie flat bread with portabella mushrooms, red peppers, red onion, spinach, feta, and garlic lots of garlic, lil on the salty side but okif you get in late or get stuck due to weather, it's not bad with some decent options.They had a breakfast buffet, eggs, oatmeal, sausages, bacon, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, cereal, potatoes, juices for 12.95, coffee was extra. everything was ok but again a lil on the salty side

3.description: Came with a large group for team dinner.The beer list was pretty extensive and had some nice choices.Appetizers were your standard premade/frozen fare and the mains were similar.Staff was rather underwhelming and tactiturn.

35.description: I've eaten here 3 times this week. Had the veggie wrap, sesame tuna and portobello burger. All 3 were really good. Nice wait staff as well.  Would recommend it, especially if you are staying in the area. The house dressing is really good.

19.description: Got the burger because it was on special and it was disgusting! McDonald's would have been better. The drinks were nothing special and extremely overpriced. Would not recommend.

28.description: The good: food is great, especially for the price at a hotel restaurant. We had the Adobo Shrimp Skewers (spicy, makes a great app or a little shrimp salad) and the Verde Chicken Taco plate. Both were delish and worth the price, food came quickly. Wide variety of beers and lots of local beers like Two Brothers to choose from. Good upper scale sports bar atmosphere. Bad: service is slow and inattentive. We first sat outside (no hostess so we sat ourselves). A waitress walked by us twice without greeting us, so after 5 min we went in to the bar. Still had to flag the bartenders down for our first beer, to order food, and for refills. They seemed overwhelmed or just inefficient even though the bar and restaurant were only about half full early on a thurs night. Also, beers are expensive... forgot I was at a hotel bar! $6-$7.50 for a 14oz craft beer. I would still recommend this place out of all of the options within walking distance. Just be prepared to have to work for your food & drinks!

45.description: This is not the Bar Louie I have find memories of. Ear splitting music where you have to point at the menu, slooooow waitress (15 minutes to get beer after 10 minutes for any staff to even acknowledge presence), food not what I remember.   Avoid from now on.

33.description: Ate here before I dropped my son at the CTA stop across from the restaurant. Food was good but the service was extremely  slow. Parking was also difficult  unless you were staying at the hotel.  Ladies bathroom not the cleanest either.

43.description: Our server Jason was awesome. He knew the food very well But the only bad thing was the portions are small. The bartender on the other hand was plain RUDE. We had for a plain and simple margretta which as a bartender and server myself you ask what kind and what kind of tequila but that question wasn't asked. The first one tasted terrible. We told Jason that we didn't want a lot of sour mix because that's what makes the drink super sour and takes the tequila away and for some reason the drink had limes in it (margaritas don't have limes in it.) We of course told him we didn't like it so he took it back to the bartender. We saw her upset from a distance. So what she does instead of making a new one is actually come to the table with everything she makes and tried to do the drink in from of us with an attitude. We looked at her and thought what the HELL was she doing?! We told them again NO LIME and she started again with the lime when we said it three times already. We told her no limes walked away with her bottles and didn't say anything. Super RUDE! It was probably the most stupidest thing of her to come to the table and do that. It just made a fool out of herself. Extremely upset still to this day coming after work trying to relax we get an attitude .   Other than that Jason was awesome and the food was decent. I just wouldn't go there at all for the drinks.

2.description: Draft beer selection was great! Had classics like Stella and Sam Adams but also had interesting and seasonal beers as well, which I loved! Service was fairly friendly. Food menu was very intersting- had cool things on it, as well as classic sandwiches and burgers. Food was awesome, flatbread was great and wedge salad was good portion size and tasty. Beer was a little pricey- Blue Moon was $7. And the music was fairly loud, felt like I had to speak over it when talking to my guest who was right next to me. All in all I enjoyed my evening here- would definitely return.

18.description: I came here on a Tuesday evening expecting dollar burger night. Apparently, every other location runs this promotion, but not this one. We were told because it is close to O'Hare, it doesn't have problems getting people in the door. So no dollar burgers Strike one.We looked at the drinks menu, and none of the draft beers have a price. I ordered a Bells Oberon and I can't remember what my husband had. $8 a piece! For draft beer! And we weren't downtown! Strike two.I will say service was quick and the food was fast as well. They did offer half price select appetizers from 4-7. We took advantage of that and split boneless wings and a chicken quesadilla for dinner.The food wasn't great, the beer was too expensive, and there are other places I'd rather go. I likely won't be back.

41.description: For an airport hotel bar this place is way above average.  I watched a Blackhawks game at the bar, ordered the shrimp tempura that exceeded my expectations, washed them down with a Lagunitas Little Sumpin', and was served by a friendly bartender.  Nuthin' not to like....

52.description: Great service and great chicken nachos. We visited on a hockey game night and the place was packed and rowdy...which never makes a boring experience.

50.description: The server, Demi, was so attentive.  I was expecting the same service as evident from all other Bar Louie locations. Very bad service. Not Demi ... She kept coming around asking me if I was okay.  Woah, you care?  Yes, Demi cares!

4.description: First of all getting there was a joke off of 90 w, u make a u-turn and end up on the ramp. Finally got there to meet some old friends visiting Chicago. Food was ok service was terrible!  Our server Tiffany rolled her eyes @ us when we complained about the slow service. Not going back.

6.description: I really like this spot.I'm staying at the Holiday Inn and this restaurant is attached to the hotel. It kind of put you in the mindset of a Chilli's or Bennigan's. I went twice. The first time I ordered the BLTT (bacon lettuce tomato turkey). OMG. That was so good. The next night I had a burger. I didn't think it was all that great. But maybe it was just that particular burger that wasn't that good. The service here was great , and both times the waitresses were so friendly. I notice that they are really crowded for happy hour. M-F for happy hour they have half off appetizers. And each day there are different drink specials. It's really a cool spot to hang alone or with friends.

22.description: Been here twice, great service. Excellent lunch specials. First time I came I had a yummy burger with sweet potato fries. Cooked to perfection- medium rare just like I like it. Second time we had a chicken nacho plate that was more than enough for the 3 of us! Love the decor- no complaints here- will def be back soon.

15.description: Been here twice, great service. Excellent lunch specials. First time I came I had a yummy burger with sweet potato fries. Cooked to perfection- medium rare just like I like it. Second time we had a chicken nacho plate that was more than enough for the 3 of us! Love the decor- no complaints here- will def be back soon.

57.description: Getting into and out of this restaurant could be a challenge if you don't realize that you have to enter at Bryn Mawr (no entrance on Cumberland).  But once you get in, it looks similar to other Bar Louie locations. The fish tacos with a side of black beans and rice were enjoyable. I know others have mentioned poor service, but this time, lunchtime service was attentive, but the restaurant wasn't crowded which might explain it.

20.description: Don't even bother.  Unless you're a friend of the bartenders or desperately starving there's no reason to stop here, okay desperately starving probably isn't a reason. Bartenders friend found hair in the same app we were eating and announced it loudly. Bartender couldn't be bothered to listen to our order and then was surprised when the item we turned away, because it wasn't what we ordered, wasn't delivered.  Never apologized just pretended to check on it.  It's always fun listening to the bartenders and other servers talk about how drunk they were last night.  Bad bad bad.

36.description: I came here on a Tuesday evening expecting dollar burger night. Apparently, every other location runs this promotion, but not this one. We were told because it is close to O'Hare, it doesn't have problems getting people in the door. So no dollar burgers Strike one.We looked at the drinks menu, and none of the draft beers have a price. I ordered a Bells Oberon and I can't remember what my husband had. $8 a piece! For draft beer! And we weren't downtown! Strike two.I will say service was quick and the food was fast as well. They did offer half price select appetizers from 4-7. We took advantage of that and split boneless wings and a chicken quesadilla for dinner.The food wasn't great, the beer was too expensive, and there are other places I'd rather go. I likely won't be back.

14.description: They have good deals and nice looking bar.Flat bread is my favoritte.. Easy parking back side of the bar..

28.description: I live a couple of blocks away and decided to watch the Hawks game and grab dinner with my son last night. It happened to be 1/2 price apps...Score!!! I had the chicken quesadillas which were the best I've ever had. They actually use real cheese and not that imitation hard stuff that you usually get. It was ooey and gooey and tasted amazing. My son had the chicken wings and said they were just as good as BWW. The waitress which I dont know her name but had cute nails was always around to refill our drinks and bring take home boxes without even asking. Glad to have an affordable, fun, and great tasting food place in the area. P.S. They have actually have specials every night unlike other places in the area which is a plus.

1.description: Just ordered some take out from here .... food was hot and fresh , very good and nice portions .... good neighborhood joint ! I will definitely be going back !!!

9.description: This place is nothing special. But in the "nothing special" catagory of neighborhood joints, Revel racks in solid points on their burgers, sports bar seating/TV views, and bar specials. It's a good spot to meet for happy hour or for a Sunday afternoon football game (there isn't a bad seat in the house). Great for large groups if you are going out drinking with a crowd. Special points for the giant jenga.

23.description: This is the best bar in the neighborhood that you can go to. staff is amazing and very friendly and polite quick service. lots of TVs. the food specials are amazing along with the drink specials prices are very reasonable. best bar food ever!!!  DJ is awesome he is there Thursday Friday and Saturday nights. Revel bar is an original nothing like it before very nice place.

5.description: I've only been here once and I went during lunch time. The decor looks great and they had tacos for $1. The tacos were good and so was the service. I had 3 steak tacos and 3 chicken and they were seasoned perfectly.I will definitely go back because I would like to try other things on the menu. I dig the laid back environment.

25.description: Great new addition to the neighborhood. Food was way better then expected. The place just opened and i spoke with the owner about all the improvements still in the works. I look forward to coming back soon.

12.description: I am sitting here now and since the minute I walked in the door, I kid you not, I felt at "home." The bartender greeted me with a smile and immediately asked about food and drinks. I was in a super crappy mood when I walked in because I spent the day at the DMV (yuck, everything that can go wrong will), but the bartender, Jen, turned that frown upside down and gave impeccable service and even cracked some jokes and the minute I needed a refill she did not hesitate to ask. Also, I ended up getting the voodoo sticks, AMAZING! This will be my new favorite home away from home as it meant a lot to be treated so kindly by a random stranger in my new Chicago neighborhood! Thanks Revel for employing Jen!

21.description: Amazing food, music, and service. Gotta give it to valentin and his wife naomi, They know how to run a tight ship! The bar is spacious and has plenty of TVs, so if u want to dance to their awesome DJ Coniac's music on thursday-saturday, watch a hosted PPV game or local sports, or even enjoy food with all of their attractive young staff, all u have to do is come.

16.description: Looks much nicer on the outside... Don't let it fool you. All it really is is a dirty empty room with a bar smacked in the middle and a few wobbly tables scattered around. Service isn't the best, drink selection isn't the best. Was only here for drinks so I'm not sure about the food. The crowd that shows up is a bunch of lowbred kids. Pretty much an undecorated dive bar as far as ambience goes...

17.description: Just cool, nice and open windows, letting fresh air in. Not pretentious like the bar across the street. Friendly staff, bartender was cool. Will be back.

10.description: Cool place!!! And AMAZING food!

11.description: I was super excited to check out a bar close to my house.   The bouncer and bartenders were super nice, however, the experience was not.   Having my friends called horrible names because of race was ridiculous.   Instead of kicking him out they let him stay.   I am still mortified that I brought my friends there and definately will not be going back.

26.description: Great neighborhood place, love that it's so close to my house! Good food (my personal favorites are the Buffalo Chicken Wrap and the Mac & Cheese bites!), good drinks, awesome service & a great atmosphere! Love Val & Naomi!

27.description: Looks much nicer on the outside... Don't let it fool you. All it really is is a dirty empty room with a bar smacked in the middle and a few wobbly tables scattered around. Service isn't the best, drink selection isn't the best. Was only here for drinks so I'm not sure about the food. The crowd that shows up is a bunch of lowbred kids. Pretty much an undecorated dive bar as far as ambience goes...

0.description: Great bartenders and food. The garlic fries are very deliciously garlic and salads are big. Nice local bar with lots of tvs and good music.

20.description: I have been here a couple of times now with my wife a son. I think the food is fantastic, the service is great and the daily specials are awesome! Its a great addition to the neighborhood. Its a little dark on the inside, but its clean and has tons of TV's for sports games, etc. I will be back for sure!

19.description: Great look, Lots of large TV's, cute girls working the bar and great food. Try the del-marto....WOW. Really good.

2.description: Great food!  Huge servings, and very tasty!!  I love all the bartenders!! We have been there for a quick lunch, a late dinner, and in a large group. The Reuben and the steak sandwich are my favs!!

18.description: Revel is one of my neighborhood bars. I've been there twice before and the food was good. We went today and it was a completely different story. We ordered the voodoo sticks to start. The sticks were delicious but the rice that accompanied it was bland. My girlfriend ordered a chopped salad. The salad was good but not chopped. The chicken, lettuce, and avocado were in big slices.  I ordered a Po' boy. I asked that the shrimp be replaced with chicken tenders. The chicken was over cooked. It was breading was very dark and dry. They also gave me ranch dressing instead of the Po' boy sauce. When I asked the waitress about the sandwich she got visibly annoyed and told us that's how the chicken is supposed to be.  I'd probably go again bit stay away from the tenders.

13.description: I live a couple of blocks away and decided to watch the Hawks game and grab dinner with my son last night. It happened to be 1/2 price apps...Score!!! I had the chicken quesadillas which were the best I've ever had. They actually use real cheese and not that imitation hard stuff that you usually get. It was ooey and gooey and tasted amazing. My son had the chicken wings and said they were just as good as BWW. The waitress which I dont know her name but had cute nails was always around to refill our drinks and bring take home boxes without even asking. Glad to have an affordable, fun, and great tasting food place in the area. P.S. They have actually have specials every night unlike other places in the area which is a plus.

4.description: Service was bad and waited along time for meal.Did not have a clue what an open face Rubin was.Very dark and loud!

24.description: Great look, Lots of large TV's, cute girls working the bar and great food. Try the del-marto....WOW. Really good.

6.description: Friday night specials are awesome!! Great food, amazing service.

22.description: A very welcome addition to Norwood Park. Only being open a few weeks this place has the potential to last. Great fresh food. A few bar staples paired with new food ideas makes for an interesting menu.Combine that with daily food and drink specials, they have a winner. But wait. There's more.  The staff. Friendly and polite. Katie and Sammie are probably the best servers I have ever had.

15.description: Had a more pleasant experience but honestly, theyre music is too loud when there isnt too many people, to the point you can here slight static. Other than that service has been good lately and they have really good food deals! Their food is also delicious. Their game definitely stepped up

7.description: Thursday, mid-day, first time at revel . . . and we were pleasantly surprised. A couple guys at the bar and two of us eating. Southern Yank pulled pork on pretzel roll - delicious. The darker stout BBQ sauce had a nice smokey flavor and a full-mouth zinginess that hits the back of your throat. Upgraded to nicely browned, whole onion rings, washed down with an unsweetened iced tea which had a real nice brewed flavor. My companion had the Jefferson Park Burger stuffed with cream cheese and topped with bacon. Awesome flavor, perfectly cooked, and bacon was great. Upgraded to mac and cheese side which was fine, nothing outstanding, but not bad. Real cheese texture. Brown that sucker and maybe add a sprinkle of something and it becomes a winner. Soda from the tap was kinda flat, switched to lemonade which was better. The server was pleasant and attentive. Large TVs surround the place for your favorite sporting events. The bathrooms were clean and toasty warm on a blustery and gray Autumn afternoon. Will definitely be back to try the other amazing-sounding offerings, not to mention the full bar!

8.description: A very welcome addition to Norwood Park. Only being open a few weeks this place has the potential to last. Great fresh food. A few bar staples paired with new food ideas makes for an interesting menu.Combine that with daily food and drink specials, they have a winner. But wait. There's more.  The staff. Friendly and polite. Katie and Sammie are probably the best servers I have ever had.

3.description: Revel checks off all the requirements of a sports bar. The food was fine. Service was brisk. Plenty of room and tvs for groups of friends to hang out and watch a game. All in all, a good neighborhood sports bar. I'd give them 3.5 stars but bumping it up to 4 for being in the neighborhood.

14.description: Great local bar. Came for a work holiday party. I would come back just for the food. Excellent burger!!! The revel burger was done to perfection. The servers were very adept even though they were obviously swamped. One thing I didn't like was the giant guard rail around the bar. I've never seen one so thick in diameter. I kept tripping over it every time I stood up from my seat. Other than that i can't complain. Great divey feel with fantastic food and specials. A must try

12.description: I love this places! The pizza is so good & the prices are reasonable. I've been a loyal customer for years!

3.description: This is my go to pizza delivery place.  Friends come over and crave this pizza.  They have a good special deal and give you a free cheese pizza and a pop. Delivery is always on time.  Definitely recommend for delivery or take out.

1.description: We just got back from Cancun on Saturday. Mind you, the non stop flight to O'Hare is less than four hours and we share the same time zone. Skip Sunday and I'll tell you about my Monday.I have no explanation for why my boyfriend woke up cranky and late in the afternoon craving a Stuffed Pizza on Memorial Day. I don't know why he couldn't get up and do it himself or thinks badgering me to hurry up and call no restaurant in particular for him would motivate me to work faster in nursing his jetlag and starvation. Yes, I'm being sarcastic! The more impatient he became, the more belligerent and ridculous he went about his tyrade. It's a holiday weekend and most people are out enjoying a barbecue-except us. A more pertinent reason for my delay in assisting him is his forgetfulness that I don't care for Stuffed, Pan, Hand Tossed and Deep Dish Pizza.As much as I advocate supporting local businesses, I'm still learning about Harwood Heights and its surrounding areas. I couldn't do it efficiently without the help of the Yelp mobile app. Yelp members who take the time to write unbiased  reviews get FUC'd for making it easy. I never would've found this place without them! Thank you, everyone!For $26.20 + $5 tip, I ordered a Large Stuffed Cheese Pizza with fresh garlic, sliced tomatoes, spinach, pepperoni and sausage. It came to our front door in less than an hour. None of the restaurants I've been to, ordered from and written about their pizza can beat that price!I'm never prepared for the weight of a Large Stuffed Pizza. "Oompf" is the noise I make; sometimes, I'll do a dip or take a step backwards when the delivery person hands over the box.One slice, one serving, is always enough for me. Any more than that and I encounter undesirable side effects: bloating, fatigue, gas, weight gain... all the reasons why I avoid eating slices thicker than thin. Needless to say, that generous triangular slice I put on my plate was "mmm mmm" out loud fabulous. I even cut a second slice of Trio's pizza in half because for once in my life, I wanted more! I could taste the difference in freshness of their ingredients.There were a few slices left in the box for us to warm up and savor later. For him, it was within a couple hours. For me, my boyfriend saved me the half I cut so I could nuke it for breakfast.

2.description: Best pizza for sure. Trios is near by my house and have been ordering from Trios for a while now. I love the different choices of topping they have. My favorite is beef and hot peppers. I highly recommend it.

9.description: This place has good pizza at good prices. I have had their deep dish and thin crust and they are both good tasting and the price is even better. Make sure you check out their coupons on their website.

10.description: Growing up in Norwood Park, this was my family's go-to spot for deep dish pizza. Not thin crust. They are better than all of the famous places known in Chicago for deep dish. I can't stress how much I LOVE their deep dish pizza. Also, who doesn't love a free 1-liter of RC?! It washes down the pizza SO WELL! Every time I go to visit my mother, I make it a point to get one of their pizzas. So good.

13.description: WOW!! Surprised again by the northwest side. Trios pizza was a pleasant surprise its right up there with Paternos except they deliver which is a huge plus. I may have to try a few other  items off menu the  based on the quality of the pizza. Lived in Vegas, AZ., and Texas in last few years and let me tell you places let this make it good to come home to the SHY BABY!! pizza pizzza and I'm not talking about little Caesars either. Rogers Park be careful Northwest side is on the move.

16.description: I have extremely fond feelings for Trio's pizza. Growing up, my parents rarely let us order food for delivery-- but whenever they'd feel especially loving, they'd order us a pizza from Trio's. And it's true, this thin crust isn't standard thin crust, but that's what makes it special. The crust is bready and a bit thicker, the sauce is a nice balance of sweet and tangy, and there's a prominent layer of cheese with such great flavor. I'm not sure if it's nostalgia or bias or what, but I love Trio's pizza. If they closed down, I can honestly say I'd cry.

6.description: Even though I live in Chicago, I rarely order deep dish pizza.  Trio's has a really good deep dish.  I'm glad the menu is very limited, because it allows them to focus on pizza.  The ItalianBeef is excellent as well.

15.description: I have driven by this locations a few times and always wanted to try the pizza. There is no dining area it is strictly a carry-out or delivery place. In fact there is barely room for 5 people in the waiting area.The Pizza...I thought the pizza was good. A couple of problems. The crust is a little thicker than most thin crust pizzas in Chicago. Also, it was a little skimpy on the sausage topping, though there was more than enough cheese.I did like the sauce base. It had a nice sweet, yet not too sweet flavor.I would have given it a better rating if they didn't skimp on the sausage.I may go back and try them again for something else.

0.description: Since moving into the area a few months ago, we've been looking to find "our" pizza place - and I'm happy to say we found it with Trio's! Delicious pizza with a great crust... we order the regular crust which is not too thin, not too thick. Goldilocks would approve. They also have little perks like collecting company coupons to get a free pizza. I'm not sure why, but that promotion always works on me. Makes me feel like I'm getting something special. After reading the other reviews, I'll have to try the deep dish next!

5.description: Way to much cheese. I'm not looking for volume.  I'm looking for quality. Sauce good. sausage good.  Cheese to thick.

11.description: Decided to try this spot out for the first time. I must say the thin crust was on point. Not overly saucy, great crispy crust and all around good flavor. I think I just found a new go to spot on the north side!!!

8.description: Love this place!! Yummy pizza. Super friendly service. And great value for the quality! One of my favorite thin crust pizzas.

4.description: I love trios. My love and I have tried their thin crust and their stuffed pizza. Personally, I preferred the stuffed pizza. It was so good and the price was excellent. :) I think this is my new pizza place. Only issue I had was that the spinach in my deep dish didn't taste too fresh... :( which is a shame because their pizza is so good. The service is usually on par, I had a small issue with one of the staff but they apologized and it's no biggie because they deliver to me despite the fact I'm not in their vicinity. This will always be my favorite pizza place, best stuffed pizza ever!

14.description: The whole family orders from here. Visitors to our home always comment how tasty Trio's pizzas are! Great delivery guys, too! Tip them well.

7.description: The only place I'll order pizza from. Amazing. I've been a customer for years and is never disappointing. !
