3.description: This is an okay little dive bar.  I like the cheap beer and jukebox; however, the people who go to this bar are AWFUL.  On any given night, you will be amongst 21 year olds playing beer pong, middle aged men who are so drunk that they are literally falling down and occasionally smacking their heads against the floor (good riddance), or really old, gross men who will make inappropriate comments to the ladies in your group.  I would only suggest this place if you are prepared for the crowd and are looking for somewhere cheap to go.  That being said, beware of the douchebags!

1.description: Nice simple bar.  No frills.  Small menu and we tried almost everything on it.  I would recommend a burger or the motz sticks although the pizza isn't too bad if you like thin crust.A pool table, some tables/chairs and a bar to snuggle up to.  Decent prices and has parking.  Friendly owners, nice staff.

2.description: Service was terrible, we waited over 20 min for a round, at that we all left the joint, the only time I'll go by Trinity is as I'm driving by.

9.description: Trinity is a shithole that houses enough rednecks and white trash to leave you wondering what nook or alley they crawled out of.  You'd think the bar was tucked away at some interstate oasis rather than Norwood Park.Domestic drafts are about $3, which is a good price if you're somewhere deeper into the city ... or even at an enjoyable bar.  But this is Trinity, so I view $3 for an Old Style as a smack in the mouth.The layout is quite miserable as well.  It's too bright.  They have low seats and tables that either leave you towering awkwardly over them or feeling like you're sitting in a mall food court.  The pool table is annoyingly in the middle of the room, but people do always utilize it. The bartenders were cool every time I was there, so that's something.  It's also dog friendly (but bringing your dog here might be considered animal abuse).  And at least they finally started accepting credit cards.  Welcome to 2010, Trinity.  I've never had fun at this bar.  I've even gone there with a beer buzz and an appetite for destruction yet Trinity was enough to sober me up and send me home unfulfilled.

10.description: Ick ick ick. The clientel alone makes me want to never go back. Pretty sketchy place late at night. You're probably better off down the block towards Edison Park.

4.description: Great neighborhood bar. Food is tasty and staff is friendly! Games are always on and drinks are flowing:)

6.description: Added a star!!Karaoke on Friday nights.Too. Much. Fun!They also have a new "Boxing"machine.Talk about getting your frustrations out at the end of the week!Although my knuckles are a little sore this morning.In the spirit of the Karaoke...I'll end with this..."I love this barIt's my kind of placeJust walkin' through the front doorPuts a big smile on my faceIt ain't too far, come as you areHmm, hmm, hmm I love this barrrrrrr"

12.description: Ok, this place just moves up on the list of a favorite dive bar!  I don't think I have had as much fun hanging out with friends and family as I have here.  Everything was great!  The drinks were ice cold, and the service was fast as can be!  And the wonderful owner was gracious enough to host our insanity for my beautiful girfriends special birthday!On top of it, the Karaoke was awesome!  The place is small enough where everything is heard perfectly, and everyone here wanted to join in on the singing!  What a perfect place to get away from the insane crowds of the downtown bars and just relax and have fun with your friends!

5.description: Karaoke will be back beginning March 2nd 10pm-2am

13.description: I can't exactly explain how I ended up here - nowhere near my home and typically not my type of drinking establishment, but it's all good! Joe was our bartender - totally nice, friendly guy.Bathroom was clean.Parking was ample.Beer was cold.Pool table.Dart board.Galaga.Did I even spot a desktop computer in the corner???What more do you want from a neighborhood pub?

11.description: This two star review is strictly aimed at Trinity Pub's credit card policy. My tables total was $70 + $18 tip. My bank card was charged the $88 total plus a $70 "hold." It's been five days since the first charge went through, and the hold is still on my account. They essentially double charged me. That has never happened to me before and is not related to my bank's policy. The rest of the review-The drink were cheap. The TVs were WAY too loud, like a THX movie experience - not so good for basketball. The sandwich good - fries bad.

8.description: You know you're in the far northwest side if you're riding along Northwest Highway. Up in this neck of the woods for my latest dart match, I expected the worst since I've never been up there and it all sounded roughneck to me. After stopping by Smokey's BBQ for some delicious brisket (based off the bartender's suggestion) we arrived to get ready for our dart match and started shooting one of their 3 excellent dartboards.Trinity bucks the trend of dive dart bars and is is a clean looking joint and looks great. Nothing in the bar looks too worn out and the drinks are really really cheap! There is supposedly a kitchen but on the Tuesday night I stopped by it was unfortunately closed! There is a jukebox, video game machine with lots of games, a pool table, lots of TVs all over the place - Trinity has a little something for everyone.

0.description: Very few people know this about me, but I grew up in a very religious family...as in my grandparents built a church and every Sunday we washed the communion glasses before the Pastor came over for dinner.  Yeah, that type of religious family. So in my former life, the trinity was the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. These days, the Trinity is friends, booze, and karaoke and I find that at the Trinity Pub! I've been here quite a few times with the M family and it's always fun! Besides the awesome karaoke, this pub has a rockin' jukebox and fantastic clientele. Also, the wristband special?!? Phenomenal. $20 for 4 hours of booze?!? Yes, please! It's way better than communion! Anytime the M's say "hey, let's go to Trinity" I'm there, because I know that this bar guarantees a great time.

7.description: This review is for the food only.I ordered the "Trinity Burger" which is like $8 and includes fries. The fries were the best part of the deal. Supposedly they use Black Angus meat which I find hard to believe. If they use Black Angus I am Rick James. The burger seemed like it was made out of plain ole slop Jewel ground beef. I asked for the burger to be cooked Medium Well-it arrived Medium Rare. The lettuce was wilted and discolored.The $9 two topping "Pronto Pizza" was not the worst, but eerily it was similar to Tombstone, but not as good! It was also the smallest pizza in a restaurant setting I have seen in my life.Save yourself the money and order from somewhere else.This place charges lakefront prices and claims a lakefront quality burger, but falls WAY shorter than any place I have eaten from deep in the city.

3.description: I was a little surprised to walk into a cafe aimed at seniors, but was glad for it. MMTAC is a non-profit cafe that not only has an incredibly inexpensive menu (think seniors menu, but very fresh food, aimed at breakfast and lunch crowd) and has extensive programs for seniors to participate in and stay alert and active. They also have free wifi. With the prices and the safe, friendly, clean atmosphere, this place is ideal for a college student to get homework done. No one bugs you, the food is good, you bus your own table, no tips. They are right off the Harlem blue line (at the end of the block with a good TBK), and have their own parking lot in the back. The place is friendly, and a good place to work away from home in the morning. Parking lot plowed on snow days.

1.description: Just happened to be in the area and thought we'd stop in. Definitely not what  the kids and I expected! Food was good and reminded me of a decent home cooked meal. Very nice personnel too.Check out the Mather's website for full details on the business model and who they typically cater too.Love what they do and what they offer.It is more than just a cafe.With that said, it is probably not a place that would appeal to the younger generation.

2.description: New in the neighborhood, my husband and son and I stopped in over the weekend and we loved the place.. very quiet good food... felt like I was eating at home.Will definitely go again as my husband and I are in our early 50s..my son who is 21, not so much.. but he did enjoy the pancakes.

5.description: Didn't really realize what we were walking in to but pleasantly surprised! I had a skillet with veggies and ham with a side of French toast. Husband had a skillet of I don't know what with pancakes. Fresh ingredients and great prices. And it's all for a good cause! Nothing to complain about.

6.description: I received some coupons in the mail from the restaurant.  When I went there, I realized it was for the over 55 club.  I am over 55, but I don't consider myself a senior citizen.  The place offers much for people to do and everyone seemed to know each other.  The staff is friendly.  The food is cheap and good.  Give this place a try.

0.description: It's not a "foodie" kind of place, but humanity here means so much more than the food serves at the cafe.  I was on the way to the Fashion Outlets of Chicago at Rosemont to pick up a set of necklaces for one of my friends.  However, anticipating the mall wouldn't be open by the time I arrived at the mall, I recalled passing by this place some time ago.  After exiting the CTA Harlem (O'Hare branch) Blue Line station, we headed east on Higgins.  Within a two (2)-minute walk, we were there.  The hours on Saturdays are 0900 to 1400, and the kitchen will stop taking orders fifteen (15) minutes before the closing time.  As soon as we walked into the entrance, hubby and I were slightly confused about what this place was.  A nice older lady told us that the kitchen was open.  We quickly figured out that the entire venue was a combination of cafe and community center.  Another friendly older lady took our orders and the cook in the kitchen was very down to earth.  He explained to me that he would be using the "ginger powder" for the pancakes instead of slices of fresh ginger.  I told him I would give it a go...no problem.  We had the regular oatmeal, gingerbread pancakes, two (2) serving of bottomless coffee for under $10.  I believe they do accept credit cards, but we had cash on hand.  The "patrons" who were hanging out at the cafe seemed to be regulars.  One of the older gentlemen, Jack, introduced himself to us and was funny to talk to.  Personally, I think it's a place where the members in the local community come together.  That's probably why they coined themselves "Mather's More Than a Cafe!"  Attention Mather's: I enjoyed my experience here this morning.  Nevertheless, the "Yelp" business page appeared to be outdated and the URL was no longer active.  In order to be successful with your mission in outreaching the Norwood Park neighborhood and other neighborhoods in the proximity, having to list current business hours and website will definitely provide a significant boost.  This "cafe," in the end, has been approved to be legit...very, very legit.

4.description: Closed on a sunday? Really wanted to try this place, but with odd hours. Don't think i'll be swinging by.

58.description: We had not been here in years.  I guess we fell out of habit.  We have recently been back twice, and the food was as always:  consistently good.  I like ordering the New York Strip Steak and  they always deliver a good one:)  Good EATS.  The kids like it and the waitresses are accomodating and attentive.  It is always comforting to eat here.

56.description: Sally's is a big, casual, friendly place for a standard American breakfast of egg and meat dishes.  Went here with extended family, visiting from both England & Mexico, as a way of introducing them to American breakfast items such as pancakes, waffles, maple syrup, hash browns--all exotic to them and all familiar to me.  I had a good plate of buckwheat pancakes with coffee, while others at my table had various combinations of eggs, corned beef hash, veggie omelets and so on..  Most of these breakfast entrees seem to be priced at about $8 and are huge helpings in most cases.  Our experienced professional waitress was great: funny and attentive.  She brought the five-year-old in our group some crayons and paper to color on without our even asking.  And the bus guys never missed a beat; they were always refilling my coffee before I'd reached the bottom of the cup, even as fast as I was drinking it on a groggy Saturday morning.

29.description: Ehhh... $35 for breakfast for 2 and we weren't satisfied with it. The food lacked flavor and I definitely make better pancakes at home. $3.25 for 4 small pieces of bacon?? I can't complain about the service but I can't rave about it either. You'd honestly get a tastier meal at an IHOP or Denny's.

42.description: I paid $8.50 for a BLT deluxe with fries and soup, and the sandwich contained only three slices of bacon.  I've been eating at this place for years, but as someone else mentioned, they're under new management, so it looks like I'll be going elsewhere in the future.  Better options include The Family Palace (Harlem & Gunnison) and The Phoenix Restaurant (Cumberland & Lawrence).

23.description: Sallys has amazing Pancakes and waffles with decent egg options.  Breakfast is the only time to go.  Lunch is that of a typical corner diner..

47.description: This place was solid as a rock. Although I went here for the first time not too long ago, I had a very good idea what to expect out out of the quality, portions, value, and service. Did they let me down? Absolutely not!I was very pleased on all accounts with my breakfast visit! I don't get out this way very much. The next time,  I need a good breakfast, I know exactly where I need to go

8.description: This is a vert normal and average breakfast / diner restaurant. I did not want the service quality to affect my judgement over the food and pricing. Thus, i went here during a less busy time on a sunday.The menu was not that big or complicated. I did not feel intimidated by the menu, i think it was standard for a breakfast place.As soon as i saw the steak skillet i knew that i wanted to try that. You can not get a steak skillet in every breakfast location. It is the royal dish of the breakfast places:) the portion was nice and filling. The blend of the ingridients were ok. The only flaw was the quality of the meat or steak they use. If someone is going for a steak plate you know that person wants to spoil or treat himself that day. So i would be really happy to pay 1-2$ more and get a better cut steak. This was some below average meat.The pancakes were so so. I would say many other places i ve been to makes better pancakes including golden nugget. I would not crave this place or make an extra effort to go there again but if i am hungry and happen to be in the area then i would eat it again.The servers are actually nice but i can understand their frusturation as they have to deal with really old crowd here i mean really old; the ones that come with an oxygen tank with them!!! So i dont blame them being little impatient with the customers sometimes.

31.description: I've only been to Sally's for their breakfast and I love it. They have a great breakfast menu. Their pancakes are pretty good but I much rather have their waffles. Service is great and even when it's hard to find a parking space, seating is always quick. Definitely our go to breakfast place near home.

34.description: My boyfriend comes in for their French toast so often, they don't even offer him a menu anymore. Just saying...Even though we already had dinner last night, Jason couldn't resist calling ahead for 2 orders of cinnamon raisin French toast. When we got home, he ate them both without offering me a bite. Good thing I wasn't hungry.So, this morning, he suggested we have breakfast at Sally's. Without any hesitation, I ordered the short stack French toast - my first time and extremely curious -  That's just 2 slices of bread, cut in half. Even though it's easy to make, it's a hassle to prepare. Not why he loves them. I now know first-hand how awesomely delicious and addicting they are here! Don't be surprised if we go back for more tomorrow.

16.description: Their breakfast and lunch are very good. They have a wide variety of offerings and their dessert selection is yummy. Fairly priced as well. I would recommend this place.

13.description: Moved to Portage Park w my ma in 2003. This has ALWAYS been our "go to place" for breakfast and lunch! Comfy laid back feel. Smiling and funny servers ALWAYS. Efficient bus boys. Breakfast food=yum! Burgers and fries (REAL cut french fries?) YUM!I love love this place

11.description: Sally's Special French toast....disappointing, no flavor. Bacon changed to a lower quality also. It makes me sad. It used to be thicker cuts. Waitress was friendly enough but I was impressed by the busboy, Rogelio, he was on point ! My husband drinks a lot of water and Rogelio made sure the cups were never empty.

39.description: Not bad. Had French toast, was tasty. Wouldn't run back. Like others mentioned, the cashier? owner? manager? The person at the check out should take that ugly, rude, unpleasant look off his face. I don't want to start my day with some dude literally TAKING my money without any "how was your meal?" or "thank you." Food average. Management terrible.

37.description: I had a Tom turkey dinner here.  It was ok, took half of it home and turned out fine reheated next day.Only complaint was the turkey gravy wasnt what I would have liked and they dont have a good vegetable selection with your meal.  I've been here before for breakfast, but this was my first dinner experience.

0.description: Decent classy-looking diner from the outside, this place has a nice ample parking lot. Inside, the decor was your "typical" outdated diner feel to it (think Golden Nugget) but that's what adds character to these places, no? The waitress we had was super nice and friendlyI ordered the meatloaf, mash potatoes, and veggies. The dish was drenched in gravy, but that's how I like it! It came with three generous slices of meatloaf which was nice and moist. The mash potatoes were pretty fluffy and tasty as well. The great thing was my meal only costed $8, and it included soup! I had the chicken noodle soup, which was pleasantly tasty, and not salty (that's what she said). Overall, the food was decent.... for a dinner.BATHROOM REVIEW: The bathrooms were super clean! I was expecting the typical old diner bathrooms... ya know, reeking of Pine sol and fake plastic plants and flowers, but this bathroom was pretty clean and bright. Sit or squat? Sit!

38.description: Great breakfast and service. Very friendly atmosphere. The best thing of all, THE PRiCES!!!

51.description: Ok parking can be a pain but lemme tell you the pancakes are so worth it. I cant tell you how many times I drove by Sally's before finally deciding to have breakfast there one day. Shame on me for not going sooner. My daughter had an omlete that was amazing. Hubby had french toast...also deelish! We'll be  back for sure.

27.description: Moved to Portage Park w my ma in 2003. This has ALWAYS been our "go to place" for breakfast and lunch! Comfy laid back feel. Smiling and funny servers ALWAYS. Efficient bus boys. Breakfast food=yum! Burgers and fries (REAL cut french fries?) YUM!I love love this place

32.description: I just don't like this place. I've been here twice - both times due to my parents wanting to eat here - and both times I've been disappointed.Their soup is spice-less. No salt, no pepper, nothing. I ordered cream of chicken soup, and out came a white liquid that can be summed up as cream with a slight chicken flavor.This past time, I ordered a deluxe turkey sandwich. The deluxe part was the addition of soup and fries. To my surprise, out came the turkey sandwich, which consisted of about 4 slices of turkey on toasted white bread. Just some lettuce on the side. No cheese, no condiments, nothing. I could barely get the dry sandwich down, and I was starving. Again, no discernible seasoning was on the turkeyeither. The grilled cheese my mom had looked fine, just a little crisp.My dad's beef sandwich didn't look good either. It was thicker, kind of fatty beef served with a ton of gravy all over it. The side was a cup of mashed potatoes drenched in the sauce.Service was OK, but not great. A waitress spilled my husband's soup as she put it down. She said a quick, "sorry," but made no effort to clean it up and just left.I love a good breakfast/brunch spot, but this place just isn't it.

54.description: Was dying to try this place but boy I should of kept waiting. We went there for breakfast and the guy that was working the register, who seats you, was ignorant as hell. We didn't ever get a nice  greeting and when we paid for our crappy food, we didn't even get a thank you. The food was terrible.  I never knew someone could dry out eggs and hash browns!  And $25 for breakfast for two....next time we're going to McDonalds!!

48.description: I ordered the Lumberjack skillet. After munching on it a bit, I noticed that the sausage, bacon, and ham pieces seemed a bit sparse. I began digging through the dish and to my dismay, discovered very little meat in it. It was almost all potatoes. I showed my girlfriend and she couldn't believe it. I showed the waitress and she apologized and offered to take it back. It appeared as though there was half a sausage link, half a strip of bacon, and a few bits of ham in the entire $9 dish. The waitress was phenomenal. But, there is no excuse for this kind of thing from the kitchen. If you charge me $9 for a dish, you'd better give me $9 worth of food the first time. Having to ask the server to take it back is not acceptable.I will not be back. I wonder what other "short cuts" this owner is taking.This place is not only expensive, but cheap on the ingredients. There are plenty of places nearby that provide much better taste and value.

44.description: Under new management.  Servers are ok but management is rude and unappreciative.  If you don't appreciate my business, I will happily take it elsewhere.

24.description: Apple Pancake is sugary bliss.  Order one to share when you first arrive, because it takes a while to bake.  The service here is always great.  The other food is standard breakfast fare, but the Apple Pancake is delish!  They've also recently added some steak and egg specials that are great deals...$10 for a nice cut of steak, eggs, potatoes and pancakes.

7.description: My omelette had the consistency of cardboard. .. not sure if they stretch the eggs or what happened but it was gross. Pancakes are delicious so I say if you go here stay away from anything that isn't a sunny side up egg...

49.description: Solid.  Waffles and wifi.And, people that know me well are familiar with my beloved breakfasts with my parents, who drink decaf until they're buzzed (the transformation is amusing).  This is a good meet-up spot for a round of slow caffeination with the dear Ps.  And the crepes obsession is in full effect here.  I don't know where they get the wonderful strawberries.  Satan, perhaps.

40.description: We were one of two tables in for breakfast at 6:30 this morning and right off the bat when I asked for coffee they poured me a mug that was cold. Took her over ten minutes to bring me a hot one, when again, the place was empty. Our food came out and the only edible thing on my plate was the scrambled eggs. The frozen straight out of a bag hash browns were awful and mushy, and the pancakes were clearly cooked on the same flattop everything else is made on because they were sponged full of smoky flavor. Not good at all

53.description: I've been here before. I'm a fan or apple pancakes, have been since I was a kid. Its been a few years since I've been here. Have they changed the prices? Our breakfast for two was close to $30 dollars. For 2 orders of 2 eggs, hash browns and 2 sides of bacon, orange juice and 2 coffees. I'm still scratching my head on this one.And from what I could see the wait staff was friendly and pleasant, except for our server. There's so many other diners in Chicago, I won't be coming back.

30.description: Went there despite the negative reviews.... Unfortunately, I have to concur....  Food was marginal at best.... service was below average... And overpriced... Pancakes were dry and. Over cooked and the veggie skillet had more hash browns that veggies..

46.description: I've came here with my wife a couple of times. Although I've been here before the most recent time really bugged me. We drove in and parking was immediate, only because it was a monday. We figured awesome! Its not busy! We get in and we were right, not busy at all. I'm looking around at all the available tables and as we stood there waitingto be seated, the man who escorts you to your table, just stared at us. We waited for a seat for fifteen minutes before they sat us down? Really? Now my stomacg was getting the best me and my emotions lol. I was upset but blew it off. We ordered our food which came out quick. The food was hot and we ate like champions but....... I rememember, I had asked the waitress for a coke.... and it never came. This place is like the stock market, hit or miss.

1.description: The food was meh.  The service was lacking. My pancakes were cold to the point that they didn't even melt the butter. Waitress never came back to check on us so I couldn't tell her. Went to pay and the hostess/cashier looked at us without a single word. We had ask how much the bill was because she didn't speak.  Never did she ask how was everything nor even acknowledge us. We were excited to try this place because it's in the neighborhood and we love to support the locals. Unfortunately it wasn't worthy of any return business from us.

55.description: This review applies to the breakfast menu only (I've never eaten lunch or dinner entrees here, just breakfast items). Yum yum yum. Delicious & generous breakfast skillets, ham on the bone, Eggs Benedict, pancakes & waffles! Yum yum yum.

9.description: I'm pretty sure this place has been around for a while, but this was my first time visiting with my family. It's a diner so they have one of those intense menus that pretty much cover the gamut of meals and a variety of offerings and is presented in, basically a thin binder. They took our reservation a few days before and had a table easily set up when we walked in. Their coffee guys are so on the ball that they almost over-caffeinate you.The food was actually pretty good. It was solid diner fare.  I ordered the Belgium waffle with the 'fresh, frozen strawberries' which made me laugh. The waffle does get a little soggy from the fruit, but can you really notice when they overcompensate with a mound of whipped cream? My corned beef has was a little salty, but at a diner I figured as much. However, I did like that it wasn't overly soggy and had a bit of crunch which kept me coming back for more. Overall it seemed that my party enjoyed their meal. I mean my dad just ordered ham off the bone and got a plate of ham...off the bone. No complaints there at all.Our waitress was very nice and was even patient with us when we originally forgot to mention that we wanted to split our bill. They were very accommodating in allowing us to do so as we were ready to head out.

26.description: This place was always welcoming of us when we came in caked with mud after playing football. They kept the water coming too.The food was always good, the service excellent. A long menu so everybody got what they wanted.We never had to wait for a table, yes it was Sunday night. But they always found a spot for us. I actually dated a waitress from there for a short time. Just another excuse to stop in for a meal.

25.description: It's old world dining in a classic pancake house setting. From the decor of brass, oak & etched floral mirrors it's something directly out of the early 80's. The menu is expanasive and the potions are hearty...quality has taken a dump over the past years though.We had a waitress today who was very unattentive, we had to ask for every cup of coffee and water. She would walk by numerous times and not even look. When we asked again for water, she had an outloud attitude and rolled her eyes saying she just got a big party, (It consisted of 8 people, NOT a BIG PARTY!) When we told her we had to ask again, she verbally said..yeah yeah yeah and walked away! The place needs a good clean up and all the staff, including the less than welcoming host, needs a personality cut out for this business. Not even a smile or thank you when paying. Not worth the aggrevation & rudeness.

12.description: I could name 10 places better than this place. It expense and not worth it, they give you very small portions and the front desk isn't friendly the waitress was nice that's why it gets 1 star.

59.description: Came here with a rather large group for a late lunch on a Sunday. The staff was very accommodating by moving us to a bigger table when our party unexpectedly grew.The food options are typical of a family restaurant. I got a chicken philly sandwich which came with fries and a bowl of soup. Our table got a mixture of food from breakfast to salads and everything looked appetizing.My only complaint was that our server never came around to offer refills on the soft drinks. She did refill coffee though.

21.description: This is my 3rd visit here in the 4 years I lived here in Chicago. It has always been a pleasant experience for me. The wait staff is very friendly and helpful. This food is good and served in a timely manner. Let's face it, breakfast is kind of hard to screw up badly, isn't it? I've had the usual bacon and eggs, chopped steak, etc. and I've always left satisfied. Thanks Sally (whoever you are)!!

17.description: I just don't like this place. I've been here twice - both times due to my parents wanting to eat here - and both times I've been disappointed.Their soup is spice-less. No salt, no pepper, nothing. I ordered cream of chicken soup, and out came a white liquid that can be summed up as cream with a slight chicken flavor.This past time, I ordered a deluxe turkey sandwich. The deluxe part was the addition of soup and fries. To my surprise, out came the turkey sandwich, which consisted of about 4 slices of turkey on toasted white bread. Just some lettuce on the side. No cheese, no condiments, nothing. I could barely get the dry sandwich down, and I was starving. Again, no discernible seasoning was on the turkeyeither. The grilled cheese my mom had looked fine, just a little crisp.My dad's beef sandwich didn't look good either. It was thicker, kind of fatty beef served with a ton of gravy all over it. The side was a cup of mashed potatoes drenched in the sauce.Service was OK, but not great. A waitress spilled my husband's soup as she put it down. She said a quick, "sorry," but made no effort to clean it up and just left.I love a good breakfast/brunch spot, but this place just isn't it.

10.description: If I could give zero stars I would. My wife and I went to Sally's today for lunch. We sat down and ordered our drinks when something came up and we found out we had to leave before eating. I let our waitress know and she brought me a check for 6.50. We took maybe 3 sips each out of each glass of RC (not Coke as we were told) and they charged us 6.50!I thought it must have been a mistake. We were not even the establishment for more than 5 minutes and they charge 6.50 for 2 drinks?I take the receipt to the front and ask if it was a mistake. The very rude manager (I assume) told us "minimum 3 dollars each no exceptions".I explained we were planning on staying but had to leave and he responded with the same statement.I will never return to this establishment when Family Palace is right down the street.

5.description: Great Service and delicious breakfast!!I came here for breakfast with a friend and we were both satisfied with our meals. I had the French toast a side of eggs and hash browns. Everything tastes great and the staff was amazing. Great job guys!!

3.description: Last visit was this AM, NEVER AGAIN!! Dirty orange juice glass and a roach embedded in a pancake! YUCK!!!

35.description: Food is pretty good! Crepes are really good, but the service is not that good. We are usually having a problems with service and orders being messed up

19.description: I came in to order breakfast to go for 50 students to go and they made the best fresh breakfast! Waitress and morning manager are so nice and we will be back. Great place, very clean. Great for breakfast!

28.description: Shame shame shame!I have not been in this place in 2-3 years due to the poor service.I was wanting a chocolate chip waffle baaaaaaaaad.Okay, I will give it a try.It was not a good idea.I was seated and was waiting for someone to come.No one coming at all.  Not even water.  I looked at my watch and thought I will wait 5 minutes. The waitress came.  I got coffee and water and ordered.  I asked for the whipped cream on the side. Sure! Food did come quickly.  When she brought it I asked for more coffee.  Sure!She did not bring the whipped cream.  I assumed that her hands were full and she would come with it.   Benefit of the doubt, people forget.  No coffee and no whipped cream.  Finally the busboy brought the coffee.  I waited to see if she would come by and I could tell her.  Nope.  Pancakes half eaten.  No waitress.  Hold on a minute, I did hear her 2 times helping the men behind me.I wanted a container for the 2 other pancakes.  No waitress.Crazy as I am I wrapped them in the paper placemat and put them in my purse!I put my coat on and was going to go up to the register.  When she noticed I was putting my coat on she brought the check.I was wondering if I should leave a tip at all.  I figured that I am not coming back so I left NOTHING.  Now don't be a hater and tell me how hard they work.I go above and beyond when they do too.I did tell the hostess I would not be returning and why.Now I am telling you.Read the negative reviews.  Then if you go, shame on you.

45.description: Very friendly and attentive servers.  There were 6 of us and each of us enjoyed the food we ordered.  Sally's will probably become a regular stop for us when we're in the area.  Portions are big enough for 2 to share and everything was cooked to perfection.

33.description: Food tastes like it came from the freezer, waitresses smells and sounds like pure cigarettes, look sloppy and are miserable just like the service.

43.description: I had an awful time there. The waitress was very rude and refused to not work with what I wanted. All I wanted was in replace of pancakes, the crepes and I said I would be willing to pay extra for crepes with my meal and she said she was not able to do it. They had chocolate chip pancakes but I really wanted crepes so I asked her if I could have plain crepes and she just ask if they can put chocolate chips in or something instead of the whole other fiasco of trying to get crepes with the eggs and hash brown. She also said that she cannot do it. It is not that hard to put chocolate chips in to be in a crepe especially if you already have chocolate chip pancakes. I am not going back there, I use to go there all the time but this just threw me over the edge. It doesn't help the fact that when I told this story to my friends, they said they have experienced or heard the same thing. I am very disappointed being a former customer.

2.description: Gross. Canned mushrooms? Disgusting cheap food. Frozen spinach.... Bagged hash browns with no taste. Disappointing to say the least. We were excited to try based on the location and we foolishly thought it would be similar to the one in park ridge. Nowhere near. For the prices, you should expect fresh food. Not from a freezer and it from a can.Front desk staff and waitstaff didn't seem to care that we ate about 1/4 of our food and openly complained about quality. Never going back.

18.description: I had a Tom turkey dinner here.  It was ok, took half of it home and turned out fine reheated next day.Only complaint was the turkey gravy wasnt what I would have liked and they dont have a good vegetable selection with your meal.  I've been here before for breakfast, but this was my first dinner experience.

41.description: This is another place that is just down the street from us so we popped in one night when it was getting late.  I was pretty excited seeing the food on other tables.  Everything looked delicious! ... well looks are deceiving here :(I ordered the reuben and it has to be the chitzy-est reuben I have ever received.  I got more meat on a reuben at Arby's and that was $3 cheaper and came with a drink.  The fries were undercooked and mushy.My husband got the patty melt.  A generous burger that was well cooked, but they must be saving a fortune on spices because I don't think this thing was seasoned at all... not even salt and pepper.  The blandest burger we've had in a long time.Both meals came with soup.  We ordered two different kinds and both were okay.The waitress was nice, but had lots of tables so wasn't very responsive/attentive.  There was a man busing and refilling waters that was very nice and always there, but he didn't speak English hardly at all.Overall I was not impressed.  Like others have said, too many other decent places to eat to go back here.

52.description: The only reason this place is even getting a star is because our waitress was at least nice at first & no stars is not an option.I went to Sally's a couple days ago with my mom for lunch. I ordered a burger with jalapeno cheese and bacon, she ordered a Julienne Salad. We both got soup with our meals, as well as a bread basket for the table. The bread was the best part of the meal. The soup was cold, not even warm, cold. So we just told our waitress we did not want it and proceeded to wait for our food. Her salad was fine at first glance, my burger was not. The cheese was not even melted and the meat was cold. So I sent it back to have them melt the cheese & add bacon because it was not there, I was nice & it was a seemingly simple request. It came back 5 minutes later and the cheese was black there was still no bacon, and the second waitress of the day couldn't understand why I didn't want it. Our original waitress then returned to see what the problem was and I looked at my burger, she apologized and asked what I'd like instead. I decided to give them one more chance.I asked them to please bring me a new burger, with American cheese & bacon. My mother and I waited patiently, she decided to take a break from her "Julienne' salad that had about 4 strips each of turkey ham & the two cheeses. Finally bout 12 minutes later my burger arrived, & I went to take a bite, because it looked like what I'd asked for. What happened next? I felt as though I had taken a bite of charcoal briquettes, and I took the top bun off to find it charred beyond belief. As well as the bottom bun half blackened. I sent the food back and asked for nothing else, just for it to be taken off the bill. The manager begrudgingly took it off. Then I had a bite of my mothers salad, got a nasty stale taste from the turkey & that sealed the deal. We will NOT be returning. This place is in need of a new owner, new kitchen staff and a less indifferent wait staff.  They could do with a reduction in their menu as well. Don't waste your time or money. You'd be much better off at the Wendy's next door!

50.description: I like this restaurant. Very cozy inside. Came on New Year's Day (in evening).Had the chicken quesadillas - they were delicious. They give you 4 nice slices (I had to take 2 home).  Comes with tomatoes, onions, and lettuce on the side. Recommended!!

4.description: This used to be a great neighborhood place not anymore starting to feel run down and the even charging now for a container if you have leftovers.

6.description: Today was my 1st time at Sally's. Wow, I had an amazing meal and everything was perfect. They gave me strawberries on the side in a good amount, good eggs.... I can't say anything bad. They earned a customer today.

22.description: I go there frequently for the breakfast specials. Always good and service always decent.  no complaints from me.

15.description: My boyfriend comes in for their French toast so often, they don't even offer him a menu anymore. Just saying...Even though we already had dinner last night, Jason couldn't resist calling ahead for 2 orders of cinnamon raisin French toast. When we got home, he ate them both without offering me a bite. Good thing I wasn't hungry.So, this morning, he suggested we have breakfast at Sally's. Without any hesitation, I ordered the short stack French toast - my first time and extremely curious -  That's just 2 slices of bread, cut in half. Even though it's easy to make, it's a hassle to prepare. Not why he loves them. I now know first-hand how awesomely delicious and addicting they are here! Don't be surprised if we go back for more tomorrow.

57.description: I used to LOVE this place growing up in the neighborhood! Now it has gone WAY down! It's so sad! The minestrone soup used to be great, they offered Navy Bean and Chicken noodle the day I went. My chicken Marsala was SO bland. It was SO disappointing! They changed their ancient menu... FINALLY but the dishes are no where near okay. I hope you get a new cook. This is sad and a tragedy. I don't even want to go for crepes for fear of disappointment! And my Strawberry Boston float, tasted like FLAT sugar free soda. Which was the BIGGEST disappointment for me. Sadly, I will not be returning to Sally's, ever.

20.description: My wife and I have eaten before and it was good. This last time was $27.00 mistake. We ordered the banna crepes and a cheese omlette. I have to say it the order was wrong. The bannas where on top of the crepes no syrup like before they where cold akes if this was correct told tha how they are served. The chesse omlette ordered to be grilled came fluffy sent back. When it came again the chesse was not melted at best it was luke warm.Had to oder another order of toast becuase the first order was cold by the time the omlette was served. Would I go back that is a big maybe.

36.description: food is ok, service is worse

14.description: I love this place easy to get to just of harlem ave exspessway always good service and good food its been here for ever love there spaghetti its not the kind of food you would think is good at a place like sallys but trust me it is mmmmmmm and i recommend the german pancake there huge and soooo good they also make fresh soup everyday

3.description: i'm not irish but i sure felt lucky to finally cross gunnison road and visit the little irish grocery store called gaelic imports. its a small place but what really caught my eye was the display case filled with various delectable looking items. i ordered a sausage roll, a meat pie and a bag of irish scones, all delicious and all made in house. another little known chicagoland gem im glad i visited. you should visit too.

1.description: My husband is from Wexford and gets homesick often enough!  We head here for some rashers and some black and white pudding, we grab some Club orange and Tayto too! They even have Brennan's bread!  With these thing and few others, he says he is "Happy as Larry!" and we head home for a feast!

2.description: I try to go here about once a month and stock up on all of my favorite Irish foods.  Must haves include bangers, bacon, white pudding, black pudding and beans.  I could eat this everyday for breakfast!  If you are Irish like me and missing authentic Irish food this is the place to go!

5.description: Great place to get your irish goods.  I'll stop in every couple week to get sausages or something.  They are always friendly and helpful.  I think they run out of some crisps sometimes, but they'll be stocked the next time i go in.  The cold lucozade and club is in the small fridge to the right of the register.  I think they take their time walking up from the back just to make me think about grabbing one.  It always works.

6.description: They just started making vegetarian shepherd's pie!  I can't wait to have the freshly made potato leek soup.A wonderful place to get your Irish goods and goodies.  They have seasonal candy and gift items also.  I just spent $100+ happily.

7.description: In an attempt to find a few nostalgia-inducing food items for my  Irish mother's birthday, a Yelp search directed me to Gaelic imports.  About twenty minutes north west of the city, this store seemed to have just about every item I could want - Canned beans in tomato sauce, Irn Bru, black currant jam, Irish/English candy (Fruit Gums!), Barry's Teas, Lemsip!, etc.  The best part: fresh Irish meats (fancy bacon!), homemade soup, brown bread(both homemade and frozen), scone bread, pasties, bangers, and puddings.

8.description: They carry many of the same product as on-line food sites like FoodIreland.com, the staff is helpful, and I flew in and filled my suitcase on a layover!  Very nice to be able to count on them having what I wanted on a whem!  They have the Brennan's they have the club beverages!  And the rashers/bangers, meat pies! what more can you ask for!

9.description: One of their homemade meat pies will warm your heart on a cold winters day.

0.description: We came here for Irish Bacon, being the one thing we truly miss from Ireland.  Normal bacon just doesn't compare....  Luckily for us, they sell it here for an excellent price.  Puddings were reasonably priced as well.  They do have lots of jewelery and crystal, but really, all we care about is the food.  :)

4.description: Like a trip back to Ireland.This store has more authentic  Irish merchandise, including food, than any store I have come across since I shopped at a similar Irish store at Woodfield Mall.The store is small but does give you a pretty good variety of jewelry, clothing, authentic Candy, daily newspapers and historical or family lineage merchandise. My only complaint was that there was no Guinness on tap. : ( Everyone needs their wee bit of wet in the afternoon.The employees are extremely pleasant and Irish through and through.It's a nice neighborhood shop and worth checking out. Be the first in your family to try freshly made Haggis!

3.description: Great place to get nails done. They remember you,  Your name, your face, and what you get done and how you like it. (No sex jokes!!) :)Always ask for linda or amy- best work hands down. And the young guy that works there- well he's a little creepy and does a bad job.

1.description: I came to Top Nails on Good Friday, mid-day, with no appointment, for a no-chip manicure.  This was at the recommendation of my aunt who has lived in this area for 20+ years.  I've been here less than a year.I won't lie, I tried to go to Lee Nails across the street first, but they were JAM PACKED.  People standing and waiting.  People standing outside.  A 30 minute wait.Tammy at Top Nails did my no-chip and she did an excellent job.  Sure, their color selection isn't HUGE, but I was able to find a fun springy color - OPI's "cajun shrimp."Tammy took her time and made sure my nails were even, well shaped, and well lacquered.  I have no hesitation on knowing that this no-chip will last 2 weeks - barring catastrophe.  She also paid nice attention to my cuticles, and made good conversation.  I'm also completely fine with the fact that there was no awkward neck/shoulder massage at the end of the manicure... really, what is the point of that?Top Nails has a great set-up - the no-chip "bakers" are built into the tables, no clumsy maneuvering around them.Top Nails - I'll be back!

2.description: Just started going there.  Tammy's the best!  She's a perfectionist, which is a good thing.  She's personable & has a great sense of humor.

9.description: I'm a regular of this place, and I still only give it two stars. The only reason I go here is because they're around the corner from my house and I don't have a car. The only time I'm ever satisfied with my nails is by Ann, and even that's not 100%. I've also been cut by her at least 6 times. One time I let someone else do my nails and they came out lumpy!. Not a big color selection. I've been coming here for over a year now, and one girl always asks for my name like she doesn't know me, like she's never seen me before! With all the business i've provided them, you'd think they'd be a bit more personable. I always say I'm going to switch salons the next time I get my nails done, but unfortunately I can't beat the convenience of this location.

10.description: They do a good job. No matter who I've gone with I've been satisfied. Its a good place if your in need for a  quick mani-pedi its easy to get in, great prices, and even if I hadn't been there in while they do always remember me and my sister which is nice. Its my top pick around this area and I do recommend it.

4.description: Ive been coming here for a couple of years now and while my ONLY issue is that I cant always get who I want to do my nails, Ive never had a problem with this salon.  Its family-owned and they are all very hard-working and caring about their clients.  My favorite is the young man, although I wouldnt mind any of the others.  He is extremely meticulous and watching him, you can tell he really cares about what he is doing.  I read the other reviews and dont understand what the peeps who gave bad reviews were expecting.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nail salon.

6.description: I just don't think they know what they are doing at this place.  I usually go across the street to Lee but they were packed and I was needing a pedicure badly.  I should have just waited.  The guy stabbed me a couple of times with the cuticle nippers, no warm towels, not the cleanest looking place; but really the place was just weird  I seriously would go elsewhere.  I know I won't be going back.

11.description: Great service !!! Very detailed... Agree not many colors to choose from...GREAT PRICES !!! Open on Sunday's !!! Appointments suggested on weekend ....

5.description: I was looking for a good nail salon since I'm new to the area. I've tried a few and ended up here. I loved it! Great prices, great service and friendly staff! I got a mani/pedi and can't wait to go back!

7.description: This nail salon is nasty. I'm used to getting my nails done downtown and now I know why!! I'd rather pay a little more than to deal with this place. First of all, they have a carpet on the floor and when you sit down in the pedicure chair, the first thing you notice is all the nails that were left on the floor!! Grosssss!!!  There's a younger boy there that does your nails there too, he's terrible. He made some rude comments about Ellen Degenerous and then insinuated that I worked behind a desk all day....if he only knew what kind of job I really have, his little discriminatory ass would of stopped talking!  This shop just seemed very dirty and cheap. Word of advise, spend a little more money and go else where!

8.description: I used to go here before going to Lee Nails in Niles.  Every time i get my acrylics filled they cut them waaaay too short.  The eyebrow waxing is the VERY BEST! I like the pedicures but the chairs are VERY outdated.  The massage chairs either don't work or the buttons on the remote are worn.  But, it's a good place to go if you are on a budget.

0.description: Okay, Suzanne i!  My mom and I love her!  The shop is very clean and the ladies are are very professional!

3.description: I absolutely LOVE Gail. She consistently does a great job. I am confident referring her to anyone and my teens and pre-teen will only go to her as well. She runs a great shop.

1.description: I've been going to Gail for over 30 years, & my mom (God rest her soul) was going to her waaay before that!! She's awesome!  All the stylists are great! I highly recommend them!

2.description: I've been seeing Gail for about 6 years she does the best cuts. I've literally had strangers ask for and take photos of my cut when I'm out of town. I found her from my Mom of all people, and my daughters go to her. Anyone who can keep 3 generations of women happy- hats off to her. In her salon I've also seen the work of Lucy over the years, she is very good also. Mom, the girls and I all do color there also with great results. My daughters wedding up-do is being done there, we did the practice hair there and it will be beautiful. 708-867-6855

0.description: ok I will get to the quality of the style in a bit. The thing I really love about this place is how from the minute I met Gail it was as if I have known her all my life. The entire staff was so very welcoming on my first visit!! They are doing my daughter's hair for her wedding...and the trial run was magnificent!. Lucy did such a great job with my hair color...Seriously haven't been this excited over my hair in a long long time.  I am so totally hooked on this salon and especially it's friendly staff. Five stars just isn't enough!!!

4.description: I have been getting hair cuts at this shop for 2 years at their previous location.  I always get a great cut here.

1.description: Yoo hoo... where are my 2 guys?I walked in and it was 2 new people.Okay Susie, give them a chance.I had to use the restroom first. I did my thing, went to wash my hands and....The sink was full of hairs not just by the drain. They were all over the sink, the bowl, long black hairs that looked similar to the girl's that was sweeping the floor.I went to the counter to order.  I told the guy about the hairs, started placing the order... I could not do it.  I could not order a sandwich.  I am not going back.

2.description: Friendly folks and good quality! Newer restaurant and very clean! Also open usually til 11 (10 on Sundays).

0.description: Alwsys friendly  and outgoing always clean and always  fresh the workers are very nice and there very quick and yet accurate on your  order

3.description: I just left here and I love Mira! Absolutely love her. I hadn't gotten my hair cut in over 2 years and she did an amazing job. I showed her a couple pictures and she did it even better. She's super sweet. Definitely my place from now on! Thanks Mira :)

1.description: 5 stars doesn't do enough justice. This place is a serious hidden gem and I'm so happy I found my new hair salon. Let me just start off by saying that I've been through the whole "search for the best salon" in Chicago. Lincoln Park, Logan Square, Gold Coast, Ravenswood....this salon in Norwood Park by far surpasses my expectations and beats all the previous salons I've been to. Mira is a guru at what she does. She uses high end salon products and knows exactly what suits you and what you're trying to achieve. She ended up curling my hair and my hair held up the entire night, and even the day after..... My hair can't hold a curl past an hour.  Plus, her prices simply cannot be beat. She also does threading which makes this place a one stop shop! Don't judge how this place looks on the outside, you just need to try it out. You're welcome.

2.description: So I randomly came into this place two weeks ago. It doesn't look like much from the outside but once I walked in, it's beautiful. I got a simple haircut. Amazing. I decided I would come back to try a partial highlight ombré and get my hair waved for a wedding. I was more than happy with what I got for my money. Mira uses only top shelf hair products and color. She was very kind and friendly. Definitely recommend the place and I will be returning soon!

5.description: They are like the best at what they do. Definitely the place for your beauty needs.. the bomb man!!!

6.description: Both of my girls (tween and child), husband, and I go here.  Meersa is our stylist and we love her, but the other people are also fun and do great work-just like a hip salon, with all the top trends.  This is a laid back, quiet, neighborhood place, but very big-it is  clean, nice vibe, nice prices and chillaxed.  Plus I get  many many compliments on my hair-let us face it, that is why I keep coming back!.  I have seen all types of customers here-from old to young.  Like many of these neighborhood places, one lady seems to be focused on the senior set, so I would send my Gram here, too. Parking is easy, also a plus to me.

7.description: I live in Chicago for many years and Victoria's Beauty is far the best salon! I've been frequenting this salon, in a monthly basis, for practically 1 year now, and I have never been disappointed. Every treatment is just perfectly performed with genuine care and dedication. Mira is a terrific professional who handles everything from mani-pedi, hair coloring-cut to a perfect Brazilian waxing. 5 start service, professionalism and fair price.Give it a try and I guarantee you will not regret it!

8.description: This place is a hidden treasure, the place is bigger than it looks. It is very modern. If you are looking for a modern look or a makeover that goes with you, this is the place. Mira is the best, she will give you her honest opinion and will have you walk out looking great at a great price.  There is also a small, but pretty cool area for kids haircuts.  I use to go to Mario Triccoci,but I will stick to this place from now on.

0.description: Although I love getting my hair cut in Chinatown, the drive isn't all that fun and I wanted to try some place new. I found Victoria's Beauty Boulevard on YELP and how could I not try something with my name on it?! I booked an appointment right away with Mira (pronounced like miracle) and she is amazing! Mira, the owner of this place, has been cutting hair for a long time and even used to own her own hair salon in Europe!  She did a precise layered cut based on pictures I showed on my phone and she curled my hair using a flat iron. My hair has never been this curly and bouncy in my life! What's even more surprising is that she didn't use that much product and my hair does not feel weighed down at all! Her salon is super spacious and she even has a cute little area for children's hair cuts- kids can watch cartoons on a HELLO KITTY chair while getting their hair cut! umm yeahh! I wish I was 5 again haha. (And they do have a boy chair, too- not that boys can't like Hello Kitty or anything because they totally should lol)Mira also does nails and waxing as well. (Best to make an appointment for fancy nails). There are other hairstylists as well and they seemed really nice and welcoming. All the products that she used are high-end salon products and you can tell that Mira really put a lot of heart into the details of this place. It has such a nice warm atmosphere and even a private room just for waxing. Super excited to find this place and even more in LOVE WITH MY HAIR! Thank you Mira!!!Notes:-Reasonable prices- under 30 for haircut (before tip)(she also does perms, extensions, etc)-Children's cuts with cute chair-Free parking right outside the door.

4.description: Im a little late writing my review.  I went here about 2 months ago, got my hair cut by Meersa.  she did a fabulous job.  After having had bad haircuts for the past 2 years, I finally decided I would try a new place and Im so happy I did.  Meersa listened to what I wanted and did exactly what I asked for.  I LOVE MY HAIR AGAIN!!! THANK YOU MEERSA :)

28.description: Something about  a bakery that just feels right.  The smells, the sights, the bustle around the counter, going to Jewel and picking up a boxed cofee cake just doesn't cut it. The quality of product just isn't the same either.House of Cakes is an old school, neighborhood bakery.  a dying breed in a changing city. The sights and smells like i said are outstanding.  The products are even better.  I reccomend the cheese sticks and the carmel pecan and chocolate chip coffee cakes.  The sweet rolls and donuts are good.  The sheet pizza is also good.

1.description: Love the signature cakes!!!!! I love coming here to get cakes because its unique, but the taste is out of this world

39.description: OK, I must admit their cakes taste decent but they need better staff working there. Ordering a birthday cake last year, the employees could not figure out how big of a cake was needed for 25 people. They were all teenagers or college kids too, so nobody could get me a definite answer. Then the cake was supposed to have a red car on it and it was done orange. The cashier, a short girl in a tank top with a tattoo on her arm reading "Hotter than a $2 pistol" did not see anything wrong with it. She may have been part of the work release program or something. I got $10 off my next cake from them, which was OK. Still, I won't be coming back since they are too inconsistent with their service.

9.description: All cash. This place is pretty delicious. We ordered an assortment of pastries and cannoli for a New Year's Eve celebration. They were happy to give us an assortment of treats that we picked up an hour later. I would definitely go back.

29.description: I will never buy a single item from this bakery again. my 89 year old grandmother and 70 year old mother have been customers here for YEARS. We went in to talk about a 90th birthday cake for my grandmother and the OWNER (yes the owner) told us she was too busy to talk with us.... she was yelling and got so upset that she threw pie containers all over the place because we requested to speak with a cake decorator about the special design. she then proceeded to tell us that it would be too difficult to decorate a lemon wedge on the side of the martini glass design that would be drawn on the cake. she made a big deal about it and at that point i cancelled the order walked out and called sweet mandy b's who fully accommodated us and everything we needed without a single problem. This is where my family's business will be taken from now on.

23.description: I love House of Cakes! Before I lived in Chicago, I would travel from California to visit my family here, and we would always have the chocolate chip cheese danish ... the cheese sticks... omg delicious.  Now I like to go there and show people I know how good it is.  Why does it have to be cash only!

5.description: I've lived down the street from this place for 2 years and just realized recently that they do more than just cakes.  I ordered my son's birthday cake from there in April and it turned out great, even though it was more expensive than I had expected (around $45 after using a coupon).  Strawberry custard filling was great.Stopped by there this week for a breakfast treat and the chocolate covered cannoli was to die for!!!!  Walked there today to get another one since I couldn't get my mind off of it and I am still in love.  Bought one of the cheese pizzas for lunch and it was good as well.  I'm only giving 4 stars because of a few strange things about this place - they only take cash and I asked about the ice cream cakes today and was told they are $25 on weekends and $21 on weekdays - for the same cakes that are already premade in a freezer in the store.  Despite these strange things, I will be back to buy one of the ice cream cakes next month for my husband's birthday (on a weekday of course).

31.description: I can only review from word of mouth but I love the prices and I love that anyone I've bought sweets for loves them!My dad swears by this bakery, It's his absolute favorite. He will always pick up a banana boat. We took a ride around the neighborhood and my dad insisted I bring my new love interests' parents a sweet treat. That worked like a charm let me tell you. Diabetics don't stop from enjoying a sweet tooth pleasure. I'm glad a small business does so well.

25.description: Great neighborhood gem. Excellent cakes, totally custom, absolutely delicious. Fine, the staff could smile more, but the place is generally mobbed, and they do well to take care of everyone pretty quickly. Great bakery for the money, and definitely makes up in taste what it lacks in front-of-house details.

12.description: The cheese sticks are delicious!

37.description: This place is great for those in a pinch situations.  You can get a cake in a day!  They have so many varieties, too!   It worked out so perfectly where we actually had choices in different chocolate cakes - chocolate buttercream frosting, fudge, oreo cookies, and german chocolate cake.  Remembering how our birthday girl likes chocolate and coconut the german chocolate cake was perfect.  The staff seemed nice enough, and offered to put on a Happy Birthday sign on it since there was a decorative chocolate topping that would be difficult to write over, but they can typically write on the cake for you as well.  I saw so many other goodies here from cookies, cannolis, and they even have pizza!  What amazed me most was the pricing, $12.99!  It's unfortunate that they don't take credit cards though.  It's only cash or check.  Unbelieveable for such a tasty creation.  I was so tempted to go back for this strawberry shortcake creation, and so this will give me a reason to come back.

21.description: I was initially introduced to House of Cakes at work when someone brought it in as a treat. They said "try these cheese sticks." So I did. And they were good ;) Made a trip there myself and bought the following for an event :1. Cheese sticks: absolutely delicious. The crust is soft yet not too soft. The filling is sweet but subtle. It is a MUST try. 2. Croissants: Soft, with an extra touch of savory! A nice breakfast treat3. Round Cheese Pizza: I think their crust is the biggest thing that makes the pizza stand out. The pizza was pretty good. Worth a try. Overall, 5-star experience. Will definitely be a regular here. The staff were young people but why does that matter? You go in, buy your goods, and go home! Keep in mind it is CASH ONLY, there is  no parking lot, just street parking but it is free. They have a coupon on their website for $2.00 off $10.00 or $5.00 off $25.00.

16.description: I was initially introduced to House of Cakes at work when someone brought it in as a treat. They said "try these cheese sticks." So I did. And they were good ;) Made a trip there myself and bought the following for an event :1. Cheese sticks: absolutely delicious. The crust is soft yet not too soft. The filling is sweet but subtle. It is a MUST try. 2. Croissants: Soft, with an extra touch of savory! A nice breakfast treat3. Round Cheese Pizza: I think their crust is the biggest thing that makes the pizza stand out. The pizza was pretty good. Worth a try. Overall, 5-star experience. Will definitely be a regular here. The staff were young people but why does that matter? You go in, buy your goods, and go home! Keep in mind it is CASH ONLY, there is  no parking lot, just street parking but it is free. They have a coupon on their website for $2.00 off $10.00 or $5.00 off $25.00.

17.description: As several people have mentioned, their cheesesticks are AMAZING!!  Creamy, sweet cheese enveloped in a light puff pastry dough showered with powdered sugar....it's a delectable treat that will create an addiction.  I visited this bakery a couple of times for their cheesesticks.  The first time, I also purchased a chocolate loaf.  When I got home to eat it, I noticed a few mold spores.  I was slightly bothered by that, but the cake looked so good...so I spooned the spores off and still ate it.  It was delicious!  Everything in this bakery looks so good!  For my next visit, I'll probably try their fresh strawberry strudels....they look heavenly.But please, try the cheesesticks!!!

10.description: First things first - I've never cared for their staff. I've been going here for years, and they are most often times rude, smug, or just plain annoyed by any question or by customers in general. We wanted to special order a carrot cake once. They said they don't special order carrot cakes. Fine. We asked if we can order one for a birthday and pick it up in a few days. They said they always have carrot cake in-stock and there is no need to special order one. So what if that day you sold the only carrot cakes in-stock? They said call early in the morning. OK fine. We asked that since it's a BIRTHDAY cake, is it possible to NOT have it decorated with carrots all over the top? (The carrot cake has an icing design of carrots all across the border.) She had to ask in the back. She came back and said no, it's not possible. WTF? OK. Can you write Happy Birthday on it? Yes, when you pick it up. Talk about accommodating!!! She was rude the whole time too. I should've walked out at this point, but I was desperate for a cake. As far as cake designs go, if you ask for flowers on the cake, they will plop a sugar flower on the cake and draw some leaves with icing. Don't expect pretty icing designs. I don't think they pride themselves on stuff like that.Anyways, I've been coming to The House of Cakes for around 15 years mainly because it's practically tradition and super local.Their Coffee Cakes are EXCELLENT. The caramel pecan one is a personal favorite. Try to stop in early in the morning because they sell fast. They are always fresh and are a real good size for around $7.Their Zeppoli are another personal favorite along with the Large Chocolate Canolis. The actual cakes are pretty decent. The cake is really light and airy (not dense at all like birthday cake).. the consistency is almost like sponge cake. The buttercream is also really light and has a consistency similar to whipped cream. If you're looking for a super heavy birthday cake with thick, sugary frosting, this is not the place. Nothing is sickly sweet here, which many people like. (Although I do like a slice of cheap Jewel cake once in a while..) I like ordering the white cake with whipped custard filling and buttercream icing. It's pretty basic, but I really like it. It's also really good with fudge icing. Their carrot cake is also really good.I've also tried their pizza bread. It's pretty good. Top it with a little good quality olive oil and sprinkle a little shredded cheese on top and pop it in the oven till it's hot and it's very tasty. Overall, it's a pretty good bakery. It's not the best, but I have yet to find somewhere better in the Park Ridge area.

11.description: The cakes here are soooooooo damn good. My mom bought a stollen today and it is amazing. So good that I even thought it deserved a 5-star review to be typed out on Yelp. Their coffee cakes are quite a delicacy as well.

26.description: I picked up a cake from HOC's today for my son's birthday. When I went to pick it up, the person helping me was not too friendly and she disappeared in the back for a while, but besides that I had a good experience there. The cake tasted excellent. I had ordered a quarter sheet cake with yellow cake, fresh strawberry filling with whipped cream topping. All the guests at my party raved about the cake. I would highly recommend HOC.

27.description: Simple cupcakes are the best. You must try their cheesecake, strawberry shortcake and authentic Italian cookies! I'm glad this place is two minutes from my house! Ps they accept cash and check only. No credit.

35.description: Love the cheese sticks, pizza breads, pastries, streudels, cannoli cake, basically anything you get here will be delicious!!!

8.description: Best neighborhood bakery! I've never been disappointed with anything I've had. They've got cakes for any occasion and are always beautifully decorated. Awesome cookies, delicious pizzas and the cheese sticks are to die for :) I also love the fresh baked bread and apple strudel!

0.description: I'm continually surprised that people line up at the newest specialty donut shops that keep springing up across the city to shell out $5 or more for a donut that's not as good as one you can get at H of C for less than a buck. Sure, it won't be the pistachio-maple-bacon-Frosted-Flakes special you can get in River North for $12 but it's about as good as a donut gets. And as everyone mentions, the cheesesticks are fantastic, as are the cookies, the pizza and the Italian bread. We've ordered cakes from here for years -- First Communions, graduations, etc. -- and they are always old-school enough to make me nostalgic for 1970's basement baptism parties and kitchen-table birthdays. And yes, the staff isn't always super friendly but they're certainly not rude or mean. It's like when you'd talk to your mom when you were a kid and she was busy watching Phil Donahue and would smile and nod without ever taking her eyes off the TV. Big deal. They're working. I can take it. One of these days, they'll serve coffee or throw a few bottles of orange juice or chocolate milk in their cooler. It would be nice to wash down all that baked goodness with a drink. I mention it to whichever woman takes my money every time I'm there, and every time, she smiles and nods. Wait - they take checks, which is awesome, even though I don't really write them anymore. Still, it's nice when you're buying a thousand things from a bunch of different places for a birthday party for your kid and you're just about tapped out. Also, this is why I'm fat.

38.description: My sister used to work here and would bring home all of the goodies. We all put on the pounds. Every year we would get the same cake: yellow cake, whipped cream frosting, with strawberry custard filling. It is their custard that is just amazing. It's a whipped cream sort of custard and it is just the most delicious creation on the planet. I've had DREAMS of this custard. Strawberry cream puffs and banana boats are for the win. Take home a pizza too. They are awesome cold right out of the fridge in the morning. They still do not take credit cards. Cash or check only. Mike O: the reason why they don't have better staff working is because most likely they are girls from Resurrection and they are paid under the table.

20.description: At the last minute a birthday party was planned to happen in 24 hrs. I called the bakery to ask what cakes were available. The girl asked if I could hold for a minute. 10 minutes later no one came back to the phone. I decided to take my chances and drive over. Not one person was in the bakery so the wait on the phone was not acceptable. ( I live 3 min away) All teenage kids working. I asked what kind of cakes were in the show case. I wanted Canoli and they had one. I bought the Canoli cake(my fathers favorite) and an Icecream cake. I got my dad all excited for the cake and when he cut it....yep! Black forest cake! ugh the disappointing look on my dads face was horrible! Thank God for the icecream cake until someone found a hair in it! I know things can go wrong but really both cakes on the same day... unacceptable!

19.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for about 10 years now and FINALLY I find my bakery for life!!  I'd been here before to buy the cheese sticks and cupcakes, but never ordered a specialty cake.  I finally ordered a cake for a baby shower and boy I couldn't eat enough of this cake! It was excellent!  I order the yellow cake with strawberry and custard filling and whipped cream.  The cake was soft and moist, the whipped cream was light and just a little sweet and the berries were sweet, juicy and delish!  For those NW-siders who remember Nyberg's Bakery on Belmont (now long gone), House of Cakes is right up there, if not surpassing Nyberg's!  Do yourself a favor and order your cakes here!!!

33.description: Brought a very large, beautifully decorated cake to a work event.  Fabulous.  That was the best cake ever.  We all like the Costco cakes, but when you really need something outstanding this is your place!  Thanks Vinnie.

2.description: I am not writing this review based on the product because there cakes are amazing.  Any big occasion that my family has had that required a special cake, we got it from H of C.  We have giving them our business for many many years.  My review is based on their customer service, not in a way that they are not friendly, but rather that they make people go around there oh-so-busy schedule, as if to say, if you want one of our cakes, you work around our ridiculous schedule.  So my fiance and I are getting married and we wanted our cake from H of C.  Problem is I work 7 days a week and its very hard for me to make time on the week days.  So I called to see if I can schedule an appointment with there cake decorator.  There website states that they are open from 7am - 5pm.  So I called and asked if I can come in on a Sunday to speak to someone about our wedding cake, no can do...Cake Decorator is not there on Sunday.  Okay, I get that it's a Sunday.  So I asked How about Saturday?  Our cake Decorator doesn't get in until after 11am on Saturday and that's the day shes making the cakes, I am told.  So basically in so many words if I want a cake from this family owned establishment, I have to come in after 11am on a Saturday, there was no consideration for the customer.  As if to say, you need to work around us, and not the other way around.  A long time customer, they want a special cake for their wedding, from us, though there are hundreds of bakeries in the Chicago-land area, We chose H of C, because it's been the only true place we go and we wanted to remain loyal, and also know what to expect from them.  Yet they tell us their is no wiggle room to meet with the decorator.  That's very sad.  Because that kind of service just inspired me to find a new bakery.  After many years of coming here...  Remember when you were once a small operation H of C?  and your loyal customers kept you afloat?  Nah you probably forgot that.  I don't expect this review to harm H of C reputation as far as how wonderful there cakes are, but maybe, just maybe they find a little more consideration.

34.description: This is a review based solely on their cheese sticks which, in my opinion, should be called Heaven sticks. The owners of this bakery are customers from the place I work and yesterday they brought in three boxes filled with their cheese sticks. Everyone went crazy because they were so delectable. They melt in your mouth and it is impossible to have just one of them. I have never been to this bakery, but if their other items are as good as their cheese sticks, I'm there!

32.description: IF you dont like their cakes - there is something seriously WRONG with you!  I particularly enjoy the cannoli filled cake. IT is out of this world. The cheese sticks are the best I have ever had and the pizza bread is PERFECT.  FOr any occassion you need a cake- this is the place to shop.  Prices are reasonable and the service is fast and friendly.  Ben going there for the past ten years No complaints.

18.description: This bakery is great. The location is in a great spot, and their desserts are delicious.

13.description: Just discovered this bakery near my home. Did not realize it sold so much more than cakes! I was pleasantly surprised to see they still had donuts in all varieties that were very fresh in the late afternoon. We ended up with 2 chocolate frosted donuts & 2  sugar Easter cookies in shapes of eggs.  Everything came to under $3.00.
