I am usually very skeptical of the bakery decorated cookies, these were by far one of the best I have ever tasted. Am kicking myself for not buying more! They also had samples of their Italian cheescake. Awesome with a buttery, homemade crust. As others have commented though they don't take credit/debit cards, so bring cash. I can't wait to go back!

4.description: House of Cakes made our wedding cake and although I never got to try it, all of our guests can attest that it was delicious. I chose House of Cakes for the quality and value. I knew our cake would be good because I had had many of their cakes before and have never been disappointed. We went with a 3 tier cake with alternating layers of yellow cake/ cannoli filling and tuxedo cake/custard/fresh strawberries. It was a simple design which I wanted but it was beautiful. So glad I went with House of Cakes!

24.description: I have orderd all of our "special occassion cakes from here for years!  Their quality cakes far surpass anything from the local chain stores.  Their whip cream is "real" and doesn't taste like it has alot of additives.  I highly suggest this bakery for their cakes!  I've just contacted them to ask about which size cake to order for a large group.The gal was very helpful in making an honest suggestion of the appropriate size I would need.

6.description: OMG! I'm sitting in my car outside this place and enjoying a delicious cheese stick.. Sounds like an appetizer but it's more like a cheese Danish stick and it is DELICIOUS . Tuesday's there only .99 & since I'm on a diet I bought 5.. .. The delicious coffee cakes are under $6 and small banana nut bread loaves for $1.99.. OMG .. I'm hooked! LOVE  LOVE House of Cakes

22.description: I can't believe no one is mentioning their "to die for" pizza.  It's a must have for all our office parties and I use it as appetizers for my get togethers.  I just cut the pizza in little bite size squares.  *Note* It freezes well, too!  MMMMMmmmm!

15.description: This little hole-in-the wall "Dive" is a cheap-eats bakery. I asked them if they have a "specialty" item. Apparently, they do!  They are famous for their "cheese sticks" so I thought I would try one. The texture was light and flaky. It is about 4 to 5 inches long and filled with sweet whipped creamy cheese. Yes, it was tasty, but not worthy of five stars. They top it off with powdered sugar, which makes it messy to eat. I don't think it needs the powdered sugar though. Cheese stick = 4 stars. I ended up buying several brownies, which are worthy of five stars. The bottom of the brownie is dusted with sugar. The brownie was chocolaty and moist (more like a cake than a brownie). The texture was creamy and smooth. My husband likes anything with apples, so I thought I would buy a few to take home. We had them the next day, and I was surprised how tasty these were. I like that you can buy individual slices as opposed to an entire apple pie. Apple slices = 4-1/2 stars. I have had their cakes from here. A few people that I know have ordered Birthday cakes from here (including yours truly). They use quality butter cream, real fresh strawberries to fill the center of the cake and are beautifully decorated. They will also put fresh whipped cream on your cake if you do not like butter cream. I prefer the butter cream though. Cakes = 5 stars. You can select whatever colors and design you would like for a Birthday cake or pick one of their own designs which are on display. The cake that I usually order is under $22, which is reasonable and serves up to 8 people.The bakery is located in a very odd location. There isn't much around this area and there are residential houses a few feet away from the bakery. There is a party store next door to the bakery, and across the street there is an Italian restaurant (Nonna Silvia's). That's about all there is in this otherwise boring non-diverse neighborhood. It was obvious to me that this is not a multi-cultural neighborhood. Since I was meeting someone for a late lunch at Nonna Silvia's I decided to stop into this little "Dive" and pick up a few sweets. This is "cash" only and is a family owned mom-and-pop operation. They also sell ice cream cakes, and are much cheaper than the Dairy Queen's ice cream cakes. This bakery could use a major update (looks like something out of the late 1980's or early 1990's). Really ugly. There is street parking and a small parking lot next door to the party store for these businesses. I found the two employees to be very cheerful and helpful. I was in and out fast, but then again, I was their only customer.

40.description: There is so much vareity to chose from here that you end up buying a lot more than you intended to. It's okay though because the prices are cheap and you can afford to keep coming back for more and more- which you will.

7.description: YES! My friends and I were staying at the nearby Springhill suites and had a major sweet tooth. After doing some yelp research, we decided house of cakes was worth the 0.7 mile walk in freezing temperatures, and we were so totally right! We ended up getting tiramisu, an eclair, a cheese stick (which is sweet, rather than savory as I had expected), a chocolate mousse cake, and a strawberry cake thing. Everything in the case looked delicious, and all of our choices were consumed within 20 minutes of getting back to the hotel room. I don't think you could go wrong at house of cakes. The best part? We got five desserts for something like $16!PS: they had a big basket of plain biscotti that they just gave out for free as samples!

36.description: This place is a great neighborhood Italian bakery. The family that owns it truly puts their heart into everything that is made. YOU MUST TRY THE CHEESESTICKS. They are hands down the best pastry item you will ever have!

30.description: As several people have mentioned, their cheesesticks are AMAZING!!  Creamy, sweet cheese enveloped in a light puff pastry dough showered with powdered sugar....it's a delectable treat that will create an addiction.  I visited this bakery a couple of times for their cheesesticks.  The first time, I also purchased a chocolate loaf.  When I got home to eat it, I noticed a few mold spores.  I was slightly bothered by that, but the cake looked so good...so I spooned the spores off and still ate it.  It was delicious!  Everything in this bakery looks so good!  For my next visit, I'll probably try their fresh strawberry strudels....they look heavenly.But please, try the cheesesticks!!!

3.description: my colleague bought in pazckis and they were pretty good, and thats a lot coming from me because i stay away anything that is close to a doughnut

14.description: We have been going to this place for over 20 years. Their cakes are always top notch. Aside from cakes I have 2 other favorites..1) Pizza by the tray. This stuff is just like the way my grandmother used to make it. It usually is eaten not heated. Doughy cheesey goodness.2) Cheese sticks. Trust the other reviews...they are great. Top tip..order the day before and they will make mini ones that are the perfect finger dessert.

3.description: In a part of town that is littered with fast food places, dusty dives, Italian cafes and Polish buffets it is refreshing to find a cozy middle eastern restaurant to remind your taste buds that they are still alive.If you make an abstraction of the eclectic decor and are lucky to be served by the owner and chef, rather than by a less flattering and borderline senile waitress, you are in for a treat. The food is excellent and plentiful and there is no shortage of choices on the menu. I've had the lamb and chicken kebabs and the filet mignon kebabs, which were succulent and done just right. The humus and the baba-ganoush were also delicious. It is still a new place, where the owners are testing the waters of the restaurant business, but with a few changes I'm sure they will pull through and solidify a much needed oasis of taste in the area.

1.description: I stopped in here on a Wednesday night with my parents and we were the only customers.  We were greeted by an older woman who was the only one there except for a cook in the back.  She took awhile to come take our drink order, but when she finally did, my Ali Baba Margarita turned out to be pretty good.Our appetizer was fried feta cheese over vegetables, and it was AMAZING.  Next was the soup/salad course, and my cream of potato soup was really nice.  For the main course I had beef and chicken kebabs which were cooked to absolute perfection. The vegetables were great too.The food was very reasonably priced and there was a lot of it.  The three of us were so stuffed we didn't have room for dessert, and the final bill was barely over $40 with an Entertainment coupon, and would've been under $50 even without it.The decor was nice and really interesting, and though our server wasn't fast she was very friendly.  She told us that they have live music on Friday and Saturday nights, and let my mother (who uses a walker to get around) know that she can park in the back next time since it's more convenient.  There's not any street parking so we had to park around the corner about half a block away, but the next time (and there will be a next time), we will park in back as we were offered.This place has delicious food, great atmosphere, and very reasonable prices.  And apparently it's the best-kept secret in the neighborhood because it should be overflowing and it wasn't.  The only thing that keeps me from giving them 5 stars is that the service was a little slow, but it was definitely worth the wait.

0.description: I've been there few times with family and friends. Delicious food, warm and cozy place for the party. The manager and owner is so friendly and great in multitasking!Can't wait to go there for another party!

2.description: I just got off the phone with someone from this restaurant in response to the review I wrote 6 days ago, about the situation I had with a delivery order one week ago.  The man went through-what was clearly rehearsed and probably written down before he called-an explanation as to why they didn't have the food I requested.  Note I say an explanation, not an apology.  Not once in this phone call did I hear an apology.  This explanation lasted about 2 minutes, which I tried to interrupt a few times with a polite "Excuse me." Finally he stopped and I asked why he was getting to me a week later, if he was so concerned about explaining the situation to me.  He once again went through his explanation, this time a little more in depth, which by this point I didn't really want to hear it.  If the guy was this concerned he should have contacted me sooner, and maybe as a reply my original review on here, and not disrupting my Saturday evening a week after I tried to place a delivery order.  I had pretty much forgotten about it, but now I'm thinking about it again.  I am also annoyed that he didn't let me say what I wanted to say: I couldn't interrupt him to ask more questions.  I thought 'the customer was always right'...and that in theory, what I had to say should have been more important to him than covering his own ass to me over the telephone.   If he was so concerned about me giving his restaurant a poor review, he should have cleared it up ON HERE so other people looking at reviews could make their own judgement.  I'm thinking that if he calls me again that's borderline harassment... I'm also wondering that since I didn't give my name or my number when I tried to place my order how he got my number.  Now I certainly will not be trying their food because their customer service sucks.

5.description: Cool little spot on Harlem just north of HIP.  Food details first and miscellaneous details after.Food:Me and my girlfriend both ordered the boneless chicken kabobs and chose salads instead of soup.  We were not disappointed.  The portions and quality greatly exceeded my expectations.  The salad was more than just a couple pieces of iceberg lettuce packaged in a tiny styrofoam container that I was accustomed to.  Some iceberg of course, but also leaf lettuce, arugula, spinach and other delicious things.  For the entree, the chicken was top notch.  Good quality, cooked just right, and it had this incredible dipping sauce.  I wish I knew more about food so I could tell you what was in it, but I can tell you it was so good I'd eat it all by itself, no chicken necessary.  We got rice with it which was a little bland and overcooked (a small part of the 4 instead of 5) but it wasn't enough to distract from the deliciousness of the chicken and that sauce.Other:I decided to try it out due to the deal and I'm glad I did.  Unfortunately, I didn't pay close enough attention to notice that the deal was for dine-in only (I carried out, they deliver as well but I live close) but the owner was cool and put the $15 credit towards my current order even though I offered to come back and dine-in some time.  At least who I assumed was the owner.  His assistant/hostess didn't know how to handle the Yelp deal I had on my phone so she called the chef out front.  Very nice guy (sorta looked like a slimmer Sacha Baron Cohen at first glance) who was pleasant enough to talk to me while taking care of the bill.  I think he has a Groupon deal going as well.  Will comment more on the ambiance/decor after my next visit, didn't pay much attention this round.The other part of giving it 4 instead of 5 was the hassle of trying to order that first time which is easily remedied if dining in.  The menu on their site was very hard to read (the reason we both went with the chicken) and the hostess/assistant that took our order on the phone was hard to understand/communicate with.I'm looking forward to dining in and trying out some of the other items on the menu my next time around and possibly upgrading the rating to a 5.

6.description: This place has the best filet mignon kabobs ever! and they delivered and were the best prices around! Delicious rice, delicious lamb kabobs, great dipping sauces, good hummus, but strong baba ghanooj, awesome cream of mushroom soup and all included in dinner plate!You cant go wrong. Friendly delivery, friendly service, great food, great prices.PS im still thinking about the filet mignon kabobs!

7.description: This little gem of a place NEEDS to get recognized! GREAT service and GREAT food! I brought my son and sister here for a Groupon dinner. It is a fusion between Mediterranean and Slavic Cuisine.We started off with an appetizer of Caspian Eggplant, which my son was a little skeptical to try but once he did, he could NOT get enough! I also had an order of Yogurt Salad come for our meal. My sister ordered the Beef and I had the chicken Koubideh. AMAZING! My chicken had great flavor! We were so full we could barely roll off our seats! But it wasn't the sluggish greasy feel, it was the OMG I had such great food and I couldn't stop eating I'm SO FULL!I'm so surprised that this place has been around 2 doors down to where I pay my rent, and I NEVER KNEW! I can't believe there weren't more people though, the prices are so reasonable and with my Groupon, EVEN BETTER! THANK YOU GROUPON!  We will DEFINITELY be back!

8.description: This restaurant is veeerrrry rarely open, and would appear to be a front for some other activity. I purchased vouchers from restaurant.com about ten months ago, and have been yet to be able to use them here. Twice I've been told that they "are hiring and will be open full time next week." They open on weekends sometimes, but it usually is a private party. Last time I went in on a Friday, there were pizzas on the table from another establishment, and it was clear it was a private function. It is a similar situation with Sandy's, another restaurant around the corner on Higgins that is never open...maybe they make too much money on the occassional birthday party.

9.description: Bad food and bad service. The place looks trashy as well. Just wasting your time and money going there.

10.description: This food was beyond amazing. I was extremely taken by the flavors in the food and how incredible it all was. Definitely would go to again!

4.description: Great  Persian and Polish food that is different and very reasonably priced. More, the people were ultra friendly and service was excellent. Loved the caucasus eggplant, baked feta and peppers, potsto pancakes and superb mushroom soup. We ate vegetarian but other diners were raving about the goulash and kebabs.The servings were large, so we had lots of leftovers and re-heated, they also tasted great. We discovered this place using YELP, when we'd just dropped someone at O'Hare. The ride back to the city, because of traffic, was going to be 90 minutes (a few days before Christmas) so we decided to grab dinner first, here. What a great find!!

58.description: Great food, and service! Had the calamari, bruschetta, some chicken dish, vegetables.  Everything was awesome!

56.description: Terrific experience/terrific food!!!!!!!  Was there on a Tuesday night, arrrived around 8:45, and they were packed. Good to see for a Tuesday night, we were told it would be a 35 minute wait, so we decided that was to long so we would try somewhere else. as we were walking out the door, the chef came out, apologized, asked if we would be interested in going to the bar for a drink and a complimentary appetizer. While we appreciated the offer, we weren't trying to get something for free, but, he insisted, so we went back in, he gave us two appetizers, and everyone on the staff, specifically the bartender, Alfonso Soriano (inside joke) was just terrific.  We had a wonderful time, and a wonderful experience. Please stop by and enjoy the experience as much as we did. Also, while your there tell Mark (chef) he certainly knows how to win clients.

29.description: Pasta D'Arte is the greatest! This restaurant is a regular for us. Everything is excellent! My wife had Veal Parmigiana (off the menu)  - a generous portion, tender and delicious. My wife's favorite. I had Capellini Pasta with shrimp. A light tasty treat which is even healthy. The bartender, Chris, is a mixologist supreme. Say hello to Mark master chef and owner of this taste of Italy. This is a destination restaurant.

42.description: Delicious food, cozy environment, and an excellent staff!  My favorite Italian restaurant on the northside. I pickup food during the weeknights, dine in for date night on weekends, girls night or with the whole big family.  Pasta D' Arte makes me a happy customer everytime. My go to apps include the grilled calamari thats so light and crispy as well as the fresh carpaccio. i am also in love with their roasted asparagus salad that has a savory balsamic glaze topped with a kick of gorgonzola. You can't go wrong with any pasta! This is truly my happy place.

23.description: This restaurant is the definition of a hidden gem! I have eaten here a few times over the years and have to say their service to my party of 20 was outstanding. Mark and Eric went above and beyond to make my daughters baptism celebration one to remember. They created a special menu, set up the courtyard dining space with favors dropped off ahead of time and had drinks ready to go as guests arrived. The food was delicious! Carpaccio was tasty, Prosciutto e Carciofi was out of this world! The dinner entrees are huge and all are delicious. Some that stand out are the Rigatoni alla Vodka,  Bucatini all'Osso di Manzo and Braciole di Carne, the sauces are true old world Italian. I highly recommend this restaurant for its welcoming feel and spectacular food!

47.description: Waiter was super funny, didn't catch his name but he was friendly. Got an extra tip for making the little one laugh and offering my mom a scotch! LOL The bread, olive oil, and parmesan cheese was good. Same with the caprese salad but how hard is it to mess those up. I ordered ricotta stuffed gnocchi's which was unappetizing. I felt sick afterwards. I didn't know it came with a cream sauce, but it was too creamy and they put too many mushrooms. I like mushrooms but in moderation, I don't want a whole plate of mushrooms. I absolutely did not like the gnocchi's, the ricotta in the middle was flavored and whatever it was, I did not like it. I was expecting plain old ricotta filled gnocchi's. Something simple, but instead I got an overload of everything. Service was excellent, but wasn't too impressed with my dish. The guys even opened the doors for us when we left. Very courteous.

8.description: HOLY YUM! This is mine and my husband's new favorite Italian spot! The food and service are unbelievable. Our go to is sharing the Caesar salad, calamari and penne with vodka sauce. We can't wait to explore the menu further!

31.description: I went in on a Saturday night w/two guests, and my reservation was not honored due to busier than normal Saturday night crowd...so we left to dine elsewhere. The next afternoon, I got a call from the owner/manager, following up on my missed reservation and wondering why we left. After explaining the situation, the owner/manager apologized, owned up to the error (a big GIANT customer service gold star!), and invited me back in for another try-with a gift certificate. I thought it was pretty neat, so my family and I went back the next week.I wasn't sure what to expect (after the botched attempt), quite honestly-but we were blown away by the excellent meals, attention to detail by our waitress, and experience in general. Super glad we tried it out, and gave the restaurant another shot. Kudos to the manager/owner for taking the time to check in with me, and inviting me back in for another meal-it was much appreciated. We cannot wait to come back, and try more of their delicious food and wine selections...including their gluten-free options (and their staff that are food-restriction friendly, too). Thanks again, Pasta D'Arte!

34.description: I can honestly say every visit gets better! Fresh homemade pastas,  great appetizers, great wines,  great beer selections. The service is excellent,  even though they are shorthanded at times, the servers still manage fantastically. The price is fair compared to other comparable Italian restaurants in the area. Can honestly say I haven't had better.

16.description: Rigatoni alla Vodka with proscuttio....Wowsa....thats tasty.I know the sauce has a ton of with cream and butter, but if your gonna use your "cheat day" you won't be disappointed.  The sauce is creamy and layered with flavor.If its not your cheat day, the Capelinni al Pomodoro is the best pasta with marinara you can imagine.If you want something hearty for that cold winter's night, order the Bucatini all"Osso di Manzo.  Its kinda savory Italian short rib pot roast(including a Flintstones sized bone) with hollow long noodles.We also like their pizzas with their thin crackery crust.The service is friendly, helpful and quick.I almost went 5 stars, but the layout of the restaurant gives me a feng shei headache.  The kitchen is in the front, the bar is in the back and the patio is heated with propane gas lamps that give off noxious fumes.  Everything seems loud and clanky.

13.description: OMG - if you wants delicious Italian diner her is the place to go. I strongly recommend you try it. The food is absolutely delicious. A true Italian awesome dish. We sat at the bar with no reservation and had the best food and time with Chris the bartender.  I give this place a five start.

11.description: Waiter was super funny, didn't catch his name but he was friendly. Got an extra tip for making the little one laugh and offering my mom a scotch! LOL The bread, olive oil, and parmesan cheese was good. Same with the caprese salad but how hard is it to mess those up. I ordered ricotta stuffed gnocchi's which was unappetizing. I felt sick afterwards. I didn't know it came with a cream sauce, but it was too creamy and they put too many mushrooms. I like mushrooms but in moderation, I don't want a whole plate of mushrooms. I absolutely did not like the gnocchi's, the ricotta in the middle was flavored and whatever it was, I did not like it. I was expecting plain old ricotta filled gnocchi's. Something simple, but instead I got an overload of everything. Service was excellent, but wasn't too impressed with my dish. The guys even opened the doors for us when we left. Very courteous.

39.description: I absolutely LOVED this place so much that I'm writing this review on the way home from dinner. My boyfriend wanted to try some place new around the area and we ended up at Pasta D'Arte. We were a little worried about the place being crowded since it was a Saturday night, but luckily they were able to seat us right away. There were 3 main things I really enjoyed:Food: The fried calamari was cooked to perfection. Just the right amount of crispy and chewy. And the spicy tomato sauce was so tasty! I ordered the Rigatoni alla Vodka which was also very good but I really loved the Pappardelle al Pesto that my boyfriend ordered. The pesto sauce was so flavorful and the large pieces of shrimp and dried cherry tomatoes really topped it off nicely. The portions were a good size too, FYI. Service: The staff was great!! Everyone was so friendly. From the host/hostess at the door, to the waitress, to the funny and entertaining bartender (I was even charmed into getting a glass of wine), the entire staff was just so nice and attentive. The chef even stopped by our table twice to see how everything was going and even asked if we needed more bread. EXCELLENT customer service. Ambiance: On top of everything I've mentioned, I think my favorite part of this place was the atmosphere. The restaurant is small and cozy but not claustrophobic feeling. I didn't realize how deep the restaurant goes back. There's even a nice little bar back there. This place definitely is a nice little, local, neighborhood gem. I think we were the only people there who were first timers. It seemed like everyone who walked in was a regular and knew the staff by name. It's not hard to see why this place has such a loyal clientele. In a nutshell, a definite must-try spot in the Jefferson Park/Gladstone Park area. I promise you'll leave full and happy!

37.description: Rigatoni alla Vodka with proscuttio....Wowsa....thats tasty.I know the sauce has a ton of with cream and butter, but if your gonna use your "cheat day" you won't be disappointed.  The sauce is creamy and layered with flavor.If its not your cheat day, the Capelinni al Pomodoro is the best pasta with marinara you can imagine.If you want something hearty for that cold winter's night, order the Bucatini all"Osso di Manzo.  Its kinda savory Italian short rib pot roast(including a Flintstones sized bone) with hollow long noodles.We also like their pizzas with their thin crackery crust.The service is friendly, helpful and quick.I almost went 5 stars, but the layout of the restaurant gives me a feng shei headache.  The kitchen is in the front, the bar is in the back and the patio is heated with propane gas lamps that give off noxious fumes.  Everything seems loud and clanky.

0.description: Still going to Pasta D'Arte, still the same great people and chef! Last time we were in we had our ongoing favorite appetizer , grilled polenta with Gorgonzola drizzled with a balsamic reduction, AMAZING! Our server was the wonderful , Kalina and as usual, fabulous service and great recommendations on what to eat! We always feel like family when we arrive and leave happy and anticipating our next visit. If you haven't yet visited this little gem, you are missing out! Located just south of Devon and on Milwalkee ( by super dog) it's also, easy to find! This is my second review because they deserve it!! Xo

38.description: Couldn't decide between 4 or 5 stars - I guess I will have to go again to decide.  Easy to miss location on Milwaukee Ave. Our Server Erik could not have been better. He was on top of everything. The food - wow - really good. I had the special - Rotolo with Black Truffle special - WOW. It was great.  The spinach on top I could have done without as it was a bit bitter - pushed that off to the side. The sauce - Oh my gosh -  made me want to lick the plate clean!Dessert spumoni - blah - try another vendor.Why not 5 stars - I was freezing in there - and I'm no tiny thing that gets cold all the time. So cold that I got a headache. There was some kind of blender thing running from the front of the kitchen that sounded like a vacuum - with the cold headache I was in pain!

51.description: By far, one of my favorite places to eat!  Very reasonable prices, comfortable atmosphere, and delicious food!  I would highly recommend it!

27.description: Not bad, not good.  Service was very good. The ambiance was nice. The bread is great.  The giardiniera was very good.  The salad was very good.  The pasta dishes are just fair.  Suggestion...more garlic, some spices and some salt.  Lastly, the prices are very high for spaghetti and meat sauce, $ 14.95.  My recommendation is $ 11.95 if that for the lack of flavor.  We will to see if things change in a while.

32.description: Love this place, never had a bad meal here! The service is top notch! My only complaint is that if you have a large party the add on the tip. We went this past Easter Sunday, my husband picked up the check for the table. Being loud and busy he wanted to pay and go. Not realizing they already added the tip he also included a 25% tip.... They guy should have know the service was good but that much of a tip... Not their fault but sometimes they do say a head of time. Lesson learned!

54.description: Came here with wife just by chance on Sunday. Not super crowded and very quiet for dinner. Might be hard to park on a busier day though. Bottom Line: The food was excellent including the wine that the waiter chose. Drinks: My wife had a glass of prosecco and I had a glass of  Chianti. Bough were chosen by the waiter and were excellent. They were not just the most expensive selection either.Bread service:  The bread was excellent, warm and soft in the middle with a crispy thin outer crust.  It was served with giardiniera, or pickled vegetables marinated in a spicy vinegar, which was a nice touch with the bread.  It was so good we asked for an extra helping to sop up the entree sauces, which we don't usually do.Entrees: For dinner the wife had the pumpkin ravioli with butter sage sauce per the waiter's recommendation. It was awesome. The sweet pumpkin flavors mixed well with the slices of parmesan and the sauce. Definitely a unique and delicious entree.  The lyrics were large. It came with a dozen ravioli. I got the seafood linguine. It was loaded with octopus clams mussels calamari and shrimp (8ct large size) that were perfectly cooked in a white wine tomato based sauce.  The pasta was perfectly al dente (just the right amount of firmness), and the tomato sauce had a slight kick, a little bit like an arrabbiata sauce with more white wine.  Very very good.Dessert: I had a cappucino, which was nice after a rich meal, and my wife had a tiramisu, which was fantastic.  The marscapone was not too sweet and had a very complex flavor and the tiramisu had a hint of zest.  Really Good.Lastly, the waiters and waitresses were all very nice.  Even the bus boys asked if the food was good.  They also offered grubhub coupons for carryout, which is cool, but I would recommend dining there.

48.description: The cream of butternut squash soup was tasty. I enjoyed the linguini aglio olio e broccoli. Service was warm and efficient, thanks Georgiana. Lunch was reasonable @ $8.95. Beautiful, little restaurant. I'll be back. Parking on side streets.

44.description: When I first stepped into this restaurant, the atmosphere was truly great. We were acknowledged right away and seated quickly. Within less than 60 seconds, our server came to greet us. The server made me and my family feel very comfortable by allowing us to take a few minutes to look at the menu, no rush. She also gave us suggestions as to what she thinks we may really like. It was a bit busy when we came in, yet I cannot complain about our service. We started off with drinks, including a delicious type of Cabernet Sauvignon (they have MANY wines to choose from). My father ordered off of the beer list, and I must say, the Menabrea Ambrata  was ordered more than just once. Great choice to go with an appetizer of brushetta. After the nice light appetizer, our food finally came. The smells were amazing!!! My father ordered a tender juicy 24 oz filet mignon with some sides, while I ordered grilled salmon. My mother ordered chicken breast sauteed in a balsamic mix. Wowwww... My mouth is watering just thinking about these dishes.I wish I can remember our server's name. She was absolutely great. She checked up on us frequently, and made sure our dishes tasted to our pleasure.While the desert menu looked delicious, none of us had room to eat anymore. Next time I come back, I will be sure to try one of their yummy looking pastries!!I can't wait to come back with my family for another dinner. I loved the people, our server, and most importantly, the food in my stomach. Bravo for impressing me; you deserve 5 stars.

24.description: One of my absolute favorite restaurants!!!! Food is amazing and the staff is always super friendly and on top of things. They took my favorite dish off the menu (gnocchi with a gorgonzola walnut sauce) but never hesitate to make it for me if I ask - which I am so grateful for because it is my all-time favorite pasta dish!! Everything I have tried is fresh and delicious. I will be a forever customer!!

7.description: Simply amazing! Very beautiful atmosphere, extremely polite and nice servers. The food was great, and cooked exactly to order. The menu has items for all tastes and ages. Our kids loved it. Will for sure come back!!

49.description: I just enjoyed the best birthday lunch at this restaurant.   I am vegan and they were able to accomodate my restrictions deliciously! !  My whole.group loved the food.  We will be back for sure.   I would also.like to mention that our server Chris made our afternoon so fun.  What a great personality and his attention to detail was phenomenal.   Thanks for making my birthday afternoon. special!

40.description: Me and my sister were craving Italian food and decided to try here based on their reviews. And I can't say that I regret it. Firstly, there is free valet parking. At least for the time that I went. The inside is a bit clustered... but there are 3 different rooms. One that's formal but generally where everyone sits, one that's more quiet and romantic with dim lighting and candles and there appears to be a bar towards the back past time bathrooms. They gave bread, vegetables, olive oil and parmasen free to start off with. It was.. Interesting. The pasta was really good. I ordered the Sacchettina bolognese. I thought it was really good. Big serving. I could only finish about half. For dessert I ordered one of the specials. It was a chocolate mousse cake. It was good, but overwhelmingly rich. Very difficult to finish. Overall it was good. It seems nice for a romantic evening. It's a very cozy place!

53.description: I nearly don't want to write this review because this is gem and I'm not sure I want to share.  However, this place deserves the positive feedback.The owner is also the chef-whenever we visit, he-himself-is in the kitchen cooking. It's unusual for restaurant owners. He clearly takes so much pride in his own recipes, he cooks them himself.  The staff are all veterans. People seem to work there for the long term. They get to know the restaurant, food, and customers very well.  The cocktails are poured well-no short pours here.  The wine selection is good and at a fair price. The food ingredients are very fresh and the flavor of the food is excellent.  The meat dishes are notably very good.  It's all a matter of personal taste-but try the Pollo Basalmico.  It's a take on Chicken Vesuvio but the twist is that it's with balsamic.  Excellent. The potatoes are also excellent and cooked very well-slightly crisp around the edges but otherwise soft and taste great.Great for a quick weeknight out. More casual on weeknights than weekends.

30.description: You come here for the food, not the visuals as it is a narrow and long restaurant with low ceilings.The pastas are very fresh as is the fish.The bucatini with beef ragu however had a strong leftover flavor that was undeniable.The beef purses (sacchetini bolognese) was very good with thin pasta sheets and a rich meat sauce.Linguini fruti di mare was full of seafood and mildly spicy as requested.Sea bass was amazingly fresh and perfectly cooked.The bread service is warm and fresh and the servers are very friendly.

46.description: Went here for the first time last night. The restaurant itself is very cute. The host was also friendly and nice. The first valet was surly, but the valet as we were leaving was very nice.  Our waiter was also nice but he would disappear for long periods of time.  It was busy, but not crazy.  We asked for the dessert menu and 10 minutes later he shows up at the table without it.  We just asked for the check. The food was fine, but extremely overpriced.  I got the walleye, which was tasty, but $27.  I don't think it was worthy of that price.  My husband got a chicken dish which he said was good, but again pricey.  The cocktails were delicious.  Overall the food is fine, but if you want to spend this kind of money, do yourself a favor and go to Sabatino's on Irving Park Rd.

1.description: We went here recently to celebrate my brothers new job which was somewhat busy due to couples celebrating Valentine's day early...seating options felt cramped since tables were not to distant from each other, and lighting was very limited so considering it was our first time here it kinda took away from the visual appreciation of my food. Our table was set off on the section which was an extension of the building so the warmth of our area relied on a space heater which fluctuated up and down automatically...Of the different dishes we ordered and the ones recommended by our waitress, I liked the  Bucatini all'osso di manzo and Caesar salad. I found the wait time somewhat unreasonable considering some other tables got there orders way before us who came there about 15-20 mins earlier...I would say this may be an experience and  more intimate setting for couples and not for a table of 4-5 persons. Price seemed abit pricey but portion was generous and food tasted alright.

55.description: We have ate here 4 times and it has been outstanding on every visit.  We love this place so much that we've decided to do our rehearsal dinner with them and cant wait for that feast!  Their service, prices and food are all spot on and we leave every time feeling like gorged pigs. Food Highlights:-Amazing pumpkin ravioli (balsamic sauce is incredible)-Chicken parm has tons of flavor-Arrabiata was perfectly spiced and flavorful-Their special rotating gelatos are amazing.  we had a double chocolate that blew our minds-Every dish that we've ordered to date has been a winner!

9.description: Went here for lunch with co-workers. Right off the bat loved the ambiance of the place. Service was friendly, prompt and attentive. I ordered the pumpkin pasta which did not disappoint. Everything tasted fresh and well made. I will certainly be back to do dinner here.

26.description: Ok went back tonight to see if my excitement was  verified and I am just as enthusiastic. A don't miss joint. If you want Italian on north end lock this place in.

25.description: I've been going to Pasta D'Arte for about eight years or more, and it is one of my "go to" restaurants. Mark Giannini is fantastic as owner and a classically-trained Italian chef, coming from a multi-generational family of restaurateurs. I am delighted when he roams the dining area, going from table to table to make sure the food is good and that patrons are enjoying themselves. When was the last time you were in a business that did that?Having been to Italy, the dining room reminds me of the small, out-of-the-way basement trattorias in Florence, which I find charming. However, on a packed night, some folks might find themselves uncomfortable, as you might be bumping elbows with other diners. The staff is generally attentive, with one particular server having a delicious sense of humor. My father was a stern, humorless German, and this guy had him chuckling. He knew how to work a crowd. (Sorry, can't remember his name).Please allow me to make a qualified statement: The food here is close to exceptional. However, like it or not, hot fat tastes good. I don't mean this in a derogatory sense; rather, I am simply stating the obvious. Good Italian cooking can be high in calories and carbs. I believe militant vegans or vegetarians will find it hard to find something to their liking here (they may have veggie/vegan dishes here, but I've never tried them). The pasta dishes with cream sauces can be very rich. They're generally made with actual cream and butter. Personally, I'm often in the mood for just such a dish, but some folks might find it a turn-off. I've had the Raviola di Zucca (pumpkin ravioli) with both the creamy balsamic sauce and the butter-sage and parmesan sauce at different times. Both are superb (one of their more consistent dishes), though one sauce definitely has a sweeter bent (sorry, can't remeber which one). On a recent visit, my daughter had the Rigatoni alla Vodka and mom had the Lasagna Bolognese. Both were excellent.On the SPECIALS menu, try the Branzino alla Griglia (Chilean sea bass), another of their excellent, consistent dishes, as I've had it several times. It's difficult to get good fish right, as most restaurants under- or over-cook it. I've never been disappointed with this dish. Also, if you're a seafood fan, PA makes a dish called Linguini del Mare full of mussels, shrimp, scallops, fresh fish and calamari. Dad had this often and was never disappointed.Also, try the calamari appetizer. Very good. The red house wine (chianti) is more than adequate.I can't speak to their desserts, as we're quite stuffed by the end of our meals.

12.description: I absolutely love this place, it's a hidden gem! THe food is amazing, clean and authentic. Their pasta is homemade and they always have specials to mix it up, I have never had anything on the menu that I didn't enjoy. This is a great date spot, family dinner or girls night out spot when your trying to stay in the neighborhood. 2 thumbs up to the management and their hospitality and always being so welcoming and friendly. Yummmmyyy!!!!!!!!!

59.description: My husband and I discovered this gem by accident and we were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful food and great atmosphere. Support local business and this one won't disappoint! Just wish they got their canoli from Conca D'Oro in Edison park!

21.description: Went here for lunch with co-workers. Right off the bat loved the ambiance of the place. Service was friendly, prompt and attentive. I ordered the pumpkin pasta which did not disappoint. Everything tasted fresh and well made. I will certainly be back to do dinner here.

17.description: After recently moving to the area, my boyfriend and I decided to have a late lunch. I can't remember a time where I enjoyed pasta this much! The place felt homey, service was excellent, and the food was incredibly fresh. This is a hidden gem and I'm so happy we live nearby. They don't have a specific gluten free menu, but can accommodate and make modifications.

10.description: The food here is really good, it reminds of eating a home cooked meal.  And as a bonus they do serve whole wheat penne upon request.  I will definitely be returning!

5.description: Yep, just like I said...this guy Mark can cook for me anytime. Tonight, mussels arrabbiata - great! Lobster Risotto - better than great. Service - solid. What can I say, I'm coming back.

3.description: This place really is as good as it gets. I have never had anything less than a great meal here. The service has always been fantastic and the atmosphere makes you feel very comfortable and totally at home. I would recommend this place to anyone.

35.description: BUONISSIMIOOOOOO!!Having lived in Italy I'm always very particular about Italian restaurants.Many claim to be authentic but none of them are comparable to this place!!The food is beyond incredible!!!The atmosphere very very Italian!!!If you are looking for a truly authentic Italian restaurant this is the place to go -- you will not be disappointed!!!!!I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone who truly wants to try try Italian food!!Complimenti e Grazie Mille!!!!

19.description: Couldn't decide between 4 or 5 stars - I guess I will have to go again to decide.  Easy to miss location on Milwaukee Ave. Our Server Erik could not have been better. He was on top of everything. The food - wow - really good. I had the special - Rotolo with Black Truffle special - WOW. It was great.  The spinach on top I could have done without as it was a bit bitter - pushed that off to the side. The sauce - Oh my gosh -  made me want to lick the plate clean!Dessert spumoni - blah - try another vendor.Why not 5 stars - I was freezing in there - and I'm no tiny thing that gets cold all the time. So cold that I got a headache. There was some kind of blender thing running from the front of the kitchen that sounded like a vacuum - with the cold headache I was in pain!

28.description: Tip top. Best Italian food I've had outside of Italy. Service is good. Menu changes frequently so there's always new stuff to try.

45.description: Awesome real Italian food at great "cozy" dining room! Service is fast and efficient and the staff seems genuinely glad you are there. Italian Cioppino one of the best I ever have! If you like Italian food and seafood this is the place to go- you won't be disappointed.

33.description: Fantastic food, great service!  A must visit for foodies.Its is a relaxed atmosphere, and the food they put out is top-notch.  The Chef/Owner, Mark is creative and skilled and every dish is praise worthy.  We just had Easter Brunch at Pasta D'Arte and my entire family from Grandma to the Toddler Twins had a great time and loved the food!My Recommendations:  Mark does seafood very well and I always enjoy the Octopus, Mussels, and for an entree, the Sea Bass is wonderful.  If you are a meat eater, the Lamb was excellent, but their steaks never disappoint.  Pastas....  I crave the gnocchi!  Its light and pillowy and they stuff it with red peppers or, as I had last, time ricotta cheese and jalapeno.  Just the right amount of spice.  Awesome!!!If you do go (and you should), ask the server or Mark for dinner/wine suggestions.  He introduced us to Ripasso Wines, which have become a mainstay in our little wine cellar!  Enormous Big Red wines at a budget friendly price.

43.description: Good food - great service. Just about everything I tasted was excellent so far and I have no complaints.

2.description: 3.5 - 4 stars restaurant. Good to excellent tasting pastas here. Fresh made pastas and sauces. Nice variety on the menu. Desserts are good too. Homey atmosphere, friendly service, and relaxed ambience. Good for family night out as well as date night. Definitely worth going here if you haven't before. Highly recommended.

18.description: I always receive great service and food here.   It is a beautiful restaurant. You can sit inside, in a courtyard, at the bar or outside. You can even bring your dog if you plan to eat outside and they will bring your dog water.  The wine selection is fabulous and the servers are well educated. The food is always fresh and very authentic. Definitely one of my favorite pasta joints.

41.description: Of all the many Italian restaurants in the Chicago area Pasta D'Arte is the best. The menu is versatile and extremely fresh. The specials are a must try because they are all excellent. Chef Marc uses only the best ingredients and pairs everything perfectly from pasta to meat to seabass to tuna. If I feel like eating vegetarian it's no problem, they are always accommodating my modifications. There's a full bar with a great wine selection. I prefer eating in the bar for great conversation. Now for the staff, what welcoming people. They must all love working here because I always see the same faces for years now. Everyone here is extremely knowledgeable and professional.The atmosphere is intimate since the restaurant is fairly small and tucked away nicely. Also there is plenty of street parking when it  isn't a day where there's valet service.

52.description: On a suggestion, my wife and I met 3 friends from high school here. It was a small quaint loud happy place. We started in the small bar where the bar tender was great. She had a great energy and nice smile. Once we were seated, our waiter Chris ran down the options with a sense of fun. We got three appetizers, all good. One was beef carpaccio, some mozzarella ball with a soft core, and I can't remember but it wad good. I had duck canneloni and it was good. This a preference if mine but a little less meat and one more tube and cheese. That's me. My wife enjoyed her pumpkin ravioli in a balsamic glaze. We shared deserts and they were great. We wound up closing it down. It was a great time. I wish I could do half stars because it wad near perfect. The only two complaints were the AC dripped on table and heads and it was a touch slow serve.

50.description: The Sacchettini bolognese is to die for!  The manager is always attentive and gracious every time we go. We recently went for the Calabrian dinner and wine pairing event and it was excellent! We received extraordinary service, superb food, and excellent wine!  Chef Mark even came out to greet us after dinner, it was a nice touch that not many chefs take the time to do. Can't wait to return!

4.description: Top Notch Service, Authentic food and great spirits what more can one ask for!!!Neighborhood place with a downtown feel!

6.description: You come here for the food, not the visuals as it is a narrow and long restaurant with low ceilings.The pastas are very fresh as is the fish.The bucatini with beef ragu however had a strong leftover flavor that was undeniable.The beef purses (sacchetini bolognese) was very good with thin pasta sheets and a rich meat sauce.Linguini fruti di mare was full of seafood and mildly spicy as requested.Sea bass was amazingly fresh and perfectly cooked.The bread service is warm and fresh and the servers are very friendly.

22.description: We went here on my sister in law recommendation. It was delicious ! The service and food was top notch. We let our server pick our appetizer and main course. Artichoke prosciutto Parmesan followed by a wonderful Seabass and shrimp Diablo ravioli. So very tasty. Great wine. Overall impression a+. Will go back for sure. Close to home and just as good as any high end restaurant downtown.

15.description: I absolutely LOVED this place so much that I'm writing this review on the way home from dinner. My boyfriend wanted to try some place new around the area and we ended up at Pasta D'Arte. We were a little worried about the place being crowded since it was a Saturday night, but luckily they were able to seat us right away. There were 3 main things I really enjoyed:Food: The fried calamari was cooked to perfection. Just the right amount of crispy and chewy. And the spicy tomato sauce was so tasty! I ordered the Rigatoni alla Vodka which was also very good but I really loved the Pappardelle al Pesto that my boyfriend ordered. The pesto sauce was so flavorful and the large pieces of shrimp and dried cherry tomatoes really topped it off nicely. The portions were a good size too, FYI. Service: The staff was great!! Everyone was so friendly. From the host/hostess at the door, to the waitress, to the funny and entertaining bartender (I was even charmed into getting a glass of wine), the entire staff was just so nice and attentive. The chef even stopped by our table twice to see how everything was going and even asked if we needed more bread. EXCELLENT customer service. Ambiance: On top of everything I've mentioned, I think my favorite part of this place was the atmosphere. The restaurant is small and cozy but not claustrophobic feeling. I didn't realize how deep the restaurant goes back. There's even a nice little bar back there. This place definitely is a nice little, local, neighborhood gem. I think we were the only people there who were first timers. It seemed like everyone who walked in was a regular and knew the staff by name. It's not hard to see why this place has such a loyal clientele. In a nutshell, a definite must-try spot in the Jefferson Park/Gladstone Park area. I promise you'll leave full and happy!

57.description: We were taken to this Michelin recommended restaurant for dinner by friends...We loved it! This restaurant is small and intimate. It feels cozy! After being promptly seated our waitress brought us a basket of fresh baked Italian bread and olive oil and a dish of freshly grated Parmesan cheese, not the cheap stuff! She also brought a small dish of giardiniera (Italian pickled vegetables)...I was liking this place more and more!All four of us ordered something different. I started with a house green salad. Mixed greens were piled up in the center of the plate and around the perimeter of this green leafy stack were arranged sliced cucumbers, green peppers and cherry tomatoes. Long, thin curly cues of shaved carrots topped it all. I ordered it without dressing so I could drizzle olive oil and balsamic vinegar myself, then dusted it with the grated Parmesan cheese.I ordered the one of the specials: Ravioli Di Asparagi. This homemade ravioli was filled with asparagus and ricotta, served in a roasted chicken demiglace sauce with chunks of zucchini, butternut squash, and sun-dried tomato, and topped with shaved grans padano. It was light and flavorful. It was excellent! The portions were large, but I did save room for desert. We tried a trio of their special deserts: Homemade flan (I didn't know Italians did flan?), chocolate mousse cake topped with pistachio gelato and homemade tiramisu. We loved them all!Our waitress was friendly, attentive, efficient and professional. We never felt rushed and had plenty of time to enjoy our meal and conversation with our friends.We look forward to returning to here for another great meal on our next visit to Chicago!

20.description: I was treating myself to lunch and was craving Italian. This restaurant was exactly what I was looking for. Firstly, good food, secondly, not over priced and thirdly ambiance and service....superb. I was the only one there at 12:30. I hope they get more business.

36.description: Been here a few times, always good food & great service! Tried the Gnocchi for the first time......AWESOME!!!!  Eric is always great & Chris is a laugh a minute!

14.description: We had dinner there last night and all of us enjoyed our meals.  Friendly wait staff, huge portions of excellent food. Next time we go there I think my husband and I will order an appetizer and spilt a meal.

58.description: The food is way over priced, and the place isn't worth the hype. The food is t anything special

56.description: The best hot dogs around! Great authentic not staged vintage drive-in. The other items are excellent but the Superdawgs are the best!

29.description: Supercheesie - 3/5Superfries - 3.5/5Parking - 5/5Service - 4/5

42.description: Tasty thick roll of meat makes One happy man! Glow in the dark Relish makes the mustard , boy! Red Hot Dog, Poppy seed bun- jell yeah.

23.description: What year is it? 1950? Wait what, 2016? Well you wouldn't know that coming here. It was a fun blast from the past but more than a gimmick. They could serve the food from a posh food truck in Wicker if they wanted to and it would still be delicious, but thank god they don't. The 50's drive experience is so much more fun.

47.description: Love Chicago hot dogs.. This place is great. Dog had a good snap and was tasty all the way around.. Best part of the deal was the pickled tomato and hot peppers.. They where great.. Fun place

8.description: Like my last visit, the Superdawg and Supercheesie--plus that money chocolate shake--are still on point.  But this weekend, I came back with a Groupon and tried a couple of other items, plus I got french fries that weren't burn victims like they were on my last run.  If you stick to dogs--sorry, "dawgs"--burgers, fries, shakes, you'll be fine...but skip the grilled cheese at all costs.  It was so bad that I'm simply going to forget that it happened on my recent visit and stick to what I will be ordering each and every time out moving forward.  (I also noted that of the half-dozen patrons in front of me this past trip, ALL of them only ordered Superdawgs and sodas; this has to be a sign.)Stick to the basics, people!

31.description: Bring your own Ketchup, if you dare.Great Polish and fries.

34.description: I like the decor food and certainly the super cool attending staff. It is tremendously fun as it is so different from other dining joints. I like the location being that you have the forest nearby and the avenues taking you to the shops after being content with the fabulous eats.

16.description: Right by the house and a quick walk to the woods. All ways a good summer event. Will be back again and again and again. I always love to get A shake. Thank you Superdog!

13.description: The Mexican taking orders on the inside asked me if I wanted "rilled" onions on my whooperchesie. Yeah, this place has character, right down to the silly ass names of their menu items. The focal point is obviously the hot dog, but I've never had it before and probably never will because the burgers and polish are too good to pass up. I'm not the biggest hot dog fan anyway. This is a very inconsequential review for a place that already has a billion reviews, but I don't care because suck it.

11.description: Hotdogs & fries...as good as it gets! Love the pickled green tomato, super crispy fries. I recommend getting a char-grilled dog (will take approx 10-15 min to cook). This may make traditionalists cringe, but I put ketchup on my hot dog so I am glad they provide it.

39.description: I like superdawg. I like parking and eating. Or walking up for the food and still sitting in the car and eating. And I like the awesome hotdogs and crinkly fries. This location is fun and the original, but I also like the other location that has a sit down area.

37.description: Good quality food, a really cool treat for small children.  Something that I noticed was that the prices are rather high for burgers, none the less it was a nice environment and a cool experience because you order through little speakers and it's old school.

0.description: I meannnnn, it's SuperDawg-let's just be honest here; if you have nothing good to say about this place, you're doing it all types of wrong. This is a childhood favorite and I love taking friends who have yet to be here or who also share the same nostalgia. If you're a first timer, you have to try the superdawg no ifs ands or butts about it. I would also recommend the supercheesie if you're more in the mood for a burger but above all I say stick with the dog. Absolutely no ketchup-classic Chicago styled dog. It comes with the most perfectly crunchy pickle and crinkle fries which are salted so perfectly.Now here's the key: I would not only recommend the superdawg but also an order of their onion chips which are literally onion rings just chipped shaped-mind blown I know. Above all as a sacred rule the chocolate shake with all of this is a must. There's something about all the crunchy and saltiness of the whole meal that coincides PERFECTLY with the shake. I would def hold out until that Groupon is avail 10.00 for 20.00 worth of food and you get all of the things you want for a more affordable range. Just do it-no questions asked.

38.description: You know it's good when you can tip your uber driver in a superdawg meal. So what if I maybe sometimes use food as currency, like you've never been to prison? Jk about that last part.I actually wanted Whitecastle, but when your drunk and alone in a strange city I thought that was not a good idea seeing as all the WC's are in the hood apparently.The last drive in in Chicago it's as classic as they come. Unlike the masses I went at their menu like a young Victor Frankenstein (he was the doctor, not the monster people). Superchili on superonionchips, with fresh onions on top was excellent, those onion petals were like mini chips of sweetness, though the chili was kind of mediocre. The Supersundaes I was surprised to see pineapple instead of banana and no peanut butter addition. Still good, but not really high end on the sweets menu. Superdawg is has great snap, garlic is subtle probably because the sesame seed bun and condiments made this pretty hearty. Crinkle cut fries were hot and crunchy, not soggy at all, but could use more salt. It looks amazing with nuclear green relish, red tomato, white onions, yellow mustard. NO KETCHUP, but they will give you packets. They really stick to their guns on that one. My driver also told me how to order so, thanks for Dave on that one. Get extra everything especially the pickled tomatoes.It's pretty throwback with the waitress', but they no longer wear skates. All in all it's a great place to get some classic food, the last of a dying brand. With NY losing it's hotdog identity, it's clear to see that Chicago is now too.

51.description: Hands down, the best hot dog I've ever had!!! I come here about 3 times a week and I've almost had everything on the menu. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to have the best food around.

27.description: Like my last visit, the Superdawg and Supercheesie--plus that money chocolate shake--are still on point.  But this weekend, I came back with a Groupon and tried a couple of other items, plus I got french fries that weren't burn victims like they were on my last run.  If you stick to dogs--sorry, "dawgs"--burgers, fries, shakes, you'll be fine...but skip the grilled cheese at all costs.  It was so bad that I'm simply going to forget that it happened on my recent visit and stick to what I will be ordering each and every time out moving forward.  (I also noted that of the half-dozen patrons in front of me this past trip, ALL of them only ordered Superdawgs and sodas; this has to be a sign.)Stick to the basics, people!

32.description: Love there Dawgs and actually they have great original char grilled burgers.  Love the shakes and fries.

54.description: I do not get the hype surrounding this place at all. Went with my roommate yesterday, both of us Superdawg virgins, both of us HUGE fans of Chicago-style hot dogs. The dog itself was fine, but it was completely overwhelmed by the fixings - so much so that the bun disintegrated before I completed my first bite. Fries were mushy, bland, and the cheese sauce tasted...sour? And foamy? Not good. Vanilla shake had a very synthetic flavor and was nowhere close to the "superthick" as advertised. To top it off, food was overpriced for a hot dog stand and you wait a long time for your food. There are so many better places to get a Chicago dog.

48.description: Good stuff.. Love the burgers and dogs. A little pricey but good food.

44.description: shakes are always good and so are the hotdogs!

24.description: Great stop for a nice burger or hotdog. All the food comes out super fresh and hot. The service is polite and speedy. Parking spaces are large enough so you don't need to worry about someone bumping you.

7.description: You know it's good when you can tip your uber driver in a superdawg meal. So what if I maybe sometimes use food as currency, like you've never been to prison? Jk about that last part.I actually wanted Whitecastle, but when your drunk and alone in a strange city I thought that was not a good idea seeing as all the WC's are in the hood apparently.The last drive in in Chicago it's as classic as they come.
