49.description: Food was decent... Hard to order and understand what you are getting for a first timer

40.description: One of the best hot dogs in Chicago. Good ol fashion drive in. You can either order from your car or order inside to take to go. Nothing beats an original Chicago Style Hot Dog.

53.description: Pricey for a hotdog and fries but my favorite hotdog place nonetheless. Their burgers are sooo good too! I also love the little green tomato, or whatever it is, that you get with your food. Love the crinkle fries. Malts are awesome. (Get your burger without the relish though).  Who puts relish on a burger? Onion chips are good too.

30.description: The dogs were OK.  I think this place is riding its reputation.  The dogs and burgers were OK, but not spectacular.  And for a place where you order at the counter and then carry your bags to a separate room where you eat out of the bag, the prices seemed high to me.  The wait to get the food delivered was fairly long too.Hmmm.  OK I guess but not Super.

46.description: Takes way way way to long for a hot dog that I feel is on par with a good Chicago Home Depot dog!!

1.description: We stopped in for dinner. We ordered 2 Superdawgs and a Whooperburger. My brother got everything on them since he thought that would be easier.I had to wipe pretty much everything off the Superdawg for my niece, but she ate the whole thing.I thought the Superdawg was good, but the Whooperburger had too much mustard. Fries were a bit too salty for me.I will be back to try some other items and Superdawg.They need to put something on that screen door to keep it from banging so loud.

55.description: Always a favorite!! Best hot dog I've ever had! Its a little on the pricy side for a hot dog but the food is so good that it's worth the money!!

9.description: Great experience & always buy the groupons, love the super dawg, supercheesie burger & much more!

26.description: My wife and I love Superdawg! From the keeps-it-hot box to the complimentary "healthy" veggies to the unique recipe Vienna Redhot dog, we are delighted every time we are in the area. And we even love the fries - they seem to be double-dipped to heat them up right before they go in the box. Love seeing the line each time too so you know all of the stakeholders are happy and the food is fresh. Go mid-century cool! Can't wait till next time.

25.description: I don't even like mustard but I did on the superdawg. Something about their formula is just right.

12.description: The iconic bright lights in the big ole city on a most perfect spring night made for a grand experience at the infamous Superdawg.   There's something, dare I say, magical about going to a place like Superdawg on a 70 degree night where the twinkling stars shine bright above.  It's a carefree, wonderful little hotspot that's a perfectly simplistic date night destination for you and your significant other.  You don't have to pay an obscene amount of money to enjoy yourselves on Superdawg's memory lane.  You can even be like a modern day Lady and the Tramp sharing a hotdog, fries and a malt.Superdawg's famed hotdogs are worth every penny and they definitely hold the right to be called one of the best in the Chicago land area.  You can say all day that a hotdog is a hotdog is a hotdog, but I'm pretty certain that the experience of Superdawg makes this hotdog, in particular, much more than a plain old hotdog.  On the drive towards Superdawg I was looking forward to trying the food, but once we drove into the parking lot I was transported back to the swingin' 60's of Grease.  Then I was really looking forward to the food - I think the experience of a place and the nostalgia attached to it can bias your perception of the food, but honestly, the food was yummy in my tummy.  I would give an A+ to the environment of Superdawg and an A to the food.I got the classic 'Superdawg' hotdog with fries and a chocolate malt to share with my fiancé.  Usually I get my hotdogs plains, but for the sake of experience I ordered it in its original form - it's only right.  We had to wait for a few minutes to get the food - no big deal - and then we got the food in an adorable little box.  My fiancé and I sat at a table out by the drive-in's (you can choose to order at/eat in your car or go inside to order).  Anyways, the fries are by far some of the best crinkle fries with the perfect t balance of crunchy and soft.  And the malt was perfect for hitting the spot, until of course half of it spilled on my fiancé.  The staff seemed to have been in such a hurry to when making the orders that someone didn't put the lid on the malt fully...and of course neither of us noticed.  This is definitely not something that would deter me from going, it just put a tiny bit of a damper on our experience.  The one and only complaint I have about this place is that there is no bathroom or area to clean yourselves up if an incidence such as this were to happen.  It causes more of an inconvenience than anything, but again I would not be deterred from eating here again.Definitely go to this location as opposed to the other one because this the original one.  Also, you should go at night because I'm telling you it makes for a perfect experience.  As the Beatles would say, "Baby you can drive [your] car, yes you're gonna be a star"... so go for a nice little drive-in at Superdawg and dine under the stars.

59.description: Great hot dogs, good fries, great milkshakes.  A must go if you're a Chicagoan!  Always busy but always fresh and quick.

21.description: Visiting my Mom and Brother in Chi town ate and dine here so good will make sure to come back here again

17.description: Great hot dogs for a reasonable price.The waiting was a bit long but it was worth it in the end

10.description: I used to come here all the time when I drove an ambulance, and I like how it hasn't changed in all that time (well you don't often see any of the carhops on roller skates anymore).  It's one of the best Chicago style hot dog joints, it's iconic enough that it's been in movies.  When I brought Maria here on an early date, that's when she began to fall in love with me.  It's one of the best things about Chicago.

5.description: Great stop for a nice burger or hotdog. All the food comes out super fresh and hot. The service is polite and speedy. Parking spaces are large enough so you don't need to worry about someone bumping you.

3.description: So unimpressed.  I will say this, the fries had a funny after taste.  Actually Genes and Jude's fries were so much better just to let you know.Also the superdawg was like a store bought jumbo cheap imitation of a Vienna beef link.I will not be back.   On the bright side, I only spent $6.50 on this . Ugh, actually I could have spent half that.

35.description: I used to come here all the time when I drove an ambulance, and I like how it hasn't changed in all that time (well you don't often see any of the carhops on roller skates anymore).  It's one of the best Chicago style hot dog joints, it's iconic enough that it's been in movies.  When I brought Maria here on an early date, that's when she began to fall in love with me.  It's one of the best things about Chicago.

19.description: Chicago Favorite, but I've Had BetterPros:Iconic Facade Drive Up OrderingOld School CultureSuperdawg OriginalCons:Awkward Service Whoopski Dog (Hungarian Sausage)Soggy FriesSadly I was expecting so much more.  I watched the hype and you would think that the dog and fries would be spot on.  Superdawg is a car hop setup where you order through a speaker.  The service is a little slow and paying the bill is more painful.  The Superdawg original is a pretty good hot dog, it comes in a cardboard box with fries and hot peppers.  The fries crinkle cut were pretty weak, soggy.The worst part of the meal was the sausage, it just had a weird taste that was unappealing.  Overall:Not my favorite dog, but we wanted to cross it off the bucket list.  It's a cool old place that I give an extra star to for nostalgia alone.  There are far better places to get hot dogs in the Chicago area.  Thanks

28.description: If I had 24 hours to live, I'd stop at Superdawg for lunch.  I've been eating here since the 1970s and there is nothing like it.  I know part of my love for the place is based in nostalgia, but my rating is objectively based.  The ambiance is fun, a snapshot of a bygone era.  The food is high quality, consistent, and delicious.  I'll usually give my regular restaurants a little leeway when they mess up, but I have never had a bad meal at Superdawg.  The day it closes is the day I leave this city forever.

45.description: I've been coming here for ever great hot dogs I love there french fries they have yummy burgers to

33.description: Love this place. It's a Chicago icon! It's a great place to grab a hit dog and get the real life drive up experience or you can order inside. The menu is small but they have all the essentials.

43.description: Man, I just love this place. From the old school feel to the sold superdawg with their green tomatoes. I'm also a huge fan of their onion chips... They're like onion rings but infinitely more dippable. If you want a classic Chicago style hot dog its hard to beat what superdawg provides in my opinion.

2.description: Used to love the place as a kid - it has gone downhill. And that's a shame. Crinkle cut fries rock. The Hot dog is average. But it is cool to eat in your car with the Drive In Nostaglia.

18.description: 1 "SuperChic" Grilled Chicken Sammy (w/fries)1 Choco Shake1 Pineapple Sundae= $17. Thankfully my buddy had an old $10 Groupon.The guys who took + made our orders were friendly. It took a while - maybe nobody really orders chicken?The sundae had vanilla ice cream, pineapple chunks, those creme-filled cookie wafers you had as a kid, whipped cream, and a cherry. Yum. The Choco shake was kind of underwhelming and plain. I'll have to come back and get a hotdog and try those veggies..

41.description: You can never go wrong with a hot dog from her, obviously. But I can never come here without leaving with a delicious chocolate malt!

52.description: I come here for the food like everyone else.  Everyone has their favorite place for hotdogs.  Ours is Superdawg.  Quality is consistent and it can get busy during peak times.  They screwed up my order for the first time ever today and of course, the African-American woman (Janice) made me feel as if I was at fault for asking for a soda that I never did order. After paying and she hands me my food order.  I asked her about the medium rootbeer, to which she retorted that I did not order any drink. The only reason I identified her racially is because the rest of the staff is predominantly hispanic and waitstaff is caucasian.  Since I was holding my son at the time, I was not able to check my receipt.  Later that night, I noticed that not only did I had asked for a soda while ordering, I also got charged for it. Yup it showed up on my receipt  Will I come back? Yes.  Will I be more vigilant, Yes I will.  Thanks Janice for the warm customer service.  There were a few newcomers behind me in line and of course you were equally cordial and patient to them as well.  I am sure Maurie Berman is looking down, thinking to herself, this is not what I wanted to leave as a legacy.   This was not part of the horse and pony show like say, Ed Debevics.  Janice simply had a piss poor attitude with little to no patience for awaiting customers.

50.description: My fiancé grew up around this place I never heard of it before he took me there. The whooper cheesie is to die for the superdawg is amazing and the shakes need to be consumed with a spoon but are also off the hook as the kids say

4.description: I hate hot dogs. I honestly can't stand them, but I feel so unpatriotic when I don't participate in the ceremonious eating of mystery meat-filled poop tubes on certain holidays. Plus, you kind of offend people when they offer you food and your nostrils flare back to the heavens. This is why I make a point of letting everyone know I do not care for hot dogs.My coworkers remembered this about me when they said they were going to Superdawg for a late dinner. I wasn't intrigued one bit, but when they offered to drive me somewhere else, I felt horrible. So, I bent and went with them. The place is like neon lights central and pretty welcoming. We parked the car and walked inside. It immediately felt like a hot dog joint that I grew up next to in Connecticut. I mean, they have to have more than hot dogs on the menu, right?And they did! I ordered a Superfish with fries and guess what? A SUPERDAWG. I know, but I was in Chicago. Who visits Chicago and doesn't have some variation of the dog and a deep dish? Come on now.I ate the fish right up. It was pleasantly delicious and fried just right. The fish didn't even taste frozen and I knew it had to have been. The fries were alright, too. Everything came together nicely... and then I set my sights on the Superdawg.Now, I've never had a Chicago dog before and I had no idea what to expect. Peppers? Neon green relish? A pickled green tomato? What? I was ecstatic! I really wanted to get into the veggies, but I couldn't do that to the hot dog (considering the money I paid). Took one bit, felt the snap of the hot dog, and sat it down. Nope.But I did eat the toppings and the bun! The pickled tomato was delicious! And the peppers! Yum yum! It was basically like eating a salad with soggy croutons - my fave! /s $5.75 plus tax for a hot dog I didn't really eat? Meh. It was totally my fault. Everyone else really liked it, so we went back two days later. I ordered a Whoopercheesie and devoured that like I hadn't eaten in days. It was a great experience.

6.description: The dogs were OK.  I think this place is riding its reputation.  The dogs and burgers were OK, but not spectacular.  And for a place where you order at the counter and then carry your bags to a separate room where you eat out of the bag, the prices seemed high to me.  The wait to get the food delivered was fairly long too.Hmmm.  OK I guess but not Super.

22.description: Always a great choice. Food is great, quick service. Throw in the $10 for $20 groupon how can you go wrong?

15.description: My favorite hotdog in the world. Today I drove my 3 friends to Anime Central in Rosemont and we had a Sunday late morning pitstop at Superdawg.It was my first anime convention and he first time eating at Superdawg for Ramon and Gabriel.Ramon had a Super Chick and loves the BBQ sauce. His big little brother Alfredo had a Whoopsie Cheese and immediately craved another. Gabriel had a Superfish.Alfredo remarked how cool it was that Superdawg has been continuously operated by Maurie and Flaurie and their family since just after World War 2.Having a Superdawg on a beautiful Sunday in May is like a spiritual experience for me!In the afternoon we heard the news: Maurie, founder of Superdawg, passed away this morning.  He was 89. Thank you Maurie for the world's best hotdog. My pure beef heart goes out to your wife Flaurie and the family.

57.description: The Mexican taking orders on the inside asked me if I wanted "rilled" onions on my whooperchesie. Yeah, this place has character, right down to the silly ass names of their menu items. The focal point is obviously the hot dog, but I've never had it before and probably never will because the burgers and polish are too good to pass up. I'm not the biggest hot dog fan anyway. This is a very inconsequential review for a place that already has a billion reviews, but I don't care because suck it.

Plus, you kind of offend people when they offer you food and your nostrils flare back to the heavens. Come on now.I ate the fish right up. It was pleasantly delicious and fried just right. The fish didn't even taste frozen and I knew it had to have been. The fries were alright, too. A pickled green tomato? What? I was ecstatic! I really wanted to get into the veggies, but I couldn't do that to the hot dog (considering the money I paid). Took one bit, felt the snap of the hot dog, and sat it down. Nope.But I did eat the toppings and the bun! The pickled tomato was delicious! And the peppers! Yum yum! It was basically like eating a salad with soggy croutons - my fave! /s $5.75 plus tax for a hot dog I didn't really eat? Meh. It was totally my fault. Everyone else really liked it, so we went back two days later. I ordered a Whoopercheesie and devoured that like I hadn't eaten in days. It was a great experience.

36.description: Gotta love the dogs at SuperDawg! The tomatillos are a fun add, and I don't know other places that serve them amongst the burgers or hot dogs and fries. Love bringing the kids and having a dashboard dinner. Chicago gem!

14.description: This was awesome. My first time here and I was confused with how to order,  but they weren't rude about it.  Food came out fast and super delicious. Next time I'm here, I may just have to stop in more than once.

58.description: First time at this location.  Same solid food as the other location.  As have been mentioned the strawberry perogies are really good.  I had a sampling stuffed cabbage, herring, polish sausage, perogies,  All the food was top notch.  So I came I saw and I ate.  I fought the good fight and really did enjoy getting my Polish on.  Since I am not Polish it takes some time.

56.description: Went to Red Apple Buffet for a Sunday lunch with my boyfriend and friend. The service here was very good. Our waitress was very nice, good with refills and quick to clear the dirty dishes. The buffet had lots of selections and everything was very fresh. I really enjoyed the homemade potato pancakes and mashed potatoes. There was also a big selection of other great Polish dishes including Polish sausage, Porgies, roast and chicken. The food on the buffet was always stocked and fresh. One of the better buffets I have been to for this reason. Over all the food here was very good. Only problem was I left extremely stuffed :) Over all very satisfied here and will go back.

29.description: I come here often and I feel it's the best food for the money.  The soups are the best.  From all the different types of restaurants I have been to, this is my favorite for sure.

42.description: Made a second visit during a trip to the side, I should of kept driving.  Maybe my first visit a couple of years ago was fluke and things have changed.  We were seated fairly quickly and the waitress came over to start things out.  She kept pushing glasses of water and soup, nothing like filling up on water and not on solid food.My biggest complaint is that food is painfully bland and lacking any taste.  I had to add salt and pepper to everything to get some taste out of the food.  Judging by the other people there they keep the food bland for the older crowd that eats there.  Also the selection of items was not all that great as I remember.  No meat pierogis, no cheese pierogis, no dumplings...I will give a thumbs up to our waitress, she did keep the table clear of dirty dishes and keep the (bad tasting) soda refills coming.As much as mock people who complain that restaurants don't take credit or debit cards for a simple cup of coffee, carry a few bucks in your pocket!  But when a restaurant charges (drink and meal) twenty bucks per person, take the cards.  As someone else posted about there little sign at the cash register, you need a Rosetta Stone to figure it out.  Luck someone in our group had enough cash on them to pay for dinner.  Also the cashier disappeared for long periods of time, leaving customers waiting to pay and get out of there.

23.description: My family has been coming here since it opened. I have a friend who says this is the closest to his mothers cooking. We love it. It's authentic. The food is great. The service is friendly. The atmosphere is welcoming. Try this place if you want good Polish food. Bring cash! They don't accept credit cards.

47.description: This place is our go to place for polish food.  My only "concern" is the price she charges on "holidays/special dates".  On Father's Day she wanted an extra $10 / PER PERSON on top of their regular price (weekend price is already more).  I paid the extra price on Easter and almost passed out when I got the bill for three people and it was $75!  On Father's day we didn't even enter the place when I saw the sign on the front door - and won't go on a special occasion dates from now on (lesson learned).  I'll keep to normal weekdays and enjoy this place.

8.description: Pricing keeps me out of the I'm a fan four star rating, the last time I was here the prices were less, maybe it's been some time since my last visit, and now it will be in the who knows when we'll be back. They're at 15.99 during the week and 19.99 for the weekend. For a Polish buffet that is getting on the high side, considering I'm not one to load up on tons of food looking to get my monies worth, I may like eating stuffed cabbage, but I don't like feeling like one. Or worst yet being called a pig in a blanket, the other name for this entree.Pricing aside, the food is very good and the service efficient and friendly. The servers do bring you soup (it's included) since it's not on the buffet. They also did a good job keeping up on our coffee, ice tea and water. At the end of your meal they will also bring you ice cream if you like, this is in addition to bussing your plates. The buffet is clean and the offerings kept on the small side so food is kept fresh and replaced often.So in other words the standard this is a buffet I don't need to tip doesn't apply. I was stunned to see the couple across from us leave a dollar (very well dressed, maybe something going on in their life or ?) I just have a soft spot for servers having been one, and this couple seemed to be having an enjoyable dinner. Plus the guy caught the look on my face when he dropped the buck down, he knew it just was all wrong. Despite the pricing, the servers aren't making the profit, so if you do go here, do tip if you get good service. So yes, it does come down to pricing, many places for Polish in Chicago that are just a little more reasonable.

31.description: Everything polish you want to eat plus more always a huge variety  they have beef turkey and ham that you carve yourself mmmm good plus perogis  stuffed cabbage  polish sausage lamb potato  pancakes  ribs and about 5 or so different cold saleds coleslaw potato salad  cucumber  salad  beet salad and much more they also serve alcohol  and other drinks but its CASH ONLY but you can use there ATM  for a fee

34.description: This place is the bomb for good old fashion polish cuisine. I grabbed a to go container and loaded up on my favorites:Veal stew, peirogi, Angus beef sliced to order, pork with plum in the middle, polish sausage (best I've had), etc. Filled 3 trays and was over $40.00 dollars but worth it.They only take cash and was lucky to have an extra bill in my pocket. I will be going on a regular basis to eat in and carry out. Better than their competitors in the area! A must try for the polish favorites.

16.description: I've been here a times and the food is good when it's hot and fresh.  It was not crowded last time i went and the food looked like it was there for awhile. I'll come back when it's busy.  Good food  for the price

13.description: I love the food. They have a white borsht soup that was out of this world. I had never had before.My only complaint , and this is with most buffet places, the food is not that hot.they only accept cash BUT they do have an ATM. The selection varies from weekday to weekend , but I normally stick with the regular Polish food.Was just there and can't wait to go back.

11.description: I love this place. I may not be an expert on Polish food (I'm from Ukraine) but everything tasted really good to me. The place was busy even early (around 6 pm). My favorite item was the chicken soup you get at the beginning of the meal. I would have gladly had seconds and thirds of that! The price was reasonable for me, but probably only because I'm used to River North Prices.

39.description: For a reasonably priced Polish buffet, I really don't know what else anyone else could want from the food and service. The waitress was attentive and brought us each a different Polish beer so we could try both kinds. They had terrific sauerkraut soup (yeah, I know, sounds awful but it tastes great), the cheese and potato pierogi was really good, as was the stuffed cabbage. The schnitzel, ham and fish with creamy dill sauce were really terrific, and I am not normally a fan of ham. I only tried a couple of things at the salad bar, including the beets which were very good. The desserts were also very good. The waitress came by and asked if we wanted ice cream, which made us both laugh since we had plates with way more desserts than we would normally have. Next time I will try to eat salad first and less dessert (yeah, right!) Don't go if you are expecting spicy food or fancy cuts of meat - it's just not going to happen. However, it's a good family place, especially in cold weather when soup, meat and potatoes are what you crave.

37.description: I'm not typically a fan of buffets but this is hands down the best Polish food in the city of Chicago. I'm a 3rd generation patron and this is like a reliable and beloved old friend.First off the food isn't typical buffet food that looks or tastes like it's been sitting out. The staff is constantly bringing out fresh dishes and it's never dried out. The potato pancakes, pierogis, ham and stuffed cabbage rolls are my absolute favorite and dare I say even better than my grandmother used to make. Expect over 40 dishes to choose from and the best of Polish/Eastern European cuisine. Do not even think about coming to this restaurant unless you are prepared to eat. You will walk out stuff but extremely satisfied.

0.description: There're two (2) locations of "Red Apple Buffet" in the city.  Both of them are located on N. Milwaukee Ave.  However, one is located in Logan Square; the other one is located in Norwood Park, on the corner of Milwaukee and Imlay.  Before proceeding to your enjoyment of buffet paradise, stop by an ATM first because RAB is "cash-only."  An ATM is provided onsite with $1 surcharge.  I was a semi-regular to RAB in the past.  I would splurge whenever I felt stressed out at my last job.  I could have talked to a therapist about my obstacles and difficult times.  For some reason, comforting Polish food worked better than an individual with credentials.  Don't equivocate RAB with some Super "some Asian country beneath Russia" buffet places because their buffet bars are organized, sanitary, and constantly re-stocked.  The weekday adult dinner buffet is currently $15.99/person, as of 01/18/2016.  Typically, when my stomach is in the most optimal condition, I can consume a plate of appetizers (chicken gelatins, beet salad, and herrings, if available), two (2) plates of "entree stuff" (pierogi, chicken/pork cutlets, potato pancakes, mushroom gravy, stuffed cabbage, and tilapia).I would end the meal with a small bowl of complementary ice cream (included in the dinner buffet), fruit, and perhaps kolaczki.  By the way, soup of the day is also included. I believe the choices of soup have a set rotation on a daily basis.  I noticed lots of customers picked up some buffet bar items to-go.  I believe they do it by pounds.  This RAB location offers customer parking lot in the back on Imlay.  The spaces are tight, so drive with caution.  If you're still able to handle public transportation after this buffet feast (more power to you), the northbound terminal stop for CTA #86 (Narragansett/Nagle) is directly across from RAB.  Otherwise, PACE #270 has a stop nearby.

38.description: Great polish food buffet.  Watch out - cash only.  Great service.  They charge groups of 8 or more a 15% gratuity for buffet service.  My large party was sat in a large party dining room - it was a nice touch.Crowd favorites were strawberry pierogi and potato pancakes.

51.description: The place sucks. The food is way below par, but very high priced. They only accept cash which makes it even more unbelievable. It seemed like when they stopped accepting credit cards and raised their food prices, the food quality dropped. I don't know what happened to this place. Maybe they changed owners or management, or something like that, but whatever the reason, it's definitely not worth it. That's too bad, because this place used to be 5 stars, now it's nothing but a bad Polish joke.

27.description: Food For THOUGHT: Know in advance this is a cash only deal but there is a private ATM on site.  Saturday afternoon 3pm and there is no parking available either in back (tiny lot) or street wise.  BE CAREFUL parking in the neighborhood - Watch the signs or risk getting towed out.Seating is booth and table, but know both are a bit undersized and the tables are crammed in tight. Believe it or not they have 'to-go' order where you can pay for a Styrofoam container and fill it by weight.   I guess if you MUST have your Polish cuisine that badly, its the only way 'to-go'!  :)I made reservations with OpenTable but they didn't even bother to look them up when we arrived :(Food For YOU: One L-shaped station complete with cold pasta/salad, salmon (its cold), and desert line the right/back of the food service area.  One Rectangular service station with hot dishes rotating in and out. Attendants at the food service area hustle, so if you don't see what you want just ask or wait a minute... they'll be back.  Just don't stand where the kitchen exit is or they'll run you over.  Please know that you have to carve your own ham, turkey and beef.  Be careful where you attempt to put your plate while maneuvering that not so sharp carving knife.  Mom steam burned her hands (ouchie!) when she picked up her plate after setting it aside to get to the ham, which was very tasty.Mashed potatoes were amazing too!  It seems the offerings vary, and some of the items I was looking for weren't on the buffet at this visit.  There was plenty to chose from if you just waited out the service attendants.Kielbasa was a bit peppery, and some of the other flavors were a bit strong too.  Mom loved the fruit pierogi, blintzes and something with a horseradish sauce.  She didn't elaborate, I didn't ask. :)  I agree with the others that the mix of food choice was a bit odd- flan??  Mom commented most of the deserts had jello in them.... a second look confirmed this.  I had hoped for different deserts but again, my grandma was an excellent baker :)Service: Service was very good.  Our waitress was on the move.  First asking what we wanted to drink (there IS a full bar on the premise too!).  Next offering choice of two different soups.  We had chicken noodle, more noodle than chicken with fresh chive. Might be your grandma's best, but mine did it better :)  The waitress asked if we were finished before walking off with our dishes - she was pretty prompt about cleaning up.  She also offered coffee and at the end of the meal a choice of two different ice cream flavors.You certainly get your money's worth - and hopefully the food choices you are looking for.While it was my intention to do this for mom, my impression was it was a nice meal but not the first place I'd think of for a meal out.

32.description: Mighty tasty! Lots of great stuff in the buffet. I was in perogi heaven! And there were various potato and cabbage and sausage dishes. Great value and service,

54.description: This Polish buffet has been our bookmark list for a long time.  I found it was cozier than I thought it would be.  We also found it to be a great value at $11 and $13 for lunch and dinner buffets, respectively.  The dining areas are separated into 3 areas that have a quaint homey feel, unlike most buffets.  One of them is by a cozy bar area.  The selection is quite good - pork shank, shnitzels, veal stew, cheese blintzes, pierogies, potato pancakes, polish sausage, BBQ pork ribs, meatballs, fried chicken, grilled fish, turkey, roast beef, etc etc.  There is also a nice selection of beet and tuna salads, herring,  and various desserts.  There were mostly ethnic European diners here tonight - a good sign on the authenticity and value here.  Service was friendly and excellent, and I could tell they have a good old fashioned work ethic here.   Easy and free street parking right outside also.  We will definitely be back.

48.description: Everything was good. This was my first time eating Polish food other than their sausage. Servers were nice, so no complain there. The place is clean. I'll go back for the schnitzel with mushroom gravy.I wasn't impressed at the desserts though. But overall, their food is good.

44.description: I went here for a family get together. We were seated quickly and our server was very friendly. I was not a fan of the soup: I had the chicken noodle, which was watered down and had no chicken in it. But I was pleased with the Buffett, aside from the desserts, which were very dry for the most part. Overall, this was a pleasant experience.

24.description: Had the lunch buffet for 11.99.  Lots of Polish fare to choose from.  Very unique and bring a big appetite

7.description: What a great experience at Red Apple!!! I'm from California visiting my boyfriend's family and had never heard of a polish buffet. The closest we get to polish is a pierogi truck, but wow I had no idea how much great food Poland has to offer! The pierogis were delicious here, as were all the salads, polish schnitzel, kielbasa, potato pancakes and blitzes. Seriously, what a great variety!! But my favorite item of the visit was... The borscht soup!! Wow wow wow you've got to try it. It's creamy, warm, dill-y and full of beer taste. Service was also very good, attentive and native polish people :) I just wish we had this buffet in San Diego, it would be our go-to spot for sure!

49.description: It's the equivalent of coming home to my grandparents house, walking in to the aromatic flavors of the 'old country', as my grandpa would say. You immediately feel welcome, and food can, and does, make you feel comfortable and happy.While the food is hardly fitness friendly, it truly is delicious, and worth a cheat meal. Well prepared, with the traditional sauces, every one of the many meat options kept me coming back for more. Sunday's Mushroom soup is unforgettable, and who can pass up fresh kielbasa? If you're doing it right, your belly will be uncomfortably big, you'll have a smile on your face, and then, yes then, you're cute waitress will offer you ice cream. The correct thing to do, is get a scoop. Maybe that cold creamy ball of happiness will cool and compact that polish meat baby brewing in your belly...Or maybe not, but it sure was yummy!

40.description: ive had polish food before and the food they serve here doesnt compare at all... the food tasted very bland and some of the meat was very rough and chewy... my friend and i was just filling our stomach with mash potatoes and gravy mostly because that's like the only decent food item we enjoyed...by the fruit and dessert table.. there was fruit flies and flies around and it keep landing on the food..yea.. not really appetizing after that..for around 16 bucks.. it was definitely not worth it in my opinion..

53.description: Now, I'm not Polish but you can't come to this restaurant and not think of an old country polish meal. It was fabulous.  They had it all. Piroges, blintzes, schnitzel, and veal ragu. I loved the mushroom gravy. There was plenty of waitstaff but I didn't feel that they were attentive as they should be with only 2 patrons in the restaurant. If the waitstaff were more attentive a big 5 stars.

30.description: Thanks a lot Red Apple. I called 2 1/2 weeks before Easter to ask if they would be open on Easter Sunday.  I was told they would be open, was quoted a price of $17.95 per person as a holiday rate and made my reservation. Fast forward to Easter Sunday. My car is loaded up with my family, including two elderly relatives in their 80's. As we approach the restaurant, we cannot believe how there are no cars parked in front. As we drive closer, we realize that is because THEY WERE CLOSED! Fortunately The White Eagle down the street was open and happy to accommodate us. It was a bit more expensive, but the food was better. Also, the servers were a million times friendlier than the people at Red Apple.

46.description: I was blown away by the food here. Admittedly, my prior experience with polish cuisine stopped at Kiebalsa. But, I left Red Apple, smiling, happy, full and in love with most of the things I tried. And I tried almost everything. In fact, I was so full that we sat for an hour as to allow time for food to digest just so we could have dessert. Beet Soup - 4 stars (*not a beet fan but it was yummy!) Carrot & Peas - 5 stars (* a favorite)Stuffed Cabbage - 5 stars Smoked Kiebalsa - 5 stars Cucumbers & Cream Sauce - 5 stars Chicken Kiev - 5 stars (stuffed w/ cheese & then fried) Roasted Chicken - 5 stars Roasted Duck - 5 stars (*super tender) Veal Ragu - 5 stars Schnitzel - 3 stars Strawberry Pierogi - 5 stars Meat Pierogi - 4 stars Fried Vegetable Rice - 3 stars Cheese Blintzes - 5 stars (sweet & creamy) Chicken Noodle Soup - 4  stars Ham off the bone - 5 stars (slow cooked to perfection)Seafood Pasta - 3.5 stars Potato Pancakes - 5 frickin' stars (* absolutely amazing) Desserts - 5 stars (don't know the names of each one. They all were good.) Service - 5 stars Value for the money - 5 stars The line was full of fresh items. You were also topped off with your choice of ice cream.  Needless to say, we all needed a nap after the feast. But the meal has left a lasting impression on my tummy. .... This will be the first of many visits to come.

1.description: Polish buffet equals comfort food equals warm fuzzies on a cold winters night. I mean, doesn't mashed potatoes and gravy sound so comforting during this cold weather?  I really liked RA on previous visits.  It's been while since we dined here and this last visit was just OK. The mashed potatoes and gravy were perfect. The roasted chicken was well-made and the chicken peices were huge! The stuffed cabbage was good, the filling wasn't too mushy, I just wish the tomato sauce was a bit more robust--it was kind of watered down.. The sauerkraut and polish sausage were really good too. The salad bar was very basic.But the carved meats (ham and roast beef) were bland (and honestly looked like highschool cafeteria servings).  They only had meat and saurkraut pierogi avaialable (what? no potato and cheese?) the desserts cakes seemed old as they were really dry. The veggies were way overcooked. I guess it all evens out, good vs bad points.  Service was nice. The buffet was kept clean. Easy parking.

55.description: The Best!  I am polish american so don't ask me if these items are truly authentic, but they are fresh, tasty and always consistent.  Four stars because I wish they had some different polish items that I like, but oh well.  You don't have to be polish to like the food, they have things like fried chicken, ribs, mashed & gravy, veal, beef stew, fried shrimp etc, etc.

9.description: About a 2-2.5: The Red Apple restaurant has been around for ages in Chicago, and the locals go there for their AYCE Polish buffet.  When you walk in, you just seat yourselves.  Our server was nice and friendly, and once snag a table, you are welcome to start. The offerings include breaded shrimps, BBQ ribs, baked fish (salmon), meatballs, pork shanks, chicken bread cutlet, roasted turky/ham/duck, potato dumplings, potato salad, croquettes, boiled potatoes, and pierogies.  I was a little disappointed because, as much as the buffet was extensive in terms of their selections, the flavors were just not tasty.  I thought they were bland and underseasoned, and even some shakings of the salt and pepper didn't do so much.  The apple pancakes were soggy and wet, and the crispy potato pancakes, while looking nice and crispy, were underseasoned.  The schnitzels and the pork loin with the dill-based sauce tasted like ground 'mysterious' meat that had a very soft texture - yikes!  The pierogies, which I was the most excited about, were boiled way too long, as it was super mushy.  Even though there were a handful of dining patrons, the condiments by the buffet were never refilled (such as the tarter sauce, ketchup, mayo, etc.). The restaurant itself was cute and very old-school, but our dining experience was just not what we expected!  I'm glad I gave Red Apple a try but would not go back!+AYCE Polish buffet+overcooked pierogies T___T+carry-out/takeaway availabe+friendly servers :D

26.description: About a 2-2.5: The Red Apple restaurant has been around for ages in Chicago, and the locals go there for their AYCE Polish buffet.  When you walk in, you just seat yourselves.  Our server was nice and friendly, and once snag a table, you are welcome to start. The offerings include breaded shrimps, BBQ ribs, baked fish (salmon), meatballs, pork shanks, chicken bread cutlet, roasted turky/ham/duck, potato dumplings, potato salad, croquettes, boiled potatoes, and pierogies.  I was a little disappointed because, as much as the buffet was extensive in terms of their selections, the flavors were just not tasty.  I thought they were bland and underseasoned, and even some shakings of the salt and pepper didn't do so much.  The apple pancakes were soggy and wet, and the crispy potato pancakes, while looking nice and crispy, were underseasoned.  The schnitzels and the pork loin with the dill-based sauce tasted like ground 'mysterious' meat that had a very soft texture - yikes!  The pierogies, which I was the most excited about, were boiled way too long, as it was super mushy.  Even though there were a handful of dining patrons, the condiments by the buffet were never refilled (such as the tarter sauce, ketchup, mayo, etc.). The restaurant itself was cute and very old-school, but our dining experience was just not what we expected!  I'm glad I gave Red Apple a try but would not go back!+AYCE Polish buffet+overcooked pierogies T___T+carry-out/takeaway availabe+friendly servers :D

25.description: This was our first time here. Recommended by a family member and it was worth the long drive there. We were aware in advance that it was cash only but they do have an ATM machine though. Parking in the rear lot was not available but we got lucky and snagged a spot on the street in front. We have heard that they can get crowded so we made reservations for our party of 5 and were seated right away in a room towards the back. it was quieter than the main restaurant area and we did not feel rushed at all. The service was great. We were offered a choice of soups and after the buffet you get ice cream if you have room :)  the buffet was delicious, fresh, and well stocked. there was a huge selection so even my picky eater found plenty to fill up on. Carving station with ham and roast beef, fried chicken, roasted chicken, chicken cutlets, chicken kiev, polish sausage, fish, pork, stuffed cabbage, pierogis, potato pancakes, blintzes, the list goes on. the deserts were all very tasty as well.

12.description: I really like the food and their service is really good. Nice place and nice area to bring with the family. 2 thumbs up!

59.description: They make some of the best pierogis around and don't get me started on their potato pancakes.  Good home cooked polish food.  The only negative is there isn't much in the way of parking and it is easy to get ticketed in that neighborhood.

21.description: It's good not great and the price pretty much ruined it for me ever going back and I'm far from cheap but not worth it 3 people with 3 cokes $73 bucks That's Insane!!

17.description: Had dinner there last night for the first time in 6 years,place was packed, food was awesome! Left about 5 lbs heavier lol.

10.description: We stopped by for lunch on a Saturday after visiting the Botanic Gardens Wonderland Express Train exhibit. This is perhaps our 5th meal here. My husband says it is probably his favorite Chicago-area restaurant, food-wise. A polish buffet, they serve all the traditional dishes, sausage, great kraut, pierogi. Also chicken, turkey, ham and fish. Variations on potato, too. Also a salad bar with all the goodies for a nutritarian like myself and a large, fattening selection of deserts. Everything is fresh. Polish language skills are not required. Very reasonably priced with a friendly staff. Cash only. GO! EAT!

5.description: The food was good and the staff was attentive. There was plenty of food and it was refilled very often. The problem I have is when the bill came. It was $19,99 per adult and $8.99 for children over 1. I think this is very expensive. They also only take cash and if you don't have enough cash they have an ATM machine you can use on the premise for a $1.00 fee. I'm sure I won't be back here again since there are many other reasonable priced restaurants in the area.

3.description: I'm American Polish, third generation.   This is like grandma's cooking.  Food is fresh, hot, and homemade.  $19.99 pp buffet on weekends. Cash only.  I'm completely fine with the price when the food selection is great and fresh.  Not many places that I wish I had a bigger stomach.

35.description: there was a time that polish food was something i would avoid. i spent seven years earlier in life as a vegetarian and my 1st polish buffet experience (a year or two after my relapse into eating flesh) sealed the deal fro me. full of heavy flesh laden dishes, lots of flour and empty carbs, polish food seemed to me the antithesis to healthy, conscious eating.flash ahead 25 years later, unlike many folks my age, i  daily challenge my dogmas. and they often drop away. though i have now been a polish food fan for a few years now it was on a bright, sunny march day that i found my benchmark for polish buffet.red apple is a bright, warm welcoming room done up in natural wood. the place was clean. the food was excellent and appealing. i loved the cabbage rolls, the fried haddock was fresh and delectable, as was the polish sausage, tilapia,cheese blintzes and various and numerous salad dishes. i was not as crazy about the pierogis and the ice cream was a little icy but these are trivial matters. the employees were excellent and i loved the fact we were the only non polish folks in the place.but one thing remained a mystery to me. at the desert bat were little yellow dishes of ....flan.flan? that delicious custard dish i associate with mexico? surely there was an answer to this strange cross cultural phenomenon. after all, there were no tacos, pad thai or samosas to be had. what was the reason?sadly, nobody there could answer that as their english was not great. but it was excellent anyway!12 bux in the day 14 at night and a special 15 dollar buffet on the weekends with treats like lamb and more. i am officially a fan!

19.description: This place is ok for a big eater. The food is basic polish food. I've been there a few times, food does seem to all taste the same. They do have a variety and it is all cooked and monitored. One thing I hate is an all you can eat place that does not watch the food.  They keep an eye on things and keep it clean.

28.description: I love it when they have white borscht.  It's so tasty.  The buffet is kept well-stocked.  The salad bar is surprisingly fresh and the selections are varied.  The dessert station has plenty of Polish pastry specialties, like Kolacky.  The carving station ham is out of this world, and the roast beef is good.  The potato pancakes are outstanding, as is the Kielbasa.  The waitress offers soup at the beginning, which she brings to the table, along with your beverages.  Then, after the meal, she offers ice cream.  The service is excellent.  The waitresses aren't super friendly, but they are truly efficient.  I think the lack of banter may be a case of language barrier, as they all seem to be native Polish speakers.  My Polish is awful and limited, so I don't dare try it.  :P  The place is clean, comfortable, and casual.  I've never had anything less than an awesome experience.

45.description: The food here is unique delicious, but just a heads up: THEY DON'T TAKE CREDIT CARDS! THEY ARE CASH ONLY! The service is so very polite and welcoming, and the facilities are quite clean. Just remember, it's CASH ONLY! (They do have an ATM on-location.)

33.description: I've came here many times in the past with my big family and was treated quite nicely. I recently came here by myself and felt quite unwelcome. I felt very uncomfortable as soon as I came into the restaurant. I was looking for some good quality polish food I can grab from the buffet and eat on the go and didn't quite find that. There wasn't any selection really and the food I did choose wasn't really tasty-- no flavor, stale mostly. The cash only policy was a surprise but the way I was told was seemingly rude. I let it all go and grabbed my cash from the atm nearby but once I got my food I realized I didn't have any utensils in the bag or napkins. I don't know, just really expected more and was let down quite a lot. Felt unwelcome &looked at sideways and on top of that, received sad food. Not quite comparable to Jolly Inn on Irving Park-- that's definitely my favorite hands down.

43.description: I came here with my friend because he had this place bookmarked. When we walked in here, it was kinda small but we ate here anyway because we were really hungry. This is the first time I have tried a Polish buffet so I really can't compare it to any other ones. I like how everything was listed, so you know what you are eating, but I honestly thought everything was just okay at best. Nothing really stood out and I have no idea why the reviews here are so great. Maybe it is just me, but my friend did not like this place as well.

2.description: Thought I found a replacement to bobak's. Food was really good until it was time to pay. Had a gift certificate i purchased from restaurants.com and was told they don't accept them and have nothing to do with them. This is a reason why i am hesitant to use these services like groupon. I paid cash but i believe i saw a sign that said something about a fee for credit or debit. Food was good but not worth the business practices

18.description: Great polish food buffet.  Watch out - cash only.  Great service.  They charge groups of 8 or more a 15% gratuity for buffet service.  My large party was sat in a large party dining room - it was a nice touch.Crowd favorites were strawberry pierogi and potato pancakes.

41.description: Since my last visit there's been a vast improvement in the food and service. The food tasted way better than the last time. Way more authentic polish food and well worth the price. We were very pleased and will return again.

52.description: Good, home made polish food

50.description: Dobry Dzień!  12 friends and I came in on a Saturday night for my birthday (I had reserved a table) and we needed space for 2 more late invites and they were very accommodating!  The service was good, always picked up the plates and refilled the water.  The food was good (being Polish I am pretty partial to Polish food) the buffet was always full, the food was fresh and tasty! A lot of the folks never had Polish food so they enjoyed it as well.The price point was good for a buffet on a Saturday night!One turn off was that normally for a buffer I would tip 10% but with that many people they added a 15% tip (mind you I would have tipped a bit more than the 10% regardless just because they were accommodating).  That was the only flaw that left them one star shy of a 5!

4.description: Love this place... I stop in here every time I visit Chicago and they never disappoint! Last time I was in they had a delightful barley soup that came with the buffet. Their golabki is always great... Almost as good as my grandmas! And when they have strawberry pierogi you know I'll be back for some extra plates. See you next time I'm in town, Red Apple!

6.description: After years of going I am final done $20 person cash only or need to pay a $1 for credit cards. Too high for a low end buffet. It no longer a value. Rather go to the Jolly Inn, same food lower prices.

22.description: We came back to the Red Apple after our move back.  Our  latest trip was a big disappointment.  May I add, that I always loved this place and found the food to bedelicious however things have certainly changed.  I've been eating Polish food as a kid(of course nothing is better than home made) and in the past I could honestly say theRed Apple was the next best thing to home made but not anymore.  The pierogies wehad on a Saturday were tough, thick, cold and there were only 6 in the pan (this was at11:30) with only a few customers in the place.  Their once delicious cheese blintzes werecold and stuck to the pan and the potato pancakes were as thin as paper.   The qualityof the food has certainly gone downhill.  Yes they had ham, turkey and pork roasts butI wanted the traditional home cooked Polish food that the RA once had.  They stoppedtaking credit cards and frankly for the weekend price of $20.00 we probably ate about$5.00 worth since hot dishes were cold or tasted like they were store bought.  Sad thatit changed so drastically.  Some of the salads were ok and the waitresses were friendly.Our server was surprised that we asked for the check so quickly.

15.description: It's the equivalent of coming home to my grandparents house, walking in to the aromatic flavors of the 'old country', as my grandpa would say. You immediately feel welcome, and food can, and does, make you feel comfortable and happy.While the food is hardly fitness friendly, it truly is delicious, and worth a cheat meal. Well prepared, with the traditional sauces, every one of the many meat options kept me coming back for more. Sunday's Mushroom soup is unforgettable, and who can pass up fresh kielbasa? If you're doing it right, your belly will be uncomfortably big, you'll have a smile on your face, and then, yes then, you're cute waitress will offer you ice cream. The correct thing to do, is get a scoop. Maybe that cold creamy ball of happiness will cool and compact that polish meat baby brewing in your belly...Or maybe not, but it sure was yummy!

57.description: Fairly good food. The price, however, is also fairly steep. The atmosphere and service is also a little meh.It is fun to take out-of-town visitors though. I know this is not a very elaborate review which should give you some clue as to the restaurant.

20.description: Bring your appetite -- my feeding frenzy brought on a sweat. Banquet style which was exactly what I was in the mood for. Food was good and abundant. Coffee fantastic. Carry out available and the price for Labor Day lunch was higher than usual at $19.19/pp.   not complaining as to me it was worth more.

36.description: So, my boyfriend and I wanted to try this restaurant, because it's located near my apartment. We were standing in the front for quite sometime before someone came to seat us. The waitress was attentive, and the food was pretty decent. After dinner, we tried paying with a credit card, since the sign on the front of the restaurant said, "Credit cards only for new customers," and the cashier wouldn't take it. She insisted we used the ATM, and I hate having to pay for ATM fees, especially since we were new customers? I checked my bank statement, and the ATM charged me twice, so I have to dispute the charges, and this is just such a pain in the butt. Why would a restaurant say they'd accept a payment for new customers, but then refuse to? You might as well just not accept credit cards, if you're going to be that cheap about it.

14.description: It's good not great and the price pretty much ruined it for me ever going back and I'm far from cheap but not worth it 3 people with 3 cokes $73 bucks That's Insane!!

3.description: Love this place. You walk in and they know your name very friendly.  Comfy massage chairs. Sometimes they will leave me in a chair for 15min.  I love it getting massaged! !  They do a great job on cuticles.  Monday - Thursday is $30 mani pedi. So it might be busy.

1.description: This is the place if you want any kind of bling on your fingernails or toenails.  Nail bling really isn't my cup of tea, but if I ever want my french manicure tips covered in rhinestones or my toenails covered with silver snowflakes, the gals here are glad to oblige. For me, a simple spa pedicure and no chip manicure will suffice. I walked in with no appointment and even though the place seemed busy, they were able to get started on my pedicure within 5 minutes I walked in the door.   The gal that did my mani/pedi was super sweet and did a great job. I hate it when the tech cuts down the sides of the toenails and I instructed her not to do it and she understood and complied.  Unlike some places that just nod yes and still do what you tell them not to. Their no-chip color selection isn't as vast as other salons but its still a nice selection.What I didn't like about the place was that it is really run down inside. The walls need some patching and a new coat of paint, the floor needs new tiles and the stations are stained with past polishes.  It's also quite cramped in there so conversations carry and  the aroma of nail chemicals is pretty apparent. Another reviewer said that parking was a breeze...really? I snagged the last spot and it was a pretty tight squeeze.  NC shares their lot with a Dunkin'Donuts/Baskin Robbins so it makes for a nice coffee before you get your nails done, but the parking situation seems quite tight.

2.description: Tony and Nina are amazing at their jobs! I highly recommend this nail salon to each individual out there because they have the best prices, sweet customer service, and make you feel comfortable/relaxed. Tony and Nina do the best foot and arm massages as well as no chip manicures! Visit them, you wont be disappointed!

9.description: They arre very nice here.  Happy everytime.No tude's and they take cc tips!$30.00 MANI PEDI -- KIller

10.description: Actually two and a half stars...unfortunately.In my search for another manicure salon (my favorite girl has cut her hours way back) I heard that one of my other favorite manicurists  "Cindi" has now switched to this salon.Cindi was there...the quality of salon I like...wasn't.We were under a time restraint so Cindi worked on my daughter and "Tony" did my manicure.Now don't get me wrong....Tony and the rest of the staff were very, very nice but..."Nail Care" is...not the most attractive of salons,not the cleanest of salons, does not use the best quality products and,does not have the freshest/newest of nail-polishes available.The worst part...my nail polish is now all bubbly. (I left before I was fully dried, or else I would have addressed it before I left the salon)It's driving me crazy every time I look down and see my fingers!To close on a positive note...1. They honored our reservation and didn't make us wait (there were ladies waiting)2. Plenty of available parking in their parking lot 3. Monday-Thursday they offer a mani/pedi special for $30.Don't think I'll be going back...even for Cindi.

4.description: Fantastic friendly neighborhood place. Went there for the first time today and spent $25 on a Saturday for a pedicure. Definitely a fan

6.description: Came here because the other nail salon I go to in the area was very busy and I didn't have time to wait.  Got a manicure and 2 days later, you can't even tell.  Six of my nails have already chipped.  Also, the people who work here are VERY rude and I did not feel welcome from the start.  Last, this place is dirty.Will NEVER go back!!

12.description: Linda, Cindy and Tony are great people. The other little sweet Asian girl that does pedicures is always nice too. Yeah, on the outside it doesn't look like much, the inside is small. However, the previous lady saying that they are unsanitary is FALSE. I've been going there for years and so has my mother and we have never once had a problem with them. Linda does amazing designs and they are one of the very few nail salons period that does NOT charge for a cut down. I get overlays on my nails with gel, and they always look amazing still after having them the full two weeks. I highly recommend anyone to go there for any kind of nail or face waxing services. They are reasonably priced and very kind, attentive people.

5.description: Great experience here. I had Cindy 2 (there are 2 Cindys I guess lol) and she was great. I had a mani-pedi and she was gentle and awesome.

11.description: My manicurist was nice. However, when it got busier she ended up ignoring me. I got a french manicure and at the end I showed her that my nails has air bubbles, and all she did was cover it more with another coat of clear polish.....I ended up leaving with air bubbles in my nails...and its not just few airbubbles....its ridiculous air bubbles!

8.description: Love this place!  I refuse to get a pedicure in Indiana - come all the way to Chicago to get my nails done here.  They know the whole family and take great care of us!  It is a small place, but that makes it nice and quiet.  My pedicure time is my 'ME" time... I don't want to sit in a row of 20 chairs only to be just another foot.

0.description: The girls and guys are very talented and super nice, I've been going there for about 5 years.

7.description: I have been going to Cindy for many years to get French manicure. After a short consultation, I couldn't be happier. She suggested me a perfect shape for my nails. The product what she applies at the end keeps my regular!! (not no chip) manicure stay for 2 weeks. Unbelievable! Amazing service!

28.description: I give it 4 stars, when compared to other fast food food. I have always liked wendy's burgers. I thought the burgers were a little more moist back in the days when they advertised "Hot and Juicy".I did have a small quality issue with some food. They did a great job of taking care of me and corrected the problem.I will be going back.

1.description: The food is fine, in the rare case it's correct.  The employees here have the mental capacity of a bivalve.  If you order a hamburger and fries, don't be surprised if what you receive is a hot dog and a bottle cap. I can tell from the drive-thru that there is an exclusive party atmosphere here, and people ordering food are distracting.  But please, let's raise their minimum wage.

9.description: Came through the drive thru. Not friendly and forget my kid's nuggets so I had to go inside. Went inside and nobody from the drive thru area gave a sh** at least the girl taking orders in the lobby said sorry.

29.description: Good place for a late night snack since they are open later than most mc donalds and burger kings. The crispy chicken nuggets are the best out of the big three.

23.description: Cashier left out $1 when I recieved my change, so I had to correct her. My bacon and blue burger had no bacon. I am not coming back to this location!

5.description: I am pained to leave this review since Wendy's is generally my go-to restaurant when we get fast food.  They just re-opened this location after a complete tear-down and re-build.  But don't let that new building fool you, despite that "new car" smell this place is dumpier than ever... and it seems that each thing you order is paying for their construction since everything on the menu is more expensive than before, some sporting an almost 100% increase.We have gone here twice since they re-opened.  The first time the staff was so confused with the coupon we had you would think we handed a coupon for McDonalds.  What a time-consuming mess that was.  Then the chicken we got was so over-cooked you almost couldn't bite through it.The last time was last night.  After starting our order in the drive through the person told us it would be one minute... after well-over a minute she returned and we had to start our order all over since what she recited was just wrong.  After paying the huge prices they now charge here we got home to begin our meal... of course the chili we had ordered for our son was nowhere to be seen.  I know, I know... the cardinal rule of drive-thus is check your order before you leave... so partially bad on us, but also horrible on them.  We were not driving back so now we are out our the ridiculous $2 we spent on a small chili (used to be $1)... and I am left with a terrible taste in my mouth for this joke of a new restaurant.   Not only that but the sandwiches we did order were so slathered in sauce that it was oozing out the side before you even picked it up and they were virtually impossible to eat without a knife and fork or a huge pile of napkins, not to mention this made them completely disgusting.I had been here quite a few times before the new building and never had experienced the incompetence, overcooked/oversauced food and general confusion and mistakes.  I'm not sure if they hired new staff or they just are not used to the new computers, grills, fry stations, drink machines, chili ladel etc.  but whatever happened here is a tragedy.  I guess I'll have to drive a little further to go to Culvers.  :(

25.description: This Wendy is the worst. I've just had one bad experience after another. The usual drive though experience end in cold food.  I even complained to Wendys (I'd really wish it was better) and they seemed to know they have had issues. They sent me a bunch of coupons which I used to buy another cold meal which I tossed about 4 minutes later.

12.description: I have bought food from here a few times but this time it was a terrible experience, ordered a spicy chicken sandwich when I took a bite it was the most disgusting thing I have ever witnessed. The chicken appeared to be rubber/plastic you could literally grab it throw it against a wall and it would bounce back. Its obvious the chicken was old and should have not been served. Fresh food and ingredients is the most important thing at a restaurant regardless if its fast food or not. I haven't eating chicken or wendys since my terrible experience probably won't for a few more weeks.

21.description: I dont know why I keep coming back to this Wendys or why I don't check my order before I leave. Maybe it's the thought that it just makes sense that I receive what I order? I just comprehend how I receive someone else order 50% of the time which is always a crappier meal than what I order. I don't like to eat in here because it always smells like pee. I don't dislike Wendys. Just this one.

16.description: I would give it a 5 star, if the service was good. I love Wendy's food but every time I go they always get our order incorrect. Also they constantly ask you to pull up to the corner because the food is not ready, the point of FAST food is to get it FAST. Then we have to wait up to 10-15 maybe even 20 minutes for our order. So in that we are STARVING! And on top of that the employees could be snotty!

17.description: It is very close to home but every time I come here they screw up my order in the drive through usually leaving something out that was paid for. One time we went there for two frostys, ordered them and paid for at first window but when we got to the second window only handed one. The point of going through the drive through is supposed to be convenient but not if you are always getting the wrong order.

10.description: Late night at Wendy's...classy, romantic, clean, FAST food, um no....My best friend and I decided to come here after a late night workout...again EPIC mistake if you're in a hurry and want fast, hot and accurate food...as he and I have gone here several times at various times of the day in hopes of all of the above improving with shift changes it had not! This will probably be our last visit there and let me explain why...after our workout, he wanted to buy me food and just have them bag it separately as we were going to different places after the gym apparently the drive through attendant stated, "um sorry sir we don't do that we can just put the order all in one." So he pulls forward as do I behind him making sure there weren't other customers behind me that I was blocking, but nope it was just him and I. I rolled down the window so he could tell me what was going on and while he moved into my window closer to me he noticed a wine bottle in the parking lot space right next to me, seems someone has a classy romantic night here...lol anyhow he told me what the attendant said as well as the typical "you're gonna have to pull up your order is going to be awhile," so we must have waited about 15 minutes. Not sure why it took 15 minutes since it appeared they had a full kitchen staff monkeying around when I passed the drive through window and that fact that he and I were the only customers with a small order not certain what took so long, maybe they were in the back killing the chicken that was on my sandwich...lol though highly unlikely. When we got our food it was correct so 1 star for that though the cheese on our food was not melted and the fries were luke warm/cold and soggy...my hypothesis they gave us old fries. Positive note the berry iced tea was amazing! Best part of the meal!!! Most likely because the super genius late night crew couldn't mess it up, put some ice in a cup, put cup under the iced tea fountain and omg hit a button! My advice, go across the street to TBK , Denny's, etc for your late night food instead, unless you have time to kill, like having cold food, a messed up order, surrounded by mess inside the building or out it's gross, who knows maybe there will be a "romantic bottle of wine" in the parking lot waiting there for you while you wait for your food!

11.description: First and last time I ever order here. Cold burger. Cool chewy fries. Sprite had zero flavor, basically a cup of soda water.  Avoid this location

26.description: Seriously Wendy's how hard to f*** up is a "1/4 Jalapeno Cheddar Burger without nacho cheese"? "Fast" Food is supposed to be that, and then at least made correctly.You suck.

27.description: In my never-ending quest to find a decent cup of joe that is also cheap, I decided to take a whack at Wendy's.  Now I havent been to a Wendy's to eat in probably 10 years, but I can tell you that even if I did eat fast food now, their recent marketing campaign with the guy in the red braids would certainly send me speeding to the nearest Micky D's.  Can you say disturbing?Anyway, Wendy's does serve coffee, but it is only available in one size, small, which equals about a half a cup if you poured it out and measured it.  The price is definitely right though:  75 cents.  However, you better like your joe lukewarm, bitter and black because thats how it comes at this particular location.  I was not offered or given cream or sugar.  I did recieve one napkin which I found to be outrageously funny.  When have you ever just been given ONE napkin? Oh well, the search continues...

0.description: I am really digging the new Wendy's with the fancy, modern interior. I don't know what ol' Dave would say, but it looks pretty spiffy.Came to this Wendy's one night in search of some fondue fries. If they were anything like the ghost pepper fries they served one time, I was in for a treat! Ordered my stuff and waited in line. They were super nice and welcoming even though it was late at night and my coworkers had lengthy orders. In and out after five minutes with food in hand.The fries... Were really disappointing. Like, it didn't even taste like gouda. Just some generic, sloppy white cheese. The fries themselves were really salty, too. Like pre-hypertension salty. Bleh!

20.description: Impressive service on Community Fund Night.

19.description: Impressive service on Community Fund Night.

2.description: We recently tried the Gouda bacon cheeseburger- made it triple patty and it was actually pretty good! Normally Wendy's has now become our go to fast food chain for burgers because i guess its just the way they cook their burgers over the other popular fast food chains. Thankfully they didn't screw up our order so I'm happy!

18.description: This place has screwed up my drive thru orders more times than they have got it right. Affter about 20 trips to this Wendy's I've given up and give my business to the taco place on the corner and open just as late! I only go to this place when it's raining and Im too lazy to get out of the car. None of the employees ever look happy, they all look miserable.

13.description: Atrocious service!!! Every time I go here, they manage to screw up my order or I sit at the speaker for several minutes before anyone says anything even though I'm the only one in the drive thru and by the time I pull up, everyone is screwing around and having a good ole time because there too busy to do their job. I have to repeat my order at least 3 times ( which I only ordered nuggets and fries) and repeat 3 times honey mustard to only open the bag and have bbq. Last time I asked for 2 spicy chicken ceaser salads and ended up getting 5?!? I don't have time to waste to keep going back to have my order fixed. Maybe they should hire people who know how to listen, speak, and count. I won't be going back. I rather go to taco burrito king or McDonald's or Burger King.

4.description: This is a pretty good wendy's overall. I would of given it 4 stars but I dropped it one star because of a recent experience.  A couple weeks ago I came here about 10:30 pm and I noticed that the doors were locked but they were still doing business in the drive thru. Their dining room hours were till 11. I asked why the doors were locked they said were closed . But your hours are till 11 I said and they really had no explanation but they did take my order in the drive thru and told me to wait outside and they will bring my food to me.  I waited about 10-15 minutes and asked this one lady who was trying to shoo me away saying they were closed.  I told her I had an order I was waiting for.  They finally let me in nearly 30 minutes later and overall it took about 35 minutes to get my food.  I asked why they closed early and they said they had no staff. But while waiting in there I counted about 6 employees so that story didn't seem right.

24.description: You know how out of all fast food chains, you always have a "worst"? Well, this is the worst Wendy's I've been to. Not really much more to say...rude employees and they screw up orders left and right.

6.description: Even though I've been on an anti fast food campaign,  I don't consider Wendy's Grilled Chicken sandwich and small Chili unhealthy. Now that I've had the audacity to eat one in front of my boyfriend, I got him hooked!We just had it twice this week for lunch already. Call me crazy but it doesn't make me throw up immediately afterward like BK, McDonald's and Taco Bell. Maybe that's how I justify that it's OK to eat here. BTW, their iced tea drinks and freshly squeezed lemonades are better than sodas.

22.description: Let's see, a 15 minute wait for food on a Sunday when there's no one else in the store + having to pull up and wait for the girl to come out with our food + a warm flat coke with no ice in it + fries that tasted like they were from last nights batch = a REALLY BAD Wendy's. I knew I should have gone somewhere else. I guess that's what happens when none of the employees care about their job. This place us the dumps. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.

15.description: Just experienced great customer service from Mary whom I'm assuming is the manager at Wendy's that just reopen today.

7.description: Everytime I go through this drive thru something is missing from my order. The employees are very rude and seem like they dont enjoy working. They never give out a receipts either. I thought the new construction to this place would of changed the restrurant all around... but no way! The food is good quality but the overall experience is HORRIBLE! One star.

8.description: Late night drive thru is horrifying.Saturday October 26th we drove in around 1am.We literally sat at the speaker for 13 minutes waiting for someone to greet us. I thought they were closed.We then beeped the horn a few times because we knew they were open and someone FINALLY came to the window. He said the car in front of us ordered about $40 worth of food.(How is that my problem?)We waited another 3 minutes before we realized there was a Burger King across the street and drove off.

3.description: This Wendy's has some dumb employees. I just ordered a cheeseburger kids meal and they give me 4 piece chicken nuggets and no bbq sauce to top it off. They are fast but they get the order wrong and they are rushing you like they don't want you to check your bag because they probably got the order wrong. And these kids want higher wages? That's a joke.

14.description: Let's start with the cashier not greeting us. Simply giving us a cold face. Next the ketchup dispenser is empty- told the cashier she did not care. We got the food it was completely messy.  Ordered chili there were no spoons; and a spoon was not given. We asked for spoon was given a dirty look you guessed it by the cashier.  We are sitting here for 20 min and already (no exaggeration) six people from the drive thru actually came in and were missing food people were upset this restaurant is extremely dirty has not been cleaned garbage is not been taken out. Just now a gentleman was waiting 4 minutes to be greeted and was NOT until he yelled out "anybody home". This is unreal. Never seen a Wendy's this disorganized. Never coming here again! And getting my money back for this horrible experience. This is not a joke as we left the drive thru guy empties some sort of tray out of the window and apologized to me for seeing it. UNREAL!

3.description: This is a gem of a shop. From vintage to new everything is special. Repairs are also available. I truly enjoy spending an hour or so looking at all the wonderful dolls. The owners are friendly and make you feel appreciated too.

1.description: Absolutely terrible. The people are so rude. We walked in and were not even greeted. The people at the counter couldn't stop talking to their friends about a show on Netflix to help us. When we finally got their attention the old lady was even more rude. I asked if they would take a certain amount for a doll that wasn't even marked. Her response was "I can't negotiate on that and prices are NOT negotiable" I will make sure everyone I know that is a collector to stay away from here. They are rude and don't deserve the business.

2.description: If you like dolls & stuffed animals then you should go and just look...  If you like to browse around and look at things you'll be here for hours...It's like a museum but you can buy everything

0.description: I made the mistake of tagging along with my wife to Gigis, about 3 hours later she was ready to go. She has such a good time every time she visits looking for Barbie clothes I just didn't have the heart to make her leave. If you are interested in any type of dolls or accessories you need to check out Gigis. I must admit I was checking out the goods as well some are antique and rare. Have Fun. The owners are great to talk to and very helpful for those hard to buy for persons on you gift list.

58.description: Sauzich, giardiniera, well done pizza.  A little Full Tilt and you got yourself a Friday night.
