56.description: Boy, I feel bad doing this, BUT....we had our party here and Phil's let us down.  We had the party room booked for 4 hrs, but they only had the food out for 1 hr. They wouldn't put the appetizers out earlier as we expected, everything was served at the same time, then they cleared it all away  They didn't like us much, they said we were too loud.  Instead of asking us to turn down our music, the manager came in and turned down the music herself.  We all still had a good time but they won't get return business from me.

29.description: Since we moved to the neighborhood a couple years ago, we've tried numerous pizza places and Phil's has by far been the best.  The thin crust pizza is so delicious and so cheesy!!  The breaded mushrooms are good too.

42.description: I wish they had 6 stars because you have to have this pizza dining in. I don't know how they do it but I really like them better then when they were on NOrthwest hwy. I ate at the Mikwaukee place one other time. I think this place gets better everytime. There is nothing fancy about their pizza. Kind of reminds me of how places did pizza in the 90s. Not fancy but good. Oh and their pizza is just as good cold the next day.

23.description: WOW 4.5 stars! - really FRESH and REALLY good pizza!Thin crust is GREAT & pan was very good ; But,  regardless which type - the cheese & all ingredients are just so FRESH,  and sauce is also very good (just the right taste) ...I order well done,  but not burnt - it's  baked just perfect!Love that Bacaroni & Sam special pizza .Great & friendly service ...Damn, All these  years,  how did I  miss such great pizza place?!

47.description: I have only had their pizza, and only thin, but is really really good, and for the price, Great!  Good quality thin crust, great service and byob- absolutely  worth a vist if you find your self on the north-west side of Chicago

8.description: My family has been loyal Phil's enthusiasts for 30 years or more now. Best pie in the city, period. Six stars.

31.description: The best thin crust pizza in Norwood Park! Hands down. Love it.

34.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and so far this is the best pizza I have found. Good balance of sauce and cheese, nice portion of toppings. Room is a bit sterile but still comfortable.

16.description: Had an awesome experience here! New to the area and found Phil's on yelp! Family owned business and the staff treated me like family. Gave me a history lesson about their business. Delicious pizza and their cheesy garlic bread hit the spot. I will definitely reorder!

13.description: I went to Phil on Saturday night it was a party in the banquet room.  I notice the one service who is the owner wife was very rude.  She acted like she didn't want us there.

11.description: Great pizza great fries staff very friendly pizza always on time veey reasonable prices

39.description: Hey, this place was recommended to me by a local in Jefferson Park and WOW---what a great find!  They deliver in their area or you can carry -out or eat in. Closed on Mondays.I got a take out pizza and salad and was so impressed at how good everything was. The pizza had just the right balance of sauce to crust and the ingredients were so fresh. I especially loved the flavor of the pepperoni and the crispness of the crust. The salad was much bigger than I though it would be and it was amazing. The restaurant is on a funky little corner so as you are driving down Milwaukee, make sure that you don't miss it (I drove right past it the first time). They have diagonal parking right next to the building on the side street so that was convenient to go in an pick-up my order. The staff, both on the phone and in person, were very friendly and helped me get my order the way I wanted it. I appreciate that they handled my special request with no problems.They have a small very casual dining room too so if you want to eat in, you can. This is my new favorite place to get pizza.

37.description: Phil's is a really good pizza place in Jeff Park and it's BYOB. Try the thin crust pizza and bring your fav brew. The place is nothing special but tasty food, great service, and even a low key place to watch the game.

0.description: Excellent pizza! Great service too! Didn't like the construction on Milwaukee!

38.description: Excellent, especially thick/pan pizza and that Mediterranean bread and that salad!  Awesome, friendly staff.

51.description: I cannot believe I have waited this long to write a review.  Phil's, forgive me!  My husband and I are close to clinical obsession with Phil's, even so that we had our wedding rehearsal here...and...I purchased a pizza warmer container for my husband for Christmas so that he or I can pick up the pizza, without fear that it will get cold on the 30 minute drive back to our condo :)  In fact, we live down the street from a Giordano's and across the street from Gino's North and down the street from Pete's Pizza...all legit restaurants that serve great pizza, but still, it's NOT Phil's!  Eating in is also a nice option.  Their chicken parm is quite fantastic, as well, as their service, simple decor, and parking situation.  The BYOB option is also quite amazing. No need to feel awkward about bringing in a sixer of beer instead of the typical bottle of wine here, and the best part...no cork fees.   We may or may not have brought in a box of wine at one point too.  A+!

27.description: UPDATE:  12 months later and this is still the only place we get pizza. We have tried a few other places since this place in the last year but, we haven't found anything is Phil's yet. Pizza still just as great. Staff is fast, friendly, efficient and overall great. Whether you dine in or get for pick up you can expect great food and excellent service.

32.description: Pizza was delicious (pepperoni and mushroom) but server was awkward. Maybe they should have someone in front to greet costumers. We walked in and didn't know if we should sit down or wait to be seated. It wasn't until one of the cooks walked out of the kitchen and told us to sit. If service was better, I would give more than 3 stars.

54.description: To stuff or not to stuff, that is the question.We started with Phil's special salad with house dressing.  Pepperoni, cubed cheese, tomato, black olives and iceberg lettuce.  Very crisp salad, the dressing could have been more memorable.  We also had complimentary thin crisp garlic toast.  It was pretty tasty, very crunchy.  For pizza we went with a large (14") stuffed pizza pie with sausage, green olive and onion.  The pan pizza and stuffed pizza are priced with the cheese base, additional toppings are $2.10 each, adds up quick.  I've decided deep dish pizza like this requires at least 3 toppings otherwise its just all lot of cheese.  The cheese to topping/sauce/crust on the stuffed pizza is almost 3:1.  This is a cheese lovers pizza for sure, I was a little in over my head on this one.  Dare I say I would have liked more pizza sauce and a little less cheese.  It was so very filling and I felt like I ate a half ton of melted string cheese.  Luckily, the leftovers reheated nicely.

48.description: I know a lot of the review are about the pizza but I went here with my fiance and we had pasta because we wanted something a little quicker. Overall the pasta was OK, but nothing spectacular. I had the spaghetti with garlic and olive oil and my fiance had the spinach lasagna. They do have a larger menu than I would have expected so maybe I just need to try something different. I did the find the server very friendly and attentive so that is why I gave then the extra star. i hope to try this place again and try their pizza.

44.description: Phil's is a lot less greasy than most places. Though I I truly love NY pizza, this is where I go in my neighborhood when I craze pizza. The owners are great and they accommodate my crazy requests (half pineapple half roast beef - don't judge).  :)

24.description: Decided to give them another shot. 2 to be exact. Whoever answers the phones is far more pleasant now. I only stick to the pizza here. I've been really disappointed with the other food. But the pizza is amazing. I just hate that Phils opens so late. I can't even begin to count how many times i've had to get food from somewhere else because they weren't open yet. People do like pizza before 4 p.m ya know :)

7.description: The last few times my family and I ordered delivery from Phil's,  the pizza was stuck to the cardboard so bad we ended up throwing out half the pie.  Also on one occasion we collected enough tickets for the free  pizza and they couldn't have been any ruder when we called in to place the order, it sounded like they were annoyed about it. Why even advertise the deal if your just going to be jerks about it to your customers?? Pizza and customer service was much better when Phil's was on Northwest hwy.  If you want delicious pizza and good service go to Paninos in Park Ridge.

49.description: I haven't updated this review in a while. I had a baked sausage panzerotti and it was great. I have had both the fried and baked and I prefer the baked version.The crust was perfect and there were just the right amount of filling. They then put a little sauce on the top before baking. This extra sauce gets a little sweet from the heat and is oh so good.It's going to be a toss up between their thin crust pizza and baked panzerotti. They are both excellent.The people are great and the place is alway very clean.I will continue to return here.

40.description: Forgive me father, for I have sinned.....in not writing this review sooner.I salivate like Pavlov's dog at the thought of Phil's.  Their thin crust sausage pizza would be my last meal on death row.  Their friendly servers would be my chosen executioners.  BYOB - that means bring your cooler, your favorite box of Franzia, and your kids for a fulfilling and inexpensive night out.

53.description: I was stuck between 3 and 4 stars, and went with 3 then changed it to 4. The staff here is very good- everyone is friendly and courteous. There is a guy waiter in the late afternoon/early evening who is consistently great. We had a private party here, and I did love the way the staff helped us set up, and also the way they went from table to table throughout the dinner service and offered to get coffee, etc, and offered the dessert we'd brought. There were two women helping with it, and both took the initiative to help us in all things. So in that respect, this is a great place to have an event.I am not a huge fan of the pizza...it is good but doesn't blow me away. I do like the crust. I am a fan of the pasta with marinara! It was delicious at our event! However, the party room we were in had a giant open doorway (5 times the width of a door) to the actual restaurant seating area. The night we were there, they seemed to purposely seat all incoming guests in the tables directly adjacent to the large open arch to the party room. Maybe they wanted to give the appearance of a "happening place" since there were only a handful of regular tables filled. But they complained we were making too much noise, and I think it could have been handled better. We're not kids, and our business far outnumbered the other guests that came in that night. The party room we were given (don't know if they have others) is completely open to the restaurant!Pluses are the staff, some good dishes, the convenient location, and even the party room is nice. Minuses are they need privacy screens or maybe actual glass doors between the restaurant and their private area, and also need to have a plan in place for how to address issues of loud music from a party. Maybe it all has to be understood in advance, or structurally accounted for.Would I use them again? Yes. But since we would want to run the event in the same way we did, I think there would have to be some changes made regarding both expectations and delivery of services from Phil's.

30.description: Really good neighborhood pizza place. My family has gone here for the past few years and have really enjoyed the food.  Unfortunately, they have really raised prices, and cut back on service. I can't think of any other restaurant that charges for table bread. I'm assuming its in an attempt to compensate for other similar restaurants opening nearby. Unfortunately, it was the wrong way to go. Prices are too steep compared to those places.

46.description: Been around forever and has always been excellent.  We pass several pizza places to get there but it is worth it.  their party room is excellent too.

1.description: I eat a lot of pizza ... New to the area and looking for pizza that has the wow factor ... Got the Phil's special extra thin well done.  This pizza was good, no frills just a decent pizza.- crust: ok, crispy decent- sauce: above average, has a hint of a sweeter flavor profile - toppings: ok, standard nothing to complain about

55.description: Phil's thin crust is great.  Just about any pizza you order from Phil's will be great.  We order from Phil's a few times a month... always half-cheese (for the kiddies) and half-sausage and onions.  The crust is crisp, kind of like a cracker, but holds up well to their toppings.  Their sides/appetizer are average.  We've had their poppers, mozzarella sticks, veggie mix, and cheese fries.  The pastas are also average.  Their lasagna and chicken parmesan are ok.  DO NOT ORDER the burgers.  I ordered one last night and it was by far the worst burger I've ever had.  The meat was burned, dried out, and tasted like cardboard.  It was really, really bad.  I guess it's my fault for ordering a burger from a pizza joint.  So bottom line, GREAT PIZZA delivered to your home in about an hour.

9.description: been ordering our Pizza from Phils for 40 years now and can't even think of going anywhere else.Over the years we have tried a few others, mostly if we order on a Monday and Phil's is closed,  but they don't even come close to Phil's.Great crust and gotta try Sal's extra thin crust, awesome.Fast courteous delivery, great prices and always consistent quality, no reason to look else where.

26.description: Their pizza is really good!! My family just recently ordered a thin pizza with many toppings and it was really tasty! We live down the street from this restaurant and we always see the delivery guys driving back and fourth! They are on top of it. Check this place out, the owner is really nice too!

25.description: Pizza is ok , sauce is a little to tangy , other then that everything else off the menu taste like it came right of of the freezer bag ,live across the street for a year and would still prefer pequads or la villa over this place any day

12.description: My wife has been ordering from Phil's for 20 years and I for 10..... We are never disappointed! Quality ingredients, delicious sauce and great service. They are part of the foundation of Norwood Park and we are lucky to have them. Thanks guys!

59.description: Delicious Delicious Delicious! My husband & I stopped by while we were in the area. We were told how delicious the food was at this place, so we decided to try it. It was a great experience coupled up by delicious pizza with the sauce being as authentic and tasty (made to perfection) just like my great aunts sauce at our family Sunday dinners! It's very hard to find that kind of old world quality food that makes you feel like your in a small town pizzeria in Sicily! The waiter was very attentive and prices are very reasonable. A great personable relaxing place to enjoy very good food and the feel of a family environment! I LUV LUV LUV IT & will be returning soon!!! 8)

21.description: Pizza awesome,salad dressing very good! Dining in not real pleasant,drafty,banquet chairs not comfortable.Did notice a lot of take out orders,I think we will join that group or delivery. Been in private room & comfortable.Also did not know was a BYOB. Overall very fresh & good food.

17.description: To stuff or not to stuff, that is the question.We started with Phil's special salad with house dressing.  Pepperoni, cubed cheese, tomato, black olives and iceberg lettuce.  Very crisp salad, the dressing could have been more memorable.  We also had complimentary thin crisp garlic toast.  It was pretty tasty, very crunchy.  For pizza we went with a large (14") stuffed pizza pie with sausage, green olive and onion.  The pan pizza and stuffed pizza are priced with the cheese base, additional toppings are $2.10 each, adds up quick.  I've decided deep dish pizza like this requires at least 3 toppings otherwise its just all lot of cheese.  The cheese to topping/sauce/crust on the stuffed pizza is almost 3:1.  This is a cheese lovers pizza for sure, I was a little in over my head on this one.  Dare I say I would have liked more pizza sauce and a little less cheese.  It was so very filling and I felt like I ate a half ton of melted string cheese.  Luckily, the leftovers reheated nicely.

10.description: Been eating at phils for 16 years my go to place for pizza stuffed or thin and there pasta and sandwich  dishes just as delicious  and awsome  love it here family owned and there food  is made with quality  ingredients  and love

5.description: Great pizza, seems like a solid neighborhood pizza place.  I will definelty be back.

3.description: Was going to eat at a burger place across the street but had weird hours so we saw Phils, great decision.Very friendly, amazing food, and reasonably priced.Would definately recommend and go back.

35.description: I doubt that my gustatory opinions are worth much. E.g., I thought army food was ok. But after sharing a bottle of vino with my girl friend in a family-run, BYOB Italian restaurant like Phil's Pizza D'Oro or Villa Rosa I become convinced that the world is a much nicer place than it probably is.

19.description: Phil's is a really good pizza place in Jeff Park and it's BYOB. Try the thin crust pizza and bring your fav brew. The place is nothing special but tasty food, great service, and even a low key place to watch the game.

28.description: Best pizza in the hood. Many others have really gone down hill so I tried Phils based on the yelp reviews. Great quality cheese and a bit thicker crust for thin crust but still quality. I could eat a large by myself if I had to but I usually put in fridge for later. Have not eaten in yet but it is a BYOB so I will make my way. Plus they have gluten free pizza and pasta for those cillies in the area.

45.description: Have not been here for some time now... I will NEVER go back.  Ordered some appetizers and a extra large pizza, each of us had a med size soft drink only 3 of us ordered refills.  My bill came and my soft drink order cost MORE than my food!? Huh?I was SHOCKED!  my soft drink bill was approx 25 dollars and there was only 5 of us and 3 were under then age of 8.    I was like WHOA to the waiter and he's like " sorry, no free refills "  I'm sorry... that's insane!    I used to love this place, but after that, I will never ever step foot in there again.  made sure I told all my friends too!

33.description: Will definitely make this a regular place for our pizza! The thin crust was awesome and love all the specialty options. The sauce was so sweet and tasty, couldn't stop eating!  It's a family business and you get that great personal service.

43.description: Had a yen for stuffed za, and wanted to show my Texan GF what Chi-style stuffed is all about.  My memories from decades ago of Uno's initially made me conclude that as an easy choice, but more recent Yelpers changed my mind, and so we were on our way to the far NW side to Phil's which has earned more stars and praise.The complementary garlic bread is nice and crispy and hit the spot with our BYOB prosecco.   Though I think they used garlic powder, not fresh puree-my only neg about the garlic bread which was still very good.  The Phi's Special Salad, kind of an antipasto, was good, but it could have been a little better with nicer olives and one or two more kinds of meat or cheese.  And it could have been a lot better with some house-made Italian, which is seriously, not that hard to make...so why not?We ordered a medium cheese, sausage, mushroom, pepper stuffed medium.  Awesome pizza, worth the wait.  The sauce and crust were excellent, generous amounts of cheese.  It takes 45 minutes, which they tell you on the menu, and you should expect if you've ordered stuffed before anywhere.  We brought tons home for leftovers, a small is actually more than enough for two.  The ambience is very basic, but lots of windows.  Service is very good.

2.description: I can't believe I left the house for this garbage. Spinach lazagna means frozen spinach from a bag between noodles and cheese. The pizza is soft, undercooked and more cheese than anything. When you put too much cheese on a pizza, it doesn't cook all the way through and you can't taste anything else. The salad was made a day before and kept in the fridge. Nothing like cold, oily croutons.The ingredients aren't fresh, the crust is bland and everything else on the menu is greasy.

18.description: Whether it's pizza or pasta you want Phil has it on his menu. My family and I have tried just about everything,  and it's always served hot and fresh. You can set your clock to the delivery person as well.

41.description: One of the best pizzas you'll ever have. Been one of my favorites for years.

52.description: It isn't often that I feel compelled to write a review for a pizzeria because it tends to be a conflict of interest for me being in the pizza business... BUT, this place deserves all 5 stars I'm giving it.  Their sign makes mention of their Pan & Stuffed pizzas but lets not forget about the amazing thin crust tavern style pizza.  I thoroughly enjoyed the thin crust as it was very crispy, had the sweet sauce, and you can tell they spent good money on a higher quality cheese.  Oh yeah and as far as the cheese goes they don't put it on sparingly... TONS of it.  I had the sausage & garlic thin crust which was outstanding, and then a stuffed spinach which was better than the big name places you find downtown.  Bruschetta app was great, and the staff was friendly and prompt.  This is what Chicago pizza is all about, can't wait to go back.

50.description: Living in Chicago my entire life has exposed me to more pizza than is probably healthy to eat. I've had it all, thin, stuffed, pan, you name it and I've tried almost every major establishment and then some. Phil's Pizza should definately be on the list of classic Chicago restaurants.  The traditional Italian/Sicilian owners bring family friendly values to the table along with good service and great food. The wait staff is highly dedicated and accommodating; they will make you feel right at home. Try my favorite-- the sausage, onion, green pepper thin crust--it is soooooo good!

4.description: We have been going here for the last year and the thin crust pizza is good. We only have dined in and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The place is very quiet, comfortable, clean, and great for kids. A big plus is that it is a byob.

6.description: In these parts, there are probably 40 pizza places within 2.5 miles of my house and about 20 within 1 mile of my house. Phils Pizza D' Oro is about 2 miles away and it's our staple when we order pizza. It's hard to find better. My brother-in-law from California is hooked on it too. He can't wait to come out and visit and the first place i take him when his flight gets in is Phil's Pizza D' Oro.

22.description: I'm torn in writing this review.  I found this place reading the yelp reviews. We ordered 2 cheesy garlic breads, 1 16 inch cheese, and 1 9 inch cheese. It started off just like most of the reviews say awesome. The garlic bread was a huge hit with my kids. The 16 inch thin was also amazing worthy of a 5 star review. Finally the 9 inch stuffed came, this is when the reviews fell short. The crust was burnt, the sauce had a very bad chared flavor to it me and my wife had a half of a piece of pizza and gave up. We informed the server who asked us if we wanted to speak to a boss. I'm sorry a good server goes to the boss says they didn't like the pizza and we're raving about the rest of the food and have charge removed. Nope I paid 16 bucks for a piece of burnt nasty pizza. Well for this you have lost my business this was my first and last visit it is a shame cause it was amazing food till the end. When presented an opportunity to fix a problem fix it. I would have done dessert but after I received bill and realized he didn't fix the bill after seeing how disappointed we were we left and went to duffs dogs for dessert. Shame was a nice little place with amazing pizza would have been one of my favorites.

15.description: First off I love that this is a neighborhood and family business.   The thin crust is excellent and the prices are reasonable.  I also really love the old time Italian American music they play.   They also have a party room available for rent.

57.description: Placed my 1st order with them this evening and went to pick it up. I ordered an order of bruschetta that was soo bad that we only ended up eating 1 piece of it and throwing the rest in the garbage it has an olive oil/vinigear tast to it that is HORRIABLE.. the pizza I ordered was the sausage mushroon, green pepper and onion and all you could taste was the green pepper. i will not be ordering from here again thanks for having me throw away $22.00.

20.description: The thin crust half roast beef half sausage with extra special sauce is by far the best pizza pie you can buy. Add a chicken Caesar salad and you have a great dinner. The customer service is unbelievable. It's a great family owned restaurant. Try it you won't be disappointed.

36.description: Worst pizza I have had since Dominoes. Utterly tasteless. Delivery quick and good price. Won't call again. BAD.

14.description: WOW 4.5 stars! - really FRESH and REALLY good pizza!Thin crust is GREAT & pan was very good ; But,  regardless which type - the cheese & all ingredients are just so FRESH,  and sauce is also very good (just the right taste) ...I order well done,  but not burnt - it's  baked just perfect!Love that Bacaroni & Sam special pizza .Great & friendly service ...Damn, All these  years,  how did I  miss such great pizza place?!

3.description: It is ok for a quick stop off, but the fries are nowhere near as good as Natalie's. The kebab was good, the Greek chicken was not to my liking. It had a bitter taste. I will try the hot dogs and burgers and see how that goes.

1.description: OK for a quick burger. Mag's comes in somewhere between fast fast food and a good restaurant burger in terms of quality and price. $8 for the burger combo I took off one star since the cook or cashier, or both, kept going into the back room and smoking.  The nasty smell wafted into the dining area. I appreciate that everyone likes a  break, especially when you're in a small business, but it should not make your guests uncomfortable.

2.description: Mag's grill took over Natalie's a few months ago and I'll have to say I'm very impressed. I had their Italian beef. Now I took one star away because they added sport peppers instead of giardiniera. But the overall beef was good. Good sized and well seasoned. Much better beef then Natalie's. Next time I will try their steak sandwich because that's what I always ordered from Natalie's because they did have a real good steak sandwich. My mom had the Polish and she said it was better then Natalie's. The fries originally were fresh cut now are crinkle cut ones. But their fries were better then Natalie's. Overall they are really good. Good service and fast too. Hopefully the owner doesn't pull his hair out dealing with the Taft students.

5.description: Now open. Food is ok. Had a hot dogs, gyros, fries and tamale from this place. Location was formerly Natalie's. Fries are supposed to be hand cut but I don't think so.

6.description: Excellent food. Excellent service. Very welcoming environment and lovely people. Will definitely go back. I had the polish, my mom and son had the burger, my cousin had the patty melt and my other cousin had a hot dog.

7.description: My fiance and I came for breakfast & were very pleased. Small menu, but the 2 egg plate we both ordered was better than many diner options we've tried in the 'hood. Not greasy, breakfast potatoes were great, and well priced. Will definitely grab quick breakfast here on a Sunday again. And regular lunch and dinner menu has great options we look forward to trying.

0.description: I like how this place is looking all spruced up after new owners taking over this place! Not that I felt anything was wrong with Natalie's but I guess I can't help compare the food that used to be served before. I like the gyro with grilled onion with a generous portion of meat even without paying for extra meat and the Italian beef gravy had a good kick to it but I didn't like the meat texture which wasn't as tender as I'd like it to be but service is quick and good!

4.description: Gyros are unreal. Especially with extra meat for 2 bucks. It was like heaven in my mouth. Only took off 1 star because i was obsessed with Natalie's fries and Mags doesnt compare...but everything else was above Natalies!

28.description: Been here a few times already and will definitely keep going back.  The burger and fries were the best I have had in a long time!  The portions on everything we've ordered so far are huge (even the kid's meal cheeseburger).  I also tried the burrito dinner on one visit and it was good, but nothing to get excited about.  I will stick to Taco Burrito King when I want Mexican food.  Clean place, large menu with lots of variety, fast and friendly service   - all at a good price.

1.description: First time at Brandy's and I will be back. I had a gyro that I thought was among my top 3. My fiancé had the cheesy beef that she ate most of it which not a norm given her small size and the huge portions. I was very impressed with how clean the place was and bathroom was spotless. Forgive me but I do judge bathroom cleanliness. They do get busy so you wait 7-10 minutes but it's understandable.

9.description: Savvas must be the owner because I've never had a good experience at this place.  The food never comes the way you order it and it's not very good.  It's very expensive and don't know why it's still here. I live two minutes away but rather take the trip to Kings down five blocks to eat good food at a reasonable price.  If by chance savvas you are the owner you should reevaluate what your serving.

29.description: Brandy's is a huge upgrade from the Steers restaurant that once was housed at this location.The Gyros is pretty good. I have not tried anything else there yet, but I see no reason why other food selections would not be good as well.

23.description: It's a decent place to stop in when you don't want to cook! I like their rotisserie chicken dinners, soups, and salads. Not a fan of they're gyros though. The first time I had one, the meat was super thin and dry. Not the best gyros in my opinion.

5.description: Gone here a few times dont really care for there food and im by far not a picky person  ive had there burgers just ok i dont like there fries at all i had there pepper and egg sandwich  way to much peppers had a super taco the beef was dried out and old the only thing i will get from here is there soups or chilli other then that ill pass plus i think there exspensive  for what you get along with there additude  and rudness

25.description: the beefs are good,tacos are excellent,lasagna and pasta dishes very good,friendly service too.i love the great new location and late hours.the wait can be a while....call your order in ahead of time.and try the banana shake it's great.

12.description: I ordered food for delivery today from the website and I received email about 1/2 hr of order stating order has been completed (order #5244) so I took that as my confirmation we should expect delivery soon.  After an hour and a half went by, I called the restaurant and the guy who answered said he did not have our order.  Basically he was very non-concerning that we received email with order # and how long we already waited.  I asked him so what does that mean, you won't full-fill our order and he said he could take our order but he won't be able to get our food to us for maybe 45 mins.  Didn't offer to make it right or apologize for the delay....just kept saying he did all his orders and did not have mine.  I chose the Brandy's on Milwaukee from the 4 choices on their website.  After I concluded he wasn't willing to make it right, I just told him forget about it and ordered from Twins Gyros on Harlem which uses Grub Hub app where you can at least track your order on the app to see is the order is with delivery person.  For a customer to receive a confirmation email and never get their order is uncalled for.  Even if went to wrong location, the restaurant should have either called customer or called the nearest location to place order.  I usually stop here after work to pick up dinner once in a while but after this i will find another place.

21.description: Talk about a big menu, so much to choose from! Great place, good food and prices. Nice and clean, perfect to pick up and or dine in. We are walking distance, will be a go to for when I don't feel like cooking!

16.description: We just moved to the neighborhood and can't stop going to Brandy's.  They have a huge selection of food and everything we've had so far has been great!  We just can't get over their gyros plate.  You get a huge pile of yummy gyros, rice or greek potatoes, pita and a salad (we get the greek).  We've also had the Italian beef and again, great quality and flavor.  The fries are always good, but we are trying to cut down, so we opt for the rice or greek potatoes.  They serve Coke products which makes us very happy.  The staff is very friendly and patient when you can't decide.  They are always cleaning when we're there which makes us folks in the restaurant biz very happy.  We think their prices are fair considering the quality of their product and portion size.  We always need a to go box!  The only drawback is the small and oddly shaped parking lot, but what can they do?  Yes, you should go to Brandy's!

17.description: It's a decent place to stop in when you don't want to cook! I like their rotisserie chicken dinners, soups, and salads. Not a fan of they're gyros though. The first time I had one, the meat was super thin and dry. Not the best gyros in my opinion.

10.description: This is one of the few fast food places I can eat at. As a Vegan, it can be really hard when a place mostly sells burgers and hot dogs. I ordered the Greek salad w/ no cheese. It was huge and filling. They do also have a Veggie burger, that is not just a Boca party. It's very big. Definitely worth many trips back.

11.description: This place is pretty good if you are looking for a good gyro. Their menu is huge and I wasn't sure what to get. The people who work their are very nice as well. This place isn't totally amazing but it's good if you are looking for a quick bite to eat.

26.description: This is the second Brandy's in my neighborhood and it's as equally consistent as the first. Both Brandy's serve up great Gyros/Hamburger/Hotdog/Fries/Salads type food.Speaking of ... they have fantastic fries and salads!I'm totally addicted to their large Greek Salad with grilled chicken breast. Delish.Second favorite ... their Chicken Kabob Dinner.Next ... their Chicken Pita (it comes with a honey mustard sauce, but I order with it their yummy Tzatziki Sauce)Best Gyro Plate in the neighborhood. (one of the best on the NW side)If you're in the mood for some good, fast, no nonsense, better than the USUAL hotdog/hamburger stand food, you will not be disappointed.Delivery is available, but I live so close I always use the carryout.

27.description: I highly recommend trying Brandys. Chicken Souvlaki is the best I ever hadBurgers are big and flavorfulItalian Beef.... Where do I start? They offer the largest beef sandwich I have ever seen. It has to be a foot long and stuffed with meat. They even deliver.

0.description: My stars say it all. If you expect Michelin Star food at a fast food joint...you're in the wrong place. There are plenty of starred restaurants in Chicago. If you're looking for non super-chain fast food, this place will do perfectly.This joint hits the spot every time. I love their cheese fries and shakes most. Everything else is solid and you can't go wrong. I'll definitely be back soon.

20.description: They struggle getting to go orders correct.  0-3 in orders we have placed.  Check before leaving.  Dine in for some reason gets it right.

19.description: place is the worst ! i will never eat there.... everyone is intitled to there opinion ....so go try it for yourself they have such an adittude it's a joke food sucks!

2.description: Usually stick to cheeseburger but totally craving bbq & potatoes and u know that feeling where u are sooooo happy went to the right place because they got it right..? Rarely, right? This place hit the spot & surpassed it with the rib tips! Now I have a second fav @brandys.

18.description: Brandy's is a huge upgrade from the Steers restaurant that once was housed at this location.The Gyros is pretty good. I have not tried anything else there yet, but I see no reason why other food selections would not be good as well.

13.description: Update!  I really like traditional Greek pastitsio and my first visit to Brandy's was not very good.  But I decided to give them a second chance on 1/4/15 and it was much better than the first!

4.description: I'm giving it 5 cuz there really isn't anything completely amazing in the area for comparison.  You'll get good quality food.  Oftentimes I get sketchy on quicker joints that sells 200 items on their menu. But everything I've had is pretty legit. We often end up here when I'm at my parents' house, either 1: too lazy to cook. 2: not wanting to get into a food coma from a buffet, 3: in the area and wanting good fast food without driving crazy far for it.Gyros: Pretty tasty. Even the pita bread is yummy! Fries: thick-cut fries where you can taste the potato. I always order a side of cheese. Can't go wrong.Chicken/Steak Philly: I've had better, but it's really not bad. Sometimes a little over kill on the onion, but otherwise delish. It's huge, and I usually am able to only finish half.BBQ ribs: they actually have a great sauce.Hot dogs: standard, but good.It's a clean and more updated atmosphere.  Open late, which is always great for me. And it's reasonably priced. I'd rather pay a decent amount to eat well, and this place is up to par.

24.description: Huge menu. Good food. I recommend the chicken gyros with a side of curly fries. You won't be disappointed.

6.description: IWas there last night omg Brandy's got slam pack they must been there 50 People in line finely I got my gyros omg the best I ever had !!! I'm going back tonight for more !!!

22.description: Absolutely everything you expect from a fast food "Gyros, Chicken, Ribs Place"  Great food and a HUGE menu.  They are not super fast or super cheap and really this is a very good thing because nothing comes from super fast and super cheap.

15.description: Is it just me or did prices go up? Walked in and right out last time when I realized I was about to spend $10+ for a freakin salad! Not sure if we'll be back any time soon.

7.description: We are usually a big fan of Brandy's but our latest meal from there left us very disappointed.My husband ordered the bacon cheeseburger and he swore he could taste the fillers in the meat. I ordered a kids chicken finger meal then received (and paid for) a full size meal and I ordered my self the Gyro, which was the worst ever!The taste was there but it was the size of a taco and the pita was so doughy I couldn't even eat it. I also asked for a side of feta, which I THINK they put in there but all I had was a cup of some stuff sitting in a ton of oil...oil?!?! What ever happened to a fresh side of crumbled feta cheese?!?Almost $40 for some very poor quality food and even worse I had to throw most of it away....

8.description: I came in last Thursday to dine in. It was such a horrible environment!! I didn't even want to stay there after waiting for my food because it sounded like a Mexican Night Club.... I was simply just trying to watch a game on the TV & there Mexican music was so loud I couldn't even hear the TV. It was really unpleasant & it was so awkward when I walked in and sat down, everyone who was working behind the counter wouldn't stop starring at me. My food wasn't all that either! I got a gyro, but the onions tasted way too old & their cumber sauce had huge chunks of parsley which threw the gyro off!

3.description: This also includes the store on Harlem Ave as well.Great variety but way to expensive for the quality of food you get. Not one single item stands out compared to other such food joints in the same area.Again, the one positive about this place is that it is truly a one stop shop. Quantity not Quality.This could have been fixed by now ... I wouldn't know it because I will never do this again. They now offer on-line ordering. The last time I used this option I was billed $7.00 more, no not for delivery nor that the tip was included which it wasn't, nor for a "convenience fee", again it wasn't. No I was charged this because their web-site at the time did not reflect their store price change, again at the time I was not aware of. I called the store after finding out that my receipt at the time of delivery did not reflect the receipt I "AGREED TO" on-line. After 45 minutes of arguing with the manager that should not be the customers fault and that "the fault" should be on their inability to control their web-site the manager agreed to reimburse me the difference. After several months they never did,What I said before I still stand by ... 2 stars for quality. ZERO stars for business sense. I lost $7.00 ... by my estimate they lost a few hundred $$$ by not correcting this.

14.description: This is the second Brandy's in my neighborhood and it's as equally consistent as the first. Both Brandy's serve up great Gyros/Hamburger/Hotdog/Fries/Salads type food.Speaking of ... they have fantastic fries and salads!I'm totally addicted to their large Greek Salad with grilled chicken breast. Delish.Second favorite ... their Chicken Kabob Dinner.Next ... their Chicken Pita (it comes with a honey mustard sauce, but I order with it their yummy Tzatziki Sauce)Best Gyro Plate in the neighborhood. (one of the best on the NW side)If you're in the mood for some good, fast, no nonsense, better than the USUAL hotdog/hamburger stand food, you will not be disappointed.Delivery is available, but I live so close I always use the carryout.

28.description: Maybe I'm missing something but I absolutely adore this place. I come here all the time. Their vegetable egg fried rice is awesome and we always pair it with their Mongolian chicken or beef. Their basil beef is awesome too. They package everything nicely for take-home and were at some point setting up an online order and delivery service. I've never been treated rudely by the people and they always remember my usual order. The only downfall of this place is that it isn't very good for dining-in.

1.description: So, so good! We ordered two dinner specials which are huge, 1/2 the container is your entree, the other 1/2 is fried rice, with an egg roll, also ordered two cans of soda. Our bill was $17.05, we happily put $3 into the tip jar for a grand total of $20.05. This is the best deal, if you are not a big eater it's easily 4 meals. If you have a hearty appetite, it's 2 meals. Everything was fresh and piping hot when it came out. Please give them a try, especially if you get off at the Harlem stop for the Blue Line. So glad we have them a try today!

9.description: Still the best Chinese restaurant around. The food is great with huge portions and the owner is a hard worker who always tries to please and accommodate his customers. He is very personable and no matter how busy they are, my order is always correct and fresh. I hope they stay in business for a long time!

29.description: I was not thrilled with my first couple of visits to this place because I found their attitude to be on the rude side.  Upon the urging of a couple neighbors of mine, I decided to give them another chance.  I don't know if they have new management but they still are not the most charming or lovable people in the world, but for placing an order to go, it is worth stopping in for the good deals that you get and the food has improved since my last visit.  The shrimp fried rice was very good.  However there is no ambience or charm, it is very plain on the inside and this is a mostly 'to go' kind of place.

23.description: Good (not great) orange chicken. Quiet spot.

5.description: Weird, called 5 times to place an order for pick up, it just rings and rings and then a recording asks me for an "access code". Too bad, guess they don't want my business .

25.description: Ever since my beloved, aka Lin's Garden on Milwaukee abruptly closed it's doors a year or so ago, I have been SEARCHING for a local Chinese place. And when I say searching, I mean asking anyone with a take-out box where the hell they got it from and threatening them if they don't reveal the source.So, I went on yelp.....and the rest is history.This place, nor any Chinese place will top Lin's, but it's neck-in-neck. They not only have a ton of vegetarian options, they give you the option of no MSG, they cook everything to order...the list goes on.I normally have a feeding frenzy when I eat Chinese and this place is another reason why that will continue.Everything is great, have yet to have a so-so dish here. Big portions supplemented by big flava! Love it!

12.description: I absolutely hate this place, not because if the food (even though the food is not good), but because the customer service. They charged me more than once more for the items I did not received. When I called to address the situation the staff was extremely rude.  Their dinner special also does not include a drink, even though the menu says it does. When I inquired about that the young man working there started swearing at me and told me to never order from them again. When I asked to talk to the owner he said he was the owner and hung up on me.

21.description: You can eat there but you can't wash your hands or use the bathroom. Had to use the bathroom at the bar next door. If they have tables and seats the least they can do is have a small sink to wash your hands. What kind of crap is that. Food was OK. Just another average hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. I wont be returning.

16.description: Not happy at all with my food and I so wnted it to just be decent since I live next to this place.I chose noodles instead of rice and they were the exact same thing that comes out of a top ramen package.The Orange chicken was terrible as well. The two stars is because there service was ok otherwise it would be one star

17.description: I have ordered from this place quite a few times now. Consistently good food. The dinner combos are huge, comes with an eggroll and a can of pop! The delivery service is pretty quick too.

10.description: I love this place, the food is good, reasonably priced, and always arrives hot. What more can you ask.

11.description: got lunch delivery, weekdayFor two of us to eat, was $13.65 incl tax,tip, delivery.  HUGE Portions, food piping hot.I had the lunch special mongolian beef which came with heaps of chix fried rice, egg roll and pop.  Flavor was good (beef tasted like BEEF, not like a facsimilie as some Chineste placed) and easily had enough left over for dinner.   Egg roll wasn't as good  both in flavor and not crisp like I like it, so that is the reason I rank 4.  Dining companion got chicken lo mein and thought it was tasty too.  Will order again!

26.description: one of the better of the americanized chinese joints. quick, inexpensively delivery by way of a friendly member of the trans-gender community (seriously) and without fail comes *PIPING* hot.  to the point that you cannot handle the aluminum portion of the packaging for a few moments. for the best price, try to dine before 3pm.  their lunch menu bolsters an entree, fried rice (see that coming?) can of soda, egg roll, soup and a small desert (usually a type of packaged jello) for just under $6.if i can tender a complaint, it would be a relative lack of true variety of flavor.  most entrees taste remarkably similar. please note this something i hold against most of the americanized chinese restaurants. so please FRE, dont be afraid to make some things truly spicy! us yanks can take it!

27.description: Their Yang Chow Fried Rice is the best!!!!!

0.description: Hands-down, one of the best Chinese food places in this neighborhood.  We ordered the egg drop soup, orange chicken, bbq pork, beef kow, potstickers and lo mein combo.  Every single dish was absolutely delicious.  Not greasy.  Not salty.  Not oversauced.  Most importantly, not overpriced!  The food is comparable to any great restaurant in Chinatown.  So glad to have finally discovered this little gem of a place.

20.description: I have ordered from this place quite a few times now. Consistently good food. The dinner combos are huge, comes with an eggroll and a can of pop! The delivery service is pretty quick too.

19.description: They don't devein (de-poop)  their shrimp in the fried rice.  Pretty average place.  Nothing special, Just your typical cheap Chinese place. Oh, and i don't think they've ever cleaned their floor. I guess cleanliness just isn't their "thing."

2.description: In this hood exceptional Chinese restaurants are far and few between. This one definitely stands out. Great service, very friendly owner willing to go above and beyond to make his customers happy, great lunch specials (enough food for two) and they are always willing to substitute something you don't like. If you are anti-MSG like I am, you can request it not to be put in your food. Big thumbs up for that! Most Chinese places load their food with this terrible additive. I order the Szechuan Shrimp lunch special and it is beyond expectation made with lots of jumbo perfectly cooked shrimp. The crab rangoons are unique as they are made with curry powder.Anyone looking for a good Chinese spot for lunch, carryout, dine-in or delivery...give it a try. You shouldn't be disappointed.

18.description: I tried calling friday, twice, and no answer at 6p. Went to Mugs pizza for the first time and was glad I did. Fried Rice lost out on $20-25.

13.description: Ordered from here last night for the first time.  We ordered online, which I would not advise anyone else to do.  Took 10 minutes to enter our order and then 30 minutes later (when food was supposed to be arriving) we got a call that they had a rush and was just now making our food.  I'm guessing the real story was that they had just realized they had an online order.  Anyways, food arrived 25 minutes after the phone call and was hot and fresh.  Sweet and sour chicken was great, as well as the Kung pao chicken.  Portions were very large.  The chicken fried rice was just ok as was the crab rangoon.  I've never seen crab rangoon with yellow tinted mixture inside, so that's what turned me off to it.  Overall food was ok and I might order again, but I'll call in my order next time and skip the crab rangoon.

4.description: Never ordered from here before. Food was disappointing will not order again! What is in the CrabRangoon????? Everything had an odd taste to it.

24.description: Not happy at all with my food and I so wnted it to just be decent since I live next to this place.I chose noodles instead of rice and they were the exact same thing that comes out of a top ramen package.The Orange chicken was terrible as well. The two stars is because there service was ok otherwise it would be one star

6.description: Two stars because we  used to LOVE this place, but it's changed big time and I don't think we'll be ordering from here again. Firstly, they used to give out coupons with their food to redeem for a free app or something and if you got enough you'd get an entree! That is no more. In addition their dinner combo came with fried rice, and egg roll, and a soda. Soda is no more. Lastly menu has changed. I've ALWAYS ordered Hunan Chicken and always loved it, most recently I got it and it was weirdly sweet and almost entirely onions/celery/bok choy/zuchhini with a touch of chicken. It used to be a lot of veggies (broccoli, corn, water chestnut, bamboo shoots, peas) with a lot of chicken. It was SO GROSS. Sorry, we're sticking to our other local favorites.

22.description: Consistently delicious food that's ready quickly and inexpensive.  I've lived about a mile away for 2 years and we got food here about once a month.  I highly recommend the kung pao chicken.

15.description: A fine choice for carry out chinese.  Everything is well prepared and piping hot.  They pack the food in quality containers, so no worry about leakage on the way home.  The basil chicken is good.

7.description: WHERE THE FOOK IS MY RICE?Oh my GAAAAAAWWWWDDDD...(with vocal fry voice) where the fook is my rice? Hey, peeps, I subtracted one star, because this time they did forget the steamed white rice for my order. I should have checked my order before leavin' this little dive, but I did not. Oh well, whatever! I got home and was so upset that the rice was missing. I called the restaurant and informed them. No apology. Nothing. I can imagine the "Deer in the Headlights" look on the person who answer the phone. WTF, so I ended up cooking some rice at home (when I was not in the mood to cook). The more I thought about it the more pist off I became. This is not "Wooooohoooooo as good as it gets" food. It is your basic Chinese food joint. Nothing unique or spectacular about the food. Just something to eat on a Friday evening when you just don't feel like going out after a long week at work or going home and cooking dinner for yourself. It's just "OK" food, but I have definitely had much better elsewhere.

8.description: I moved into the neighborhood in June and have been searching for a Chinese restaurant, as my husband loves Chinese.  I am not a huge fan, but I enjoy some chicken dishes.  My husband has ordered a few times when I wasn't home and has loved every thing he's had.  This past weekend I finally gave in and let the hubby order dinner for us.  My husband initially asked for delivery but changed his mind and told the man he'd pick it up.  I could hear the man say "THANK YOU" and I was across the room.  (It was snowing bad and had been for a couple days).  We got extra white rice and many thank yous for picking up instead of waiting for delivery.  When I got home and bit into my sesame chicken I looked at my husband and said,"FINALLY".  It seriously took us like 6 Chinese places for me to find one I liked.  Thank you Fried Rice Express for making sesame chicken the right way. You have a return customer here.

3.description: I've been enjoying this place for years. The owner is a friendly hard working guy. He's always pleasant if you can catch him on a day he's not in the back. The portions are huge. They have a great combo special that's well worth the next day leftovers. Our favorites are extra spicy orange chicken, beef chop suey and cashew chicken. It's always fresh. They use a lot of meat and vegetables. It's always consistent. Only order from here!

14.description: So gosh darn good.  Sesame chicken, yes please.  I get the small portion which is a very generous size.  Their delivery is fast, the food arrives warm and the employees are very polite.  Ordered wrong the first time, then have stuck with sesame chicken and egg rolls since then and haven't been disappointed.  Fair prices as well.

3.description: One of the most efficient, professional and buyer friendly purchasing experiences I've had. The staff knew their products and helped me to get the best mattress for me. I've had back issues for years, multiple herniated discs in both my lumbar spine as well as cervical spine. I bought a king sized double sided pillow top, as recommended by the employee I spoke with. It has worked wonders for me, as I am now finally able to sleep through a full night comfortably, with less back pain! Overall, top notch customer service, quality product and convenient buying experience. Definitely recommend  Aspen Slumbers to anyone looking for a new bed, especially those wanting to try an alternative treatment to aid in back pain relief. Will be purchasing another for my parents Christmas gift!

1.description: Can't say enough good things about my experience with Aspen Slumbers.  Do to a hectic schedule and move, I was not able to see the mattress in person. I took their word on the quality since I was referred over from a friend. Not only was it a great bargain for the price but the delivery was very prompt and they provided their own financing.  Couldn't be happier. Highly suggest looking in to them as they provide quality products at wholesale prices.

2.description: I was a bit skeptical of the prices and quality of the products when I 1st reviewed them...however, this site is outstanding.  The ordering process was seamless, and the mattress we purchased was of the highest quality.  I want to thank Aspen Slumbers for providing wholesale prices directly to consumers.

0.description: If you want a great mattress without spending thousands at a retail store...call them NOW! I ordered my mattress on Thursday, paid for it on Friday and it was delivered Saturday! My delivery window was 1-5pm, and they were at my house at 2pm on the dot.  My bed is so comfy that I didn't want to leave it to go work! Thank you John and the rest of the crew at Aspen Slumbers for getting my sleep back on track!! I highly recommend them and wouldn't go anywhere else in Chicago for an amazing pillowtop :)

58.description: People who review places like this should really consider the type of place they're reviewing before they get upset. This isn't Alinea or Tru, it's Brandy's. Who cares if the employees barely speak English and drink Modello in the parking lot? It's a Chicago junk food spot! Food is decent here. The fries are cooked well. The gyros are super super greasy though. I don't like mine dripping and I prefer mine cut thinner.The menu is hilariously large. You could eat every day here for 6 months and probably not have the same thing.

56.description: Went there yesterday. I have a half an hour for lunch. I ordered the grilled chicken panini and after only 18 minutes my food arrived. The mother and daughter next to me also also chicken, before I did, and still were waiting after 18 minutes. Ridiculous!  At $10+ for lunch the service should be lightning fast. Horrible wait time and an indifferent attitude from the clerk when I mentioned how horrible the wait time was. I;ll pass from now on.

29.description: The menu at this place is pretty overwhelming, and it could really stand to drop a dozen or so items from the board. There are a few gems here, and the best recommendation I can make is to GO GREEK.  The gyros and Greek chicken? Great! Italian sausage is dry and bland. Burgers are hockey puck-ish.  If Brandy's just stuck to their specialties, I would bump this rating up for sure!

42.description: Weird... It took me a while to remember when I ate here and why I was all the way out in Norwood Park! Anyways, I realized it was on the way to the reception for a friend's wedding and we weren't going to eat for a while. Enter Brandy's.So essentially this is a Greek fast food place with your typical gyros, chicken, burgers, etc. It does have bigger sized meals which I thought was neat, but not right.Food was good, but not out of the ordinary for this type of place. Same for service.

23.description: I got the Greek rotisserie chicken and it was very good. Nice flavorful skin and the meat was juicy and fell off the bone. The corn nuggets are also really good. I was expecting more of a corn fritter, but this is less doughy and more of just deep fried sweet corn. So good though.

47.description: Really yummy burger, gyros are good, fries are super yummy steak fries. Brandy's delivers and they are quick and nice. 5 stars, not a complaint to be had here!

8.description: Anytime I go to Brandy's I always get the chicken kabob salad. It's delicious however as others have stated a bit on the pricey side.

31.description: Nearly $10 for a gyro, fries and drink? It better be excellent for that price. Its just above average here. Seating and parking are easy. Very friendly staff. Dont get me wrong, its not a bad joint to go to, just expect the prices to be a little higher than your typical gyro spot.

34.description: Driven past this place a bunch, but never stopped by.  Partly because the Yelp reviews are pretty off and on for this one.  Tonight, the place I intended to go was closed to Brandy's it was.  I got the gyro meal with everything... everything being sauce, onions and tomato.  Cost was kind of high for a "fast food" type place, but I do agree with others when they say that the portions are quite large.  Especially the fries, I couldn't even finish them.Overall I thought this was tasty.  Not sure if it's the best I've had, it was somewhat greasy, but the pita was absolutely packed with meat.  I give it 3 stars only because of the price I guess.  If I'm going to pay $10 for a sandwich, fries and a drink I could probably go get a good burger or something at a sit-down place right down the road and honestly that would probably win over Brandy's unless I was in a rush.The staff was friendly, the place was clean and the food preparation was fairly quick, appropriate for cooking/preparing food instead of throwing pre-made stuff out the window.I'll probably be back.  Not a first choice, but not a bad choice either.

16.description: It's a fast food even though it doesn't say so. The food isn't that fresh, and I didn't get a good impression from the hygiene of the place. The delivery works fast, and if you need something right now in the middle of the night, sometimes it's better than nothing.

13.description: Gyro, fry, and drink are solid. They are pretty consistent in food quality. Lots of choices.Really quick with pickup/delivery.

11.description: Went here tonight for dinner. Place was busy, dinner time. Girl at the register clearly is a new worker...I don't mind that. (We all were new at a job at some point, right?). When she asked the other girl (I later found out that her name is Penny) a question, who was so very busy making shakes, Penny not only turned around and talked with attitude to her, but to us as well. The line was getting longer behind us, and Penny did not see the need to help her, nor the other people in line.  She turned back around and 'dismissed' us and continued on with the shake-making. I felt sorry for new girl, so I reassured her that she did a great job and wished her luck. Food took long, more than 20 minutes for a burger, steak quesadilla and some beans and rice. People who arrived way after us came, ordered, got their food and left. Wouldn't have minded that much, if the beans and rice weren't ice cold. I've been coming here for a long time. Service has continually declined. My visits are fewer and farther between. It's a shame because they have a great menu and you can satisfy just about anything you might have a taste for in one stop. After reading some of the comments on here, I guess the owners don't care anyway.

39.description: NEVER ORDER DELIVERY! These people are so ignorant. I swear on everything I love that almost every other time I ordered from there, these people would forget something or make something wrong. Compensation?? Hah usually they say 'oh well we will bring it to you now' I hmmm ya ok because I'm supposed to let my food get cold and gross so you can complete my meal. I have even told them to triple check my bag. Now why the hell should I even feel the need to do this? They're rude cheap with fixing food. I'm fed up with their BS. I'll never give them another chance again.

37.description: Went here for the first time last week. Their menu was unbelievable. I am not sure if this is in any relation to the Brandys on Oakton in Des Plaines, but it was very good.

0.description: The only reason I'm giving 5 stars is because I LOVE Brandy's food! I come here often and have never had a problem with anything. I had my food delivered this afternoon and my food smells like cigarette smoke! The delivery driver should really wait until he delivers the food before he chain smokes and hot boxes his car.

38.description: As soon as I walked in this place I knew I would love my food! The girls by the registers always make sure your order is complete and they repeat it so no mistake is made! The cooks are fast and food is just perfect. 1/2 Greek Chicken with choice of potato and choice of soup, salad or cole slaw for 9.00 with tax  where do you get that? It was so good I am definitely coming back their salads look awesome! The guy that was sitting next to me had Ribs he told me they were falling off the bone. Their menu is huge but its worth to take the time and choose. I love this place !!!

51.description: Brandy's is one of my goto's for a last minute, "gotta get a decent meal in my belly and I don't feel like cooking" places.  I usually get the Chicken kabob plate with rice and Greek salad (hold the onions, they are a bit strong).  The chicken is cooked to order & very very juicy.  The rice is very tasty and full of flavor.  It comes with a nice decent tahini sauce and pita.  It's very filling, but I usually follow it up with a side of Greek cream of chicken rice soup... nice thick and tasty.The place has a menu that take up a whole wall... offers a lot of plates.  Your typical Gyros, burgers, dogs, fries and even tacos.  Whatever you're in the mood for they have it, they even deliver and you can order online.  Pretty good last minute goto.. and its right down the street :D

27.description: I wanna give this place more stars but the prices are ridiculous.... $12 for chicken sand fries and drink. Don't get me wrong the sandwich is fantastic but over priced. The menu is OVERWHELMING. Fast foods, Greek, "Italian", Mexican and breakfast. You don't know where to look first. One chicken sand says chicken "patty" in other words processes garbage patty $7 without fries and drink. Terrible. I don't eat that garbage and the lady was telling me it's all white meat. I said no there's a difference between patty and actually chicken breast, no thank you. I ate here twice and probably can't eat here for a while because of those damn prices. $4.49 for a grilled cheese with no fries or drink? GTFO

32.description: This also includes the store on Milwaukee Ave as well.Great variety but way to expensive for the quality of food you get. Not one single item stands out compared to other such food joints in the same area.Again, the one positive about this place is that it is truly a one stop shop. Quantity not Quality.This could have been fixed by now ... I wouldn't know it because I will never do this again. They now offer on-line ordering. The last time I used this option I was billed $7.00 more, no not for delivery nor that the tip was included which it wasn't, nor for a "convenience fee", again it wasn't. No I was charged this because their web-site at the time did not reflect their store price change, again at the time I was not aware of. I called the store after finding out that my receipt at the time of delivery did not reflect the receipt I "AGREED TO" on-line. After 45 minutes of arguing with the manager that should not be the customers fault and that "the fault" should be on their inability to control their web-site the manager agreed to reimburse me the difference. After several months they never did,What I said before I still stand by ... 2 stars for quality. ZERO stars for business sense. I lost $7.00 ... by my estimate they lost a few hundred $$$ by not correcting this.

54.description: Huge menu and good food!  Its a local neighborhood spot for me.  Service is always friendly and the food is always good.  The chicken gyros are outstanding, not to mention their portions are big as well.At times however it can be a bit pricey depending on what you order.But I would recommend to any one in my neighborhood.

48.description: Brandy's is a Greek-at-heart fast food place with a huge menu (almost overwhelming, really) of food items: gyros, souvlaki, hamburgers, pizza, hot dogs, Italian beef, steak sandwiches, pasta, salads, a whole Mexican sub-menu, pork chops, fish, ribs, breakfast items and on and on.  I stood there like a deer in the headlights while staring up at the dozens of menu board signs hanging up near the ceiling.  I mean, there's 32 meal combos listed, alone.Brandy's is part of a small local chain: Brandy's in Des Plaines & Chiggy's in Hanover Park making up the rest of the group.  It appears they all have the same menu.I went in at lunchtime on a Saturday.  The place was packed, with many families and kids, most seeming to be having a good time.  And yeah, the place was LOUD.  You order at the register near the door, than wait for your meal at the pick up window down near the soda pop machines.  My order came up within minutes  Seating, though not a huge amount, seemed adequate, with standard 4-top booths along the wall and some high-top tables in the middle of the room.  There's outdoor tables for nice weather, along the reasonably large parking lot.I had a very nice lunch combo for $7.99 (plus tax, no tip necessary): a large overstuffed gyros in pita with onions, tomatoes & tzatziki sauce, along with a large order of standard fries and a fill-your-own cup of soda (I chose Minute Maid lemonade, though most Coca-Cola products were on the spigots).With so much coming and going, the doors were constantly opening and I found the place a little drafty (this being late January).  The restroom was very clean and functional.Overall, Brandy's is a nice place to go for cheap fast tasty food.  And there really isn't anything like it for a mile in any direction, on this largely residential stretch of Harlem Avenue.

44.description: Another great experience.  Ordered online, walked in, picked it right up, and was back home in minutes.  Always good food.  They do have higher prices, but they give you enough food to make it worth your money!

24.description: I like Brandy's. I have been a NWsider for a long time, too long to remember. When the hubs and I moved into the neighborhood, we felt the need to explore every restaurant within our general 5 block radius. Brandy's is located right on Harlem and is a breeze to get to and has a little parking lot. Brandy's is super bright and lit up. Most of the time we order out, sometimes we get it delivered, and a few times we have eaten inside. I enjoy their salads and burgers which seem fresh and made with care. The hubs enjoys the chicken philly. This isn't your typical grease pit because they serve a wide variety of foods and is clean. I would say that Brandy's has something for everyone (dieters and non dieters unite!) The food comes out fast and made to your specifications. The service is good and friendly. I really enjoy this NWside hospitality. The only bad thing I can say is that I think the prices are a little high for the food you are getting. We don't indulge at Brandy's as often because of those reasons.

7.description: I like Brandy's. I have been a NWsider for a long time, too long to remember. When the hubs and I moved into the neighborhood, we felt the need to explore every restaurant within our general 5 block radius. Brandy's is located right on Harlem and is a breeze to get to and has a little parking lot. Brandy's is super bright and lit up. Most of the time we order out, sometimes we get it delivered, and a few times we have eaten inside. I enjoy their salads and burgers which seem fresh and made with care. The hubs enjoys the chicken philly. This isn't your typical grease pit because they serve a wide variety of foods and is clean. I would say that Brandy's has something for everyone (dieters and non dieters unite!) The food comes out fast and made to your specifications. The service is good and friendly. I really enjoy this NWside hospitality. The only bad thing I can say is that I think the prices are a little high for the food you are getting. We don't indulge at Brandy's as often because of those reasons.

49.description: The food is pretty good. The gyros is delicious but the food is overpriced for sure. The older lady cashier is very rude and lost my business. She needs a smile on her face and fix her personality.

40.description: I remembered when this was tasty pup where i had my first pizza puff and fell in love! New name, i had to try it! Had lunch delivered, I got the spicy chicken sandwich which came with a drink and fries. The sandwich was great! First off it came on a onion bun which had great flavor just wish It was toasted! The highlight was the spicy sauce that was actually spicy. Places like this to me though have a lot riding on the taste of the fries and they did not disappoint! They were crispy and flavorful. Overall great favors so many options fair prices! Ps they even delivered during a blizzard! Have to five them love for that, deff trying more here!

53.description: Shrimp basket is a must for lent awesome, never fails

30.description: Great Italian beefs. Been there a few times and the food is consistently good. Definitely worth a visit.

46.description: I don't know what everyone else is tasting from this place, but its mediocre at best.  In terms of food, everything is generic and frozen.  The chicken gyros is always burnt, the fries are tasteless and soggy, the burgers are dry as a bone, and the soups are thick and bland.  This place has steadily gone down hill in quality.Now for the rest of the establishment.  The parking lot is a complete clusterf*ck.  it's easy to get in but no so easy to get out with limited spots.  The menu is a weird fusion of Greek, Italian, and Mexican.  It stretches across the length of the restaurant and takes forever to read.  Good luck if you decide or just give up and take the first thing you see.  The prices are too high and to top it off, they screw up your order almost every single time.  This place has gotten away with taking my money and not giving me my food a few times.  I've finally had it and will NEVER go back there.  There are 20 other similar establishments in a 3 mile radius that I'd rather go to before I choose Brandy's.  Get an identity, get better food, and get your orders straight.

1.description: Went recently and got the football chicken gyro, ir way so much I ate for two days. The fries were amazing. Can't wait for it to warm up so I can sit out side and eat.

55.description: This place is amazing! I work nearby and never tried it. Finally went with a buddy of mine and it did not disappoint. We ordered double cheeseburgers and they were perfect. They had a side of fries and a drink. All for around $7.50 and definitely worth it. I seen a variety of meals here from ribs, to fish dinners, to hotdogs and burgers. Next time II am in, I will grab a gyro. I just need to make sure I am hungry enough for it. I like the old school scarface era feel to the place.

9.description: If you can't find something you like on this big menu you have a problem. Their menu is like a book! I never know what to get. I never had anything bad. Service is always good. I also do take out. Gyro's are always loaded with meat.

26.description: Too much on the menu. . Honestly having a value meal that goes to #30 is insane. . Food is blah and seriously 8.50 for a shit gyro. ..nah I'm good!

25.description: Out of 10 times I ask for utensils/napkins, I get them ONCE! It's delivery,  yes I need napkins and a fork!  I include this in all caps in the message part... and still nothing. This happens with the Brandy's on Milwaukee too! If I really need to pay extra for this I will.

12.description: I must have passed this joint a thousand times by now, but I finally tried it out today.I walk in and see an enormous menu that basically spans the entire wall. Not knowing what to get or what was good, I asked the girl at the register a few things about the choices and she seemed like she knew what she was talking about.I ended up going with #1 on the menu which was the gyro with a drink and fries. I do have to agree with what other people have said about the prices. $8.95 for just one gyro, fries, and a drink? It certainly isn't the place to go to if you're looking to save some money. I asked to have it to-go and got my order in a few minutes.When I actually got around to eating it, I was surprised by how packed the gyro was. There was so much meat. I asked for everything on it so it came with tomatoes and sauce and some onions. It was oily, but tasty nonetheless. The fries were also good. They were cooked just the way I liked them - nice and soft inside but with a slight crunch on the outside.I'll probably come back again and try something new. Knocking off a star for the prices though.

59.description: Mehhhhh. Its ok. really big menu.

21.description: We have lived in the area for three years now and this place seems to get worse and worse. I mean, we would get food from here anytime we came into the area before moving here and it was top notch. The service and quality of food have gone to shit since the owner opened places in more lucritive areas. The guy with the glasses running this location seems to care about quantity instead of quality which is a crying shame since most places in this area suck and charge way to much for below average food. This place has gone from one of the brightspots of edison park to just another overpriced dump people around here seem to settle for.

17.description: Weird... It took me a while to remember when I ate here and why I was all the way out in Norwood Park! Anyways, I realized it was on the way to the reception for a friend's wedding and we weren't going to eat for a while. Enter Brandy's.So essentially this is a Greek fast food place with your typical gyros, chicken, burgers, etc. It does have bigger sized meals which I thought was neat, but not right.Food was good, but not out of the ordinary for this type of place. Same for service.

10.description: Hey Brandi's...since you felt the need to ask me...here is my review.  I decided to pick up lunch at your place because I did not have my car and this is the ONLY closest option since they closed the Deli near by.  I ordered a small kid's size portion in case I did not like it I would not have to spend so much money.  When I picked up my food...not sure if that was the owner...but did you seriously feel you needed to "confront" me because I posted a review on Yelp about your food?  I have the right to my opinion and to express it. I seldom chose to pick up food at your establishment but now will just avoid it.  Not sure if  you might spit or do something to my food.  Your cheeseburger and fries were okay.  Happy?  Don't pick on your customers for providing you feedback.  I did not like your ribs and I felt they were too expensive...so what???
