I have the right to my opinion and I have shared it here at work too.

5.description: Brandy's is a nice place with a big big menu. They are a little on the pricey side but I got their Italian beef and fries. The beefs are good here and the fries are good too and I'm a big fry guy. If they would lower their prices a bit then I would frequent them more.

3.description: Food: 5 stars - really delicious and flavorful gyros - good meat-to-pita ratio.  I love that they use white onions, not red, and that they are sliced paper thin so as not to be overpowering.Atmosphere: 4 stars - it's a typical quick service greek place - but cleaner than many others I've seen, which I appreciate.  They also have an outdoor seating area with about 10 tables.Service: 2 stars, but I'll give it 3 because they were at least *trying.*We came in last Wednesday for dine-in and had the dog with us, so while G sat outside with the pooch, I went inside, ordered, and waited for our dine in order: a cheesesteak and a gyros sandwich - both of which came with fries.  I was shocked that I waited 25 minutes for this order.  When I say they were trying, an older gentlemen, presumably the owner, kept asking me what my number was, so I would tell him.  However, that didn't stop other orders, which were taken after mine and should've taken longer (burgers and chicken sandwiches - which are cooked to order) from coming out before mine. Lets get one thing straight, gyros is already cooked.  It's revolving on a spit, just waiting to be shaved off, maybe kissed by the grill, and dressed.  Cheesesteaks do not take 25 minutes to cook.  So, either my order got lost somewhere, or something got messed up and had to be re-done.Mr. "what's your number" was also not very apologetic or motivating to his staff...  he would just ask me my number and say "I'm telling them (cooks) to go faster.  Well, I was standing right there, you really weren't, just saying "where is number 123?"  About 3 times.  And it still took 25 minutes.At least the food was hot, and the fries were crisp.Not sure I'd opt for dine-in again, but Brandy's is a good option.

35.description: Ok when it's good it's good I've been here a lot and not one time can I say the food looked or tasted like crap or come to think about it it's never been not enough  I eat on the road a lot everyday and this restaurant keeps me coming back they have there shi... Together and for delivery there like a certain fast food chain that uses freaky fast for a slogan I am always amazed at how fast they are keep it up brandys keep it up  thanks for not using cheap ingredients it shows even your hot dogs can't be touched by too many places

19.description: This also includes the store on Milwaukee Ave as well.Great variety but way to expensive for the quality of food you get. Not one single item stands out compared to other such food joints in the same area.Again, the one positive about this place is that it is truly a one stop shop. Quantity not Quality.This could have been fixed by now ... I wouldn't know it because I will never do this again. They now offer on-line ordering. The last time I used this option I was billed $7.00 more, no not for delivery nor that the tip was included which it wasn't, nor for a "convenience fee", again it wasn't. No I was charged this because their web-site at the time did not reflect their store price change, again at the time I was not aware of. I called the store after finding out that my receipt at the time of delivery did not reflect the receipt I "AGREED TO" on-line. After 45 minutes of arguing with the manager that should not be the customers fault and that "the fault" should be on their inability to control their web-site the manager agreed to reimburse me the difference. After several months they never did,What I said before I still stand by ... 2 stars for quality. ZERO stars for business sense. I lost $7.00 ... by my estimate they lost a few hundred $$$ by not correcting this.

28.description: I must have passed this joint a thousand times by now, but I finally tried it out today.I walk in and see an enormous menu that basically spans the entire wall. Not knowing what to get or what was good, I asked the girl at the register a few things about the choices and she seemed like she knew what she was talking about.I ended up going with #1 on the menu which was the gyro with a drink and fries. I do have to agree with what other people have said about the prices. $8.95 for just one gyro, fries, and a drink? It certainly isn't the place to go to if you're looking to save some money. I asked to have it to-go and got my order in a few minutes.When I actually got around to eating it, I was surprised by how packed the gyro was. There was so much meat. I asked for everything on it so it came with tomatoes and sauce and some onions. It was oily, but tasty nonetheless. The fries were also good. They were cooked just the way I liked them - nice and soft inside but with a slight crunch on the outside.I'll probably come back again and try something new. Knocking off a star for the prices though.

45.description: As everyone else has said: huge menu! Problem, not that much of is not deep fried or grease-filled (which some days is just what the Doctor ordered, ya know?), but the salads are huge and very pretty.If you can't find something to eat here, just stay home.   Patio for summer months too!

33.description: This is not "fast" food.  We waited 25+ minutes last night around 6:30 for a souvlaki sandwich, a gyro, and two orders of fries.  I will think twice about coming here again for a quick meal on my way home.  Would be faster to go home and bake a casserole.

43.description: I've tried this place 3 times and each time my food was just ok. First time I had the chicken gyros. Bread was burnt and I was picking very small bones out with a few of the bites I took. Needless to say I threw it out and ended up making something I had at home. Second time I tried the steak burrito. It was very very bland. Rice and beans served with it were good but disappointed by the burrito. The last time I had a hot dog. Nothing special, but better then my other two times. There are much better hot dog places out there though in my opinion. Biggest turnoff was the first visit. Brandies hasn't really changed my mind about the quality of the food.

2.description: Try out there gyros it's the best, the place is always clean!the cashier is always friendly!

18.description: Better than average food, but I have to say it's the HUGE menu they offer for whatever mood you are in. It is a staple on our dine in and delivery schedule as a family.

41.description: This is a great place for Italian Beef sandwiches. They will fill you up. The beef is not dry or tough. It is so good and juicy. They offer sweet peppers and hot giardineira peppers.   They have amazing curly fries too. I usually call ahead and place my order so I don't have to wait for it.

52.description: I love love LOVE the gyros! Everything tastes delicious, especially great for hangovers - so it helps that they deliver! I go back all the time!

50.description: Great turkey burgers! When I walk in the nice lady at the register already knows my order!

4.description: Food pretty good but prices are extremely high for your typical hotdog joint. 8 bucks for 2 hot dogs? pricey!The menu is huge! almost too big.. it takes a while to get through it and decide.  everything from classic Italian dishes to a Mexican menu  to typical sandwiches..I will continue to come because it's blocks from my house.. but I wouldn't go out of my way.. you can find food that's just as good for a way better price elsewhere.

6.description: I love to go to brandy's with my brother and just get milkshakes and fries, which are always good. However, my friends wanted to go there for dinner a while back, the menu is very long and contains very few vegetarian options, which is understandable, since it is a hot dog joint. However, they do have a veggie patty that is a bit pricey, which I do not recommend. It was green and squishy. In all, the fries and milkshakes are wonderful but if you are a vegetarian just stick to that, don't try the veggie patty.

22.description: Worst burger I have ever had. Ordered the double burger and got to rockhard patties on a bun. They still tasted like they were frozen, Except grease was dripping from them. Don't waste your time at this place.

15.description: I remembered when this was tasty pup where i had my first pizza puff and fell in love! New name, i had to try it! Had lunch delivered, I got the spicy chicken sandwich which came with a drink and fries. The sandwich was great! First off it came on a onion bun which had great flavor just wish It was toasted! The highlight was the spicy sauce that was actually spicy. Places like this to me though have a lot riding on the taste of the fries and they did not disappoint! They were crispy and flavorful. Overall great favors so many options fair prices! Ps they even delivered during a blizzard! Have to five them love for that, deff trying more here!

57.description: This place is pretty good. The food is solid. The pork chop sandwich is the best I've ever had, better than Maxwell Street. I liked the super nachos. The char grilled hot dog is very good. The corned beef sandwich was OK, the problem with that is I have to compare it to Elliott's. The Gyros are good. The prices are a little high, but the delivery is excellent and the variety is fantastic. Don't understand the bad reviews.

20.description: We order from here for delivery and we pick it up. There's so many options to choose from that it's hard to decide . My guy loves the gyros. I will say that it is getting pretty expensive there.

36.description: I can only comment on one food...the gyros. I think this place makes the best tasting gyro. I'm not a expert on gyros, but compared to the places I've gone to this one is the BEST for me. The portions of meat in the gyro is great. The service has alway been fair. They need to smile and be more welcoming. One last thing, I'm always cold in this restaurant whether is winter or summer!

14.description: The food here is great! We've eaten here numerous times. WARNING!!!!! If you order something for delivery, you need to SPECIFY that you want napkins and silverware. I understand small family owned businesses need to keep costs down. Maybe the delivery driver should keep some in his car....

1.description: I don't usually Yelp many places, but I felt compelled to do so. This has to be one of the worst hookah lounges that I've ever been too and I've been to plenty hookah lounges. For starters the ONE ventilation system used to pull the lingering smoke up is very weak. I can't taste my own hookah, but what I do taste is cigarette smoke from the other customers inside the lounge. I'm pretty sure it's against Illinois law to smoke in any place of business, unless this place has special privileges, which I DOUBT!!!!Later my wife and I received our cups of their "world famous tea" and let me just say it looked like a cup of colored water with no flavor at all. I guess they ran short on tea leaves or something. We were ready to leave but couldn't find a server to get us our bill. btw there were only 2 people working the in whole entire place. I walked up to the register to pay so we could leave this dreadful environment, I greeted the "waitress/server/register person/ mngr" or whatever her title maybe, Didn't even get a hello or Thank you but she was real quick to Take my $30 dollars. This place wasn't worth $30 at all in my opinion. It's WAY over priced and I feel they take advantage of new customers, they don't have prices on the menu for hookahs, it seems as they make them up as they go along. I do not recommend anyone to go here. If you want a real Hookah Lounge and not some whole in the wall that's trying to nickel and dime you to death, then go to HUBBLE HOOKAH it's only 1 mile away.

9.description: ***update! Please read!***Original review:As I'm sitting here right now I've been waiting for my hookah for the past half hour. This place isn't super busy and setting up a hookah doesn't take that long (speaking from experience) so I don't understand what's taking so long. It also doesn't help that the lady working here is pretty rude. No customer service skills at all. I advise you to try "my hookah cafe" much better service and way more organized in terms of menu.Update:  The person nahrain a. Is affiliated with this businesses so her review should be disregarded. She sent me messages harassing me to take my review off of her business. She posted a review at 1 in the afternoon on a Friday and posted 5 different hookahs in her pictures. Who orders 5 hookahs in one sitting for the first time they go to a place. very fishy! I usually wouldn't worry about someone's opinion about my review but since she went as far as harassing me I have to expose the false review and show you how they treat customers.I added a picture of her message to me as proof but note that she thinks I am a different problem customer but she is wrong.

23.description: I've driven by this place before and never thought of going in cause it didn't look like my kind of hookah lounge but I was wrong. It's not very upscale but it is a very chill spot just the way I like it. The hookahs here were very good and that's the most important thing and they give you an option to get a fruit head which is pretty cool to try. The prices were very good and the service was awesome so I'm a fan of Prince Hookah and it's BYOB.

5.description: This place is ok, nothing special. Came in on a Friday night around 9:45pm and it was pretty dead. The hookah was ok nothing amazing, and since the place isn't busy it isn't as fun... Maybe this place was good at its prime, but maybe it's time they renovate or move on...

25.description: Saw this place just by driving to work and decided after my shift to got with some people. Parking is a bit tough in the back, but once you go in it is a pretty nice place! It was clean and the people were fantastic.  We also ordered a hot chocolate and strawberry smoothie.... amazing!

12.description: Very bad service. Not a friendly place to go to. Over priced for no reason. Service is bitchy and inattentive. Would not recommend.

21.description: Been going here many  MANY times with groups of friends and is always a good time.  Good chillin spot for this area. They were closed for a while cause the owner went out of the country. Bummer but who cares. Hostess  working here is very nice and the hookah is awesome. Other people are just too damn cheap to pay for their asking prices. Its a BUSINESS, show some courtesy, just like any other place. Great place overall!

16.description: The place is nice convinian but terrible hostess no smile very rude u order a hookah then she asks u what to drink u say no I'm good she gives u a look like ur a piece of crap last night I went there w my friend we go there at least 4 time a week I had my diner with sprit then at the end she goes no outside drinks next time I'll charge u .Screw u I'm not going back there ever unless the crazy witch hostess is gone.

17.description: I've driven by this place before and never thought of going in cause it didn't look like my kind of hookah lounge but I was wrong. It's not very upscale but it is a very chill spot just the way I like it. The hookahs here were very good and that's the most important thing and they give you an option to get a fruit head which is pretty cool to try. The prices were very good and the service was awesome so I'm a fan of Prince Hookah and it's BYOB.

10.description: I really wanted to give Prince Hookah a better rating but there's one good reason I didn't. Let's call out the things I liked first:Good: Nice prices, I like the décor and layout, usually a good music selection (modern electronic/dance), BYOB, free Wi-Fi, seems pretty cleanBad: TERRIBLE hostess. Don't you want the business to succeed and to maximize your potential for tips? Well, she doesn't. At least pretend you know how to be a good server and you want to be there...She's been rude and slow to attend to me/my group every time I've been there. But, I've been putting up with it...until now... Most recently on a Saturday, I planned on bringing in a large group of people with our own alcohol and we were ready to spend a lot on hookahs and energy drinks. So, I called ahead just to get a feel for the situation. I verified that it was BYOB and then I asked: "I might be coming in with a large group. Is it really busy or packed in there tonight?" (I wanted to make sure there would be enough room and time to be served.) She responds: "WHAT KIND OF QUESTION IS THAT?"...Probably never coming back. If it weren't for the pathetic "hospitality", I would have made Prince my new go-to hookah lounge.**Advice to ownership (even if the hostess is one of them): Get that lady as far away from customers as possible. What a joke...If that situation ever changes, I'll be back for one more chance.

11.description: It's a ok place. Nothing to fancy. Seating is uncomfortable   Prices are fine.  I wouldn't visit again though. Parking sucks.

26.description: I love this place! Noticed it by chance, it's a fairly new spot opened up in January as the lady who works here told us. Super friendly atmosphere super friendly hostess super relaxed and chill with free WiFi hookah is good great!

27.description: I just stopped by Prince hookah lounge this weekend. Loved it! A MUST see!!! They have a wide variety of hookah flavors, incl europea teas, turkish coffee, baklava... Very friendly staff! Great atmosphere!! Simply the best!

0.description: First and foremost  I want  to thank Helen for making  my last stop for my 30th birthday  amazing! The lava cake you gave me was amazing! Secondly   my group  had an amazing  time, we were so comfortable  and enjoyed  the attention  that you all provided. Normally  my friend and I  go to hubble  hookah for mommy  time away from the kids but I know I will be definitely  making my way through there from this day forth as long as she's  there.  you  lots Helen thank you!

20.description: I really wanted to give Prince Hookah a better rating but there's one good reason I didn't. Let's call out the things I liked first:Good: Nice prices, I like the décor and layout, usually a good music selection (modern electronic/dance), BYOB, free Wi-Fi, seems pretty cleanBad: TERRIBLE hostess. Don't you want the business to succeed and to maximize your potential for tips? Well, she doesn't. At least pretend you know how to be a good server and you want to be there...She's been rude and slow to attend to me/my group every time I've been there. But, I've been putting up with it...until now... Most recently on a Saturday, I planned on bringing in a large group of people with our own alcohol and we were ready to spend a lot on hookahs and energy drinks. So, I called ahead just to get a feel for the situation. I verified that it was BYOB and then I asked: "I might be coming in with a large group. Is it really busy or packed in there tonight?" (I wanted to make sure there would be enough room and time to be served.) She responds: "WHAT KIND OF QUESTION IS THAT?"...Probably never coming back. If it weren't for the pathetic "hospitality", I would have made Prince my new go-to hookah lounge.**Advice to ownership (even if the hostess is one of them): Get that lady as far away from customers as possible. What a joke...If that situation ever changes, I'll be back for one more chance.

19.description: I have been going here since they opened, roughly. The first time in we got a full tour of the place and even the upstairs area. We were told about the large group rooms and all the different types of hookahs they can do. What we love the most if the wide range in house blends and the fact that they have natural coals at no additional cost (At least that's how it was the last time we were there). Sadly the last few times we tried to go they were closed. It wasn't anything to do with them. I know there was some remodeling and then from what I was told some one had passed away and they were out of town. Pricing compared to most is low. I  like that they don't just have starbuzz which is a huge win for me. They wash their hookahs the right way and they do it often. Not a huge range in drinks but the byob is nice! I honestly would throw a party here. the music is modern and has a huge variety so its not like sitting and listen to nothing but rap. They also have movies and if your the only ones in there some times its just the movies playing which i love! I am hoping to go again soon! Keep up the good work! Love you guys a lot!

2.description: I called half hour ahead and reserved a table for 10 people they gave us a  VIP room, this place was packed with a good vibe crowed! The music was nice, first time ever smoking a good hookah with no air leaks, I recommend Miami Vice flavor it's amazing with lots of clouds. I told the waitress that we were celebrating my boyfriends BDay and she surprised us with a fruit bowl hookah on the house! The staff was very friendly and funny they were joking around with us, I highly recommend Prince Hookah!

18.description: Ive been to a few hookah  lounges in the past and i might  say that this one has been the worst one EVER! The service  was terrible  especially the server she had a attitude we had been there for at least  an hour and she had only came 2 timea when we arrived when they brought the hookahs and when we had arrived the table next to us was empty  later a group of guys were seated next to us and she came to check on them al least 5 times within a short time period. Also supposedly  this place is byob and when we looked on our tab we were being charged for bringing our own beers this is absolutely ridiculous  no where in that establishment does it say that there is a 5 dollar fee PER PERSON  when you byob ... on that note that was the first and last time i visit this place

13.description: I'm not an avid hookah goer but I've visited a few over time in the Chicago area and I've never been so disappointed. I'm usually an easygoing person about these things I'm never usually a complainer but I've never been so disappointed. We were charged 30$ for ONE hookah (which was dry, not working, flavorless, and awful) and a 12$ corking fee for ONE bottle of wine. They even gave us red solo cups instead of wine glasses! Unbelievable. Hostess/server was so rude and angry from the moment we walked in and sat in the back on her laptop the whole time and paid no attention to us...there's so many better places in the neighborhood, try Hubble or many others.

4.description: This hookah bar is dope! Great place and good hookah, they have large verity of tobacco my favored is lemon/mint "fumari" there hookah is on point specially the staff they are very friendly! Best hookah spot in Chicago!

24.description: Hostess was pretty rude. Smoothie was pretty good.

6.description: Such a chill spot with great customer service! You'll love it there. The owners are great and so accommodating. Good music and big tvs, perfect to watch the game

22.description: ***update! Please read!***Original review:As I'm sitting here right now I've been waiting for my hookah for the past half hour. This place isn't super busy and setting up a hookah doesn't take that long (speaking from experience) so I don't understand what's taking so long. It also doesn't help that the lady working here is pretty rude. No customer service skills at all. I advise you to try "my hookah cafe" much better service and way more organized in terms of menu.Update:  The person nahrain a. Is affiliated with this businesses so her review should be disregarded. She sent me messages harassing me to take my review off of her business. She posted a review at 1 in the afternoon on a Friday and posted 5 different hookahs in her pictures. Who orders 5 hookahs in one sitting for the first time they go to a place. very fishy! I usually wouldn't worry about someone's opinion about my review but since she went as far as harassing me I have to expose the false review and show you how they treat customers.I added a picture of her message to me as proof but note that she thinks I am a different problem customer but she is wrong.

15.description: Service was terrible! We felt very unwanted and the time it took for us to receive what we ordered was very long. The waitress was not friendly at all! And the flavored tobacco was mediocre. I DO NOR RECOMMEND!

7.description: If i could, I would give zero stars. The customer service is below any level of competence. At the place, they do not care about the costumers; they only want your $. You cannot sit by your friends - there is 10$ surcharge.one  Hookah is limited for two people only.Avoid!!!

8.description: Cool little hookah place on Harlem. i heard some complaints from regulars about the hostess, but I thought she was nice and made sure we were taken care of. Lots of fun characters here too.

3.description: Whenever I come to Chicago I must visit this place. Very comfortable and fun, the service here is great. Everyone is friendly and makes you feel at home.

14.description: I don't appreciate being told how to smoke the hookah.... I've been smoking for years. If I want to only have one coal to make it less harsh then that should be my decision not Helen's. Also didn't like how they ran over to me yelling at me for moving a hookah. Obviously if I break it I would pay for it, not like it matters these hookah pipes are not of quality. I was considering renting the top room for my birthday next week but after this I don't ever want to come back here and I would not recommend this place to a friend. If your looking for a great lounge go to ultimate in villa park.  Great service and there they treat you like a prince, despite the name here I was talked down to like I was an imbecile.

1.description: This is the go to shop if you live on the northwest side. Family owned which is a plus. Customer service is beyond amazing. I purchased an engagement ring from here last year. Jon helped me out a lot with my purchase. I told him my price range and he brought in a couple of diamonds for me to look at. Picked out a diamond and was ready to pick up within weeks.  A few months later, a small accent diamond was lost and was replaced at no charge.  You cannot a better shop with this type of customer service. Will be going back next year for wedding bands.

2.description: I live very close to this shop and needed my Mont Blanc watch repaired. I spoke with John and he helped me. He fixed the smaller dial, added a battery, and a strap. I walked out with a watch looking and performing like new. It was beautiful. Very happy with the service, and will be going back. Hours are a little odd so check the times, or call. Nice family business.

0.description: Henry Paul Company (Henry and his son, Jon) has been my only jeweler for the past 10+ years.  They are a smaller shop, so their pricing is very fair and competitive in comparison to some of the larger, more commercial companies out there.They are extremely knowledgeable in all aspects of jewelry and accessories, including gold, diamonds, other rare-earth materials, settings, repairs, watches, etc.  It is an ethical shop with strong values, prompt response, and professional.  Go here first, before going anywhere else.

58.description: Decided to grab some take out.  We ordered the Dumplings, Kimchi Maki, Kimchi Tofu Salad, the Cure all soup, Wolfman Dream and Tibetan High Noon.  Really loved their Dumplings, Salad especially the dressing,  Soup, and Tibetan with noodles.  I didn't really care for the Maki, because the seaweed was too tough to bite through.  The Wolfman was just ok compared to the rest too.  Overall though I really liked everything we had and would definitely order from them again on my next stay here.  Plus there is a 10% cash discount too.

56.description: I have been searching all over the Chicago area for some authentic vegan Korean food. ( I know I know, you're probably laughing at me for being stupid to think that there is a vegan Korean food establishment that exists* For fans of Korean Food, me being one of them *bibimpab and kimchi anyone?*., it is extremely hard to find such a place, so I did what smart people do-I yelped it!!!  Since Yelp is a know it all, it gave me Amitabul as a search result.  I went there the next day. Its a small corner restaurant that can be hard to miss, but the big sign helps.  The inside is relatively cozy with some sort of mystic ambiance *the owner is Buddhist so there are tons of pictures statues etc of Buddha*. I met the owner and he was SO nice!! and hospitable! I told him it was my first time there and he gave me suggestions on what to try and was not hesitant to answer my questions.  I ended up getting the Dr. K's cure all soup-since I was craving a spice attack. Typically this soup is good for hangovers, flu, the cold etc but I felt like I needed a healthy pick me up in my system although I wasn't sick. It was so so good!  My order came with two containers, one with the broth and veggies, and one with the noodles and veggies. You mix em together and viola you the soup. It was def worth the drive :) I also got the homemade Sunset Smoothie *made with tofu, but you can't taste it at all* that was really good as well. So for the vegetarians and vegan homies out there, who want to try some Korean food I say go to Amitabul and give it a try. What have you got to lose? :)

29.description: The cure-all soup and the dumplings are the best. I love how spicy everything is and that they have tissues on the tables for those runny noses you get. The service is always great. Some of the dishes are a hit or miss, especially if you're a texture kind of person(which I am).

42.description: Very nice food. I'll come here add again to try different food.  Dr k soup is good and spicy. And it was good enough for 3ppl. Tempeh stir fry which my wife ordered is nice too.

23.description: Great vegan food - it's in a very non-distinct location, south of Superdawg.  The Korean-based dishes are amazing and the pictures embracing the foyer are an awesome welcome.  Everything I've had is very flavorful.  Friday nights here are busy.  Will go back as often as I can.

47.description: Amitabul is pure comfort food. I love the stirfries. They are giant and loaded with veggies, sauces, nuts, spices, and flavor. When I don't feel great, I head right over to Amitabul. I'm rating it a four, though, because I feel like some of the food is too expensive. Amitabul is a hidden treasure in Chicago and well worth traveling out of your way.

8.description: Amazing, amazing, amazing! The Cure All soup is the only thing that makes me feel better when I have bronchitis. All of the food is amazing, fresh, flavorful. If you are a meat eater, you will not miss it one bit.

31.description: I was skeptical. I'm not vegan and have no interest in becoming one. That said, I have been here twice and have enjoyed my meals. They're simple, spicy, and large. I look forward to trying different things here. Quiet space. Lots of Buddhas.

34.description: Absolutely my favorite vegan restaurant in chicago. I eat here twice a week at least (I work next door). Only negative I could say is that I wish they were open on Mondays too :) my favorite dishes are the Wolfmans Dream and the Green and Greener Nirvana. Always followed by the Energy Shake! The chewy brown rice is to die for. You immediately feel the good vibes and energy once you step foot inside. I really feel good about eating here and I highly, highly recommend it.

16.description: My bf was not feeling well and I decided to drag him here since I had heard about Dr. K's soup. The place had a zen feel to it and people were quietly talking as we walked in. Per the owner's recommendation we started with the Vegan Dumplings, which were delicious. We followed with Dr. K's soup and Wolfman's Dream Treats. The soup had an earthy taste to it, not too spicy. The other entree had various nuts mixed with the side of rice and a good selection of vegetables that were still crispy. We both enjoyed the dishes even though we are not vegan and found them to be quite interesting. If we were to come back, I would love to try a noodle dish since I am not much of a rice person. My boyfriend felt much better that same day, it could have been the soup. We also found the food to be inspiring thus we tried to eat more clean food and it did brought us more energy while it lasted.

13.description: I just love this place. Everytime i come here it's like heaven. All of the food is fresh, authentic and vegan. I love Dr. K's noodle soup, it's to die for.

11.description: I don't know what I was expecting but I was so disappointed. I got the kimchi noodle soup. It just felt very very flat. It had spice and that was all. The flavors weren't balanced at all. I thought a slice of lime will help but guess what, I asked for one and was told I can't get lime or vinegar or salt because they don't have them. I couldn't finish my bowl of red water and left hungry :(

39.description: Great soups.  This place delivers exactly what it promises.  Amitabul is a great vegan restaurant.  I always feel great after eating here.

37.description: Worth the trip!  Hop on your old car and head way way up Milwaukee avenue for Korean Buddhist Vegan nirvana. This gem is on the far northwest side and the food is awesome. Carefully overseen by Chef owner Bill, the food is the best spicy stuff ever. Try the soy pancakes!  They are savory- not sweet- and perfectly balanced with veggies inside. The healthy nut is a Korean noodle dish with fresh veggies and top shelf shrooms. The date tea is great!They do close early, so give em a break and come at 6.

0.description: Let me say this is probably my most favorite vegetarian restaurant. I absolutely love this place! Ive been here a couple times but we always get carry out from here so I can't tell you about the restaurant itself but the service is great in terms of ordering and being ready. The portions are huge so be ready to share.My absolute favorite thing on the menu is the dr k's cure all noodle soup! It's spicy and full of delicious veggies and noodles! I can eat this soup all the time! We've tried the dumplings, kimchi (which they sell in jars), and many of the stir fry dishes. I can't remember the names exactly but I'm sure there all good. Just a FYI the food tends to be spicy here so ask about making it mild or suggestions for mild food. We like it spicy so we don't usually ask!In terms of pricing it's very affordable. Parking is street parking but it's not too difficult. My only issue is that there closed Sunday and Monday which isn't that big of an issue u less u need your fix. Definitely give this place a try! I don't know why it took me so long to rate this place!

38.description: so so GOOD! this place has been on my to do list for over a year (it's a little out of the way for me) and I'm so glad I finally made it. the kimchi noodle soup is delicious and the portion is huge. definitely could be split between 2 people. the ginger citron tea is also yummy with real orange and ginger in the bottom of the cup. definitely going back to try the cure all soup!

51.description: Best vegan soups around

27.description: Whether it's dinning in or doing a pick up, Amitabul is consistent with delicious,healthy,quality food. Dr K cure all soup is absolutely delicious and I swear by it for when you are feeling a little under the Chicago weather. I do think it is a little pricey but the quality and taste of the food is worth it

32.description: After looking at the photos of other people's food, I've concluded that I just ordered the wrong thing. I got the Dark Side of the Moon and the Seaweed veggie salad. The Dark Side hardly had hardly any mushrooms, and the salad had hardly any seaweed it it. Flavors weren't anything to get excited about.

54.description: Was looking for a healthy lunch option so decided to give Amitabul a try. I had one of the noodle entrees medium spicy. There were a lot of fresh veggies in the dish and I was impressed with the spicy flavor. Medium spicy definitely has some legitimate heat! My stomach is sometimes sensitive to spicy foods but I had no problems after eating here. I recommend trying this spot if you enjoy Korean flavors and are looking for something on the healthy side.

48.description: Yikes, what a delicious meal. We started with a healing Dr. K noodle soup loaded with veggies. One bowl was enough for three of us with plenty of leftovers. Then we had the pancakes-- delicious, with great texture, sauce and perfect brown rice. None of the food here is fried, another nice plus. I can't wait to come back.

44.description: An average restaurant experience that definitely aligns with the 3-star Yelp rating.  We ordered the Mandoo dumplings. They were tasty enough to finish the whole order, but somewhat dry.  My daughter had the Sunset smoothie, and it was just ok.  We love smoothies, and this was not up to anything we make at home - it wasn't cold enough, and the tofu gave it an odd consistency.   Our main order, Dark Side of the Moon, looked like soup.  The flavor was fine (not stellar), but the veggies and noodles were limp from sitting in so much sauce, and the dish cooled down very quickly from so much liquid. It was not an appetizing looking dish. The bill, with tip, was almost $33.00.  We eat  out frequently at Asian restaurants in Albany Park and Chinatown, and this did not compare with our favorites.  The ambiance is basic and the service was extremely slow.  Based solely on reviews, I might do a carryout order of the Dr. K's soup, but I would never go back to eat at the restaurant.

24.description: I think this place is amazing. The food is great and it's really a lot for the price you pay. The food is jam packed with vegetables. You really get what you pay for. Beyond the food, this place is worth the trip. The atmosphere is great and Bill is the nicest guy ever. Would highly recommend such a hidden gem to anyone.

7.description: If I could eat every meal of my life at Amitabul, I could be a vegan. They actually offer this option - you can sign up for a monthly meal plan, and I've been there while people come to pick up their meals, and heard them rave about it.I've been coming to Amitabul for years, since they were in their old Lakeview location, and I've never been disappointed. My favorites are the "Healing Soup" bowls - The Steve's Super Shitake Noodle Wonder Soup if you want something with a mild taste (and love mushrooms), and The Dr. K's Cure All Noodle Soup if you want something with a more spicy kick. And the Dr. K's really does help if you have a cold. Another great menu selection they have are their teas. First time I went there, I ordered a Citron Tea and was surprised to find out it wasn't actual tea, or even herbal tea, it was hot brewed citron in water, which basically tasted like hot lemonade, and is the most amazing thing to drink if you have a cold or sore throat (or just really like lemon). They also have a ginger tea that's ginger brewed in hot water, and is perfect for an upset stomach - I used to stop by there when I was pregnant just to get the tea.The rest of their menu is a really wide variety of vegan rice bowls, stews, noodles, bibimbop, all with different vegetables and flavor combos, and all great.Amitabul is definitely one of the top vegetarian spots in Chicago!

49.description: Don't be fooled by the unassuming decor of this restaurant. Every item on this menu has been carefully thought out and masterfully combined. It is so hard to find a palace to eat that can accommodate vegan/vegetarian dining while still remaining delicious and filling. The portions are generous and were enough for me to eat dinner and have some for lunch the next day. I enjoyed "The Dark Side" while others in my party enjoyed some spicier choices. Everyone was thrilled with their meals. The most challenging thing about this place is deciding what to eat among all the choices!!

40.description: Very tasty, fulfilling meal that doesn't make you crash afterwards. The veggies were cooked right, nice sauces, and just good overall for the price point. Another thing I liked was the owner, I assume, making his rounds around the different tables to ask how people were doing. I don't see that often enough.Cozy atmosphere.

53.description: Vegan Korean food? Sign me up. Why can't we have something like this in Columbus?Admittedly the almost complete lack of Korean words on the menu was a bit disorienting. I wasn't sure from looking at the menu how the various offerings corresponded (or even if they corresponded) to common Korean dishes.I ordered the ginger tea. I ended up receiving the citron tea (yujacha?), but I know that I mumble and its quite possible the server misheard me. Sorry! Anyway, I love citron too so we're cool. For my meal I ordered the Yin and Yan. Turns out, the rice cakes were tteokbokki after all, yay! It had a pleasant level of spiciness and still managed to feel light, which I think is very special for this type of dish. Also, I love that the rice served here is actually brown rice with mixed beans--that adds texture, flavor, and nutrition to the meal. I also got a chestnut cookie for dessert, which was of a delightfully dense texture.If I come back to the Chicago area, I'll be sure to give this place another visit! I'll try to speak more clearly next time :)

30.description: Worth 4 stars but I gave five because I have never had Korean vegan dishes and it is better then I thought . Brown rice maki was good. Most dishes there are less oil, less sugar and less salt, perfect for me.

46.description: Amitabul was quite average. I ordered the noodle soup and it was spicy but it did have good vegetables. The service was a little slow, but I would go here again for the right occasion.

1.description: When I asked my husband if he wanted to try this place, his response was, "VEGAN Korean food? But the meat is my favorite part of Korean food". Luckily, I have friends. So my friend and I dragged our respective kids in for a lunch date. It was surprisingly crowded for noon on a weekday. The waitress was a little of a hot mess but the owner came by to take our orders. I went with Yin and Yan because the "only order this if you can take the heat" sounded like a challenge to me. My friend had the cure all soup. The kiddos were boring and had tofu miso. I loved my lunch. It was pretty satisfying even with the lack of meat. I tried the broth from my friend's soup and it was good. Next time maybe I'll give it a try. Although this isn't impressive, my kids loved their miso which was surprising because it had shredded zucchini in it. My husband has reluctantly agreed to give it a whirl. I'm recommending it to everyone, especially my vegetarian friends.

55.description: I'm not a vegan but I love this place. I love the energy maki rolls, Soups and smoothies. Whenever I'm sick I stop by for the cure all noodle soup. It's amazing,

9.description: The Dr.K soup was full of seaweed. The Tibetan dish was better, but super masala spicy. They do not take American Express. The service is nice. The music is tranquil. It was a good experience. Definitely 3 stars. I would come again, but I am not itching to.

26.description: Been going to this place sice it was Jim's grill on Irving Park rd by Addison. I always make sure I gtgere if I can when I'm visiting from LA but this time no sharing the recipe for the dish and they used to teach cooking for the health conscious. Then I wanted to order a seaweed salad for the table and one to go for my Sister. I was told while pointing to a particular table that they had ordered the last one. Little strange and then my soup was served to me wrong when I have been ordering it the same for over 20 years. They remembered me even. I had to bring the new soup home because everyone at the table was very done eating. Haha oh well. Still a hidden treasure but no longer needed for me to make my way over there. Thank you for the years

25.description: Great vegan restaurant . The owner is super friendly and welcoming .  The soups are delicious and huge!

12.description: IMO, the healthiest and best tasting vegan restaurant you can find in Chicago.

59.description: Every time I'm in NW Chicago and they are open, I'm there. Huge menu, and every dish I've had I liked. Real feel-good food. And save room for a cookie!

21.description: Such a fan of this place!  It's really amazing food, it's super affordable and a really cute restaurant, quiet, service is good, and it just has a cool feel to it.  Glad I got to go, and please keep doing what you do! :)

17.description: This place is beyond awesome and serves some of the most magical and restorative food. I have moved out of the Chicago area and I only wish they had a cookbook (hint, hint) so I could try and continue eating their dishes! Have to settle for visits when I am back in the area, but it is always worth it

10.description: Excellent food! The flavors are extraordinary. Although the place lacks ambiance, the amazing food makes up for anything else lacking in this restaurant.

5.description: First time here and let me just say, the Dr K Cure All soup is amazing! I was a little nervous to order it to go, but the to go order came nicely packed to two huge contains for me to build the soup at home. I would go back to get more soup! :)I also got the Mandoo Vegan Dumplings, which were also amazing. They like melted in your mouth. I finished all 12 in one sitting!

3.description: Absolutely love this place! I never knew that be veggies and tofu can taste this good. This place brings Korean food to a whole new level! Plus it's cruelty free. The atmosphere is peaceful, the restaurant is clean. I like the laid back feel. It makes it seem as though I am dinning at a friends house. I will definitely be coming back!

35.description: Ok, I know this will not garner any happy thoughts when I say this but I cannot wait for winter so I can go here all the time.  The soups are the perfect fix for a cold wintery night.  Eat in or better yet, take out and eat on the couch while snuggling up to a warm dog or pillow and listening to the wind outside.  I have sampled a few of the soups and stews, as well as the yummy dumplings.  Some of the soups can be quite spicy hot so know what you are ordering before you do.  The veggies are all so fresh.  I love this place and love the fact that I can order anything without worrying about it not being Vegan.  Definitely one of my favorite places in the city!!

19.description: Was looking for a healthy lunch option so decided to give Amitabul a try. I had one of the noodle entrees medium spicy. There were a lot of fresh veggies in the dish and I was impressed with the spicy flavor. Medium spicy definitely has some legitimate heat! My stomach is sometimes sensitive to spicy foods but I had no problems after eating here. I recommend trying this spot if you enjoy Korean flavors and are looking for something on the healthy side.

28.description: Great, clean food.  Quiet and calming atmosphere.  Everything was made fresh.  Green Juice was delicious.  Wonton Soup was hearty, filling, and tasty.  Good service.

45.description: Amazing! You do not have to be vegan to eat here. Their food is so good. Their tea and soup is always my first thought when I am sick or on a cold winter day. I would recommend to anyone I know.

33.description: I've been going to Amitabul since I moved to Chicago in '98 and they were still located on Southport. Although the menu has not changed a lot over the years, the meals are still as wonderful as the first time I ate there. They have a unique atmosphere, a welcoming staff, and are highly recommended even by people that have no idea what the words "Korean vegan food" means. Some of the food is very spicy, but they've toned it down a bit over the years. You get a lot of food for your money, so go hungry!It's a great place for dates, kids are welcome, and it's BYOB. You can get there via the CTA, but check google for the best instructions- it will vary based on your timing and which buses are running. It's also the best place to have lunch or dinner after a visit to American Science and Surplus down the street!

43.description: I was very mixed about finally trying this place out and needed to leave a review because I don't understand how it gets such glowing ones. All of their dishes sound fairly unexciting, and what I ordered tasted just the same. I got their shitake mushroom noodle soup which at $11.95 comes in a big portion but with little flavor. It was just very bland and not very flavorful, though the menu described it as a mild broth which may be why. The other dishes coming out also looked plain. I also ordered the Awakening Energy juice which tasted like some canned nectar mixed with water. I wasn't very impressed overall, especially having been to other vegan Korean restaurants that I really enjoyed such as Hangawi in New York.Also for all the health-focused food of the restaurant, there is no mention of organic or non-GMO anywhere.

2.description: This place was pretty good for cooked vegan food! Perfect for anyone who is sick and needs to clear out their sinuses or soothing a sore throat! I was very happy with my meal and excited I had a chance to step out of the box and try something culturally new. It was light, refreshing and very earthy. I was super full afterward and would def come back for another try at something new! The owner was so nice and very knowledgeable on which way to guide my husband and I which was really great. The service was a little slow considering there were a lot of people in the place but the food made up for that aspect! If you are looking for something new this is a place you need to go to. You can even take your non vegan/vegetarian there too :)

18.description: Worth the trip!  Hop on your old car and head way way up Milwaukee avenue for Korean Buddhist Vegan nirvana. This gem is on the far northwest side and the food is awesome. Carefully overseen by Chef owner Bill, the food is the best spicy stuff ever. Try the soy pancakes!  They are savory- not sweet- and perfectly balanced with veggies inside. The healthy nut is a Korean noodle dish with fresh veggies and top shelf shrooms. The date tea is great!They do close early, so give em a break and come at 6.

41.description: If you are expecting a fancy materialistic setting you are missing key message of eating well.  The key message of Bill Choi  becomes crystal clear when you eat his ultra healthy creations.  The organic and carefully considered flavor melange  is professionally processed with unequalled results.   I call it magic. If your mindset is to enjoy great tasting healthy food,  please tell me the better place than Amitabul.  Natural Awakenings loves this place.

52.description: Oh my God!!!!! Get the Dr. K soup and hold on for your life!!!  Fresh ingredients and a pleasant owner.....do NOT miss this gem on Chicago's Far NW side!!!!

50.description: The soy pancakes were amazing!  I also loved the dumplings.  This place surprised me!! I will be back soon! :)

4.description: So I got to try this restaurant after the third try because the first time I went here, it was their closing time...and the second time I went it was Sunday so it was closed.But about the food, it's simply awesome! Their Dr. K cure soup can really help cure sore throat n cold. I really loved their black pearl pancakes too. This restaurant is definitely a must try! :)

6.description: Came here for my daughter's birthday. She had Dark Side of Moon, my son had Zesty Noodles and I had the Maha Poao. Medium spice was perfect. All of our dishes were excellent! Friendly peaceful atmosphere.

22.description: Flavorful, ethnic vegan cuisine. The owner waited on us and personal greeted my friend who brought, a regular.

15.description: Whether it's dinning in or doing a pick up, Amitabul is consistent with delicious,healthy,quality food. Dr K cure all soup is absolutely delicious and I swear by it for when you are feeling a little under the Chicago weather. I do think it is a little pricey but the quality and taste of the food is worth it

57.description: The food is good. I love the descriptions for the ingredients - they can be amusing. The atmosphere is very tranquil and the owner is so chill. We came in 10 minutes before close to have a sit down meal because my mom, vegan, was in town and I really wanted to show her this place. I don't recommend doing that, and we felt bad. But the owner was so accommodating and welcoming the whole time. Definitely one of the better places I've been in Chicago. All around good vibes and good cuisine.

20.description: If you care about fresh, all natural ingredients and desire healthy, energetic food, than Amitabul is the place for you. Chef Bill will serve you enough food for two meals at extremely reasonable prices in a very casual and welcoming, zen, environment. Try the Green and Greener Nirvana, and don't forget the dumplings, maki and famous Dr K's curative soup. They even have monthly meal plans at great prices. This is a real find on the outskirts of the city. Easy access from 90 or the Edens and amble, free, street parking.

36.description: I really enjoy Amitabul's delicious vegan Korean food.  I have dined in and taken out, and it is excellent both ways.  The food is consistently delicious and full of flavor.  The teas are fantastic, too, especially the ginger citron.  The first time I ate at Amitabul, I didn't really pay attention to my surroundings until halfway through the meal.  I noticed the beautiful artwork on the walls, the creative and tasteful way it was decorated, and then I finally started reading all of the inspirational quotes on the walls.  At just about the same moment, I was observing how energized the food was making me feel (up until that point, I was just delighted with its deliciousness)!  Then, for the rest of the evening, I was really noticing how good I felt.  It is rare that I dine out and actually feel energized and lighter!  What started as a meal out became a complete experience, one I was not expecting but really enjoyed!!! I have enjoyed the ginger citron tea, the vegan dumplings, the original pancakes, Dr. K's healing soup, Dark Side of the Moon, Wolfman's Delight, and the kimchi salad.  There is really something special happening at Amitabul, and I think it is best experienced for one's self.  Highly recommended!

14.description: I've been going to Amitabul since I moved to Chicago in '98 and they were still located on Southport. Although the menu has not changed a lot over the years, the meals are still as wonderful as the first time I ate there. They have a unique atmosphere, a welcoming staff, and are highly recommended even by people that have no idea what the words "Korean vegan food" means. Some of the food is very spicy, but they've toned it down a bit over the years. You get a lot of food for your money, so go hungry!It's a great place for dates, kids are welcome, and it's BYOB. You can get there via the CTA, but check google for the best instructions- it will vary based on your timing and which buses are running. It's also the best place to have lunch or dinner after a visit to American Science and Surplus down the street!

1.description: This shop is where I bring our cast-offs because if Norwood Thrift can't use it or sell it, they have pick-ups by other charity organizations, so everything eventually finds a home.Norwood Thrift has expanded into two storefronts so there is slightly more room to move around. Volunteer staff is friendly and there is a parking lot behind the row of storefronts if you can't find parking in front. Norwood Thrift is steps away from the Norwood Park Metra stop and just a few doors north of the wonderful Woolly Lamb Yarn Studio.Green Tip: bring your own reusable shopping bag.

2.description: This place is ok.  It's definitely bargain basement (kid's ice skates for $4)   the staff is all volunteers, and all profits go to the nursing home across the street - so if you can spend a few bucks there, it's for a good cause.  Wednesdays and Thursdays are the best to go -the ladies in the place on those days are efficient, friendly and make the place easy to search through.  Unfortunately, limited hours (volunteers, you know) - but if you want to volunteer to help out, you'd get 25% off everything!!!

0.description: If I lived in the area I'd be in here on a monthly basis. A friend and I came in here on a weekday afternoon, as we did happen to be in the neighborhood. The store was well organized, tidy and not overly 'stuffed' as everything was easy to shop. Their displays for the upcoming holiday seasons were nice. I found a men's Banana Republic coat in the perfect size for my husband for just $10! I snagged it right away. It was very gently used and he's still wearing it.Street parking in front. Bring your own bag(s). Friendly volunteers.Prices were extremely reasonable and the proceeds go to a great cause.

3.description: It's a nice Walgreens. Typical layout. I was sad that they didn't have Cherry Chapstick though. I did find the original flavor which is not so good. Oh well. Everyone seems nice enough and it's a pretty big store, clean and organized, with lots of parking.

1.description: I prefer this location over others in the neighborhood. The pharmacy staff is friendly, helpful and professional always. The pharmacists remember your name and ask you how you are doing. They genuinely care. It's clean. Employees are helpful. Judy has been with Walgreens for 39 years! She's a great cashier- always smiling :)

2.description: Employee (or customer shopping for 30+ minutes (yea right...))  parked in GAS car in electric vehicle parking spot (blocking charger for NO REASON).  Hello?? They are marked and reserved for a reason.  Walgreens corporate should take some action.Entire parking lot is available.  Went inside and tried to flag someone's attention but no one cared.  Went to a different Walgreens...

0.description: Not bad, but not great. In regards to cleanliness, it's fine. Things are decently organized. But if you're running there to grab something that you need on the fly-don't count on it. Two examples: They don't offer plain tomato sauce (I needed one more for chili-They only offered flavored ragu). I also ran there for lime juice-no luck on that either.They do have a Redbox outside-that's a perk!

4.description: Overall a nice and convienent drug store.Staff-wise, this location is like every other Walgreens. This location is not a 24 hour location.  For a 24 hour location, go to the Walgreens on Cumberland in Noridge or the Walgreens on Cumberland and Devon and Talcot in Park Ridge.

28.description: Where do I even start with Nottoli? It's a typical Italian food shop. There are at least 3 in my immediate neighborhood, all with decently sized deli counters and varying sizes of imported cookies, drinks, pastas, sauces, and so on.The subs are really good and decently sized. Half of the sub is a pretty filling lunch, and they slice all the meat right when you order from the deli. I usually get a ham sub, I've never once been disappointed.But the real gem that Nottoli is hiding is their selection of frozen pastas and sauces. Their spaghetti sauce is absolutely phenomenal. I've never tasted better. I don't know what the hell they put in it, but it's incredible. Their meatballs are also amazing - and I don't even like meatballs. And, of course, their frozen ravioli and mostacholi are addictive. Stock up your freezers, because once you have them here, you'll be craving them for days afterwards.Also, the foccacia they have up by the cash register? Get yourself one or two. Even though they don't make it there, it's the best foccacia I've ever had.

1.description: There Italian beef is so good, the owner is nice and the place is always clean and stocked up, they have A variety of Italian cookies they are so good. Check out this place you won't be disappointed!

9.description: Best place to buy a sub in Chicago hands down. Perfect every time without flaw. They have "pepper spread" which is basically just blended up giardiniera, great to put on a sub or anything really.

29.description: I shop there from time to time. The pre-cooked Italian dishes are good, inexpensive , and microwaveable. I stock up... Store in the freezer until I have the urge for Italian food. Pop a dinner in the microwave... and... Voila !

23.description: Well, it's miniature inside. The people making the sandwiches are usually fairly sweet. The clerks at the cash register are HORRENDOUSLY RUDE!! The clerk informed me that there was a ten dollar minimum if using a credit card to pay and then put my card in the register and decided she had the right to hold my card until I finished looking for something to add up to ten dollars. I asked her why she took my card and she said" I was holding it for you.' Who KEEPS  a customer's credit card? Oooooh, but if you look Italian, you get the royal treatment, smooches, samples, etc. If you just have an Italian last name like me, and you'd like a friendly, polite cashier,  forgeddaboudit.Bari has better subs. Fontano's has way better subs.

5.description: Probably the best beef that I have eaten. Freshly cut and dip in that great cause. People there are great also. Go and get a beef there please

31.description: This review is going back in time but I doubt its changedI used to go here 28 years ago before i moved to California.You cant find anything like it out here.

25.description: Fantastic italian sausage which is what I went there for, best I've had.  Also ordered 4 subs, bread was great, nice and fresh, nice portions too.  Service was very fast and place is very clean.  Prices not out of line and I felt I got a good deal for what  I paid.  Place was busy for an late afternoon.  There are about 5 tables if you want to sit down and eat your sub.  I will be going back...

12.description: I just catered from Nottoli for my son's graduation party. The food and service we're outstanding!! Everybody raved about the Italian sausage and chicken parmigiana. Not to mention that we went through three trays of subs and could have easily went through three more!! They were a huge hit with the teenagers!! Thanks Nottoli!!

37.description: Whenever I am in town, I stay near here and always mule home 10 pounds or so. Their hot Italian sausage is some of the best in the area. I grew up near here and ate it my entire life. Attached to Mom's apron strings, I was always excited to come here as a child. The sights, and smells are exactly the same. I just grilled about half of my stash*, time to book a flight back to Chicago and re-up!*see picture

21.description: It may sound crazy but I am not sure if this place is affiliated with Nottoli & Son on Belmont or not. I wanted a sub sandwich and am used to going to the Belmont Nottoli, but they are closed on SUnday. My roommate INSISTED I was wrong and someone at his work said they are open. Long story short, after several drive-by to the Belmont place on Sunday with no luck I saw a Nottollis on Harlem as I was coming home from Marianos. This place WAS opened Sunday. I got an Italian sub and 2 cannoli. The cannoli were ok, nothing spectacular but I think freezing and defrositng just did not do them justice. The sandwich was good but sort of cut 75/25, I although I wanted to eat  1/2, I had to pick big cut, small cut. I would have to comapre sandwiches form both places side to side to see if there was any difference. The man at the counter was more interested in talking to some buddy who came in the door as he rung me up than pay attention to me, but really, all I need to know if how much I owe. I don't need small talk. Yes, the place is kind of dirty. Could use a scrub. Looks like they have a good selection of giardinera.

16.description: STUCK IN TIME COPYCATSOld school is a good thing; stuck in time is not. The decor in this small grocery store/deli is old-fashioned and kinda dirty. Not really dirty, but like if you ran your fingers across the top of the counters you know your finger would pick up a layer of dust. Plus, some of their salads (in the deli case) look dried out, i.e., old.Their lunch meat is definitely quality and very well-priced. Their fresh cheese selection is stellar. They have a hot bar as well as Italian homemade food in the frozen section. Most of that is good, but sometimes it's bland. Their cannolis are nothing to sing about.The store reminds me of the kind I grew up with around the Grand/Austin area. I have a lot of nostalgia and warm memories of those places. But I feel that Nottoli needs to join the rest of the 21st Century and update their place and they NEED to create more tasty hot bar items and create something different and not simply copy other Italian grocers in the area.

17.description: I love you Italian beef....but Nottoli's, I'm mad at you. I'm not supposed to eat beef, and there you go making a smoking good beef I can't resist. Worth noting, I've never had one of these beefs fresh! My coworker brings me one, and I get to it later that night, or the next day. With that being said, the thing is still off the hook. Sorry beef, not meaning to refer to you as a "thing".... That was out of line. But I still dream of having a fresh one....with the dream ending in a cold sweat because the beef was laced with a hot Italian sausage. Good grief. Or should I say beef.

10.description: Be going for there for years keeps getting better. Try the Breaded Steak sandwich !!! Awesome ! Panini 's are outstanding as well as all of the subs. Awesome Italian sausage  as well .

11.description: Nottoli's is our go to when we can't decide what sounds good to eat. The subs are great, and we have tried nearly all of them. The sausage is delicious also. We bring all of our out of town guests to try it out and they always comment on how good the food is. Staff is friendly and location is convenient with the parking next to the deli.

26.description: Sandwiches were good but the place is FILTHY and the employees are extremely UN friendly.  I will not be going back.While waiting an extremely long time for 3 sandwiches, I was looking around... and shouldn't have... I don't think this place has EVER been cleaned.  It's very tiny, very old, and everything is dingy and run down.  The cold case had tons of condensation on the doors and was not cold at all.  All the corners, nooks, and crannies of the store had piles of crud and dirt.  Thankfully I didn't see any bugs or I would have been outta there.  Under the meat slicer was piles of dried up food crumbles that had obviously been there a long time. I saw them making the sandwiches in back but I was really afraid to watch them handle my food.They don't carry many dry/canned items here, and what they do have is basically anything you can get at a produce center like A&G or Tony's.  It's overpriced too.  That being said, the Italian sub sandwiches were very good.  However the sausage sandwich had no sauce.  Just a dried up piece of sausage with a half melted slice of provolone on a piece of italian bread.  They also make homemade cannolis that are delicious, but maybe not so fresh!  Another bonus was little packets of saffron at the register for a reasonable price. I'm not sure what's up with this place.  It used to be alot better.

27.description: Mmmm Nottoli....I really need to go here more often. As I understand it they are a small deli that make subs and other Italian favorites. Well everything I had here is amazing delicious. Granted it was frozen sauce and frozen meatballs that you can make at home, but if their food was THIS good from frozen, I can only imagine how much better it is fresh. If I lived nearby I would probably never buy another jar of sauce from Jewel again because the sauce trumps crap like Ragu with ease. And their meatballs! Oh their meatballs! These are probably some of the best meatballs I ever eaten! Since I am more or less the only person who likes meatballs in my family I usually just end up eating frozen ones you get from Jewel or Market Day, which are OK and get the job done. I don't know if I could ever go back to eating that crap after having Nottoli's meatballs. I recommend them! With their meatballs and sauce, when you cook pasta at home it's like being in a great Italian restaurant. You know those ads for Bertoli's frozen Italian entrees? With the chef being all disgruntled because every one is eating at home now? That doesn't happen because of Bertoli, it will be because of Nottoli. With Nottoli on your side, you can be your own fantastic Italian chef and spoil your family rotten with the super high quality of their sauces and meatballs. Delizioso!!

35.description: This is a great little corner Italian deli that includes a cute little Italian man.  It comes with all the normal accoutrements that you would expect.  What I really recommend is the deli, especially the home made section.  I ordered large pans of both meat and spinach (vegetarian) lasagna and they were so yummy.  Unlike other Italian eateries I talked to, they cooked the lasagnas for me and had them piping hot on time.  I bought these for a bridal shower and had many raving reviews from guests.  I have also heard great things about their sub sandwiches.  Definitely a place to go to if you need a quick dinner for you or if you need something bigger for a party.

8.description: The best Italian Sausage in Chicago - They have a few different varieties and they are all good.  Our favorite is the Garlic and Fennel.  Great off the grill in sauce or in Lasagna.  Great other specialty items to choose from as well.  always friendly and helpful.  Go and try it.

0.description: Take the sauce leave the cannoliOk we'll take them both. I always go here got the frozen spaghetti sauce.  We call it Momma Nattoli gravy, because I'm sure there must be an old grandma in the back over a huge pot making this stuff with a recepie hand carried from the ol country. It is in the freezer on the left by the deli counter. I get fresh pasta from Pasta Fresh a mile south of here and combine the two and claim it as my own homemade spaghetti.  I did this on Christmas and everyone ooohhed and aaahhhed about what a good cook I am. The sub sandwiches are good and the breads are fresh from DiMattos. The meatballs are wonderful and oh ya take the cannoli.

20.description: you just cant beat nottoli.  Either location, harlem or belmont. just deliciousness.  My GO TO spot for italian saseech, it is the best around! great subs, buy their sauce and homemade meatballs when making a quick meal.  Love everything about this store. Family owned and operated, they are very nice and accomodating. They also do catering and the food is pretty damn good!

19.description: you just cant beat nottoli.  Either location, harlem or belmont. just deliciousness.  My GO TO spot for italian saseech, it is the best around! great subs, buy their sauce and homemade meatballs when making a quick meal.  Love everything about this store. Family owned and operated, they are very nice and accomodating. They also do catering and the food is pretty damn good!

33.description: Really good subs...the marinated eggplant is good. They have awesome imported smoked meats from italy.

2.description: You are almost overwhelmed by the wonderful smell of food and tradition as you enter this island of Italian food. It's almost like one travels back in time to the days when small, mom and pop, stores like this were prevalent neighborhood, family food markets.They had quite a selection of Italian sandwiches on the menu and countless selections of meat, salads, cheese and olives in the deli case. Not to mention the variety of frozen pastas and meals ready to eat in the frozen case. A selection of Italian food staples is also available to purchase, from sauces, pastas, olive oil and on and on.To say that everything was fresh and freshly made goes without saying. They also have the old school Italian pizza cut into rectangles, something I haven't seen in years.These places are hidden gem. Shop Local! Screw Jimmy John's, Subway and the like and give this place a try for a better quality, better tasting, fresher, yet cheaper and better for you sandwich and food.

34.description: Great Italian subs and italian beef & sausage combo sandwich!

32.description: I was taking my taxes in and stopped in for a quick sandwich. I love the quaint, old school vibe of this place. We ended up getting an italian sub (salami, hot capicollo, mortadella and provolone cheese) and a veggie sub (roasted peppers, marinated eggplant, artichoke hearts, and provolone cheese). Both were yummy. Can't beat the price either (under $5 each). I really appreciated that even the veggie sub with all the marinated veggies wasn't overly oily, and the service was excellent. The bread was crisp and fresh, but not so crusty you could break a tooth, which I appreciated as well.They have a great deli counter and a pretty decent market as well. I'll definitely be back!

18.description: The decor is a bit dusty but the back counter is where it's at. They provide ah-mazing subs if you are willing to wait a bit. Put in a order over the phone FIRST and cut your wait time in half. The Italian Sub sandwich has this wicked vinaigrette that puts it over the edge. The pasta salad with the thinly sliced carrots is awesome. Next time I'll try the lasagne or fresh cheese.

13.description: Meatballs, and sausage for home.  Italian beef, and sub for sharing on-site.   Great food and old school feel make this a wonderful unplanned stop.  The reviewer who called out stopping on the way to O'Hare is definitely eating well on their flight!  Enjoy.

4.description: This perfect throw-back Italian deli was a pleasant surprise! Located on the east side of Harlem Avenue it reminded me of a well-known Italian deli that I went to in NYC several years ago. This place looks like a deli from a movie that's set in a New York deli (Note to Self: Work on Screenplay). It has  been in this location for over 30 years. I ordered the Italian sub and it was loaded with fresh meats -- a mix of cured meats with provolone cheese, Iceberg lettuce finely shredded, slices of tomatoes, and an oil-vinegar dressing. The inclusion of a sneaky, but assertive pepper jam is what won me over. It is the quintessential classic Italian sub sandwich. Is there any better way to prepare this delectable sandwich? I think not!The sub here hits every element of a classic Italian combo. It's a well-balanced sandwich and not too heavy despite its ample stuffing. The bread held up nicely with the amalgamation of over-stuffed fillings and a sweet brine that decked out every flavor. The exterior of the bread was crispy and the interior was fluffy light. The bread is from D'Amato's Bakery, and the freshness and quality was very obvious to my palette.  There were cured meats hanging in front of the deli counter (if you are tall be careful not to bump your head). They make their own gravy (Americans call this "sauce") from scratch as well as lasagna, mostaccioli and cannoli. They sell authentic Italians products and have a variety of cheeses on hand. This is a mom and pop operation. It is narrow and small but well compact with loads of products. They also have a parking lot. Be careful not to hit the mother sucker huge pot hole upon entering or exiting the parking lot. Service was hospitable but not overly effusive. The deli and grocery store are well maintained and clean.I stumbled upon this joint on March 11, as I had an appointment in the area. I was driving north bound on Harlem Ave to hop back onto the Kennedy expressway and head back home when I noticed "Nottoli Italian Foods & Deli" on the east side of Harlem Avenue. Now, I have been to Bari Deli & Grocery and also Tony's Deli on Northwest Highway over 25 times. I am a sub sandwich snob, so I had to give Nottoli's a shot. It was an unexpected, spontaneous find! I can honestly say that the Italian sub sandwich here stands up to the delectable sub sandwiches at Bari (on W Grand Ave). I do not often drive out-of-the way for a deli, but this is one joint where I would return. I'd like to try their meatball, Italian beef and Italian sausage sub sandwiches.  My 6-inch Italian sub was $5.99 and the double Italian bread was $2.69. I was in and out in under 5-minutes. Bada-bing, bada-boom-boom! (P.S. You have to spend $10 or above to use your Debit card. However, it really depends on WHO is working the front register. If it is the "old" lady or "old" man walk away and go elsewhere. I stopped here on April 4, 2015. I ended up leaving the sub sandwich on the counter and walking away because she said I had to spend $10 or more. I saw NO SIGN that mentioned this in the store). Not cool. I will definitely not be returning. Ever. Period.

24.description: The Subs here are awesome! Been going here for years and never have had a bad meal! I love the made to order subs the are fresh and delicious! They have homemade pastas, homemade sausage and sauces that make a great and quick, easy dinner! If on the North side this Mom and Pop place is a must!

6.description: Nottoli Foods is just one of those places that you would have to be told about. Almost offensive to say, but this is a truly "authentic" Italian market that probably does 95% of its business to local residents who have always shopped there in search of the best Italian meats, cheeses, olives, and breads. It hasn't been polished to cater to trust fund wannabe food bloggers whose "of the people" claim is High Life consumption. For this reason, the prices are staggering.The deli portion of the store is at the rear, while the center store consists of three aisles of pastas, spices, breads, and a few sauces (I assume for the folks who don't make their own). Fresh pastries/cookies are located right at the counter. The front of Nottoli's has two small high-top tables for on-premise consumption of sandwiches from the back.A co-worker and I (she was the one who knew of Nottoli) stopped there on the way back to O'Hare. Two huge sandwiches, two drinks, chips, a side of marinated artichoke hearts, and a side of rainbow tortellini set us back $20. Not apiece. A single Jackson. My co-worker originally wanted to stop there because she always picks up some things to carry back to her home for herself and friends. This time, she picked up a lifetime supply of apple-sized olives for about $15.If you are flying out of O'Hare and want a decent place to grab a bite, this place is also blessed with great parking. It's approximately 15 minutes east of the airport, making it a convenient stop from downtown. Pull your generic rental sled into the parking lot off of Harlem and bring an appetite.

22.description: I've been going here for cookies, subs, soups, and pasta since I was a little girl. I love this place oh so much for their great, but smallish, selection of Italian goods.
