15.description: I went there just before the lunch rush to pick up a sub.  The lady took my order and went to make my sub.   As I was walking around and looking for a side dish I heard a clickin sound that I knew was the sound of a finger nail clipper.  Sure enough I look behind the deli counter and it was an employee cutting his nails standind right behind the lady making my sub.  I ran out of there as soon as I could.  I called to talk to someone there and they apologized but they had to add that he wasn't cutting his nails next to her.

7.description: The BEST Italian Sausage ever!

36.description: I love this place. The people there are always so nice and helpful. They have great prices and everything you would need to make a great Italian meal. The biggest surprise for me was the great sandwiches they make. I finally tried an Italian sub and it was great. Not as good as Bari's but a lot closer and almost as good. They put a good amount of meat, cheese and a generous amount of seasonings and oil and vinegar. It got a little soggy but I kinda like the vinegar so if you don't, maybe ask them to put a little less dressing on there. I'll be back!

30.description: nottoli is the new mistress in my lifegrabbed a 5 dollar ital sub last week on my lunchbreak and bit into heaven...i dont eat meat often so when i do...if i say its good...u know its damn good...perfect amount of dressing splashed on (other half lasted til lunch the next afternoon with zero sogginess!!!)not really a gripe here but a bit of a nuisance if u have limited time...u order sammies from the deli counter so u may have to wait in line for a bitthey take credit w/a $10 min but really thats not an issue cause with all the other awesome imported goods in here ur golden*only gripe was on the focaccia...must have been sittin in the store for a while cause a day after i took it home it grew some mold :(

3.description: WOW, The simmering smell of DELICIOUS hits you when you walk in.They have a great selection of ready to go food. Ravioli and lasagna are both first rate. All the subs are great and the value can't be beat.

14.description: Love this place it is awesome must go I have been going to this place for years must try the Italian sub its the bomb literally they have 2 locations and they are both the same which is amazing MUST TRY

3.description: I just came from getting a mani and pedi from Alice. She is literally the best nail tech I have ever had & I've been getting my nails done since my sophomore year in high school. She takes her sweet time, clipping, exfoliating, and especially messaging. A rarity now because salons are more considered with quantity instead of quality.She notice my ingrown toe nail and tried to sooth it by clipping dead skin away. Then when she did my nails, she recommended the color on my nails in my picture! Instead of the black I originally wanted. And she even did some design which I loved and didn't even charge me extra for. (I had a gift certificate!) I loved the service so much I came back just to make sure she got her tip!

1.description: My grandson and I were there yesterday and a male cut our hair - we both showed him pictures and he did not do anything near what the picture was.  My grandson was so upset I can live with mine but it is like 3 inches shorter than was anticipated and what the pictureshowed.  Classic I am the professional and I will cut your hair the way I want not the way you want.  I will never go there again I should not have paid for the cuts.  Maybe if you get Jackie like I did the first time it is ok but never let anyone else that works there do your hair.

2.description: I used to get it cut at korean places and gave this place a try.. Ive entrusted my hair here twice before and they i thought they were fine, my friends didnt like it and i didnt think anything of it until i started looking at my old pictures. They were actually pretty ugly, i only overlooked it because i had long hair before and thought they would grow out a little nicer. The only reason im giving it a bad review now is because the guy doesnt care and one of the female workers rushed my haircut it in order to take care of other mongolian customers, so they were being a little unprofessional in favoring their own race. I managed to find a better hair salon thats worth it and more friendly.

9.description: They left me with a burn cut. I am missing a layer of skin from my eyelid and my eyebrows are still extremely messy.

10.description: Got a great cut from March last week. Jackie and her staff are so nice and helpful. This is my new salon!

4.description: I went this beautiful salon yesterday! I colored my hair by myself. After 2 times oh god I looked terrible! Then I decided to go this salon before they closed. Immediately, I called to this salon and woman who picked the phone she was very welcoming me and they got me before they closed. I went there 20 minutes before they closed. Thank god, They were both of the ladies done my hair. They did great job! Also, they have awesome personality also so fun. We shared food together. Absolutely, I would come again this salon. Thank you specially Tseegii sister also one of a kind woman.

6.description: Lisa has been my hairdresser for the past 4 years. She's the best that's why I travel over 15 miles just for her to cut, shampoo and style my hair. It's worth the drive as this place is very clean, great prices and their staff is very friendly. They can do every hair style imaginable as well as razor fades. Jackie O's also offers a wide variety of salon & spa services.

12.description: Jackie is the best!! Very good prices and she cuts hair like a champ! Always knows what she's doing and every time i walk out of there, i have a smile on my face..considering i've cried a few times after i left other salons. Jackie's new salon is super clean and modern. Did i mention great prices?? I recommend her for guys and ladies. She cuts both and does a great job

5.description: Jackie is a great hairstylist with years of experience. She's very attentive to her customers and takes reservations as well. Recommended !

13.description: I am so happy that Jackie finally opened up her salon. She is an awesome hairstylist and I highly recommend her.

11.description: I used to see Jackie for waxes when she was with Bana and I'm so excited to go see her at her own salon! Booking an appointment asap! Prices can't be beat and she is a talented woman as well as a very nice person. Trifecta!

8.description: This salon deserves more than five stars.  The prices are rock bottom.  The staff is friendly and skilled.  I've had services done at some of the finest salons and spas in the world.  The services here are just as top quality, only at a tenth of the price.  Lisa gave me an outstanding shampoo, razor cut, and blow out.  Alice did a great job on my mani/pedi.  Run, don't walk, to this place.  It's clean, comfortable, reasonably priced, and staffed by knowledgeable professionals.  My only criticism is that they need to remove the plastic off the back of the pedicure chairs.  That was a little sweaty, due to summer weather.  If they want to protect the fabric, I suggest a towel, slip cover, or spraying Scotch Guard on them.

0.description: First time going to this salon. I showed some pictures of different colors I would like but I told Jackie to do what she thought was best. She directed another stylist and it turned out beautiful. It was not what I expected or usually like, but it's perfect. There are some minor things that bothered me about the experience, that is why it's not a 5. Overall, I will be returning.

7.description: This is a new salon which recently opened on the NW side of Chicago. Jackie had worked at a previous salon on Central Ave. I was so happy to find her, and see she has her own salon. As Always. she did an excellent job on my hair. Color, cut style, wax, for $55.00!! The salon is new, and well decorated. I hope more local people are aware that she has her own place. The only negative i would say, if this is a negative, and that is the majority of staff, and clients when i was there were mongolian. Thats fine. It just was uncomfortable at times as no one was speaking Enlgish. Then again, who cares. Jackie did an excellent job.

12.description: Amy Hall Martin is fantastic! I have seen her work and know many of her clients. She does a fantastic job with color and is always up to date with the latest styles and trends. She listens to her clients and provides them with styles that are always flattering. I highly recommend Amy and this salon.

3.description: OMG Great service, great hair.  They feature Living Proof products and my hair has never been this good.  Marla fit both my Mom and I in with a color and a perm and haircuts and we loved it.  So lucky to have found this salon!!!

1.description: Came here on a Saturday, and I don't know if Marla or Amy cut my hair but she cut my hair EXACTLY how i wanted. Usually people screw up a couple things with my hair but not here. She was able to execute with precision all while holding a great conversation and listening to disco music haha. Out the door for 26+tip.Just a heads up, its a little difficult to find the place even with a gps. Theyre right next door to Ginos in the office building.

2.description: I'm totally loyal to Marla! And, that only happens when I love the way a hair dresser cares for my hair. My hair has never looked better. Marla colors and styles my hair to fit my personal style and baby-fine hair, while still changing things up to keep contemporary. She has also turned me on to phenomenal products that give me fullness, body and an amazing healthy shine. Love, love, love that I've found Marla to care for my hair!

9.description: Marla has been cutting my hair for many years. She always changes it up for me, which I love.  She is great at color too. Definitely try the reflexology.  Marla gives you her full attention and makes the experience fun.

10.description: Marla is my new favorite hairdresser. She worked with my  schedule and gave a great cut.  I'll definitely be back for other services.

13.description: Amy, a stylist here has been doing my hair for years and she is fantastic at women's cuts and is very creative with color. She always seems to know exactly what I want (even though I may not) and it always looks great for a reasonable price. I encourage anyone to check it out. Kudos Amy and keep up the good work!

16.description: Marla, the owner of the salon has been styling my hair for the past three years. She is great at what she does, and is priced reasonably. The salon is small, but very nice with the latest products, hair color, etc. Convenient to those in the Park Ridge / Rosemont area.

6.description: Whether Marla or Amy cut may hair, they always do a terrific job.

15.description: Knowledgeable in current styles, products, and trends. This salon offers a variety of services at affordable prices with a friendly and welcoming staff. A well kept secret that deserves to be shared.

0.description: If you want one of the best experiences for your style, your hair and confidence, then Marla and Co is the place you want to go.Affordable, flexible schedule, advice on what works for your type of hair, rather than someone forcing their products or style on you... Really one of the best stylist experiences I've had.I've been a client for about 2 years and every time, I am surprised and just blown away. Today was one of my favorite cuts/styles... As I age, it seems difficult to have a cut that works, and Marla always comes through.Located in 2 convenient locations in Rosemont / Chicago area, just off Bryn Mawr... Thank you Marla ad Co. I look forward to trying some new services...

5.description: Went in for a haircut and was pretty direct with what I wanted. Instead, received the basic "go-to" haircut with layers. 3-stars for the fact that she did not listen...just washed my hair and I am sticking by the 3-star rating. Would not return nor recommend

11.description: Jaqui, who does reflexology here on Tuesdays, is spectacularly good at it and also extremely personable, nice to talk with. I highly recommend making an appointment with her.

8.description: I work in the same building so I thought this would be nice and convenient to get a pedicure on my lunch. I specifically told the person I only have an hour then I need to get back to work. She seemed nice, very chatty. The pedicure was okay but it seemed to go at a snail's pace. It took over 15 minutes just to paint my nails. Not sure I will be going back here.

4.description: Amy cut my hair and really did a nice job. The salon is very quiet and peaceful. It has been several weeks and it continues to grow out well. I definitely will be back.

14.description: The owner Marla cuts my hair. Not only is she good at it, but she is a super nice person as well.The salon is located on the lower level of one of the Presidential Towers on Bryn Mawr. It's mainly aimed at people working in those towers, but if you want a really good $35 haircut, this is the place.

7.description: Great men's cut from either Marla or Amy.  Very satified with how they've handled my hairs!

1.description: My Nails look like a "Full-On Monet"What's a Monet?It's like a painting see, from far away it's Ok, but up close it's a big ol mess! Thank you Cher from Clueless, you have just helped me describe what is wrong with my no-chip manicure. Only the friendliness of the staff saves this from a one star rating.The shop is clean and atmosphere is relaxing.  Although I wonder about some of the decor items--helicopters?  Okaaaaay.....I had a feeling my No-Chip would turn out bad as my tech had a really sloppy technique and my nails did not stay under the light as long as I think they should have.  The nail color goes all the way down to the cuticle on some nails and isn't very even, so up close it looks pretty sloppy.  I'm sure no one would notice it if I was just sitting and talking to them, but as someone that's had really good no-chips in the past, the work here at T-nails really is sub par. I visited Monday morning and it's Thursday and paint on one of my nails chipped today.  See? Sloppy technique.  Don't waste your time or money here.

9.description: Their nail work was fine. I was just blown away that the technician asked me if I just had a baby.  I have never had a child and I was offended.  Im not sure why someone would feel the need to ask such a question, so rude.    They will never get my business again.

23.description: I came here about an hour and a half before close on a Thursday night. It was my first visit.  When I got there, there was a woman getting a pedicure in the far pedicure chair. I was done before her. It was very rushed and there was barely any scrubbing of the rough spots that I came to get rid of. The lady who did my pedi was not at all friendly and I doubt she spoke English. There was another lady who was working on someone else who seemed very nice - I wish I'd gotten her. As I'm sitting here writing this review, the polish on my toes is still gummy and has many dents in it. I've had many pedicures and I do my own nail art so I know a thing or two about nail polish. I know that when the polish stays gummy it's because it's old. I'll most likely go back to show them what's going on but I really don't want to deal with how uncomfortable I'll feel when they start talking about me in another language. I'm really sad because I saw such great reviews here and the place is new. If anyone finds a good place for pedicures, please let me know!!!!!****************EDIT!!!*****************Can't believe I forgot about Rose Nails on Milwaukee & Austin!!!!!!! Awesome place and they are SOOOO FRIENDLY!!!  Great work and lower prices!!!!

5.description: Everything with my experience was fine. Nothing special. Credit card tips not allowed. I offered to run to the bank and take out cash. "OK"Ran around in a giant neighborhood circle within 5 minutes.Came back and they had closed and turn off all the lights. Thanks jerks.

25.description: I had a few great experineces here so far! They are very customer friendly, and are patient! Their location is great and parking is easy. They were extremely clean, and I can't wait to go back!

12.description: I came here about an hour and a half before close on a Thursday night. It was my first visit.  When I got there, there was a woman getting a pedicure in the far pedicure chair. I was done before her. It was very rushed and there was barely any scrubbing of the rough spots that I came to get rid of. The lady who did my pedi was not at all friendly and I doubt she spoke English. There was another lady who was working on someone else who seemed very nice - I wish I'd gotten her. As I'm sitting here writing this review, the polish on my toes is still gummy and has many dents in it. I've had many pedicures and I do my own nail art so I know a thing or two about nail polish. I know that when the polish stays gummy it's because it's old. I'll most likely go back to show them what's going on but I really don't want to deal with how uncomfortable I'll feel when they start talking about me in another language. I'm really sad because I saw such great reviews here and the place is new. If anyone finds a good place for pedicures, please let me know!!!!!****************EDIT!!!*****************Can't believe I forgot about Rose Nails on Milwaukee & Austin!!!!!!! Awesome place and they are SOOOO FRIENDLY!!!  Great work and lower prices!!!!

21.description: This place is newer so it seems clean. But they never ever ever ever have enough people. You often wait at least a half hour before you get started. It's so freaking annoying! I've been to several places that do NOT take that long. And one guy just sits on his iPad while you are waiting. It really drives me crazy cause they never give any inclination as to how long you will be waiting!! Their work is mediocre, not worth the wait.

16.description: I just love this place! The service is wonderful and the staff is very friendly. I always get my nails done by Tony (been his customer for about 7 years now) and I have never, ever had a bad time. Everywhere I go I get compliments about my nails. When I do get a pedicure it is a wonderful, relaxing experience!  I wouldn't even consider going someplace else!

17.description: This place is not the place worth it for a no-chip. You see $25 dollars and think great deal -- wrong- my nails look awful..... ! Save yourself the heartache!

10.description: The ladies are always nice to me. Clean place that makes my nails look amazing at a great price.

11.description: T-Nails is very friendly and affordable! $30 for a mani/pedi! Awesome! I had a great nail tech there her name is Jane - she is very nice, asks questions, and works hard to earn your business. The pedicure chairs - yes, please! They are so comfortable and the massage is great! You have a nice chance to soak your feet, get the pedicure and then a salt scrub on your legs with a hot towel. I loved my mani/pedi by Jane! Go see her!

26.description: I have been going here since it has opened. I love this place, very clean and they do great work. I always get the non chip and no problems so not sure what Mickey  is talking about!! Never a bad experience here!!

27.description: Yes shop is new and clean. Staff is friendly.  I went as a walk in for a non chip. They started me about 10 minutes after I arrived but was seated immediately. My non chip was priced at $25. I think that is their grand opening offer. I must say I won't likely return. My nails were finished at different lengths. From a far clear finish looks fine but a closer inspection reveals in uneven layering and coursed filing under the coats. My tech was Krystal. Not horrible but certainly not great.

0.description: Let's not get things twisted, I like to keep proper. By proper my mean nails manicured. I am a big fan of T Nails. Their shop is clean and beautiful. Their people who work there are really friendly and are very skilled in keeping your nails proper. My go to guy is Sam. He is so friendly and really makes sure my no chip manicure is flawless, time and time again. My mother in law goes to Tina, and she loves her. I have had some disaster no chips from other places but i am so happy with their service. The prices are great and dont forget to bring cash for your tip because they dont take it on the card (they still accept credit cards, just cant put a tip on there).

20.description: I used to be a Religious Lee nails on devon kind of girl, but this is definitely my new place... Its super clean, brand new, and the Prices are AMAZING!!! $28 for a no chip French Manicure??? Sign me up!!! I really cant understand the workers but I had a younger girl that I really liked... I will be a return Customer for sure!!!

19.description: This place is newer so it seems clean. But they never ever ever ever have enough people. You often wait at least a half hour before you get started. It's so freaking annoying! I've been to several places that do NOT take that long. And one guy just sits on his iPad while you are waiting. It really drives me crazy cause they never give any inclination as to how long you will be waiting!! Their work is mediocre, not worth the wait.

2.description: This is my favorite nail salon. I have been going here for years and they do a fabulous job with no chip and my pedicure. Very affordable compared to other places and friendly as well. Highly recommended.

18.description: I would have rated one star but the politeness of the staff earned this place two. I've been looking for a new nail place and needless to say, this is not it. When I first entered I was greeted and told to pick a color, my wait time was about two minutes on a Saturday evening. The place looked clean and new and I was excited to get my fill and a color change.  I was called over when the lady was done with her previous customer, I told her what I wanted and she began to rip off the bottom of the gel nails for the fill (as many places have done before) but the way she did it hurt and it seemed to amuse her. I toughed it out though and at the end she tells me too much was taken off so she needs to soak them off and do a new set. I wanted a fill so that I could be out of there faster, but at this point I didn't have much of a choice and agreed. It took her a while to get them off, and when she started the new set it was obvious she had very little experience with gel nails. She didn't size up the tips to my nails,  used scissors to cut them to my "desired" length and did so crookedly and too short. Her gel application was sloppy and thick. Not once did she use those electric filers to even out the surface. She did some manual filing,  but only left my nails more crooked and super short. If I wanted my nails natural length, I would have gotten a regular manicure. Finally,  she applied the color. She got it all over her hands and mine,  at least she used acetone to remove the mess she made. The price was reasonable,  but I would rather go elsewhere to get it done right.  I will not be back.

13.description: They Did Really Good Work. Only downside was that i got fungus. .sometimes the wait was long but hey that's life. The owner did fantastic work.His attitude was shitty. I walked out in the middle of a service. Sorry. :-(I stopped going because I got Foot Fungus..but also because I waited so long for a service, that I had to go I had a haircut app across town . Long story short they offered to charge me 4 my Many pedi and have me return for the manicure. .. sweet lord, tony was pissed when I refused the offer. . If you have other commitments then, you have a limited amount of time, not a  big deal. However that particular day 5 clients  walked out they became angry. Not my fault. They should have told me, that they were booked and I would have gladly returned!

4.description: I went to this salon for over a year till they started getting sloppy. I went in one day to get some nails fixed. I sat down showed her what I needed and got a look of" What?". She did a horrible fix job. I told her that it did not look right and this was not acceptable. She had to call someone on the phone talk to them and then tell me to come back in an hour. REALLY? I walked out and never returned.

24.description: I drove by the place and thought I would give it a try.  They take walk ins.  There are quite a few manicurists.  I was given to one and liked the work he did.  They can be difficult to understand.  I returned and had him again.  Nice job.   The manicurist next to him chatted on her cell as she did her client's nails.  At this point I am a returning customer.  I walked in and asked for a pedicure.  He was in the middle of a client.  I said I could wait and TOLD him that I would be a couple doors down at Subway having a sandwich.  I finished and came back.  He had started a client who had just walked in.  They told me to sit and wait.  I decided to leave.  I am now a regular somewhere else in the neighborhood.

6.description: Took a last minute chance at a pedicure on Sunday !!! Very nice and accommodating ! Lots of colors to choose from too !!

22.description: I have been coming to this salon every few weeks for about 9 months now.  If you're looking for a good value, quality work and kind people, this is a great spot.  My no-chip manicures here last for a good two weeks - and I wash my hands constantly with alcohol-based rubs.  At $25 for a regular and $28 for a French, they're a good value.  The polish on my pedicures usually lasts around 3 weeks or so.  Pedicures come with a foot / leg salt scrub while you sit in a massaging chair and watch TV.  Very relaxing.I have never waited for a service, and I rarely make an appointment or call ahead.  They work efficiently, too...which I especially appreciate when short on time.  The people who work there are sweet.  They have always treated me well and have gone above and beyond on a few occasions to make me feel more comfortable (e.g. when I was 9 months pregnant, one of the women who worked there offered to give me a massage [no charge] while my nails were drying because she could tell I was tired.)  Really kind.The location is convenient (right on Northwest Highway). Parking is easy and free.

15.description: I wanted to love this place again.. really I did. I used to come here all the time when they first opened.  They were great! The service was exceptional and the prices were good. I only stopped going because I moved and found a spot closer to my home, however, my best friend and I decided to try them out again since we were in the neighborhood. Walking in, the nail salon has a very clean feel to it and we were greeted right away. I was even surprised that they remembered me and even asked after my sister. (I seriously hadn't been there in a year so I was pleasantly surprised.) They asked my friend and I to pick a color, which we did. I just wanted a nail removal, mani and pedi. The pedi went great. My nail tech was very nice and super attentive. After she was done she asked me to take a seat at her section (I'm assuming). She didn't soak my nails off.. no.. she buffed them as low as possible.. which burned the heck out of the tops of my nails. After saying 'ouch' about 20 times.. she grabbed a fake plastic nail and  tried to slide that between my actual nail and the acrylic one I already had on!!! Ughhhhh... never again!! My nails were already tender and this just made it 10x worse. So as she worked on my right hand I decided to just pull the ones on my left hand off myself because what she was doing felt far worse. To top it all off she kept insisting on a color I didn't want to do. (It was completely different from the one I picked for my pedi).. well after the nail removal she buffed my nails some more.. had me wash my hands.. soaked them in water for 2 minutes.. cleaned the nail beds.. and added polish.. I have had manis before.. There was no hand rub.. and even worse.. no apology. When she told me the price I was surprised.  She charged me for the nail removal. The one I helped with lol That was kind of a joke.. wanna know the kicker, I still gave her a nice tip!!! How awesome am I?! My problem isn't with the staff, really.. they're super nice and again the pedi was good.. The salon is very clean, but I'd never go through their nail removal process again.. ever! Don't think I'll come here again.. I'll stick to the few places by my house..

7.description: Never disappointed clean, friendly, quality work! Great selection of polish and more no chip choices then anywhere I've seen

8.description: Sam has always been great when it comes to no chip! Called to asked if he was in & said I would be there at 5pm. Get there to get another lady & told her I asked for Sam. Was ignored so done pedicure then when it was time for nails I asked again for Sam. I was told I should have asked. I said how many times do I need to ask? She told me I could wait for him but I said I'm not waiting around for him to finish someone else...just do it. Nails were not even filed down right & I bet it won't even last 1 week. Guess I will find another place to go.

3.description: Quite possibly the worst manicure/pedicure I've ever received. The woman painting my nails was rude and abrupt. She played on her phone throughout the mani/pedi (including while wearing wet gloves mid-pedicure).  My no chip manicure was bump filled and peeled within two days. While it is less expensive than other nail salons, it was a total waste of money.

14.description: I've been getting my nails done for years... This is the first place I've found that never let's Me down. Sam is the best and my nails are always perfect. I get the powder gel. Sometimes we put the no chip on top. Even though I am loyal to Sam, I have seen the other people do great jobs. Everyone is always super nice. Great pedicures too. I drive all the way from Wrigleyville just to come here. PS. You can pay with a card but tip in cash only!

58.description: I always order my THIN crust Pizza from Dino's. It is hmm hmm good. My only complaint is that sometimes it is too greasy. Otherwise , it is my favorite neighborhood pizza joint.

56.description: For those of us who complain how hard it is to find a good classic Chicago thin crust pizza, head on up to Dino's. It's  as good as Pete's used to be. 'nuff said. pricey but worth it

29.description: Took my son's grade school and basketball team to Dino's after the championship game with family.  We had about 30 people in all and Dino's staff was very accommodating and friendly.  We called last minute and they put us in our own room with a pizza buffet, pitchers of pop, etc.  They took great care of us and every one was happy and loved the pizza.  Almost forgot to mention they had a gluten free crust option.

42.description: Heard this place has been here forever. Once you get inside its got that old school italian family restaurant place, kinda like where micheal corleone shot the officer in the head (The Godfather reference) Overall the pizza isnt bad nothing special. The service is pretty good, i like the small bar in the back, and the outdoor seating is amazing on nice summer days. Good for groups or families.

23.description: Not a bad neighborhood spot. Definitely forgettable unfortunately. It was good, but nothing really stood out. The food was good, nice prices and good service. Everything looked home made. I ordered the blt, fried ravioli, and a canolli.  All were very good.

47.description: I grew up eating at this place. I also lived in the neighborhood half of my life. While both are stale and out of date, Dino's is an atrocity against the humble pizza. The dough has enough corn starch to keep your car from slipping on an icy driveway. The sauce is canned, sweet and uninspired. The cheese is mediocre. My grandparents swear by this place. They also make mainly recipes from 1960-1970. Do yourself two favors. One, stay away from this place, there's no excuse for bad pizza. Two, if you are unfortunate to live in this area: move. There is a better and larger world out there.

8.description: I am a big fan of their thin crust pizza (sausage and green pepper).  Dino's is in my top 5 favorite pizzas in the city.  Really good lasagna as well.  The pizza sauce is sometimes inconsistent which is sometimes a letdown, but really good more times than not.  We typically do not order anything else and prefer to order it as carryout.

31.description: Dino's is a pizza parlor right out of the 50's, and their pies are legit. Thin crust, well done is definitely the way to go normally, but the BBQ bacon is an awesome way to change it up. Always fast, and is definitely the best in the neighborhood. The weekly deals are unbelievable too. Wednesdays you get a small cheese with any pizza, and free pop with any order on Saturdays. They're a neighborhood place and really appreciate their customers, and they have a descent sized dinning room and small banquet room too. Their food besides pizza is pretty good as well, pasta, beef and the other Italian staples. Dino's is the only place I order from for a good reason, it's really good and consistent.

34.description: Peperoni should be under the cheese. That's a must .Christine was wonderful as a server. Met a guy named Jason he was also amazing! Took 2 stars off because of the peperoni.

16.description: THE BIG BEEFS ARE BACK!Have nor been at Dino's for quite some time after a few bad beef experiences (read previous post)So on a whim we stopped in and got a few beefs to go and there just like the original big bomber's .Will be back!!

13.description: Love their BLT pizza. Other Italian favorites are always good. Lasagna was awesome  it's a neighborhood joint and certainly not a stuffy formal place.

11.description: Best pizza! Love it there! Friendly servers and lots of other great stuff on the menu too. Try the BLT pizza or the cheesy beef sandwich.

39.description: Best pizza on the northwest side of town. Prices are not too bad and any pizza you order I promise you won't be disappointed.

37.description: I had my first slice of pizza here as a little girl, and now 25 years later I am back in the neighborhood and Dino's is just as magical as I remember.  They also have an updated back patio which is comfortable and inviting in the summer.

0.description: I don't think I can capture the experience my family and I had with the Dino's staff for a birthday party we celebrated in their private party room but I'll try! We had been looking for a place to hold this party for a few weeks when I found this gem. My husband and I liked the cozy clean feel of the place that comfortably seated our 50 guests. The food was absolutely delicious and was presented in a very appetizing manner as well! The servers were super friendly and served everyone their drinks with a smile. Our only regret is not going to Dino's sooner! We were recently back for pizza night--yumm!!!- and were welcomed back by Bianca, Lupe, and Melissa  with a warm smile, friendly conversation, and great service! I recommend Dino's to anyone and everyone for the food, the service, and because it's amazing!!

38.description: Great thin crust Chicago style pizza; heavy on the ingredients and sauce. Delicious pasta dishes only make dine-in choices more difficult. Great hearty soups and hot fresh bread with your meal put it over the top. Good value. Take-out or dine-in, you can't lose if you want authentic Chicago pizza.

51.description: This is the place to go if you want good thin crust pizza.  Nice crust, quality cheese.  I order larger than I need and then have it the next day.  I was on a search in the area and Dino's was the best!   It reminds me of an Italian neighborhood restaurant where everyone goes.  Many large parties and families seem to come here. They also offer sandwiches and entrees.  My friend had soup and lasagna when we went in and he thought both were tasty.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Reasonably priced.  Quite casual.  Some day I am going to order the pan pizza.

27.description: Pizza is great. Order it well done and it's not as greasy. Pasta dishes are tasty too.

32.description: Don't come here if you want to listen to music or Hanks game while eating pizza. Pizza is okay but management doesn't care about the customer.

54.description: I'm not impressed really. It's not bad but is not great. The staff is nice, but weird. The bar area is old and out dated. I actually like there pizza better the next day. It's a neighborhood joint so it's cool and they do have a really nice outdoor patio.

48.description: We have been ordering from here for 20 years.   Last night we order a stuffed pizza and we picked it up due to the snow storm, we assumed it would be quicker and the pizza would be hot.  The pizza was AWEFUL!  Very little sauce!  The sauce that we did get was very salty!  The pizza was totally burnt on the botton.A $25.00 pizza out the window.  I had three family members that wouldn't even eat the pizza.We normally order from Phil for stuffed pizza, I get we will stick to them.

44.description: Great pizza place. Great service and wonderful staff. Christine was our server. she was wonderful with a personality. Very cute as a bonus.

24.description: Wednesdays are the best. .buy one get one. .. Great ingredients. ..When I moved from gladestone park to Norwood park I had to find a great pizza joint and man does Dinos fill that void..love dinos!

7.description: I heard that yesterday on the 8th of Oct they were closed with a big green sign saying there license is suspended and I head it's because they weren't cleaning there dishes right and some other stuff I ain't going there and there food wasn't so great the past year I see why now!

49.description: Been ordering from here for 20 years and its going downhill!  Sadly, to say!  Always recommended them to everyone!  Don't anymore!  Over the last year, whenever I'd order a pizza, I would have to say.."ask the cook not to burn it please", because it would come black around the edges and on the bottom so we would have to cut off the best part and throw it out.  We complained once and received a new pizza in 3 hours!! Asking them not to burn it...seemed to work.  It would come perfect.  Well, today I forgot to say it...and, guess what??  It's burnt!!! So, I'm angry and decided to write my review.  Why???.. Should I have to add "don't burn it" to any pizza order from anyplace???There is a delivery man, that we think is the owner's husband or father.  He will ring the door bell, bang on the door and windows till you answer!!  Can i get up from my chair???   Make sure you have exact change with him as he automatically thinks whatever change there is, is his!!! Husband gave him a $50 bill one time and he just starts walking away with the change. Or...  He will also give you change back and automatically think that $5 is his tip and pocket $5. Watch out for him.  Older, under 5'8, gray hair and usually wears a Baseball cap. He never has your pizza in the hot box.Younger delivery kids are very professional and respectful and never have tried to pull any scams with your money like the old guy does.  They always have your food in the hot box!! I will order from here again....just never a pizza!Their pastas are very good and I love their greasy cheesy garlic bread. Lasagna order is enough for one person, or two if not real hungry.Mostacolli order is enough for 2-3 people.  Husband loves their baked clams. Reminder...watch your $ with the old delivery guy andOrder something besides pizza. They also may want to computerize their ordering system.  Very antiquated.

40.description: I was in Chicago to pick up my friend from O'Hare when I found out her plane was going to be VERY late due to a storm. I stumbled upon Dino's and figured it would be a good place to stop and have a leisurely dinner. It was the best decision I made! Not only did they give me SO much food for a decent price (I had the eggplant parm), they were so wonderful! My waitress, Michelle, knew I would be there a while and she was so attentive without being pushy. She always wanted updates on my friend's flight status. It was nice to have a waitress who genuinely cared. The entire staff was so attentive the entire time. I also LOVED how late they were open. They are open hours after Starbucks closed. I was soooo lucky to find this place. I recommend it to anybody in the area.

53.description: First time there. We were recommended by a friend. Dino's is a neighborhood joint, unfortunately not enough left. The pan pizza was great: tasty sauce, enough cheese and fresh toppings. Service was good. Hopefully next time we go, it will go up to five stars. Looking forward to it!

30.description: I want to start off by saying that my husband and I have been trying different pizza places around town since we have been let down by our usual place we have been going to for years....sorry Annette's.  I also told myself that I would stop doing reviews if I had only been to a place once.  I think others need to follow that rule as well.  With all that being said, I somewhat regret to announce that I wish I never never never ate food INSIDE this place.   We had been ordering pizzas from Dino's for the last several weeks...  Four great pizzas in total.  They were crisp, nicely sauced, and the toppings were good.  No complaints about the pizza.  Since we have been having such great luck with the pies, we thought we would dine in and see what else they had.I hate to be so rude, but the place inside needs major work.  We sat next to the window near the door.  The booth is kept together with duct tape and the window frame is cracked and seeping water.  The room is also old.  Our waitress was a hot mess.  Hair was pulled back, yet looked as if she just rolled out of bed.  She also spoke as if she just rolled out of bed....a little dazed.  We ordered the spaghetti special....soup, salad, and unlimited spaghetti.  There was a choice of two soups,.  My 3yr old had minestrone soup, which was ok.  My husband and I had some kind of beef noodle, not good.  Our salads came. My salad was wrong and my husbands dressing was spoiled.  Or spaghetti was ok.  Nothing special at all.  It felt as though I was very ripped off, sauce tasted like Ragu. I could have done the pasta at home with jar sauce for a few bucks for all of us....not $9.00 for each of us.  The waitress had showed up before our spaghetti, to our table with a large pizza and basket of fries which we had to tell her was not ours....I wish we didn't tell her.  Our meal was terrible.  The meal plus the slow, dazed waitress plus the decor just makes me wish I never ate there and kept it strictly a carry out pizza place only.  I suggest you do the same.

46.description: Best stuffed spinach & sausage pizza on the Northwest Side.

1.description: Food excellent. Service atrocious. Called to let manager know about bartender. Manager seemed professional and asked me to come back. When I returned to give it another chance, the angry bartender told me that she likes to joke around and have fun, that she had been working there a long time and that she didn't appreciate me starting any trouble for her. She then proceeded to bully me and badmouth me to her regular customers who told me that she was telling them that I am crazy. I guess I'm so crazy for expecting good customer service... good service that doesn't include wait 25 minutes to get served a drink and instead of taking my order, I get a bag of Aldi brand cheetos slapped down on the counter in front of me...instead of asking to take my food order yeah... I guess I'm so crazy and unreasonable...

55.description: I am giving this place 2 stars for the incredibly SLOW service. I am not even faulting the waitress for the wait. She did come over after 25-30 minutes to let us know she checked on our order and it should be up shortly. If we had ordered a stuffed pizza or something on that order I could understand the delay. We ordered a burger and a steak sandwich! The place wasn't even packed. We did notice there were too many kids working there. They all seemed to be standing around and a bit disorganized. I've had their pizza before it is good. If I was going to do takeout I would maybe order from here. We noticed a lot of people coming in to pick up pizzas. That's probably the best way to eat here. I don't think we will dine in again.

9.description: OK, I like the neighborhood appeal, the homey interior, but if you place a carryout order for more than say, four or five people, double check your order. Large numbers seem to throw the staff. I've had items omitted or erroneously included on two previous occasions, but tonight is a polar vortex evening and I refuse to hike back over to the restaurant because they forgot to include my order...and I'm still waiting for their guy to deliver it. So, words of caution: double check your order. Be patient if you're waiting for their delivery guy. Have your friends/family order enough to feed you until your order arrives.After dinner update: the Italian beef: very dry. Plentiful but very dry. My dog was thrilled though...Buffalo chicken sandwich: huge but amazingly chewy. Cheesy beef was OK since the cheese helped offset the papery dry beef. Oh yeah, still waiting for my soup. So I took down one star.

26.description: I work out of my home and get off work at 12 noon every Friday -- year round -- so I decided to drop off something at my friend's house. My friend had just ordered a medium-sized bar-b-que chicken pizza from Dino's Pizzeria. She was sitting on her patio with her two young children. I wasn't there for a long visit, but my friend kept insisting that I try a slice of pizza. I told her "I already had lunch" (even though I had not eaten lunch yet). She handed me a paper plate and insisted I try a slice. I noticed right away that there was tons of oil (grease) floating on top of the pizza and the cheese didn't even look like it was melted. The cheese appeared to be sliding around as she moved the pizza box. I thought WTF! I took a tiny bite, and almost gagged. It was the worst pizza I've ever had. Seriously bad. I couldn't even swallow this crap. When my friend turned around to tend to her 7-year old son I took the napkin from my lap and placed the small piece that I had in my mouth inside the napkin. The texture of the bar-b-que sauce was very, very thin -- almost like a watered-down bar-b-que sauce. It was bland and disgusting. It was as if someone had poured a half-bottle of olive oil on top of the pizza. I have eaten at many, many pizza joints in Chicago that are much better than this place. The difference between this place and the others is that the other restaurants offer quality cheese, meat and crust. On the other hand, the quality here is lacking. Perhaps they are into serving quantity and not into serving quality.

25.description: i LOVE their thin crust pizza.  Best in the city in my opinion.

12.description: My family just attended a Christening party here.I actually was embarrassed for the hosts.The service was bad. The waitress seemed so crabby and unfriendly.When it came to the the food they only brought so much out. This was a buffet. I think if you feeding 50 there should be enough to go around for 50. Only about 3/4 of the guest got appetizers. They finally came out with two tiny dishes.The pizza went the same way.Would not recommend for parties.

59.description: I live in a secure building. One night I was sitting in my lobby. One of Dino's delivery drivers came to the door. I did not open it due to the fact that there have been some recent break ins. When the guy got buzzed in he started cursing at me and my elderly neighbor. What kind of low life would do something like that ?

21.description: THE BIG BEEFS ARE BACK!Have nor been at Dino's for quite some time after a few bad beef experiences (read previous post)So on a whim we stopped in and got a few beefs to go and there just like the original big bomber's .Will be back!!

17.description: I absolutely love this place. From the neighborhood charm to the amazing thin crust pizza, Dino's is a throwback type of joint. Great carryout and reasonably priced too. I try to make it here at every couple months or whenever I'm in the mood for terrific pizza.

10.description: Inconsistent!! I just moved into the neighborhood and have gotten pizza here about 5 times. Sometimes it is good and sometimes it sucks. I hate that it is inconsistent! Just make the pizza good! I hate when 2 inches of cheese melts into the middle of the pizza and the outside is all thin. Last time I got garlic bread here it was hard as a rock. I don't think I'll be coming back anymore. Dominos is better than this place.

5.description: First time we came here was a couple of years ago in the dead of winter and everything was top notch. We decided to revisit yesterday to try the pizza. We're having a great time sitting on the nice patio. Menu mentions to ask the server about the "extensive" beer selection. Server seemed annoyed I asked. Hubby mentions to our waitress that he saw a specials sign that said PBR tallboys were $2.50. She confirms that they have PBR and so he orders one. We proceed to eat the yummy pizza and drink two more. Bill comes and three PBRs are calculated at $12 and not $7.50. The waitress' response to that was that the bar is separate and they have to charge a different price because we are sitting outside. WTF? Never heard of such a thing. I can go to The Garage Bar nearby and sit on the rooftop patio and drink off their extensive beer menu inside and out for the SAME price. Imagine that.

3.description: I order from Dinos religiously when I am working at resurrection hospital. They go above and beyond to get their customers anything that they need. I always ask for alternatives in my meals and they have no problem adjusting ingredients. I know what a pain that is to do that and they never make me feel bad for any of my requests. Corine, Bobby and Benny are all wonderful employees with great customer service and should be recognized for always going above and beyond.

35.description: Great deep dish. Veal parm is exceptional

19.description: Awesome thin crust pizza in an unassuming environment with great service.  Our server today (male, young) was quick, polite, thoughtful and good at anticipating.  I've been here many times for pizza and I do think they have one of the best thin crust pizzas around.  Piping hot, too.

28.description: The staff did a great job with our little family party of 15 people.  The pizza was very thin and tasted delicious.  I would go out of my way to come back here.

45.description: Ordered from here today for the first time. Wish I could share details about the pizza, but after waiting TWO HOURS for a delivery I decided to cancel. According to the receptionist, the pizza was delayed because there were fifteen orders ahead of ours, REALLY? Don't you think you should have said that instead of telling me it would be arrive within the hour the first time I called? Or maybe something you should have shared the second time I called to check-in on my order status? There is no reason a pizza should take over an hour to be delivered. I will NEVER be calling this place again.

33.description: First time and last time Dino's. An hour and 20 minutes for a large thin sausage pizza. On a Tuesday night. I had to call to see if it was even coming. Then the driver called and blamed it on traffic. We live a half mile away. When it finally came he insisted it was still hot but it was barely warm. Barely.Your pizza is decent and so close to my house but I don't like being lied to.

43.description: I've been here twice over the last month or so, both times as softball game win celebratory outings.  The first time, the pizza was absolute garbage.  Thin, flavorless, greasy, and very uninspired.  I felt like throwing up after a few peices. The second time I was here, the pizza didn't seem as bad, but it was still under par with many of the other nearby pizza places I go to.  I'm not sure what it is people love about this place - there are always people here and they strike me as dedicated, long-time patrons based on their interactions with the restaurant staff.  Most of the customers are of the frumpy old quiet type, if that even matters.Nice staff, limited parking, crappy pizza.  Oh, and watered down soft drinks.  Pass.

2.description: Great neighborhood place.  Pasta's are old school and pizza is delicious.  They also deliver and we order from them often.  The owners are very generous and always donate to our school events:)  The staff and warm and friendly.

18.description: I've been eating at Dino's for a while now and the thin crust pizza is the best I've had.  Always up for Dino's.

41.description: I have only gotten delivery from here.  Which is quick and they've always gotten my order right. (And now i've written that, my next order will probably be messed up.) The pizza is a little better than standard.  The thin is OK; I prefer the pan.  The crust is a little extra cornstarch-y, not too much to make it bad, just different from what I'm used to.I've also ordered the Italian beef sandwiches on garlic bread.  The amount of garlic on the bread is not consistent-througout the piece of bread or in the intensity from each time I've ordered it.Because it's the best pizza that delivers to me (so I've been told from neighbors), I will continue to order from here.  And like it.

52.description: I wanted to point out that they have a gluten free pizza crust. It is not really advertised and I have been looking for a place in the Norwood Park area that delivers and has a gluten free crust . My family gets the regular crust pizza which is just fine, not great but not bad. The reason we keep ordering from Dino's is because we can order one pizza with gluten free and one with regular crust. It is hard for me to compare their gluten free crust to others because I was recently diagnosed and I have not found many others.

50.description: This place is old school which is pretty cool. We picked up our pizza but next time I think we will dine in. Lou malnattis is my favorite but this ranks in the top 3.  Their pasta e fagioli soup is pretty tasty.

4.description: This place is great one of those places that brings you back to when life was simpler just old fashion good people the pizza was really good as well as the mostaccioli and the services was top notch i would defiantly recomend this place and i will be back.

6.description: Believe it or not, they have some of the best fried chicken you will ever taste.  It is fresh chicken, that is breaded right before it is fried, and not overly spiced like some of the chain chicken places.We have used them for catered chicken and have never been disappointed.  It works out to be about a buck a piece, which is a fair price, although their product is superior.Give the neighborhood guy a try for your next catered party.

22.description: I recently had a surprise 30 th birthday party for my daughter at Dino's. I called and spoke to Bianca who explained the different packages available.I relied on her experience and expertise in choosing the package in our price range... and could not have been happier with her suggestions. I called back on a couple occasions and spoke to her son, Joe, and sister Bruna, who were also very helpful.I chose the unlimited pizza, salad and pop package.The salad was cold and crisp with several dressing choices.The pizza was piping hot, very thin crust, delicious with everything from plain cheese, to cheese/ sausage, all vegetables and deluxe. More pizzas were made as needed. The pitchers of pop and water were filled frequently and our waitress was amazing at filling drink orders and making sure our guests had plenty to eat.We were allowed to decorate the room prior to our party and they even supplied the painters tape, as I had brought scotch tape which could have pulled the paint off their walls.Extremely pleased with the staff, quality and amount of food and the fact that we were allowed to bring in our own cake.I highly recommend Dino's for your next gathering.They do all the work and you can sit back and enjoy your guests.My daughter was very surprised and had a great birthday.Thank you Dino's. We pulled it off!!!

15.description: I'm really regretting purchasing delivery from Dino's tonight. I ordered at 7:00, and at 8:00 I get a call from the delivery driver, saying he can't read my address on the receipt. I tell him my address. About 10 minutes later the driver calls again saying he's at the front door. I go downstairs, and he's neither at the front or back door. I call back to verify he has the correct address. He doesn't... Apparently he had 5400 on the receipt instead of 6400. Not his fault since the lady answering phones wrote it down incorrectly. 10 minutes later he calls to say he's at the front door, but I was standing there, and he wasn't there. He was parking.So when he does show up he was nice and apologized for the inconvenience. He gave me a warm bottle of RC. I was nice and gave him a tip even though I was pretty annoyed.Here is a review of the food I ordered:Buffalo chicken sandwich-I didn't think it was very good. It was about a foot long, so it would have been nice to have it cut in half. The chicken was pretty tough. The condiments (lettuce, tomato, and pickles) are wrapped separately from the sandwich. I understand why you did this, but you have to then peel the soggy bread away from the chicken to put on the condiments.Onion rings-These tasted okay. The mystery sauce that came with them wasn't good. Ranch would have been better. The sauce container had opened during delivery, and it spilled onto the plate and onion rings.Jalapeno poppers-These tasted good and came with ranch dressing.As a recommendation for the restaurant, you should consider adding a system where customers can provide their phone number when ordering, and you then have our address on file, so we don't have to provide it each time. That would have prevented this mess. I was pretty unhappy to receive food that wasn't hot after waiting an hour and a half for it. I don't really plan to order again because I remember not having a good experience the previous time I ordered either.

57.description: First off, I have eaten in this place only once or twice, but have taken out a bazillion times.  Lived down the block from here for 13 years.  This place is just so Chicago, you have to love it.  The thin crust is crispy on the bottom, with the right amount of greasyness(sp.?) on top.  I would literally walk through all manner of elements to get to this place, through the heat and humidity, throught the snow, it's that frickin' good.

20.description: Ordered delivery from Dino's and everything was great. Got the awesome Wed special-the pizza was good, the bruschetta was delicious, and all for a great price. The delivery driver was also very nice! Always a great experience with Dino's.

36.description: My only visit was last Friday night. The place was packed but still had excellent service. We had soup ( minestrone and cauliflower) pizza and beer (Labatts Blue $8/pitcher). Everything was great. If I lived in the area it would be my pizza joint.

14.description: Love this place! I used to live down the street from this restaurant and would order their pizza and wings for delivery. They have some of the best pizza especially for the far northwest side of Chicago. Even though I not currently in the neighborhood anymore I still make the 35-40 min drive just for their pizza!

1.description: I really like this store, really nice unique things with CPD logo. Affordable prices and parking not bad at all. My kids love this store and for gifts this is where we come

2.description: This police collectibles shop has been around for a few years now. Cute little shop with tons of police memoirbilia. I hear the owner collects the stuff and just decided to buy his own shop to store and sell all of it. Smells like that "old smell" in the shop and stuff's cheap. Great for collectors or just a nice place to browse. I got myself a Chicago Police hoodie - I get asked all the time where I got it - I got it here!! Only street parking here.

0.description: I absolutely love coming here. There is a great variety of CPD and CCDOC t-shirts and gifts. The owner is an amazing retired CPD officer who is nothing but friendly and accommodating. I love the fact that he does this for fun and love of law enforcement. Definitely worth the trip.

3.description: Wafa is amazing!!! I cut off 10 inches of my hair and she did an amazing job cutting and styling! I love it! The prices are amazing for the service, definitely would recommend this salon to anyone!

1.description: Please save your money and go somewhere else. This place is FILTHY and extremely unsanitary. Go in an have a look for yourself! This place is completely covered in dust and hair. By the looks of it, salon has not been cleaned in months! I saw hair brushes and scissors scattered across the floor and it made me cringe. I honestly have no idea how I sat through without running out and calling the health inspector. If you insist on still going here I would avoid getting anything In this place waxed!

2.description: This past Tuesday I finally convinced my son to get a haircut after school.  Our plan was to drop off a package at a local UPS store and drive to a Hair Crafter's salon after.  We discovered Mademoiselle Salon purely by accident.  They had a sign that said $5 haircuts for kids.  It was a win win situation.The owner is incredibly sweet.  She understood that my son did not want his hair cut.  She also understood that he was extremely self conscious of his cowlicks.She literally gave him the best haircut that fit his face that he has ever had.By the time that she finished, he was beaming.What made this experience even more amazing was the fact that I did not realize that she accepted cash only.  (Her credit card machine is arriving next week.)  I did not have any cash with me.  She out of good faith told us not to worry and to pay her back another day.  We were complete strangers!We however could not do that.  We were able to walk across the street to Walgreens, buy something and get cash to pay her.She restored my faith in humanity.

9.description: Wafa is my girl! I don't even go in with any hairstyle plans, I tell her I want to keep the length, she takes care of me. Whether it's a new style, or a quick maintainence cut, or highlights, or overall color, the price is right and it gets done right. She listens to what you want, and offers her 2 cents. And WALA... feel like a rockstar when I leave the salon. I feel pretty, oh so pretty, I feel pretty (gorgeous hairstyle) and witty (found a great secret salon)  and bright (perfect prices!)!

10.description: Wufa strikes again!  I went in with 2" roots, and hair so long it wouldn't do anything right....AND 2 hours to go before leaving for GRADUATION ceremony.  ORG!!!!And I left looking wonderful.  HOORAY FOR WUFA!!!

4.description: I love this place! It's affordable and she did an amazing job! I trust her 100% with my salon needs!! I'm very weary about allowing people to cut my hair. I promise, you don't regret coming here!! I received soooo many compliments about my hair after she was through with coloring and cutting it!

6.description: I love this salon. I have been going here for 2 years and I wouldn't go anywhere else. I see Waffy and she is the best! She does my color, cut, eyebrow threading and tinting. Her work is excellent and consistent. Prices are great! An added bonus is that she is a real pleasure to be around!! I would highly recommend this salon!

12.description: Terrible service. I sat in the chair with soaking wet hair waiting for a blow dry while wafa kept taking walk in clients and making me wait after I was shampooed. She kept saying 5 more min, 5 more min. And after 25 min I walked out. She was very rude.

5.description: Had an amazing experience!! Wafa did a great ombré color and cut long layers for me. The color looks great! I'm always nervous about getting anything cut because it turns out shorter than I'm comfortable with, but she assured me from the start she wanted to keep my length. It looks just amazing. Bonus points: her son who did my shampoo and rinse was funny and nice, and their dog Simba was sleeping on the side and he's SO CUTE. Price was very reasonable. $100 for the color and layers

13.description: Lllooovvveee Mama Wafa!!! She threads my eyebrows RIGHT!!! And for $5... Be generous and tip! She's worth it all! She's done my son's hair... And it's about time I get mine trimmed. Will have to update my review!

11.description: I've been getting my eyebrows threaded here for months and Wafa always does them amazing! I also had a hair cut done and it turned out fabulous. I never have to explain to her what I want or how I want my eyebrows. I let her so what she knows best and it always turns out great. The prices are unbeatable and she is very fast.

8.description: This is one of the best saloon's I've been to, reasonable prices for the services. The only downfall to it is that they don't accept credit or debit cards.

0.description: Wafa is the best! I followed her from her previous place, that was 7 years ago. She is an absolute delight! I'll never go anywhere else!

7.description: This is a great place for a fast, affordable haircut for a guy like me. Wolfa is very nice and does a good job. In and out In less than 20 min.

28.description: Just came out and had the best Sushi I've had in a long time. The fried Scallops were to die for! Everything was so fresh and definitely got my Sushi fix. Although the food was exceptional, I think the service I got from my waitress Jessica was even better. Such a kind and sweet girl. Thank you Jessica!!! I will definitely be coming back and I'm bringing all my friends with. Even though it's all you can eat for $20 they don't compromise quality here. It's a must for Sushi lovers I know in a couple of months this place is gonna be packed. Check it out for your selves.

1.description: Having dined at Royal Sushi a few times now, I feel compelled to report to my fellow Yelpers the common themes I noticed.  Although the overall cleanliness of the restaurant seems acceptable (granted it's only a couple of years old), the service could REALLY use a TON of improvement.  Upon arrival, I asked how long the wait was and was told it'll be about 20-30 minutes.  Over an hour later, we were finally told where our table was - not shown to it.  Before I even sat down, I handed our all-you-can-eat menus and asked to have the appetizers brought out right away.  15 minutes later, I asked again...  and again, 10 minutes later.About half an hour after we sat down, I asked how much longer before we get our sushi order (glancing over to the bar with 4-5 chefs behind the counter):  "It's almost done."  15 minutes later, I asked again...  and again, 10 minutes later.  (Notice the pattern?)  Even for water, we had to ask the server for a refill.  We get our bill, inform our server of a discrepancy, and wait (again!) for our cards to be picked up and returned to us.  What's most puzzling to me is the restaurant was half-full/empty even on a Friday or Saturday night!  The ONLY good thing about Royal Sushi, in my opinion, is the "above average" (NOT "excellent") quality of the food.  However, I'm not convinced it's worth the 1.5-hour wait...

9.description: Unbelievable deal. $19.99 all-you-can-eat, freshly prepared and served sushi. The wait can be a bit long, but I can deal with that. The servers are very friendly and helpful.

29.description: I Just about died when I  found out this place is from the same owners as sushi city in downers grove! Similar menu, but so glad I no longer have to drive an hour to get yummy, fresh sushi! By far my favorite all you can eat sushi joint. My only complaint is the long wait I had to endure for each roll, it wasn't too busy the night we went so I can't imagine the wait once this place gets more traffic. Other than that,  can't wait to be back!

23.description: The service was slow. We went for the "all-you-can-eat" but we were only able to order 6 rolls. It was 25 mins per 2 rolls. The restaurant wasn't even half-full.On top of that, the rice they used to make sushi is on the dry side. It definitely lacked water when they cooked it. I'm Asian and I know how rice should be.We spent $50 bucks on that kind of quality. If we went to Blu Fish, it would've been a bit pricey but the quality of food is unmatched, and I bet food will be served altogether on-time. Have you ever had a meal where you got full but never liked what you ate? That was my experience.

5.description: This place is ridiculously good, well priced all you can eat sushi which includes appetizers, sashimi, maki rolls and even house specialties! The plate presentation is spot on! The sushi chefs artwork on the plate will make you eat with your eyes. The food is absolutely delicious! The portions are obviously endless! If you like sushi you have to check this place out!! You will not be disappointed. Favorite picks: TOUTLE, TORCHED DRAGON, GODZILLA, FRIED SCALLOPS, and this shredded crab & cucumber salad covered in tempura flakes

31.description: This place is phenomenal. $19.99 for all you can eat sushi, and appetizers. Everything was fresh and delicious. The salmon was some of the freshest I've ever had. I may have just found my new sushi spot, conveniently located a mile from my house! P.s They serve liquor!!!

25.description: I am impressed. They take pride in their craft. The staff was excellent. The only thing better than their friendliness was the food. We had the Mango Roll, Torched Dragon, and Snow Mountain. All were unique. The preparation and presentation was beyond beautiful. You can really see the pride they take in their craft. The mushroom soup was the biggest surprise of the night. The perfect amount of spice. Mmm. I found my new sushi place

12.description: Funny that we only stumbled upon this place because Blufish doesn't open until 4pm and the boyfriend was starving at 3pm. Instead of waiting for Blufish to open, we decided on this place. It was a weekday and I think there was only 2 or 3 other parties there. Service was fantastic and we were really glad to see that the rolls were not stuffed with rice. For AYCE, this place is 5 stars. The only reason why I didn't rate it as 5 is because it's not the best sushi out there, but definitely the best I've had for AYCE so far. You would never expect that by looking from the outside (same strip mall as Jewel and O'Reilly's), but it's actually spacious yet cozy inside. My only concern is that Umami Sushi was really good when they first opened too, and now they're disgustingly terrible. I really hope that doesn't happen to this place!We visited again last Sunday for dinner and brought my sister with. It was a little more packed but service was still great. The wait surprisingly wasn't that long between orders. I think this is because they brought out rolls as they were ready (which I prefer), instead of trying to bring out a big tray of your entire order. I noticed they added sliced cucumber to their water (I likes) and also added a few more special roll options. As a recommendation, the godzilla roll is an awesome cooked option. The Downer's Grove and Turtle roll were also very yummy. I personally love Rainbow Rolls, and this place does an okay job for AYCE. And lastly, I usually eat my money's worth alone in unagi and sake nigiri!

37.description: The best sushi I have ever had. It was wonderful and the staff is so nice. The atmosphere is so comforting and beautiful. Have gone twice so far and plan on going again! Keep up the good work! The first time I got the California and Philadelphia rolls. This time I did the lunch special and got the avocado maki, the v.g. maki and the Alaskan maki. Also got mochi for the first time. Yummy! Just to state the prices are great! The food is fantastic! I highly recommend. If you don't like the idea of raw fish they have quite a few options to help with that! :-) the first time we went we spent a total of $25 and this time it was $42 for two people and that's cause of the lunch special and the three drinks and mochi. Heck of a deal!

21.description: Never has any intentions of trying sushi but got dragged here. All i can say now is it was actually delicious! I only ate sushi with cooked shrimp though, I will still not try it with the raw fish. Will definitely be back again.

16.description: Tonight was the first time I've been here for dinner. I usually go during the week for lunch. I was with a party of 8 people. We ordered over 15 rolls and didn't come out for more than an hour. Our appetizers took a while to come out too. There was only one waitress and the host in front seating people. It was a full house when arrived around 7:30pm. The food was good but service could be better. I wouldn't recommended coming for dinner unless they hire more waitresses/waiters.

17.description: Was not impressed.  the sushi had very little flavour.  the chix terriyaki was bland.  would not go back.

10.description: Absolutely beyond amazing. I cannot believe that the all-you-can-eat is only $20.. It includes appetizers, soup, nigiri, AND all of their house special rolls. My husband and I ate crab rangoon (excellent), fried scallops, edamame (only complaint of the whole meal - it was a little overcooked), several pieces of nigiri (so fresh!), and a couple rolls. We were completely full by the time we left. We went on a Friday night around 7:30, and the wait for each roll definitely got longer as the place filled up, but it was never unreasonable or unbearable. We sat at the sushi bar, but we had a very very sweet waitress who clearly cared about our experience and was very personable. I can't say enough good things about this place. I hope they are successful!

11.description: Great sushi place and nice ambiance. We came as a family of four on a Sunday night. We were the first table and it filled up fast before 6 pm. The appetizers are plenty and freshly cooked. The nigiri sushi is pretty fresh and more variety than regular all you can eat sushi. They certainly have a lot of maki sushi rolls as well. I have to comment on my favorite roll, spider toll! It's so much better here. They don't put too much rice and sauce in the roll and I can taste the soft shell crab. We are very pleased with the service too. It's a nice place with friendly service. Good location with plenty of parking too. Definitely coming back soon.

26.description: Very good sushi spot in an unlikely location.The service is very good. And the nigiri is good as well. Their spider roll is highly recommended too.My wife and I have opted for the all you can eat sushi dinner. The quality of the fish is good.

27.description: Great sushi place and nice ambiance. We came as a family of four on a Sunday night. We were the first table and it filled up fast before 6 pm. The appetizers are plenty and freshly cooked. The nigiri sushi is pretty fresh and more variety than regular all you can eat sushi. They certainly have a lot of maki sushi rolls as well. I have to comment on my favorite roll, spider toll! It's so much better here. They don't put too much rice and sauce in the roll and I can taste the soft shell crab. We are very pleased with the service too. It's a nice place with friendly service. Good location with plenty of parking too. Definitely coming back soon.

35.description: Good new sushi place. Got lunch to go and the sushi and miso soup were really good. Fast service during lunch on a weekday. Looking forward to dining in when I get more time. Really nicely decorated.

8.description: Absolutely delicious! Food and service was outstanding. Our waitress was very attentive but not in a overbearing way. As for the restaurant itself I really like the vibe and ambiance, everything is brand new and veryyyy clean (self proclaimed germaphobe) As for the sushi... Out of this world good! The Jono and Toutle roll were my favorite. So happy I won't be traveling to the city as often for quality sushi because I much rather go here. Word of advice: I have a feeling this will become a popular place so come here before the crowds starting rushing in!

0.description: Side note: My boyfriend was a long time sushi chef and we like to check out any sushi restaurant we can. We came around 8:30 on a Saturday night and the restaurant was oddly very quiet. Not at all a bad thing, I'm assuming they opened up not too long ago. They have a wide variety of sushi options for rolls, nigiri, and AYCE for $19.99 a person. Appetizers were also included in that option.Honestly 5 stars all around for this restaurant! We went with the AYCE, and oh boy did this place exceed our expectations! We ordered a variety of different kinds of nigiri (salmon, tuna, white tuna, and octopus), 2 Turtle Rolls, 1 Downer's Grove, and 1 Jojo. The rolls were a lot smaller than the usual "larger" size we normally get served at other restaurants when we do AYCE (a BIG plus). The slices of fish for the nigiri were extremely smooth and the rice was soft and warm. I cannot stress how important it is for us to finally find a place that does not neglect the rice in sushi! Our server was also extremely nice and checked on us every so often to make sure we enjoyed the food and had everything we needed. This restaurant has become our go to spot for sushi, and I honestly think their price of AYCE sushi is too low for the quality they give!

38.description: the sushi make it look beautiful and taste good... Place nice I will like to go again

20.description: Within the strip mall on the corner of Foster and Harlem, "Royal Sushi" vowed to gain loyalty customers by offering all-you-can-eat sushi buffet (lunch: $15.99; dinner: $19.99, as of 12/08/2015).  Since this establishment has been relatively new, cleanliness was definitely on point.  Even though items can be order In a la carte style, I believe dining in the AYCE fashion is the way to go.  My rationale behind this statement is backed up by the prices I saw on the regular menu.  One (1) order of Godzilla rolls, with eight (8) pieces, would cost approximately $14.  Imagining that you multiply an order of signature maki rolls by four (4), you've got two (2)-people worth of AYCE sushi covered!  If the westernized maki rolls aren't your cup of tea, scale up your orders with nigiri instead.  It was comforting to see that ratio of rice and fish wasn't ridiculously disproportionate.  We had the salmon, white tuna, and spicy salmon nigiri.  I personally will stick with nigiri next time as my primary choices for my version of AYCE.  We tried the "city" rolls, as suggested by our server.  I would give them some credit for creativity, but the overwhelming amount of sauce disoriented my tastebuds.  In other words, I couldn't decipher exactly what I fed into my mouth.  However, $19.99 for dinner sushi buffet is reasonably-priced for the Chi-town standard.  The server handed us three (3) copies of AYCE menu.  Well, we were full upon exhausting two (2) copies.  Hubby and I agreed that Royal Sushi is a keeper.

19.description: I Just about died when I  found out this place is from the same owners as sushi city in downers grove! Similar menu, but so glad I no longer have to drive an hour to get yummy, fresh sushi! By far my favorite all you can eat sushi joint.
