My only complaint is the long wait I had to endure for each roll, it wasn't too busy the night we went so I can't imagine the wait once this place gets more traffic. Other than that,  can't wait to be back!

33.description: Delicious !!! Sushi is fresh ! They don't pound the rice on the rolls like some places. So far my favorite it the Mexican roll. Can't beat the price. The staff and chefs are very friendly and quick. I can say this , umami is going to def have some competition ! Good job Royal sushi :) thank you for a great experience

2.description: Came here randomly due to a spur of the moment sushi craving and I must say that I left a lot more satisfied than I had expected. Coming in, it was pretty dead as there were only 4 other tables occupied, and I couldn't understand why. With a sushi place like this one and an appetite like mine, I ordered the AYCE. Out of that I ordered crab Rangoon, miso soup, spicy tuna roll x2, dragon roll, New York roll, and the Godzilla roll (I know, I'm fat). All of these rolls came out in a timely manner and all of them were pretty good. I would really recommend the Godzilla and red dragon roll as they are both delicious and visually appealing. What I liked a lot is that after the first round they didn't start stuffing the sushi full of rice *cough, cough, Sushi Para II* and kept it pretty consistent with the rice to fish ratio. Overall good little hidden gem in a strip mall. Having a sushi craving? This place will more than suffice

34.description: you  must branch out of the norm...this place is a excellent place for the novice and sushi consumers. Try Ozeki Nigori Sake...this place is a must!!

32.description: Oh man.. I drove by one day on my way to jewel..I yelped it and saw all the positive reviews.. It's amazing here! I'm pretty picky when it comes to my sushi.. Definitely worth the money..all you can eat dinner just $19.99 some of their house specials included! I definitely reccomend everyone try it.. I haven't found a good sushi place in the area yet, I just found it!

18.description: Bad.Wait.I forgot.Wait.Their servers forget.Incredibly slow service. Their servers forget what you order. I legit think they just forgot to put our order in and we waited over an hour for our dinner.

13.description: The service was slow. We went for the "all-you-can-eat" but we were only able to order 6 rolls. It was 25 mins per 2 rolls. The restaurant wasn't even half-full.On top of that, the rice they used to make sushi is on the dry side. It definitely lacked water when they cooked it. I'm Asian and I know how rice should be.We spent $50 bucks on that kind of quality. If we went to Blu Fish, it would've been a bit pricey but the quality of food is unmatched, and I bet food will be served altogether on-time. Have you ever had a meal where you got full but never liked what you ate? That was my experience.

4.description: I have a new favorite place for AYCE sushi and even my kids agree with me.   I went to Royal Sushi on a rainy Monday night for my son's  post-birthday celebration. This is his birthday request to me, to go to an AYCE sushi place...that's my boy! He makes me proud:) I did not make reservations but we took our chances. We got here at around 6:30pm and the place was still empty although by the time we were leaving, the place was already almost packed.   I cannot itemize all the rolls that we've tried because we had so much. Why 5 stars? Their rolls are packed with everything in the middle of each roll...with just the right amount of sushi rice. There are rolls with 5, 6, 8 and 10(dragon roll) pieces  per order and it is helpful that this is written on the menu. We try to choose the rolls with 5 or 6 pieces to start with, except for the Dragon Roll, we have to have the Dragon Roll :) All the ingredients are fresh and the rolls very well presented. The place is neat, washrooms are clean, and the service is friendly and efficient.    We'll definitely keep coming back. Thanks yelp for leading me to this great find:)

24.description: Absolutely delicious! Food and service was outstanding. Our waitress was very attentive but not in a overbearing way. As for the restaurant itself I really like the vibe and ambiance, everything is brand new and veryyyy clean (self proclaimed germaphobe) As for the sushi... Out of this world good! The Jono and Toutle roll were my favorite. So happy I won't be traveling to the city as often for quality sushi because I much rather go here. Word of advice: I have a feeling this will become a popular place so come here before the crowds starting rushing in!

6.description: Still think this place is great. I went again today.  Fresh etc.But.... Two rolls are just plain nasty in my mind and should be taken off the menu.  Sapporo roll-drenched in ginger sauce.  Think of the side of ginger that you get with the wasabi blended up and poured all over the roll and the rolls is ice cold too.  I had to eat this one all by myself because after 1 bite my gf would not touch it.Mango roll-I LOVE mango and can eat about 4 in one sitting but somehow it tastes not so good on a roll at least the one they make here.  Skip these and say thanks to me later.

22.description: I came to this sushi restaurant with high expectations. Too bad the sushi didn't taste as good as it looked. I was very disappointed. My tuna didn't taste fresh at all! Also, I DON'T recommend the mango roll. That was honestly the worst thing I have ever tasted in my life (I'm not even exaggerating). It had way too much mango purée sauce that overpowered the whole roll. As far as service goes, it would have been nice not to have to hunt down the waiter every time I needed something, especially when the restaurant is dead.

15.description: Outside appearances are deceiving. I went in for the lunch special and was glad I finally decided to go. I was surprised there were so few people in there, the place was very clean and nice looking interior. I tried the unagi maki, crispy sweet potato maki, rainbow maki, American maki, salmon skin maki, masago, and the saku. The fish was fresh and good tasting, some of the rolls were a little heavy on rice or cucumber but that's expected from a $15.99 all you can eat special. I will definitely go back and recommend to everyone who enjoys sushi

7.description: My husband is a huge fan of sushi, but prior to dining here, I'd only tried once or twice. Well, I'm a huge fan now! We've come here twice now, once for lunch and once for dinner, and both times did the all you can eat. I did notice some other reviews mention wait time and I will say when we went for dinner (Saturday night) we arrived fairly early, around 6pm and we were only the second table to be filled. But by the time we left roughly an hour later, almost every table was filled and our wait time for our last few pieces we order was significantly longer. I know that is because everything is rolled fresh and didn't mind the wait, but something to be aware of. Overall I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!

36.description: Good place for a fair deal. Extremely friendly and quick. I would love to got there famished to take advantage of their all you can eat including their specialty rolls. I will go there again!

30.description: Sushi is very delicate, very good, very special, everything is so amazing. The restaurant is very good-looking, service are also very nice. I like here

3.description: Within the strip mall on the corner of Foster and Harlem, "Royal Sushi" vowed to gain loyalty customers by offering all-you-can-eat sushi buffet (lunch: $15.99; dinner: $19.99, as of 12/08/2015).  Since this establishment has been relatively new, cleanliness was definitely on point.  Even though items can be order In a la carte style, I believe dining in the AYCE fashion is the way to go.  My rationale behind this statement is backed up by the prices I saw on the regular menu.  One (1) order of Godzilla rolls, with eight (8) pieces, would cost approximately $14.  Imagining that you multiply an order of signature maki rolls by four (4), you've got two (2)-people worth of AYCE sushi covered!  If the westernized maki rolls aren't your cup of tea, scale up your orders with nigiri instead.  It was comforting to see that ratio of rice and fish wasn't ridiculously disproportionate.  We had the salmon, white tuna, and spicy salmon nigiri.  I personally will stick with nigiri next time as my primary choices for my version of AYCE.  We tried the "city" rolls, as suggested by our server.  I would give them some credit for creativity, but the overwhelming amount of sauce disoriented my tastebuds.  In other words, I couldn't decipher exactly what I fed into my mouth.  However, $19.99 for dinner sushi buffet is reasonably-priced for the Chi-town standard.  The server handed us three (3) copies of AYCE menu.  Well, we were full upon exhausting two (2) copies.  Hubby and I agreed that Royal Sushi is a keeper.

14.description: My husband and I live in between two AYCE sushi restaurants. Royal sushi, here in the Harlem-Foster strip mall and Umami sushi on Cumberland and Lawrence. Any time we have a taste for sushi we go to Umami but due to high reviews, we decided to give Royal Sushi a try. Overall, we were disappointed in every aspect of Royal when compared to Umami. The service was very slow, even though it wasn't crowded. We were brought out one role at a time and had to wait a while in between each role. They were attentive though and kept our water filled throughout our meal.As far as the sushi itself, it was good. If I have never eaten at Umami, I would've been happy eating here. Having had better sushi though, It just wasn't up to par. The best roll we tried was the house special and the gyoza app was very good. In the end, after leaving Royal sushi, we were left with a somewhat satisfied sushi craving but will definitely be heading to Umami in the near future.

0.description: This is a cute addition to the neighbor hood. If you want to buy a unique gift for a friend, relative or child this is the place to go. For the holidays I went in to find my niece a small gift to finish my holiday shopping. I walked out with a bunch of cute items that she loved all well price. I also winded buying my mom and sister unique necklace charms. The staff and owner there were so helpful talking with and walking me through all the wonderful treasures they have in the shop. If you live in the neighbor hood it is definitely a fun place to stop in and do a little shopping.

36.description: Bakers Square has breakfast? Really? This is the conversation that took place every single time my boyfriend suggested we go to Bakers Square for breakfast. We finally made it there...no questions asked. Luckily it was a Friday morning so most people were at work and we had the place to ourselves (with the exception of the over 90 crowd). The breakfast combo is pretty cheap at around $5.99 and you get SO much food. We had a table full of french toast, biscuits, eggs, Belgian waffles, coffee, sausage links, English muffin and country brown potatoes and their were only two of us! before the meal we thought we would want some pie for the road but no way! Check it out. Bakers Square has breakfast! who knew? :-)

29.description: I grew up at this place.  I remember when it use to be called Pop n Fresh Pies and then they changed the name to Bakers Square because they wanted people to know they had food too. Great job marketing department...now you seem to only bake stuff. I'm being sarcastic!This place was always a fun place to hang out with friends and get a slice of pie. My favorite is the chocolate peanut butter.  I remember just falling for it when I first had it. I did make the mistake in my younger years and actually eat food here.  I was young...we all make mistakes.  I will say that the corn bread was really good. This place is about pies.  When we were kids my Mom would buy the whole Banana Cream Pie and bring it home. It was not my favorite but it was my Dad's favorite.  He would eat it with a fork right out of the pie tin. This place will always hold some amazing memories for me.  Not many places serve the varieties of pies as this place does.  So next time you are in the mood for a slice you must hit this place.

42.description: After remodel this location still looks the same. Food is good but can't believe how expensive bakers square has gotten. Still will go back for the yummy pies....

23.description: Service = GoodEverything else = BadOther customers = Ugly(Food = Marginal, Pie = Great)

31.description: WARNING: Are you craving a good piece of pie that tastes home made?  Do you have a sweet tooth from time to time?  If you answered YES -- this is the place to GO -- excellent pies, but go elsewhere for your dinner.  SERVICE:The service is not great (unless you are sitting in Angelo's section).  He is an outstanding Server, and will take very good care of you!  I recommend that you ask if Angelo is working and have the Host seat you in Angelo's section.  Otherwise, take your chances on getting crappy service here.  Unfortunately, over the years, the managment has changed, but nothing has improved.  The bottom line is the service still sucks.  If you want good service, don't go here.  BEWARE:We ordered the chicken pot pie which was extremely salty (very high in sodium).  Also, it did not contain chicken breast, but instead it was filled with mostly dark meat and very little chicken pieces.  When we found a piece of chicken it was connected to a piece of bone (or other tissue that we could not recognize unless we send it to a Lab for I.D.).  Bottomline:  Stay away from the chicken pot pie.  Although the crust was wonderful -- light, flaky and pretty good -- the inside of the pot-pie was very disappointing -- ugh!RECOMMENDATIONS:The butternut squash soup is pretty good.  The summer salads are fairly decent.  Also, the chicken salad with walnuts, dried cranberries and other goodies is flavorful and robust.  If you want a simple and lighter dinner, such as soup and salad, I recommend the flat-bread sandwiches.  For example, the Mediterrean and Italian beef sandwiches are filled with an explosion of flavors.  We tried the Cuban sandwich and it fell flat for us -- skip it.  The honey dijon chicken breast dinner is consistent (order the sauce on the side or they will drown the chicken  in the honey-dijon mustard sauce).  Please keep in mind that the butternut squash soup is seasonable -- starting in mid-October -- not sure when they discontinue serving it though.  We usually go to dinner elsewhere (Chicago, Park Ridge, Oak Park, Evanston or Rosemont) and go to Baker's Square for dessert.  Once in a while we go here for soup and sandwich, but that's about it.   Baker's Square is not really a dinner place, but if you feel like dinner stick to a sandwich and soup (or as my niece likes to say "sang-wich").FREE SLICE of pie every Wednesday:  They serve a FREE slice of pie at lunch or dinner time.  It gets very crowded so if you are going for dinner and/or lunch plan to arrive early -- otherwise, you will be waiting for a table/booth and/or parking spot.  The restaurant is family friendly (older kids -- not toddlers or babies) and it has an open-floor plan.  It is also a neighborhood favorite for the senior citizen crowd, so if you don't mind being surrounded by the "blue hair" crowd, go for it.

34.description: The only thing that could be better about Bakers Square is the restaurant portion of the whole place. It's ALL ABOUT the pie. All of their pies are incredible. They won't let you down. I won't even give you my personal favorites because I don't want to sway you from the fruit pies which are all freaking WONDERFUL I just personally prefer pies full of sugary nuts and oreos and chocolate and cream (not all in one). Anything you try, you're going to like it. They're reasonably priced as well. If Baker's Square happened to expand their menu I think that they'd be able to improve their business, which I'd really like to see.

16.description: This is my go to comfort food place. I know it's a food chain but it's been around so long and it's consistently good.

11.description: I have been going to this Baker's Square for over 20 years.  It used to be my favorite spot for breakfast, but it had really gone down hill over the years. I had such high hopes for this place after their most recent remodeling.  I was so happy to see that they were finally turning around.  Well, the hubby and I went there the other morning for breakfast, and sad to say...this place has NOT changed!  Aside from fixing up the outside, all they did was slapped a coat of paint over the same old nasty ceiling and called it good.  The cleaning practices are worse than ever.  The window sill right next to the booths was covered with a thick layer of dust.  It looked like they hadn't cleaned it in weeks.  The window had greasy finger prints smeared all over it.  Worse, was our waiter whose shirt was FILTHY!  It looked like he had been in a food fight it was so dirty. Finally, and this was the last straw...I could see into the kitchen from my seat and not one, but two of the servers were putting their dirty thumbs on the pieces of pie that they were serving to customers.  They would slide the spatula under the slice of pie, then use their dirty thumb to push the piece of pie onto the plate.  NASTY!!!  This place is a dump and a health hazard.

39.description: I can only hope that with Baker's Sqaure's recent financial problems that this one will remain the same.  Unfortunately, my favorites have been taken off the menu or changed (especially the veggie sandwich!), but the service here has always been exceptional and the food is always good.

37.description: Bakers Square is such an awesome place to just enjoy a meal on a cold, or even a hot day! they have all kinds of stuff to eat, so if ur a picky person, PLEASE.... don't complain! lol. I luv their soups, too! They're a nice thing to eat on a cold day... YUMMO!

0.description: Absolutely love this place.  Food is great and service is quick.

38.description: No matter how much they remodeled and tried to fix the place up, the service is still sub-par. Last time I went, I ordered the chicken pasta. I thought that would be easy and hard to screw up. I am sure you have guessed by now that I was wrong. They brought my girl's dinner and told me that mine would take a little longer. OK, that is kinda weird but whatever. After 30 minutes, the waitress comes over and says "we are all out of the noodles for the chicken pasta." I couldn't help it and I gave her a look like "it took half an hour to figure out you didn't have them?!" and she said they could use a thicker noodle instead. I was hungry and I couldn't leave since we had already been served half our order, so I said fine and waited even longer for them to cook the new dish. Luckily the thicker noodles were probably better than whatever they were out of. The manager did come over, apologized, and gave me a free piece of pie for my trouble though. I guess it worked out.

27.description: Every Bakers Square restaurant I go to has great customer service. I had a waiter named Angelo and he was very detailed with specials and very attentive to my girlfriend and I. She ordered the strawberry crepes, in which I had the chicken pot pie (which is amazing and filling!).  This Bakers also got a recent make over, which is nice. Makes the area feel more loungish, and the prices aren't bad at all. I typically go here 1-2 a week. Also, I order pies from here all the time. Especially for Thanksgiving...I recommend reserving pies...you will be a hero. Pies to try out:Pumpkin Pie Supreme (a great Thanksgiving pie!)Coconut CremeCandy Cane Apple PieBlue Berry

32.description: I only come here because I drive my elderly neighbor here on Wednesdays. The food is below average and the service is bad.

13.description: Was disappointed today with my dining experience at Baker's Square.  My honey mustard salad was not good.  Some of the lettuce was wilted beyond its time.  The chicken was a very small portion and was a frozen breaded patty.  The only thing that was good was the corn bread side.I will pass on the salads and stick to the pie...Staff was very pleasant.

24.description: Wow, where to start? Well I started by waiting a few days to see if I'd feel any different about the experience, nope still the same. FWIW, this review is solely based on the service. The food was just what you'd expect from Baker's Sq. We walked in and had to stand around a bit, and when we were greeted it was friendly enough, I did ask to sit on the side which is a little quieter, but it wasn't closed as one other table had just been seated. We got a well...okay type of response.Our server was friendly enough, however when she dropped off the coffee she filled my cup less then halfway, no big deal I can certainly fill my coffee cup. However, after I did there was no coffee left in the carafe, so was this left over from some other table? Who knows, but what I did know was there wasn't much coffee left in it.Moving onto the meal, and looking forward the line of booths, everything is going swimmingly at the other table, the one customer is making cute small talk with the sever, maybe if I did that things would have been better. The meal arrives, I'm given an empty ketchup bottle. No extra napkins or water like the other table received. We did get through our meal, and as we sat, waiting and waiting, the other table had their dishes cleared and was working on their pie. The server finally checked up on us, I asked for a container for my mom's lunch. She brings back the smallest container, which you could see that there was no way the leftovers would fit in there. Perhaps, she then assumed we didn't want pie, because I had to ask to place the order. She then takes off to pickup the check from the other table, (nice because you usually go to the register to pay)She comes back with the pie, my mom then asks for a glass of water with no ice, she comes back with a glass with ice, my mom wasn't going to say anything, but I piped up and said, "mom, didn't you say no ice?" she then replied yes. She comes back, drops off the water and the check, and tells us we can take it to the register. I look at the check and ask will they give her the senior discount up there? She says, no and takes the check back. Clearly, my mom's a senior, sure she looks good for her age, but she's in her 80's.Other table, is well on their way out the door, long before us. During the whole thing, I didn't bitch, I wanted too, but I was with my mom and I didn't want her to have an unpleasant lunch. However, when I went up to pay and they asked, "how was everything?" I thought, here's my chance, "I replied the food was good everything else fair." This is where I expected the person to say, "what was the problem?" instead she just looked right at me and handed me my change. I have to say, on top of the unfair service, because I could see that the server was capable, this interchange bothered me more. Here I'm telling you "fair" and there's no response.There's a phone # on the receipt, maybe I'll call and tell them to check out this review, because frankly I don't want to repeat it. I know it's Baker's Square, and a chain, however, they do differ. We do go to the one further south on Harlem close to Addison Ave, we're sort of regulars at that one now, but what made us become regulars was the good service and the concern for their customers.

7.description: I've never really been drawn to Baker's Square, but my wife wanted to go there for Mother's Day.  Very good stuff.  Here's why --1)  SELECTION & PORTIONS -- They really have a wide variety of very good food.  Something I liked was that they offered a reduced portion size called "just right" and they knock a couple dollars off your order to eat what a normal person should eat anyway.  2)  CORRECTION OF ORDER -- My pregnant wife forgot to ask for something removed from her salad in order to keep it pregnancy-safe.  We offered to purchase the meal that we messed up on, but our waiter just said it was OK and quickly brought us back the same meal without feta cheese.  3)  JUST SPECIAL -- This  place is very comfortable and cozy.  They gave flowers to all the mothers on Mother's Day.  They gave my daughter a pack of crayons and coloring sheets right away, and all the staff were friendly.  Definitely a heavily Caucasian crowd, so don't come here to meet a cross-section of Chicago's ethnic diversity.  But for good ol' American cooking and a place with good hospitality, stop in and eat.

40.description: I think I may have just gone on a bad day?  The heat was BLASTING the entire time we were there.  It was SOOOOO warm and uncomfortable.  If anyone has any suggestions for lunch in this area, please let me know!  I met someone here for lunch due to lack of better ideas..

30.description: 3 words here: Free Pie Wednesday! My favorite, I'd have to admit is the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie. I can go for me a slice of that almost anytime! (But I dont, so do not worry!)This place is nostaligic and sorta special to me because I would spend hours there with friends eating and smoking and drinking coffee for hours upon hours when I was in high school and college.Only downside is that in the summer, it gets really really cold in there! They like crank up the air conditioning waaaay too high. I recommend the chicken fingers! Lol

1.description: It's a shame that this place has gone down the tubes this much.  While the food is still a little above par for a chain, the once great service (and it appears the management also) has slipped.  We were in for breakfast yesterday, they were a bit busier than they usually were (gleaned by listening to the staff's comments amongst themselves) and service lapses showed greatly.  We had to wait about 5 minutes to even be greeted by a harried hostess/cashier/pie boxer.  When we were seated and upon being greeted by the server and asked about drinks we said what we wanted and also said that we we're ready to order, his response was " just let me get the drinks first".  I will admit it ticked us off, especially when he dropped the beverages off and then immediately took our order.   From where we were sitting we could see the kitchen backing up and servers waiting for plates to come over.  Our food came hot, except for the ice cold blueberry muffin.  I was told that was the new service spec for the muffin.  I've never heard of getting a cold blueberry muffin in a restaurant before, but I went with it as the server seemed swamped with other tables and I didn't want to ask for him to get it warmed.Get your act together

9.description: I went to this bakers square on Saturday, November 7th, 2015. Firstly, let me start by saying that my daughter, mother and myself frequent bakers square every Saturday, however this is our first time going to this specific location, store # 658. So if your a minority or specifically African American I wouldn't go here unless you want to get horrible service. Our dining experience started by the assistant manager attempting to seat us in the back near the restrooms, in which we noticed that's where the other African American patrons were sitting, I asked the assistant manager, do you have any seats over there (pointing to the bigger dining area), he looked at me as if annoyed and replied "sure" dryly. We didn't say anything about it we just continued on with our lunch. So our server whom is white comes and takes our order, he repeated our order 3 times to us. After waiting what seemed like an hour, we noticed our white server was asking all his other tables if they needed anything, bringing them their food, and being courteous as a waiter should. However, the server never came back to our table at all after taking our order. I saw the assistant manager walking pass and I asked him, do you know how much longer our food will be? He went to check and immediately brought it out to us, which further tells me the meal was ready, the server just didn't bring it to our table. My mother meal wasn't correct and we had no napkins during our entire meal. At this point I'm fed up, I spoke with the assistant manager and told him I think their is some racism going on here, in which I don't tolerate. I told the assistant manager that my mothers order was wrong and told him I wanted the check, store number, and to speak with the general manager. The assistant manager brought back everything I requested. Now, we're speaking with the general manager, I disclose to her all the above information and she's nice yet tries to make  it seem like racism wasn't the case and more so tried to blame the server as just being "bad" and not understanding the job. The general manager nearly begged us to pay for our meal however I politely declined and explained to her, I don't need a free meal, I insist that I pay for our meal and this is about the way in which we were treated and the poor service. I stated sternly once more that I don't want or need her to take care of our bills, she insisted we take a free pie, I accepted the pie to suffice her however I paid our dining bill for our meal. I told her that I would be calling corporate to complain, and informed her that we will not be back to this location again. She asked us to try that location again, I gracefully declined. I paid for our meal and we left the establishment.

26.description: Don't judge.I grew up on Bakers Square.  Both sisters worked at my suburban outpost location in high school so I have fond memories of chain smoking Marlboro Lights in the back while gulping down diet Coke and Oreo pie.Again, don't judge.  I was 17-years-old.The truth of the matter is I always enjoy my meal far more than I should at any Bakers Square.  The tuna melt is never a let down.  I always order it with a side of honey mustard that I'm convinced is laced with crack it's so good.  I unabashedly dunk my sandwich in it along with pretty much anything else on my plate.  BS always has some kind of meal deal where you can get 1/2 a sandwich, cup of soup, side salad and a slice of pie for something ridiculous like $9.  I mean, seriously.... so cheap.Really, though, it's all about the pies.  You can't go wrong.  I'm a slave to the Oreo, but the Peanut Butter Cup is nothing to shake a fist at.  You don't really want to admit how good the pies are because of all the amazing bakeries and such in Chicago, but for reals... the pie is the shizz.I'm also consistently impressed with the diet Coke at Bakers Square.  It always has the perfect amount of carbonation.  Sounds silly, but it's important.This location loses a star for lousy service.  Slower than molasses and inattentive, but it certainly won't stop me from coming back.

25.description: I love this Baker's Square and it scores high on my list as favorite places to go. The staff is so educated, friendly and well mannered. I've gotten to know so many of them from going there for years that  some are like family!Food is always best quality. I'm always on a diet, so many choices here if I don't choose any pie. I eat many things when I got there and have never been disappointed yet!

12.description: I really don't get it.  When I go here I like it.  For some reason I usually forget about Bakers!I did the usual, where do I want to go? Then as I was driving home, there it was!  To make the deal even sweeter it was free pie day.  Woo hoo !  I decided to get breakfast.  Eggs sunnyside up, english muffin with grape jelly, bacon well done and fruit.  I know they were just usual eggs but they really hit the spot.Server was nice and attentive, coffee was good and you get your own pot on the table.  I took the coconut cream slice home.When I got home I put my PJs on and layed in bed, watched tv and ate the pie.Does it get any better?Okay, having the next day off would be nice but.........

21.description: I really don't get it.  When I go here I like it.  For some reason I usually forget about Bakers!I did the usual, where do I want to go? Then as I was driving home, there it was!  To make the deal even sweeter it was free pie day.  Woo hoo !  I decided to get breakfast.  Eggs sunnyside up, english muffin with grape jelly, bacon well done and fruit.  I know they were just usual eggs but they really hit the spot.Server was nice and attentive, coffee was good and you get your own pot on the table.  I took the coconut cream slice home.When I got home I put my PJs on and layed in bed, watched tv and ate the pie.Does it get any better?Okay, having the next day off would be nice but.........

17.description: Service = GoodEverything else = BadOther customers = Ugly(Food = Marginal, Pie = Great)

10.description: Reasonably priced meals.  MOSTLY...a very kind, polite and fast wait staff.  A few of the waitresses leave you in the corner and forget about you, which is frustrating.  Especially when you ask for crackers for the soup and she never brings them back.  Don't ask us if there is anything you can do if you aren't going to do it!POSITIVES:Free pie Wednesday.  Huge comfortable seating.  When you order coffee they leave a pot on the table so you don't have to wait for re-fills.  They are very kid friendly, teenage friendly, young adult friendly, regular adult friendly and senior citizen friendly (MOST of the staff)We were there for breakfast one time, and the waitress took her break so she could drive a regular customer home because she did not want the elderly lady slipping or falling in the snow.  Really very commendable great service.Food is very good too!!

5.description: My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite to eat. He ordered the breakfast special and I ordered a BLT no mayo. We noticed there was only a cashier/ hostess and two waitresses. Later on we saw a busboy. The restaurant was quite crowded, especially for a Sunday night. Our food took quite a long time to arrive at our table. I picked up the toast to make sure the mayo had been omitted, and much to my dismay what was suppose to be " 6 pieces of bacon" was possibly two slices that were crumbled into very small pieces.  Our waitress was attentive, but definitely overwhelmed. When she didn't come back to  the table, my husband got up and spoke with her. She went in the kitchen and came out about 10 minutes later with a new sandwich. The second one was much better with full bacon slices. My side was a fruit cup.Unfortunately,about 40% of the grapes were soft or rotting, and the melon not the greatest. I had water and my hubby a Dr. Pepper. My husband's pancakes were golden brown on one side and completely white and under done on the other.Our bill was $23.00 without tip. Very disappointed with the quantity and quality of food. We definitely won't be going back. I think they are fortunate they are pretty much the only restaurant in this area, or they probably would have had to close their doors long ago.

35.description: When it comes to breakfast and to chain restaurants in my area....  I prefer this Baker's Square over the local IHOP, Denny's, etc..It is not as crowded as a Denny's on a Saturday morning and the food is not bad at all.  I really like their white bread, it is almost like sourdough'ish in its texture and taste.  Not sure what brand they use but I like it.I usually always get their plate called 'The Square Breakfast' and it has always been consistent.  The service is very good and the managers make a point of going around asking if everything is OK.  But not to the point where it is annoying or disruptive.

19.description: I have never written a review for this franchise restaurant, as I try not to review a "franchise" restaurant because these are usually not worth reviewing. The reason I am reviewing this restaurant is because I have always had a wonderful server who is hospitable and such a sweet human being. His name is Angelo. Angelo has been working here for many, many years. He always has a smile on his face no matter what kind of day he has had. I am a huge fan of their salads. I enjoy their strawberry salad topped with warm chicken breast. They tend to change up the salads according to the Seasons, so I appreciate that they try "new" salads reflective of Spring, Summer, Fall and Winter. If you enjoy eating salads, soups, sandwiches, and any kind of pie imaginable, give this restaurant a try. My favorite soup is butternut squash. Everyday they have a different "soup" of the day. Ask if Angelo is working and request to be seated in his section (area). I will give the service here (since I always get Angelo and always request him) five stars. He is excellent, attentive, welcoming and really good at his job. He always makes sure that you, the customer, are very well taken care of and if you need anything at all, he'll take good care of you. Please keep in mind that this is a franchise restaurant. Expectations should not be set high. Another excellent Server is Jeannie. She is always on top of her game, and will take really good care of you. She is filled with positive energy.They remodeled this restaurant several years ago. It looks more like a huge dining area with fewer booths. The booths always fill up quickly. Their salmon is always cooked perfectly and it is not a huge piece. It comes with steamed vegetables and your choice of salad and/or soup. The salmon is flavorful and juicy. I like that the texture on the outside is crispy, but the inside is tender and soft. There are different Managers here, so management is hit or miss at this Baker's Square. This restaurant is not culturally diverse as other restaurant that are in the inner city or in the heart of the city. However, the service is fairly decent, the price-point is very good, and the selection of pies are too many to list here. Every Wednesday is FREE pie Wednesday, so if you feel like breaking up your week and getting a FREE slice of pie, go for it. It can get fairly loud on Wednesday evenings, so expect it to be crowded and busy. My favorite pies are coconut cream, French apple cream cheese, strawberry and banana cream pie. If I get a slice of pie here, I usually work it off at the gym by adding 30-extra minutes to my work-out routine.

28.description: It's bakers square....I'm never disappointing....I definitely prefer this place over i hop or any other diner....I usually get the honey mustard chicken....or the chicken tenders....and i always try to save room for pie!The servers are sweet and attentive!!Free slice of pie on Wednesdays.

3.description: Even tho i had bad experience i still love the place and their food. And i think they're working on their service! Their customer service has good relationship with their client and i like that

33.description: If you have trouble gumming down food, then this place is for you and your dentures. Everything seems to be made into a fine paste and BLAND. Where else can you eat while an elderly nun glances over at you like the pie you are downing is a sin, which it probably is.  The only exception is the oreo pie which will bring you one step closer to heaven :]

43.description: This is the best Bakers Square I have been to. This one is newly remodeled. Before they remodeled it it seemed smaller on the inside but now it looks huge. Friendly staff and great food.

2.description: Oh, Bakers Square. Stop paying people to write these fabulous reviews. You're service speaks for itself.

18.description: Don't judge.I grew up on Bakers Square.  Both sisters worked at my suburban outpost location in high school so I have fond memories of chain smoking Marlboro Lights in the back while gulping down diet Coke and Oreo pie.Again, don't judge.  I was 17-years-old.The truth of the matter is I always enjoy my meal far more than I should at any Bakers Square.  The tuna melt is never a let down.  I always order it with a side of honey mustard that I'm convinced is laced with crack it's so good.  I unabashedly dunk my sandwich in it along with pretty much anything else on my plate.  BS always has some kind of meal deal where you can get 1/2 a sandwich, cup of soup, side salad and a slice of pie for something ridiculous like $9.  I mean, seriously.... so cheap.Really, though, it's all about the pies.  You can't go wrong.  I'm a slave to the Oreo, but the Peanut Butter Cup is nothing to shake a fist at.  You don't really want to admit how good the pies are because of all the amazing bakeries and such in Chicago, but for reals... the pie is the shizz.I'm also consistently impressed with the diet Coke at Bakers Square.  It always has the perfect amount of carbonation.  Sounds silly, but it's important.This location loses a star for lousy service.  Slower than molasses and inattentive, but it certainly won't stop me from coming back.

41.description: After remodeling and getting two new managers and getting rid of the old two this place really turned around. A new menu and everything. Of course the old favorites are there along with new ones. I recommend getting the Fried Cheeses appetizer, and for an entre I get the Grown Up Grilled Cheese which has shredded mozerella cheese, american cheese, and bacon on parmanini bread. One of my favorite waiters at this Bakers Square is Adam definately ask for him if he's there.

4.description: Baker's Square is known for their pies, right? So, calling on the phone to ask the price for a piece of pie, I did not expect to be met with stammering and silence. Pies are there moneymaker, I would think. Anyway, my dad loved the pie.Go Hawks!

6.description: I've recently rediscovered Bakers Square.  Okay... maybe not really rediscovered, but decided to try it again after not visiting for a few years.  This location has been remodeled and the menu seems revamped.  Lots of selections, but it was nice to see that they still had some of the classics.  Nice place to sit down and have a good meal then end it all with a nice piece of pie.

22.description: I love pie, there I said it.... I am determined to make all associates of mine love pie too, therefore I ALWAYS suggest pie places as to not feel like the only fat@$$ hog all the time....BS is the Pie super highway, at least in Chicago it is, for me. BS has something called the chicken stir-fry pita, if you've never had it, get it, then order the triple-berry pie warmed w/ ice cream, then tell me you still don't like the place. Places like this and basically all "breakfast all day" places, you gotta find the consistent dish you like & stick to it.The fruit pies are actually better than any of the cream pies, you just have to have them heated with ice cream, duh.

15.description: I love pie, there I said it.... I am determined to make all associates of mine love pie too, therefore I ALWAYS suggest pie places as to not feel like the only fat@$$ hog all the time....BS is the Pie super highway, at least in Chicago it is, for me. BS has something called the chicken stir-fry pita, if you've never had it, get it, then order the triple-berry pie warmed w/ ice cream, then tell me you still don't like the place. Places like this and basically all "breakfast all day" places, you gotta find the consistent dish you like & stick to it.The fruit pies are actually better than any of the cream pies, you just have to have them heated with ice cream, duh.

20.description: My waitress Amy talked me into the egg white omelette and it was amazing.   She was friendly,  the restaurant was warm and inviting, the parking lot easy to use and I look forward to the next visit.

8.description: Too bad there isn't a negative star review!!!Waited over 35 mins for food, it was hotter than hell and the outside temp was 95 degrees!!! Ac wasn't on or not working. Our server had a supervisor " title " Seems like it was her first day on the job... food sucked really really badStay away from this location too bad there aren't many locations left... wait maybe cuz they suck

14.description: Free pie Wednesdays for the win! Not gourmet food, but decent for a great price. I love the rise and shine breakfast plate that they serve all day. It comes with eggs, hash browns, and choice of fruit or toast/english muffin. It's the perfect amount to not fill you up too much for that slice of pie. You also can't beat that the plate is under $6! I've tried many of their pies but my favorites are the cream cheese apple and the caramel pecan silk. Yum!

3.description: This is the worst location I've ever visited and I'v been to the one in Joliet, Naperville, Schaumburg and Arlington Heights. First off, the employees tend to be a bunch of duds with little to no people skills. Second, the store is always a mess and has a strange odor. I've never understood how a store that supposedly sells current fashion trends, hire people who seem to have zero fashion sense. They are way too selective on what they take, and I feel that if you take clothes that's not the fashion style of the person looking at your things, then they don't keep as much.  This location sells cheaper brands, if you want a good CM, go to the one in Arlington Heights!

1.description: I bring my gently worn clothes I've grown tired of here. Whatever they don't accept, I donate to Goodwill.I make money and people happy either way! I made $45 today.

2.description: I can only speak for myself, but I didn't think anyone in there was rude at all. As a matter of fact, I had a great experience. They took the majority of the stuff I brought  in and I walked away with $58, which was more than I was expecting. I checked out their website, first so I had an idea before hand what they were looking for. Right now they are looking for boots, coats, sweaters, scarves and gloves for the upcoming winter, so I wasn't going to head over there with my summer dresses. I'll save that for spring/summer.They have a huge selection of shoes, handbags and denim and when I have the funds I plan on replenishing my wardrobe there.

5.description: Totally agree with Jen R.- sales people are rude and unapproachable.  The first time I went in there they took one of my items and said my clothes were "out of style" I got it, so when I decided to do some summer cleaning I put together another bag and went in, only to he greeted by different staff with the same bad attitudes, this time they rejected every single item, when I looked around I saw some things that were worn and dirty and I was shocked- I will never go there again, just FYI- Platos Closet is a block south and the staff is super sweet, professional, impeccable in their dress and manners, don't waste your time, and also they say they take all these brands on the website, they don't , unless it's high end don't bother! Lastly, all the clothes behind the counter were lying all over the floor, bins all over, no organization!

6.description: Another place that you can score a few good items. Going through all of the stuff can be a bit much so you have to be in the mood. I did get a great steal on some aldo flats for $10 and some patent Kenneth Cole flats for $12 (came out to $8 with a coupon). I will go back for sure.

7.description: They have several diamonds in the rough. Designer clothes for discounted price. However, the sales clerks do not know what they're doing!!

8.description: I have been to the one in schaumburg and they were great! Since then I have moved to Chicago and the closest one to me was the one at this location. I had a two bags, a couple pairs of sunglasses, and maybe 5 shirts and sweaters I wanted to bring in. They are open until 9 at 8 I called them and told them it would take me 25 minutes to get there and if they would still be able to look through my items since I didn't have very many. The sales person was very rude and automatically said no we stop taking clothes at 8:30, I had said well I would probably be getting there between 8:20 and at the latest possibly 8:30 and if that would be ok. Without evening thinking about it she just automatically said no. I thought that was very rude and inconsiderate since I would be getting there before the deadline or right at the deadline and I only had a few items. I have worked in Sales and know what it's like when customers are still trying clothing on when the store is closed but I have never been rude, tried to kick them out, or told them not to come in even if they were walking through the door right as we were closing. Unfortunately because of one rude sales person this place will be losing my business.

0.description: Clothes Mentor is the non-teen equivalent to Plato's Closet.  This is a small store, boutique-like in size but packed with a lot of stuff.  Brands include J.Crew, Banana Republic, Ann Taylor, LOFT, The Limited and work approriate clothing.  My experience as a buyer and seller has been fine.They'll explain to new sellers that they sell things for up to 70% off and pay a third of that.  However, if you walk around, you'll see that there's a capped amount for payouts.  I did a double-take when I found a DVF dress for $25.  Fantastic deal for the next size 0 shopper looking for a little black dress!  To sum it up, for nice brands that are within the last couple years and good condition, they'll take.  An older or generic label might be rejected even if the style is classic.  Designer items would do better under actual consignment for the seller unless you really don't have time.

4.description: I'm sorry but when I walk into a small owned business, not only do I expect to be greeted but I also expect to be told about the sale or clearance that is going on, so I'm not wondering what all these purple stickers on everything means. It was my first time here today, and although they did have some rather decent stuff I would not be returning by how rude the girl who was working today was. I thought that customer service was a priority? If I'm asking you a couple of simple questions like, what all these purple stickers on everything mean, or do you have a specific brand or do you also buy stuff here.. Why am I getting one worded answers with attitude while you don't even give me eye contact? I'm sorry am I bothering you from just standing there? Um no! I can take my business else where. You just lost a customer! 3 stars for the quality of stuff here at decent prices.

29.description: When not at work this is where I go... staff pretty cool, prices are good...they always take care of my staff as well.

42.description: TOP THREE THINGS I WOULD DO WITH ACCESS TO A TIME MACHINE: 1. Stay in college and major in everything and anything I could get my hands on. (Hidden meaning: Not work for, like, ever) 2. Never eat anything chocolate or smoke anything tobacco-filled, thus cutting my addictions off at the knees. 3. Tell my naive, post-college self that spending 5 nights a week at this smelly, scary hellhole picking up guys twice my age and very often passing out on a bar stool sometime around 4 was not a healthy use of my time. No food served, except like frozen pizzas. Its kind of frightening how many fights are breaking out and how many people are making out, right in the middle of a public domain. Its like an older, less safe version of college.  Except the majority of the poeple here NEVER WENT to college. They just spent all those years at Teasers.... or arent old enough for college yet (scaaaary) Stay away. Cheap drinks though. Sigh.

23.description: What a fucking shit hole. I wish I could give this place no stars. Every ass hole townie old fuck in the area thinks they own this place and the surrounding neighborhood.

47.description: Why?  Why come here?  Unless you are one of those that "needs more alcohol" or  "it's 2am, i gotta get more in me, why not stay out till 4am...i gotta pick up some girl"!!     I used to go here, a LONG time ago.  We'd make it a Tommy on Higgins night, then to Teasers when I could get my dance on in the front window!!   It was bad then.  Just not a good drunk crowd.  Came here last night, not sure why for a few night caps.  The bar was dead except a few regulars.  But i reminded me of the old days......nothing good can come out of late night bars.  If you are in the area and are in dying need of a late night cocktail......then fine.  But don't drive out of the way to go.

8.description: Love the staff love the environment! Jager, ricky, tia, and rory are amazing. For a local bar I love coming here after work

31.description: I can stumble home from here, plusAfter a night of drinking, this place is still open and i can stumble home drunk, minusEh, it's not that great. But it is open till four, there is a jukebox and enough room to hide from the loser that won't get the hint.

34.description: I dont understand why theirs so many negative reviews on the place. The place has changed alot from these 08/09 reviews. One small peeve I have is how expensive the mixed drinks are! but the beer is pretty cheap which is nice! and they got a good selection of it too. I like how the place is dim and chill with the candles, only thing that sucks is the suburban douche bags and the A&F girls. Its a mixed crowd of new youth with old dudes! you will how ever find the possibility of having a fling with random girls there. Over all its a bar I dont mind going to when I wanna kick back and relax and make fun of the douche bags...Kudos to you TEASERS!!!!

16.description: A good place to go to if you are too drunk to remember where you are. Which I was and I'm happy that I can't remember.

13.description: I've been going to this bar off and on for more than  several years now and have always had a blast. Very friendly staff, they pour heavy, and the prices are low. Overall a great working man's bar in the neighborhood. Lots of good people, the owners give back to the community regularly, a few idiots get mixed in late at night as it's a 4am bar but what 4am bar doesn't get stuck with a few idiots late at night? Best way I can describe this bar is to compare it to a younger, hipper, more fun version of that old TV show Cheers. I look forward to many more visits for many more years.

11.description: My favorite bar with the best bartenders and security staff! Management is always amazing as well.

39.description: Teasers isn't all too bad. It's your basic sit down and enjoy your drink and talk only with your friends type place.

37.description: They have almost nothing on tap. They actually rely on candlelight at the tables because they keep the lights so dim in this place, which is really not a great idea when all the tables are solid wood and this places is chock-full of the too-drunk-to-what spillovers that somehow wander here after their bars close at 2, since Teasers is open til 4 every night. They don't even have Metallica on the jukebox, even in the "super duper rip-off rate" search mode. Say what you will about that band, but for having sold a hundred million albums, you'd think they'd AT LEAST have Enter Sandman, if not deeper cuts. Barring the fact that this is completely out of my way, by about 8 miles in one direction, this bar is just mediocre. It's basically another version of "that bar" where all the people you never really wanted to see from high school hang out. 6 years later. And seeing the Chicago police outside more often than not to break up potential fights speaks volumes about a good number of the patrons, especially the stalker-ish ones and the assholes coming from places nearby. Madison Street this isn't. The only real redeeming thing is Monday and Wednesday Mug Nights, which other people have explained... except refills are now $3 instead of $2 due to "the new alcohol tax." Which is a load of crap because it's only about a buck more to buy a 12-pack from the store. Still cheap for 24 ounces, sure, but even less appealing than before. I'd almost rather just get a pitcher and save money again.

0.description: Amy G.  I think you left out a few things from your experience.  1. You waited maybe 2 minutes. More like 45 seconds from when you sat down. But I'll give you 2 minutes.  2.  I asked you very politely  if I could get you something to drink.  With a highly aggressive manner you barked that you had waited "for a long time".  I apologized for your wait and again asked what I could get for you.  You ordered a vodka cranberry.  I smiled like a good bartender does knowing how to deal with customers like you.  I placed a coaster and your drink in front of you.  That's $5 dollars please.  3.  You told me that you were NOT going to pay for it.  At that point I realized that maybe you just had enough to drink and I shouldn't be serving you.  So I dumped your drink.  If you were not going to pay for it then it was a wasted drink.   I paid for that drink on my comp.   4.  I asked you to leave.  You asked for the manager.   I was the manger on that night but you decided to argue, push and slap my door staff.  As a private business we have the right to refuse service to anyone at any time for any reason.  You gave us many reasons that night.   I think it's only right that your review has both side of the story.  I would hate to lose good potential customers over a bad review from someone that probably gets their food spilt on at chain restaurants after she waited so long just for her vodka cranberry.  Watch the movie "Waiting".  It's a good reference for what to do and how to treat your service staff at bars and restaurants.  Respect given=respect returned.  We would like to fire you as a customer and hope you can find a bar/late night bar that will be accepting of you.

38.description: If I only knew! my 21st birthday night celebration almost came to an end one Friday morning around2 until a voice from the crowd said TEASERS open till 4! Looking back on it now I am the one who is ultimately responsible for not putting Mr GOOD TIME CHARLIE to bed that very moment. It all seemed to good to be true, a local bar open till 4! The sweet Carney Bouncer who was about 35 with a sour puss on his face and a scruncci in his hair refused to let me in! AGAIN THIS IS ANOTHER OPPORTUNITY to just go home but the fact that he thought I was OVER SERVED as he allows the whole cast from thriller who where obviously belligerent right in front of me struck me the wrong way. THIS GUY IS ZEUS hahaha! I kind of feel bad for him because he never saw my Poker face coming. After 20 minutes of him refusing to let me in because he obviously wanted only 40 year old Gremlins at the bar he didn't even own, I met the owner who apologized let me in AND BOUGHT ME A DRINK. I guess he didnt get the OVER SERVED MEMO from his  BIG TIME door guy. It was a nice gesture from the owner but at this time nothing would save Teasers haha not even the deli man in the lab coat cutting up sausage and cheese for people at 3 in the morning. THIS WAS THE MOST BIZARRE experience ever........ I'd go back just to witness the creatures of skid row again.... This is why mommy says don't stay out too late when its a full moon

51.description: "Yo Vinny!""Yo""Ay, watch me pick up dat broad over by dere!""Da paralegal wit da big bleached permed hair?""Yeah! Waitaminnit, lemme comb my unironic mustache and straighten my Mike Ditka haircut. My satin jacket look clean?""You betcha, paisan! Wit da gold horn pendant and da tanktop, you'll take two or tree of 'em home in da caddy!"It'll be 1985 in here forever, so wicker park hipsters can come here to see what it was really like. This bar could be in New Jersey.  You can do worse I guess, and there's not much else in the area besides the moderately better Tommy's. If you're a guy who likes to fight this is your mecca because everyone's tougher than everyone else, and everybody likes to name-drop mobsters and city officials. If you're a gal who likes the d-bag scene, this is your new mecca. Muscle milk!

27.description: Been reading the reviews on this place, sound like a bunch of haters and people that just don't quite get it. This is a 4 am bar nuff said people wake up. Are there are d bags here hmmm YES IT'S 4AM AND THE NECKTARS OF THE GODS HAVE TAKEN OVER! ALCOHOL! Ok let's get to t he meat and bones of the scenario great beer specials,frozen pizza, pretty good bartenders that move fast, and a good mix of people, especially on  weekends. Otherwise a whole bunch of regulars. This place is what is, a local joint that's OK that goes HAYWIRE! After 2am on most nights. As far as the three star rating indicates its A-OK and serves its purpose. Ohhh I almost forget if your in the hood and you wanna watch sports they have plenty of good TVS.

32.description: Teaser's is always a good idea at 1:30 in the morning... then you get there and realize you should have gone home.  Teaser's is open til 4 during the week and 5 on saturdays.  Teaser's isn't a bad bar per se, it's just the douche bags that hang out any late night bar really enjoy this place.

48.description: My old stomping ground.  It used to be a cool spot.  The only decent late night spot in the area.  However, with the recent 4 am privileges taken away from Rog's and the 3 am license taken from Skore's, this place gets ultra crowded late night.  It's a mix of nw side locals, niles, park ridge, and norridge folks, and a good ammount of ghetto.  I still come here on occasion but miss the old days.

44.description: Backstory: One month ago I received a phone call from an old friend.  I hadn't seen her in 2 years.  She came into town and gave me a list of bars she wanted to go to with me.  I should note that our life  paths wildly diverged a long time ago...so yeah, her choice of bars doesn't really "mesh" with mine.  But, she's a buddy.  I chose Teasers because I've been here before.  This isn't my kind of bar but I think it could be a lot worse.  Barleycorn's is worse.  But I'm not gonna go there...I promised myself no more rants about Barleycorn's.  Teasers is clean.   Not much selection of beer on tap but they have a few goodies (Fat Tire and Harp).  I'd never step foot in here on a weekend but Sunday through Thursday I understand it to be pretty dead.  Music is...I can't remember the music.  I think the music was drowned out by the 15 or so TV's spread throughout the place with all manner of sports being presented (Ultimate Fighting?!).  The bartender was super nice however.  Very nice.  I was really surprised.In summary: It's a working class bar for working people located in a working class part of town.  Not my scene but not a bad place for people who like these places.  Big hair still makes an appearance at places like this and many of the males pronouce "th" with a "d" sound.  Interesting.

24.description: I seriously cannot stand this place..I hate that my friend's come here once a week and drag me along. The guys are creepy, The women are trashy and it seems like everyone after 3am is looking either to get laid or get into a fight...And I'm looking for neither...I need to start going home normal hours...

7.description: I can feel my dead relatives cringe at the sign of me walking into this shit excuse for a bar. Way too crowded, filled with high school acquaintances that I never thought I would see again. Takes 20 minutes to get a shitty watered down beer, and the women who drink there are far from classy. Finding the exit was my early Christmas present.

40.description: Here's why you should go:2.50 beer specials. Buy a mug that's approximately what..hmm like 3 beers, and refills are 2 dollars. Bring your mug back? 2 dollar refills. CHEAP drinks, very cheap. PRE-mixed long islands but they're still very strong. Cheapish shots. Here's what you should know:It's a craphole of a bar. There's plenty of room to bumble around, arcade games, multiple bathroom stars and the crowd you'd imagine (for the most part) bunch of d-bags bumbling around drunk. When I was there there was a guy who was laying on the ground, he was fine, just drunk, other people like "uhh what do we do?" Etc. If it's your neighborhood, that's cool man. Go to Teasers and try to keep to yourself, you don't want to get the D-bag cooties from talking to some of the other jerks there.But hey if you drink enough perhaps it won't matter anyways.

30.description: I saw adult men do a chest bump last night.This is the place to be if you are 28, you live with your parents, and you like cheap miller light.If you want to have a good time, venture into the city.  It's not that much farther to Jefferson Park, Lincoln Square, or even Roger's Park.It's just a bunch of adolescent men and euro trash.The bartenders were kind of slow, but the crowd was big.  They did an ok job but there should have been more of them.

46.description: whats wrong with getting your drink on late? This place is 1986 every day, in need of a makeover.

1.description: Great staff and great service. I'm always served in a timely matter when I go in. The staff is always nice and very professional. I've been going there for years and never once have I had an issue.

9.description: Worst place ever!!!!They treat industry workers like their nobody's!! When I asked  about industry workers they pushed away from us!!     When there was a situation and I asked for a professional courtesy they laught!!!Why laugh when we're both on the same level??!?!!!!!?!

26.description: Holy haters!!! I read just a couple reviews and had a good chuckle. I absolutely love this bar!!!!! I now have a 9 month old so sadly I haven't been able to visit my old haunt in a hot minute! The drinks are cheap and strong, bartenders knowledgeable and fast, and the rest off the staff super friendly. And when trouble brews (no diff then any other bar, fights etc) they handle it with the quicks and keep everyone else safe. A great place to see old friends or meet new ones, and you don't have to worry about being judged by some hipster for having fun (like chest bumping lol) this scene is for people who go out to have fun NOT the "I'm over it, whatever, Ironic crowd" Grab a great bloody during a game, or cocktails and shots for late night fun! Oh and there are d bags at EVERY bar and especially a 5 am bar so no one could possibly hold that against the bar. And for every person that would sit there and rag on this bar, why are you there at least once a week? Ya that's what I thought! First time we get a mommy daddy free night in the old hood you can bet your arse youll find me at the dirty!

25.description: Noooooooope. That's all I gotta say! Seriously speaking, it's not my kind of scene or bar what-so-ever. I do not recommend this bar.

12.description: So we walk in Friday 23rd.We grab a drink and as we're walking to a table near the dart boards this guy literally closed lined another guy slams him to the ground and we stood their gawking.I couldn't believe it.  No came to break it up.  Patrons did.  We left immediately.

21.description: There are 2 things that are great about this place... CHEAP and right by our home.Besides that... there is no besides that... The only reason you go here is because you...1) still live at home with your parents....2) still live at home with your parents nearby...3) still live at home with your parents nearby and are over 304) likes to be called a douche bag5) absolutely have no ounce of class in your system :DLike many on here... yes.. you will see grown men chest bump... and yes the douche bag to none ratio is WOW!My wife and I ended up here one night.. because we were still up for drinking and there was absolutely nothing to do... reality hit as soon as the regulars bellied up next to us with fresh ice cold old styles.... and kept em coming.....  I'm just thankful we still walked out of that place with some dignity left over :D

17.description: Teasers is the bar after the bar. Open till 5AM on Saturdays! Barr staff are quick to make your drink during peek hours. They had a hot dog cart out in front 1 for $3 or 2 for $5 chicago style hot dogs. Always running beer specials

10.description: One of the worst bar experiences... I waited so long to get a drink even though the bar wasn't busy, and finally when the bartender started making my drink I told him that my wait was too long, so he looked at me and dumped my drink that he was making and called the manager on duty to kick me out.  We tried talking to the manager and he just laughed at us and said we had to leave immediately "because he said so." I will be calling management about the way we were treated, no professionalism at all here!

5.description: Great, Family Bar! you get some of the Best Bartenders in the City! great music, darts, friendly staff, and great specials! Long Time customer and highly recommend Teasers to anyone. out for the game or looking for a late night spot, Teasers is the Place!

3.description: I'm noticing a trend on people writing reviews in that they are people who either haven't been here in years or are blaming staff for them not being able to handle themselves...the place is awesome

35.description: This place had a real nice makeover.  The dance floor (aka Ultimate Fighting Octagon) has been removed and the bouncers actually patrol the place, snuffing out trouble before it goes any further.  Only real drawbacks include only having pizza for eats and no Golden Tee golf, but other than this it's a nice place with good people.  Will definately be back.

19.description: I found this place using my phone. My friend and I wanted a place to get drinks nearby and Teasers came up. So we said what the heck and tried it. The atmosphere is really nice and diverse.  A variety of music plays all night. Teasers also has lots of TVs, darts, and pinball. We loved that Teasers had drink specials on a Friday. The drinks are cheaper than most bars or pubs. We will definitely go back again!

28.description: No f'n thanks! That's it!

45.description: If you're the type of guy who likes to snort coke, pick fights and hit on ridiculously drunken women (or the type of girl who looks for these qualities in a guy), then you may have just found your new favorite bar.Not everyone in Teaser's is a complete tool, but with plenty of real estate and a 4 a.m. liquor license, this hellhole quickly fills up after 2 with every douche bag from the surrounding area.  Your senses will be bombarded with obscure (terrible) songs played from the jukebox and meatheads walking by shoulder-bumping you in a pathetic attempt to establish dominance.The best thing I can say about Teaser's is that it's located near a Taco Burrito King.  And I hate Taco Burrito King.

33.description: Cheap drinks! 4AM! Live bands"sometimes", decent Tv's, some games to keep the extra ADD kid occupied....Taco Burrito King across the street.

43.description: Teaser's is conveniently located across the street from the local crack bar and attracts only the finest clients. It is the most glamorous place in Chicago to catch ebola, high-five a crackhead, and participate in a gang warfare. This is the local 4-o'clock hot spot so be prepared for every d-bag in town with a popped collar and an IQ of 3 to wander on in and act out "My new haircut"

2.description: Perfect bar for an industry crowd, the staff is friendly, fast, and attentive and the prices are very fair. The food is amazing too! Be sure to try their pizza and wine bombs!

18.description: Teasers? I've been in jails in third world countries I've felt safer in. And the woman with a missing tooth yelling at me from across the bar, "Excuse me sir, you're gorgeous!" was a nice touch.But the bartender was polite.

41.description: Came here on my 21st birthday...which was eons ago.  Came here again because I had a relative in the area and still see why I didn't like this place.  Lot of locals and offbeat people located here.  I'd have to say that many of the other posts are accurate.....lot of odd people before 1am, and after 1am, this place picks up more of the derelict crowd.  The have a 2 x 2 dance floor and many of the ladies show up here are the Acqua Net users.  Somehow, someway, this place still endures.

52.description: Oh, Teaser's.  I had a going away party from my now previous employer at this establishment yesterday.  Tim M. and I thought it would be a nice ironic place to hold such an event with some of our office-type co-workers.  Turned out to just be a regular bar.  The owner was very nice and accommodating to our large group.  Ton's of signed sports memorabilia on the walls, cheesy music and darts/golden tee.  I will never go back because it is just not my type of bar, but the staff was nice and the prices were decent.  They had a benefit for a cheer leading squad come in after 8pm.  I felt weird explaining to the raffle people that I just didn't see giving money to a cheerleader's squad was a worthy cause.  People are sleeping on the streets!

50.description: If for some reason, you ever find yourself sitting in your freezing car waiting for a drunk friend who INSISTED they go into Teasers and have another drink, PLEASE have more will power than me and just leave them there. There are few bars in Chicago that given the choice of going in, or waiting in an unheated car in November, would force me to pick the lonely car sitting, but this place can only be described as hell on earth. Nothing like visiting family in the suburbs for the holidays and being submitted to this douchbaggery to make me ever so thankful I live a good 10 miles from this place.

4.description: One of the only places I go. Literally.  I love my teasers family.  No cookies necessary.

6.description: Amazing bar to come to. Manager, Michael is always the best bartender. Never a dull moment. Best trained staff around.

22.description: The good: It was open.The bad: It's a dive without any personality and too much douche bag to none ratio. I will not be returning...

15.description: There are 2 things that are great about this place... CHEAP and right by our home.Besides that... there is no besides that... The only reason you go here is because you...1) still live at home with your parents....2) still live at home with your parents nearby...3) still live at home with your parents nearby and are over 304) likes to be called a douche bag5) absolutely have no ounce of class in your system :DLike many on here... yes.. you will see grown men chest bump... and yes the douche bag to none ratio is WOW!My wife and I ended up here one night.. because we were still up for drinking and there was absolutely nothing to do... reality hit as soon as the regulars bellied up next to us with fresh ice cold old styles.... and kept em coming.....  I'm just thankful we still walked out of that place with some dignity left over :D

20.description: Teasers? I've been in jails in third world countries I've felt safer in. And the woman with a missing tooth yelling at me from across the bar, "Excuse me sir, you're gorgeous!" was a nice touch.But the bartender was polite.

36.description: I don't know why so many people knock this bar. I barhopped here last monday night. It is away from crowds of downtown and there are several bars in the area. I drove by a few years ago and discovered this Higgens harlem area. It is about as far NW as you can get and it has a suburban feel. Many of the nearby dive bars were ok. This place was the biggest and on a monday night football night it was mostly older men. It was so refreshing to see very few females in the bar. maybe on the weekend it is a college dropout bar. It was a nice mix of Latino and White and all ages the night I went. Most of the few women were latino and i wonder if it has same crowd during the week. It was real nice and decorative inside. maybe the drunks are out on the weekend, but the night I went it was a very calm relaxed crown watching Kle Orton and the Broncos win another. Hello Folks every bar has obnoxous drunks on the weekend. So what else is new. If you don't want to see loud drunks then maybe a bar is not for you. Get up early on a Sunday and hang out somewhere else like a church.

14.description: Super fun bar and great place to hang out with friends.  Many different drink specials and always have the major sports events going on. Bartenders are friendly and the owners are always giving back to the community and to charitable causes.

12.description: I would never really write a review for Micky Ds, but just wanted to give a shout out to the owner for having the most nicely landscaped McDonalds in probably all of Chicagoland.  Plus, they never gave me sweet tea instead of unsweetened. That ruins my day.

7.description: Used to go here all the time just about every morning for breakfast  till last winter one of the workers who was shovling left a ice breaker in the drive thru  and it poped up and damaged  my car so i made a police report and talked to the owner he admitted  they left it in the way and said hrll fix my damage  2 years later still not fixed wont return  my calls and now says itd not his fault and hes not responsible  nice way to treat a loyal customer  and not a good way to run a business  a very bad business  man GO ELSE WHERE

19.description: mess up orders all the time

1.description: Things have definitely gotten better. I'm not sure of it was a change in management or what. Be prepared, however, to wait about 10 minutes if you order breakfast during the lunch hours.

2.description: I was served, in the drive-thru, by a man wearing a BATH ROBE !!!   TERRIBLE !!

9.description: Making a pit stop McD looks good but the bathroom door is broken. Is this up to McD's required presentation code? Also gang signs on trim of door.

6.description: I have patronized this McDonald's location for many years and can't put into words how worthless I felt the last time I walked in.  I stood in front of the counter for ten minutes before someone approached to take my order.  The workers were so involved in socializing at the pick-up window that it made me feel my business wasn't necessary.

18.description: This McDonalds has been renovated recently and added an additional drive-thru and plasma tv's in the eating area. Also, the comfy chairs are arranged just like a living room so elderly folks can chat with their friends about WWII in total comfort. The counter where I'm sitting has a nice view of the 50" Plasma TV and this McDonalds also has Wi-Fi so I can write my Yelp review on my iPhone.  The courteous girls working also seem to know just what I want, maybe cuz I eat here every day.  5 stars for clean restaurant, Shamrock Shakes and nice employees.

10.description: I never thought I would write a Yelp review about a McDonald's, but the Manager was so outstanding that I had to! I'm pretty late with this, but about 6 weeks ago, the night of the 2015 blizzard in Chicago (beginning of February), my neighbor and I were starving, and everything was closed because of the weather. We finally found this McDonald's open, and when we pulled into the drive through, and this is around 3:00am,the gentleman on the speaker was so friendly that I even made a comment about how someone could be in such a good mood in the middle of the night! His wonderful behavior continued once we pulled up to the window to get our food, and he let us know that it would be a minute or two because our food was being made fresh, and it was! This gentleman deserves a raise! I wish I would have gotten his name so I could give him proper credit on here, but hopefully this somehow makes it back to him or his superiors. Keep up the good work!

13.description: Dear McDonald's; Thank you so much for some Hot & Spicy diarrhea. It lasted hours!                                   Your's Truly -                                                       Worn Out p.s. the Shamrock Shake ruled.
