16.description: This is the best MCDS I have ever been to! The staff remember you, your orders, and ALWAYS have a smile and a "have a nice day" and say please and thank you. =] Their drinks are made 99% right (sometimes they hear wrong), but offer to fix it immediately without if's or but's.

17.description: I don't know why I keep coming back, we stop maybe once a month if that on the way home from the park- the orders are constantly messed up.  I ordered a hot tea and all I received was hot water.  Other orders are usually wrong and I have ordered Happy Meals for my kids and they are constantly missing either the chicken nuggets, fries and apples.  I understand if it is 1 time, it happens but this has happened 4 of the last 5 times we have stopped there!

15.description: Make sure you check your bag before you pull away from the drive-through - many times I've left without the dressing to my salad.

0.description: Nothing really interesting or special about this place. I do have to say I came here several times, but in particular, there was one occasion where I came during the lunch hour. Seeing there being 6-cars deep in the drive-thru, I ventured in, where there were at least 4-people ahead of me in line. One of the registers only took cash, which made a customer really angry... I don't understand how people get angry so easily?Either case, seeing the staff here work their magic and not losing their cool, despite the long line and aggravated customers, this was a pleasant experience. The inside of the place was rather clean, with napkins, straws, and soda syrup, a-plenty.BATHROOM REVIEW: Nothing too interesting about this bathroom. It was as "clean" as expected for a McDonalds. Sit or squat? Squat.

5.description: Not a pleasant visit. Nobody in the crew are smiling. Its 9am, they should still have energy to smile to customers. I just stepped in and i was already asked what i want to order. I felt like im being rushed

11.description: To be fair, this probably should be 5 stars but while I do like McDonalds - it is a fast food chain! The food can't compete with some of the better restaurants out there.With that said, this location does a great job! The service is good, the food is good, parking is okay and they are open 24 hours. I haven't had a bad experience yet, the orders have been correct and the food has tasted fresh (knock on wood).

8.description: I couldn't give this place zero stars so i had to give it one star to leave this review. The tall skinny manager is unprofessional and is a bad example for the workers. Instead of treating customers friendly and with gratitude this guy disrespects them and antagonizes them to make them never visit this place again. I will never visit this McDonald's again. I called McDonald's corporate, let's see what that does.

3.description: Worst McDonalds. They've never gotten my order right and their fries taste like rotten oil. No one is ever friendly and they always seem to have a bad attitude. It really sucks because this is the only fast food restaurant near my house for whenever I need a fast meal. I may as well give myself extra time and drive further to another restaurant and get my food correct with people who are happy to take my money.

14.description: I wish there was a zero star. I ate there with my dad and it was not good! I got sick from here and threw up so much and had to go to the hospital for two days. My dad got sick too! Listen here: DO NOT GO TO THIS MCDONALD'S IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE SICK!

4.description: Did drive thru. Only asked for large Coke.Paid, moved to next window, got medium.Told them I ordered large.  Took a couple of minutes.  They replaced it with a large.  No sorry, no nothing.As I drove away I started drinking it.  Helloooooooooooooo.It was 7 up/Sprite.It only gets more difficult people.

12.description: Fast, friendly, and cheap. You can't beat $5 eyebrow threading at this local fave of mine!

3.description: My mom recommended this place for face/ eyebrow threading. I went in a day after she did for the exact same service. She paid $13, I was charged $25. Granted, I should have asked the cost prior to the service, so I didn't fuss about it. When I asked for a list of their services with the prices; however, I found it sketchy that their wasn't one. Can't help but feel alittle ripped off

1.description: STAY AWAY!  My girlfriend was looking around for a salon near our home and this place was few blocks away.  She called and asked what the prices were and was told around 65.  Just before the stylist was done she asked what the price was again.  She was told 170 dollars!!!  I got a phone call few minutes later and contacted the salon how the price went from 65 to 170 and was told the stylist has left and the owner only comes in once a week but not sure at what time.....  She has been getting same color done etc for years and never paid more than 100 dollars!

2.description: If you want a nice quick eye brow threading, Meera's is a great choice. It's quick, inexpensive, and the staff is nice. Usually you don't need to wait more than 10 minutes, it does get busy in their. I wish they spoke a little more clear, but they do a good job and usually understand what it is you want. If you aren't satisfied they will go back and fix your brows to your liking. Oh, and they always give u a tissue at the end for those teary eyes you get during the threading (I'm such a baby!).They do have other services such as hair cuts and other hair removal services. I cannot comment on these though as I have never tried any of them. But they do seem busy so they just might not be too shabby for the price you are paying. I recommend this little place. It's convenient and decent :)

9.description: Great place! They do a great job threading! My eyebrows are always even and they even offer lotion to rub on top! Great value at only $5.  Ask for meera she's the best!

10.description: Called and scheduled a mens haircut. They called back to switch appt time. We confirmed. I arrive and wait, stylist was a no show. No reason given. Was a waste of time. Poor communication.

13.description: The difference between waxing and threading is cash.  Why pay outrageous amounts of money for someone to burn your lip or brow when you can go to Meera's for $5 (each service) and get threaded.They do such an awesome job that there is usually only standing room waiting if you get there late (they open at 9:00 am).  Some people prefer to wait for Merra to do their threading which makes the line even longer.  I HATE WAITING!!  The only questionable thing I've observed is Meera talking on the phone while she does her craft.  Although I've never had a problem, how do you pay attention to you job while you're talking on the phone??  Other then that I love this place and I'll never go back to the expensive salons for this service.

16.description: Eyebrow Threading. I will never again get my eyebrows waxed and as long as I don't have to go too long before getting back to Meera's I will never use my tweezers again. Eyebrow threading is such a good way to shape your eyebrows and the end result it awesome. It lasts for just about 2 weeks. The best part of Meera's is that is only $5.00!!! It's amazing. When they get you in right away in only takes about 5 minutes. Of course because Meera and all of the other girls are so good at what they do, there is a line sometimes. However, they do their best to keep the line moving. They know immediately when you walk in if you are a threader or a waxer, because they are just that good. If you have never had your eyebrows threaded-I highly suggest that you give it a try. I have been going for 3 years and will continue to as long as they stay open. They take thread, literally, wrap it a few times, pull it tight and let it go against your eyebrow. They can shape your eyebrows any what you would like. There is some pain, but then again what beauty doesn't come with some pain. IThe skin around your eyebrows stay red for a few minutes after but then returns to normal and your eyebrows and ready to! They also thread lips and face and all that. I've only done my eyebrows and I definitely recommend it.

6.description: I went in and liked how they shapped my eyebrows. The Young thin girl had an attitude, was somewhat rough..I noticed that she did not take the tip I left her, so I wonder if meera still keeps the tips? Any way back to the actual service- she made me bleed. Did not want to remove stray hairs. Had an attitude. Rude. Told me that it was better 4 me to have a unibrow,and long eyebrows. Did not want to trim them, like I was asking . Won't return.

15.description: I am a big fan and loyal customer been going there for 9 years..  They have had many girls come and go but the last year it has been the same ones.  I love the fact that since i been going they have not changed their prices.  I never leave disappointed but for $5.00, what else can you ask for.  I believe that  nice/clean eye brows compliment your face.  I get many compliments as to where i get them done. I like that fact that i can go get eyebrows done during my lunch, i am in and out.  Give them a try.

0.description: First Time here and I absolutely loved this place! They did an amazing job with my eyebrows!

5.description: My new go to Eyebrow place! I use to travel from Harlem and Addison to Kedzie and North Ave because I was so stuck on the person who use to do my eyebrows. Cmon Ladies once you find a GREAT one it's hard to trust or even let someone near your face! My sister recommended this place for threading. I went. At first I went to the lady in the first chair (thin with long straight hair) She did good. But She was a little rough. She made me bleed and left hair clearly where it should not have been. I asked her to fix and she did. But I felt with an attitude!  I went to the lady in the second chair (short curly dark hair w/glasses)  the next time! AMAZINGGGGG! She's tender and communicative. She takes her time but not like OH MY GOD WOULD YOU HURRY! She's graceful and you can feel her warm spirit. Another time the second lady was busy so I went to the First Lady. It's like she remembered me and was angry I never went back for HER service. Dude I felt every hair leaving my damn face. She made one eyebrow extremely skinner than the other! I felt she did that purposely! I'll never go to her again no matter how busy the other lady is. I tip great wherever I go! I remember I gave her a freaken $1. It's a nice clean place , gets busy at times so they have a numbers when necessary to keep tabs on walkins. And they offer kids cookies which my kids always look forward too. The lady in the second hair is who keeps me coming back! I would've loved to give it 5 stars but attitude goes a long way especially when ur dealing with someone's face!

11.description: Eyebrow threading done right (for almost each attendent), reasonable price.  Nikki gives great haircuts too.

8.description: Meera's is sometimes a hit and miss to get my eyebrows done at. The youngest worker there is the best. She's patient and takes her time even when it is extremely busy.Meera who does my eyebrows really well when it's not busy is not my favorite person to go to during the busy hours. She rushes and misses quite a few spots.I love the fact it is ONLY $5 for eyebrow threading and $9 with upper lip (waxing or threading). I've been going here for a few years now and their prices hasn't change! Sweet!

4.description: They do eyebrow threading and waxing for $5. The staff is really nice and professional. Meera ofcourse is the one to ask for but the other people are good too. For men wanting to get their eyebrows done, come here there are so many other guys that go here. My friend was so nervous about getting his done but they explained both methods and made him feel comfortable. So come check it out!

14.description: The price is unbeatable. As far as wait time goes it varies greatly. Just yesterday I walked in and sat right down. Othertimes I've had 10 people in front of me. I sometimes think my eyebrows are a lil uneven, but that could be me just being crazy picky. I always get compliments after I get them done and no one seems to see the uneveness even after I try to explain it. If you want to get your eyebrows done without feeling like you just paid waaay too much, then Meera's is the palce.

7.description: Some of the things I've read about Meera's business practices in other reviews have me worried, but I've personally had nothing but great experiences each time I've been here for brow and upper lip waxing.  $9 total for both really can't be beat!I tend to go way too long between visits, and my brows get really bushy.  I've been scolded for this by a few threaders on Devon, but Meera is always very polite and non-judgemental.  One of my eyebrows even grows differently than the other (one has a natural arch, the other does not), and she always remembers this each time she sees me.  She tries her best to get them even.  If she's on the telephone or having a conversation with another person, they might turn out uneven or thinner than I'd normally like, but I've had more satisfactory experiences than negative ones.They e-mail special offers from time to time - for example, buy a certificate for 10 eyebrow threading sessions and get 5 free.  I believe they also just started accepting credit cards, which is a nice plus.

12.description: Great little grocery store. The broccoli salad is fantastic, along with their other prepared foods. The prices are in general very good. In fact their organic eggs and milk are 50 cents cheaper than other grocery stores so they have some good deals.  Love their coffee too!

7.description: A great small grocery store.Clean and well organized, this store carries a nice assortment of fresh produce, meat and dry goods.  They had a good variety of fresh made breads and my favorite Aunt Mille's white bread.They also had a small, but well thought out organic vegetable selection.They are very well staffed (ala Marianos) and every register was open.The parking lot is a little tight, so bring your patience.They have a great coffee shop that opens at 5:30 am to catch the commuters.  The coffee shop features intelligensia beans and has some nice pastries and such to accompany your coffee on the trip to work.I tried the food on the hot bar and honestly, it was just ok.  The chicken was a little dry and everything else looked a little steam tabled out - do hot bars ever look good?...i think not.  Maybe if the hot bar doesn't make it, they can make this a sit down coffee shop.To wind down your day, they have a good selection if liquor, beer and wine.A welcome addition to the growing downtown Norwood Park.  And I thank you for stocking organic foods and booze!

19.description: So glad this opened in NW park! This small grocery has a surprising amount of variety - especially organic and other special dietary items (gluten-free and dairy-free) I wasn't expecting! The deli is high quality and the sushi (weekends only) is really good! I'm also loving the coffee bar - just wish there was some tables & chairs to sit and enjoy.

1.description: They are way better than the past few attempts in this location. The hot food bar is a big time saver, and the soups are good. I especially want to commend them for accommodating allergy requests. They have made special Rotisserie Chickens for us (requested a day in advance), and the staff at the deli counter is very accommodating to requests for allergy free items and procedures to insure no cross contamination. We really appreciate their focus on the customer!

2.description: Ok I've given Ada's a few more chances and I like the store.  It's convenient and never has a long line.  It's a great place to so small shopping trips.    DO NOT get anything from the coffee shop.   They made my drink a matcha  with samples that had been sitting out on the counter  for who knows how long.   The samples were made with milk and I requested soy milk.   Not only is it disgusting to pour old samples into a fresh drink someone with food allergies could become seriously ill.

9.description: Nice Local grocery.Good Deli - fair prices.  They had Rotisserie chicken for 4.99 each.  Looked good.I tried their Asiago bread and it was very good.They have some prepared food in the front near the coffee counter.  I tried their chili - it was a little sweet - but good.Very happy overall and i hope they make it.

6.description: This grocery store is not even close to being up to par!  The produce selection is very limited and not fresh!  Every piece of produce was bruised as if the produce is purchased at a discounted rate.  The meat department is very limited...most of the meat is wrapped in saran wrap which leads me to believe that they are hoping it stays "fresh" past the normal timeframe for selling the meat.  In all my years shopping for food across the globe, I have NEVER seen meat wrapped in plastic.  Meat and produce are the primary items I went to purchase and I walked out with a box of cereal.  The employees at the deli counter do not know how to slice turkey and do not even show you a sample of the thickness of their slice before they complete your order.

18.description: I love this new store in the neighborhood. Our area is a food oasis with so many options, but Ada's brings some unique products I love and will keep going back for. The prices are competitive and they offer some fantastic specials. I like to condense my shopping and they have most of what I usually need.  My absolute favorite is the smoked salmon. It is just a piece of fresh salmon, smoked lightly on site. It is very low salt so I can eat it every day. This is not like nova lox cured with smoke and salt, it is just smoked salmon. You really have to try it, it is so tasty an healthy! The hot food bar is better than Mariano's and Whole Foods by far. The choices are amazing, and so tasty. I met the chef one evening when I was there and he said they aim to keep the hot bar ingredients healthy. My favorites are the roasted veggies, many different types of meat loaf and the apple gobbler dessert. They have whole steaks and pork chops, mashed potatoes like my mom makes.  I had the beef goulash with some mashed potatoes last night and it was wonderful. I work long hours, and I have little time to cook, so Ada's offers a welcome place to get a good prepared meal. I have to mention the fresh pastries and bread, the great coffee shop and so much more.

10.description: I really want this place to succeed. The owners and all the staff are super nice. But the past few times I've been here they did not have basic items. Most recently, 2 days ago they did not have jalapeños. A few weeks ago, no basil. About a month ago they didn't have chocolate syrup. I end up going to Ada's and then to Jewel to get the rest of the stuff I need and it's usually pretty basic stuff like this. I really hope this store gets it together, it's in a great spot and it would be very convenient.

13.description: Really enjoyed coming here! Nice staff, clean establishment! Came here to grab something out of their lunch bar- really impressed with the quality and selection! I ended going with the pre made Cobb salad! Really good and only four bucks for a huge portion! Will definitely be back to shop and for lunch! Huge selection of food, liquor, and bakery/deli for their size!

16.description: Awesome grocery store!  They have an excellent selection of organics and gluten free products.  Their deli has great salads and lunch meats.  It's great to finally have a neighborhood grocery store with such quality products.

17.description: The Service, the people, the certified Angus Meats are all absolutly splendid. The overall experience was/is wonderful. The staff is very helpful and eager to answer your questions, Ownership is very friendly, and they keep the selectiom fresh. The store is always clean with very accomodating isles, the produce is fresh clean and crisp, Overall just a great store/experience.

15.description: Absolutely LOVE Ada's!  Fresh, quality selections, delicious homemade meals, fabulous coffee, and super friendly service. Always a great shopping experience. So glad to have you in the neighborhood!

0.description: Absolutely wonderful store for those always necessary quick trips. Reasonably priced with a slammin' deli section that offers some of the best mushroom soup I've ever experienced. There's a hot food carry out section, a great coffee bar (Intelligensia, whoo hoo!) and a very friendly staff to make the place even more appealing. And if the store doesn't feature your favorites you can drop a suggestion/request and every effort will be made to stock the item. Hard to find that kind of attitude in the big chain stores.

5.description: The deli has me coming back time and time again. Perfect place to stop on the way home from work for something for dinner, premade or ingredients. The chicken salad, mushroom soups, potato salad, lunch meats have all been DELICIOUS. I can't wait to try more. All of the employees have been nothing but nice and helpful. The owner is very customer oriented and has hopped on a register to speed up the checkout process if there was more than one person in line. On a neighborhood  walk with your dog? There is a bowl of water as well as a bowl of Snausages at the door for your pooch.

11.description: This is the new store that Norwood Park desperately needed. Good prices, great selection and kind staff all make this a win-win for us here. There is a coffee shop attached to the building as well!

8.description: I'm giving Ada's the full five stars because they sell rotisserie chicken- DELICIOUS rotisserie chicken!Ada's also has a variety of fresh produce with lots of organic options. Their deli meats and cheeses were less expensive than I expected. As for their prepared foods, I've tried their Cranberry Couscous salad (tastes like Thanksgiving!) and their Roasted Corn salad. Both were so fresh, flavorful, and tasty. They made great side dishes for my cookout!I initially went in to support a new, local business expecting a limited selection with high price tags but was so pleasantly surprised! I'll definitely return for the bulk of my grocery shopping. Maybe it was what I picked out but my bill was cheaper here than at my other main grocery store, and my purchase today included a number of extra items like cooking spray and Kcups.

3.description: Compared to the other 2 stores that were in this building. Ads'a is a breath of fresh air. It's a really nice little store down a few blocks from my apartment. Their produce section is small but real nice. The quality is good and fairly priced. The deli section is small but nice. Good prices. I tried their house smoked ham and I really liked the taste and price too. The store almost looks like a copy of the previous ones but with fresh faces. They greet you when you walk in which is awesome. I hope this place survives due to shop n save not far from here. This place is a bit closer to my home then shop n save.

14.description: Ada's market and deli is a wonderful addition to the neighborhoodIt has an excellent deli, great market, good prices on all items in the storeAnd if you don't see something,  Ada will get it for you! Service and customer satisfaction is their motto.

4.description: Ada's is such a wonderful addition to Norwood Park. The previous incarnations of grocery stores that occupied this location were lacking in a way that was hard to pinpoint, until Ada's opened and made it clear why this store is head and shoulders above its predecessors. Ada's has a reasonable selection of produce, an large deli, an organic food section, as well as a hot bar and a coffee bar. I haven't compared prices at Ada's with other stores in the area, but I do find Ada's to be one of the cleanest, beat organized, and friendliest stores. I want this place to do well because it really is a cut above the rest of the small, local stores in the neighborhood.

1.description: I love this salon, have been going there for 10 years, than I tried a high profile place for my rather difficult hair, and I realized how much I love Inga. They make you feel like home, they always advise you what is best for you, and they are up to date with trends in fashion, and I am not, so it works well. I think I will be going to this place forever. Thank you ladies, and especialy Inga and Agnieszka.

2.description: I went to this salon, because it was recommended by a friend. I had an appointment, yet I had to wait 30 minutes to be seen. The stylist was great, however, at one point I was alarmed when she mentioned that she normally does not work with hair this long. Um... I shifted in my seat, visualizing a chop job. The shampoo girl made me feel uncomfortable by making comments about my long hair and questioning how the stylist will manage it. This further elevated my stress level. In the end, she did a good job and worked with the layers I already had. I probably would have returned if I felt more comfortable sitting in her chair during the first visit.

0.description: Love this salon and its brand new look! But that is not what keeps me coming back time after time. My stylist is Agnes and every time I get my color done, I get a ton of compliments! I switch between an auburn and strawberry blonde and each time the color looks amazing. She really knows how to pick out shades to compliment my skin and face. All the ladies here are amazing... Ewa and Monika are awesome as well!

29.description: My son just did a tour in Afghanistan with the united states army. I am a member of zipfitness and have recommended them to many people. So when my son came home and had to keep working out for when he returned to his home base, i went in and asked if there was 1. a military discount 2. if i could pay an additional 12.99 for the month and maybe had the membership fee waived because he was only going to be here for 3 weeks. they told me no, there are no military discount nor would they waive the fee even though he would only be here for three weeks, when i asked for the corporate number, they gave me another number for the zip in waukegan, when i called back today they would give me no other info, so i called waukegan, and they said they would get an email to the owner and have him call me.  Could i pay the $35, of course, but its the principal of how ZIP FITNESS clearly does NOT support the military. Perhaps they should read a little letter that STARBUCKS wrote to the troops when they asked for coffee, it kind of went like this - Starbucks does NOT support the war, thank you for your business, hmmm, i shared this info and i at least have 30 people who no longer frequent. perhaps zipfitness should think before they speak.

42.description: I'm shocked to read all the complaints about "high schoolers" hanging out at ZIP.  I didn't know that wanting physical fitness had an age requirement.  The young people who have been there, at least while I've been there, have been respectful and doing the same thing that I'm doing: focusing on a workout.  I'm happy to see them there, getting in shape and doing something productive, rather than wandering the streets or playing video games.  When I was in high school and joined the gym, I'd be horrified if they told me I couldn't because I wasn't "old enough."  (And I've been out of high school for a long time).  But enough said about that....It's very clean!  The staff is super friendly!  I love the new machines.  The locker room is immaculate.  There is tanning for anyone who wants to access that.  Cheap, cheap, cheap!  Easy parking!  There are TVs everywhere and all you  have to do is bring headphones, plug them into your machine, and choose a channel to listen to them.At other gyms, I've often felt intimidated.  Here, everyone is friendly and no one appears too full of themselves.  I finally feel like I found a gym that I will return to regularly and I actually like being there!A great addition to the neighborhood.  Thanks, ZIP!

23.description: I've been a member since they opened, I haven't been there in months, but this place is awesome (and cheap)! Very clean, nice new equipment, and only a few meat heads around to make you feel uncomfortable about going to the gym three times a year;)

8.description: The Good: Low cost gym where the majority of people are there to get in a workout and not for the social aspect you see at other fitness centers. Plenty of cardio machines; solid selection of strength training machines and free weights. Front desk staff is friendly. The Bad: There is a small stretching area in the back but forget about stretching because it is always full of people lifting in the space and checking themselves out in the mirror. Plenty of TVs throughout the facility to keep you occupied during a workout but they choose the most useless stations - always HGTV, E!, infomercials. My personal favorite is the multiple options of religious programming on Sundays. I mentioned the front staff being nice enough but all they do is hang out up front - I never really see anyone cleaning or trying to enforce a rule or two to ensure everyone has a great experience.The Ugly: Next door is a Chinese Buffet and particularly in the evening, the smell eventually gets into Zip and it's pretty strong. Locker room is pretty clean overall but usually smells a little funky.

31.description: I love this place. Always clean, friendly helpful staff and never overcrowded. You cannot beat the price. Not a fancy full service gym, but they definitely have enough equipment to get a great workout.

34.description: I must say that I have been more impressed with the location.  Some of the kids are still there but it's not as bad as it was when it first opened.  My wife and I have been very very happy with this place so far.  Never have to wait for a machine.  The weights do get a little busy so I head over to the machines.  I get a good work out and go home.  Would be nice to see protein shakes being sold and I like the idea of the new referal program, well played ZIP!  Some personal training might be nice.. keep up the good work, you have made me a happier customer!!

16.description: The main complaint that it does not get 5 stars, really the price alone should get it 5 stars, is the temperature. In winter it was always too cold, and in summer you never know what to expect. The low monthly cost may be factoring in to the heating and cooling costs. So working out in winter can get you brain freeze--if you're breathing heavy. Whereas summer can have you dripping wet, and trying to cool off anyway possible.There's always too many channels with sports on. Lately if you want to watch sports, news, hgtv, you'll be in luck every day. I guess you have to ask the staff to have something decent on, there is no permanent setup to what tv channels are on  which TVs.There seems to be some issues with maintenance, cleaning, and too much idle time of the staff. Some weight machines need lubrication and the hand holds on some need to be moved back to the correct position before they start breaking. The insides of the lockers continue to get dirtier week after week, the gentle cleaning to the showers could be more often, and the fabric floors(especially in the locker rooms) need a deep cleaning now and then. With sometimes three staff at the desk, all just talking, things could be better if they had more initiative.All kinds of people go here at all hours they are open, so no one is really out of place. Just please if you go, work out, sweat a little, you can motivate everyone else. And remember it's what you eat that has the biggest impact on your fitness goals, so change your eating habits if you intend to lose weight and exercise as often as you can.

13.description: Originally horrified to join a gym, I gave in November of 2012 and have never gone back.I started my weight loss journey in July of 2012 and had lost 30 pounds prior to joining zip. BUT ZIP FITNESS HAS CHANGED MY LIFE FOR THE BETTER.Since joining, I have lost 90 pounds with zip (120 total) in the last year and few months. This gym is not intimidating, you will always find a machine available, and the staff is superb. I've gone less often in recent months as I've gotten closer and closer to my goal, but have started back up again.I love their 30 minute circuit and their stairmasters (there are 6 available). This gym is very easy going and it may get busy at certain hours but you'll always find something free. This isn't a gym for HARDCORE body building types. If you're there and are acting like an idiot, I've seen you and I've laughed at you. If you're going to be grunting and walking all over the gym covered in free weights, go to World's Gym. This is Zip Fitness. This is a safe place to work out and feel comfortable getting into shape.Seriously I owe these guys my life.

11.description: Less that 2 miles from us we stumbled on it going to the grocery store.  Huge parking lot for this shopping complex so parking is safe with no issues.  The store is clean and HUGE!  So many machines there is never a concern about going in and having to wait to work out.Friendly staff, simple showers and a no-nonsense no frills gym.  And oh... did I mention the great price!

39.description: Zip has pretty basic equipment but that's all you really need I guess. There are selectorized machines for each body part, which is nice. The free weight area has a couple of bench press stations (no decline station... wtf?), smith machines (no power rack... wtf?), straight barbells (no EZ bars... wtf?), and dumbbells... but only up to 75 lbs (wtf?). The setup is slightly odd to me as well. The weight machines are at the front of the gym, the cardio machines take up the middle, and in the back are the free weights. Why not put the weight machines and free weights together? There is a circuit training section in the corner which is kind of neat. An automatic timer keeps you on track while you alternate weight machines with cardio. Anyway, these are minor complaints for me. It's not what you have, it's how you use it! There is a TON of cardio equipment so you cardio bunnies will be happy. Lots of treadmills (w/built in fans!), recumbent bikes, upright bikes, step mills, Jacob's ladders, stationary rowing machines, and a couple different ellipticals can be found. A stretching area is in the back corner with stability balls, BOSUs, bodybars, and floor mats. The place is clean, the staff is friendly enough, locker rooms are spacious, and membership is quite affordable. The basic membership is $13.00 per month while the premium membership is $25.00. That gets you gym access, a Zip t-shirt, water bottle, tanning, and access to a kiosk which gives you workouts (good if you have no clue how to workout I guess). No group classes here.

37.description: $12.99 need I say more?  Ok, there really needs to be staff to help tell people to rack their weights!!  Or perhaps larger signs that read "FINISH your workout re-rack YOUR  weights" The high school kids are not bad, the problem is that they will not separate and do their workout , they have to remain in a pack of 6 guys all standing around at the bench press.  So there is no hope of getting a set in.  The early morning hours are the best time to go, no waiting for equipment.  The gym could use some more "plates"  so that you did not have to steal them from another area to workout.  i.e. If you need more than 6 45# plates on the leg press machine you need to grab them from the smith machine etc..  It seems like a very easy fix to buy more.Locker areas are very clean.

0.description: There's a lot to really love about this gym.  It's location, cleanliness, size, hours, and the fact that the majority of people that frequent this place are there to work out.  It's not a meat-market.  It's not a place for young people to hang out because they've got nowhere else to go, etc.  What you get is a LOT of treadmills and elipticals, along with a decent selection of machines and free weights.  The price is right.  Plenty of parking.  The locker rooms are very nicely sized. The staff is approachable and have ZERO attitude.  I can't stress enough how important that is to every gym-goer.  It's most likely the make or break for someone as to whether they will return to a gym.That being said, I feel with a few changes; this gym can be perfect.There are too many treadmills.  The amount of people on a treadmill vs in an area of weight/resistance training is 2-1 usually when I'm there.   There should be a strict "no weights allowed" policy in the mirrored stretch/abs/yoga area of the gym in the North/East corner.  Too many people leave the weight in there, or take up too much room for people who want to stretch/work abs/do yoga in there.  There should also be more dumbbells in the 5-20lb range.  Realistically, there are few people there who regularly work the heavier weights.  I have yet to see both sets of the 40-100lb dumbbells out at the same time.  Having 4 sets of the 5-20lb dumbbells will help tremendously with the need for those weight amounts.Honestly, these are minor issues compared to the value and amenities here at this gym.  Ditch the attitude and the hype of most of the big name gyms and save your $ and sanity by coming here instead.

38.description: ELDERLY LADY PUTS YOUNGER PEOPLE TO SHAME!  Well today I went to work out twice in one day (once in a while I do this).  To my right side was an elderly lady, possibly early 70s to mid 70s, and she was putting the younger people in their 20s, 30s and 40s to shame!  She was on the treadmill, walking fast at 4.2, not running.  She was on Lap 12 and stopped the machine.  She took a drink of water, and I thought "well, she's finished" -- now I won't look so bad (I was only on Lap 5).  Four laps equal one mile.  To my amazement, she turned the treadmill back on and kept on going.  I was very impressed with how she pushed forward and kept on going and going and going and going -- like the Energizer Bunny.  She left the younger people who were running on the treadmill or walking fast to shame.  I got off the treadmill and she was still going and going.  Wow!  I wish I had a trophy with me because I would have handed it to her!

27.description: Okay maybe a 3.5 star rating! I started going to Zip when they first opened and for the price you really can't go wrong.This is a no frills, no swimming pool, no child care, no aerobics classes of any kind - very basic gym. However, if weights, cardio machines and weight machines are all you need, then this is may be the place for you.Parking is always available, the staff is polite and the place is kept clean. I personally don't pay attention to how old or young the cliental is but have noticed on a rare occasion someone not following proper etiquette here. For example: not wiping down the machine, or staying on the same machine an excessive time just talking with one of their friends (but this isn't often).One thing that does bother me is you have to go in to cancel your membership and they will not do it over the phone. I'm sure they have some legitimate reasons for this but all they really have to do is have you set up a security question or password to confirm your identity.

32.description: Had membership with ballys for 5 years and let me tell you something it sucked....the bathroom smelled like dirty bootyhole and the environment was depressing ( you walk down into a basement ..feels like your walking into hell) where as ZIP its much more friendly...Staff members are nice I wish that they had more freeweights other then that ZIP IS CLEAN,FUN,AFFORDABLE, AND NEW.

44.description: It's new, super clean and there are no challenge to find parking. The staff is friendly and they immediately greet you upon arrival. The place is  inexpensive, has no frills and has a simple agreement with no extensive contracts to hassle with. I'd recommend Zip Fitness to anyone that benefits from having to go to a gym in order to get motivated. Zip Fitness gets the job done and I'm grateful that they moved into my neighborhood.

24.description: If you like watching HGTV, the CW or the Weather Channel while you workout, then this gym is for you. There's gotta be over 15 TVs, and you're lucky if one of them is showing a sporting event. Blackhawks playoffs are on, and only one TV at one end of the treadmills is showing the game. There's clearly interest from the customers, because every treadmill near the game is full. I've asked a couple times for channels to be changed, but it's just not worth the effort anymore. Plus, I feel bad breaking up the employees hang out time and flirt sessions with each other.  Value for the membership can't be beat and there's plenty of equipment, but this seems to be a gym for soccer moms. I just can't understand why they need to show every channel's week night drama sitcom instead of people competing in actual physical activity.

7.description: Overall a decent place for the money. The cleanliness level is good and the people that come here seem to be concerned only about working out. I wish they had more machines though.

40.description: As an avid gym-goer, for $12.99/month this is not a bad gym. It is mostly cardio/machines, with a rather small free weight section. The free weights are limited, but as long as you go when it isn't crowded, there is enough equipment to get a decent workout in. I can not stress this enough, timing is the issue with this gym. You have to go at the right time. Go too early, and you'd swear it's a geriatric gym. Too late, and its ridiculously crowded, mostly so by teenagers (who seem to have nothing better to do but stand 6 to a machine and watch mtv). So earlier is better. I don't have a problem with the seniors, except their lack of knowledge in gym-etiquette. Mainly being the old lady perfume that could choke a horse, and make obtaining a headache inevitable. Overall, the pros: for $12/month, the cleanliness, and the ease of parking, I give this gym a B, and am happy with my membership.Cons: I wish they would have more free weights, less teenagers.

30.description: I am so happy my friend recommended that I sign up at Zip Fitness! Back in Dec of 2009, I signed up at Fitness Premier in Melrose Park. I liked this gym because it wasn't as busy/crowded as Bally's and LA Fitness. That gym, however, closed in January of 2011. Before coming to Zip, I signed up at two other gyms. I hated it. I wasn't enjoying my workouts and the staff was not friendly. The gyms were also outdated and dirty. Zip Fitness is the complete opposite! I never worry about getting on a machine. They have a TON of treadmills and ellipticals. I love the amount of TV's they have, too. And $12.99 a month? WHO CAN BEAT THAT!What I like most about this gym is that I don't feel "judged." Everyone is there to do the same thing. Since joining my first gym in Dec 2009, I have lost about 120 pounds. I am very excited to continue that journey at Zip Fitness. After reaching a goal weight, I plan to meet with a Gym Genius to see how the free weights and cable machines work. I have yet to try out that portion of the gym. They also have a 30 minute circuit training area (I did this briefly when I was at Curves and I enjoyed it).Some other pluses: The staff is very friendly. I am always greeted when I walk in and they always say goodnight when I walk out. The bathrooms are CLEAN. They are maintained and kept up properly. This is a huge benefit for me. There is nothing more disgusting than wads of hair in drains, dirty sinks/toilets, etc. This place still looks like it just opened. They have tanning available, but I have not tried that. I want to also comment on the "younger/high school' crowd that I see here. Yes, at times, there are handfuls of young adults here. But they are ALWAYS working out. They aren't standing around socializing. They are on a machine running next to one another or lifting weights together. How can someone complain about that? I wish more young adults/teenagers would realize the importance of physical activity and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. It's better they are there than out on the streets doing who knows what. These kids keep to themselves and behave. I have never seen a problem. Overall, I am very pleased with Zip Fitness. Some of my friends work out at bigger chain gyms and pay ridiculous amounts of money... and for what? If I want a smoothie, I'll go to Jamba Juice and have one made there. If I want a towel to shower with, I'll bring my own. Zip Fitness is a top-notch facility at a BARGAIN price. HAPPY WORK OUT! :-)P.S. It's kinda cool this used to be CEASARLAND! Great memories there as a child, and now I am building new ones in my weight loss journey! :-)

1.description: you get what you pay for. this place is loaded with old grouchy people who like to take a nap while working out. Machines, especially treadmills are the cheapest and constantly  malfunctioning. I am a runner and the place has nothing to offer to semi professionals. Also the main attraction of the place is a horrible stink of Chinese restaurant  burned food, which comes from the neighboring China buffet, throughout the air vents. I  have reported this several times to the Zip management but no echo so far, after more than 6 months. Terrible place not worth any attention.

9.description: Feel very comfortable using this gym. I'm new to working out, never too old to start.

26.description: I'm a new and very happy member. This place is a basic run of the mill gym, So if thats what your looking for i would recommend you check out Zip, its kept very clean with nice staff. I love the fact that on every machine you can plug your headphones in and watch TV I get to work out and still catch all my shows. Over all a great gym.

25.description: Theres no pool or track but that being said the place is top notch. Good prices, not too busy, good hours, and friendly workers.

12.description: Very affordable, yet provides all the equipment you need. The staff is friendly usually. You might hear a few grunters and weight droppers here and there, but overall it's not a big deal. The majority of weight lifters seem to be either high school or college students. I wish there were better restaurants nearby.

21.description: The main complaint that it does not get 5 stars, really the price alone should get it 5 stars, is the temperature. In winter it was always too cold, and in summer you never know what to expect. The low monthly cost may be factoring in to the heating and cooling costs. So working out in winter can get you brain freeze--if you're breathing heavy. Whereas summer can have you dripping wet, and trying to cool off anyway possible.There's always too many channels with sports on. Lately if you want to watch sports, news, hgtv, you'll be in luck every day. I guess you have to ask the staff to have something decent on, there is no permanent setup to what tv channels are on  which TVs.There seems to be some issues with maintenance, cleaning, and too much idle time of the staff. Some weight machines need lubrication and the hand holds on some need to be moved back to the correct position before they start breaking. The insides of the lockers continue to get dirtier week after week, the gentle cleaning to the showers could be more often, and the fabric floors(especially in the locker rooms) need a deep cleaning now and then. With sometimes three staff at the desk, all just talking, things could be better if they had more initiative.All kinds of people go here at all hours they are open, so no one is really out of place. Just please if you go, work out, sweat a little, you can motivate everyone else. And remember it's what you eat that has the biggest impact on your fitness goals, so change your eating habits if you intend to lose weight and exercise as often as you can.

17.description: No frills, what you see is what you get place. Great hours, nice staff, good amount of equipment so you are never waiting for a machine, and clean to boot. For $12.99 a month it's no lifetime fitness but it fits the bill.

10.description: I have been searching for a perfect gym for the past couple months since planet fitness is out of my way. I had to narrowed it down to x-sport, a gym by my job downtown, or zip fitness.soooooo I ended up picking zip bc they have a price you cannot beat for everything they offer. This place  has so many equipment And it's not packed !! Also, joe was so helpful and informative. I look forward in making this my new gym! So 25 a month= awesome hours, lots of machines, and tanning ...

5.description: Matthew is a cocky kid. Full of life for 16 year olds. But nothing for adults. He is not a fair employee and even goes for embarrassment and smirks. He is employed at the cheapest gym in the area and it shows. Way to go MATTHEW!

35.description: Love love love zip fitness on Harlem and foster   I have been to other gyms as a guest and never ever felt comfortable. I joined zip when they first opened in August of last year and never felt intimidated or looked down upon. The staff is very very friendly and ultra supportive and never judge or look down on u. When I joined I was a heavy heavy 240 for a 5"11 guy that sucks. I am oryx to say that goin to zip 5 days a week since August has helped me drop 70 yes 70 lbs and it was all about the comfortablity of the gym. It has Avery diverse crowd ranging from  young adults to elderly people. There a very few "food" rats that are there to flex there muscles and just pick up chicks and text on there phones on equipment. Everyone is there to workout and no one judges anyone. Heck I have even gotten tips from members who have seen me doin a workout and wanted to give me a different variations. The activtrax workout program that is available to members was suggested to me by the manager when I felt I was hitting a plateau and asked for advice to help achieve a better cut and achieve my goal. I highly highly recommend zip to the novice like ,yield as well as the professional it has everything u need to help u achieve your goal without the attitude and judging of other gyms and for 24.99 a month( which includes unlimited yes unlimited tanning and can bring a guest with u every time u visit is awesome!)

19.description: I am so happy my friend recommended that I sign up at Zip Fitness! Back in Dec of 2009, I signed up at Fitness Premier in Melrose Park. I liked this gym because it wasn't as busy/crowded as Bally's and LA Fitness. That gym, however, closed in January of 2011. Before coming to Zip, I signed up at two other gyms. I hated it. I wasn't enjoying my workouts and the staff was not friendly. The gyms were also outdated and dirty. Zip Fitness is the complete opposite! I never worry about getting on a machine. They have a TON of treadmills and ellipticals. I love the amount of TV's they have, too. And $12.99 a month? WHO CAN BEAT THAT!What I like most about this gym is that I don't feel "judged." Everyone is there to do the same thing. Since joining my first gym in Dec 2009, I have lost about 120 pounds. I am very excited to continue that journey at Zip Fitness. After reaching a goal weight, I plan to meet with a Gym Genius to see how the free weights and cable machines work. I have yet to try out that portion of the gym. They also have a 30 minute circuit training area (I did this briefly when I was at Curves and I enjoyed it).Some other pluses: The staff is very friendly. I am always greeted when I walk in and they always say goodnight when I walk out. The bathrooms are CLEAN. They are maintained and kept up properly. This is a huge benefit for me. There is nothing more disgusting than wads of hair in drains, dirty sinks/toilets, etc. This place still looks like it just opened. They have tanning available, but I have not tried that. I want to also comment on the "younger/high school' crowd that I see here. Yes, at times, there are handfuls of young adults here. But they are ALWAYS working out. They aren't standing around socializing. They are on a machine running next to one another or lifting weights together. How can someone complain about that? I wish more young adults/teenagers would realize the importance of physical activity and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. It's better they are there than out on the streets doing who knows what. These kids keep to themselves and behave. I have never seen a problem. Overall, I am very pleased with Zip Fitness. Some of my friends work out at bigger chain gyms and pay ridiculous amounts of money... and for what? If I want a smoothie, I'll go to Jamba Juice and have one made there. If I want a towel to shower with, I'll bring my own. Zip Fitness is a top-notch facility at a BARGAIN price. HAPPY WORK OUT! :-)P.S. It's kinda cool this used to be CEASARLAND! Great memories there as a child, and now I am building new ones in my weight loss journey! :-)

28.description: They have a ton of machinery, a nice, helpful staff, it's really clean, tv's overhead to entertain you while you go.  All for $12.99 a month.  I can't complain!

3.description: A wonderful employee who deserves great recognition for his professional knowledge and personal kindness is Joseph (Joe).  I'd highly recommend his assistance to any Zip-Fitness member, as Joe will put a smile on your face with his kindness!:-)

33.description: Immaculately clean, helpful staff, and respectful people... I love it!My cousin joined and brought me as a guest.  I loved it so much I joined myself.  I don't feel embarrassed to go there because I am overweight.  Everyone is there to work out, period.  It's NOT like an X-Sport where all the beautiful people hang out to socialize and check each other out.. No.   Zip is full of regular average Joes just coming to crank a sweat and go home.  There are people of all ages and sizes and nobody judges anyone.  Everyone is friendly and polite and will gladly assist if you aren't sure how to use a machine.  Plus there are buckets of wipes everywhere and everyone cleans their machines.  I am so happy this place opened!

43.description: geezus ppl are harsh...its cheap its clean equipment works and staff members are polite...u really cant ask for more for $13 a mo.my only complaint is that sometimes its really toasty in there & i could use some more upbeat tunes to work out to :)

2.description: I love working out here and never feel outta place. Half of the staff seems very friendly but the other half seem annoyed all the time. Especially when you walk in and hand them your little membership card. Its not my fault you have to scan everyones.

18.description: Finally, after weeks of not having a leg press machine it is fixed again. However, despite the fact that the employees continue to lubricate the machine (for the seat to move forward) it is still extremely hard to move it forward. It feels great to have a 4-day weekend and go to the gym a little later than I normally do. The staff is still great at this fitness center, and the Manager, Kristen, is fantastic. I increased the rating again. Now that the kids are out of school for the Summer months I love going here when the Soccer Mom crowd isn't here. During the school year, they hit up the gym around 8 am. Now, it is not so busy so I can do my 2-hour work out without a huge crowd of Soccer Moms. Gotta love it!!!!

41.description: I love Zip. I've been to some nice gyms downtown and they certainly aren't on the same level as zip but for the price it cannot be beat. If you look at my restaurant reviews, I give 5 star reviews to $5 lunch places which certainly aren't on the level of a $50 dinner but a steal for $5. For that same reason, Zip deserves 5 stars. Ballys on Cumberland which is the next closer gym is always more crowded, more difficult parking, and more expensive. The only "con" for me is that the free weight section is quite as extensive as ballys. However, this also means there aren't as many meatheads around grunting while lifting. So it depends on what type of workout you are looking for. If you are looking for an affordable neighborhood place to do light lifting and cardio, this place is perfect. As a side note, I go most weekdays around 8pm and don't notice "kids" standing around talking. But quite frankly, I just got back from the gym and couldn't describe a single other person there. I am there to workout, put on my headphones and could care less about who is around me.

4.description: Zip Fitness is a great gym if you want to save money. There's a few things though that I wish they would change. A lot of the cardio machines are shaky & need to be replaced. Also they should consider moving the gym into the empty space where Burlington used to be. It would be more private and there would be space for more machines.

6.description: I love the club, but I am noticing that the bikes are all rusty and my biggest pet peeve is that why do they allow club members to carry all their belonging from machine to machine or leave their gym bags and coats etc near the treadmills so anyone can trip over them.. they need to enforce to use lockers.  Everyone else does.  May need to switch to export fitness instead.

22.description: Less that 2 miles from us we stumbled on it going to the grocery store.  Huge parking lot for this shopping complex so parking is safe with no issues.  The store is clean and HUGE!  So many machines there is never a concern about going in and having to wait to work out.Friendly staff, simple showers and a no-nonsense no frills gym.  And oh... did I mention the great price!

15.description: Ok,First off, this gym is well kept.  The cleanliness here rivals or tops more expensive gyms. Plenty of weight machines and normal treadmills.  The staff is nice and helpful. The rates fantastic .So why am I pondering joining another gym? Quite frankly I have had it with the rude and lousy behavior of the customers.  Though there are signs posted about cell phone use,  I cannot count the number of times I have had some brain damaged individual next to me blabbering on and on loudly enough where I could hear them over my iPod. Seriously.  You really need to ask Cheryl about her dogs dyslexia diagnosis or whatever while working out? Even worse people sit at weight machines and have conversations.... who cares if your waiting to get in it..... The biggest problem. There are some really epic super high incline treadmills I love. But there are only two of these popular treadmills.....that's right two. The rest are narrow cheap models....but there are about fifty of those.  Soo getting on these is a chore even on non peak times. And it's always a battle. People leave coats or ipods or whatever they can find to save machine.  Some stalk the two machines. .I was almost knocked over by one lady who had been lurking on one of the cheaper treadmills nearby. . (You can tell these people . They position themselves at treads near the high incline machines and walk at a mile an hour while watching the machine like a hawk then practically flying off the cheap treadmill once it becomes clear. )But I think tonight I saw the most astonishing example of idiocy at this place. A woman got on this high incline machine.   Started it ran for about ten seconds then proceeded to stand on the safety rails and talk to her boyfriend for twenty minutes. ..ok.  But no. .. she then left and followed him over to weight machine area all the while leaving the machine running and her stuff on it. She then came back.   And got a call that she had to take elsewhere . Then left machine again for fifteen minutes, running her crap still on it.Came back and did it again for another ten minutes. So I thought .. heck with it i'll do some of the weight machines.  Well the teenage wannabe muscle head squad was hanging out at and around most machines.  Not exercising.  Talking to their friends.   Great.  Finally found a machine that was usable only to have someone sit next to me talking on a cell phone. I left This could be an awesome gym. By if nobody is enforcing the rules here it's going to alienate people like me. .  Crazy people who come to the gym to work out. Not talk on a phone. Save machines I'm not using. Our use them as seats to talk to my buddy's.....I'm going to wait and see if it gets better. But I Will be keeping my eyes open for another gym in the meantime

20.description: I like this gym but their hours kinda suck. Open only till 10 pm on a Friday night! I just wish they were open a little later during the week and weekends.

36.description: For the $12.99 I pay every month, I am perfectly satisfied. I never have to wait for a treadmill or an elliptical. The weights do become a bit crowded by the younger groups of people - but some of the reviews on here are insane. Contrary to what gym-goers may have experienced, I have never seen a swarm of highschoolers running around the place amok. It's really not that serious.Clean facility, plenty of machines, and super affordable.

14.description: I've decided to edit my previous review because, based on feedback I received from another user, I've come to the conclusion that perhaps I was a little too specific with the details of my own personal gripe and it's led to individuals not being able to see the forest for the trees. Suffice it to say that my previously positive experience with Zip was tarnished because of the way I was treated during a payment disagreement. I felt that my dispute could have been handled in a way that was more agreeable to the principles of good customer service. Bottom line.

3.description: I love it, love it.  I had Marlena do my eyebrows years ago, and from a laser treatment by someone else I lost a little eyebrow and also it does fade in time.  So I went back to her and she did an amazing job!  I mean I don't even need a touch of eyebrow pencil or a color enhancement. It looks totally natural and also she created an arch so my eyes are brighter, it's like an eye lift.  I would totally recommend her to anyone.  She also teaches it, so you know that means a lot!I had to YELP her, nice job Marlena, THANK YOU!!!

1.description: Moved from Chicago to Arizona, no one does nails and makeup like Marlena at. Royalty of Beauty.Best place Ever!We make it a point to get our nails done at Royalty when in town!!!

2.description: As a full-time student, I simply don't have spare time to apply makeup in the mornings, especially for my brutal 7AM exams. I figured permanent makeup will not only allow me to sneak in some extra Zz's in the morning, but will also stay in place throughout the day without having to be concerned about raccoon eyes with my eyeliner smudging or wearing thin. I did quite a bit of extensive research in the Chicago area to find a permanent makeup artist who not only performed beautiful work, but was also affordable for poor college students like myself. The business is tucked in between a hair salon and a dental office (if I remember correctly) with plenty of free side-street parking, a rarity in Chicago. Although quite small, her business felt like I was in a cute little cottage. Marlena, the permanent makeup artist, is an adorable Polish woman with 13+ years of experience and is extremely detail-oriented, personable, with an all-around bubbly personality. Marlena made me feel very comfortable and in control by verbally explaining every step she was taking. The initial numbing cream she applied took approximately twenty minutes to settle in. She then asked me to draw my eyeliner exactly how I preferred and would allow me to view her progress throughout the procedure to ensure it was exactly the way I wanted it to turn out. She is meticulous with her work and would not proceed without my approval, which made me feel as if I was in complete control. Personally, the overall procedure was painless as Marlena did an excellent job of reapplying numbing cream after every stroke session. I would highly recommend Marlena to anyone interested in receiving high quality professionalism and extraordinary work!

0.description: It's been more than 10 years since I got my eyebrows tattooed and was fading away.  I was pretty nervous about getting another one since the lady who did my last eyebrows screwed it up pretty badly...It come out uneven...Marzena, an amazing permanent artist, made me feel very comfortable after I have expressed my concerns and took her time in doing the job.  She even initially told me to come back the next day to do the procedure, so we had more time and that I would feel more comfortable about the whole thing since we weren't rushing.  Not only did she do an amazing job with my eyebrows but she keep on applying the numbing ointment so I was not going to feel any pain.  She even went over it couple of times, so the color would stay in and that I don't have to come back for touch ups.  It's been a day now since I had it done and so far my eyebrows look amazing!  What took 30 minutes of shower turned into an hour one since I cannot stop looking at my self in the mirror!  I have eyebrows now!  :)  I would highly recommend her service and actually referring a friend pretty soon.  :)

58.description: It is 2 minutes from my apartment, and I always take a break like 2-3 months, then come here hoping for better food. And I get a stomach ache and leave disappointed. Point being, AVOID this place at ALL COSTS. Canned anything is not good. I saw the rubber steak too. How do you even consume that? This is worst than fast food. It really deserves no stars, but seeing as that is not an option, I gave it 1.

56.description: Live a couple of blocks away and go here @ once a month.  Have not had anything that was bad but have not had anything that blew me away.  You get solid diner food.  GF loves the crepes, and for me The Breakfast Burito is a better than average choice.  The dinners are @ $10 and come with soup, salad, entree, potato, desert, and coffee.  If you are looking for somewhere that you know you are getting a solid meal, Big Top will not let you down.

29.description: I really enjoyed my meal also Cathy my waitperson she was very attentive. I felt very comfortable with her and she made me feel very special

42.description: I've driven by this place a few times and always made a mental note to try it since it's not too far from my house.  I have lived in Chicago about 9 months now and have tried a number of other diners with very disappointing results... bland, tasteless, overcooked food.  I finally made it out to this place last night.  I was a little nervous trying it for the first time with family from out of town in tow, but trusting my fellow Yelpers, I was pretty confident we would have a great meal.  And Boy did we!!The place was completely empty when we pulled in at 7 on a Sunday night.  The service was fabulous from start to finish, the meals were served in a prompt manner and all looked wonderful.  The soups and salads were served at appropriate temperatures and quickly.  The bread was also fabulous.The meals we got were the meatloaf dinner, the skirt steak on toast (which was a nice roll), the rib-eye sandwich and the Rueben (based on fellow Yelpers reviews).  And I'm not exaggerating when I say that all of these both looked and tasted fabulous!!!  The steaks were cooked to order nicely, the fries were good.  Each plate came with a healthy tomato slice, lettuce, pickle and cole slaw.  The meatloaf dinner had to have been the best deal since it was served with soup and salad, a veggie and potato, a drink and a dessert, all for $12!This place looks rough from the outside and certainly has seen quite a few happy customers inside, but I still found it clean and comfortable.  Definitely an environment that I was not afraid to have my 2 year old.  Ample parking!  Don't let the weathered signs turn you off, this place is a true gem.Thankfully I think I have found our go-to place to have a quick, affordable, fabulous bite!!  We will be back numerous times over I'm sure and I can't wait since there were so many things on the menu I wanted to try.

23.description: I am so confused by the rating given to this place? Yes, they are open 24-hrs but they serve CANNED vegetables and bitter cheap lettuce! The soups are canned too and the fountain drinks are almost always flat. Their juices are the cheapest available and taste awful. It's not the cleanest of restaurants and the service is usually polite enough but not outstanding...plus their plates and glasses are very old and scratched and they can never get them as clean as they should be. The pancakes are descent and made quickly. The coffee is always very good.

47.description: Ahh The Top! Love this place. Its the perfect joint to stop in after a late night of having some drinks or after a gig. I honestly can tell you that once I left a wedding early because the food was so bad and my girlfriend and I looked at each other and said .... big top! The ambiance of an old school dinner. This place is just awesome. The food never disappoints.  My favorite is the corned beef the Ruben is amazing and great patty melts. Prices are very reasonable. The staff is always very friendly and prompt.  I for one have never had a bad experience here.  If you like American diner food, then you will love Big Top!

8.description: I ordered the chicken skewer lunch plate,it came with sautéed pepper,onions,pita bread and rice very good and seasoned.The chicken was chunks of white meat and very tender.i recommend this dish if you love chicken!

31.description: Im not going to take too long with this. I could go to Ihop for a better breakfast.3 eggs over easy with toast and a burger patty along with a short stack of pancakes for my daughter shouldnt cost me $38 especially when the burger patty wasnt a homemade. obviously frozen patties.

34.description: The food is great, very reasonable prices, great service and food came out fast. The waitress Kathy was very friendly and attentive. Don't let the outside fool you. It's a great place. We will be coming back.

16.description: This is our second time here and we enjoyed our meal more than the first time. The waitress is a sweet older lady who took very good care of us. My husband chose the spinach and feta omelet, while i opted for the denver omelet with American cheese. We were happy with the food and the price. Looking forward to our next visit.

13.description: The restaurant is extremely busy but the servers and cooks work at a fast pace to keep up with everything. We sat at the counter and got to watch the madness happen. Unfortunately, we also witnessed our waitress constantly yelling at the kitchen and accusing them of screwing up orders. Because of this, our breakfasts were delayed and my food was slightly cold (especially the hash browns). The waitress was also rude to us. The food was just okay - the combination of that and our waitress means we won't be coming back.

11.description: I have been searching for a regular place to go since my move back to Chicago in March. I finally had an opportunity to stop in a few weeks ago, and have been back a few times since. The food is always great, and the service spectacular. I waitressed years ago and had regular customers, much like the girls in this place. It is so nice to see smiling faces at breakfast! So happy to have found this place !!!!

39.description: We ordered the breakfast pork chop about a week back and that was humongous ! Tonight we ordered the dinner pork chops Greek style we were surprised to see not one pork chop but two on the plate! The next time server is always friendly! They have a great Greek salad also!

37.description: Big Top is average at best but better than some other places in the area.  The night shift  Waitress is very nice and accomodating as is the owner.  Once in awhile I enjoy a late night snack there.

0.description: Big Top occupies a special place in my heart. It's nearby, it's open 24/7, what more could a writer want? The service is super sweet, and really friendly. I'd love to strike up a conversation to learn more about their stories. The food is good and reasonably priced. I think their French fries are some of the best I've had in my entire life. I would highly recommend them. Double plus, if you end up at Big Top at any hour of the night and choose to play Bananagrams, no one will judge you. :)

38.description: I ordered a skillet and my other family members ordered giros. They were both okay, but could have been better. The cheese on my skillet seemed like it was kraft slices, and altogether the skillet didn't have much flavor. My family's giros had dry meat. I would come here again to give it another try and order something else. Their menu is huge..

51.description: i had a fish sandwich it was so good and the people and that were so friendly just one thing did not care about when it came to the service they do need lots more help it seems to me like the bose is trying to cut down on service help and that may hurt the business

27.description: Ah.maz.ing! If the diner food wasn't tasty enough the service would have pushed it over the top!! Our server greeted us with a contagious smile and warm good morning greeting.  We ordered...food was brought to us in about 15 minutes...i ordered the breakfast burrito w ham, if you do, you WILL NOT be disappointed.  The other person in my party ordered the pancake breakfast, his over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. Our drinks, coffee and Coke, never came close to being empty.  We ended up having our meal purchased for us by the owner and unfortunately neither of us had cash on us and when we expressed this to our server, without hesitation she said dismissed our concern.  Again, food YUMMO and service, AMAZING!

32.description: My dining experience at Big Top was delightful. Unlike competing diners in the area (cough, cough...Elly's and Sander's), the staff from the host to the waitress was extremely pleasant and made you feel at home. The food was delicious and arrived quickly. I definitely plan to return. They are also giving out calendars for the New Year, which was a nice touch. This place is exactly what an ideal diner should be like.

54.description: Great place for breakfast dinner or lunch. I took a girl there once and she didn't like the coffee. S time went by I found out she barely likes anything . I recommend this place

48.description: A neighborhood restaurant open 24 hrs wouldn't survive if it wasn't good.The menu matches the 1970s look - steaks, chops, chicken, fish, roast beef, pork, meatloaf... Probably no avocado salad or broiled artichoke hearts here.Service was better than the food.  Hot Turkey sandwich was institutional quality - cut from a turkey roll, canned "brown" gravy, instant potatoes.  Somewhat stale roll, but with real butter, not "whipped spread".  Ice cream had ice crystalsPerhaps if the menu had fewer items, it would be easier to maintain quality

44.description: This is the place to be if you want a good breakfast.There greek style skirt steak with eggs and hashbrowns and toast is my fav thing to eat. i am not a big breakfast person but this place is one of the best.highly highly reccomend this place it will not disaapoint you.

24.description: It is difficult deciding between 2 or 3 stars.  I decided to filter in customer service.This is a great neighborhood place.  Maybe it was just a bad day/moment.So read the other reviews and my previous one and decide for yourself.The Vanilla Phosphate was wonderful as always.I ordered Turkey with sage dressing, mashed potatoes and gravy with a side salad.I did eat the mashed potatoes, salad and drank my phosphate.  I tried but could not eat the turkey or the dressing.  The turkey was too thick for my taste.   Besides that I thought the turkey was chewy.  I have never had chewy turkey before.  The dressing made me sad.  It was mushy/too watery.The waitress asked how things were early on.  I told her and she offered to get something else for me.  I just didn't feel right though doing that..  She sincerely wanted to correct the problem.  Even offered a piece of cake I denied.When I went to pay, a different waitress asked me.  I told her also.Both said that the turkey is a customer favorite and they serve quite a few.So they were surprised.  Maybe just a bad day for them or me.At some point I will return and try again.  Just not the turkey and dressing.

7.description: This is definitely a small and cozy family diner! I enjoyed the food and service and looking forward to trying more on their menu! We ordered strawberry banana pecan crepe, panckakes, and a sausage skillet.

49.description: This place is a time machine to the late 70s. Just a classic greasy spoon that probably hasn't changed at all in the 40 or so years it's been open with the exception of a single flat-screen tv. The circus theme isn't any more than the outside of the building, so don't expect any crazy shenanigans inside.

40.description: I am a regular at Big Top Restaurant. The staff is very nice and everyone does whatever is necessary to make you comfortable. The food is good food. It's nothing fancy, but not second rate, either. I highly recommend Big Top Restaurant as a good place to have a meal with friends and family.

53.description: Always serves up a good breakfast. I usually get the Skirt Steak and Eggs and have never had a reason to complain. A friend of mine said they have the BEST Gyros around, so of course I had to check it out. He was right, they are much better than Nick's Gyros at the corner. Always get a lot of food. I usually only go for breakfast, have had a few lunches, lunch food is pretty much your basic neighborhood restaurant. No complaints though.

30.description: Waited for 20 minutes at a table with no menus no water and the waitress (Janet) did not even acknowledge my presence. It was not crowded at all and yet I was not even given a second look to make an order. I have been coming to this place for years and every year it gets a little bit worse. I think this was my very last visit. I am a very understanding when it is packed wall to wall with people and you don't get seated right away but this is just awful. God help the person who gets the waitress by the name of Janet.

46.description: Dear Big Top,I hate you. I hate you so much. Your food taste the way your exterior looks. You make me depressed, but i always come back for more. I'm not sure if the hash browns you serve are hash browns or just foam from the booth cushions. I'm not sure if the hot sauce you have is red water or actual hot sauce. I am sure of one thing: you make my insides hurt. I didn't think it was possible to screw up an omelet, but it is, and you did it. But for some reason, probably because of location, i always come back and you're crowded. Do you just serve me bad food? What am i missing? I got a reuben once, and i think it laughed at me. I just. I just....I hate you Big Top- NateP.S. I'll probably be there on Sunday.

1.description: It's hard to find something special to say about this little 24-hour diner. You definitely don't have to worry about what you look like when you come here, so if sweatpants and endless coffee refills is your endgame, then look for further. You're greeted by a host the moment you push through the glass doors. Today, I was offered the option of sitting wherever I wanted.I had the croissant sandwich with bacon, egg, and cheese, nestled up against cheddar-topped potatoes. I couldn't turn down a side of corned-beef hash either. Again, here I am loading up on food for no reason. The sandwich disappointed me.
