The croissant wasn't moist or buttery, but everything else was delicious. The corned-beef hash being the best out of everything.  I really wanted something from their lunch menu, and they must only serve it after a certain time of the day. My appetite was somewhere along the lines of a bacon-cheese burger with a fried egg, surrounded by french fries. I think with the breakfast items offered, that it would be better for you to order crepes or an omelet, both of which I wasn't in the mood for. The next time I get a sweet tooth, I might find myself at their doorstep.

55.description: Nice 24 hour restaurant.. Large portions,I take a lot of food home. Nice waiting staff. Eat there every Wednesday. Snacks, full meals priced reasonably. Comfortable atmosphere.. Meals around $10.00 Lots of stuff on menu under $10.00.

9.description: Man the place is bad havent been here in about 10 yrs they use to have Good food. service was so slow and there was only 2 tables including ours my wife got the pork tenderloin it had no bread at no breading as well was horrible she said i had the gyros plate that tasted like they dipped it in lard and the waitress all though she was nice was very absent minded started serving the new customers before she was done with us i would totally look elsewhere.

26.description: I usually get the corned beef skillet. Tastes good but one time an older waitress with shoulder length blonde hair gave me corned beef hash and said it was corned beef. It wasn't, she thought I didn't know what I was talking about lol even though I've been here before. Skillet was good however. And I've gotten the actual corned beef and yes it's pretty good, pancakes are decent too. Customer service is usually good just don't expect any silver platters.

25.description: I like this place's biscuits and gravy a lot. My wife introduced me to the plate, which her mother is supposedly a master at. That's why I can't say they're the best. But this is a really homey, comfy place to enjoy a great meal, and we really enjoy it.

12.description: Im not going to take too long with this. I could go to Ihop for a better breakfast.3 eggs over easy with toast and a burger patty along with a short stack of pancakes for my daughter shouldnt cost me $38 especially when the burger patty wasnt a homemade. obviously frozen patties.

59.description: If you happen to be in this god-forsaken part of the city after hours and you find yourself slightly less than sober order something from their limited skillet menu.

21.description: How can you dislike this place?  They keep their prices low and they serve good portions.  And they are open 24 hours.  The staff is understaffed, yes, I took off a star for that.  It took a little long to get served, but that was understandable because there has only been 1 waitress every time I've been there.  But, this is a swell place.  They have a lot of options on their menu.  None of it is amazing but this is a great bargain.

17.description: I am so confused by the rating given to this place? Yes, they are open 24-hrs but they serve CANNED vegetables and bitter cheap lettuce! The soups are canned too and the fountain drinks are almost always flat. Their juices are the cheapest available and taste awful. It's not the cleanest of restaurants and the service is usually polite enough but not outstanding...plus their plates and glasses are very old and scratched and they can never get them as clean as they should be. The pancakes are descent and made quickly. The coffee is always very good.

10.description: The soups are great the food is mediocre the ambiance of the place is old and musty the service is crap, unless you get TRIANE who is literally the nicest lady in the world! This is the place you go to a 3am when the bars and clubs let out and your drunk and want greasy diner food, other wise I would suggest another breakfast place!

5.description: Not bad at all! A charming, traditional Chicago mom-and-pop diner at just the right price. The old waitresses were so friendly. I got the gyro plate which was almost more than I could eat! They were gracious enough to substitute carrots for the fries. Food was good - didn't knock it out of the park, but was plenty delicious for the price. Lovely little place to try out if you're ever in the area and want something quick and no-frills.

3.description: Love this place been coming here since freshmen year of h.s. The food is so good. Prefer the desserts instead. They really have to update their menus there old and dirty.

35.description: Im pretty sure I've been coming here since they opened and everything is the same, literally! The decor, food, and awesome service and hospitality! I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. My favorite is the turkey melt! Always hot And delicious! They're also open 24 hours (except Sunday's) which is a plus when the grandkids are hungry at 9:00 pm and I don't feel like cooking.

19.description: It is difficult deciding between 2 or 3 stars.  I decided to filter in customer service.This is a great neighborhood place.  Maybe it was just a bad day/moment.So read the other reviews and my previous one and decide for yourself.The Vanilla Phosphate was wonderful as always.I ordered Turkey with sage dressing, mashed potatoes and gravy with a side salad.I did eat the mashed potatoes, salad and drank my phosphate.  I tried but could not eat the turkey or the dressing.  The turkey was too thick for my taste.   Besides that I thought the turkey was chewy.  I have never had chewy turkey before.  The dressing made me sad.  It was mushy/too watery.The waitress asked how things were early on.  I told her and she offered to get something else for me.  I just didn't feel right though doing that..  She sincerely wanted to correct the problem.  Even offered a piece of cake I denied.When I went to pay, a different waitress asked me.  I told her also.Both said that the turkey is a customer favorite and they serve quite a few.So they were surprised.  Maybe just a bad day for them or me.At some point I will return and try again.  Just not the turkey and dressing.

28.description: The restaurant is extremely busy but the servers and cooks work at a fast pace to keep up with everything. We sat at the counter and got to watch the madness happen. Unfortunately, we also witnessed our waitress constantly yelling at the kitchen and accusing them of screwing up orders. Because of this, our breakfasts were delayed and my food was slightly cold (especially the hash browns). The waitress was also rude to us. The food was just okay - the combination of that and our waitress means we won't be coming back.

45.description: Good old fashioned diner food. The service is great, the atmosphere is just like you would expect from a diner which is great for me. I grew up around diners. Love the burgers and chicken there. Just about anything you order is made fresh after you order. If you're looking to eat late on the north west side drop in and enjoy!

33.description: Excellent Eggs Benedict - perfectly done.  Very friendly server and staff.  Comfortable and casual atmosphere - you can wear sweat pants.

43.description: Went to Big Top for the first time for breakfast and both my husband and I were pleasantly surprised.  The Denver omelette and corner beef skillet were both great as far as greasy little diners go and the service was good as well. We even preferred Big Top over our usual breakfast place and will definitely return in the future.

2.description: This place was alright. Definitely old school. Food came out within 10 minutes it wasn't busy at all on Sunday at 8am but the food coming out that fast leads me to believe it's not fresh at all. I had egg Benedict for the first time and I personally thought the sauce was gross, my boyfriend enjoyed his meal. Not sure what he got but I guess it was decent. Nothing to brag about and probably wouldn't go there again. The server was nice but didn't go out of her way when she saw my plate hardly even touched she didn't bother to ask if it was alright. Which in my opinion as a previous server is not great. If you don't care to blow $20 on food you can make better at home than this is the place for you.

18.description: This place is pretty good. Service was kind of slow the Saturday we were in but the food was above average. I always judge based on the pancakes and theirs were good. I'll give this place another shot and it may just me our regular breakfast spot !

41.description: Late night breakfast spot in the neighborhood. Always open.

52.description: Great corner restaurant with fresh home made soup every day and delicious specials. Just enjoyed chicken rice soup , beef & rice stuffed cabbage with boiled red potatoes. It was delicious

50.description: I've been going here since I was 7 years old. Their omelette's and hash browns are delicious and homemade. Waffles, pancakes, chicken noodle soup and club sandwich are also one of my favorite things.

4.description: I came in on Valentine's Day with others and we all loved it! I ordered a chocolate milkshake which was great and the amount they give is so generous compared to other places I've been. I had the pancakes with eggs and everything was done completely well! There was hot syrup ready which was even better. Service was quick and friendly! I recommend this to everyone! I can't believe I hadn't gone there before.

6.description: I have gone into Big top numerous times to get their soup which i really like a lot. They have a chicken rice that is simply amazing....although i normally get my soup to go the other day i decided to dine in...  After dining in i realized that this place is very dirty and outdated..I understand the old school diner ambiance but having duct tape on most of their booths made me second guess why i was eating there.. The bread that came out with the soup looked like someone put their finger in it.  And finally the bathroom was just disgusting!!!  As far as the service goes , i have no complaints but I am just curious to why a business such as big top that seems to be busy cannot invest a little bit in their decor... Huge turnoff.

22.description: One of my all time favorite  restaurants  to eat at always good hot and fresh large variety  great soups fun and attentive staff too prices cant be beat as well love this place

15.description: I never heard of this place but one night my friends and I were out having a good time and we got hungry at the end. We saw on google that this place was open and near our current location. The venue inside was very pleasant. Well kept and spacious. The menu was just as good as well. I had a breakfast plate with eggs, pancakes, and hash browns. It came out really good and out in a timely fashion. My friends got a burger with friends and it was huge for a good price. All in all i am happy with this venue and the decision I made coming here. I will def be back.

57.description: Been going here for 20 years, mostly during the late hours! Servers are really friendly as is the owner. Food is a big step up from McD's but its no Morton's! With that said , it is one fine late night diner!

20.description: We had everything on our table, from mixed sea food plate, French toast, salads, cheese sticks, potato pancakes, banana splits for deserts and everything was equally bad. I'm writing reviews only if something is realllly bad or really good. Fish and everything sea food was from the freezer, meaning tasted and looked like it's from the box out of grocery store (only thing that was ok was scallops, as my friends says). We nibbled a bit of everything just to try it and most of the food we left on the table because it was bad.To top everything, we really wanted to be nice so we ordered banana split for desert in hope that we will forget how bad the food was...gee... It's really unbelievable that you can't find one thing that is eatable or tasty in this place (and believe me, I feel horrible by writing this review). It upset me, when I was reading about this restaurant on their menu, they are mentioning how they are promising the best,freshest ingredients...blah blah... Makes you believe that they really care. The waitress was unfriendly from the moment we walked in, I'm assuming because we were group of different ethnic background or she just had a bad day.

36.description: First time here, not sure why, we've lived in the neighborhood for years! Love, love, love the cheese blintzes, delicately folded and filled with delicious sweet, creamy, cheese that has orange zest in it for a very delicate flavor. Also had the potato pancakes which were crispy on the outside, yet soft on the inside with a side of bacon. Put sour cream and apple sauce on them, yum, yum!!! Both platters were served with tomato slices and canned peach halves, which I adore. We'll definitely be back!

14.description: I only come here for the corned beef skillet and chocolate milk. I also love that this place has looked exactly the same my whole entire life. Not many places like this left like this in Chicago.

3.description: I am a Northwest Sider who has Mondays off ... have you tried to find a decent barber shop on a Monday? It was with great pleasure that I took a chance on a Barber Shop which had yet to be reviewed here. Don't let the "styling" in the name fool you, Ron's is as good as it gets when it comes to old-school Chicago neighborhood barber shops. This is a place for Men, with the requisite reading material, and a mini fridge which is well stocked should you be thirsty. The shop is well appointed with Chicago sports memorabilia (especially the Cubs). Ron is , of course, a Cubs fan. Sox fans should not despair, however, as Ron has a "shrine" dedicated to the South Siders.Highly recommended !

1.description: There's a sign outside that says $7 buzz cuts, and unfortunately I've found such advertisements really indicate "you get what you pay for". I went for a simple crew cut on a day where there were about ten customers waiting for one barber. I can't say for sure if my hair cut would have received more attention on a slower day, but the cut lasted about one minute and was the quality of a boot camp buzz. I spent about twenty minutes at home with my wife fixing all the spots he missed. If you really want to support a local business, there are many better options in the area. I don't think this guy has any barber training.

2.description: Great place to get a haircut. Old school barber.

5.description: Inexpensive barber shop.I am not a total fan of this place.  Last time I was here, I asked for a simple buzz cut.  Ron did not take care to even out the sides.  Nothing worse than looking like a juice bag because of a poorly done haircut.I have never been so scared for my life as when he was shaving me with a straight razor while looking away and chatting with other customers.  Granted, part of the barber shop is the social experience, however I do expect full attention to be paid when using a straight razor around my neck, m'kay.So why did I give this place 3 stars?  Simple... he may be flawed, but this is one of the few places where you can go in this neighborhood for an old school barber shop experience.  Ron's is simple and to the point.  This is not a salon.  This is not a chain.  This is not where the trendy people go.  This is where your grandfather would have gone.  Plain and simple.

0.description: The best barbershop in Chicago, Ron is by far the funniest and entertaining barber and the ambience of the place is awesome beware Sox fans lol, highly recommend this barbershop check it out for yourself

4.description: Ok , here it is the real deal. Go there your first time, keep your mouth shut and take it all in. It is the best. Men are men and sheep are nervous as you hear the real deal on Chicago politics, sports and neighborhoods. Ron has been cutting hair for myself and my family for at least 25 years. He is the best.

1.description: A nice old mans bar with mafia looking guys. This place is a liquor carryout store and has good prices compared to the chains. Five nice statues around bar make this place different than the rest.

0.description: Best dive bar around ! Bartenders are friendly and the old men are great! Lots of retired cops and firemen come in here

28.description: Didn't even want to give one star. The waitress was super rude. She literally gave us a dumb stare when we ask for hot sauce. EVERY Colombian place should have chimichrri sauce. Food was over price and NO flavor. We paid 10 dollars just for soda because they did NOT tell us refills wasn't free. Very very very disappointing... Service and food

1.description: STAY AWAY & Thank me later. Customer service is terrible. 30 minutes to bring drinks out. An hour to bring out the food. When they bring out the food they bring my wife a bone dry steak. Asked the waiter to refund us the steak and did not. I won't ever waste my time here. Believe me when I tell you this place sucks. Meals are not worth $25.00 I promise you that. && they automatically include a service charge. I'll tell you this. My bill was 103 due to 15.00 being a service charge. Far from worth it. I would give this spot negative stars if I could.

9.description: My ex-wife decided to try this place to celebrate our daughters 21st birthday.  Once I knew the name of the place, I went straight to Yelp to read the reviews.  To say the least, I was shocked on the negative reviews.  I almost called my ex-wife to let her know how bad this place was.  Instead of calling her, I decided to give this place a chance since it is a relatively new establishment.  I like to make my own assessment of things.Upon arriving at this location, it appeared to be not as bad as described in the reviews.  Inside looked decent so it started off ok.  Upon sitting at our table which was reserved for 20 people, I made sure to let my family know soda refills and water were not free which the waitress said they were.  That was a nice surprise since the reviews said there was no refills on soda and you had to buy bottled water.   Soda and water refills were given to us in abundance.  We then ordered our food which came out at a reasonable time of about 25 minutes considering the place was just starting to get busy.  The food was not as bad at all.  My family and I would give the food a solid 3 out of 5.  My wife is Colombian so I know good Colombian food.  The cocktails were decent too. My family had Mojitos, Margaritas, Martinis and a few other drinks.  Finally, the music which my family and I truly love.  The music was part DJ, part music band, and for a strange reason, a private Mariachi band for a guest.  I can see where former guests have said the DJ speeds up the music from its normal beat.  This was the case when the DJ started playing but after a bit of time, the music was right on.  The music band played music which was nice but not the right music to start the night off with as it was very slow and soft.  Later on, a new band came on and played upbeat music which got the crowd dancing on the floor.  Initially, the restaurant allowed a private Mariachi band to come in and play for a private party.  It was nice for three songs but the establishment allowed this private party to take over the music for about 30 minutes.  This made the entire restaurant feel alienated as the Mariachi band was on the dance floor facing the private party.  I hope in the future, the restaurant management only allows for a few songs to be played to a private party. Lets talk about the overall service now.  Service started off ok between 7:00-8:30 pm but once the place was full, serviced slowed down enough where we had to remind the waitress several times for things we ordered.  I will tell you at no time was the staff rude or inconsiderate to us.  I feel had the establishment had a few more servers and bartenders, this place would have been able to easily accommodate all the people.     The place was also a bit warm especially when everyone started to dance. The AC system needs to be on full blast.  Overall, my family and I were very pleased with the service, quality of the food, and music.  I hope the owner of Congo reads my review and takes into consideration the good and the bad and makes any changes necessary to improve this place.         I was later told by a family member that a lot of people go to Congas to just dance.  I can see where the establishment would charge for bottled water vice free tap water and not offer refills on sodas.  A business would make no money if you  come to just dance and drink free water.  This is a business trying to make some money after all.         So would I return to Congas with my family?  Yes, I would.

29.description: It was a great experience and great music. We are turists in Chicago looking for a nice place to hang out while in the city! Great service!!!! A must!!! good Colombian food!!!

23.description: This place doesn't deserve a star. I would give the star to the DJ since this is the only attraction worth my while. The food was horrible and management need to treat customers with respect. I suggest he take some management class. My friends and I came in and got a table. I asked for water since we haven't decided what to order yet.  The waitress said they no longer serve water, they only serve bottled water which we would have to buy.  What type of restaurant doesn't serve water? The waitress kept coming back and pressuring us to order.  We noticed the manager was constantly eyeing us and kept sending the waitress back.  When we got our food, it was so bland and dry. I would not recommend this place to anyone!

5.description: Horrible service! It took a very long time to order a drink. Understaffed to handle a large crowd; many people were complaining about the wait. Unfortunately, there was only one bartender to serve the people.

25.description: Heard of this new place through advertisement at the Salsa Congress last weekend. So we went there last night to check it out since Tumbao and Coco's closed down, 3 of us, we paid $10 each for cover charge, dj was playing salsa. Walked over to the bar, ordered drinks then we ordered an appetizer from the bartender. I had to ask her if we could sit at a table. So we picked a table, waited for 1/2 hour then I went back to the bartender to ask about our appetizer. Then food was brought out by a young hurried man. He didn't bring plates or water. No one asked if we needed anything. Waitstaff after waitstaff kept passing us up.  Finally I asked for a box for the leftovers. Then a band started playing. The worst sounding band. The singer's voice had the most horrible piercing sound. We gave it another 30 minutes and had to leave. I told the host that the band was horrible and she didn't seem to care that we were leaving after we spent $30 to get in and $60 in drinks and appetizer.  Don't think we will return.

12.description: The servers were nice but not very attentive. We came with a large group. Our glasses were empty most of the night. Our orders took a very long timeto be filled. Some of them were not correct and needed to be sent back. The music was fun and helped with the long wait. Overall the experience was a disappointment. Will not return.

21.description: Looks good from outside but inside after sitting down sooooooooooo disappointing. First, not organized at the front and NO place to place your coat and NO coat check so be prepared to leave your coat in your car. Came later around 10:30 for the music and atmosphere but soon realized almost impossible to talk to people you are with. Why? Shrill extremely loud coming from very bad distorted sounding speakers. It never got better. Next, even though it is suppose to be Latin music, there is a very bad DJ, that destroyed all the songs by changing the rhytmn of all, yes, all the songs to a thump, thump or just generic boring house beat for all, yes all the Latin songs or this stange DJ sped up the speed of the song so it is racing. This DJ must not be Hispanic or is used to DJing at druggie places with screaming loud house or hip hop music. We all came to dance Latin but eneded up not even getting up the music was so bad. It is a sin to so distort all these Latin songs. Yes, DJ did the same things whether the song was supposed to be Salsa, Bachata or Merengue or Cumbia. We ordered drinks that came in thin, very thin, plastic glasses that pushes the drink out when you try to hold them.Waiter ok but will not look at table and stands over by bar looking at the wall instead of at his table. Thus, service is hard to get.Mentioned Congas to some of my Latin friends, who mentioned they went there and the bad thump thump and hip hop can of the beat annoyed them greatly and said they will not be back. One friend who is from Columbia said she came to the opening now expecting good Latin music but instead go this bad bad streamingly loud distorted Latin songs either or both sped up so not able to dance to them or the bad hip hop thump thump beat which is not Latin and we are not talking about reaggaton.

16.description: Came here to celebrate my daughter's graduation. We had a reservation and we were seated promptly. The waitress was very attentive and I truly appreciated her service. The food was not that great there was seven of us and we all felt the same. The music was great and the drinks were good too. It's just unfortunate that the food was not that great. They are very new so I hope the will make some changes to their kitchen. I would definitely go for the drinks and music.

17.description: Looks good from outside but inside after sitting down sooooooooooo disappointing. First, not organized at the front and NO place to place your coat and NO coat check so be prepared to leave your coat in your car. Came later around 10:30 for the music and atmosphere but soon realized almost impossible to talk to people you are with. Why? Shrill extremely loud coming from very bad distorted sounding speakers. It never got better. Next, even though it is suppose to be Latin music, there is a very bad DJ, that destroyed all the songs by changing the rhytmn of all, yes, all the songs to a thump, thump or just generic boring house beat for all, yes all the Latin songs or this stange DJ sped up the speed of the song so it is racing. This DJ must not be Hispanic or is used to DJing at druggie places with screaming loud house or hip hop music. We all came to dance Latin but eneded up not even getting up the music was so bad. It is a sin to so distort all these Latin songs. Yes, DJ did the same things whether the song was supposed to be Salsa, Bachata or Merengue or Cumbia. We ordered drinks that came in thin, very thin, plastic glasses that pushes the drink out when you try to hold them.Waiter ok but will not look at table and stands over by bar looking at the wall instead of at his table. Thus, service is hard to get.Mentioned Congas to some of my Latin friends, who mentioned they went there and the bad thump thump and hip hop can of the beat annoyed them greatly and said they will not be back. One friend who is from Columbia said she came to the opening now expecting good Latin music but instead go this bad bad streamingly loud distorted Latin songs either or both sped up so not able to dance to them or the bad hip hop thump thump beat which is not Latin and we are not talking about reaggaton.

10.description: I tried Congas out a little over a week ago on a Friday night. The food was great, the drinks were great, the music was great, we had the most amazing server (Velvet) and the dance instructor was sooooo awesome!! I wasn't really sure what to expect from the reviews that were posted on Yelp, but I'm so happy that I went with my gut and gave this place a try. I will be returning very soon. Do yourself a favor and stop by on a Friday night!

11.description: Great atmosphere, good food! Fantastic music to dance to. Salsa classes are fun. Good strong mojitos! I love this place! Best new salsa club in Chicago!

26.description: Thank you for responding however I'm not the person you are referring to. I am definitely not a musician. As I mentioned in my previous review that I am a business manager myself. Therefore I have to point out the obvious that management might really have a problem cause you've made it clear that someone other thank myself has an issue with the management at this establishment. Now I wasn't expecting to follow up on this but I decided to because you clearly have either mistaken me for someone els or come up with a story to try paint an image for someone that might come across this review and think it was done out of spite. Word of advise instead of feeding fuel to the fire. Just fix the problem at hand. Respect people and you will get the same in return. I can tell you that if your establishment was ugly and your food was horrible but the people that represented the place were courteous and respectful I would still give good ratings. Cause in all actuality the only thing that stands out is the way you treat someone. Have a wonderful and blessed day.

27.description: I heard about this place recently opening, I have been there twice already, both times got really good service, food was good, the music was great, I will definitely go back. Reasonable prices, nothing crazy. Good place if you like to dance.

0.description: Came here for a friend's birthday party (which Congas hosted for free and definitely had enough space to accommodate us all plus several other parties and walk-ins). We had family style dining and the service was outstanding. The owner is a very nice gentleman and did whatever he could do to insure that our party was happy and well fed. It's not easy satisfying a huge group of hungry Puerto Ricans. Congas serves mainly Peruvian, Columbian and Cuban cuisine. The food was good, however it could be improved and the prices need to come down. I'd love to see some other dishes on the menu. The female bartender was awesome and really made our drinks like a bartender should. The dance floor and live DJ were great for shaken' what ya mama gave ya. The atmosphere was good and the crowd is diverse in age and ethnicity, which I love. This is a great place to bring a date, girls night or have a party with Latin music and flair. The Northwest side of Chicago definitely lacks good, fun Latin spots, so I am happy they are here. FYI: They host different events for holidays and themed parties. There is parking in the back and they do take reservations.

20.description: My ex-wife decided to try this place to celebrate our daughters 21st birthday.  Once I knew the name of the place, I went straight to Yelp to read the reviews.  To say the least, I was shocked on the negative reviews.  I almost called my ex-wife to let her know how bad this place was.  Instead of calling her, I decided to give this place a chance since it is a relatively new establishment.  I like to make my own assessment of things.Upon arriving at this location, it appeared to be not as bad as described in the reviews.  Inside looked decent so it started off ok.  Upon sitting at our table which was reserved for 20 people, I made sure to let my family know soda refills and water were not free which the waitress said they were.  That was a nice surprise since the reviews said there was no refills on soda and you had to buy bottled water.   Soda and water refills were given to us in abundance.  We then ordered our food which came out at a reasonable time of about 25 minutes considering the place was just starting to get busy.  The food was not as bad at all.  My family and I would give the food a solid 3 out of 5.  My wife is Colombian so I know good Colombian food.  The cocktails were decent too. My family had Mojitos, Margaritas, Martinis and a few other drinks.  Finally, the music which my family and I truly love.  The music was part DJ, part music band, and for a strange reason, a private Mariachi band for a guest.  I can see where former guests have said the DJ speeds up the music from its normal beat.  This was the case when the DJ started playing but after a bit of time, the music was right on.  The music band played music which was nice but not the right music to start the night off with as it was very slow and soft.  Later on, a new band came on and played upbeat music which got the crowd dancing on the floor.  Initially, the restaurant allowed a private Mariachi band to come in and play for a private party.  It was nice for three songs but the establishment allowed this private party to take over the music for about 30 minutes.  This made the entire restaurant feel alienated as the Mariachi band was on the dance floor facing the private party.  I hope in the future, the restaurant management only allows for a few songs to be played to a private party. Lets talk about the overall service now.  Service started off ok between 7:00-8:30 pm but once the place was full, serviced slowed down enough where we had to remind the waitress several times for things we ordered.  I will tell you at no time was the staff rude or inconsiderate to us.  I feel had the establishment had a few more servers and bartenders, this place would have been able to easily accommodate all the people.     The place was also a bit warm especially when everyone started to dance. The AC system needs to be on full blast.  Overall, my family and I were very pleased with the service, quality of the food, and music.  I hope the owner of Congo reads my review and takes into consideration the good and the bad and makes any changes necessary to improve this place.         I was later told by a family member that a lot of people go to Congas to just dance.  I can see where the establishment would charge for bottled water vice free tap water and not offer refills on sodas.  A business would make no money if you  come to just dance and drink free water.  This is a business trying to make some money after all.         So would I return to Congas with my family?  Yes, I would.

19.description: Wow! What an experience, a GREAT one at that! Yes, you've read the other reviews & you're still hesitant to try the place. So was I, especially since it was a Father's Day treat with family and I did not want to disappoint, I didn't nor did the service or food. We went for lunch, had the place to ourselves but after an hour or so it was getting a good vibe. The service was good, very well attentive & sweet. The food was great, big portions & they all had great flavors. The only negative(4 stars) I would say is that once the place was getting more crowded our service declined & we waited a bit for our to go boxes & check. But it was understanding, since they only had one person on the floor. Hopefully another came in later cause it was jumping once we left. Will be going back for dinner. Many bands & great music was posted for the near future. My husband, dad & family had a GREAT time. You can't knock it til you try it. I'm glad I did

2.description: Great environment high and energetic! Salsa, bachata, merengue music and more! Went there on a Friday night with a group of friends, however we did reserve a table so we didn't have to have to wait!

18.description: Went here today to watch the Columbian soccer game. The place is pretty big and nicely decorated. The food is decent, some of it better than others. I would recommend the picado plate, ceviche, and paella. The salad and lomo saltado weren't as impressive. The service was good and the waitress was friendly. I'm giving it an extra star to support my Columbian roots.

13.description: Very disappointing!!! Would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone, especially to celebrate a birthday!I made reservations for my moms 65th birthday, 1 week in advance for 25 people. The manager on the phone asked if I wanted balloons set up and I said yes. I explained it would be for 16 adults and 9 kids. He said no problem and everything was good! Well... On the day of, I decided to call to confirm my reservations and to my surprise they didn't have it. I couldn't believe it!!! The supervisor on the phone said whoever I spoke to didn't write it down in the right spot...but he said don't worry we will make sure to have everything setup for you. Our reservations were for 6pm and when I arrived I couldn't even get inside the restaurant because the front door was locked!! I had to call my sister who was already inside to open the door for me. My brother and his family came after me and they experienced the same thing. I had to go open the door for them!! Even after I complained to the hostess about this. Ridiculous!!  My other family was already there seated and it was clear to me that they didn't have everything setup! They quickly put some tables together to accommodate us but they didn't care to dress the table up with white table covers and balloons the way they were setting up the rest of the birthday tables in the restaurant. When I asked to speak to a manager he was not very accommodating. Instead he said they didn't have time to set everything up because some of the party guests had arrived 15 mins before the reservations so they didn't want them to wait for their table and so they decided to sit them down. What a lame excuse!! And how nice of him to blame my family for arriving there too early! My family said they were in no rush when they got there, in fact they even sat by the bar and had a drink while they waited to be seated. Which is when the waiters were grabbing tables and putting them together. After we were all seated, the service was beyond slow!! Waited forever just to get a glass of water and place my order. The food came out at different times throughout the night. We felt we didn't even eat together. While I was having my dinner, others were still waiting for theirs. The food was not that good either. I didn't realize basically every plate comes with French fries! I was looking forward to eating my steak with rice and beans...instead I got dried up yuca and fries!Also, when I ordered a margarita, they said the machine broke down so I had to wait even longer for a drink! Overall, It was a very bad experience. I was very disappointed!!!  I am always trying to check out new Latin restaurant and I have nothing but bad things to say about this place. Never again!!!!

4.description: The worst place ever! Service was horrible! Over an hour and a half for our appetizers. Appetizers finally came one plate of empanadas were still frozen in the middle. Asked to talk to the manager he wouldn't come to our table. Finally came after an hour and many attempts of asking for him. He tried blaming it all on our waitress. Asked for water, side of rice and condiments took forever to get that as well. The pictures on the internet are nothing like this hole in the wall. False advertisement! Never coming back again. A party of 16 that drove over an hour to get here because their web page made this place look so great.

24.description: It is really hard to believe this place has bad ratings. I went last night and we were seated right away. The food is the best Colombian food I have ever had in this city. The live band was very entertaining, the staff was very attentive and the drinks were great. The prices are moderate, parking is found easily and there is so much space! Do not be fooled by these 1 star ratings, go for yourself and make your own opinion.

6.description: Where to start? Oh yes! I got it! New Years eve!We made a reservation few days before, confirmed at midnight the day before, and re confirmed on December 31 at 3 pm, needless to say, We drove for 45 minutes to get to this place only to encounter all the sidewalk iced, but even though we managed to get inside. After that we encounter the "hostess", she asked for our names and told us our name WASN'T THERE!!! But, I've work in restaurants, so maybe there was a mistake or confusion, I just expected an apology and our table, but no. The "hostess" told us she needed to talk to the manager, then came back and told us that the manager was busy but we could talk to the owner, we agreed; he appeared with a half way open shirt (seems odd for a restaurant owner, but that's none of my business). He told us that it is IMPOSSIBLE that I was confirmed because we didn't pay in advance. Well, if he had told me that when I spoke to him at midnightI would have made the payment,   so I went to be nice and told him I was the person that called at midnight  (he answered at home), he insisted that tenths of people called him at midnight so I repeated my name, and I even played the voice message they left confirming my reservation. He insisted that it was IMPOSSIBLE,  and told me that the person who left the mesaage was busy at the bar. So, he  just justified the employee, whether is his wife, lover, or a random irresponsible, sb as him. As I wrote before, I've worked in restaurants most of my life. I would have owned my mistake, apologized, and try to make it right, and if I couldn't make it right, I'd be really humble to admit my mistake and take full responsibility for it. I wouldn't hide, and certainly as a boss I wouldn't take a defensive pose. I'm very respectful when I go to restaurants, I don't like the concept "customers are always right", because that's not always true, but if you have a customer that makes a reservation and you screw it up, at least admit it and apologize! Anyway, I believe things happen for a reason. They had 2 security officers (which where very nice), and after we left I was wondering if they have those security officers because they have had troubles before. We called another place, they said they had a table for us, and we had a great time. Thumbs up for the other place. If I could give 0 stars or negative ones, I'd have done it. PS: I try to don't write bad reviews because I'm a firm believer that everyone deserves a second  chance. But not this place. This place doesn't deserve not even a try.

22.description: I live in Chicago for many years, with a habit of dining out, at least 2 to 3 times a week.  In regards to price, service and management Congas gets: Zero, Zero and Zero stars! Service: Went today to try the place as I have a friend that lives 2 blocks from there and I live 10 minutes' drive to to/from there, however the word I have to say is: DISAPPOINTED! We had a table with 4 people; the waitress forgot to place the complete order and 1 guest waited for nothing less than 1 hour and 30 min for her dinner to arrive. When it finally arrived, it was not even hot. Of course we asked for a box, the check and left with no intention to return or either my friend who lives in the neighborhood.Management: After we have complained about the delay and asked for an explanation, the waitress has informed us the manager would personally come to talk to us; however it did not happen. The manager never came to the table, an explanation was not given, and not even a deduction was applied to the bill, as a courtesy for our trouble of having waited for over 90 minutes for a dinner plate.Price: Be careful when ordering soda: There is NO free refill, l and each glass cost 3 bucks (I mean each 1/2 glass, because the other half is just ice). Food: I am giving 1 star for the food alone, because at least what I have ordered was good. The overall experience is not worthy. Chicago is a huge, multicultural and versatile city; go spend your money somewhere else. At Congas you over pay for the food and pay for a Greedy management and No customer appreciation! Do not waste your time and money there! Google for Colombian restaurants in Chicago and you will find better places within seconds.

15.description: Not sure what the service is like as we are here to taste the food and try a couple of the drinks.  They are fairly new to the neighborhood so they invited us to give them a try.  The food we tried was fairly good if you like food from South America....the ambiance of the place seems nice...its a little dark in here so hard to see how clean it is. The pistachio cake is very good.  So is the Flan.  The menu is hard to read.  I was glad to see a good turnout from the neighborhood and hope this helps them with their business.

7.description: This place doesn't deserve a star. I would give the star to the DJ since this is the only attraction worth my while. The food was horrible and management need to treat customers with respect. I suggest he take some management class. My friends and I came in and got a table. I asked for water since we haven't decided what to order yet.  The waitress said they no longer serve water, they only serve bottled water which we would have to buy.  What type of restaurant doesn't serve water? The waitress kept coming back and pressuring us to order.  We noticed the manager was constantly eyeing us and kept sending the waitress back.  When we got our food, it was so bland and dry. I would not recommend this place to anyone!

8.description: We went to congas for my sister's 40th birthday. We had a reservation for 730pm we were a party of 14. We arrived before the crowd. There were literally two tables in the restaurant. We had two waiters and it took us 1 hour and half to get our food after waiting 30minutes to place our drink and food orders. We had to send several plates back, no refills on drinks. We asked for a manager. Waited over 20 minutes for a staff member to come out to tell us the manager was not on site. A short time after the manager magically appeared. He accused our table of ordering incorrectly, stated he couldn't give everyone a discount and told us he was going to take this situation out on his staff! Completely unprofessional and poor customer service! I would give no stars if the site would allow it!

3.description: This place definitely doesn't welcome non Hispanic people. They were avoiding me and my friend at the bar to serve. And then when we finally got someone to do so they up charged us. $12 for mixed drink and $10 for shots!! Fun place to dance but I guess you got to be the right ethnicity:(

14.description: I had an An acquaintance that advised me about on an event being held here on September 26, A live salsa band that i had been listening to for years i decided yo give this place another chance for my birthday so I called one week prior and set up a reservation for 10 guests I was celebrating my birthday I called 3 days prior to the date and confirmed my reservation I spoke to the owner and he had told me where I would be sitting  at the time of arrival they had no tables left they had given my table away they try to accommodate me in a corner with a table with no tablecloths no waiters and waitresses this place is completely a loss don't even waste your time coming there the music is horrible the workers are horrible the people at the door horrible the promoters are the worst they lie just to get you in the door and is just all just a place with no class just disorganized, never again come to the dump.

1.description: Was here for pizza. It was meh.  Service was kind of spotty and slow and the pizza was overcooked.It may be a good place to get some drinks and watch a game but the food leaves something to be desired.

9.description: Stopped in after the NW Side Irish Parade and had a blast. Awesome juke box, nachos were good too.

23.description: Very popular bar on the far NW side of the city. Nothing spectacular about the several times that I've been there, and have only had beer. They offer food, but have never eaten there. That is next on my list.

12.description: What can I say about Tommy's??? Well, it's just a good ole neighborhood joint. This is a place where you can get decent bar food and run in to the neighborhood peeps. It's pretty comfortable and isn't usually too crowded. The beer is ice cold here! This is mainly why I like it. Definitely not for the trendy, upscale clientele. If this is what you're looking for, go somewhere else.

21.description: Not terrible, just an average neighborhood pub.  Food's ok, typical burger/fries fare.  In my experience this place is about as far from Chad/Trixie haven as it gets.  Reasonable to 'eh' tap selection.  I wouldn't avoid it but wouldn't go out of my way for it either.

16.description: Good pizza with a different sauce. My friend brought me here and now I'm hooked!

17.description: This seems to be the happy hour spot for our company, and I finally made it to my first one celebrating a few birthdays.  We came in through the back where there was a nice fire welcoming us in along with the sports channels on the tvs.  We collected a few tables for our group and enjoyed the $2 domestic draft beers.  They also have a bucket of 6 beers for $16 I think too as a special on Friday.  They actually have decent food or appetizers here.  The nachos was pretty good, and my coworkers seemed to like the mozzarella cheese sticks and the cheese fries.  There is a front area that has more of the typical bar look, but I like how comfy the back area is.  I have to say despite the good deals and the rest of the place the bathroom needs a major fixing.  There was water dripping from the ceiling in the women's bathroom and it wasn't clear.  So, the bucket looked like it was collecting dripping uring.  It was right in the middle of the room so you definitely had to walk around it.  It's really bad because when you drink you have to go to the bathroom alot, and you don't want to deal with having to avoid dealing with that situation.  Plus, it just looks gross.  Regardless, the cheap drinks will bring us back.

10.description: What the hell happened to this place?  Dumpy, owner obviously hasn't sunk a penny into this joint since 1985.  Seemed to have lost its character and most of the customers considering we stopped in on a Saturday night and it was a ghost town.  Sell the place, give someone else a shot.  What a shame.

5.description: I'm not really a 'regular' in this part of town, but I would hang out at Tommy's if I was. Good prices, pretty excellent food and never overly-crowded so it's easy to find seats.  Tons of parking outside and lots of TVs for your sports watching pleasure.

11.description: I read all the other reviews and am wondering where these trixies are?  I mean the term trixie indicates that the girl is as least decent looking.  I have not ever seen a good looking chick in here.  This is way more of a dive bar then some Lincoln Park douche/trixiefest.  The food is good here.  Pretty average stuff.  But the reason I come here is the beer is ice cold.  They must keep their coolers at like 35 degrees.  Not too many stools at the bar, but there is plenty of seating in the place.

22.description: Walk in anytime and enjoy being treated like an outsider and paying too much for a drink. A favorite gathering place of lunkhead sports addicts and their trixie-wannabees.

0.description: Tommy's is the place that we always stop to after work bartenders are always happy they always have a smile on her face and the popcorn is always fresh. Taco Tuesday is always a plus to stop in an enjoy a taco and a drink

20.description: Tommy hosted an after-party for his college alumni hockey team, and I was dragged along by my hockey-playing husband.  The team members were treated like local celebrities: the beer and pizza just kept coming!  Service was pretty good, food was fine, beer was cold.  What more can you ask for?

19.description: Tommy hosted an after-party for his college alumni hockey team, and I was dragged along by my hockey-playing husband.  The team members were treated like local celebrities: the beer and pizza just kept coming!  Service was pretty good, food was fine, beer was cold.  What more can you ask for?

2.description: This is the best and friendliest sports bar on the Northwest side good people ... nice staff and good food made to order!  ... cheers T

18.description: This is just a good neighborhood joint.  No airs or graces just a solid come in drink and dont be an ass or " out you pixies go through the door or out the window. "   Plenty of tvs for your sports viewing, decent pub grub, all in a no hassle environment.  A really good neighborhood bar.

13.description: It's is a great neighborhood bar. I have been here on many occasions. Met my Friends here for my birthday recently and it was nice being in a place that's not super loud, so you can talk without screaming, but lively enough that you feel welcome. Service is friendly and good! I like the chili too!

4.description: Good bar!

6.description: I came here to meet up with some old friends from school. It's a great location to meet when you've got folks from the Western 'Burbs and NW Chicago getting together. We were here on a Friday night but the place didn't seem busy at all. There's the bar in the front and tables in the back room. Because we were all catching up with each other and sharing stories, I was kind of glad it wasn't super crowded so we could actually have a conversation without yelling. Service was good, attentive but not hovering. The food is standard bar food. We shared the fries, nachos and buffalo wings. The wings were pretty spicy--just the way we liked them. The usual beers on tap and the margarita's on the rocks were pretty good too. Lots of TV's for the sports fans. Hubsbie had been here before and was kind of sad that I didn't invite him out with us. Sorry hon, it was my turn to check this place out!

15.description: Tommy's is a full bar with menu (simple fried pub grub).  Dim lighting keeps the place inviting and nostalgic.  The pub-style dining sets with the wide open glass doors in the front and additional outdoor seating might have us declare this location as the staple for after work drinking.  I don't remember the type of music playing but there are a few television sets overhead.  The service was considerably quick, however, both my drinks tasted like water (vodka cranberry).  My buddies and I will have to come back for a second round of drinks and to, this time, order the grub.

7.description: Swung into Tommy's after the Bears game yesterday to grab a bite to eat on our way home.  I have been there before and loved it so....why not.So, we got there and it is a great Chicago hangout and everyone there was great!   I was disappointed that they no longer had Polish Sausage on the menu but I got the Cheesy Beef and it was delicious.  Could have used some peppers but it was still good.  My buddy had the steak sammich and LOVED it.  Great place and will come again for sure when back in Chicago.Totally a place I would hang out at if I lived near there.

8.description: Once a year my uncle drags me to his "guys from the block" party somewhere on the "oh god how are we still even in the city" far Northwest Side. This year we came to Tommy's. It was a decent place. The entire back room was blocked off for a party that still hadn't come in by 11pm, so we were stuck in front. The beers on tap are decent for a small neighborhood place. It feels like the kind of place where you go every weekend if you live in the neighborhood. The prices were good. My bf ordered food and said it was very good, and the kitchen is open reasonably late. It was only crowded because we were a huge group and the back was closed. The bathroom was a little weird and a single, but it was clean. I wouldn't make this my regular place, but it wasn't bad for a convenient meeting place for people coming off 90 to get together for a pleasant evening.

3.description: Nice local bar i love to go. Always the chill spot to go with me and my buddies after work and what not. Couple beers and pool always a great time. Stay golden tommys

14.description: It was a Thursday night, prof let out us out early. I'm starving, and I need a beer. So we came to Tommy's. Their parking lot is a bit tricky to get into, especially due to the huge snow dump. We get in, and they're playing sports on the tube, and old Irish songs on the radio. There were the office folks there finishing off happy hour. But after they left it got pretty quiet. I get a cajun chicken sandwhich with fries and a blue moon. Hubby get's a cheeseburger and fries and Guinness. They've changed their menu included more food. Will definitely go back. Need to get more people out there cause after 9:30 on a Thursday a bar should be more crowded.

58.description: Ok, I really liked this place.  Of the suburban places I've been to, Tamales in highland park is still my favorite but this place is second for sure.  In fact, they are probably tied....I like the salsa, it is a house made and unique.  I loved it.  But I love Tamale's salsa too and Tamale's takes itGuacamole is totally awesome at Mom's Old Recipe and beats Tamales.  We had a combo app that was solid and we enjoyed it.I had mole....In order of my favorite MolesTarascas in the cityTamalesMom's old recipe some mexican joint on clark st which I can not recall the name.All other mexican places I've tried have mediocre mole not worth trying.  hubbie had carne asada and thought it was goodkids enjoyed their quesadillas over the ones at tamales...but they r 5 & 7...when they get older, i bet that would change to tamalesi have never been to frontera...hence it is not making my list

56.description: Love the food.  Love the staff.  Love the owners.  Best gauc in town!  If you are looking for a great place to have fish taco look no farther.  The fish taco are divine.

29.description: So good. Just tried for first time. Portions are huge, very fresh and delicious. We had steak burrito, steak fajitas and mango margarita.... All were awesome

42.description: We stumbled on Mom's by accident. The hubs and I were craving some Mexican food and were not really feeling TBK (Taco Burrito King), which is near the area. After searching on Yelp, we discovered Mom's in Norwood Park. What a gem!There was not much around it so I wasn't expect it to be so lively! As we walked in we were greeted by live music and the place was packed! A lot of large groups and families, which was nice to see. Loved the ambiance.The chips were freshly baked and the salsa - it had an interesting twist to it. I might be interpreting it differently but it was almost as if it had some asian influence - reminded me of a hint of kimichi spice). I ordered the Tilapia tacos and the hubs ordered Skirt Steak tacos. BEST steak tacos I've tried in a long time - hands down. The fried tilapia I thought was okay, a little overpowering. It was a large portion, but it almost felt like I was eating the fried tilapia by itself and the tortilla, seasonings, sauce got lost somewhere. The rice was good though - fluffy and flavorful.It looked like everyone around me had a margarita so I ended up ordering a House Margarita on the rocks myself and it was fantastic- I ended up ordering two! And boy were they strong! By the time the bill came around we were so surprised to find out Friday nights were $5 Margs. (I should have ordered three!)So excited to have found Mom's- a great Mexican restaurant in the area with good food, tasty drinks, and fun atmosphere.

23.description: We drive by this quant mexican restaurant everyday and we always see people inside. So we decided to give it a try. We started with the guacamole and chips and salsa, which were very delicious. However, here comes the bad part. Firstly, I thought it was strange how there weren't many latinos in this restaurant. And all through the main course I realized why. My father ordered the steak enchiladas with mole that tasted slightly bitter. My mother ordered the steak taco dinner, and the steak tasted almost like tongue or lengua. It was very chewy and had a funny taste. I ordered the enchilada and burrito combo, my enchilada was just cheese and was good (this is very hard to mess up) my burrito was ground beef and tasted as if it was from a microwave package. Overall the rice and beans were average, the portions were very small for the price. Three dinners and one horchata cost $50.00. Everyone who thinks this is good authentic mexican food has never had it. If you're truly seeking good mexican food give Garcias on Western a try. In some, the food was mediocre and over priced.

47.description: This was better than expected. It failed the native test, ie how many Mexicans are eating there (none). I got the mole enchiladas and the mole sauce was fantastic. It was sweet and rich. As for the service, they were attentive but not overbearing. They appeared exactly when we were out of something or done.We will be coming back again!

8.description: What a gem! Enchiladas trio is absolutely delicious.  The flavors all mingle closely to provide a fantastic authentic experience in your mouth. Mmmm. Servers are so friendly and warm. Very nice spot.

31.description: Delicious salsa and guacamole, enchiladas were yummy and service was great. I would totally come back.

34.description: There's plenty of Mexican places to visit over this one. We picked up an online order and the place seemed nice. My gf and I appreciated some of the art. The staff seemed nice and were quick to get us our food. However, I got enchiladas which were not very good. Plus, we asked for some things to be done which they seemed to just disregard. My gf liked her tacos, but I don't think they were anything to write home about. And their enchiladas were a joke. They were closer to Chinese food than Mexican. Also, it took us some time to find their menu online, and it seems to need some updating. The price definitely wasn't appropriate for what we received.

16.description: Delicious salsa and guacamole, enchiladas were yummy and service was great. I would totally come back.

13.description: This place is absolutely amazing..We've eaten at many Mexican resturants throughout the United States and this place is definitely on my top 3 lists....

11.description: There are some oddities to the place. --One half of the restaurant has different seating decor than the other--Our seating was metal patio seating with brightly colored cushions.--The menu was 3 looseleaf printed pages on white printer paper--Star seating in the windows for those that want to be seen, although it's a quiet stretch of Milwaukee avenue.--wall art that really didn't have a theme or looked good.But--service was great, super friendly. I never requested, but they offered to make a kids meal for my son. cheese quesadilla, beans and rice. --some of the menu items seemed very unique and not at all what I've found at local mexican taco places. For example:  pasilla pepper cranberry red wine sauce, bean sauces, house potatoes made with jalapenos and onions.--Ice cold milk creamy horchata--strong flavorful margaritas served on the rocks--smaller portions so we don't feel overstuffedI ordered the Enchiladas Verdes Con Frijoles De Olla, Chicken. Two folded corn tortillas topped with a green tomatillo sauce, romaine lettuce, red onion, sour cream, avocado and Mexican grated cheese. Served with pinto beans. I found it to be a refreshing take on enchiladas. the romaine lettuce added some cool freshness and texture and the green tomatillo sauce was well-flavored. Food is a solid 3, Service elevates it to a 4. Nice place.

39.description: Moms Old Recipe is a unique, Mexican restaurant that offers wonderful food, enthusiastic employees and a warm and inviting atmosphere. The owners, Alena and Ana are awesome! Their sister Lety, is a wonderful waitress and makes your meal experience great. I would highly recommend this restaurant to any authentic Mexican food-loving person!

37.description: disregard my last review. I left a great review for this place that should have actually been for Tuxpan's I just called and asked for 3 steak tacos with sour cream and cheese. I was going to pick up since they dont deliver. she offered me a special, 3 tacos with rice and beans. I asked how much, she said 15. I asked for how much just for the tacos and she said it would be the same....? Confused I ask "15 dollars for just 3 steak tacos?" she then proceed to tell me something about the meal special and it would be the same because the tacos are "3 dollars a piece plus .75 for sour cream and cheese". I told her I didn't want the special, just the tacos.Aren't specials suppose to be the better deal...? she then lowered me to 11 dollars for the 3 tacos. I just ended up cancelling. I never had their food and unsure if I want too.

0.description: Strangely delicious! If you want some slighly upscale Mexican cusine in a casual spot, this is the place to go! All the food tastes fresh, flavorful, and more importantly, homemade! I love the food! I took off one star because the menu is not as large as most Mexican restaurants. However, they make up for it with outstanding dishes.

38.description: This place is a diamond in the rough.  You could never tell from the signage what Mexican feast awaits you within the tastefully appointed dinning room.  My wife and I dropped in early as they opened for Valentines Day supper.  The service was outstanding only to be outdone by the entrée's delivered to the table.  Portions are generous but by no means oversized.  The Carne Asada was worth every penny.  We will be back!

51.description: I thought the ambience was wonderful the waitresses were very very friendly very accommodating. The food was out of this world I had the steak quesadillas to die for and my friend had the shrimp tacos that were out of this world. I would go back again and again and again! In the hot chocolate is a must!

27.description: I go here all the time.  Ther service is fantastic, if you go at odd hours it's even better.  When my daughter was a baby they would bring her a special plate of avocado and crackers.  I never asked for it, they just brought it  : )From the outside the storefront blends into a long stretch of karate shops and dentist offices.  Inside is lovely.  The quality of food though is what makes it really special.  I spend a lot of time in the Fulton Market and I'll put it out there and say Mom's can go up against some of the best.  It's not cheap but the food is fresh and prepared with culinary precision not found in most neighborhood mexican joints.I'm also really happy this place is walking distance from my house because the margaritas are yummy.

32.description: Been my favorite  Mexican  restaurant  for at least 10 years everything's  made fresh 100prcnt  real authentic  Mexican  food here family owned always at least one of the 3 sisters are cooking in the kitchen and even the mother st times there food isnt only delicious  but there food looks like art pieces  when they serve it and its good quality and made with love

54.description: There are some oddities to the place. --One half of the restaurant has different seating decor than the other--Our seating was metal patio seating with brightly colored cushions.--The menu was 3 looseleaf printed pages on white printer paper--Star seating in the windows for those that want to be seen, although it's a quiet stretch of Milwaukee avenue.--wall art that really didn't have a theme or looked good.But--service was great, super friendly. I never requested, but they offered to make a kids meal for my son. cheese quesadilla, beans and rice. --some of the menu items seemed very unique and not at all what I've found at local mexican taco places. For example:  pasilla pepper cranberry red wine sauce, bean sauces, house potatoes made with jalapenos and onions.--Ice cold milk creamy horchata--strong flavorful margaritas served on the rocks--smaller portions so we don't feel overstuffedI ordered the Enchiladas Verdes Con Frijoles De Olla, Chicken. Two folded corn tortillas topped with a green tomatillo sauce, romaine lettuce, red onion, sour cream, avocado and Mexican grated cheese. Served with pinto beans. I found it to be a refreshing take on enchiladas. the romaine lettuce added some cool freshness and texture and the green tomatillo sauce was well-flavored. Food is a solid 3, Service elevates it to a 4. Nice place.

48.description: From the moment we walked in .. Great experience.  Greeted and seated quickly. The appetizers were fresh and delicious as my photos show. Our dishes were outstanding ...for appetizers We had a combination plate of mini flautas, quesadillas and huaraches .. Our entrees consisted of Chicken tostadas and cheeses enchiladas. Our doses were presented top notch but the overall all flavors were fabulous ...The salsa is sooo delicious. This is a home recipe restaurant. Hence the name. I highly recommend the drive here and you will comeback for sure!!!!

44.description: I have come to realize I have a thing for chef owned, independent operators. I sit here and watch the owner do everything, she loves it and she cares. Today she is my waitress while keeping an eye on the kitchen through the four by four window towards the back. She also makes a hell of a margarita. As I sit and await my skirt steak combo I will tell you that the shrimp ceviche salad I just enjoyed may have been the best tasting thing ever to meet my tongue . The crisp veggie amuse and the chips and salsa are as great and unique as this place itself.Come on northwest corridor of the city, this is the place for Mexican. #eatlocaleatgreatfood

24.description: Thanks to Yelp, we found a wonderful, non-fast food, mexican restaurant!  We went on a Sunday evening for an authentic Mexican meal.  We had the Chile Relleno de Picadil.  This is the first Chile Relleno that we had that had a cream sauce.  The meat filling was spectacular.  Our waiter, Ernesto, said this cream sauce is common in Mexico around the Christmas holidays.  The Taco Trio was also quite excellent,  The fish taco was a breaded Tilapia with a light slaw base,  the steak taco was a little chewy but wonderfully flavorful,  The chicken was delightful.  It was just enough food for a satisfying meal.  A bit on the pricey side but I'll pay a bit more for really fresh food!  This restaurant has plenty of street parking.  Do not park in the bank parking lot next door, though.  The decor is warm and inviting.

7.description: Why has it taken so long for me to discover this place?! It's AWESOME!!! The ambiance is certainly nothing to write home about, but the food (and drinks) are awesome. Enjoy some killer margaritas and amazing, HUGE platters of food. I tried the enchilada trio and all three varieties were outstanding. Service is attentive and friendly, and prices are very reasonable especially considering the quality and value of the meal. I can't wait to go back again very soon!

49.description: Outstanding food and atmosphere.  Previous Yelp reviews are accurate.  First of all the salsa is unbelievable.  I am going to attempt to reproduce it at home.  It has a great smoky flavor which can only come from roasting ingredients whole under a broiler or on a burner.  I want to also guess that they use chipotle peppers instead of jalapeno or serrano which also added to the smoky flavor.  Then they pureed the ingredients in a blender.  Tasted like smoky, silky tomato soup.  Started off with the guacamole.  Deliciously creamy with just a hint of heat.  Good size portion too.  We had to have our chip basket filled 3 times!  Main dishes included the Pollo de Mole.  Again, wonderful complex flavor: smoke, chocolate, sweet, savory, bitter.  Excellent.  Wife had shrimp quesadillas which she loved.  We had several house margaritas which were also excellent, if a little on the sweet end of the spectrum.Prices are somewhat higher than taqueria-type places but far below what one might expect to pay at Frontera Grill.  Great food.  Great value.

40.description: Food is excellent and the atmosphere is really fun. Service is excellent margaritas are really really great and so was the guacamole. I have the fish tacos I would definitely try this place out.

53.description: I have passed by here several times and wondered how it was but never stopped!  Then early this week, my friend said "Let's go to that little Mexican restaurant down the block."  Walking in, I was impressed with the decor and the server who greeted us was very friendly.Our food was delicious and was served hot and plated beautifully for presentation!Now, I was going to leave this out but I believe it is important... My friend had the misfortune of finding a fruit fly in her food.  We questioned if we should leave or stay.  We opted to stay as we know that in the food industry unforeseen things happen and it wasn't a dirty insect that would make us believe the place was unsanitary.  We politely showed the waitress and she was more than apologetic.  She offered to take it off the bill but we asked that another plate be made.  When the bill came, she comped the entree altogether and offered us complimentary dessert which we declined.We will definitely be back and believe it would be a great place to have a nice event such as a birthday party or baptismal party.Check it out!  The Norwood Park/Jeffferson Pk doesn't have much to choose from for good eating so, stop passing this place up and stop in!

30.description: The three were delicious and surprisingly filling considering the small portions. I decided to add some dessert so I had a coconut ice cream with some masa crumbs which I found very tasty. Overall we had a great time at Topo and I forgot to say that the staff was very friendly.

46.description: Best steak fajitas I've had in years!  Shrimp in butter garlic sauce was perfectly done.  Smiling friendly family waitstaff.

1.description: Salsa was very good.  Escabeche was perfect.  Margaritas were tasty, may come across as a little weak but be warned,  they have an after affect!  Vegeterian enchiladas with mole sauce were amazing!  Mole sauce was authentic! Rice and beans (frijoles a la holla)  was good and authentic as well. Camarón a la diabla was tasty but only got 5 shrimp.  Something to consider if you have a big appetite. Staff is friendly. Waiter was nice and joked with us a bit.   Restaurant is nicely decorated.  Feels like I'm at a restaurant back home in Michoacan.  Cloth napkins,  water goblets and clean white table clothes.  Over all,  highly recommended.  I'll be back to try some of the other dishes and more margaritas!

55.description: Mom's Old Recipe Mexican Restaurant is our new favorite for Mexican food on the northwest side of Chicago.  My husband and I order carryout from Mom's at least once a week.  The staff are friendly and the food is delicious.  We drove by Mom's for quite a few years before finally venturing inside to check it out.  What a surprise!  The guacamole is excellent and one of our favorites is the steak quesadillas.  We ate at the restaurant recently with some friends and when the margaritas were served, they just didn't taste like they usually do.  We continued to drink them anyway but our server decided to have new ones made for all of us.  It was a very nice gesture and the new margaritas were as good as ever.  Highly recommend for authentic Mexican food.

9.description: Delicious. Enjoyed the food and the margaritas. The place is bigger than it appears from the outside. The crowd very mixed. All age groups and different ethnicities.

26.description: Worth the schlep!  Convivial atmosphere, delicious food.  The service is very friendly but a bit slow.  The huarachitos were yummy, and the camarones al Diablo are fantastic. The wine list is a bargain!  We'll be back!

25.description: Tacos are amaaaaazing! Great service! Friendly services. I eat here couple of times a week and crowd is mixed including families dinning together. Diamond in dirt!

12.description: Thanks to Yelp, we found a wonderful, non-fast food, mexican restaurant!  We went on a Sunday evening for an authentic Mexican meal.  We had the Chile Relleno de Picadil.  This is the first Chile Relleno that we had that had a cream sauce.  The meat filling was spectacular.  Our waiter, Ernesto, said this cream sauce is common in Mexico around the Christmas holidays.  The Taco Trio was also quite excellent,  The fish taco was a breaded Tilapia with a light slaw base,  the steak taco was a little chewy but wonderfully flavorful,  The chicken was delightful.  It was just enough food for a satisfying meal.  A bit on the pricey side but I'll pay a bit more for really fresh food!  This restaurant has plenty of street parking.  Do not park in the bank parking lot next door, though.  The decor is warm and inviting.

59.description: We just moved into the neighborhood and discovered this place right away.  The food is delicious and the service is decent.  The fare is upscale classic Mexican.  We are always looking for an excuse to go and get dinner here.  My only criticism is that the beer selection is quite limited however the margaritas are good.

21.description: Top notch! This is our go-to Mexican restaurant. The service, the food, and definitely the margaritas keep us going back time and time again! Best fajitas around!

17.description: Did not like the food. Had better elsewhere. Would not recommend. Good service. Reasonable prices. Just ok margaritas

10.description: What a find!I was looking for a place halfway between our place in Old Irving and our friends' place in Park Ridge.  Enter Mom's Old Recipe.First, the margaritas were amazing!  We split a pitcher.  We also split a roasted corn and poblano queso dip.  YUM!I had the enchiladas trio.  One vegetarian (topped with avocado, cilantro, and red onions), one chicken, and one steak mole.  The mole was chocolatey, and in a good way!  The green was excellent!  Everything tasted so fresh.We split a flan at the end.I can't wait to come back!

5.description: Food was okay but I love authentic Mexican food and my meal tasted exactly like what they offered in Rivera Maya on resorts. Tasted very Americanized per say. Not the worst I've ever had but not too good. Service was okay. Will I come back? Maybe if I'm in the area and no other Mexican food around.

3.description: Ok so me and my coworkers have a thing of sharing great places to eat at and we drive all around the city and suburbs so one day he was bragging about this place and by driving by it a few times I was like not sure by the way it looked outside I was skeptical so one day I was with my girl driving by and said come on let's try this place out it took a little long to get our food but damn it was so good I will definitely go back little pricy but worth it

35.description: Outstanding!  It was a cold Wednesday in March, but our friends knew what to do.  They took us to a warm and inviting Mom's Old Recipe Mexican Restaurant to cure the winter blues.  It is now going to be our 'go-to' place for mexican cuisine.From the outside it is unassuming, but once inside you are pleasantly surprised to see incredible art work on the walls, tables well-set, and a lovely fully-stocked bar.  All very charming. Now to the food:  authentic, flavorful, and abundant.  As luck would have it, co-owner Malena, waited on our table of four and made the food to order.  We had a variety of menu items:  the guacamole, the enchilada mole, the taco trio, and the lemon tilapia and all were top-notch.  And of course, we had some great mexican beer &margaritas to accompany our meal.A good find on Milwaukee Avenue!  You feel appreciated as a customer and are treated like family.

19.description: Couldn't decide if I should go 3 or 4 stars. Place looks like a dump from the outside. Walk in and it was fantastic. Charming, clean and fresh. I'd give our waiter 5 starsThe Chips were awesome but the salsa was too hot to eat - I wish they would have given 2 kinds of salsa.
