For an appetizer we had the Sampler - Two huarachitos, two mini cheese quesadillas, two mini chicken flautas and guacamole. The Guacamole was fantastic. I would order that if given another chance The quesadillas were fried - I did not care for them. I had the Enchiladas Ranchera. Two folded corn tortillas stuffed with your choice of chicken or ground beed topped with a Mom's unique tomato non-spicy sauce, melted Chihuahua cheese and sour cream. Served with rice and refried beans. I went with the non spicy item since their salsa was too hot for me. It was a bit on the bland side and the Chihuahua cheese was almost non existent.  The beans were very bland as was the rice.The place was packed and I would give it another try based on the ambiance, our fantastic waiter, and the Guacamole and chips.

28.description: We go here at least once a month and have never left disappointed.   Margaritas are great and chips and salsa are my favorite anywhere.  I seem to be stuck ordering the Enchiladas Trio most visits because I simply can't get enough of it....three totally different tastes in one plate.    My wife moves around the menu a bit more and has always been happy with her choices.  Always good service and a nice place whether out on a date or out with family and kids.

45.description: Awesome service. An great food.I will go back.  The huarachitos appetizers are good oh and ceviche was delicioooous

33.description: Keeping the place at five stars, where it belongs.  I stopped in yesterday for a quick late lunch and tried the shrimp tacos.  They were outstanding.  I was a little nervous that they were going to be fried, but that was not a problem at all.  Each of the two tacos came with two very large shrimp which were butterflied before breading, so there was plenty of actual shrimp on each taco.  The shrimp were cradled in cabbage with just the right amount of a creamy salsa/sauce in fresh tortillas.  Delicious!I should also mention another recent trip I made here, with my wife for dinner.  I had the combination of the skirt steak and the tequila shrimp.  The steak was awesome, but the tequila shrimp, dripping with pan sauces and caramelized bits of garlic, put it to shame. Just incredible food at this place, every time I show up.

43.description: Another Great place on NW side... my newish nabe :-). Excellent unusual Mexican food( Spicy- YAY) with great service , drinks and cool looking too. Its our 2nd visit and we shall return.

2.description: Ok so I have been hearing about Mom's Old Recipe Mexican Restaurant (MORMR) on 5760 N Milwaukee Avenue.  I donate platelets every other weekend.  The woman that works there has been raving about the food.  Everything I go in to Lifesource she asks me if I tried Mom's Old Recipe yet.  Then my friend at the gym mentioned this restaurant so all of sudden this dim lightbulb in my head goes hey maybe there's something to this.Well we went there last night after the heaviest November snowfall in Chicago in the past 120 years.  Naturally they don't have parking so we drove around trying to find a spot on the snow covered streets.  Just when we were about to give up we found a spot about 1 block away in the mushy slushy streets.When we walked in MORMR has a very nice ambiance w/Mexican music playing in the background.  The restaurant wasn't too busy, but we were told it's normally packed on Friday & Saturday (probably a result of the heavy snow).  The service was excellent.  The busboy brought us water and chips and salsa (mucho caliente, but muy Bueno).  The waiter came brought us menus and asked us we wanted any drinks while we peruse the menu.  The presentation of the food is very good.  I never ordered chorizo enchiladas so I that's what I ended up ordering.  This dish came with 2 chorizo enchiladas with a special bean sauce, queso cheese w/sour cream drizzled in an artistic pattern & rice.  They were delicious. My wife order the mole chicken enchiladas.  They were also pretty good, but were lacking some flavors.  I preferred the chorizo enchiladas.  The waiter was very attentive always coming back to check to see if we needed anything else.The service gets 5 stars, ambiance 5 stars for the service and 4 stars for the food. The food is good, but I felt a little pricey as I have eaten at Mexican restaurants where the food was just as good or better for less.  Overall I feel this is a very good restaurant and worth checking out

18.description: Moms Old Recipe is a unique, Mexican restaurant that offers wonderful food, enthusiastic employees and a warm and inviting atmosphere. The owners, Alena and Ana are awesome! Their sister Lety, is a wonderful waitress and makes your meal experience great. I would highly recommend this restaurant to any authentic Mexican food-loving person!

41.description: What a find!I was looking for a place halfway between our place in Old Irving and our friends' place in Park Ridge.  Enter Mom's Old Recipe.First, the margaritas were amazing!  We split a pitcher.  We also split a roasted corn and poblano queso dip.  YUM!I had the enchiladas trio.  One vegetarian (topped with avocado, cilantro, and red onions), one chicken, and one steak mole.  The mole was chocolatey, and in a good way!  The green was excellent!  Everything tasted so fresh.We split a flan at the end.I can't wait to come back!

52.description: First time here-and plan on going back. Food was delicious, the service was very good.  The restaurant was decorated kinda funky but pleasant. The menu had plenty of choices-and it was not on notebook paper as recent reviewer experienced. Looking forward to a return visit.

50.description: Went on a Tuesday night, restaurant was quiet with only a few tables occupied. We weren't sure what to expect since we live just a few minutes away and have never noticed it before. Pleasantly surprised!  Good, fresh Mexican with a bit of gourmet twist. I had the 3 enchilada combo which was tasty and fresh. My husband had fish tacos. They use a fried Tilapia which was slightly over fried...would have preferred a fresh grilled fish taco. Atmosphere is kitsch Mexican, but warm. We will go back soon and try more entrees for sure!

4.description: Solid Mexican joint with good food and drink options. We tried the mole enchiladas, huevos rancheros, and steak burrito. All were good but steak was a little fatty. I then had the michelada with a dos x very good. Service was good although they got our steak order wrong at first. But then fixed quickly. Sat outside on a nice late summer day and it was fun.

6.description: Their steak tacos are the absolute best. I have never had better tacos, and their quality of meat is always impressive. Their salsa is also out of this world! My mouth is watering just thinking about it !

22.description: Super tasty and authentic Mexican food! Cozy spot with excellent margaritas. One star is removed because I felt like the prices were a little high compared to other Mexican restaurants. Parking can get tricky on Fridays and Saturdays. Wish it was a tad more affordable and I would be there at least once a week!!!

15.description: Delicious!!! Just a tad bit pricey (guac was $9)  but worth the money for the freshness and quality. Michelada's, delicious. The chicken and steak were very juicy. Very good. Bus boy was a sweetheart older man, deserves to be tipped! Don't forget about him! Will definitely be back!

57.description: The steak mole enchiladas and skirt steak tacos are amazing! By far my favorite. Courteous service and a clean, sophisticated atmosphere. Great casual date night and good local Mexican restaurant for the northwest side of the city.

20.description: My wife and I had a craving for some good authenic mexican cuisine and took to yelp. Living in Jefferson Park, there aren't many good sit-down Mexican restraurants. Upon reading the reviews, we decided to try Mom's Old Recipe. It was delicious. The food was pretty good. Both the wife and I ordered tacos. Delicious! 3 tacos each and a side of rice and baked beans. Complimentary chips are served with really spicey salsa. Delicious! Could not pass up on the $5 margaritas! Delicious for the warm summer night. All in all, this place is one of our new favorite restraurants. Definately recommend it!

36.description: Couldn't decide if I should go 3 or 4 stars. Place looks like a dump from the outside. Walk in and it was fantastic. Charming, clean and fresh. I'd give our waiter 5 starsThe Chips were awesome but the salsa was too hot to eat - I wish they would have given 2 kinds of salsa. For an appetizer we had the Sampler - Two huarachitos, two mini cheese quesadillas, two mini chicken flautas and guacamole. The Guacamole was fantastic. I would order that if given another chance The quesadillas were fried - I did not care for them. I had the Enchiladas Ranchera. Two folded corn tortillas stuffed with your choice of chicken or ground beed topped with a Mom's unique tomato non-spicy sauce, melted Chihuahua cheese and sour cream. Served with rice and refried beans. I went with the non spicy item since their salsa was too hot for me. It was a bit on the bland side and the Chihuahua cheese was almost non existent.  The beans were very bland as was the rice.The place was packed and I would give it another try based on the ambiance, our fantastic waiter, and the Guacamole and chips.

14.description: I go here all the time.  Ther service is fantastic, if you go at odd hours it's even better.  When my daughter was a baby they would bring her a special plate of avocado and crackers.  I never asked for it, they just brought it  : )From the outside the storefront blends into a long stretch of karate shops and dentist offices.  Inside is lovely.  The quality of food though is what makes it really special.  I spend a lot of time in the Fulton Market and I'll put it out there and say Mom's can go up against some of the best.  It's not cheap but the food is fresh and prepared with culinary precision not found in most neighborhood mexican joints.I'm also really happy this place is walking distance from my house because the margaritas are yummy.

28.description: I've been here once last month, just before they moved to the new and better place... and 3 times this month. I got a haircut and highlights from Joanne. I really love my hair! I originally wanted to dye my hair light brown. My natural hair color is black. Joanne suggested getting caramel highlights instead, to make it not such a drastic change. I am so thankful and happy that I followed her advice. I am truly satisfied! Plus I got a free shine application with my highlights as part of their Moving Special. Perfect score to Lamaris Salon. Yay!I also like their Waxing Service. I got my brow wax from Laura 2 times already. The first time I came in, she told me not to pluck my brows for 3 weeks. She wanted them to fill in and grow a little bit, so she can better shape it next time. I tried to shape my brows a month ago and it was not nice. Hahaha! I guess I have to leave it to the professionals. I originally asked if I should come back every 2 weeks, but instead she said to wait for 3 weeks. I was impressed that she just did not say yes, so I can come back more often and therefore spend more money. I felt that she really cares for what is best for clients. Kudos to Laura! She is very good and very gentle. She uses wax for sensitive skin. I have sensitive skin and did not have any reaction to the wax. My brows were beautifully shaped and more even!!! Again, perfect score to Lamaris Salon.Last but not the least, manicure and pedicure. I had a no chip manicure 2 weeks ago and it is still intact and nice up to the present. It is supposed to last for 3 weeks. My pedicure is still nice, no problems at all. My nail lady, Linda is very nice and chatty. She just makes me feel comfortable and relaxed there. They now have a new massage chair! It's pretty cool! It massages your back, even your bottom! Hahaha! It feels kinda weird at first. Anyways, going back to my nails review, Linda was very knowledgeable about the process and was able to explain to me how the no chip manicure works. I gouged my index finger nail right after I was done. I was trying to get my keys out of my pocket. She had to soak it first while wrapping my finger in an Aluminum foil, then she had to redo the whole process for one nail again. I was extra careful after that, and now I'm still happy about my mani. I asked if they are going to offer massage in the future. They said that they are currently working on it. Right now, they have acupuncture and cupping. I will wait for the massage service and let you guys know how it is. I also want to add that the first time I came here, I used a Yelp deal. They honored it and even gave me a $5 discount if I come back to their new salon after they move.  So, I luckily got a free hair shine and 5 dollars off!Overall, I give Lamaris Salon  a 5 out of 5! I love this place and the workers are nice too!

1.description: *please note*You will be on their texting list. I have not been here in almost 2 yrs. I received a random mass text few months back. Requested to be removed. Tonight, I receive a text from Rita herself. PLEASE stop texting me!!! I haven't been back in two yrs for a reason and do not want to ever come back.

9.description: This salon has very friendly staff, many spa treatments and tons of product for you to shop. Theresa  is my hair stylist! LOVE LOVE LOVE her! Linda is my nail technician and she does a great job. All hair and nail techs are very accommodating and very talented.

29.description: I was pretty desperate for a haircut and I just moved to the area so I thought I'd try Lamaris out.  Yes the haircuts are cheap but I wasn't impressed with the place overall.  I waited about 30 minutes for my appointment and then the cut was just average.  I didn't get anything special - just a trim and some texturizing at the ends - but I wasn't thrilled with it.

23.description: I went to Lamaris based on other reviews and liked I could purchase $75 for $50 off of yelp.  I didn't have too high of expectations just because it was a new salon for me and I'm always leery at first.  I got full coverage color as well as a haircut.  I can say without hesitation that this has been the BEST coloring I've ever had.  Rita was my stylist and did an awesome job.  I've been to many other "higher end" salons with nowhere near these results.   I also love the cut - have been complimented many times on both already.  I'm going back next week for highlights (which she gave me a 25% off coupon for!).  I highly recommend Rita - extremely personable and does the job right!  I plan on going back for mani-pedi's sometime soon as well.  I found my new hair home!!

5.description: Great salon! A "hidden gem" in my opinion. If you don't know where the salon is, you might miss it! However, once I discovered this place, I never wanted to go anywhere again. The stylists and other staff are all super nice and make you feel at home! I always see Maggie. She is extremely talented at what she does! I don't trust my hair to anyone else!

31.description: I have been desperate for a brow wax for a week or two, but just haven't had time to go. I wanted to try a new place; I've been to Trim a couple of times, but they don't knock my socks off.I'm from the west coast. In Oregon, I paid $10-12 for a wax; half that if I went to the beauty school. While at school in California, I went to a place that charged $8 for brows. I thought it would be impossible to find a place for brow waxing in Chicagoland that was less than $17 with a good reputation and service.I did a google search and decided to give this place a try on my way home from the suburbs today. Living in West Ridge, this place is only about 15-20 minutes from my house, which is about how long it takes me to get to the place in Lincoln Park that I go - except there's free parking, and plenty of it.Best of all - the girl who did my brows, Laura, did a fantastic job. I called around 4:10 and they were able to get me in at 4:30; the shop closes at 5 pm on Saturday. Laura was extremely thorough and really listened to what I asked her to do (which usually doesn't happen; I even had one woman recently tell me that it wasn't possible). She was very patient; I felt she was truly concerned with making sure it turned out well and that I was happy with her work, rather than just getting me out quickly and getting her cash. She asked me to please not leave unless I was truly happy with how they looked; she also checked with me about how I liked them a couple times during the process, which was a nice change. Of course anyone who does your brows asks how it looks - but that's when s/he is pretty much done. She was also extremely friendly, as was the other salon employee who was there.I can't end my review without mentioning what a fantastic bargain it was. The cost was $8 for my brows. Allow me to say that I don't believe I have ever left a place after having my brows done and was as happy with them as I was this evening. I think they look great! And for it to have been done for such a fantastic price makes it my new brow salon!

25.description: I bought a Groupon for this spa for a Brazilian Wax. I had previously been going to a spa out in the suburbs and I wasnt too impressed but i just didnt know where else to go. I would always leave with stray hairs and in pain.  I figured for $25 groupon I would give this spa a try. LAURA IS AMAZING! I swear I will never go to another spa for a wax again. She also did my eyebrows and told me not to pluck them bc shes going to shape them for me & fix them. Laura makes you feel 100% comfortable while remaining professinal at the same time. She is also the owner. I will recommend to her everyone and anyone who needs a Brazilian wax or any waxing service for that matter. She gives you disposable panties so you dont get any wax on yours, plays soothing music, wears gloves, and never double dips her wax stick! she also uses hard wax which is much easier on the skin! Especially for people who have sensitive skin. I even think the hard wax brazilian lasts longer than the regular wax brazilian that most spas use.All in all this salon and spa is the best i have found for Brazilian waxing and ill never go anywhere else.

12.description: I found a living social voucher for a Brazilian wax and decided to try it because I am going to Mexico. I looked at all the reviews about Laura and they are all 100 percent correct! From the moment I walked into the salon everyone was so friendly and welcoming and when Laura was doing the Brazilian wax I felt more comfortable than I do when I go to the gynecologist! Everyone told me how uncomfortable Brazilians are and painful and this was not the case here. I would definitely recommend coming here for a Brazilian and using Laura! I will be back.

21.description: Terrible customer service - bad first impression. I called and made an appointment earlier on a Saturday for an afternoon appointment. I showed up 10 minutes early to the appointment, as suggested. Rather than an employee opening the door, another customer unlocked the door to let me in. No one greeted me for about 15 minutes, as there was no one at the receptionist desk. After 15 minutes, one of the stylists that was working with a customer asked who I was waiting for. There seemed to be confusion as to where the stylist was that was scheduled to take my appointment. After another 10 minutes, the receptionist showed up and began to ring out the clients whose appointments had just ended. After 30 minutes of waiting, the receptionist let me know that she was going to call the stylist to see where she was, and that there had been a mistake with the time of the appointment. After getting off the phone with the stylist who was now on her way to the salon, the receptionist asked me if I still wanted to wait until she got there, another 5-10 minutes. Sorry, but waiting over 40 minutes for an appointment (with a staff that does not even greet clients) is not worth it in my opinion.

16.description: I made a same day appointment for a haircut and highlight as I had a groupon. I wasn't sure who was going to be doing the job but when I got there I was immediately greeted friendly. Of course I was nervous and apprehensive never having highlights on my brown hair. Rita immediately made me feel at home and she was so nice!! I was very pleased with the service, the end  result was amazing!!! Rita was a very excellent colorist and you could tell she had many years of experience. I would highly recommend this salon to anyone!!!Thanks Rita!!!

17.description: Laura is great at Brazilian waxes and facials!!! Love love her and she is soo sweet!:)

10.description: Same as some of the other folks that posted, I got a deal for this salon on Groupon. I would have given this place 2** but I was extremely happy with the facial that I received from Diana. She was really sweet and very knowledgeable with some outstanding skin care regimen recommendations. The reason why I would have subtracted a star would be because I went in with my mom who had the same GrouponNow deal. The deal was for a facial and brow waxing. I went first and my mom had to wait since Diana was the only one there doing facials. When I was done with my facial, I asked Diana who would be doing my brows. She then sent me to a young lady that threaded them. The deal was for waxing, but threading was better for me, so no complaints. Afterwards, I was asked about form of payment for the brows. I had to remind them that it was included. Then young threading lady left the shop. I sat to wait for my mom. Once she was done, I once again had to ask who was going to do her brows. Diana looked around (I'm guessing for the lady that left), then said she would do my moms brows. I'm not sure if this was part of Diana's job description, but she handled the situation nicely.The jist of this is: I would return, mostly to give Diana my business because she was so personable. Otherwise, I was a bit put off by the seemingly uniformed rest of the staff. BUT, to be fair, it was a GrouponNow deal which is a deal only available for a minimal amount of hours on the day it's offered, so maybe all of the staff hadn't known about it.

11.description: I had a Brazilian here with a groupon, it was painful and took like 25 min.  I went to TRIM in Wicker park that specializes in waxing and took 10 min and was much less painful.

26.description: Laura who does the Brazilian waxes is nothing less then amazing. I started going here off because of a deal she had with pretty city in October for breast cancer awareness ( a wax for $31) and have been going back for about 3 years. I recommend her to anyone and everyone !She keeps the room warm, has disposable underwear so you don't feel too exposed, plays relaxing music (ie rain forest, harps playing, wind chimes), wears gloves, uses delicate wax (with a different stick each dip into the wax), and talks the entire time.  She makes me feel like an old friend, she remembers everyone I recommend and we catch up on work, school, and family.

27.description: If you have CURLY or KINKY hair, PLEASE GO SEE LAURA  H.  She is AMAZING with haircuts.  She is the only person that understands that there is a certain way to cut curly hair.  And no one better to trust with your hair, then someone with Curly hair themselves. I FINALLY LOOK NORMAL!  She is also amazing with color.  I was just excited to try her because I heard alot about her from other people, so a good haircut was all I was looking for.  But her COLORS are amazing!!   I dont have that typical Orangy hair when someone tries to lighten my curly, frizzy hair.   Her blow dries are Perfection!!  You would never think I had curly hair after she blow dries it.Im going in a few weeks for a Keratin Treatment.She told me she has been doing hair for about 20 years and to have someone with that experience and still be young, trendy and relatable??.. I couldnt be happier!p.s.  The NEW SALON is soooo NICE!  So laid back.

0.description: I've been coming here for waxes for about 6 months now (I've also gotten one facial). Laura is great at what she does and is fun to talk with. I always leave with great results, and the prices are wonderful for the service provided. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good esthetician - Laura is the best.

20.description: I really had a very positive experience. I made an appointment with Rita for a haircut. I was very nervous about changing my do, but she was able to put me at ease. My haircut turned out great and happy with the look. I am definitely coming back.

19.description: I've been here once last month, just before they moved to the new and better place... and 3 times this month. I got a haircut and highlights from Joanne. I really love my hair! I originally wanted to dye my hair light brown. My natural hair color is black. Joanne suggested getting caramel highlights instead, to make it not such a drastic change. I am so thankful and happy that I followed her advice. I am truly satisfied! Plus I got a free shine application with my highlights as part of their Moving Special. Perfect score to Lamaris Salon. Yay!I also like their Waxing Service. I got my brow wax from Laura 2 times already. The first time I came in, she told me not to pluck my brows for 3 weeks. She wanted them to fill in and grow a little bit, so she can better shape it next time. I tried to shape my brows a month ago and it was not nice. Hahaha! I guess I have to leave it to the professionals. I originally asked if I should come back every 2 weeks, but instead she said to wait for 3 weeks. I was impressed that she just did not say yes, so I can come back more often and therefore spend more money. I felt that she really cares for what is best for clients. Kudos to Laura! She is very good and very gentle. She uses wax for sensitive skin. I have sensitive skin and did not have any reaction to the wax. My brows were beautifully shaped and more even!!! Again, perfect score to Lamaris Salon.Last but not the least, manicure and pedicure. I had a no chip manicure 2 weeks ago and it is still intact and nice up to the present. It is supposed to last for 3 weeks. My pedicure is still nice, no problems at all. My nail lady, Linda is very nice and chatty. She just makes me feel comfortable and relaxed there. They now have a new massage chair! It's pretty cool! It massages your back, even your bottom! Hahaha! It feels kinda weird at first. Anyways, going back to my nails review, Linda was very knowledgeable about the process and was able to explain to me how the no chip manicure works. I gouged my index finger nail right after I was done. I was trying to get my keys out of my pocket. She had to soak it first while wrapping my finger in an Aluminum foil, then she had to redo the whole process for one nail again. I was extra careful after that, and now I'm still happy about my mani. I asked if they are going to offer massage in the future. They said that they are currently working on it. Right now, they have acupuncture and cupping. I will wait for the massage service and let you guys know how it is. I also want to add that the first time I came here, I used a Yelp deal. They honored it and even gave me a $5 discount if I come back to their new salon after they move.  So, I luckily got a free hair shine and 5 dollars off!Overall, I give Lamaris Salon  a 5 out of 5! I love this place and the workers are nice too!

2.description: I have been getting Brazilian waxes for over 10 years and was used to hopping around to different spots looking for "the one" but now....I have been getting Brazilian waxes from Laura for a little over 2 years and I could not be happier. I go every 8 weeks. She is peppy and spunky and loves to talk and that helps the process seem faster and less painful. She knows what's she's doing and in an area that can be sensitive and uncomfortable she makes everything "smooth" literally :-) I always feel refreshed and clean after leaving with a Brazilian wax from Laura. I've never had a bad wax from Laura.

18.description: I really had a very positive experience. I made an appointment with Rita for a haircut. I was very nervous about changing my do, but she was able to put me at ease. My haircut turned out great and happy with the look. I am definitely coming back.

13.description: I went in for a Brazilian wax on a recommendation for Lamaris and had a good experience.  Laura was my aesthetician and she was super friendly, made me feel comfortable and she used a hard wax (no cloth strips).  This technique takes longer since she works in small sections, but it's less painful and she gets nearly everything.  Wish her service was a little less pricey ($50 not including tip) but she did great work.

4.description: I've been going to Rita for my hair for almost 3 years.  Before I finally "settled down" with her, I used to "salon hop" - in search for "the one" hairdresser who made me feel good about my hair.  She listens to what I want done and does it, yet she also advises me what to do with my hair and I take her advice, which I have not regretted.

24.description: Yesterday, I scheduled at Lamaris with my favorite stylist for both a cut and full highlights.I am in love with my hair!!!! Laura H. is AMAZING!!! With Laura all of your hair worries will disappear. Yes, really.I have fine, thin blonde hair which is very technically difficult to cut and style properly.  She does such a wonderful job I wouldn't dream of seeing anyone else.  I asked for bangs and that alone is a challenge. I love them. I also had full highlights performed. They are gorgeous! I am so happy. I even received a compliment from a hair colorist friend today.I have seen Laura H. 3 times for cut & style and 4 times for full or partial highlights. Every time I have seen Laura I have asked for minor adjustments in the color or cut: low lights and highlights, blonder around the face, or blonder everywhere. She knows exactly what I am thinking and nails it every time. Additionally, they always grow out perfectly while looking very natural. Thank you, thank you, thank you.  I have not yet had any spa services performed, but I have been told to see the other Laura for facials and Sam for nail services.

6.description: I was so excited to get my chemical peel yesterday. I talked to people and did my own research (Google) and got really great reviews for the effects of peels. I have deep acne scars and was hoping to reduce them. Laura was the one to do my peel. I asked her about the different types of peels. She told me she's going to do the mildest one. I told her I'd prefer something stronger for my skin. She declined and said maybe when I come back. (I wasn't planning on coming back, I thought one treatment would do it). Also, after a chemical peel, the person is supposed to peel for a few days. I didn't peel at all! I don't think there's even a difference in my skin's appearance. It was more of a facial advertised as a peel. I feel conned. Waste of money!

22.description: I purchased a groupon for a haircut, but was met with disaster at this salon. On booking my appointment was told the stylist was unavailable for the Groupon time slot, but after a long phone call another stylist stepped in  to accept the Groupon. They did not tell me when booking my appt I had to come in at a different time for the new stylist so I was prepared to go in at the appointment time I had already scheduled.  Thus, due to their scheduling errors I was left without a stylist and wasted $10 of my groupon bucks that I could have used for a different salon. They offered to accept my groupon another day, but I only needed their services for a special event I was attending,  so just took my loss and now going to a different salon.Also, another thing that really grinds my gears about this salon was that the receptionist was really persistent that she had the right time. They scheduled me at a time I was at work, and it makes no sense for me to book  an important appointment when I know I wouldn't be there.

15.description: I bought a Groupon for this spa for a Brazilian Wax. I had previously been going to a spa out in the suburbs and I wasnt too impressed but i just didnt know where else to go. I would always leave with stray hairs and in pain.  I figured for $25 groupon I would give this spa a try. LAURA IS AMAZING! I swear I will never go to another spa for a wax again. She also did my eyebrows and told me not to pluck them bc shes going to shape them for me & fix them. Laura makes you feel 100% comfortable while remaining professinal at the same time. She is also the owner. I will recommend to her everyone and anyone who needs a Brazilian wax or any waxing service for that matter. She gives you disposable panties so you dont get any wax on yours, plays soothing music, wears gloves, and never double dips her wax stick! she also uses hard wax which is much easier on the skin! Especially for people who have sensitive skin. I even think the hard wax brazilian lasts longer than the regular wax brazilian that most spas use.All in all this salon and spa is the best i have found for Brazilian waxing and ill never go anywhere else.

7.description: Ive been coming to Lamaris for the past year or so. The salon is a little hidden, and I like that there is parking in the back. Ive been having Maggie cut and color my hair for several years and followed her here from another salon. She is fun to talk to and has great energy. She does a wonderful job with my cut and color, and I always trust her opinoin. She really knows how to get my hair to be that perfect blonde shade. I know my hair is in good hands with Maggie.  I have also started seeing Joann K for my eyebrow waxes.  My eyes are beyond sensitive, and usually get red and water so much I look like I am crying.  None of that happens when Joann waxes my eyebrows. Talk about a miracle worker!  She allows me to sit up a little more, and the waxing is practically painless.  I hate to mess with my own eyebrows, and she makes them look so great!

8.description: Great deal great service has coupon did facial.  Great conversation cool music private room. Laura took the time to explain everything that was being done to me also gave me a few samples to check out personal tour of the different products I can obtain. The place is pretty easy to get to and I would call to make an appointment ahead.

30.description: I went to see Laura for a brow wax last week, and I was very pleased.  I had gone to nicer (and more expensive) salons/spas in Bucktown and Lincoln Park before for brow waxes where I received about the same quality of wax job but paid $20-25 for it.  Laura charged only $8, which is amazingly cheap.  Laura gave me a great shape, and I really appreciated the time she spent to soothe my bright-red brows after the wax.  I always get really red though, that has nothing to do with her.  She's chatty, which is a great for my distraction, but she remains focused.  After my wax, Laura took the time to write out her hours and her personal cell phone number to call for future appointments.  I dropped her one star only because there was a lot of tweezing, and I just personally prefer more waxing to just get the pain over with.  This might have been more to do with my brows and less with Laura, but I will re-evaluate after my 2nd visit.

3.description: I bought a Groupon for two no chip manicures. The person who did my nails was nice, but she kept making offhand insults about the color I chose. I would be fine if she said it once, but literally every 5 minutes she said how the color was not her style, and it's too nice out to pick a color this dark. Okay, I am the client and you're not the one getting your nails done. I felt awkward most of the time and wanted to leave as soon as possible.Luckily, it was the shortest and most half-assed manicure I have ever gotten. She didn't even soak my nail, or cut any hang nails. She just used a cuticle pusher to push my cuticles to the desired shape but it hurt so bad and my nails started bleeding. The groupon said there'd be "essential oils" and a hand massage but there was none of that.So, I guess it was a good thing my manicure was short so I didn't have to stay there one more minute. I still have one more left on my groupon, but I doubt I'll ever use it. Seriously, stay away.

14.description: Ok I have been seeing Laura for waxing for years. Today I decided to try other salon services. I met Rita she was excellent my hair looks great and the cut is one of the best I've had.... This place just keeps getting better... I WANT TO MOVE IN !!

58.description: Great spot in the Edison Park/Norwood Park neighborhood! Delicious food, good service (was a little slow), and fantastic decor. Enjoyed a buffalo chicken wrap with to die for fries! A+ on those babies! Didn't have any drinks, but the selection looked decent!

56.description: The burger was good. But it took way too long (more than 20 minutes for burgers is too long). There were only two servers for the entire pub when we were there.

29.description: Best curds around but cold home chips and burger under cooked. Have tried the burger twice now and both times not cooked to order. Nice place but kitchen needs help. Give it a try at least once, sloppy joes r good and pulled pork is very tasty. Tough parking too.

42.description: Awful service - we had to move to the bar to get anyone to take our order.Awful food - our salads tasted like plastic and for fear of food poisoning, we stopped trying to eat them. After notifying our server, she insisted that everything was fresh, proceeded to give us our bill w/o anything taken off. Just an apology.Will not be back. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

23.description: Decent place to watch a game. Service was a little slow at times. Got the burger sliders which were alright. Wouldn't go out of my way to go here again.

47.description: Under new management and it shows. Menu selections and food quality improved along with new staff. Great place to catch a game with all the TVs and sound, always a great time .

8.description: Well this was my first time here and it was the Blackhawks game. So of course it was fairly crowded just as any other bar I would have gone too. My friends and I were very fortunate in finding a table underneath a TV. So as we sat down about 15 minutes later a server approached us and asked what we would like to drink. I look at their beer menu and it was a fair selection. What annoyed me was the amount of beers they did not have i stock. But whatever I am here to just watch the game. i order the Lagunitas IPA on draft. She came back about 15 minutes later and dropped off all the drinks. We were hungry and decided to order some food and this is where it got interesting.I order a burger, my friend ordered a sloppy joe and chicken tacos. Since it was really busy I did not expect to see my food for another 30 minutes to be fair. But when the food came out I was missing a few things. My burger was suppose to have lettuce, onion and tomatoes. It only had lettuce. A server should always come back to check on their guests the moment they get their food not 15 minutes later. Anyways I ask for my onions and lettuce and a side of BBQ sauce. She comes back 10 minutes later with ketchup and tomatoes and more lettuce. I wasn't trying to have anything ruin the Stanley Cup final so I gave in and just ate my food. My friend's chicken tacos was so salty it was unbearable to eat. I mean I have had salty tacos but you'd think that flavor would cancel out after lettuce, sour cream and etc poured on top of it. After we ate we pretty much just continued to drink till the game was over.When the Hawks won we just closed out our check and headed out because the fun was over. All in all its a nice place to hangout if you're in the local area. But you prob might not find me there anytime soon.

31.description: I have been here before a few times but this most recent visit was just so awful I had to write about it. IStarted off alright, my firends and I were in Saturday around noon and sat at the bar. There was maybe 3 other tables. Our bartender was friendly at first, got our drinks and took our food order. We order an app and soups with our meals. It took almost an hour for our soups to even come out. My 3 friends got their meals before my boyfriend and I even got our soups. We never got our app and finally when our food came out (I ordered a BLT by the way, should never take that long to make a BLT) I said something about how it was almost an hour before we got our food and the bartender told me I was wrong and it was only 35 minutes. It may have been only 35 minutes until our friends got their food but my boyfriend and I waited almost another 15 minutes for our food. She claimed that the 3 other tables and us at the bar all put our food orders in at the same time and they only had 1 cook which I don't really find as a good excuse. To make matters worse the bartender then just sort of gave up on us. She stopped coming by to see how we were doing, check our drinks. It was like she knew she messed up and didn't think we deserved any more of her time since she thought her tip was already basically gone. We did still tip her 15% even though she didn't deserve it. We will probably be here again since it is close to my brother's place in the city but I will never forget this incident and will not hold back if this ever happens again.

34.description: F.Y.I. I only come here on Mondays for Trivia Night. This place is so fun on Monday nights! They have plenty of parking, and a big spacious room for multiple teams to join in on trivia fun. There is a $5 Monday night special where you get a Moburger and fries. Delicious. I've had their chicken tenders which are ok, and their homemade chips are kinda gross, I don't know if that was a bad night. OH but their tater tots- AWESOME I can never have enough of their tots. Also I think domestic canned beers are only $3 that night too.However, the reason this is a 3-star is because service can be really slow. They often seem under-staffed. The best service I get is when Holly is working. Even though the food might take awhile she at least acknowledges the situation and apologizes for it. She always checks up on us to make sure we are being well taken care of. None of the other waitresses have been as attentive as her... sometimes we even feel ignored.All in all, good place to hang out with friends on Monday and learn a few things while eatin' a burger and drinking a beer.

16.description: We were at this so called bar last night for a Christmas party, the bartenders were terrible! They had 3 bartenders, 1 behind the bar, 1 working the tables, and 1 running food. The bartender behind the bar was annoyed that she actually had to make drinks, my husband ordered a captain and Coke he got jack and Coke, just seems like they don't care, she literally made one drink at a time, horrible service!

13.description: All in all, not a bad place to catch a Hawks game.  We showed up on a Friday night about ¾ of the way into the 1st period and had no trouble getting a place to sit.  There are plenty of TV's for a good view from anywhere.Service was a little slow, but I feel like they may have been short staffed.  We shared some appetizers - I tried the beer nuggets and the buffalo chicken dip.  Both were really tasty - there's a reason why buffalo chicken dip is referred to as crack.  I just wish that the tortilla chips that were served with them hadn't tasted extremely stale.  Oh well.I'd definitely come back for hockey, a burger, a beer... and I hear they have karaoke on Friday nights.

11.description: Avoid this place like the plague. If you want to witness drug deals in the bathroom, an extremely rude and unprofessional owner, by all means, go there! Oh, and their food is terrible too.

39.description: Pretty neutral on this place.  There is parking which is a plus.  The atmosphere was nice, outdoor seating was nice.  Came on a Tuesday night, apparently karaoke night if you are into that.  Seemed like a nice set-up with a huge song selection.Food was decent, beer selection and specials were decent, server was attentive.  Overall I would say this is a pret

37.description: Good service, and great beer menu. Enjoyed the food while I was eating it however, got very sick a few hours later.

0.description: Not sure if this bar had a large space or if it was just because it was really dead on a Saturday night. In any case, the location is pretty uninviting (in the corner of a strip mall) and probably why not many people were there. Aside from that, it was an A-OK bar.  There are a good number of TV's and had pretty standard bar food. You can't really mess up nachos and tater tots. The bartender at the side bar was really friendly, attentive, and easy on the eyes. I would say this place is good if you have a large group of people in your party and you guys plan on going and staying at one place and looking for fairly decent drinks and bar food.

38.description: The food and drinks are good but the live band was a tad obnoxious and we waited like a half hour for burgers. It shouldn't take that long to make a burger and some BLT sandwiches with fries.  We waited a long, long time for our food.

51.description: Ok. They couldn't make a Texas tea.  I was out celebrating my birthday and we ordered tenders and fries. The food was cooked in oil that had fish in it and ruined the food. Getting drinks not happening. Go somewhere else it was a Tuesday really.

27.description: ive been here once before with BFF & we both liked it but after last night i totally changed my mind. it was st pattys day so i figured they would have some specials to go along with their regular menu but they didnt even offer their regular menu and just had the st pattys menu! whaaaaaaaatt!!!!?! who does that!?!!? there were only like 10 things available and the 4 of us all ordered something different. we were all so dissatisfied with our meals! i had irish nachos & specifically asked for NO green onions but they were still on there!! my friend ordered a corned beef kabob but it was just meat & no veggies whatsoever! what kind of a kabob is that!? other friend had a corned beef sandwich and that was just neat & bread with nothing else. other friend had corned beef & cabbage dinner in which he liked the cabbage but said the beef was not so good. the midori & seven up cocktail i ordered was all just seven up with a taste of midori so it wasnt that good either. plus the service was poor. we waited very long to get service for our drinks and food and to get our bill. i totally understand that its st pattys day so its crowded & lots of people but dont they know this & shouldve been better prepared with more wait staff!? we were all just disappointed with this place & i felt bad since im the one who suggested we all eat there. if this was my 1st time bein here i definitely wouldnt come here again. but since ive been here before & like some things from their menu i might come back if im in this area. however i doubt if my coworkers will try it again. so u only get 1 chance to make a 1st impression right?......

32.description: They have great chili and the best cheese curds in area. Their stuff burger is the bomb. If your lucky you may get a sample of Ruben Balls with probably the best 1000 island dressing I have ever had.

54.description: A nice looking bar in a strip mall in Chicago. The place has two sections with a pool table out away from the main bar. It has a fireman theme and I imagine many firemen must live in this far corner part of the city of Chicago. The food is ypical bar grub and they bring and cook it fast. Plenty of television screens to watch from and basically just another bar and pub in the city.

48.description: This spot is located in a nice looking strip mall. The inside looks very nice with a rustic medival feel. The crowd on a Friday night was disappointing but the food is great. Pretty good beer selection, and good food this is a nice cheap spot to meet up and chill that won't be too busy. I'm sure this spot will be alot better in the summer!

44.description: They need more than one server on a Thursday. They need to regulate the smokers smoking at the patio seating area 5ft from indoor seating areas. Which is gross for the people eating and drinking indoors. They need to update their website specials so I don't come in expecting $2 bottles when in fact,  its a lie. They need to be more attentive on order details and who ordered what food.

24.description: I do admit this place is hit and miss. Tonight, definitely a hit. I had a great timeThe service was on point and our server was very nice. The place wasn't too crowded for the Cubs game, which was nice. I know they have had some growing pains, but I think they got it right.

7.description: Love this place! My husband had passed by here a few times and we decided to stop in. We ordered the cheese curds, Mo burger with chips, and the Double D burger that came with tator tots. My husband had a Jolly beer from The Traveler, an East Coast company. The food menu was pub food but different, which I really liked, and it was so satisfying! Everything was in house which I liked too. Service was wonderful and the place reminded me so much of some of the pubs we went to in London and in Ireland. I also loved the decor, with old firehoses, a fire ladder, and Mo's old police uniform. Mo's own daughter who now runs the restaurant also checked on us, she is so nice! I would definitely come back here - it looks like a lot of fun on weekends, it's a good crowd, the food is good, the service is good, and it looks like a great place just for a drink or getting together with family and friends. It's a pretty down to Earth good ol' pub with reasonable pricing.

49.description: My wife threw me a birthday party here last weekend and we had a blast. The manager, Megan, made the room available for her to do some early preparation so I could get the surprise of a lifetime!  The party was a huge success, and the bartenders and servers (Zak, Jamie, and Melissa) made it seem smooth and effortless). It felt like we were having a house party, without the mess in the house. Mo Dailey's is an excellent spot to host a gathering and we recommend it highly!

40.description: Went there yesterday and this time I won't be back. Service has always been horrible but this time it was beyond repair. The servers were using profanity in front of the very few customers that were there. I know this is not the Ritz but geeze u kiss your momma with that mouth..... And the answer to that is no: because one server was kissing her BF and actually making out with him in there and in the parking lot. And: I'm not done yet... They ran out of 3 kinds of beer?!? Really So a recap: food is mediocre, service is horrendous and supply is not a priority. So in my opinion that means the customer is not a priority just the boyfriends and friends. Thanks but no thanks. Never again.

53.description: This is a pretty good bar to go to if you are in this neighborhood.  I have never had a problem getting a table here and they usually always have some pretty good drink specials on any given day.  My husband and I have eaten here multiple times and have never had a bad meal.  The southwestern wrap is delicious and the tater tots are always perfectly cooked - brown and never undercooked, just the way I like them.  Service is always spot on as well - you will never be empty on beer here.  They also have a lot of flat screens to watch "the game" on if you want.  The only down side is that when they are playing music it is usually pretty bad... especially if you come later at night.  This is by no means my favorite bar to go to or anything, but if we are on our way home from work or the train or something, we will stop in here for a couple of beers and some food.

30.description: I have very few complaints about Mo Dailey's. This is our new neighborhood bar of choice. The service is pretty good (sometimes slow if there's a crowd but it's understandable) and the servers are very nice and fun to talk to. It can sometimes get loud, depending on what's going on. So if there's a Blackhawks game or it's karaoke night, don't expect to talk at a whisper and be heard. But it's never crazy crowded.The food is good. It's bar food, so you can't have very high standards, but their pizza is good and I like the Buffalo Chicken Salad. Drinks are cold, game is always on, not a bad seat in the house. And the decor is nice. It's all CPD and CFD stuff, since it's around where all the police and fire fighters for Chicago tend to live.The only complaint I have is that it seems like all of the tables here are wobbly. I wish they'd get that fixed. But seriously, that's my ONLY complaint.

46.description: I've been going here since the restaurant first opened a few years ago. The management/owners have changed a few times, and it has had its rough patches, which some of the negative reviews on this site probably come from. However, it's back under the original family, and the quality is fantastic!Great Chicago decor, with lots of nods to the Chicago Police and Fired Departments. The food is standard bar food, but what really stands out are their burgers. Every time my family comes and visits, they always demand to go to Mo's for a burger and a beer.My only criticisms are that it can be pretty loud on the weekends, and there never seems to be enough servers.

1.description: Service was slow and I just didn't like the vibe of the place.  The music selection of dance tunes and pop music isn't the genre I care for.  The food I saw being delivered to other patrons didn't look all that appetizing, so I passed.  Parking was difficult, even with a lot on a slow night.  I can't say definitively that I'll never be back, though it isn't likely.

55.description: Mo burger and onion rings have a great dipping sauce!

9.description: From ALL Chicago sports or Karaoke on Friday nights, this is the place to be.  Come watch the Blackhawks play, guaranteed to be sitting next to another fan. This place  has all the excitement as if you were at the game. Management cares about your experience, servers are pleasant, and bartenders are great.  Menu has everything for the entire family. From wings to their Turkey Club, you'll never walk away disappointed.  Check out their Dailey Specials.

26.description: Service blows. Our wings were super cold, so instead of making us new ones, they reheated it.... with our celery on the plate. Who the heck reheats celery? No thanks.

25.description: If you like gravel and rubberbands in your food, then this is your place! I'm not even kidding, and not much of a reviewer but after this experience last Sunday 4/12/15, I had to share.Typical slow service was expected but when one from our group pulled a dime sized rock out of her mouth from her grilled chicken ceasar wrap, it took a serious turn for the worst. The manager had it re-made on the fly and minutes later, my boyfriend pulled out 2 black pieces of gravel from his mouth. He also took a re-order and half way through his 2nd chicken ceasar wrap, pulled out a 2in round sized rubberband. How does that even happen?! Can that be an accident?! Doubt it but seeing as the manager did not show her face to our table again, she probably didn't have a clue. Pretty rude and rediculous.Another order at our table were the sliders which were not even edible. The buns were so hard that even after banging them on the table, not a dent was made. Two others barely got their food, those came at the end around the time the rubberband shenanigans happened.I'm seriously concerned about the food quality and standards for everything in this kitchen so if you like your teeth and health, I'd avoid this place.Thankfully we did not have a bill but I still feel as though we got punked.

12.description: Great place! Since I moved to NP no bar/restaurant has been as welcoming. The bartender was super friendly. I told him it was my first time and he told me the history of the place and all about the police and fire theme. The owner greeted me. Shook my hand, welcomed me and told me about the events they have and specials. I came in on a tues afternoon so only about 6 people were there, but the crowd was good and everyone was kind.On food, I got a wrap and toys for $8! The SW wrap was delicious, tater tots were satisfactory and apparently they have outdoor seating too! Great space! I def will be back :)

59.description: Decor is great. I found the staff very friendly. I really enjoyed the Mo burger. Lots of tvs to watch games, The menu was somewhat limited. If you're not looking for a burger, then I would recommend a lot of the other restaurants in the area.

21.description: If you have a craving for cheese curds then definitely come here. The curds are perfect with Not too much breading (hate those "curds" that are actually mini-cheese sticks). The staff is always friendly and attentive. This is a place where you can come and relax with friends and feel right at home.

17.description: Decent place to watch a game. Service was a little slow at times. Got the burger sliders which were alright. Wouldn't go out of my way to go here again.

10.description: This place sucks! I'd give it no stars if I could! Seriously the worst service in the city with servers who would just as soon spit on you as look at you! Their management is very rude and unprofessional as well as food that is iffy at best but you feel like you have to order it to not be rude, even though the servers are rude to you for no reason....just really horrible and I will not be frequenting this establishment anytime soon unless changes are made in personnel and cuisine expediently!!!

5.description: First, let's say I love the design concept. After that everything goes downhill. The craft beer selection is composed mostly of fruity beers that cater to the palate of a 19 year old. There was one server and I saw her at my table... Never. On karaoke night, two of us waited at the bar through three songs before we were able to order shots and another song before they were delivered. 4 shots of fire ball and a patron were ordered. I watched the shots being poured from the bottles, but as a bartender in the industry for 15 years, those shots were surely not what was ordered. I would put a large sum of money on that bottles were filed with a cheaper substitute. Fireball has a very specific consistency, and what I received was not even close.

3.description: There was only one server.  We didn't get any napkins with our meal.  She was ran ragged.  The food was really good. My boyfriend got the 'Mo burger and I got the steak out sandwich.  They played nothing but country music.  I asked our server if they played anything else besides country music and she said they do on other nights.

35.description: I had high hopes for this place but was disappointed. First, the pluses:They have a parking lot, no more refilling the meter. The food was pretty good - standard fried bar food, nothing to write home about but they have a menu with good variety (and some vegetarian options!). Drink specials every night of the week. The atmosphere inside is pretty cool, dark but clean and decorated like an old firehouse. The downsides:Holy smokes, the service was sloooow. They only had one server working the entire room, so everything took forever. Yes, she was kind and doing the best she could, but they were making it really hard on her. There are TVs everywhere, this really is a sports bar. This may fall in the plus category for some. The audio was tuned to a game while we were there, so if you're into that sort of thing this would be a good place for you. Sit at the bar so you get better service. I probably won't be back, just not my kind of place.

19.description: Was planning to go here for a drink or two but was called ignorant by the "owner". Tried calling to check if they carried a certain drink, phone rang for a period with no answer during regular business hours. Later received a call back from Megan who did not properly identify herself as a Mo Dailys representative let alone the "owner". Thought it was a wrong number, tried to politely hang up. 3 calls later told "ignorant" and not to bother coming in. Don't worry, don't plan on it

28.description: Went to Mo Daileys  on St Patricks day around 130 in afternoon. Only 12 people in there when we arrived. Service was very slow, very understaffed there, what seemed like a decade waiting for our food, the orders were messed up,  the waitress tried her best , wasn't her fault, the kitchen must've screwed up, any way after waiting for our orders , waitress was running around my friend & I went to the bar to get drinks for the kids, the lady behind the bar ignored us, I finally got her attention , placed my.  Order , she asked who our server was, we wanted to pay separately for drinks or wait forever for the waitress,she had a tide with us, we didn't yell at her or anything. Just annoyed at waiting forever for service, food wasn't that great, I had better food in jail, when I was in service. Will never go n back there again. Then the manager tried to help by giving us 5% off then argued with us when then double charged us for drinks try never gave us. Also scraped off the cheese on one of the kids burger an told us that they don't do that. making  us feel like we did it. Error in print wasn't there st pats day, was there sat before. But still very bad service

45.description: I am not one to complain, at all. I'm not picky regarding food, prices, drinks, service, etc. HOWEVER, my first experience here was an absolute nightmare. I met some friends at Mo Dailey's the other week for the final Blackhawks vs. Kings game. My friends had grabbed one of the several tables they had for outside seating so I was excited to enjoy a nice night with some good hockey. WELL, that did not happen. After SEVERAL (I'm talking 4-5 times) attempts to catch a waitress down my friends and I were still watching a black TV screen. We were almost half way into the first period of the game and they still had every single outside television off. Now you'd think for a Friday night as well as a huge game you'd have the televisions on in advance...Not only was that a kick in the pants but when my friend had to get up to go inside to speak someone about the TVs (which a customer should not have to do) the ONE waitress working was terribly rude to her and pretty much told her there's nothing she can do for us right now. Oh alright.At this point my friends and were thinking of just turning the TVs on ourselves. Either that, or leaving the place completely (except we had ordered two buckets of Coors about 45 minutes ago). Once we were in the middle of the second period, a man had FINALLY turned the televisions on. It was pathetic how much we thanked him. But now we struggled with the garage doors that connect the inside and outside of the restaurant/bar being half way down to the point where it cut off the middle of the TV. This was just exhausting.We had tried flagging our (OR A) waitress down for the last hour and a half we were there to order food...nope. Didn't happen. Also, most of the drinks we received were not from a waitress but from each of my friends going up to the bar inside to order the drinks to bring them back to the table themselves. I guess we got some waitress training while we were here too?All in all, I will never go here again. I was excited about the place being that it was a cute, tucked away place at the end of a strip mall. But never again will they receive our business.

33.description: Service sucks! Been here three times and each time it took forever to have a server come to our table and then even longer to get our food and drinks.  Will NOT be coming back.

43.description: Decent beer selection.  I knew that by looking at the taps.  I asked for a beer menu and was brought a wine menu.  The bartender didn't know the prices of the beers on tap and didn't mention specials until after we ordered.The nachos were disgusting. The cheese sauce they used was of lower quality than what you find at a movie theater.The veggie burger was pretty good.It was a tuesday night which meant country music karaoke.  Strange for an Irish pub.

2.description: If I could give them 0 stars I would. I would strongly recommend avoiding this place like the plague. I have been a regular of Mo Dailey's for several years, as I attend Karaoke night on Fridays. While I love the karaoke there, I need to let people know what happened to me this past Friday. I went there with my husband for a drink and karaoke. Well on Saturday morning when I got home, I noticed that my debit card was missing. My wallet has a zipper around it, so there is no way that it would have just fallen out. This means that someone stole it, or it was accidentally left behind at the bar. I called the bar twice in the afternoon to see if it was returned, and was told it was not. No one however offered to take my name or number in the event that it was returned. Later that evening, when checking my bank account, I noticed an unauthorized charge at a bar down the street. The charge took place at 2:30 a.m. on Saturday morning. I then called the bar back to let them know that my card had been stolen there as a courtesy, so that they could be on alert as people could also be stealing from inside the restaurant. It was a courtesy. I was calm and kind about it. Well, the response I got was far from a thank you. The person who answered the phone, who I believe was the owner yelled at me and said you're card wasn't stolen, it was returned back here this evening. The person who returned it said that you had dropped the card and was continuing to go off on me and accusing me of things that weren't true. This was beyond unprofessional. First of all, the card was probably returned because the person who stole it couldn't use it anymore. In addition, if had been dropped, why wouldn't they have just brought it back in on Friday night instead of waiting 24 hours to go back to the bar? Again very suspicious.Since I was unable to get anywhere with them on the phone, I then went to their web site and posted what had happened. Again, I got a very defensive response and was told that would never happen in their establishment. Again, explain to me how I had my card at midnight in a zipped wallet and by 2:30 a.m. there was an unauthorized charge at a bar down the street? In addition, the owner removed my comments from their Facebook page.I then got a phone call from the owner basically apologizing, but also still blaming me, and again reiterating that it didn't get stolen because someone returned my card. They also said that they earlier in the night had cut up my card. Um, why on earth would you do that, instead of locking it somewhere and giving the patron at least 48 hours to contact the bar? They also said that no one had contacted the bar earlier that day to ask about a lost card, which again was NOT TRUE!! I have been a regular for a long time, and have kept my mouth shut for too long. In addition to the rude manager who yelled at a regular, I have experienced repeatedly slow service, understaffed service, rude and pushy servers, wrong orders, drug deals by employees in the bathroom, and employees smoking outside while I am waiting for my food (which really seems unsanitary). Since I was a regular, and I enjoyed karaoke, I let it go, but not anymore. In addition, I have noticed that most of the servers aren't there for very long which should have told me something about the management from day 1. I am sure that the manager will give a defensive response to this at some point, but honestly that just proves that they aren't confident in what they are doing, and that they are not open to true feedback from their regulars, AKA the people who keep the business alive. All I had wanted to hear initially was a thank you for letting us know that, we will look into that, but instead I got an attitude, yelled at and a fake apology. Needless to say, I will be taking my business (and my friends who go with me on Friday's business) to another location on Friday nights that appreciates their regulars and treats them like family instead of yelling at them.

18.description: I think giving this bar/restaurant two stars is generous. We went on a Saturday afternoon to grab a bite to eat. There was four tables being served and it took over an hour to get our food! Not only was the service slow but the waitress didn't even know the menu. She had to grab it from my mom to check & see if what she was ordering even existed. By the time our food arrived we were starving & completely let down by the quality. Southwestern salad was terrible, along with the quesadillas. I'm not sure how you can screw those up, but they did! Not only that but the price for the quality of the food did not match up. I was so close to walking the extra two blocks to go to Iron Horse & I'm sad we didn't. Won't be returning to MoDaileys.

41.description: The menu is pretty ordinary.  Typical burgers, nachos, fried, blah, blah.  I wound up there twice in the past couple weeks.  Got a burger both times and order it med. rare both times.  It was medium on the way to well, both times.  Tasted ok, but if you can't cook mid-rare, either say you're cooking everything medium well or don't ask.  And they're in a rush to serve the Guinness.  Let it crown up and settle a little.

52.description: We've been here several times and appreciate having a place like this in our neighborhood.  The food is always good; good burgers, perfectly cooked and plentiful tots, yummy beer nuggets, great fish and chips, etc.  Decent drink specials.  Good service.  Live music on occasion.  An all-around great neighborhood place.

50.description: You know it must have been a good night when you don't remember checking into where you were at. I was here for karoke night. You don't come to this pub because it's aesthetically appealing or because of the food. I think people frequent this pub because it is a great place to meet up with people you know in the immediate area. My friend picked me up from the airport and took me to a late dinner. After sharing 2 pitchers of Hite beer, we were ready to sing our hearts out. Not much beyond that, unless you count the two or three shots of Jager that we did. The crowd was awesome. I think the guy with the thick silver chain and long sideburns was my favorite. He reminded me of a cross between Elvis and Neil Diamond. Friendly staff! I'm not certain but I think I ended up making out with one of them. This was probably the best belated birthday experience I've had in years! Cheers to supportive friends who make sure you live life, and get home safe.

4.description: Any place that serves tater tots as a side is fine by me!!!This place has been here a while, and I used to live in this area.  My parents still do so I frequent the area often.  This is most definitely the nicest of neighborhood bars in the area! Clean, roomy, great menu...everything!  I wish this place was around when I was still living here.  The entire strip mall is actually somewhat "new".  If I still lived here I'd go more often for sure.Came here for lunch on a Tuesday...pretty dead, but the service was great, and friendly!!! I saw some video somewhere (I can't think of the source) but it featured their cheese curds... way better than Culvers!  You can't really score that great of cheese curds south of the Wisconsin border but these were up to par!!! SOOOOOO good!!!!My lunch of chicken fingers with a side of tots was great!  And how can you pass fried oreos for dessert and NOT order them??? Yep...got those too!  The quality is a bit higher than regular ol' bar food.  I suggest checking this place out!

6.description: Stopped by earlier for a bite, it's in my neighborhood. Great sliders, nice people and a really neat space. The hall to the restrooms had some thoughtful and interesting photos, neat stuff to look at. I'll be back, hope they stick around. I like yelp but hate the naysayers that pull the ratings down based on one experience which was most likely a mistake. Just had to add that because I'm surprised they only have an overall rating of three stars. Maybe some of those folks complaining should just go to Subway, it is next door after all. Next time I'd like to go with a huge group and try a bite of every app on the menu, they all looked great! Same for the desserts...

22.description: Good hot food! Great customer service and the decor is awesome! I wanna come back and try more ... Today was the cheese curds, tots with my burger ...only down side was I ordered medium well and it wasn't but it still was juicy and delicious! So not holding it against em

15.description: Great place to go.   Friendly staff.   Karaoke with Shane is second to none.  Great sound, huge selection of songs and top notch singers.   Great selection of food and drink specials.  Clean and welcoming.   I love the outdoor seating in the summer.   It's convenient because you can bring your drink outside if you step out to smoke or vape.   I strongly recommend Mo Dailey's.

57.description: I've been here a couple times, once to drink and once to actually eat a meal. The first time went just fine - we sat at the bar and got served right away. The second time was a complete DISASTER.My fiance and I met up with a couple of friends at the restaurant. We got there first and decided to get a table. As we stood in the doorway of the place, no one approached us, or even looked at us. After a couple minutes of standing there, we decided to find our own table amidst the other patrons (There honestly weren't that many). After sitting down, NO ONE APPROACHED US, even though the waitress walked past our table multiple times. Finally, we asked the bartender for a menu, and she said the waitress would be with us shortly.When our friends arrived, the waitress finally came to our table. We ordered our drinks, and 10 minutes later, she brings two of the four drinks to us (we would've gotten quicker service simply going to the bar 2 feet behind us), and tells us that they have run out of the beer we requested. Okay - so I order a Black and Tan, and we proceed to order our food. Over ten minutes later, she brings it to me, and it's a glass of straight Guinness that tastes like it was sitting in the backroom for days. Whatever, I won't complain, I don't want spit in my food. Finally, over 20 minutes later (I don't know why we didn't just leave at this point), we receive our food. My fiance and I got cheeseburgers that were mushy and undercooked; my vegetarian friend ordered a Chicken Caesar Salad but told them she didn't want the chicken, so what did they give her? The chicken... And her boyfriend ordered Fish and Chips and ended up with a Fish sandwich. Seriously??? We tell the waitress that our orders were incorrect, and she says "Sorry, they are having problems in the kitchen." She then says the manager will comp the Fish and Chips since it was completely the wrong order. My friend had to WALK UP TO HER to get the check because she literally avoided our table, and the check did NOT comp anything. We approached an older bartender to ask us for help and she told us that she "can't do anything, go talk to a manager." That was the last straw. We paid the bill even though we should've just walked out, left NO tip, ate McDonald's for dinner, and promised ourselves we will never EVER return.

20.description: Any place that serves tater tots as a side is fine by me!!!This place has been here a while, and I used to live in this area.  My parents still do so I frequent the area often.  This is most definitely the nicest of neighborhood bars in the area! Clean, roomy, great menu...everything!  I wish this place was around when I was still living here.  The entire strip mall is actually somewhat "new".  If I still lived here I'd go more often for sure.Came here for lunch on a Tuesday...pretty dead, but the service was great, and friendly!!! I saw some video somewhere (I can't think of the source) but it featured their cheese curds... way better than Culvers!  You can't really score that great of cheese curds south of the Wisconsin border but these were up to par!!! SOOOOOO good!!!!My lunch of chicken fingers with a side of tots was great!  And how can you pass fried oreos for dessert and NOT order them??? Yep...got those too!  The quality is a bit higher than regular ol' bar food.  I suggest checking this place out!

36.description: Someone convinced me to try it again... server was nice but she was the only person waiting every table AND bartending. So we didn't say anything when the appetizer was cold. But we both ordered medium, to medium rare burgers, & it was more well done than a grandma's meatloaf. 3rd time won't be the charm

14.description: If you like gravel and rubberbands in your food, then this is your place! I'm not even kidding, and not much of a reviewer but after this experience last Sunday 4/12/15, I had to share.Typical slow service was expected but when one from our group pulled a dime sized rock out of her mouth from her grilled chicken ceasar wrap, it took a serious turn for the worst. The manager had it re-made on the fly and minutes later, my boyfriend pulled out 2 black pieces of gravel from his mouth. He also took a re-order and half way through his 2nd chicken ceasar wrap, pulled out a 2in round sized rubberband. How does that even happen?! Can that be an accident?! Doubt it but seeing as the manager did not show her face to our table again, she probably didn't have a clue. Pretty rude and rediculous.Another order at our table were the sliders which were not even edible. The buns were so hard that even after banging them on the table, not a dent was made. Two others barely got their food, those came at the end around the time the rubberband shenanigans happened.I'm seriously concerned about the food quality and standards for everything in this kitchen so if you like your teeth and health, I'd avoid this place.Thankfully we did not have a bill but I still feel as though we got punked.

58.description: They now have NO-CHIP manicures...$40.00!!In some of my favorite OPI colors..."Really Not A Waitress""Lincoln Park After Dark""Bubble Bath"etc.If you get a pedicure ask to see the "Disco Lights" in the foot tub.Speaking of a pedicure, they have a special "Spa Wrap Pedicure" for ten dollars extra...they gel up your legs (twice) and wrap them in plastic and hot towels....mmmmmmm. I'm melting.In addition Rose is becoming quite popular for Spa parties with BYOB! What's not to love?

56.description: I'm not a regular patron of these kinds of establishments, but I needed to get some busted nails fixed before a big event. Rose fit me into a busy day, listened to what I needed, and hey voila, perfect nails. The price was right, they know what they're doing, they're clean and polite, and you'll look good for weeks. Go for it1

29.description: This is the worse nail salon!!! I got a no chip manicure on Friday and it started chipping the next day!!! My nails are all cracking and it hasn't been a week. I did not use a credit card so I can't go back for a refund. The lady next to me was telling me the no chip last 4 weeks - my lady must have missed a step. For the price of the no chip I should have just went somewhere on southport! Really disappointed!
