42.description: Love love love this place!! Rose is a sweetheart and all the ladies are very pleasant. The shop is nicely decorated and SPOTLESS!! Pedicures are top- notch never rushed the massage chairs are wonderful not the cheapy vibrating ones the nice full massage ones. Designs are free which is unheard of and so beautiful! These ladies are artists. I live in Wauconda and it is definitely worth the drive.

23.description: Tina just gave me one of the best pedicures I've ever had, no joke. She was amazing. She was very detailed and didn't rush through the process like a lot of people do when people are waiting. She did an amazing exfoliating scrub on my legs and topped i off with a killer leg massage.When I walked in today, the place was jam packed but I was still able to get right in. I will for sure be back to see Tina!

47.description: Rose Nails is awesome!  Betty is the best, always providing friendly service and she does an EXCELLENT job.  I am very picky about my nails and Betty always makes sure they turn out exactly as I want them.  PLUS, you can't beat the price!  They close at 7 p.m. but will stay in the evening and take as many customers as walk in the door, sometimes until 9 p.m. or later.  The salon is clean, relaxing and not intimidating.  If you're looking for awesome service (the best I've ever had at a nail salon) and perfect nails for a great price, try them out!

8.description: Pleasantly surprised that I would love a place on my very first visit! First off, customer service is definitely a priority here! I called to schedule an appointment for a mani/pedi on a Saturday afternoon, they took me in with no problem. I got Kim and she is so sweet! She took her time on my feet and hands. She made sure to let her know whether I was happy or not with anything. She wanted to make sure everything was done right and how I wanted. I loved hearing that! The other staff were friendly too. Rose Nails just got a new returning customer!

31.description: They always do a great job!  Everyone is so nice and kind. I just wish they had a bigger selection of nail polish colors, therefore I sometimes I bring my own color.

34.description: I called on Saturday for a Sunday appointment.  You don't need an appointment, but I thought I wouldn't take a chance seeing that it was the weekend.  I didn't have to wait at all upon arrival.  The massaging chairs are fantastic and my pedicure is lovely.  The massage was a little rough.  Next time I will tell her to use less pressure.  You can't beat the price!

16.description: LOVE Rose's nail salon! Rose herself is as sweet as they come. She's always willing to stay late or open early to get you an appointment if you need one. It's usually very busy, but it moves quickly. For as busy as they are, thy still know everyone by name. Pretty rare these days. Now to the nails. I've gotten the absolute best pedicure here hands down. A ton of polish to choose from and awesome massaging chairs. I did get a no-chip that I wasn't pleased with, but I think the polish was old vs. the tech doing it wrong. Even my husband goes here!

13.description: I moved into the Jefferson Park area in 2011 and needed a  new nail salon. I am very particular about where I get my manis and pedis so when I came to Rose Nails hoping for the best. Well, it was! I've now been coming her since 2011 and each time I like my nails. Rose is very friendly and so are most of the nail techs.  They are very busy especially on the weekend so you may wait a little but you can make an appointment. I will not go anywhere else. I like that they disinfect their tools and the place is clean. This is the only place I get my nails done.

11.description: I needed to get a quick manicure on my lunch hour. I found this was close to my office so gave them a try. They got me in right away, Jenny and Rose were very friendly. It appeared to be a clean place and my nails look great. Only $10 for the manicure, I am used to higher prices, but the manicure was just as good.

39.description: I've been going to Rose since she opened about 8 years ago and I will only go to her salon. Rosie is the best and takes great care of her clients. Her place is clean and everyone is friendly. She gets to know everyone so well and her client's happiness is most important. She is so accommodating and will work late just to get people in and ready for their special occasion or regular mani/pedi.  Rose Nails does the best nails in Chicago!

37.description: Was looking for a manicure shop, close to where I live now.  I came across the many wonderful reviews Yelp had for Rose Nails.  I made an appointment for the next day.  I was warmly greeted and was soon escorted to my mani chair.  My cuticles were expertly cleaned, nails beautifully filed into shape.  The manicurist took her time and polished my nails to perfection!  All this for the very reasonable cost of $10.00.  Needless to say I recommend Rose Nails highly!  I will return there, but my mani still looks terrific!  Anne H.

0.description: I come here because I'm able to book appointments because I'm always running on a schedule. I get my pedicures done by Kim and she is so sweet. She does a great job.

38.description: Wow! Today was my first time to Rose Nails but, what fantastic customer service they have!! I got acrylics and a pedicure and both look great. The ladies kept asking if I was enjoying my service and the price was very reasonable. I will definitely come back!!

51.description: My friend has been going here for a long time and after dinner at a place right down the street, we came here for a little pampering.  The place was hopping but upon entering, the technicians said hello and they even know my friend by name!  She got a mani/pedi and I only got a mani.  I was able to sit next to my friend during her pedicure and use the massage chair while chatting.  When a technician was available for my manicure, I got one of the most detailed manicures I've had in a while.  She took her time but it didn't feel long.  I picked out OPI Mrs. O'Leery's BBQ and I love the color.  The cost?  $10.  You can not beat that price and hospitality.  It's about 20 minutes away from my house but I'm coming here for my manicures!

27.description: I've been a happy customer here for several years now.  $34 for a mani/pedi is a deal!  I stopped going to those other places that charged $60+ and the polish was chipped within a few days.  And even though I loved those nail techs as well, I just couldn't warrant paying that much any more.  I'm happy with Rose's nail techs and I've never had to wait very long.  It's a win-win!

32.description: So I was looking for something close to home to get a quick pedicure because I was in desperate need, but also a little sick.  I checked yelp and this seemed to be the place!  My toes look great($25) and when I started to have a coughing fit, the technician (whose name I will get next time) told me to keep coughing it will make you feel better.  How nice!  Then as I was leaving, Rosie(who I think is a manger/owner) asked me again if I wanted a manicure.  I didn't, once they chip I will pick all of the color off making it a waste.  I saw a sign for a type of no-chip that claimed to be gentle on the nails, I said maybe I would do that next time.  Rosie told me that all no-chip are the same, and that I was better off just getting a manicure(which is the cheaper option anyhow).  Then she looked at my nails and said that she just needed to file them because this was her job and my nails hurt her eyes, so she did just that, for no charge!   I will definitely be returning to Rose Nails and bringing my friend with!

54.description: I came in on a Sunday afternoon, definitely later than the stated 4pm closing time on the door.  I thought maybe, just maybe they might still be open.  She (Rose) was kind enough to do my pedicure, and she didn't at all rush through it (she was also finishing up a manicure).  She took her time, was so very friendly and pleasant, and when even when I was drying and trying to rush out because they were obviously closing for the day and cleaning up, she gently told me to sit and relax, not to worry, that they weren't leaving yet.  And wow, that massage chair was absolutely wonderful and I loved my pedicure (first one in 2 1/2 yrs).  I'll definitely be back!  Rose is awesome :)

48.description: This was my go to nail salon when I lived up in Jefferson Park. A $10 manicure? You just can't beat that! On top of the already awesome price, they'll give you a loyalty card where after a certain number of manicures, you get one for free!The manicures there are always well done and last a while before chipping. I got a french mani-pedi there before my wedding, and it lasted through the honeymoon even though I was constantly in the pool and I went snorkeling.The women are very professional and everything is very clean. They aren't the most chatty ladies I've ever met, but that's fine by me. I usually went with a friend anyways, so we would mostly just talk to each other.Do make an appointment if you know you want to go ahead of time. While week nights aren't particularly busy, it can get pretty full on weekends, and the place isn't that big. I saw a reviewer suggest making this place BYOB...now that's an idea I'll try out next time!

44.description: My daughter was in a panic because she need to get her nails done before her college tour the next morning. It was 8pm, she called Rose Nails and they told her to come in, the owner will wait for her. This is the first time I had my nails done at Rose Nails and I extremely impressed by the service and attention to detail. They didn't rushed us, they didn't do a rush job, just took their time and made sure we were satisfied. All this for $10.00, WOW!I have been to esthetically nicer salons but they have lack the professionalism that comes with customer service. We were constantly rushed and they never asked us if we were satisfiedLove Rose and her team, we will definitely be back.

24.description: This place is truly like a family. They remember your name, your kids' names, what you do for a living, etc. Rose's warm greetings are always so great. They're willing to go above and beyond for their customers. I've had a couple of messed-up manicures and they fix them right away with no complaints, but with empathy! Best prices in town, too.

7.description: My first time coming here, not sure why I didn't come any sooner. I LOVE MY NAILS! After going to Lee Nails at Six Corners, I needed a fill in after THREE DAYS. The result at the time wasn't great and I left unhappy and upset for not saying anything(review & pics are listed under their business ). Did a search and found Rose Nails, just around the corner from me. I'm absolutely IN LOVE with my nails. I was skeptical at first, thought I was going to have another bad experience since I waited 15min. but they were busy after all.  Once seated, I met Jenny and she did what she knows best. I took a peek at the prices for other services and they're not too shabby.  I'll be going back for a pedi

49.description: The place was nice and clean, and the people had a great attitude, but my nails are totally messed up.  I had them take off my overlay and reapply my gel overlay and now it has chipped off, the nails are different thickness from nail to nail, and there's gel on the back of my nails.  Added to the fact that it took an extreme amount of time to get done.  The people are nice, but that doesn't do me a bit of good if my nails are right.  I won't be going back.

40.description: Loved it here!   Ro, Rose, Ann were all great!!!   Thet were all very friendly, very nice, and very personable.  Ann did a great job on my overly abused hands and feet!P.s.  The massage chairs are awesome!

53.description: This place is exremely clean. The decor is updated so you do really get a spa-type feel when you come in.  Rose, the owner, is a very sweet woman who really cares about her business.  In terms of  service, this place is an absolute 5 star place.So a few weeks before I started working in the hospital,  I came in for a no-chip manicure.  I was advised that they really may not hold up and last as long, and was encouraged to have gel applied instead.  The end result was fabulous.  But  the terrible part is that the drill bit they used to smooth out the ridges in my nails--- left deep, moon- crescent indentations! It took months before they grew out entirely. Even using a buffer to smooth out the ridges couldn't take the crescent indents away.I might just be meticulous about how my nails look, but after that I"d rather paint my own nails. I get bored easily and hate chipping, so I change my color every 2-3 days.  Otherwise, I'll still come back for pedicures. It's not 100% for me, but I really do think this is an awesome spot. Out of other salons I've tried, this place does give the best service. Even when coming in near closing, they strive to do a really good job. I came in once just before 8 and they didn't finish with me until 9.

30.description: BEST nail salon. I've never really committed to a nail salon but if I could, I would marry Rose nails.  They are always super cheery and are each genuinely nice.  My nails always come out good and best of all will last on averaged for ten to even fourteen days- which says a lot because I abuse my nails for a living.  I can wholeheartedly recommend any of the ladies to you, Rose and Ann being my go-tos.  If you're doing your eyebrows I would see Rose!

46.description: I went today after reading all the positive reviews, and I can only say thank you.  The shop was VERY clean and the staff was wonderful. I came in as a walk-in and was taken care of immediately.  I was greeted very kindly and since I was new to getting any type of manicures or tips I asked quite a few question. Rose, the owner sat and explained everything to me. Rose also gave me suggestions to keep my hands healthy and get the most out of my manicure.  I will definitely be returning to Rose's and would recommended it to anyone. My next visit will be in 2 weeks for fill ins. I can not say enough positive things about my experience today.

1.description: I was in the area and stopped in in a whim due to the high reviews without an appointment. There were a few ladies waiting and talking with each other about how long they had been waiting. After waiting myself an hour, I was starting to wonder if I made the right decision not to bounce.Got a pedi and a no chip manicure for $55 and I was very very happy how long my stylist took with my winter worn feet. Most of the women that worked there knew customers names and asked about their families.  Overall I loved this place and its turned out to be actually worth the wait. I can see why this is a local favorite. The long wait makes this 4 stars.

55.description: I can't say enough good things about Rose nails. I had been faithful to another chain (that shall remain nameless) in the area for years until I had multiple bad experiences. Went to Rose on a recommendation from a friend and can't believe I waited this long! Service is fabulous! Rose tries hard to remember each repeat client and does her best to make new clients feel as though they're regulars. Good massage chairs, great selection of colors, and no chip nail polish! Prices are very competitive and all the girls do great work. They don't rush you out like in other places and pay attention to detail. Very clean they handle rushes of people without breaking a sweat. They accept credit cards, but tips are cash only. They're located in a mini strip mall and parking is usually available. Definitely the place to go for a relaxing mani/pedi.

9.description: It was a nice experience.  The nail tech that I had was named Jenny. She was thorough,  didn't rush through the pedicure I requested. The other nail techs were also friendly. There's a stamp card where on your 11th visit you get $5 off. I'll definitely return.

26.description: Rose Nails was recommended to me by a friend. I had a pedicure, done by Kim. She was fantastic! I asked her to pay extra attention to my calluses and dry heels, and the result was above and beyond my expectations! she scrubbed and exfoliated for the longest time, and I could tell she was really paying attention to make sure she smoothed all the rough spots. She also took a lot of time to shape the nails and trim my cuticles and other dead skin. Her paint job was great as well. I left with my feet feeling super clean and smooth, not just like someone had slathered some lotion on them and painted my nails. This is the kind of pedicure I love, because I feel like my feet were taken care of and given the maintenance they needed. I also had my eyebrows waxed by Betty. I like that she kept them fuller. Most places wax them so thin! my only small complaint is that I wish she had trimmed them a bit as well. I met the owner, Rose, on my way out after paying. I told her how happy I was with my services and how impressed I was that almost every person who came through the door while I was there was a regular customer whom she knew by name. She was very gracious. I told her I would leave another shining review on yelp and that she'd be seeing me again!

25.description: I would recommend Rose Nails to anyone. Not only does Rose provide excellent service to make sure her clients leave happy but the technicians do a great job as we'll. my 1st experience was awesome went in with my cousin who was getting her nails done and while i was waiting Rose noticed I had a chipped nail so she insisted to put another cost of nail polish with no charge. Now thats service!

12.description: Me and my wife both went for a pedicure. I had never had one before and enjoyed getting my feet scrubbed and cleaned up! The price was great and the staff was kind!

59.description: Having just moved to the area from Lincoln Park I've been looking for a good nail salon. I've been to Rose's two or three times and it is by far the best salon in the area: Rose is very nice, she greets you and makes you feel welcome. All the techs that I have had have been very good. Even like the massage chairs and TV going. Price is reasonable for the quality. The ONLY thing that I dislike (and I've noticed that alot of the salons in this area do this as well) is that after they massage all that nice lotion into your hands, they tell you to go wash your hands. I can't stand that. For one, it interrupts my relaxation and second, it washes all the lotion off. I find myself grabbing lotion on as soon as I get home because my hands are dry. The exceptional nail salons use a wet cloth and polish remover to get the lotion off just your nails, leaving your hands feeling soft and silky and smelling yummy. If Rose's salon didn't make you wash all the lotion off your hands, it would be on my list of exceptional salons! But I would still go back at the last minute, I'd just be sure to bring a bottle of lotion with me to reapply after the manicure.

21.description: Looking at my receipt: I was here on 7/7/14, to Rose Nails, on 5787 N Milwaukee Avenue. Today is 8/20/14. I don't get pedicures or manicures very often (but I take good care of my nails-they are very short, so the manicurist doesn't really have to do a lot), so my boyfriend and I saw the positive reviews & decided to treat ourselves, and being that we were in this area of Chicago, we went here. My boyfriend got his toenails painted, and I got a pedicure & manicure. All in all we paid about $60 for services, and $11 in tip. Pros: Ladies were kind, courteous, nice massage chairs, good selection of polish, cool airCons: Only 1: They do NOT have nail dryers, they have these cheapie 3 inch mini fans that they sell at dollar stores, so you have to sit with your toes curled up off the floor and your hands in claw like positions to get your nails to dry.  And you just sit there and sit there, and finally 16 minutes later (yes I timed it), I ask my worker--Can I go? And she didn't even check my nails and yes. So my bf pays (because I know not to dip my hands in my purse), and we walk out the door and I carefully  open the car door and my pointer finger smudges immediately! So I go back in there and ask if they can fix it...My lady says: "What did you do? You not supposed to touch anything when you leave here." Um REALLY? I think you are wrong. So instead of fixing it, she kind of smooths it over and adds more polish to it. I sit again for 9minutes this time--and then my lady comes over and says "OK, you fine, "and not even checking the hardness. I walk out of there, irked. I get home and 2 days later, my polish is flaking off. Do you know what kind of job I have? I type, copy and fax things. After 1 week my nails look like I work in construction. Yes, to say the least.. I was very unhappy with this business.

17.description: The staff here is extremely friendly and helpful. I often treat the ladies in my family to mani/pedi days here; we are regulars and will remain so. Sometimes there is a slight wait, but the staff is always readily communicating any updates always very accomodating. Thanks to everyone at rose nails!

10.description: Tina just gave me one of the best pedicures I've ever had, no joke. She was amazing. She was very detailed and didn't rush through the process like a lot of people do when people are waiting. She did an amazing exfoliating scrub on my legs and topped i off with a killer leg massage.When I walked in today, the place was jam packed but I was still able to get right in. I will for sure be back to see Tina!

5.description: The ladies here are super sweet and show gratitude for your business. I gave 3 stars because I recieved the no chip manicure and the painting wasn't as nice as I wanted it to be. There are lumps in the paint (not noticeable if you glance at them). I don't like to give bad reviews especially when the employees are wonderful, however, I have to be honest. I will go back and I will make sure the manicurist is aware of my slight disappointment.

3.description: This was my first time going to Rose Nails and I really enjoyed talking to my nail girl Vy..she was very sweet and professional. I loved her attention to detail and quality. I got a no-chip manicure and a regular pedicure. I am so happy to have found a nail place close to my house and I look forward to seeing Vy again.

35.description: I love going here to get my nails done. They do a great job epically there manicurist Betty!!

19.description: Fantastic experience !  Rose is super kind and the staff so friendly.  This place has a very positive energy.  I like that it is clean and they even have warm towels to dry your hands after you wash them.  Highly recommended.

28.description: Love Rose nails. I'm new to the city and was looking for a place to get my nails done before a wedding. I used yelp to help me find a nail salon and luckily Rose nails was right up the street. I have sense been to Rose nails at least 6 times, I've never made an appointment, always just walk in and i'm always greeted and helped almost immediately. Rose is always super sweet and everyone else always smiles and is really inviting and nice. I got lucky to find this gem on Milwaukee Ave, and for the prices I won't go anywhere else! Thanks Rose Nails!!!!

45.description: First off they do good work, some better then others, but I can get good pedi/mani's elsewhere. What makes me upset about this place is what probably makes them good. They have a lot of regulars and show them more attention then people who have been there about 6 times now (that would be me). The last time I went Rose, the owner I am assuming, gave some woman more attention then she did with me. She sat her in the pedicure chair first to soak even though I was getting a pedi as well...It didn't look seem like she had an appointment either. On the same last visit Rose did my mani and maybe she does a good job on others but she globbed on my paint. Then she lectured me on biting my nail (I don't bite my nails I just cut them really short but thanks for assuming) Why I keep going there I don't know...The last 3 times I went I waited for an hour....an HOUR! That's my fault for sitting there and not making an appointment.The place is clean-yesThe price is decent-yesThe service is ok-yesBut I don't feel like waiting for an hour to get things done or get lectured like I'm 7.

33.description: Came here for a manicure and a color change on my toes because I read all the great reviews on here and because they only charge $10 for a manicure.  I called and scheduled an appointment the day before for 11:30.... I waited until 12:10 to be taken care of.  When I finally sat down for my manicure, the guy who did my nails was super slow & didn't talk and when he did I could hardly him.  He did the normal 2 coats of nail polish but they were VERY thick layers; not to mention it looked like a kid painted my nails.  I might as well done it myself.  It was at least a half hour after he did my nail that I left.  After AN hour of drying my nails, they were all smudging because he put so much polish on.  I finally decided to just take nail polish and take it all off - total waste of money!!  I guess it is true.... you get what you pay for.The color change on my toes was fine (no complaints about that)... because one of the young girls who works there did that.Definitely will not go back...

43.description: Good work but rude customer service by the nail techs. The tech I had seemed disinterested and depressed.  She then busted out her cell phone to play games after she was done with my nails.  She didn't bother to mute her phone. There are plenty of nail salons including one that is less than a mile away that is 1000x better.  I won't be back.

2.description: I went to rose once before and she did a great job. This time I'm not so please. I came in four days ago for a no chip.The two fingers on my left hand were awful. And my pinkie as well. She also glued nearly all my fingernails to my skin.I might come back for a manicure but not for a no chip.

18.description: Rose Nails was recommended to me by a friend. I had a pedicure, done by Kim. She was fantastic! I asked her to pay extra attention to my calluses and dry heels, and the result was above and beyond my expectations! she scrubbed and exfoliated for the longest time, and I could tell she was really paying attention to make sure she smoothed all the rough spots. She also took a lot of time to shape the nails and trim my cuticles and other dead skin. Her paint job was great as well. I left with my feet feeling super clean and smooth, not just like someone had slathered some lotion on them and painted my nails. This is the kind of pedicure I love, because I feel like my feet were taken care of and given the maintenance they needed. I also had my eyebrows waxed by Betty. I like that she kept them fuller. Most places wax them so thin! my only small complaint is that I wish she had trimmed them a bit as well. I met the owner, Rose, on my way out after paying. I told her how happy I was with my services and how impressed I was that almost every person who came through the door while I was there was a regular customer whom she knew by name. She was very gracious. I told her I would leave another shining review on yelp and that she'd be seeing me again!

41.description: Best place to get your nails done on the northwest sitde!  The place is immaculate!  Rose is a doll!  The girl's are really artists.  The designs are free which is amazing and they do beautiful work.  the pedicure chairs are top notch.  Can't beat their prices!  Highly rcommend Rose Nails!!

52.description: Worst experience ever! I went there for a polish change on my toes and a manicure. It took a total of 15 minutes for both! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?! The girl didn't ask me what I wanted (shape or length) and cut my toes nails so short that they hurt. During my manicure she pushed my cuticles back with this sharp tool and cut me more than once... never apologized I should say. My hand massage was not even 30 seconds long (and let's be honest I can paint my own nails the reason we go get our nails done is to relax a bit) So upset with this place I will NOT be back.. Lee Nails is down the street and they give you a hot towel, a nice long massage, and a MUCH cleaner atmosphere. If you do choose to go to this place do not see the younger girl there see one of the older ladies they seemed much friendlier! Needless to say I left with sore toe nails, scraped up finger, cuts on my fingers, a very sour attitude towards this place. Choose somewhere else.

50.description: I worked in a salon through college and I know a thing or to about nail services.  I got a manicure there on super bowl Sunday and was very impressed.  The woman listened to how I preferred it to be done and executed the work flawlessly.  She showed great attention to detail on my cuticles and the polish lasted over a week!  For me that is really impressive, since as soon as I see the first chip, I take all the polish off.  The manicure is ONLY $10!!! Even with a $5 tip, I'm still paying 25% less that what I would normally pay for a manicure ALONE!  The woman that I was with wasn't much of a talker, but that's OK, she was friendly and willing to talk if you brought subjects up. Plus I would rather have a great manicure by someone who is focusing on their work, than a shoddy one by someone who is more focused on telling you about their woes..

4.description: Great manicure for only $10! Mine lasted a good two weeks. Everyone is so nice & do a great job!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND

6.description: A Very disappointed !!!! Came in for a mani pedi by far the worst service ever. I been here before and the service was much better. I didn't get the nail tech name but after asking her to cut down my nails she said OK but didn't and only file and she went to put my shoes on when I asked you don't apply lotion and oil and she said she did when I said she didn't she said oh sorry I forgot. Didn't even feel like I had a pedicure.  I said I just wanted to leave and she said it was a $15 charge.

22.description: LOVE Rose's nail salon! Rose herself is as sweet as they come. She's always willing to stay late or open early to get you an appointment if you need one. It's usually very busy, but it moves quickly. For as busy as they are, thy still know everyone by name. Pretty rare these days. Now to the nails. I've gotten the absolute best pedicure here hands down. A ton of polish to choose from and awesome massaging chairs. I did get a no-chip that I wasn't pleased with, but I think the polish was old vs. the tech doing it wrong. Even my husband goes here!

15.description: I got my nails done here for St. Patrick's Day and Rose did an awesome job! I asked for clovers on my nails and even though they had never painted those on nails before, she took the time to draw a few out and was able to give me what i asked for! Thank you Rose : )

57.description: I have been going to Rose for about 5 years now.  Rose is the most personable person I know! She is so thankful for your business. All the nail technicians are great. On busy weekends Rose herself pulls up a chair and does mani and pedis. The manicures and pedicures are done well and do last!! Even though Rose is only open until 8pm, if you call and say you need to come later, she will stay open for you!!!You can get a mani/pedi for $34 and for $32 if you pay cash!!!This place is fab!!

20.description: Needed a quick pedicure and was lucky to get a pedicure by the owner Rose. She was so sweet and took her time in pampering my feet with a great foot scrub and a little massage. She made sure that my nails were polished perfectly and that I was satisfied with the service.

36.description: Roses nails does a great job with pedicures!  And the price for the mani/pedi combo keeps me coming back. There have been a few times where I have had to wait a while as a walk in but I'm always happy with the finished product.

14.description: My favorite place to come get manicures and pedicures! I am always happy when I walk out of Rosie's!

3.description: I recently had Ridgewood Gardens do my daughters bridal shower. The flowers were stunning and all my guests commented on how beautiful everything was. Their attention to detail and all the extra gems they included made the centerpieces un forgettable.

1.description: I ordered a funeral spray for my Uncle on January 5, 2016 to be delivered to the funeral home 3 days later, this was NOT a last minute order.  I was very specific about what I wanted including the fact that I want a ribbon on the arrangement that read Beloved Uncle.  The spray was $150. so it was not cheap.  The spray was delivered without the ribbon and the following morning many of the flowers were curled and dead.  I was very embarrassed.  I called Ridgewood Gardens to express my displeasure I was told "what can we do, cut flowers die and we cannot be responsible." I was also told that Christina, who guaranteed me I would be very happy with my order, was on vacation for two weeks and I would have to call back and speak to her.  I am very dissatisfied with the flowers and service.  I would not use or recommend Ridgewood Florist.  I'm sure there are other florists in the area that would do a much better job.

2.description: I have worked with Ridgewood Gardens for several years and they never let me down. They are extremely creative and always have beautiful and unique designs. They have great customer service no matter if I am ordering a single arrangement or multiple center pieces for an event. I never have to worry about the quality and beauty of the flowers - it has always been superior. They go above and beyond and would highly recommend them for all of your flower needs. GREAT place to shop and find the most unusual flowers and garden accessories.

5.description: We used Ridgewood for a funeral flower order, and I have to say the experience was not favorable. I spoke with Christina and she let me know she would be the one helping me and designing my flower order. The flowers turned out beautiful. We ordered a fairly large wreath of white flowers and they looked much nicer than in the photo. However, I dictated over the phone and spelled out each name that should be signed on the card, and she did not get it right. She left off 1 name and misspelled another (misspelled "ryan" as "rayan"). Since this was for a wake/funeral, it's pretty unacceptable that someone be left off the card. Like I said, flowers were beautiful, but they certainly didn't make up for the book keeping issues.

6.description: Ridgewood Gardens is the best place for flowers and plants.  Despite if you want cut flowers, flower arrangements, planted flowers, plants etc, you will find whatever you want here.  They have flowers from all around the world and if you are looking for a particular flower from another country the owner can purchase them for you through her international connections.  All of the flowers are fragrant, fresh and beautiful.  Whenever you walk into one of the green houses you can small all the flowers unlike most places where the flowers have no smell at all.  Best of all the owner treats all of her customers like family and the staff is friendly as well.

0.description: We needed a funeral spray last minute - same day - on a Sunday. Ridgewood was one of the few places around that was open on a Sunday. They took our order about 3 hours before the wake began, and still offered to customize it for us. Thank you, Christina and Ridgewood, for the excellent customer service. The spray was beautiful. We look forward to patronizing come Spring for our patio planters!

4.description: I love shopping here for special occasions and flowers for the summer to display around my home they design everything every year I bring my pots in and they make beautiful arrangements that will not break your pockets  the owner always makes me smile and I feel well appreciated and taken care of when I'm shopping there I am very pleased with this establishment and I recommend this place all the time for all needs whether it's a last minute bouquet of flowers or a funeral or wedding they've got you covered 100 percent!!!!

3.description: Horrible customer service. The "Sandwich Nazi" is the best description of the guy working behind the glass. He doesn't listen to what you are ordering and acts like it offends him that you want your order correct. Stay clear of this place!

1.description: Okay. Obviously I meant WITHOUT the sandwich.  Damn auto text correction!!  I'm not a thief dammit!!!!!

2.description: Service here is HORRIBLE!! The guy that makes the sandwiches is rude and doesn't want to be there. If he doesn't like being there then maybe he should find another job that doesn't require him doing anyone. He slams the ingredients, doesn't listen to the order, and has a huge attitude. I walked in to get some sandwiches for a trip and he looks bothered every time someone walks into his restaurant. While he was making the sandwiches he stood behind the counter cracking jokes about people in a different language and got my order wrong. HORRIBLE and racist! Never coming back.

9.description: Very lazy workers. Never a good experience here, walked out last 2 times. There seems to be a trend with the creep working behind the counter.  Lazy, rude, disrespectful, nasty, dirty, creepy, perverted (oogling young girls trying to order), I can go on and on. I don't understand how someone can keep the guy on payroll. The food is average subway, if you can make it through the ordering process with these morons working here.

10.description: Everytime I come here the guy working is the most angry, poorest sandwich maker. It was completely empty at 9pm on a Saturday and he is just barking at us and throwing ingrediants onto the sandwich.  There are way better Subways in the area and this guy just completely lost my business.

4.description: I must have gotten the same bitter guy as the last reviewer. I did not have a chance to eat breakfast at home and decided to stop here on my way to work. The store was empty and I received no greeting when I entered and the young man actually looked bothered that someone came in and made him work. I asked for their 3 inch breakfast sandwich on flatbread...he grabs the regular footlong bread when I correct him that I wanted the flat bread..he goes to the back and came back and threw the flatbread into the counter and continued on to angrily pile on the ingredients to make the sandwich...he was just very very rude and then when he charged me..I realized that he had made a 6 inch not a three inch...I normally wouldn't have cared for the mistake and paid the $1 difference but just because he was so grouchy and rude, I did dispute it and reminded him that it was HIS mistake not mine that he hadn't listened and started rushing through the process. Needless to say....there is no way I will be making a stop ever again to this particular subway store with this very disgruntled worker.

6.description: My review pretty much mirrors that of Cheryl's and Adri's. I stopped in here recently to grab a sandwich before work. The gentleman who was working just seemed disgruntled at the fact there was one customer coming into order. I felt as if I disturbed him by ordering here. He started making my sandwich and when he asked if I wanted it toasted, I said "no". Then he turns around immediately and throws it in the toaster. He was so unsocial and rude that I didn't argue the fact and paid so I could get to work on time. There was another time a friend and I had come in here late night (2-3am) to enjoy some late night sandwiches. As soon as we grabbed our food to sit down, the employee asked if we were really eating inside, to which we said yes. He said okay and walked away angrily. About 10 minutes in he says to us "you guys need to finish in 10 minutes, I have to mop". We felt pretty offended, but we said okay. Soon enough, he brings the mop out and starts mopping around us. So we understand that as the cue to leave. As long as this subway has this poor customer service and employees who are very rude, they have lost my business completely. I would refer everyone down to the Subway at the corner of Milwaukee and Nagle. The staff is much more friendly and always seem to have a smile on their faces.

11.description: they used to have a guy here who took 20secs and made a great sandwich...now there are some girls there who rush around like chickens with their heads cut off who make not so great sandwiches...im just about done ladies

5.description: I know. 4 for a subway is a bit  much. but here's why.These guys are open 24hours!! Ugh. I love. I work as a PM shift RN... This means I leave work at about midnight. Good luck finding something healthier to eat when Chicago becomes "Fast Food-ville" right?? So i'm really happy these guys are a 24hr joint.Anyway. My caution is this: be careful with the avocado. I've been served unripened avocado a couple of times from these guys; I mean cmon. If your knife aint slicing it and you're hacking wishing it were a machete.... maybe it's time to give it up.  But.... still.I'm a fan of any place open after midnight. Otherwise, typical Subway. So three stars for Subway, extra star for being open late. It's pretty clean in here and they aren't ridiculous with portions for veggies. (No salad sandwiches here).

7.description: Really, it's 24 hours?!eating good late night....nice!

8.description: I like to imagine the "sandwich-nista"  getting hit by a car. This place sucks, the guy that makes the subs sucks, and well...the guy sucks.  I don't know if he has a superiority complex or a little man complex, possibly both, but he sucks. As for the the review, it's subway. Why are you looking on yelp for a subway review? F this guy. F this chain and most of all F this guy. I like to think he is a student of U of Chicago and we're a part of his thesis, but in reality, he's a dick that loves bad tv. Oh, and he loves when you piss all over the bathroom.

0.description: Not only is this location 24 hours, but the man there during the over night shift during the weekend is AMAZING! We drive past a couple 24 hour subways just to come to this one:)

1.description: The morning of my appointment on one of the most important events I have ever hosted, I got a call saying my morning appointment is canceled.  Maybe they are okay to use if you're just scheduling a haircut, but if you're scheduling something more formal, beware...there are two other reviews in here saying that they canceled the appointment last second as well.  Be very wary when you schedule with these guys...especially if you have something important going on.

9.description: This was my second time getting my hair cut at Aiyu....I love Dana...she knew exactly what color to use on my grey's and this last appointment added highlights...My hair looks great and I have gotten many complements...I was going to another salon for over 15 years...and decided I needed a change. I was very nervous at first but Dana is wonderful. She is welcoming and I immediately felt at ease.  I have found my new salon and I love it...Thanks Dana you are the best!

12.description: I woke up today and saw my new cut and color and thougt how lucky I was o have found Aiyu and Dana. This was my third visit. I thought that the best way to say thank you was to let others know about how great this place is. Here is what is great about Aiyu.Dana is great with both cuts and color. I had been going to a salon for 10 years and found it difficult to book an appointment with my guy for color because he lowered his hours. I was recommended to Dana. The first time Dana did my color she explained the color product she uses and why my former color was leaving my color brassy. She uses the best products and I can say that my hair has not looked at all brassy since. In fact my color had not looked this good since I went to an exensive place in Wicker Park nearly a decade ago. The color was so perfect I called her the next day to tell her how impressed I was that she was able to get it so right the first time. We are now talking about extensions as my hair is starting to thin a bit. She talked about a modified version where we would add fullness and the cost and time involved would be reasonable for me. So for technique and knowledge Dana is amazing.Let's talk about Dana herself. She is the person you want to spend an hour or two with(if you get cut, color and highlights like I did yesterday). She is one of those rare people that is always upbeat, kind, and great to talk with. You leave her salon feeling great about yourself. In the end what more can you ask.

21.description: Yep, this salon is as good as it gets.  I love Dana (the owner) - she is simply fantastic at what she does!  I asked her for a rich brown color and it was beyond my expectations.   Dana has high energy, is funny and I look forward to spending time with her as I get my hair cut and colored.  Her prices are great and the salon is cozy and welcoming.  Check her out ...you'll rave about her too!

16.description: Mac gave me the best haircut I have had in years. He is very talented, patient, and listens to what you want . The entire staff is inviting and helpful, the products are excellent, booking is easy. The northwest side of Chicago is lucky to have a salon of this caliber .

17.description: I have been looking for a great hair stylist for too long and have now found one that I hope to keep forever. Dana understood what I wanted and made it happen!  The salon is super private and very cool! Dana uses very high end products and it does  make a difference. This was the first time I have ever had my hair treated and didn't itch afterward. I have been to some local expensive salons in the area and my experience was not good. Prices are very reasonable and fair. I lovethissalon and suggest you try it.......chances are.....you willbe back.

10.description: I just got home from my first visit with Dana at Aiyu and let me tell you, I got a fantastic cut! I was so scarred from another salon that I hadn't had a hair cut in 11 months. Dana listened to my needs, asked me about my lifestyle, and worked her magic on me.... Viola! My hair was once again back to being awesome. Dana was so kind and welcoming, she really made me feel great about the whole experience. I'm Soooo happy - I found my new Salon! Yay!

5.description: this is my first review on yelp. I just had to review since I know lots of people like myself that have a hard time finding a good salon. and because of prior bad experiences, I had not cut my hair in over 8 months. I moved back to my hometown Chicago from NY after 10 years so I was looking for a hair stylist to stick with. shortly after I moved back in spring of 2013, I had a bday party to attend and needed a cut badly. on short notice I stopped by the nearest chain hair cuttery. it's wasn't a bad cut necessarily but it wasn't a good one either. she missed trimming at least one layer. and she scolded me for having dry hair, doing keratin, and not cutting my hair every 6-8 weeks.fast forward to this past Friday. I read a few reviews and also wanted to stay within driving distance of Jefferson Park. so Aiyu peaked my interest. I was super nervous but as soon as I walked in Dana was so warm and inviting. the place is small but very neat and modern. she mentioned her training and education which did put me a little at ease.conversation flowed with Dana, but I never felt pressure to converse (sometimes I just want to read a magazine or play with my phone and not necessarily have an hour long convo while my hair is being done) (FYI: I'm an introvert). but I felt really comfortable. the wash was great, she conditioned my hair more because it was dry and needed lots of dead hair cut off. but she never once scolded me.she asked and actually listened for what I wanted. and I too asked her opinion on length to cut but she didn't go crazy cutting my hair all short. I wanted a cut but I still wanted my long hair. when she was done I admit I was a little surprised, it was probably the best cut I've had. all the dead hair was gone. my hair was still long, and it was shiny and soft and so flowy. my boss complemented me as soon as I walked in to the office yesterday.I'm loyal in that when I find good service (car shop, hair salon, etc.), I stick with them forever. Extra points for sending me a "thank you" email.thx Dana, I'll see you soon.

11.description: This salon is has a very peaceful feeling.  My stylist, Joann, gave me a highlights and a cut.  She was very attentive and asked the right kinds of questions to understand what I was looking for and then made great suggestions.Highly recommended!

22.description: Dana, (the owner) is the MOST talented hair dresser I have ever been to!!! She is simply the best at color, and cuts. Everyone who goes to her sends all of their friends, and so on, and so on. (See for yourself!) Dana is always up to date on the latest looks and trends. She is also amazing at Extensions and Brazilian Blowouts. I have seen them on several of her clients, and am going to treat myself to extensions early next year. Her prices are very reasonable for the talent you are getting. In addition, and most importantly she  is super nice and funny. You will have a great time at the salon. Her space is small and intimate, as a boutique salon should be. You will not be disappointed!

0.description: I have been looking for a salon in my neighborhood and found it!!  Aiyu is a great place.  Joanne cut my hair and she was so nice, sweet, talkative and professional all at the same time!  I met Dana, the owner as well, and she seemed to be very fun and a great stylist too.  Prior to visiting this salon I got a not-so-good haircut and I decided I needed a hair change.  So after consulting with Joanne we went with a cute, stylish AND problem solving cut.I will definitely be back and highly recommend Aiyu!

20.description: Aiyu Hair Design is a breath of fresh air from other salons I've been to. Not only is it the beautifully decorated, but I felt immediately welcomed and comfortable the minute I walked in. My hair has never before looked or felt better. Great cut combined with great products, my hair looks great even if I just let it air dry! I highly recommend the Brazilian Blowout, I have never been more pleased with my hair than I am now. Thank You Aiyu Hair Design, you're THE BEST!!!

19.description: Aiyu Hair Design is a breath of fresh air from other salons I've been to. Not only is it the beautifully decorated, but I felt immediately welcomed and comfortable the minute I walked in. My hair has never before looked or felt better. Great cut combined with great products, my hair looks great even if I just let it air dry! I highly recommend the Brazilian Blowout, I have never been more pleased with my hair than I am now. Thank You Aiyu Hair Design, you're THE BEST!!!

2.description: It has been years since I found a stylist who understood what I wanted and was able to make my hair look this good.  Dana, the owner, who is also so sweet and fun, cut almost 8" off my hair my first time seeing her, and it looked amazing!  I have lots of hair and it ranges from kind of wavy in the front to full on S waves in the back, so it's not the easiest to work with.  Dana just knew exactly how to shape it so that it lays right, but still has lots of swing and movement.  This salon is such a great find for me.  Compared to what other salons charge, it is so reasonable to leave with hair you love!

18.description: Dana, (the owner) is the MOST talented hair dresser I have ever been to!!! She is simply the best at color, and cuts. Everyone who goes to her sends all of their friends, and so on, and so on. (See for yourself!) Dana is always up to date on the latest looks and trends. She is also amazing at Extensions and Brazilian Blowouts. I have seen them on several of her clients, and am going to treat myself to extensions early next year. Her prices are very reasonable for the talent you are getting. In addition, and most importantly she  is super nice and funny. You will have a great time at the salon. Her space is small and intimate, as a boutique salon should be. You will not be disappointed!

13.description: I went in on a glowing recommendation from my neighbor.  I was getting drastic color done, going from blonde to dark brown.  I had an appointment with Mac and he did an awesome job.  Joanne also gave great suggestions.  The salon had such a comfortable feel about it, very welcoming.  I will certainly be going back.

4.description: I went here a couple times for cut and color. I think my colorist was too afraid to leave the lightener in. I wanted to lighten for summer and I ended up with extremely brassy orange highlights and had to return for a tone. Went somewhere else two weeks later for a real color job. And the cut was a barely noticeable trim. Prices rather high for what you get. Not very experienced stylists.

6.description: Just had my first appointment at Aiyu and can't say enough!  Warm welcome from the moment I walked in!  I was asked by Dana about any concerns about my hair, but I felt instanly trusting and it was well placed...I walked out with beautiful color and cut and felt like I just met an amazing person I can't wait to see again.  Great experience...can't say enough and the prices are great!!!

15.description: Love my hair highlights! Natural looking and consistently awesome every time. This salon is also well priced. Dana is very sweet, interesting and fun to talk to. I really look forward to my hair appointments. I also love that she promotes local artists on her walls.

7.description: I just moved to the area and wanted to try somewhere close.  So I randomly made an apt with Joanne.  It was such a great experience.  The salon itself was welcoming, clean and modern. Joanne was so personable and enjoyable, I didn't want to leave.  This is officially my new place to always go when I need anything for my hair.

8.description: I have kinky curly hair.  A co-worker recommended her "amazing hair stylist Dana".  I tried to get on schedule with Dana, instead ended up scheduling with Joanne.  I was so nervous because this hair of mine is not easy.  I got my roots touched up (cover lots of gray) and wanted the brassy/orangy color my hair turned into gone, along with that some peek-a-boo highlights.  Joanne was great!  I love it and am going back for some more highlights.  Joanne here I come!!!

3.description: This is by far my favorite hair salon!! After months of searching for a hair salon, since my previous hairstylist left the other location I went to, I have only positive things to say about it!! First off Joanne is super sweet and nice!! She does an extravagant job with hair color and cut!! I have received so many compliments about the color and how well it suits me!!! I can't wait for my next hair appointment!!!

14.description: I can't tell you how long I've been waiting for a place like this. I found Aiyu through a friend and could not be happier. Dana listens to what you want and makes great suggestions. I often find sitting in that chair to be awkward, but Dana is super sweet and friendly. The place is small but well decorated and welcoming. AND she cut my hair exactly how I wanted!

3.description: We have been going to this place on and off forever. My daughter had 2 proms to go to recently and Judy did her hair both times. She did an amazing job!

1.description: Do or Dye was amazing for our wedding. The salon was perfect for our large group and very accommodating. I would highly recommend for all occasions!

2.description: Ive been to this salon just a couple times when i wasnt able to get in with my usual stylist. Judy is amazing! she did my hair for a wedding that i was going to and it was only $40. i went back months later for a cut and color. im thinking of sticking with judy and never going back to my old place! super friendly staff. extremely reasonable prices! Just keep in mind they only accept cash and checks. they do not accept CC's. :)

5.description: New to the area, I asked a neighbor whose hair I admired where she went ~ and so was referred to Do or Dye. Decided to call for an appointment on short notice since I had an event in the evening. Brittany (not the person my neighbor went to) answered the phone and was able to book me that day (big plus to me).  The shop is a little off the beaten path in Norwood Park, but is clean & modern. Brittany was very personable, listened to what I wanted and gave me the result I was looking for with full highlights and a cut for a reasonable price.  I'm happy to find a place I'll go back to, hopefully for a long time.

6.description: I drive in from the city to have Brittany do my hair.  Its inexpensive and she does a great job every time, I get compliments on my hair everywhere I go.  Highly recommended!

7.description: Judy is phenomenal.  Reasonable salon.  Just did my hair for my wedding trial, and she will do it for my May wedding.  Did my hair just as I had envisioned it - I am confident she will exceed my expectations.  I have had luck in past years with stylists there - really friendly and cute atmosphere.  Def. Rec.

8.description: I recently moved to Roscoe Village, but still drive out to get my hair done at Do or Dye.  I get highlights and a cut for about $110 and it includes tip.  It's not the hippest trendiest place, but Caren (sp) does and amazing job.  I fear that I will eventually get sick of the drive, but for now, I can't see going anywhere else.

0.description: I've been coming to Brittany for a few years now and she's always done an amazing job on my hair.  Everyone is super nice and helpful at this salon and there is no stuffy attitudes here.I highly recommend!

4.description: This place is great! Sheila and Karen do a great job with updo's. They are friendly , the styles are current and they are reasonable. Worth the drive if you live outside the Norwood park area.

28.description: This was the first time I was there.   I moved into the neighborhood 1.5 years ago.   I tried one other place and was not impressed.   I was driving back to old area for pedicure.   Tried this, I now have a new pedicure place.   They were fast, friendly and efficient.

1.description: Totally convenient because it's so close to my house. I called, said I could be there in five minutes or so, and the receptionist said they could take me then. I got a no chip manicure and a spa pedicure. The receptionist gave me the basket of no chip color swatches (they have a TON of colors - OPI, Gelish, CND, Essie, etc). I brought the color basket with me to the pedicure chair, and as soon as I put my feet in.. realized I hadn't picked a color for my toes. I picked one from the no chip colors, and asked if she could find something that looked kind of like it - I really didn't care that much! She clearly did not like this, but called the receptionist over and had her do it. She was very rough with my feet, and when she was about halfway done, looked up at me and said "you better pick a no chip color now, I'm almost done and I have no time for this." What?? I will take responsibility for being indecisive - I was kind of enjoying just looking at the colors, plus I didn't realize that I was agitating her. To make matters worse (for her), when we sat down at the nail counter, I said "actually.. Do you think you could just do a French no chip?" She just looked at me, totally flat expression, and said "... Fine." Ouch. I am just not sure what motive she would have for making me feel like such an idiot. She was just downright unkind. The actual paint job is nice, though two nails do have rough edges - when I pointed them out  before she painted she said "they will wear down on their own." Overall: receptionist was very nice and sweet. Place was clean, modern looking. I like the fact that they open a new pack of tools just for you for your pedicure. Price was.. okay ($58 for spa pedi and French no chip) - I've paid less, but I've also paid more. All 20 nails LOOK nice, though I have doubts about how long the no chip is going to last. I'll update when I know more!

39.description: Best places ever highly recommend great unique selections of gel nail styles....., clean place, great staff, Wendy is my personal favorite..... Great prices for the excellent work they do. Must see for yourself. Would rate them a 10 if I could. :)

9.description: My friend and I came here on a whim because our usual nail place was booked for the evening. We were hoping to get a gel fill and saw that this particular salon offered the service (not all do). So we called ahead and asked if they would be able to take us in about 15-20 minutes and they said yes. We headed on over. When we arrived, it was noticeably busy with all the stations filled and other customers who were already waiting ahead of us. Based on the other Yelp reviews I saw in combination with this observation, I took this as a sign that they are probably a halfway decent nail salon. They clearly had the clientele to keep business rolling! So we added our names to the wait list and after about 10 minutes they asked me and my friend to have a seat at this nail bar/station area. Kinda unique with a display underneath the glass countertop with little flowers, sand and stones. A middle aged gentleman got started on my friend while I sat next to her. He made no indication that someone else would be coming over to work on me at any point in time. I began to realize he was going to be working on both of us. The majority of the time he was distracted, glancing at the TV behind him, greeting and talking to patrons walking in, talking to other technicians, etc. He paid such little attention that as he was sanding off/removing the previous coat of polish from the gel overlays, he left the drill on too long to the point where it was burning the actual nail bed. He did this to both my friend and I at numerous points during the session. We both pulled away and said "ouch!" And he said nothing. No apology or asked if we were alright. Throughout the appointment he was not gentle, ground away at my cuticles which are now cracking and are visibly irritated. He kept going back and forth between my friend and I until finally about halfway through another technician came over to me to finish -- or so I thought. She seemed confused as to where he left off, so just started making it up as she went along. I would mention certain things, like "can you fix this?" and she seemed irritated. Finally after she was finished I looked at the work and was it so awful and incomplete I asked to speak to the manager.I told her my cuticles hadn't been trimmed and they forgot to put a coat of polish on (I did French tips but they only put the white tip on but no pink layer. You could see the outgrowth from previous times I had my nails done.) I pointed out that they also hadn't cleaned out underneath the nail and everything just looked messy and unprofessional. She was able to fix most of the issues, but as she was working on my nails she would say "Oh, so you like them short" in a tone as if to imply I was making their job more difficult. She also went on to comment "your skin is really dry" -- umm... thanks? She said this in regards to cleaning up my cuticles to which she added "next time you should get a manicure in addition to the gel fill" and I said the place I usually go to does it automatically, I don't ask for it. I also wanted to add that I wouldn't be coming back to find out.

29.description: I have been going here for around two years, and I will never go anywhere else. Clean, friendly, professional and all around great service. I'm always satisfied with my mani/pedi and I've gone in on some of their busiest times and they made sure not to rush. The owner genuinely cares about her customers and you can tell by the kind of service they provide.

42.description: I recently went to this salon because i was looking to get a no-chip manicure for the holidays. Lee Nails was recommended to me by a few girlfriends. i decided to try it out because it was really close to home. The girl who did my nails, Julie, is amazing. She takes her time and is very careful with what she does. she just doesnt slap on the color and throw you under the dryer.  She also did my eyebrows which turned out great as well. Lee nails is a little pricey but if you want it done right i feel its ok to spend a few extra bucks. i will definately be going there again. well worth it to me.

23.description: Came here for the first time, asked for a gel full set and Vivianne is who did my nails. I am very meticulous with my nails because I always do them myself. I love them very square and not too thick, Vivianne did a great job making sure they were perfect. She was really funny and enjoyed her doing my nails, I will be back!!!

5.description: I came there yesterday for the first time. I found this place on Yelp and wanted Helen to be my nail artist. I called two days in advance to make an appointment particularly  with her. When I got there I was told that she is not working today. Nobody ever called me and informed me about that. That's why people do appointments before. I would definitely recommend the owner to take the contact information when the customer calls just in case something will change. But overall this place is not bad. Lily was doing nails for me. She is very nice and did a good job.

31.description: Thank you, Helen, for a great pedicure and no-chip manicure.  Quick, efficient and very pleasant. I will return.

25.description: I've been here a handful of times. The first time I was really impressed but after that not so much. I was in a bind and so I marched into Lee nails this weekend and I wound up with Karen. The place was busy and my expectations were very low due to my previous experiences here but she did a great job. She was very meticulous, making sure my nails were even and she didn't bat an eye when I told her I liked them very square. She polished them perfectly and did not cut me once during the entire process. I've been to two other techs here and the next time I end up here I will be sure to go to Karen and only Karen. I'll be sure to update :)

12.description: Update! I stopped in tonight and spoke to the owner and the worker who did my nails...without hassle she agreed to do them over again free of charge. I got a slightly darker shade of red and dismissed the whole glitter idea since I was kind of past it at this point...and my lovely dark red no chip manicure is wonderful. I'm pleased and very glad that they quickly offered to fix me up. After she was done tonight she said that if there are any more problems, do not hesitate to come back. :)

37.description: I LOVE,LOVE, LOVE this place... Its my Go to!!! when I want a mani pedi, i head over here.. Wendy is my Favorite!!! Shes wonderful and really takes her time to get it right.. I love it here, not far from my house and Its super clean, Nice and comfortable!! Ill keep going here as long as they are open!!! PS bring Cash with you because you cant put tips on Credit Cards anymore..

21.description: My girlfriend and I came here from out of town as walk-ins and they immediately seated us for our mani/pedis. There were many nail colors for us to pick, ranging anywhere from Essie to Opi, however I did notice that a lot of the colors were older collections and had been there for quite some years. Nevertheless, my pedicure came out very well. My manicure was done in a timely fashion, however the application  was not done that great- the technician failed to put polish on the side of my nails. Once I pointed this out to her, she quickly fixed the problem. Otherwise my nails came out fantastic. Because I got a regular manicure with regular polish and not gel, I had to sit and dry my nails. Their nail drying station consists of three chairs which hands and feet are simply placed under regular light bulbs, not UV bulbs like many other nails places have. There are no fans to speed up the drying process. It took forever to dry my nails!Overall, my gripes about Lee Nails:- cannot add a tip onto the credit card- $40 for a basic manicure/ pedicure (expensive)- nail drying station needs improvement- older nail polish *needs updating

16.description: I came here off a whim because the reviews seemed good and it's very close to my home. The ladies there are always so friendly ! I have great conversations with all of them. They never rush me out and they are never rude. They do an amazing job every time. I like my nails round like egg shaped and they are the only place that doesn't give me stiletto nails! I don't like pointy ! But other than the great nail work customer service in a salon is so important to me because who wants to sit for and hour  with a rude person not even making eye contact with you ? And trust me it's happened more times than I can count. Overall I love this place and will keep going back every 2 weeks for my acrylic fill!

17.description: My girlfriend and I came here from out of town as walk-ins and they immediately seated us for our mani/pedis. There were many nail colors for us to pick, ranging anywhere from Essie to Opi, however I did notice that a lot of the colors were older collections and had been there for quite some years. Nevertheless, my pedicure came out very well. My manicure was done in a timely fashion, however the application  was not done that great- the technician failed to put polish on the side of my nails. Once I pointed this out to her, she quickly fixed the problem. Otherwise my nails came out fantastic. Because I got a regular manicure with regular polish and not gel, I had to sit and dry my nails. Their nail drying station consists of three chairs which hands and feet are simply placed under regular light bulbs, not UV bulbs like many other nails places have. There are no fans to speed up the drying process. It took forever to dry my nails!Overall, my gripes about Lee Nails:- cannot add a tip onto the credit card- $40 for a basic manicure/ pedicure (expensive)- nail drying station needs improvement- older nail polish *needs updating

10.description: I've been coming here since the summer. Helen is great as well as the rest of the staff. She listens to what I want, she takes her time and is very gentle. My nails have lasted for about 3 weeks without chipping. I've brought my mom and sisters and recommended my gfs to come here and they've only had nothing but positive things to say. They also do nail art, eyebrows and eyelash extensions. You will not regret coming here!

11.description: Love this place bestest of all Nail salons!  Kathy always gets the start of my ingrowing big toes fixed up right!!  All any other place does is clip the corner which is NOT helpful. The girls are all super sweet. They do take appointments, but you don't need one.  I recommend an appointment if you want a specific person. Plus there is an awesome massage place next door I think is owned by the same people. Hint go there too to get your holiday pampering on!

26.description: I've been going here, on and off,  for about 15 years, usually only pedicures, they are very nice. I just got a full set of gels for $30.00 and they took me with no wait on a Friday night. They turned out great! Thank you!

27.description: The best nail salon around, especially for acrylic/gel nails. Wendy, the owner has done my nails the past 2 times and they have been perfect. She recommended the pink/white gel nails and they look so natural and lasted 3 weeks.

35.description: Fast, friendly service. Everything was clean and comfortable and my pedicure has lasted 2 weeks without any signs of chipping. This is new favorite nail place!

8.description: Always great service here and all the ladies do a good job.

0.description: Took my friend here for her birthday. We had pedis done and were talked into no chip manis. We saved 10 bucks by doing the combo.Lilly was my gal,she was Wonderful!! Pleasant and enjoyed her job! This makes a world of difference, and if you saw my feet,you would understand! I always feel sorry for who ever get me lol. My friend had Cathy,she too was awesome!Lilly talked us into a no chip,I am glad she did. Very nice salon and there is a nail *bar* where you sit,so you are up at a,counter. They have an abundance of color's that MATCH the no chip as,well as your toes!Nice place,nice time,great service!

38.description: The first time I went to this place was during their grand opening a few years ago and I haven't stopped going there since. I'm one of those nail snobs who wants their nails done perfectly and after 15 years of getting my nails done I finally found a place that can do them perfectly. It doesn't matter who you are with, all the gals do the same exact PERFECT job. They take their time. The only thing is this salon is always busy so schedule an appointment. I now live 25 miles from the salon and will continue to make the trip to get my nails done here. Its totally worth it.

20.description: I came here off a whim because the reviews seemed good and it's very close to my home. The ladies there are always so friendly ! I have great conversations with all of them. They never rush me out and they are never rude. They do an amazing job every time. I like my nails round like egg shaped and they are the only place that doesn't give me stiletto nails! I don't like pointy ! But other than the great nail work customer service in a salon is so important to me because who wants to sit for and hour  with a rude person not even making eye contact with you ? And trust me it's happened more times than I can count. Overall I love this place and will keep going back every 2 weeks for my acrylic fill!

19.description: I found this place on yelp. It had great reviews. I went to Helen to redo my nails and fix the horrible mess made by another nail salon. Helen is the best. All the other nail techs seem to also do quality work. New to the city and I am so glad I found this place. Yay Helen and the crew at Lee Nails! This salon is very fashion forward.

33.description: I love this place! I take my mom and niece with me for girls day and we always get the best treatment!

2.description: I love what they have done with the place. Everything is so updated. I have been going here for the last 3 years. Two of my nail technicians left, now I have Kathy do my nails. She is very nice, kind woman. She definitely has a lot of experience. I would recommend this place.  Kathy, please don't quit.

34.description: Awful, awful, awful! Walked out halfway thru pedicure. Rude, inefficient pedicurist was on her cell phone while clipping around my toe cuticles- and drew blood from clipping too close - twice!! Apparently, she could not hold the phone with her shoulder and talk while racing thru my service.  When she put on her headset to continue her phone conversation I said I'm out of here, first and LAST time I go there. Don't waste your time, your money or your toes!!

32.description: I love this nail salon, even though i no longer live in the area i make my way here every 2 weeks for my nails. All of the ladies here are very nice and professional. I never make an appointment and i have never waited more then 10 minutes. They have a wide varitey of nail polish including opi, essie, china glaze etc. They also have one of the biggest selections of no chip colors i have seen. All around this is a great place to get your nails done.

18.description: Yesterday I went the first time to salon for full legs waxing. I was told over the phone that price for the service is $60. I end up paying $110 not sure for what, I was asked by lady if I want bikini done I said yes and she never mentioned that there is additional charge for that also she asked me if I want underarms done, I did no have a lot of hair there. She charged me for that too, she never mentioned that there is a charge for that. After procedure when I came home I checked my legs and I noticed that was a lot missed. I called and complain and I was offered to re do it. All together horrible experience and I would not recommend to anybody.

41.description: A very clean place!  The only thing I don't like about them are the manicure stations.  They are kind of high and hard to sit in front of.

13.description: It was my first time here. I couldn't get to my regular nail tech and since this place is 3 blocks from my house I thought I'd give them a chance. I called to make an appointment. When I got there for my appointment at 12:45 I had to wait about 15-20 minutes to be taken care of. All I wanted was a gel fill and polish change on my toes. The girl who did my nails was so nice but not very good at her job. She chopped off all of my nails without asking  and then filed all of them unevenly. The paint job was terrible on my fingers. Air bubbles and completely uneven. She did my toes first and after an hour she said they were dried. I had to ask her 3 times because she was on her phone and not giving me the client service she should have been giving me. She wrapped my toes in a bag and when I took the bag off there were lines all over them. I couldn't believe I spent $40 on my nails. It's the worst my nails have EVER looked. I'll never go there again.

4.description: I had a manicure yesterday at Lee and really have no complaints.I walked in at 11:30 without an appointment for a no-chip manicure and was out the door at 12:45.  I did have to wait a few minutes, which is to be expected without an appointment.The color selection is much larger than the last place I went for a manicure, but the staff was not as friendly, so there's a trade-off there.I also like being able to see the bottles of nail polish when I'm choosing a color - call me crazy.  I chose a no-chip color based off of the swatches they had at the front, but then noticed that they had all of the OPI no-chip bottles hidden in the back.  Maybe the customers aren't supposed to touch them?  I don't know, but I ended up seeing a color I liked better and switching.The manicure itself was pretty standard - $35 for a no-chip.  The was no extra charge to soak-off my old no-chip, and my technician happily cut down my nails a little bit before filing them.  They are nicely shaped.To me - it's a toss-up between Lee Nails and the salon across the street where I went two weeks ago.  One is friendlier, one has a better color selection.

24.description: My friend and I came here on a whim because our usual nail place was booked for the evening. We were hoping to get a gel fill and saw that this particular salon offered the service (not all do). So we called ahead and asked if they would be able to take us in about 15-20 minutes and they said yes. We headed on over. When we arrived, it was noticeably busy with all the stations filled and other customers who were already waiting ahead of us. Based on the other Yelp reviews I saw in combination with this observation, I took this as a sign that they are probably a halfway decent nail salon. They clearly had the clientele to keep business rolling! So we added our names to the wait list and after about 10 minutes they asked me and my friend to have a seat at this nail bar/station area. Kinda unique with a display underneath the glass countertop with little flowers, sand and stones. A middle aged gentleman got started on my friend while I sat next to her.
