He made no indication that someone else would be coming over to work on me at any point in time. I began to realize he was going to be working on both of us. The majority of the time he was distracted, glancing at the TV behind him, greeting and talking to patrons walking in, talking to other technicians, etc. He paid such little attention that as he was sanding off/removing the previous coat of polish from the gel overlays, he left the drill on too long to the point where it was burning the actual nail bed. He did this to both my friend and I at numerous points during the session. We both pulled away and said "ouch!" And he said nothing. No apology or asked if we were alright. Throughout the appointment he was not gentle, ground away at my cuticles which are now cracking and are visibly irritated. He kept going back and forth between my friend and I until finally about halfway through another technician came over to me to finish -- or so I thought. She seemed confused as to where he left off, so just started making it up as she went along. I would mention certain things, like "can you fix this?" and she seemed irritated. Finally after she was finished I looked at the work and was it so awful and incomplete I asked to speak to the manager.I told her my cuticles hadn't been trimmed and they forgot to put a coat of polish on (I did French tips but they only put the white tip on but no pink layer. You could see the outgrowth from previous times I had my nails done.) I pointed out that they also hadn't cleaned out underneath the nail and everything just looked messy and unprofessional. She was able to fix most of the issues, but as she was working on my nails she would say "Oh, so you like them short" in a tone as if to imply I was making their job more difficult. She also went on to comment "your skin is really dry" -- umm... thanks? She said this in regards to cleaning up my cuticles to which she added "next time you should get a manicure in addition to the gel fill" and I said the place I usually go to does it automatically, I don't ask for it. I also wanted to add that I wouldn't be coming back to find out.

6.description: Ladies there are very friendly and do a great job. There are so many colors to pick from for the no chip.

22.description: I found this place on yelp. It had great reviews. I went to Helen to redo my nails and fix the horrible mess made by another nail salon. Helen is the best. All the other nail techs seem to also do quality work. New to the city and I am so glad I found this place. Yay Helen and the crew at Lee Nails! This salon is very fashion forward.

15.description: I LOVE this nail salon. My first visit was with a friend, who is a regular. We got pedis and it was great- my polish lasted forever! I just went back for a No Chip and was blown away by all the options! I've never seen such an extensive polish and no chip color selection! My nail tech was friendly, fast, and did a beautiful job on my mani. I have definitely found my new spot. I was a little surprised by the price ($35!), but my hands look so nice- I can't complain. :)

40.description: I haven't had nails done here often, but I can highly recommend Wendy (her family owns the salon) for waxing.  She is so good, and makes getting a bikini wax about as comfortable as it's going to get.  Affordable too.  Ask for her when you call. Also nice that there's a big free parking lot there, thanks to the Dominicks and Walgreens, etc.

7.description: I found them after a disaster with another salon. They do a great job, but they don't do real gel nails.  Gel nails is gel, not to be confused with acrylic nails which are created using liquid monomer and polymer powder. They still do what almost all salons do a UV sealer over acrylics. You get charged extra at all salons for just this simple cover coat. I would go back to them but it just ticks me off about how all salons fool everyone about gel nails.

36.description: I walked in after a terrible experience at Le'sNails in Harwood heights on Harlem Avenue. The owner greeted me and opened the door for me and asked me right away what service I was looking for and said he could take care of me right away he even listened to my terrible experience at Le's Nails in Harwood Heights. I was so shaken from what had happened and the way I was treated there it was a relief to have somebody treat me like a human being, sit me down, start my pedicure tub for me. I did not have to wait I was greeted by a very pleasant girl who talk to me and treated me with respect and courtesy and good customer service I was very impressed by the cleanliness of this place and the awesome job they did on my toes thank you Lee Nails I will definitely be returning to you!

30.description: I love this place I been already 5 time there and every time I'm more and more happy with them they are professional nice and polite to the Customers ...I strongly recommend this place to everyone 5 Stars for them @-}--

3.description: Lee nails is the best salon I've been to! Sometimes I use groupons elsewhere so I can get my no chip done for a little bit cheaper, but I'm always disappointed. The only thing I wish they had here was a punch card, like for 7 manis, get the 8th free, or any sort of discount for repeat clients. Nothing compares to the quality here. The ladies at lee nails always do such a great job. Very professional! Plus, the renovation/ expansion they just did looks amazing. I'll definitely keep coming back for my nail services! Thanks again ladies!

14.description: Solid little place. Nice ladies and good service. This is not too far from my Sunday errand runs so sometimes I get a foot massage next door and then a pedicure here. I have always been pleased with the service and staff.

3.description: I have been going here for 15 years, they are very friendly and good! I only do Mani pedis and they last about a week before they start to chip. I wouldn't go any where else!

1.description: I had a wonderful time getting my nails done at the salon. I found them on yelp and they had a five star rating so I decided to give them a try. I haven't done  my nails for at least six or eight months and I went there to get a gel overlay with French tips and they did it perfectly not only that the lady Lucy was very nice Lisa was very Nice she did my pedicure and Lucy did my gel overlay I definitely recommend them and I will be going back very affordably priced check it out

2.description: This is an excellent place for nails.I get gels on my hands as well as an awesome pedicure.My nail lady Debi is pleasant as well as professional.She knows what she is doing.I have been there 2x so far and it is the most fun I have ever had in a nail salon.My nails were a wreck when  I went in there and she did an excellent job with what she had to work with. This is my new favorite nail place hands down.I also purchased this Lavender lotion they had as well.I will always come here.I am not surprised they have stellar reviews.

5.description: This salon has been open a very long time and there is a reason it has. ITS great! I got a gel set by tammy and she did a beautiful job and it was quick around 30 min!!! They didn't complain about me coming an hour before closing, and did a beautiful job. Will definitely be back!

6.description: If you want good, basic mani-pedi,overlays-tips, and brow threading, this is the place.  There is never any "mama drama" so prevalent in other salons. The prices are rock bottom too and there is plenty of on street parking.  I've never waited more than two minutes before the techs started their smiling service.   If you want to be a regular, they will store your personal implements.   The only caveat: the color selection is limited so if your heart is set on something specific, bring it. I have never brought my own color, I always found something I wanted, but you might be more particular.

0.description: Pros:  It's clean.  Prices for a mani-pedi better than most places.  If you are a regular customer they will give you a box with a few things like nail files in them, just for you.  Staff is very friendly and they're hours are good.  So far I've never seen it super crowed either which is good because they don't seem to take appointments. massage chairs are good.  they have a lot of regulars which is a great sign of a solid business.Cons:  It's not fancy and looks about 20 years old.  But hey, what they save on redecorating, they pass on in better pricing!

4.description: I have been going to u nails since I was little with my aunt and grandma! It's my favorite in the entire Chicago land area! The girls are sweet, talented technicians who always take their time! It's a must visit for me whenever I'm in the neighborhood!

3.description: Glad to hear I'm not the only person who finds that woman so mean and Rude. I used to come here after dinner in the summer, but stopped because I don't feel it is right to treat a paying customer like junk. I've never put in a complicated order. It was either Iced coffee or sherbet. She would treat me like I was asking for her first born. I hope corporate comes in and changes things up.

1.description: Best Dunkin Donuts! I come every morning around the same time and they know my order before I even get in there and are super speedy to get you your coffee. And my coffee is always perfect. I honestly can't say this about any other Dunkin donuts.

2.description: The workers are a bit rude. Sometimes don't understand well. A new girl servers my hash browns cold. They don't always fill up the hot chocolate to the brim. The only thing they're really good for is cold drinks. I keep coming hoping their service gets better but it never does.

9.description: Worst service ever in a Dunkin Dounts restaurant, even single/short/easy orders get all messed up. This people need a "new sherif in town" who can put everything and everybody in order.

10.description: They are nice, and remember your face. Nuff said.

4.description: Drive thru is the worst ever.  I visit at different times and no matter when there seems to be someone working the drive thru that barely speaks english.  I frequently have to repeat my order 2 or 3 times at the speaker and then again at the window.  I understand that traffic noise could be a problem at this location but even early in the morning when there is no traffic they can't get it right.  The woman that works the window is friendly about half the time that I go here.  Sadly there is no other drive thru near me so I have to live with this place until the one in Northbrook near my office opens.  Hopefully they speak english there.  Learn english please so that you can better serve the majority of your customers that speak english.

6.description: Let me preface this review by saying that I generally love Dunkin Donuts -- the coffee, tea, food, donuts, everything. I spent five minutes looking for this specific location of Dunkin Donuts on Yelp JUST so I could write this review. I've never felt compelled to pinpoint one location of a chain just to complain, but my experience here just had to be documented. The manager was this rude and condescending woman who refused to redeem a Google offers coupon that I had (purchased at the end of May, $5 for $10; so if you have the same coupon, don't bother coming here), instead telling me to call Google to ask for my money back. Her complaint was that Google wasn't paying them, so she refused to let me use the coupon. Oookay. That's not really supposed to be my problem, but since I had driven ten minutes out of my way to come to this specific location to use my coupon, I thought I should at least walk away with a dozen donuts. All the donuts were stale and dry and the worst DD donuts I had in my life -- they had probably been sitting out there for the entire weekend.Nasty donuts. Rude staff. Do not come here.

11.description: I go here because it's so close to my house but I wish it would change.  Order two boston cremes.....they put them face down in the bottom of the bag and all of your chocolate sticks to the bag.  Never get donuts here past noon, they are rock hard!  I have had a few pleasant experiences here but not many.The coffee is great though, so there ya go!

5.description: This Dunkin Donuts is by far the worst one I've ever visited. It's managed to retain that dubious distinction for nearly a decade, a title run longer than Bruno Sammartino's.The employees are rude (especially a middle-aged woman who's been there for years) and filthy. I went in there yesterday for a bagel and immediately lost my appetite when I saw a bunch of houseflies crawling all over them.Oh, and good luck understanding what the hell they're talking about. You'd think after working here all these years, the middle-aged broad would have a better handle on the English language. You'd THINK.Just avoid this location. If you're traveling north, hit up the Double D at Harlem and Milwaukee. If you're headed west, there's a great Dunkin at Northwest Highway and Devon. East? Right past Crawford on Devon. South? Jefferson Park.

7.description: Don't visit here. The staff is rude and ill-mannered. The place is gross and dirty too. Ewwwww. I was in Chicago to visit with my family and we stopped by this location to grab breakfast. We had a big order (for 7 people) and the cashier wasn't patient enough to wait for all of us to place the order. Okay, I hope this isn't a Chicago-an thing, but when we wanted to ask if they had a price for a box dozen of donuts (which some places offer), she was rude in answering our question. Then we asked if we could swap out some of the donuts. They're all the same price and all you have to do is grab a different one. She said she couldn't cancel the order. WOOOOOW... way to go customer service and common sense. Hope my next visit to Chicago has this place closed or better management.

8.description: I have to say I wasn't too impressed.  The location itself wasnt clean as there were alot of dirty tables.  The staff really didnt seem interested in what was going on (with the exception of lady helping us, and she seemed to not be patient)  They were all talking and maybe gossipping, and my mom and I sat there and ate...maybe 20 mins later after it wasnt busy one person decided to go out there and clean tables and sweep.Got what I needed....probably would go to the milwaukee and harlem one next time.

0.description: All these negative reviews don't include the context of when they visited, I've always had excellent service in this location, but I patronize this shop after midnight.I started drinking Dunkin' Donuts on the recommendation of the Chicago Police, as they are always nursing caffeinated beverages to keep alert. After some trial and error to create a coffee beverage that would give me the same staying power as Starbucks (but at half the price), I finally found it, besides, this location doesn't give me a way to go on the ingredients, or botch the order as some other Dunkin locations have in the past. While I maybe visit this location once a week, or every two weeks, the staff has memorized my order, and confirm it before starting on it. If you're planning on making this (or any store, really) a regular stop, try tipping your server a dollar, the service improves by an order of magnitude once the staff and server see you frequenting their establishment.

12.description: I followed Brittany from her previous salon to Matisse, the place she opened on her own a year ago. It's beautiful sunny space that she found, made her own and made her customers feel welcome at ... very much a downtown feel at neighborhood prices. She's the only person I've had touch my hair since I met her 3-1/2 years ago. Just today I left feeling as happy about my hair as I did about seeing Brittany at her salon. She's put together a great staff who take wonderful care of you. Brittany listens, offers advice and takes the leap to figure out how to give you what you want - vowing to make it right if you don't like it. What more can you ask for??? Oh, and the most comfortable shampoo chairs EVER! Soft cushion for your neck! Heaven!!!

3.description: I had been getting my hair done by Brittany for a couple years before she bought Matise. I of course had to follow her there because I always loved how she colored my hair and never pressured me into trims or doing things that I wasn't up for. I have now been going to Lauren for a couple years and am so happy with her as well. Not only does she  always do a great job with coloring my hair she is also an awesome person to talk to for the two or so hours you are sitting in the stylist chair. All the staff at Matise are great people that make you feel welcomed. Their prices are extremely reasonable and they use good product. I am so happy I found this place and live close by! 5 stars all around!

1.description: I am very disappointed with the services I received at Matisse. I left very upset a few weeks ago after getting an "ombre". After going back for a color correction (which I ended up paying for products even though over the phone I was told I will only be charged for blow dry (ridiculous also) ) unfortunately by the same hairstylist, the color came out even worse. Over 200$ later, I ended up buying a box dye and cover all the damage at home :_(

2.description: Corey gives me my haircuts here, and she does a terrific job. I never know quite what to do with my hair, and she can help me figure that out without asking me a zillion questions. I have baby-fine hair that I don't want to spend a lot of time styling, and she makes it possible for me not to have to fuss with it much. The salon is pleasant, and they run a tight ship, so you're rarely asked to wait for them to finish up with someone else. The prices are reasonable, too. (You can see the price list on their well-designed website, if you're curious.)

9.description: I was having a hard time finding/picking a hair salon in my 'new' north-side neighborhood, after years of commuting to LP to my salon of 9 years.  I was referred to Matisse by a friend from college, who married the owner's sister. Small world, I know.In any case, I LOVE it.  Brittany did a wonderful job, and really took her time listening to what I like/want/am used to getting.  She also is very intuitive when it comes to colors, and what works versus doesn't with your skin tone.  She did exactly what I needed!  She was totally honest (but gentle!) with her opinions, in my case I needed to lose 6 or so inches of my hair, and needed to darken up my blond.  I was definitely nervous, but loved (and still love, 1.5 months later) what she did with my hair!I will definitely be going back to Matisse to see Brittany!  I couldn't be happier about finding such a high quality salon so close to Edison Park!

10.description: This place is really nice. Patty does a great job and is really interesting & fun to talk to. Much, much better than cutting my own hair. The shampoo they use smells really nice, definitely higher quality than the strawberry Suave that I use at home. My hair smells so good, I'm thinking about upgrading to cucumber flavor Suave.  I look forward to going back & visiting Patty again. The owners should make her a partner. Matisse & Patty Salon. I still have a few grey hair however. Maybe I can get a senior-citizen discount next time.

13.description: I LOVE matisse.. Its fairly new in the area and i've been meaning to check it out for awhile now. Finally went in and got some color by Patty. Shes seriously awesome. She sat and talked about what i wanted and what compliments my skin tone and even gave suggestions on shampoo without pushing me to buy.It is an Aveda salon.. and they often send out mailers in those coupon book things for 50 percent off first time customers and other stuff like thatWalk ins are welcome!

16.description: I had a great experience at Matisse. I got a full highlight and haircut with Patty. I have a lot of hair, so the highlights took a while and I feel like she took her time and put many highlights. The next day I noticed some highlights were brassy and I wasn't very happy with the tone so the owner told me to come in the next day for another toner application. There was no awkwardness - which was a relief and the color came out perfect! Also, I was VERY please with the cut. I ended up with bangs that I love and they are growing out great too. I will definitely return!

6.description: I've been here a few times this year and I've been extremely pleased with the color and cut that Lauren has been doing for me.  I wanted to go blonder and she's been slowly adding high lights to my hair, to which my husband is happy that I'm "losing some brain cells" with each visit to Lauren.  The cut she has been giving me allows me to either dry it straight or to let nature run it course and air dry it with the natural waves.  All in all, I've been very happy with Lauren and Matisse!

15.description: So, I look on Matisse's website, and I'm thinking the coloring is going to be a lot cheaper, because that's how it presents itself on the website. I give them a call to make an appointment, and ask how much it will be, just to make sure. They say it will be at most $64, and I agree to make an appointment even though it is a lot more money then it says on the website. I walk in, literally no one is there, and the woman asks me how I want it. I tell her, and she walks over to the receptionist, who told me it was going to be $64, and the stylist walks back over to me, and tells me it will be $70, plus around $10-15 for the actual color. Me: "The receptionist told me it was going to be AT MOST $64."Stylist: "It's at the stylist's discretion. It will take me almost an hour to do." I just walked out. There was not one other client in there, and they're trying to squeeze more money out of me. I am 16 years old, and do not have enough money to keep giving them when they keep raising the price of an Ombre coloring. If I were you, I would take my money and time elsewhere, perhaps to Salon Buzz, in downtown Chicago, where they are professional enough to keep the price the same from website, to receptionist, to stylist.

0.description: After we moved to this neighborhood, I could not find a salon that I liked.  My hair is super thick and curly. I was a little intimidated to go to Matisse because I was worried about the cost, but after several bad cuts I threw caution to the wind and went.  I have been going for about two years and love it! It is not that expensive either.

5.description: Love Brittany. She is honest, sweet, and great at cutting my hair. It's an adorable Aveda salon. Super easy to find. I would recommend it to anyone.

11.description: The salon was clean, first impression was going great until the stylist who was working on my hair had to seek another stylist opinion, that made me nervous. Of course I ended up with highlights that looked like grey streaks. The woman who worked on my hair immediately realized the bad job and offered to fix it for another day. I went back a few days after and was treated differently as if given the cold shoulder. Anyway my hair was redone but very sloppy, I did not even get a proper drying job, no effort at all. I walked out with damp frizzy hair. Thanks a lot! Definitely not going back!!

8.description: I love this place!! My stylist of many years moved and I was in search of a new salon. I regularly passed it on my way to and from the store and decided to try it out.  I am so happy I did.  Patty asked questions about what my normal hair routine was and how I like to style it.  She took that into account when she cut and styled my hair. I was overjoyed with the end result.  The next day at work I got a ton of complements.  Everyone at this salon is extremely nice.  I plan on sticking with Patty and Matisse for a very long time!!!

4.description: I recently got my haircut by Patty. She is amazing!! I had very long hair, almost to my butt, and I wanted to cut it shorter. She spent the time to talk with me to figure out what length I would be truly comfortable with. The end result was so beautiful. I love it! It's the perfect length without being too short for me, it's a little past my shoulder now. She even said if after a week I still felt I wanted it shorter I could go in and she would do that for me. I wouldn't change a thing, it's perfect!!!

14.description: I went here after reading reviews on yelp. Patti is awesome. She listened to me and did exactly what I wanted. I have already booked my 2nd appointment with her for 6 weeks!!! The staff is awesome also. I felt that I was at a downtown salon but it was only 5 minutes from my house!!! Definitely recommend this salon!!!

7.description: I have been driving out to Matisse from Logan Square for a few years just to have Brittany do my hair.  I am either a hair stylist's dream or worst nightmare.  I am easily bored and in between visits do ridiculous things....mostly with hair dye but sometimes scissors are involved.  Brittany manages to stay patient AND never lets me leave looking like a monster.  I also usually let her do whatever she feels like doing within my particular hair mood.  She even went out and bought fun colors to have on hand for when I am feeling obnoxious.  Regardless of what I want out of a hairstyle Brittany always has good advice and is thoughtful in how to achieve a look we both think will be a winner!

3.description: Owner is kinda old school tough Italian but the waitress was really nice. Cheap cocktails and good Scotch selection.

1.description: Crazy nice neighborhood bar - best owners ever, bourbon selection gets better every time I visit.

2.description: Where is this place? Why no address? I tried to get to the cross street but could not find a bar when I got there. Please, help me find this. I will improve stars to 5 full shiny stars when I go in and have a good time.

0.description: Best bar in the world. Hands down

4.description: Best bar ever

3.description: Very friendly service! They know their stock, and are reasonably priced! I needed Advent candles for my church and no other store sold tapered candles. They not only had them in stock at a great price, but there were many choices of sizes! I'll be coming back!

1.description: Great place to go if you are looking for Christian gifts for baptisms, first communions, confirmations, church ceremonies, etc.  The people who work there leave something to be desired.  My son and I walked in and saw four people working, no one else in the store.  We were not greeted.  As we walked around the store, we clearly could not find what we were looking for.  No one asked if we needed help.  They continued with their debate on who owns the rites to the birthday song and laughed after the woman said she could sing it in Polish, but it didn't translate to happy birthday.  After going to the counter to ask if they had any other angel pins besides those with birthstones, I was told no.  So I decided to make one more round of the store and guess what...I found a whole basket of angel pins!  So contrary to the previous review, they do not know what they have in their store.If I am ever in a pinch, I might go back, but I would rather travel downtown, from Ravenswood, to St. Peter's shop to buy these types of sacred gifts, knowing they are much more helpful.

2.description: SHAMEFUL CUSTOMER REGARD--- CANNOT EVEN HINT AT CUSTOMER SERVICE....These people should NOT even call themselves "Christians"--what a joke!! If I could give them a MINUS 5 stars--that's what they deserve.You would also think that in today's economy with overhead of rent,  employees 'benefits, carrying costs of inventory, on-line sales competition,etc,  you would THINK that at a "religious" goods store, they just MIGHT try a little harder to go an extra step to gain a loyal customer--NOT these women. As I told them to their faces yesterday---"See ya in Church--you hypocrites"- "-I hope you can sleep at night".  I am so very thankful that I was able to find the "Catholic" gift I so desperately needed for a last minute "Catholic event"  at the European Imports and Gift shop @ the Oak Mill Mall on Milwaukee and Oakton. If I had had the time to drive out to Divine Word on Waukegan Road in Northbrook, I would have--wonderful,caring folks.

0.description: This is a WONDERFUL company to work with online.  The merchandise is always as shown.  We have used the printed attendance buttons for over 20 years ... the kids still love them and the competition is steep to get perfect attendance each year.  The print your own Confirmation Certificates are Beautiful and so easy to use.  Mary Morrow answers emails quickly and is super efficient and friendly.

3.description: Nice bar for a small party. Family owned and operated.

1.description: Having dropped in on a lot ( and I mean a lot ) of holes in the wall.... This one is a great find..  The polish is an actual Polish sausage... Beer is cheap ... And the staff want to get to know you . ** if you are a hermit hipster , you might feel uncomfortable** ... It's like drinking in your Polish grand parent basement... Drinking their booze , grandma cooks you food and you have a laugh with good people. All this with a patio too :)

2.description: Filonek's.  They have some of the best deals in the area, provide free food during Bears games, and have great staff.  The bartenders really take care of their patrons.  If you want a prissy bar with "good beer" (sneer), go somewhere else.  :)~

5.description: A pretty decent Polish bar on Milwaukee avenue. I prefered the Irish bars on this strip, but this one gets ok review as there were go go dancers and some weird band the night I went. They have a very select food menu and from the smell of it I don't think it could be that bad.

0.description: I frequent this place every since I move in the area to start the owner I just love she has a lot of personality and she, s very personable she makes you feel feel welcome , I heard about there killer cheese burger and gave it a try I have to admit it's pretty delicious , I have met three of the bartender, s and yelp they are all pretty and make hellafa nice drinks , if your ever in the area give this place a try I enjoy it

4.description: You gotta love Filoneks.  From the cheap prices on the pitchers of beers to the fact that the bar tenders actually pay attention to what you order and try to make it a habit of comping you every few rounds!I have been coming to Filoneks for years and have to say I have never really been disappointed (unless my favorite waitress isn't working).  It has a nice neighborhood feeling to it, but you will get people from all over the city coming in for a drink at the bar.  The outdoor seating is nice for the cooler nights, and atmosphere can't be beat!

58.description: Last year, I purchased a Bloomspot for a 2 hour massage that I was unable to redeem for various medical reasons and this overbooking issue they had. The owner has stated that if I cannot get my money refunded from Bloomspot for this purchase, she will honor it in the salon. I am satisfied with this verbal agreement. This year, I purchased a Groupon for a Moroccanoil treatment with haircut and blowout. I did not have any issues scheduling this appointment, as I made it 3 weeks prior to the point I wanted to use it. Now coming from a woman who has spontaneous salon and spa decisions, I decided to not go straight to disappointment after reading the Yelp reviews. I chose to do everything in advance so they would be able to accommodate my needs. I was very pleased. Amanda was my stylist for the Groupon and she was very friendly and funny. She did a great job texturizing, thinning out and reshaping my unruly curls.My only complaint is when calling it feels very rushed on the phone and the guy who works front desk seems sometimes awkward and trying to push me off the phone or to the owner. I would recommend some phone etiquette lessons.All that being said, I'm more than satisfied with the outcome of my haircut and the luxury of the Moroccanoil treatment and blowout I did not have to do myself. Luckily, this salon is just 2 blocks from my apartment, so I will be using them this summer.

56.description: The Groupon Curse strikes again!  I feel like a lot of the criticism for this salon is ill-informed.  The truth is, it's a nice little place that, while not mind-blowing, is perfectly acceptable.Yes, appointments are not the simplest.  Took me a couple tries, but after leaving a message I got through and they were more than accommodating for my (yes) groupon.  The spa is nice, modern, pretty clean.  The changing room is a bit awkward as it's one big, unisex room.  You can really only be there by yourself and as I went with my friend (girl, not romantically linked) I had to change in the shower with the door closed.  Also, it seemed as if the scheduling was done on a large Day-Minder page so there was some confusion as to who was going where.  There were a lot of befuddled, robed clients walking around looking for somewhere to go.As for the services, they were pretty standard.  The massage was pretty good and vigorous.  The facial was more of a facial massage.  I felt stuff being slathered on but I had no idea what it was.  Could have been slathering handfuls of margarine on my face for all I knew -- no extractions or anything like that just sort of a rubbing.  The pedicure was pretty industry standard, but I can't complain.The staff was super nice and very helpful.  They really seemed like they wanted to please and were genuinely trying their hardest to make our experience great.  For all those grouponers complaining about the scheduling thing -- I get it.  I know it's frustrating, but it's not fair to lower a business's rating just because you couldn't schedule it.  Totally unfair to a perfectly fine salon/spa.I also thought it was funny that the staff referred to my companion several times as my wife though she most certainly is not my Mrs.

29.description: Purchased a Groupon last year. Have not had a problem using it. The front desk staff is adorable. 2 young college (?) boys who have the best manners and are always polite. They always call to confirm my appointments. The only problem I will say is that the laser technician is always so booked she has limited slots on weekends. But other than that it has been a positive experience. My husband has gone with me just to wait and they are always friendly and offer him coffee or water. Nice people. Beautiful place. Great location with parking.

42.description: I really wish I could review this spa but I can't.  I have been calling since February 2013 and not only can I not schedule an appointment but I have not once received a call back.1. February 2013 I called spoke to Carmen inquired about their rates for May she immediately told me no and said Mother's Day would be booked up. When I said I am not looking for Mother's Day she said "O" she took my name and number and promised to call me back the next day since she did not have her appointment book in front of her. NEVER RECIEVED A CALL BACK.2. March 2013 I called in the morning and left a message- no call back. As I was driving home from work that evening I called again and spoke with a young gentleman. I told him that I left a message at 6 am and did not receive a call back.  He said they probably had not checked the messages yet that day!? I then told him I wanted to book for a Saturday in May a girls spa day he proceeded to tell me that he is not allowed to book Saturday appointments but promised to have the manager Carmen call me back the next day. NO CALL.3. April 4, 2013 I called spoke to a woman who said she could not book any appointments and that she would have Carmen call me back that day. An hour or so later I got a call from the spa back- I missed the call but no message was left- I immediately called back and the same woman took my name and number again. Apparently she lost the first message and told me Carmen would call me back that day.... It is now April 20th. Never received a call back.I really like to give small businesses a chance and this spa is so close to my house I can almost walk there.  I wanted to schedule a spa day for the ladies in May. We would have spent almost 500 dollars here. Too bad I will never see the inside of their Spa This really gives small businesses a bad name. I guess we will be heading over to Mario Tricoci.

23.description: I should have known that this was going to be trouble when I first tried and tried again to make an appointment. It took a few weeks before I got a callback and someone that understood what I was talking about.When I got there, I was ignored for about five minutes, then finally someone asked if they could help me. I explained that I had an appointment with a Groupon. The person seemed confused. OK...... then a very nice lady Carmen, came over and told me how lucky I was to have Amanda take care of me and what a great colorist she is and had honors in her classes etc., etc. OK.... that's nice, if only it were true. I really think that Amanda is fresh out of school. If I wanted a school service I would have gone to a beauty school. Amanda doesn't understand what the color ASH is nor highlights that are champagne blond. NO RED, NO GOLDEN COLOR. She did the sloppiest job at highlights that I ever saw. I could do much better myself. Well ok, sloppy doesn't mean the out come will be bad. Amanda seemed not to really care about what I wanted or what I paid for She seemed quite distracted. Talking to her was like pulling teeth. That's alright too, the bad part comes in when I don't have the light sprinkling of a few natural looking highlights on my dark ash colored hair. The entire top of my head was golden red. Very displeased. She seemed angry at me. She tried to fix it while I contained my anger and encouraged her that things happen and it will probably turn out good. Without notification she goes to work on someone else and doesn't even tell me she is going to work on her next person and another lady came to finish. IT WAS NOT FIXED. IT LOOKS AWFUL. A WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY.I think what they do is get in new people fresh out of school to have them get the experience with the Groupon. I hate to say this but I don't think this place will make it.They have all kinds of workers just walking around adjusting tea bags, moving magazines etc.After I got home I thought maybe I could tone it down with some toning shampoo. Couldn't do this. I called for the owner to call me back a week and a half ago.No response to my phone that has voice mail and caller ID. I have given up. I waited six months for my hair to grow out and get a good color, highlights and cut. All to end up looking like a clown.If you go there ask a lot of questions, but don't expect honest answers about who is working on your hair.Best wishes to this new owner, but I don't think your place is going to make it with the attitude and non concern for your clients.. I was very polite and accepting but just wanted my hair fixed. NO RESPONSE BACK.. I'd be leery of this place.

47.description: I really wish all these negative reviews were posted before I bought my Groupon, as it would have saved me a lot of time and frustration. I called many times without anyone answering the phone, and left several messages.   When someone finally called me back, they seemed willing to fit me into their schedule, UNTIL I mentioned that I had a Groupon.  Automatically, the scheduler's mood changed from welcoming to standoffish. She immediately said that they are completely booked and I shouldn't expect to get an appointment before my expiration date, and that I should just contact Groupon for a refund.  Excuse me?  I thought the whole purpose a business does a Groupon deal is to get new customers. I explained to her that I bought this Groupon for my mom's birthday, and she was really looking forward to it, so I didn't want a refund, I want the services. I suggested that other businesses who were overwhelmed with appointments extended their expiration dates so that the customers could still use their Groupons.   She said that is not their policy and again said they were completely booked with Groupon services, so I should just ask for a refund. Another important note is that Groupon lets you use the amount you paid after the expiration date, but she also said that wasn't her policy.  Ok, I tried to be reasonable, but this lady does not care about procuring new customers. Why is it that businesses who fail to have enough staff make their customers pay for it?  Why are they making us go through the hassle of cancelling, and do they not realize that they are sending away very unhappy potential customers?  Why do they treat Groupon customers like second class citizens? Don't they understand that people use Groupon and other deal sites to try new businesses they haven't heard of before, and hopefully become repeat customers?  If they think Groupon customers are such an inconvenience, stop doing Groupon deals! I will never again attempt to make an appointment here again.  It is obvious they do not care about customer satisfaction, so I'll take my business elsewhere.

8.description: I got a Groupon for a massage, facial, salt scrub mani/pedi for my daughter and her friend. When they got there they were told they scheduled them for the wrong Groupon and would not get all the services. What they did get was a 15 min massage, 15 min facial and a quickly pedi that was smeared and didn't have time to dry because there was 1 girl trying to get both pedi's in before their massage and facial. They were told one of them might be able to get her mani squeezed in. Both girls were rushed from room to room and then made to wait 10-12 minutes, but that time was taken off their massages and facials, resulting a hurried, un-relaxing experience. When I called to complain, Carmen basically told me they were lying. I offered to send her the picture I took of my daughter's pedi on her cell phone and she told me it was my daughter's fault. No offer to fix this. She told me to call Groupon.Based on this experience, I would say go elsewhere.You can drink a glass of champagne and eat a strawberry at home.

31.description: This is the best place to go to for laser hair removal.  The least painful laser I've ever experienced and just as effective as those archaic electric shock "things".  (Who'd pay for that anymore when they've  developed much less painful lasers for hair removal?) Roberta is my favorite aesthetician, however all the aestheticians are friendly and professional.  Watch for groupons.  They come out with them all the time.  I've used about 3-4 so far.  It makes laser hair removal extremely affordable and as pain-free as possible.

34.description: Don't waste your money on the laser hair removal.  It didn't work!  I think this is in part because of their system.  Since the salon used pulsed light technology, the technicians need to go over the SAME exact line of hair at least TWICE at EVERY session in order for the hair to be removed. Considering that my legs look the same after 7 sessions, and it only took the technician about 10 minutes to perform the procedure on both of my legs, I think the equipment is either defective (I did get an extra session because the laser was broken during one of my sessions) or the technicians need to pay more attention to detail when using the machine. Despite that, the technicians were really nice and I didn't have the scheduing issues that other had.  It's just not worth your money (even with a Groupon) if you don't get any results.

16.description: SPA and service always amazing!!! We have our girl spa celebrations every few months and we are happy with the staff and services we receive.  Massage by Brian and meni, pedi, hair treatment and style always perfect. I am now doing hair lazer removal and very happy with the sessions. I highly recommend Allure de Vie spa!

13.description: Updating my previous review. My ma just had an all over color and cut today with Amanda. The owner was there. I am assuming she read the review. I admire people who take constructive criticism. She is one of those people, thus is why I changed my updated review to 5 stars. I had an expired groupon and she honored the paid amount and took into consideration a special they were having. She was genuine and different, for the better. My ma is extremely happy w her color and cut and Amanda.  Will definitely be back for my ma :)

11.description: Buyer beware.  You get what you pay for.  They run late all of the time and have limited appointment times.

39.description: Yes I am fan of their male asian massage therapist. You can tell him how and where you want to concentrate on. There might be negative reviews with other services but not with him, thus we are going back for him.

37.description: I found a Groupon for this place and called prior to purchasing it. I immediately got an appointment that worked ideally with my schedule to get a haircut, style, and Moroccan oil treatment with Amanda. Gotta be honest, was a bit nervous after reading previous reviews but was wonderfully surprised by my experience. I came in a few days later, used their lot in back (the designated spots that are clearly marked for the salon customers), and checked in. The lady who greeted me, Carmen, who is also the owner, and Amanda were incredibly welcoming and friendly. The lady and gentleman who were at the front desk when I left were also friendly and helpful. I was looking for something in between a pixie cut and Mohawk so I don't think I was their usual demographic and the soothing, spa ambiance implied a more high end, conservative clientele. I was not, though, judged or treated as if I were a lesser client or different in any way. The previous reviews from Groupon users implied some pretty rough experiences but clearly they're looking to turn around their image. The (full) 5 minutes of oil treatment, styling, and final haircut were outstanding. The experience and conversation was pleasant and Amanda was so friendly and genuine. I had a fantastic time and love my new hair!

0.description: This salon is amazing. Natalie always gets my cut and color perfect! I highly recommend her. This Saturday 1/09/16 I decided to try their spa services. (Massage, Facial, manicure)  Everyone was so professional and I walked away so happy and relaxed. Love this place you will not be disappointed,

38.description: I had laser hair removal here and it was a great experience. Results were great and so was the service.  Would definitely recommend.

51.description: I had a Groupon but, unlike some other bargain hunters out there, had no trouble making an appointment. I had a pedi, facial and massage. The massage was the highlight. The therapist was very good -- just chatty enough to make sure it wasn't awkward (as it sometimes can be when the client is a woman and the therapist is a man), responsive to my request to pay extra attention to my shoulders. The pedi itself was fine -- nothing special -- but I did enjoy the chocolate strawberries and champagne. The facial was relaxing and refreshingly free of cross-selling products. I wasn't crazy about the lockerroom, though. The locks aren't the best -- had to do a lot of key jiggling to lock and unlock -- and some of the robes have seen better days. But the staff was roundly friendly and at the atmosphere was pleasant.

27.description: Haven't even walked in the door at this place but I can tell you already their customer service is absolutely horrible! They gave me a really hard time for a missed appt I had due to an emergency biopsy I had the day of my appt. I called first thing in the morning to cancel and when I called back to reschedule they were so rude - so rude that I asked for my money back. They said they would have to charge me $60 because of 3 techs that had waiting for my missed appt. My appt was not till 4pm and I called at 10am to cancel. I guess this salon does not have a phone to reach their techs for cancelled appointments. Keep the money Allure.I also had a hard time getting someone to return my call. Their receptionist (Kevin)   needs to take some classes on customer service. This place does not even deserve 1 star!

32.description: This place is a challenge to review. So many good things, so many bad things - it is hard to find a way to even it all out. First, let me say that I had Angela and that I was thrilled that she knew exactly what I was talking about when I described taking my hair from a long tangled mess up to a short sharp-angled bob. When she styled it, it looked amazing - but when I got home, the cut requires a full blow-out every time I dry my hair. The color is keeping fantastically though!Now as for the salon.... the place is a logistical nightmare. Angela was working on three clients at once. From the next room, there is an incessant "beep beep beep beep beep beep beep beep" from the laser machines. After an hour in the salon, I was ready to walk out mostly because I couldn't take the noise. A salon is supposed to be relaxing, but the layout and weird noises from the laser room made it less than  enjoyable. Not worth the full price - but it looks like most people are Grouponing!

54.description: Horrible management, but nice employees.  I purchased the groupon special in November for myself, my sister, mother and grandmother.  I gave the groupon to my mom and grandma as a gift for christmas.  I called to make them an appointment end of December and found out there was a 2 month wait for Groupon customers.  Scheduling was difficult as the groupon scheduler Carmen is very unorganized and has 2 different appointment books (paper book and computer program) and mixes things up a lot. Making the appointment and actually confirming it is a hassle that is not worth the groupon deal. The receptionist always says Carmen the groupon scheduler has to call you back to make the appointment.  Carmen NEVER calls back and does not return emails either.  Finally after a few calls (that go unanswered a lot) we got a hold of Carmen in March and got a June appointment.  We call a few days before our appointment to confirm and shocker, we aren't in the system.  Carmen has the audacity to say that her system is error proof and we must have never made an appointment and she has to reschedule us for AUGUST.  It took weeks to make the appointment, and we waited months for it and yet she wants us to wait even longer.  We made the appointment with Carmen the one and only person who makes groupon appointments.  Then she makes a big deal about having to move things around to fit us in, but we can't get all 3 services that we paid for and have to come back for our facials another time.  We got our massage and pedicure our first day there and the people are very nice and professional.  I loved the pedicure ladies, they were nice and funny.  After our appointment Carmen had to reschedule our facials since there wasn't anyone to do our facials since our appointment magically disappeared.  She tried to schedule us to come back 2 months later for our facials. 2 MORE MONTHS for us to finish the service we are owed??? On top of this she doesn't even try to make up for this mix up and for making us come back 2 months later by maybe giving us something for our troubles.  Any normal customer service manager in this situation would have said "I'm sorry we lost your appointment and that you have to make 2 separate trips and wait another 2 months, so how about a pedicure or massage for half off next time".  She made us feel like we were a bother to her busy day of not returning people's phone calls.  The service was good but NOT WORTH the hassle of being treated like a second class citizen because we're groupon customers.  Oh and the best part is Carmen blames groupon for the scheduling conflicts.  How about not selling an unlimited number of groupon deals if you can't even handle the customers you already have?  When I called in February to make our appointment they were so overbooked, yet for Valentines day they did another groupon deal.  HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT AND HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  Carmen if you read this the spa is beautiful and the employees are great.  You are the only reason this business will get bad reviews.  Your attitude is very disrespectful and talking down to customers is not the way to run a business.  I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS SPA AS LONG AS CARMEN IS SCHEDULING THE APPOINTMENTS.

48.description: I also purchased a groupon for the spa package for two for me and the bf.  Booking the appointment was a bit difficult, but I had a good feeling about the place, so I pursued.  Luckily, we don't work traditional work hours so we were able to book an appointment easily without having to take time off work.  Receptionist was very kind and showed us to the changing rooms, gave us locker keys, robes, and flip flops.  We sat in the waiting area with snacks and water then had our pedicures.  Pedicures were great, and I love that they made him very comfortable (being a guy and getting his toes done :) After that we went our separate ways for massages and facials.  I had a deep tissue massage which was excellent!  Honestly, I get massages pretty frequently and must say this was in the top ten list!  I'm only 5'3, so it wasn't an issue for me, but my bf did say he felt claustrophobic in the room (he's 6'3) and said he could have touched both sides of the walls if he stuck his hands out.  Facial was meh, no extractions (which I'm sure was because it was only 30min), but esthetician was friendly.  As we were finishing up around 4, I did notice the spa was starting to get packed, so I would try to arrive before then if possible (atmosphere was so much more relaxing).  Would definitely return!

44.description: Pleasant staff and a very clean space. A little bit of a hike from the city and a bit difficult to get on public transit but it is definitely do able. The offer a number of services and have some pretty good specials.

24.description: Nightmare even trying to make an appointment to this place. They seem overwhelmed by their Groupon offering, but if you don't have the infrastructure to support so many coupons, you shouldn't be qualified for the deal. I called four times before someone returned my call to schedule an appointment. The owner was incredibly rude. I returned my Groupon.

7.description: Horrible customer service. Have been calling the past few weeks about making an appointment for a groupon. Mailbox is constantly full. A woman finally called me back and stated all groupon appointments need to be requested through their online service. Followed her advice and still have not heard anything back about the appointment. Definitely take your money elsewhere.

49.description: Horrible. When I first bought my Groupon about a year ago, I had difficulty scheduling the appointment...I tried three times to schedule it, with no luck. So...I waited almost a year to try again. The first time I called I got voicemail. The second time I called I spoke to a man who said he was not the "scheduler" and took my name and number. I never heard back. The third time I called, they hung up on me. I have complained to Groupon and even after that complaint (and contact by the Groupon support staff), they have not called me back. I have decided that I'm going to just flush $99 down the drain and not even attempt to schedule my appointment. If I end up going I will probably be bitter, so not worth it. I would not advise anyone buy a Groupon for this salon. Maybe they are more accommodating to non-Groupon users?

40.description: 2 years later and I still love this place. The owner Carmen is so friendly and accommodating. I had a cut/color with Sam and he did a wonderful job. Very meticulous and the color turned out exactly as I had wanted it. I've had mani/pedi and the staff does a great job and they are so friendly. I usually call ahead a week or two in advance to get the date/time I want. I'll be going there for laser hair removal and I heard they are putting a new slimming treatment on the spa menu, so I can't wait to try that out too!

53.description: 1. Always seem to get an appointment two months down the line2. Can never seem to find me when I call to confirm my appt3. My facial was so mediocre, no massage, limp hands4. Mani/pedi disappointing, nail techs were talking to each other the whole time in Polish, I think, and I felt like I was interrupting their conversation 5. They have a parking lot in the back, but the intersection is so busy it takes forever to actually get to it6. Not even going back if the services were free

30.description: I love this place! Ive been to so many spas and salons and this is the best one I've ever gone to! The staff are super friendly,  the atmosphere is relaxing and clean, tasty champagne,  great masseurs, and the specials on the prices are definitely a steal! I am looking forward to my bext visit! I recommed this place to everyone! P.s. carmen the manager is a sweetheart and Alex the hairstylist is awesome!

46.description: if you're reading this wanting to know if this place is worth getting the groupon, DO NOT GET GROUPON!  do not even bother going to this place to spa or get a haircut.  this place is a hack of a spa.  the lady who runs this place is super disorganized and so full of crap she continues to tell you b-s after b-s.  when we made our appointment we couldn't get anything confirmed until two months away.  already a sign this place is so wrong.  so we go through with it b/c we made this $99 investment to feel good.  so we finally go and it's nice, the staff is friendly.  get the robe on, sit in the tranquil waiting room and wait to be called to our first treatment.  i got the facial first and my husband was in with the masseuse.  the massage was supposed to be 60 minutes but he was out before my facial was done so he got ripped off on that time.  the facial was nice, btw.  i liked my massage she was good too. now here's the worst part.  my husband and i were back in the waiting room waiting for the final treatment, the pedicure.  we're waiting, we're waiting.  i go out in the hall and there's a woman in her robe and i find out she's waiting for her massage treatment.  she tells me that she was right smack in the middle of her pedi and one of the staff  told her that her masseuse was ready for her but that was 20 minutes ago!  she was getting pissed.  so i come out to the salon area in my robe and the masseuse was sitting in a chair getting hair done and the manager was standing around them talking.  i call for the manager to come and she gives me this b-s story about how they are short with staff and someone will be right with us. i tell her i'm not waiting any more and to give us a gift certificate for the pedicure.  she said absolutely.  my husband and i change out of our robes and go back to the front desk and the manager tells us more of her b-s stories.  after we get the gift certificates i remembered that i left my something in the pocket of my robe in the 'tranquility' room.  i go back to retrieve it and i see that the robes my husband and i placed in the basket hamper was hung back up on the hanger to be used by the next person.  grossss, like gag me with a spoon!  i wish they had a negative star on yelp b/c they don't deserve to receive anything.  my husband called groupon and complained to them about this place and we got a refund.  i took the gift certificates and tore it to pieces.  there's no way i'll return to this place.

1.description: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! DO NOT GO HERE! I purchased a groupon for this salon based on previous reviews. After MONTHS of trying to make an apt I FINALLY was able to go in. When I showed the groupon I was informed it was in "fine print" that there would be an additional $25 charge-what was the point of buying the groupon if they are going to tack on hidden fees?!?!I apologized & said I was not aware-if there was something we could work out.The owner then informed me that she "didn't like my attitude and was refusing me service" AFTER taking my groupon. There goes $40! This is seriously a scam & the worst business woman I have ever run into

55.description: Got a $100 for a Christmas gift.  the lady told me I could only use it on a Wed. despite the fact the certificate says nothing of the sort on there.  She messed up my appointment dates.  She basically does not want me to use the certificate and just wants me to keep my money.  She is a thief and I need to report her to the better business bureau.  I suspect she is closing down soon.

9.description: I had an expired Groupon and they were still able to accommodate me right away with  the option of picking from several openings for a mani/pedi over the next few days.  I was treated well and got good service. Very nice people here!

26.description: I am going to break this down into sections for convenience. Booking:  I purchased the groupon in January and tried to get a hold of them in February to make an appointment I called them and emailed them multiple times and after over a dozen attempts I finally got a hold of them only to have them screw up my package. I never got a reminder call or email before my appointment either. Massage:  I asked for a deep tissue massage and this wasn't anywhere close. I've gotten dozens of massages in the past and this was by far the worst. They asked my if I had any trouble areas and I said yes and they proceeded to neglect those areas completely definitely not going back for that. Facial: this was ok. They did the usual steam and towel routine and asked if I wanted my clogged pores extracted..isn't that one of the points of a facial to begin with?? Also when applying the various products they never told me what the were or what they were suppose to do ( unlike other facials I received). Most likely wouldn't go back for that. Pedicure: this was also just ok. There was the usual foot bath but the water wasn't warm. They didn't really clip my nails or pumice my feet either. The polish selection was very limited but application was good. Also there was no massage during the pedicure either. Pass. Also they serve you champagne and chocolate covered strawberries during the pedicure and the strawberries were covered in Hershey's chocolate syrup not the hardened chocolate that is the norm, this made it very difficult to eat without making a mess. Time management:  nobody there seemed to know what order which service was coming next so they would put u in a very small waiting room while they sorted it out. Since I didn't wear a watch and I left my phone in my locker I didn't k ow what time it was but after I was finished with all my services I saw what time it was and it was way earlier than I expected which means that my services weren't as long as they were supposed to be :(Overall this place was a huge disappointment but I guess you get what you pay for. I thought it was a great deal but it wasn't. Needless to say I won't be going back.

25.description: Always great service from Roberta!  I have purchased a multitude of services from them including manicures, hair cuts, laser hair removal, and will be trying their facials soon.  Customer service is always great!  This has been my mainstay salon for a few years now.  I intend on keeping it that way :)

12.description: It was my first time here. Excellent services!!! Everyone was friendly, helpful and the salon was beautiful.  I am a customer from now on. Good job ladies!!!

59.description: Great service. Answered my phone call right away. I used a groupon for 3 services and all were great. They called back when they said they would and kept the reservation date. Would recommend this place. People not expecting the groupon effect gave low ratings. If you have groupon take into account that many others have them too. Very nice sense of humor too.

21.description: Updating my previous review. My ma just had an all over color and cut today with Amanda. The owner was there. I am assuming she read the review. I admire people who take constructive criticism. She is one of those people, thus is why I changed my updated review to 5 stars. I had an expired groupon and she honored the paid amount and took into consideration a special they were having. She was genuine and different, for the better. My ma is extremely happy w her color and cut and Amanda.  Will definitely be back for my ma :)

17.description: This place is a challenge to review. So many good things, so many bad things - it is hard to find a way to even it all out. First, let me say that I had Angela and that I was thrilled that she knew exactly what I was talking about when I described taking my hair from a long tangled mess up to a short sharp-angled bob. When she styled it, it looked amazing - but when I got home, the cut requires a full blow-out every time I dry my hair. The color is keeping fantastically though!Now as for the salon.... the place is a logistical nightmare. Angela was working on three clients at once. From the next room, there is an incessant "beep beep beep beep beep beep beep beep" from the laser machines. After an hour in the salon, I was ready to walk out mostly because I couldn't take the noise. A salon is supposed to be relaxing, but the layout and weird noises from the laser room made it less than  enjoyable. Not worth the full price - but it looks like most people are Grouponing!

10.description: This place employees are great and do great work!On the other hand the lady that sets appointments and greats you, NOT SO MUCH! I purchased a group-on and be trying to get in since SEPTEMBER. I called once a month and every time i told them i had a group-on the tone completely changed. It went from "and when would you like to come in" to "we are booked into the new year and Saturdays where corporate events only!"Saturday is the busiest day for these business and to have them booked for corp. events only is highly unlikely...Funny how a friend called and was able to get in that same week! They put a group-on out there to then punish you when you purchase it. Its very simple, in the offer state.... only day time apt ...done! But to treat ppl so rudely when the offer is being made by your company is bad business.

5.description: Purchased a Groupon ticket for highlights.  Tried multiple times to make an appointment but they would forward my call to the Voice Mail.  I cancelled my Groupon and will take my services to another Salon.

3.description: Bad experience with a Groupon purchase.  Everyone who has bought a Groupon please follow up with Groupon to get this business kicked off the site.  They clearly do not care about their Groupon customers.

35.description: I just started my full body laser hair removal treatments, and I must say that I am in awe! The treatment was virtually painless, my technician - Justyna - was top notch (professional, very attentive, personable), the front desk staff is one top of their game. I will definitely be back for other services in between my laser hair removal sessions.

19.description: Yep, I was also one of the groupon users. $99 for 2 people to each have a 30 minute massage, 30 minute facial, and pedicure served with strawberries and chocolate and a glass of champagne. As this was for my birthday, my husband agreed to go with me, and even took on the rigorous task of scheduling the appointment for us. Surprisingly, we didn't have too much trouble. He called, left a message, and they called right back. We tried a few different dates until one finally worked.We didn't get a call confirming our appointment. I realized that as we were driving there and I was a little nervous. But, I was ready to bring my A-game if there was trouble. We get there, and they claimed they tried calling us, but couldn't reach us. Were they lying? We had no voicemails.Parking was easy. There's a big lot in back of the salon, though be careful where you park as many of the spots are reserved for some of the businesses there or the condos. The salon itself is hard to spot. It's is on the far north corner of the huge new condo complex on Northwest Highway, just a little north of Devon.Anyways, we got there about 15 minutes early. They said that was fine and pointed us in the direction of the changing room, where we changed into robes. It is one big room, which could be awkward if you are with a friend. They give you a locker to keep your clothes, purse, and shoes, which locks and you keep the key. We were ready for our first service.The facial/massage parts are separate. I was hoping it was more of a couples massage, but that is not the case. I decided to head to the massage room first. I was very much taken aback that there was one massage therapist who was male. I've gotten a number of massages before, and this was the first time I was given an option. The massage itself was adequate, but I didn't enjoy it as much.Next for me came the facial. Again, it was adequate, but nothing fancy. I've definitely had better elsewhere. My face came out feeling soft, but it only lasted for about a day. They did use hot stones, which felt nice. They might want to do something about soundproofing though. I could hear EVERYTHING going on outside the room.Finally, we enjoyed a pedicure together. The nail polish color selection was not the best, with only a few Essie polishes. The pedicure felt rushed to me. For example, they started using the buffer on my foot after it had been soaking for less than 2 minutes. Because of that, my feet weren't as smooth as they normally are after a pedi. The nail polish itself does look good though - no chips or smudges.Overall, it was an OK experience, and you can't really go too wrong with $49.50 for 3 salon services. But, I felt less than pampered. The facial and massage each felt short and the pedi felt super rushed. There weren't a lot of people there when we were there, so it wasn't too busy, but I felt like everyone was just trying to get their service done so they could get to the next person. The people working there were nice, don't get me wrong, but it was just a hurried vibe that I got from them.I would likely go back with a groupon/deal in hand, but not without. it wouldn't be worth it.

28.description: Positive: Facial is amazing. Negative: Bought a groupon here for 3 services for $99. You could come with someone and each person would get a 30 minute service or you come alone and get three 60 minute services. Well the massage was about 30 minutes and it was supposed to be an hour. Again the facial was amazing and a full hour. And then there's the pedicure which was the most rushed pedicure I've ever gotten in my life. I've also never had anyone only do one coat of polish on a pedicure ever. I mean it is a dark color, but it usually lasts a little longer if you put on an extra coat. The services also come with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. While I love chocolate covered strawberries, you know dipped strawberries with the hard chocolate, I do not really enjoy Hershey syrup drizzled strawberries. If I come back here I would only come for the facial.

45.description: They made up for my bad experience, and all is well :-)

33.description: Went there for my first time and it surpassed my expectations.namanda took the time to find the perfect hair color for me and explain everything. The manager was beyond great to... She welcomed me and explained all types of specials they had going on and made sure I was comfortable. I will absolutely be going back

43.description: This was the absolute worse experience I have ever had in a hair salon.  The male stylist completely butchered the incredibly simplistic style I asked for.  I even brought an exact image.  The style was very basic, just a straight cut with no layers or bangs.  I left in tears, after the man butchered my hair, with strings of hair left inches longer than the rest.  I do not recommend this salon.  The employee came off stuck up and obnoxious, considering is oblivious to the fact that he desperately needs a career chance.

2.description: The salon is lovely and the service is great, but now I have a gift certificate from December  (it's now mid-February and I can never schedule an appointment! They offer and sell so many "deals" that you have to book weeks in advance to get any service. Very disappointing!

18.description: Although everyone is friendly greeting you when you are there at the spa the outcome for laser hair removal is a waste of money there. I received 7 treatments for laser hair removal and not one place on my body has any results. Every place I received hair removal it had all grown back! They say it is the top of the line laser system but if it was I think at least on one part of my body I would have seen results. The only thing that was suggest for me to purchase more packages and they would give me only 1 free. After paying over $1000 for 7 services. I received absolutely NO results. Do not waste your money here for laser because it won't work. They will suggest that your doing something wrong or even ask if your taking hormone pills or say you have very think stubborn hair. I did as they told me and was not on any type of medication or hormonal pills for that fact. I have to say I was not pleased with the results and my hair is still on every part that they lasered. Some of the parts of my body I never shaved in my life and now that I started shaving for the laser service, I have to keep shaving because the laser did not work.

41.description: My story begins back in late 2011 when I bought a Groupon for a two person spa day. After several attempts to schedule the appointment, I gave up. I sent emails through their website, called and left messages....I felt ignored. I figured I'd just use the value that I paid for and get some services done when the time would come that I would need them. Fast forward to last week, May 2013. It was so much easier to schedule an appointment now that I wasn't using a "Groupon" even though I was using the value of it. I had a special event that evening and scheduled a manicure, pedicure and hair wash, blow dry and style for the event. Manicure/Pedicure: This went well. I'd give the girls 4/5 stars. It was a typical service you'd get anywhere. Nothing above and beyond, but it was nice and they did a good job. Not sure I'd come back since it was pricier than I usually pay for these services, but I needed to use up my Groupon value. Hair Job: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! First off some background.....I had just had my hair highlighted about one week before this appointment, so it was a little fragile. I let the hair stylist know this before he started. My hair is fairly long, not too think or thin. I wanted/asked for a hairstyle to wear my hair down with some waves and a little volume. It started bad with the hair wash. The stylist shampooed it extensively and TWICE!!!! While shampooing it, he would mush it all up creating the worst tangle ever. Any experienced stylist should know better than to do that. And with the recent highlighting, my hair was fairly dry. It did not need two shampoos. What should have followed was a good conditioning...but NO. I got barely any conditioner and it was almost immediately rinsed out. After the shampoo, no hair product was used at all. He proceeded to comb out my hair, taking handfuls of hair with it from the mess that was made during the shampoo. Then the styling.....OMG.....I've never seen hair done this way. NOT EVER!!! My hair was partially dried to start off with. That's normal. The stylist was using a normal round bristle brush to dry it and get some volume...still normal. Then it began. He would dry a section of my hair with the roller brush...then wrap my hair around the brush until it was tight, and left the brush hanging from my head, with my hair wrapped around it. SERIOUSLY!!! I could literally feel it tearing at my scalp. Then he'd grab another round brush and do it again. At one time I had three brushes hanging from my head. Then he went back to the first brush, took my hair out, wrapped it around his fingers and used a bobby pin to pin the 'curl' to my head. To top it off....the bobby pins he used.....they were ones that I had just removed from my hair from how it was styled when I walked in. Does this salon not provide their stylist's with their own tools? The bobby pins weren't even holding well because they were stretched out from my use. This went on with my whole head. Hair brushes hanging, wrapping my hair around his fingers and then just bobby pins. At least he used some hairspray, which was all that was used that seemed normal. While my hair 'set', I changed clothes then went back to get the final style. The curls that were removed were not curls and hardly even waves. He then proceeded to tease my hair for some volume. My hair really didn't need that abuse after everything else. He also proceeds to tell me how damaged my hair is. NO S$!T SHERLOCK after what you just did to it. I take good care of my hair even with the coloring I do. He should know how to handle it. After a few more minutes of teasing, hair spray, etc, all I could do was grin and bear it and get the hell out of there as fast as possible. FINAL: To top it off.....I was charged the highest rate on the hair stylist.....the rate of an "Artistic Director." If that guy is their "Artistic Director," they have some serious issues. Who knows what a normal entry level stylist would have done to my hair? I ended up not using the whole value of my groupon and they wanted to issue me a gift card for the remaining value. Thank goodness I saw the Fine Print that said I can use the value toward goods or services. I used the leftover amount to buy some products they sell. At least they can't mess that one up.Conclusion: Don't get a Groupon. Don't use their hair services. Manicure/Pedicures are worth if willing to pay the price.

52.description: I read all the bad reviews before coming for my appointment and have to say I was not expecting to have such a great experience. I too had a groupon and was treated first class. Although I think they did my services backward, pedicure, then facial then massage, I really enjoyed it. I do think that the girl that did my facial should have explained the process and what she was doing as it was my first facial, but it was a really relaxing experience. The room they take you to in between services is so nice. Although this was my first trip ever to a "spa" and I have nothing to compare it to, I thought it was great. Carmen was really nice and the other lady at the front desk was also very friendly. Brian did my massage and it was amazing! I will definitely go back to Brian to get a massage.  Yes, it may take some time to get through and make an appointment, but give them a try. It is worth it!

50.description: Yep, I was also one of the groupon users. $99 for 2 people to each have a 30 minute massage, 30 minute facial, and pedicure served with strawberries and chocolate and a glass of champagne. As this was for my birthday, my husband agreed to go with me, and even took on the rigorous task of scheduling the appointment for us. Surprisingly, we didn't have too much trouble. He called, left a message, and they called right back. We tried a few different dates until one finally worked.We didn't get a call confirming our appointment. I realized that as we were driving there and I was a little nervous. But, I was ready to bring my A-game if there was trouble.
