We get there, and they claimed they tried calling us, but couldn't reach us. Were they lying? We had no voicemails.Parking was easy. There's a big lot in back of the salon, though be careful where you park as many of the spots are reserved for some of the businesses there or the condos. The salon itself is hard to spot. It's is on the far north corner of the huge new condo complex on Northwest Highway, just a little north of Devon.Anyways, we got there about 15 minutes early. They said that was fine and pointed us in the direction of the changing room, where we changed into robes. It is one big room, which could be awkward if you are with a friend. They give you a locker to keep your clothes, purse, and shoes, which locks and you keep the key. We were ready for our first service.The facial/massage parts are separate. I was hoping it was more of a couples massage, but that is not the case. I decided to head to the massage room first. I was very much taken aback that there was one massage therapist who was male. I've gotten a number of massages before, and this was the first time I was given an option. The massage itself was adequate, but I didn't enjoy it as much.Next for me came the facial. Again, it was adequate, but nothing fancy. I've definitely had better elsewhere. My face came out feeling soft, but it only lasted for about a day. They did use hot stones, which felt nice. They might want to do something about soundproofing though. I could hear EVERYTHING going on outside the room.Finally, we enjoyed a pedicure together. The nail polish color selection was not the best, with only a few Essie polishes. The pedicure felt rushed to me. For example, they started using the buffer on my foot after it had been soaking for less than 2 minutes. Because of that, my feet weren't as smooth as they normally are after a pedi. The nail polish itself does look good though - no chips or smudges.Overall, it was an OK experience, and you can't really go too wrong with $49.50 for 3 salon services. But, I felt less than pampered. The facial and massage each felt short and the pedi felt super rushed. There weren't a lot of people there when we were there, so it wasn't too busy, but I felt like everyone was just trying to get their service done so they could get to the next person. The people working there were nice, don't get me wrong, but it was just a hurried vibe that I got from them.I would likely go back with a groupon/deal in hand, but not without. it wouldn't be worth it.

4.description: Worst spa ever. I got a deal that I'll b fully refunded if did not get any result at the third sessions knowing that I had previous wonderful experience at different spa overseas I got result at the second session n that's why I decided to have full body when they assure me that I'll b fully refunded if did not get any results at the third session, but when I told them that no results till now and I'm really wondering why cz I'm sure I have to get some result according to my previous experience at different spa the owner was too rude and screamed and lost her control and according to her attitude I asked her to send me my money back cz this is what we agreed on I have been trying to call them about one year and till now no response.

6.description: I will not be returning. Used groupon to get a haircut and single processed dye and received chemical burns on my scalp!! I had thought she left dye in my hair but I actually had several dime-sized scabs all across my head.

22.description: Disagreement on credit to be used lead to facial starting 20mins late. As a client, who arrived on time, I'd expect my hour facial to be an hour. But wasn't because of this. Then waited 45 minutes past scheduled time for a no chip manicure appointment   Both services went well. The staff is friendly and salon is nice. The lack of communication between staff in both scheduling and package purchasing is completely unprofessional and was very disappointing to me. Otherwise, they would've found a few new,  consistent clients.

15.description: Always great service from Roberta!  I have purchased a multitude of services from them including manicures, hair cuts, laser hair removal, and will be trying their facials soon.  Customer service is always great!  This has been my mainstay salon for a few years now.  I intend on keeping it that way :)

57.description: So.. yeah.. the process to get an appointment is ridiculous. They refuse to answer the phone.  When we finally did get a hold of them and made the appointment, we called them when we were in the parking lot to see if it's OK to park back there.. no answer.  We parked anyway and were in the salon within 3 minutes and 3 people were behind the counter.  Uhhh.. Why are they intentionally not answering the phone???????But anyway.  We had a groupon.. facial, massage and pedicure.  We walked in and it was very nice. Plain and quaint.  We go into the back and they tell us to change into our robes.  While I got a massage, my mom got the facial.. and vice versa. The services were OK.. I feel like the facial was nothing more than her putting different lotions on my face and then wiping them off.. no tools used. just a deep clean, I guess.The massage was good.  You can choose from a Swedish or a deep tissue massage.  I chose deep tissue.  I forgot his name, but it was an Asian man doing the service.  He was really good about asking if I wanted more or less pressure but was kind of yappy.I didn't like the pedicure.  The women were not friendly and rushed through it.  Maybe because I was the last client of the day.. I don't know.  They barely scrubbed my feet... did not get all the dead skin off.. no leg/foot massage..  They painted them nice.. but that is expected.I'd go back if i came across a spectacular deal.. but wouldn't waste my time dealing with the hassle of the appointment process and mediocre service.

20.description: Bought a Groupon for hair cut, color, moroccan oil treatment.  This WOULD have been my 4th time at this business. I couldn't get anyone to call me back to make an appointment.  I did speak to someone who finally answered a phone. I was told that Groupons are only for new clients and that since I'd been there before, they will always offer the Groupon prices.  But they wouldn't make an appointment, instead took my name and # AGAIN, only to never get a call back. I even went through Groupon, who called them with my info.  NEVER, NEVER, NEVER got a call back.  I finally got my Groupon money refunded in Groupon bucks.  Which I will use to try another neighborhood salon which is interested in retaining customers and has customer service. First time I went here, was the spa package Groupon, I would have given it 4 stars. I even received a thank you email. Was informed if I like them on Facebook and review them on Yelp, I'd get a $25.00 gift certificate. I did, they didn't.Second time was again the spa package, much harder to make an appointment. But I also was trying to book 2 appointments, I thought, ehhhh, maybe. Still would have been 3 stars. The massage was rough and not relaxing. Third time was the same same hair package that I just got my Groupon refund from.

36.description: I also have fragile hair which I do try and treat gently and was berated by what sounds like the same gentleman with  for using chemicals on it (I don't and tried to tell him that) and he then actually tore my hair to show me how brittle it was.  If you want to be talked down to and accused ask for him.

14.description: Positive: Facial is amazing. Negative: Bought a groupon here for 3 services for $99. You could come with someone and each person would get a 30 minute service or you come alone and get three 60 minute services. Well the massage was about 30 minutes and it was supposed to be an hour. Again the facial was amazing and a full hour. And then there's the pedicure which was the most rushed pedicure I've ever gotten in my life. I've also never had anyone only do one coat of polish on a pedicure ever. I mean it is a dark color, but it usually lasts a little longer if you put on an extra coat. The services also come with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. While I love chocolate covered strawberries, you know dipped strawberries with the hard chocolate, I do not really enjoy Hershey syrup drizzled strawberries. If I come back here I would only come for the facial.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Horrible just horrible, I knew for 6 bucks it wouldn't be great but the food looks like its been sitting for years. I would rather eat out of the garbage than eat there .

1.description: I came here about two weeks ago for the buffet. I knew I should have left the moment I took a look at what seemed to be days-old food but I was with my mom and she wanted to try it. The fact that no one else was in there during dinner time also should have said something to me. Literally everything tasted bad. EVERYTHING!!! The pickings were slim, barely anything in every hot plate, and it was all bland and dry. I begged my mom to leave and we were gone after 15 minutes. Oh, and I got to spend a good chunk of my evening with the toilet.  Love yourself, don't go here.

2.description: I really hate it when my mom asks me to pick up an order of Ing's fried chicken skins because I usually end up eating a good amount of that AMAZING deliciousness on the half-hour ride home.  It's incredibly good, although it's definitely something I shouldn't be eating. But it's complete torture to just let that over-packed pan of still-warm and crisp chicken skins just sit there.  The skins call my name and I could never say no....ever.  Especially when it comes with a cup of vinegar.  Ugh, my mouth is watering.As for the actual food, we've done catering from here a few times and I'd say it's just okay.  Prices are pretty low.  I have seen the buffet before and it doesn't look too appetizing.But if you have a craving for tasty, crisp chicken skins, you can get a quarter pan piled high for only $9!  Just be sure to share it with several people so you don't increase your chances of a premature heart attack.

9.description: Ing's China King now has Buffet Lunch ($5.95, 11:00 am-3 pm) and Buffet Dinner ($6.95, 3 pm-10 pm) ...All You Can Eat. Very Tasty!

10.description: When I order something that is labeled "Hot & Spicy" I expect it to not only be hot in the temperature, but I also expect there to be some heat in the spices.  Well, the Cashew Chicken, labeled "hot & spicy" on the menu, wasn't spicy at all.  In fact, it was rather bland.  The egg rolls were pretty mushy inside.  I only ate half of my egg roll.  Now, the vegetable fried rice was delicious!I'm giving it 3 stars because of the rice and because the chicken in my cashew chicken was cooked correctly.  Not rubbery.

4.description: Egg Rolls are outstanding!  Veggies are fresh and the Meat is always flavored and cooked well.  The old lady that works the register is very nice and helpful. Ings is a master of delivery and carry out!  Within the last few years they expanded the restaurant and started the buffet which I have had but Ings really shines when their food is made to order....fresh and hot!

6.description: I always buy chicken from here for family gatherings. The chicken is juicy and crispy and goes really good with rice. They serve big portions for really cheap prices so I highly recommend ordering their chicken for big group outings or pot lucks. I tried their fried shrimp once and it was ok, The reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the chicken and the service. The lady who runs the restaurant is very kind and patient. Even though she has a heavy accent and is hard to understand sometimes, she gives great customer service to make sure she takes down the right order and leaves the customer happy. It is not the best sit down place even though it is a buffet. It is very cheap and there is not a broad selection on the buffet menu so it is better as a take out place. There is not much parking around the restaurant. I always look forward to eating Ing's chicken for family outings as it is so popular amongst my family.

12.description: I love ing's not only its cheap their Fried Chicken is awesome. I like how its just fried without breading. So tasty and crunchy. She makes this Chicken dish too thats kinda how chinese makes duck but she uses chicken instead. Sweet and salty. Yum! I love going there when I get my oil change next to  ing's

5.description: Let's be clear.  I am not a fan of buffets.  More often than not, it is cheap and the food quality reflects that.Buffets are always inhabited by old folks in tracksuits who have already lost their taste buds and tell you in all seriousness..."You can't shake a stick at this deal!"I was "treated" to lunch here by my boss.  It was more of a trick.I can't help it.  He was super psyched that it was $5.95 a person and thought that it could become a regular stop for "us".  No thank you.  I'm a snob when it comes to Asian food.Food looked old and congealed.  There was a complete fish floating in sauce with it's eyeball blanched.  Another full fish was fried with it's eyeballs.  Totally gag worthy.  Absolutely nothing appealed to me.  I tasted what looked edible and all of it was cold.  The restaurant is very outdated.  It is literally stuck in the 70's.  There was as expected,  lots of people over 60 who appeared to enjoy their food.  I was the only Asian there other than the owner.  Very telling.

13.description: Have tried Ing's Chinese Buffet, as it's now called, twice.  Was hoping the bad first time was a fluke; apparently not.  When I order something "hot and spicy", as the previous reviewer, I expect the food to be hot and have lots of heat.  What I got was sweet.  Why, oh why do so many Chinese restaurants advertise hot and spicy when in reality the sauce is sweet?  The only reason I gave it two stars was because the pot stickers were pretty good.  Plump with lots of meat.  Needless to say, there won't be a third try.

11.description: This is the best Chinese food I've had in the city- at least the fried rice. If you get the Mongolian hot fried rice it is actually hot, but sometimes differs in temperature each time. I constantly get cravings for the fried rice and egg rolls which are really crunchy and greasy! I have not tried the buffet yet, but it seems like the food was better before the transition

8.description: If I could give no stars I would. Had the buffet and it was pretty gross,don't know why I stayed.I started with the egg drop soup and there was something blackish green a flat like object in the egg,I asked the owner and she said we precook it that's why.Should of left then,but no kept eating and now hoping I am not going to be sick.I sat with my back to the buffet and faced the large mirror,and there were these little bugs crawling up the mirror did not get to see what kind.CAN  WE  SAY HEALTH INSPECTOR SOON! First time and won't be back.Kicking my self for staying,yea cheap but hope not worth getting grossed out and sick.Food was very salty and cold.NOT GOOD!!!!!!

0.description: The reason why on my first visit I decided I'd keep going back is this: I sat down with my wife who wanted to eat from the buffet, while I was only in the mood for steamed vegetables and rice. Since they don't have plain steamed veggies in the buffet, (they do have them covered in sauce) I ordered the large portion and told the lady I would only eat the veggies, and that I wouldn't eat from the buffet. She brought me a plate full of delicious steamed vegetables, and told me not to worry and to eat from the buffet all I wanted. She only charged me for the buffet, which is cheaper than the large steamed veggies. About their catering menu... I haven't found a cheaper place for large quantities of food. With a $15 tray of fried chicken thighs and legs I fed everyone at my Superbowl party. Most of the complaints I read here about their buffet are about how unappealing their food is. That is the case with most Chinese food, people! I live a block away and I visit here very frequently, and I've never had anything that was stale or didn't taste right. I'm also surprised people say these things, especially since the lady who owns the place constantly refreshes the trays. My only complaint is about their ventilation system; it does get a little hot and sticky in there.

7.description: From the moment I walked in, I knew this was a bad idea.  It was lunchtime on a Tuesday and there were only 2 customers in the place.  Although the place is large and has the potential of holding a good rush hour lunch traffic.  The establishment looks dirty and out-dated.  The walls are covered with generic mirrors and tables are place down one side of the restaraunt.  The quality of buffet food is atrocious.  I would not feed it to my dog.  A lot of the food tasted like it was frozen for weeks at a time and then warmed up for lunch.  Small portions of the food were placed in warming dishes causing the food to dry up and lose all moisture and substance.  The eggroll and crab rangoon taste and smell rotten.  The fried rice was beyond;  tasted rotten and old as well.If could rate the establishment a zero, I would.  I give it a half a star for trying.

1.description: Having a bad experience at the moment. Went to this salon and my hair is botched...the color that is. 8 hours the first visit almost 3 hours the second visit and I'm still three different colors. I admit I knew it would be difficult going from dark brown to silver but she said she could do it. My hair is three different colors. I have asked for only half my money back and now I'm being blown off. Surprised and shocked that a salon wouldn't make good.

2.description: Great salon, with great people who do an excellent job always. Keep up the good work. i will recommend you to all friends.

0.description: Call right now and get in with Maria! Talk about a hair genius! Great prices and amazing results! I have been going to her for 12 years! She has fixed my hair from my "brilliant" ideas of going to a dif salon or even box dye! I bring in a picture and she matches it perfectly or she is honest and says I dont think that will work for you etc!! Seriously go to her NOW!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: I heart you TBK.  I'm gonna date myself with this, but remember back in the day when everyone was first getting on the internet?  Remember creating an aol profile, chatting w/ random people, and then meeting up with these total strangers?  Well, for some reason TBK at 2 AM was the official meet up place for me.  Always packed, always enough drunks to entertain and help keep your convo going, and security.  Hidden, but there.It's now renovated, but I loved TBK best when it was in all its run down glory.  The food was and still is cheap and good.  Although amongst friends it became the go-to place for drunken eats, I've stopped by during daylight hours to grab lunch and dinner.  Their portions are huge, and their steak tacos are the shiznitz.  So full of steaky goodness I can hardly make it through two.  They also have a pretty tasty looking bfast menu for those interested.The staff here is always awesome.  I remember meeting up with my dad here for lunch all throughout my college days.  He'd be in full police uniform and they'd always comp our food.  Which meant I was stuck figuring out what it would've cost, and then we'd toss it in the tip jar.  One time some ass started yelling about the "pig flashing his badge to get a free meal."  The guy behind the counter actually pulled our money out of the tip jar and schooled the guy.  Nice.  Nothing better than service with a smile, and some attitude when you need it.  Yes, I really do heart you TBK.

56.description: Best damn late night mexican food ever. I have only gone to the ones on Harlem & 90 and the newer one in Niles. The Niles location has a full service bar in it as well although I have never been there early enough to take advantage of it.

29.description: If you are one to party all night long in the city and you are drunk out of your mind like a freakin' monkey or something else -- smoking a few Acapulco gold and in desperate need of greasy, non-authentic Mexican food, then hit up this joint. Food tastes so much better when your taste buds are whacked.  If you don't mind low-quality meat, cheap, greasy food late at night this may be for you. I wasn't stoked with this place, so I will say no thank you. (P.S. This is a franchise chain that is open 24-hours).

42.description: BEST LATE NIGHT DRUNK FOOD IN THE CITY OR BURBS.I have been here several times over the past 10 years and am never disappointed.  Normally I pick up on the way home from a night of drinking in the city and there burritos never disappoint.  I recommend the al pastor spicy with fresh jalps, with guac, xtra green sauce on the side.  And I know it's hard to believe but there cheese fries are quite stellar as well.  I have never had this place sober, but for drunk food it cannot be beat.Calling ahead to place your order and beet the line is always a good call.

23.description: I used to live in this area and usually came here after the bar closed...truth be told.  On a rare occasion I'd stop in for something for lunch or dinner "to go".  I'm a fan of the nachos, or I should say I was a fan of the nachos.  It's been a while since I ate here, so I didn't realize they used orange nacho cheese being a mexican place and all...Though my memory does serve correctly that they have some large quesadillas that ooze with orange grease.If you come in this place late...you'll get a line, a pretty crowded place full of drunk people.  But any other time, holidays, etc. they are always open.  It's cheap mexican eats...not much more.

47.description: Just a great burrito place.  Watch out for the db's after midnight or so, kind of sketchy these days.

8.description: I used to live in this area and usually came here after the bar closed...truth be told.  On a rare occasion I'd stop in for something for lunch or dinner "to go".  I'm a fan of the nachos, or I should say I was a fan of the nachos.  It's been a while since I ate here, so I didn't realize they used orange nacho cheese being a mexican place and all...Though my memory does serve correctly that they have some large quesadillas that ooze with orange grease.If you come in this place late...you'll get a line, a pretty crowded place full of drunk people.  But any other time, holidays, etc. they are always open.  It's cheap mexican eats...not much more.

31.description: Umm where r your gloves at?! First you touch my money and after you make my food?! Go wash your hands first! Low on meat and not really great service. Take your extra minute but make sure my food is good.

34.description: Im not a fan.Not at all.Lets just say when I think of good Mexican food Taco Burrito King doesnt even make the list.Only way I ever walk in is when (like today) I get an OVERWHELMING taste for a burrito and everyplace else is closed.Last time I was here was 3 years ago on New Years Eve at about 3am.And YEP!!! Everywhere else was closed.Im giving them 2 stars versus one because they do come thru for me on those days when I ABSOLUTELY MUST have a burrito and everywhere else is CLOSED!!!!

16.description: This place used to have the best burrito in town now this is not only my decision but my friends share the same view they have horrible food. I can belive day went downhill within 2 years.

13.description: I love TBK. They're open 24/7. Most of the people I know ONLY go here after a night of drinking, but my husband and I actually get cravings for it and eat it for dinner. We actually walked* (*shoveled our way) there to get food during a huge snowstorm a couple of years ago that closed down practically everything else in our area. It's not the highest quality, but whatever it is, it's pretty damn good and I can't stop eating it. The service is quick, the tables are pretty clean, and it's so easy to find a seat when it's not 12-5am. I usually stick to their Steak Junior Burrito Plate (their King Burrito takes me two days to eat!) or Steak Torta Plate, which make a great meal for cheap! I love their tamales, too, and their quesadillas are pretty tasty, though often a little too greasy. Order one of those, grab yourself some salsa, get an horchata, and you just scored an awesome meal for less than 10 bucks! Yay!

11.description: Awesome drunk, ok sober.  Its much cleaner than it was years ago.  My wife loves the cheese quesadilla

39.description: Great food, great experience, very nice guys working there, always busy- because people know how reliable and awesome it is :-) My personal favorite: steak fajitas. YUMMM!!!! but everything is delicoius-did try most of it through the years and all is divine!

37.description: This place is AHHHHMAZINGGG. Their tacos & burritos are heaven in your mouth! I love this place, and the best part is it's open 24/7! I like the atmosphere, & how it's always pretty clean inside. However, its a 30 minute drive there from my house so that part sucks. :( But I hope this place never closes down, cause it wins over ANY mexican restaurant out there!

0.description: Thoroughly enjoyable burrito.  It was the size of a dachshund (minus the tail). Not too expensive,  either.

38.description: Love the food but very expensive for it. Could get better somewhere else for cheaper. Only go there when there are burrito specials, steak is good. Very greasy though. Whatever its a burrito

51.description: Good place for Mexican food!!

27.description: Our food was food until we noticed hat the guys in the back wre not wearing gloves while cooking.  This is beyond nasty and unsanitary!! I will never eat here again and my advice to all others is to never eat at the taco burrito king in Norwood park!! Horrible horrible place...

32.description: Better options in logan square. But if your like most people here, your wasted at 4 am and want some mexican food thats walking distance. The interior is alot nicer than it used to be. Parking in back. Food is just average. 4 stars if your hammered 2 if your sober.

54.description: Good, cheap food.  Gots to love that.

48.description: Best taco burrito king I've been too. Very rarely messes up my order. C'mon how can you mess up an order like mine? I only like my tacos and burritos with lettuce onions and cilantro. One particular guy always takes my order and have rarely had a problem with my orders. The food is great. The service is so fast. Only wished they delivered.

44.description: Nothing special here. Microwaved quesadillas and glorified taco bell tacos. Their burritos are slightly better but nothing to go out of your way for.

24.description: I see these all over the city so I figured I'd give it a shot on my lunch break, I really did want to like the food but it was a little bland for my personal taste and Carmela's in Uptown has spoiled me. Sorry TBK.

7.description: If you like the people handling your food without gloves and an obvious gash on his hand, go here; it can be exciting to see what disease they give out for free.They also have gone down hill with quality (as hard as that can be to comprehend if you've eaten there before).  The meat I ordered last night was full of fat and gristle.  I didn't even finish my first taco before tossing it in the trash.As someone that used to eat here regularly, I will NEVER step foot there again.

49.description: This happens to be one of those places that I (or most people, I suspect), have never visited completely sober. Always open and serving up greasy food by the platter-full, it's the perfect spot for satisfying your late night hunger (aka soaking up a night's worth of alcohol). Though it definitely packs a 'walk of shame' kind of punch (how can it NOT, when you're devouring fried food at 4AM in your now too-short dress with your smeared makeup sadly obvious under the fluorescent lights?), the food always hits the spot. Beware, it's always packed - usually with fellow party-goers - and you'll likely have to wait in line for a bit. The great thing is that they employ security to 'police' the patrons, so you at least have some sense of order in an otherwise inebriated crowd. Our group's token drunk friend wandered away for a moment, and one of the security guards was on us in an instant. I suppose it would be a huge liability for the place if their clearly drunk customers started wandering off into the night.

40.description: Awful, just awful. It is not the first time they screw up my phone order.Yesterday I called them and ordered something as a pick up; I was told that it was going to be ready in 10 minutes; arrived there and not only it was not ready, but they lied to my face and said that they had never received the order and that the phone number that I had called belonged to a different location. Fine. On my way out, I decided to redial the number and GUESS WHAT??! the phone rang and I could hear the guy talking to me both on the phone and in the restaurant. I returned to the register and the guy apologized, yes...but why do it in the first place??? Why lie to a customer like that?! I was never offered the meal for free or even a discount. Paid, took my food, and left.In conclusion, you ARE BETTER OFF GOING ELSEWHERE. There are plenty other locations that they have in the area, only a few miles away.

53.description: Nothing good ever happens after 2 in the morning, I learned this from Ted Mosby. Nothing good except Taco Burrito King that is.I'm pretty sure Ted's never been to T.B. King.It was past 2:30 when I got there with the usual gang (we lost one along the way after a long night of dancing and partying, she had to get up early). My three tacos (two Al Pastor and a Carne Asada) were fantastic. We ended up full and sleepy. A perfect ending to a great night.

30.description: Chicken GRIZZLE tacos. How about some meat.Very poor tonight. I have to have more words to get this posted so I will reiterate.  To much GRIZZLE.

46.description: Good food but noisy and filled rowdy drunks after 11pm, one of which recently broke one of their store front windows. On another occasion I helped a teenage girl who overdosed on weed and went into a seizure while inline. But enough about the customers. These are the most flavorfull tacos in all of chicago! They are open late too! Good place to go for that late night craving. They have parking in the rear. They are also trust worthy, I left my credit card there one time and retrieved it the next day.

1.description: They have no tap water available!  Supposedly the owner doesn't want to give out tap water and wants to force everyone to pay 2 dollars for bottled water. This is the first time any restaurant anywhere has denied me tap water. What an absolutely greedy way of conducting business for a place with shitty fold! Taco bell tastes more authentic than this waterless garbage of a place!!

55.description: Tastes so good going in. Hurts so bad coming out!The last 2 times I've eaten at this location I've gotten very sick. So did the people I ate with. Never again.

9.description: I have to admit that TBK has won me back.  When I worked on the Northside (I'm a Southsider) in the mid to late 90's this location and the location on Belmont were my favorite Burrito and Taco joints.  When they opened their location on South Harlem I was excited about it since I had not eaten it since 1998 (I think) unfortunately the south Harlem location was not the quality I remember + it was pricey!About 2 months ago I was hungry on a Saturday night and stopped the Belmont location and the I got the Junior size burrito with Al Pastor and it was delicious!  This past Saturday night I was in the same situation and was headed home (I live in Wisconsin now) and I remember about this location that is right off I-90 so I got off the expressway and grabbed another junior size burrito and it was delicious as well!  This made my almost 2 hour drive home complete.I can only wish we had something like this in Wisconsin, good food and late hours on the weekends..(sigh).

26.description: People complain too much. Stop the lame ass negative shit. Let me sum this place up. You go out late night and you had a few drinks this is the place. Good prices,big food. Stays open super late and super early.

25.description: Went at 6pm and had no problem finding a seat or ordering. They got my order right and the food tastes fantastic! It is a fast food place, so you don't have to pay tip. You just order your food, take it, and sit anywhere you like. It is like a chipotle but better. The parking is limited if you come during busy hours. The large horchata at $2.69 is well worth it! It is large like the huge burritos! They are great for carry out also! The Sunday special is the best for the Carna Asada! Well worth the price for the same meal less $2 comes with a medium drink. I took a picture of the daily specials below. I will go again to try the other tasty entrees. They have a great assortment of food to choose from with lots of locations all over Chicago and in Niles and Des Plaines! The place inside is clean and has a good atmosphere!!! No complaints or problems during non rush hour!

12.description: This place is so gross, everything is awful. They put way too much sour cream and cheese on the tacos it's ridiculous. Never eating here again. The Al pastor did not even look like the picture that was up.

59.description: I want my TBK back! Not sure if owners changed, or just cost cutting measures. This is different food. Steak is tasteless, cheese is different, guac is bland and rice and beans are bad as well. Not only is the food different, it's bad. We've been patronizing TBK for 15 years and now our family needs to find a new Mexican home. I'll miss the 2:00am hunger urges. I guess it's back to Sally's. We've tried the other 2 northside  locations on Harlem in hopes it was one location and the same disappointment. Other long time patrons have noticed the same changes.We'll miss you! Let us know if you find your true self TBK, 'til then, the search begins to satisfy the Mexican urge.

21.description: Went here last night after scoping out teasers (a bar across the street). This is about all this place is good for; something to eat after a long night of drinking. I only drink on occasion and very rarely. When I do it's just one beer. So there is no more long nights of drinking in this old dog but for you young guns who haven't figured out your limitations yet, definitely a great place to get some food after getting completely ripped. Being that I am beyond this scene of life, I taste the food for what it is... Absolute crap. I got a quesadilla and a taco yesterday accompanied by a large Horchata. The quesadilla was bigger than I expected it to be, very greasy of course just the same. The taco was really decked out and full of all kinds of good stuff. The Horchata lacked a cinnamon essence leaving me wish that I had a bottle of cinnamon at my access. Outside of the food, they're always nutty people lurking around the place, nothing against them, it is just a little weird seeing a guy do over a dozen laps around the lobby muttering random sorts of things that no one can understand. Oh and I can't forget to mention the fact that the heat was broken and it was 6° outside. The place felt like an icebox and you could easily see the breath coming out of your mouth. Again like I said though, if you're young and out having a good time getting ripped his crap, none of this stuff probably would've phased you. The food probably would tasted great. The speaking in random tongues probably would've been amusing. The fact that there was no heat wouldn't have made a difference because you would've been so warm with all the alcohol you drink. Long story short, come here drunk or don't come at all.

17.description: Went at 6pm and had no problem finding a seat or ordering. They got my order right and the food tastes fantastic! It is a fast food place, so you don't have to pay tip. You just order your food, take it, and sit anywhere you like. It is like a chipotle but better. The parking is limited if you come during busy hours. The large horchata at $2.69 is well worth it! It is large like the huge burritos! They are great for carry out also! The Sunday special is the best for the Carna Asada! Well worth the price for the same meal less $2 comes with a medium drink. I took a picture of the daily specials below. I will go again to try the other tasty entrees. They have a great assortment of food to choose from with lots of locations all over Chicago and in Niles and Des Plaines! The place inside is clean and has a good atmosphere!!! No complaints or problems during non rush hour!

10.description: If I could I would give it no stars. I ordered a chicken flautas and the chicken was red so it wasn't cooked right. Then I went to the washroom and saw one of the cooks he didn't even wash his hands!! Never come back here again.

5.description: I use to stop here on the way home from work a few times a week to pick up some dinner and since work slowed down I haven't been here for awhile. Well anyways when I placed my order I caught that the guy taking my order didn't ask me if I wanted everything on it like they have always done. They say they put sour cream on the burritos and when I got home and started eating I didn't taste any and I looked and sure enough I don't see any in the burrito. I remember one time I requested extra sour cream and got charged for it and there was none on the burrito.  This place has gone to shit and you don't get what you pay for unless you want an attitude from one of the illegal cooks.  The government needs to deport all the idiots this place hires along with the owner seeing that they  allow the workers to use drugs and drink alcohol while preparing food for customers.  If you want a good burrito go to a real Mexican Restaurant not one of these fast food shit holes.

3.description: I have been a regular customer since the day they opened in my neighborhood... Over 15 years ago.  I come about once a week and bring my daughters.  Tonight, for the first time, I was told that they no longer serve water with the meals.   Instead, you have to buy a bottle of water. I see Mr. Lamas, the owner, sometimes when I go there in the morning for steak and egg breakfast.   I will be sure to question him about this new policy and if it doesn't change I won't go there anymore. I spent $24.70 there tonight. The least they could do is give me three small cups of water.

35.description: Wash down that PBR with a giant burrito, neckbeard.

19.description: I've been coming here for years! I found a new favorite burrito (chorizo), but the last few times here it has not been very good. I am not sure they cook it enough and the bright red color has thrown me off, going to stick with Steak. Otherwise everything else is decent, especially since I only come here late night. 24hrs is a big plus

28.description: Many better options.   If you want to chew on pieces of fat in anything with steak,  this is the place for you.  Very low quality,  but cheap.   Not very clean either.

45.description: Not as good as it used to be.  I still go back from time to time and get ground beef tacos, they're not as fatty as the steak. I mostly would go there when I'm sober unlike 70% of their patrons.  Dont get me wrong I've been there drunk too lol.

33.description: There are certainly better spots in the city but TBK are so convenient.  They are generally okay but have to downgrade them just a bit. The chicken ques. had a bunch of rubbish chicken in it.  i would have preferred less (it just overflowed) with more quality chicken breast.  Folks didn't seem to care much.  Not sure if I'm going back.

43.description: TBK is TBK. You generally know it won't be the best mexican but it shouldn't be terrible. This particular location goes above and beyond to suck. I always have some kind of problem here - so now I drive 2 miles South to the one further down Harlem ave. Why would I do that when this one is blocks away?Guacamole that was obviously from someone's unfinished order (had other meal ingredients in it like chicken from a taco and was browning).Chips that are stale and taste like finely aged cardboard.When you ask for cheese they assume you mean a cheese taco with sprinkled on top.For some reason they cannot do al pastor right here. It's always real sweet and leaves an odd aftertaste. Something is off in the seasoning.Add on the fact that the staff at this one are incredibly rude and you've got motivation to go elsewhere.

2.description: Food business in the city of Chicago resembles what is like in real estate: location, location, location.  This place is barely making the pass grade, but it's located directly across the Harlem Blue Line station (O'Hare branch).  Since I refrain from purchasing food at the Fashion Outlet Mall (where I work), I think I'd rather see the Taco Burrito King for my lunch take-out.  However, the service was super fast.  I was about to "check-in" on yelp.  As soon as I grabbed my phone and started sliding on to the app., my order was ready.  Yeah, for real.  Thus, I was in and out within three (3) minutes, with a simple order of a steak Super King-sized burrito.  For the quality and taste of the food, spending $6.85 plus tax doesn't quite justify.  Being in Chicago, there's a TON of Mexican food joints that are a thousand times better than this.  Well, I guess the Taco Burrito King is really the King, because you can't beat the location.  For someone like myself working in Rosemont, the take-out option is just way too convenient.  They do have items for vegetarians.  The entire venue is clean and bright; service I received was friendly.

18.description: I know that I love their fish tacos, and this may be the only place that makes them in the TBK franchises? But this review deals with their telephone ordering system. If you go in, you order and wait- typically a while time if it's during a traditional meal time. I'd give them more stars if the phone ordering was better.Husband and I wanted to skip the line and call in for pickup. We've tried this a few times and every time we call, first, they ask us to hold. We hold, but we can hear everything that happens on the other end of the line including other orders that are coming in as we are waiting to speak. That's kind of rude. From there, the last time that we tried to call in a pickup, they hung up on my husband after making him wait for ten minutes. I can understand being busy, but the phone etiquette needs improvement. One of the people at this restaurant asks us how long until we'll be there. How about we come over and you just have the food ready? We say ten minutes, and they say okay. Sometimes a price, sometimes not, but that's less important for this review. If you're calling in, beware. The food is the same, but the service over the phone is NOT as good.Update: It's not worth ordering over the phone. My husband got there, and they hadn't even begun the order until then. NOT cool. I'll give them another chance, but they really need to improve their phone ordering. Ambiance is remodeled dive? Lots of room inside the dining area and a kitchen where you can see everything being made- a plus in my book.

41.description: Their food is hit or miss. Sometimes, it is AWESOME. Others, eh. I like their pork tacos with cilantro and onions. And their special-of-the-day is usually good. Sometimes, the steak in the burritos and tacos is too tough. But they are generous with the meat and the toppings. They don't have dessert and their horchata is a tiny bit watered down (but not enough to keep me from getting it!). The counter staff are o.k. Never rude. But the guys at the grill sometimes mess your order up.Overall, it beats fast food hands down. But as far as authentic Mexican food is concerned... eh. For what it is, it's expensive. A meal for a family of 4 will run you at least $30 without drinks.

52.description: FAMOUS FOR- Super King Burrito (6/10)BUZZ- Horchata (10/10)- Steak Quesadilla (6/10)I ALSO TRIED- Super Nachos (7/10)- Home Made Tamale (4/10)- Tacos (5/10)Ah..TBK! Believe it or not, outside of Taco Bell, this was my first introduction to Mexican food back in the mid 90's. I used to be in this neighborhood (even though I lived in the burbs) almost 3-4 times a week with friends, so we used to frequent everything on Higgins (which actually included a lot of Wendy's). Lately, I've had a chance to go back and noticed they've redone the place quite nicely. I never knew there was this much space in there before! I kinda missed the old ghetto look, though. Ah, nostalgia!SUPER KING BURRITOThe only reason this is famous is because of its ridiculous size! TBK serves food on oval shaped plates, and this burrito overshoots the plate longways on both sides! On top of that, the height of this is about as tall as a Big Mac! During my sophomore/junior year of high school days, I was able to take this down, but I can't even imagine doing that now! Funny story, one of my friends, who was this tiny girl, actually ordered the Super King. We actually both ordered it, and she finished this before I did! Not to mention, I was surprised at how clean her plate was. Mine was like a soupy mess! The burrito has meat, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream, and maybe some other things too. I guess this is an Americanized burrito. I know sour cream is uber diet fail, but I gotta tell ya, the sour cream is kinda what held this burrito together, tastewise. There's no butter here, at least I don't think, but the only way I can describe the taste is...buttery! And it has a lot to do with the sour cream, carne asada, and flour tortilla. HORCHATAI order an horchata from every single Mexican restaurant I've gone to, since I discovered TBK. Not only because I like horchatas, but also I want to compare that with TBK's. I believe that TBK has the best horchatas in the country! I've been to countless Mexican joints in Chicagoland, and I've been to a few in LA, including King Taco, and TBK has the best horchata. People look at me funny when I say this, but some places experiment too much with the cinnamon, and they end up with something that tastes like how Old Spice after shave smells! Not TBK! Theirs is sweet, milky, and just the perfect balance of sweet and spice. The spice never tickles your throat, it's there, but without a trace. MMmmmm! STEAK QUESADILLAThis used to be my favorite back in the day, but I had it recently, and it's not all that it used to be...that or my taste buds have changed. The thing I remember loving was how the steak had such a great smoky and beefy flavor to it, and it harmonized so well with the cheese and tortilla, but now, the steak isn't as prominent. It's just a more chewy cheese quesadilla. Ok, that's a little too rough. But honestly, the steak's flavor has been diminished quite a bit from what I remember.SUPER NACHOSAh, always faithful nachos with steak. They put cheese (I don't remember if it was nacho or melted cheddar), sour cream, lettuce, tomato, guac, and steak. But the main event, is the pickled jalapeno slices. It doesn't look like a lot of food when they hand you the togo styrofoam container, but even as you pick it up, it's just incredibly dense. Then you open the lid, and you see it's just packed to the top with chips and....stuff. I remember not being too thrilled about the cheese. It wasn't bad, it was just, the least performing of the other flavors. Even so, altogether, the nachos performed very well. When all the flavors combine, you get a pretty harmonious balance, but the jalapeno slices with every bite is what makes this a winner. The steak, again, used to be a lot more prominent, but now it's just "a face in the crowd." TAMALEI've been on a tamale trip lately. I want to know what a great tamale is, so I order them wherever I see 'em. TBK seemed like the perfect place to try one, and theirs was really weird. It was a lot stronger on flavor than most, and the masa taste was hard to find. Strangely, I tasted rosemary! It was one of those things where I took a bite and was like, "Bleh!" But then I was compelled to take another bite and was like, "Bleh!" But then I was compelled to take another bite and was like, "Hm." And that's the end. It ended at "Hm." I'm not eager to try it again. I like the masa in my tamales, and here it was overrun.TACOSI tried steak and chicken, with onion & cilantro, and neither were really impressive. The meat was pretty bland on both accounts, so it was a very "on par" experience.TBKONTINUED?I'll always go to TBK if I get the chance...for the Horchata...and something to accommodate the horchata with. It's sad that some of the food has changed a bit (or my taste buds), but at least one thing stayed the same! Anything paired with a TBK Horchata is all right with me!

50.description: 5 stars you say?Must be fancy, huh?Not really.  But is the chef Escoffier trained, or Michelin starred?  I'm going with a big N-O.But is this place full of alkies, skeezes, skanks and scalliwags after midnight?  Guaran-effing-teed.  Myself not withstanding, I could just as well be included in this grouping of social misfits.I used to live a couple blocks from here.  It actually used to be much smaller and 2 doors North on Harlem instead of on the corner, and it used to be a standard grease joint called "The Harlem Exit".  When TBK opened, I missed "The Exit", but not for long.  I started making TBK a regular stop after getting off the Blue Line to walk home. I miss those times. For seriously.  Living 25 miles away isn't that far, but considering tollway traffic and other things, it's not as if I can just walk out the door with a quesadilla craving and be home without even locking the house door.  So when I get the chance to get on some of this Mexican goodness, I jump at the chance.  Most of the urge to eat here, though, comes after 2am.Before I go on, let me just say, my former residence being in such close proximity to this place allowed me to eat here at normal hours, like during the day, right when they opened, right after school let out,etc., so I'm probably 1 of 14 people who have eaten here with a Blood Alcohol Content of 0.00  I know what the food tastes like when NOT under the influence.  Regardless of this,I think they make some kick ass food here at TBK,and part of this I base on their ability to make the staples of taquerias well, when a lot of other places, IMO, consider these items "throw away" and don't put their all into it.  Beans.  Rice.  Guacamole. The beans? Best refried beans I've ever had, ever.  They come topped with cheese, but I like them with less than put on, so I can taste the beans themselves.  The rice?  Not overly salty, delicately flavored.  I like my rice plain, no carrots, green beans, or corn.  The way I like to eat my rice is, I dip my fork into the beans, then into the rice and eat them together. You should try it!  Guacamole time!  Yeah buddy.  You know you hate that phony strained to death bright green flavorless "guac".  TBK guac comes chunky with the tomatoes, onions, cilantro, it's fresh and it's damn good!Quesadillas - Love them.  Gooey chihuahua cheese in folded crispy flour tortillas.  Slightly greasy.  Dip them in both green and red sauce, you'll thank me later.  This is my favorite thing to munch on here.  Flauta plate - Stuffed with chicken and only chicken, which is how my wife likes it, as opposed to stuffed with chicken smothered with saucy badness and onions and the like.  It's chicken rolled in a tortilla and fried.  The plate comes with the rice and beans, which she doesn't eat, so bonus for me, I eat them with my quesadilla, and everyone goes home happy.  What else have I gotten here?  Steak and Eggs.  Always good, sun up or sun down.Chorizo and Eggs.  Don't be scared of a little chorizo.Every combination of chips and whatever.  The red salsa is fire in a cup.  I recommend.  Tortas.  Of all kinds, steak is my fave.  It's a sandwich.  It's amazeballs.  Tacos.  Double wrapped, corn tortilla.  Standard filling is meat + Gringo toppings.  Lettuce, tomato and cheese.  Want cilantro and onion?  Just ask!  Taco Salad.  I wish it was smaller.  I suppose I don't have to eat the whole thing.  That's a stupid thought.  I guess I do wish it was smaller.Fajitas.  Chicken I prefer.  Green peppers and onions.  Burritos.  The first thing I ordered when I first ate here The one thing I've eaten and did not thoroughly enjoy?  The pork tamale.  I am biased to a particular brand.  Nothing against TBK, it's probably just that I've been eating them from El Milagro for the last 18 years.  TBK has really changed since they first opened, they went from having 0 security guards to having 3 working graveyard on a Friday.  But the food is still the same, whether it's daytime, nighttime, and whether you're sober or not.  But come here sober for your first meal.  Then come eat after getting drunk and rainbows will be shooting out of your burrito!  Don't forget to get the Large Whore-chata!

4.description: You come in, give the man some money, and you immediately get a hot, delicious fucking burrito in return. What else do you want, you buffoon? Too much grease? Go cook a chicken breast in your oven after a long night of drinking instead.  You don't think it's the greatest burrito ever? Douse it in verde sauce and quit whining. You don't like the loud drunk people around you? Stop paying attention to them, you should be eating your hot burrito anyway. It's 3am and drunk people are everywhere. I absolutely love this TBK. When you're half in the bag at 4am with a $10 dollar bill in your hand, you shouldn't have high expectations that your hunger is going to be efficiently and deliciously satisfied.  UNLESS you're going to this TBK.It's an easy 5 stars when you consider what you should be expecting from a 24 hour fast food establishment.  No matter how packed they are, they filter through and deliver on orders in a fast and efficient manner. All the employees are familiar and have clearly mastered the art of late night burrito production.  Every time I've been here I've quickly received a delicious burrito at a reasonable price. No complaints here.

6.description: definitely one of the better TBK's. I only wish it had a drive-thru. less greasy. pretty consistent cooks. the parking lot can be scary and sketchy by yourself at night. but i like that it's right off the highway, and it's a good go-to for hangover food if you've gone drinking at Chaser's across the street.  i love tat they serve the full menu 24/7, as a night shifter craving non-breakfast in the morning.  however.  one of the morning workers is kinda creepy and gives me a hard time about my food order cuz he always tries flirting with me.  once or twice is okay, but now it's sad that i avoid coming here just so i don't have to deal w feeling uncomfortable

22.description: Food business in the city of Chicago resembles what is like in real estate: location, location, location.  This place is barely making the pass grade, but it's located directly across the Harlem Blue Line station (O'Hare branch).  Since I refrain from purchasing food at the Fashion Outlet Mall (where I work), I think I'd rather see the Taco Burrito King for my lunch take-out.  However, the service was super fast.  I was about to "check-in" on yelp.  As soon as I grabbed my phone and started sliding on to the app., my order was ready.  Yeah, for real.  Thus, I was in and out within three (3) minutes, with a simple order of a steak Super King-sized burrito.  For the quality and taste of the food, spending $6.85 plus tax doesn't quite justify.  Being in Chicago, there's a TON of Mexican food joints that are a thousand times better than this.  Well, I guess the Taco Burrito King is really the King, because you can't beat the location.  For someone like myself working in Rosemont, the take-out option is just way too convenient.  They do have items for vegetarians.  The entire venue is clean and bright; service I received was friendly.

15.description: The BEST vegetarian nachos in the land!

57.description: Did a call in and the girl screwed up my order. I had a super king steak burrito. Pretty good!

20.description: Love this place. Their steak tacos are the best. Their horchata is pretty good too :) my roommate usually gets the quesadillas and says they're good.

36.description: This place is most disgusting of all burrito king places so far. Asked for two veggie burritos , while they prepaid my veggie burritos there was meat particles all over the cooking sheet. They just mixt my veggies int it. In my burrito I foud many beef remains. It's definitely not for vegetarians. I don't mind if they cook meat on the same place where they cook veggies,  but they should clean their tools while preparing other food and not spreading meet all over the place. Anyway it tasted horrible. Nasty food, it sucks. I will never come back even while starving. Thanks for crap.

14.description: I havent been to this place in a long time so I stopped in for a quick Burrito to go. I would not give any stars if possible! I had a Beef Burrito and it was the worst Burrito I ever had in my life!!! It was all salt, no flavor whatsoever!!! Save yourself the trouble and just pour a salt shaker down your throat! Now I remember why I havent been to this place.

3.description: Without a doubt a bargain in a box. .. They have a lot of things found at your local Costco but at a close out price.  I'm not sure how that happens but I don't mind.  This store is neat and organized enough to make looking easier.  This is definitely the best place for spaving... spending while you save.

1.description: Funky store that is 95% crap but 5% cheap treasures. They have a bunch of closeouts or damage boxes at tremendous prices as well add other items that they got a good deal on. You have to experience this place at least once! Some of the "shopping carts" are boxes with strings that you drag on the ground!

2.description: Absolutely love these stores.  We make a weekly visit to at least one of them.  It is basically a Costco, Sam's Club outlet.

5.description: I kinda don't want to review this place for fear it will become as paled as it should be. But this place is amazing. Each time I've walked out I've felt guilty like I stole something. There you have it you have the key is your choice if you unlock anything with it.

6.description: Normally, my experience at this store is in the 3-star range. The employees do a lot of talking amongst each other (which is totally fine unless there is a bunch of cussing going on and inappropriate convo). However, when my boyfriend and I went in earlier this week to purchase a TV, we had the great pleasure of dealing with Raul, the district manager. The first TV we got had a faint dead pixel line so he allowed us to return it for a different TV of which he knocked down the price due to the hassle. The TV is awesome (like seriously awesome as hell and we got it at an amazing price just because it was missing a Qwerty remote that isn't really necessary because the thing works with iPhones - keyboard problem solved!) and since we live so close by Raul WALKED the TV over to our house with my boyfriend because the box wouldn't fit in our car. There is no such thing as better customer service. Raul deserves a post-Christmas bonus or two.

0.description: This store is amazing! No more dollar trees or family dollars for me! I find something new here all the time. Brand name items for a lot less than most places!

4.description: Ever wanted to find a store that was a third each flea market, dollar store and Big Lots? Did you imagine it would be laid out roughly by room of the home sort of like a thrift store with shocking disorganization to match? Did you picture it would be primarily huge shipping boxes piled high with items that you have to sift through like a $5 DVD bin? Well it's real and it's AWESOME! Shaving cream, cereal, area rugs, coffee pots, spray cleaners, water pistols, never seen before brands of candy bars, luggage, spatulas, televisions, razors, scrubbing pads, ant poison, roasting pans, water filters... I could literally go on another dozen lines but I think you get the idea.  Unlike dollar stores, they have many name brand items.I spent about a half an hour skimming the surface of the boxes and walked with a few killer deals. Best in Show went to a "lot" of individually packaged 3M Scotch-Brite scrub sponges for $8. It was packaged in a way that I couldn't get an exact count but when I got home and realized there were 14 of them I was ecstatic. They often go for $3 a piece at Target. Runner-up went to a spray bottle of Pledge Multi-Surface (I love that stuff) for $2... that's less that half price.  Btw, it's easy to assume that the name of the store comes from the boxes piled high with bargains. It doesn't. Rather than a shopping cart, you pull a card board box with a nylon rope as a handle. I've never seen anything like it and I love it. It's like a thrift store except everything is new and there isn't any smelly clothing. Captain Coupon two thumbs up!

3.description: Dorina's Eurospa is the most reasonable place around. I will not go anywhere beside Dorina's Eurospa. I always go there for my eyebrows, mani/pedi, etc. Dorina is such a sweetheart too! I would highly recommend this place!

1.description: I have been going to Dorina since my Junior year of high school and I absolutely would never go anywhere else! She always finds time to fit me in for an appointment whenever I call. I live in Champaign now for school and whenever I'm back in town, I always make sure to get my beauty services done by Dorina. Like I said, I won't go to anyone else! She does a great job with everything (facials, waxing, manicure, and pedicure). She is also a licensed esthetician as well. I never get cuts or ingrown hairs or blisters from the wax. She is very gentle and definitely knows what she is doing unlike a lot of waxing businesses in the area.

2.description: I absolutely love Dorina. Her place is a hidden gem.  She makes you feel comfortable - even if the service itself might not be.  She offers great service for a fair price.  I will definitely be returning.

5.description: Dorina does the best waxing I have ever had.  Hands down!  Very clean and professional, using sterile cloth strips and the best quality wax, she cleans areas without too much irritation, and with minimal pain.  After I went to her based on a recommendation, I am now driving all the way to Norridge every month to see her (I live in Old Town, so in traffic it can be a long drive, but she is well worth it).  I have been to most "posh", downtown spa's, but Dorina's waxing is much superior and a lot less expensive.  I highly recommend her.

0.description: Dorina is such a sweet woman she will accommodate so you can have your services done. She makes you feel comfortable, she is honest and you can talk to her about anything. I had a facial by her and she did an amazing job and she didn't poke my face with needles. I will definitely be coming back. Parking maybe tricky if you come in the P.M. so give yourself time to park

4.description: This place is the best because of Dorina.  She is the kindest person and gives the best massages.  I have been coming here for years and no matter what ache or pain I have she will fix it.  I have tried other places through the years and nothing compares to a massage by Dorina.  When I am finished I am so relaxed I can barely drive home!  I would go there daily if I could.

12.description: HOORAY! A real hardware store with the stuff you need and people who know what they're talking about. Sure it may cost a bit more than the Home Depot or Menards, but the merchandise is quality and the service is strong. I'll still buy paper towels at Costco but this is the place for actual hardware, plumbing, electrical, etc. A great addition to the neighborhood.

3.description: I love this store. Its in the center of the neighborhood and its dog friendly. So if you need to walk the dog, then stop to pick up some light bulbs or any other item, this is the place.The staff is always helpful and polite. My favorite hardware store!

1.description: Ace hardware just continues to disappoint me. Not his location in particular, the Ace brand now is mostly  crap made in China. I ordered Christmas presents from AceHardware.com in plenty of time for the big day.  Now just 3 days left they have cancelled my order.  I suspect that they did not want to honor their online sale coupons on name brand merchandise.  I called customer service and wha connected to some lady with a thick Indian accent. She said she was in Florida but could not remember the city name...hmmm Ace had drifted from their origin and now is mostly an overpriced dollar store.

2.description: This hardware store is my local hardware store. I come here very often and sometime 5 times a day. I recently got a condo, 2 mins away. All my visits overall have been great ! The ladies at the front are very cheerful. The guys in the back are great and very helpful. Some things are a little pricy but, they do have awesome sales.

9.description: Finally something useful along this stretch of Northwest Highway. I know the old saying Ace your neighborhood Hardware Place will ring true for residents close by. Those that know me know that I'm way out of my area, however I do have family up this way and will definitely be stopping back in because I love local businesses.This Ace is a scaled back version of some of the larger Ace's, however the average homeowner will find all their needs can be met here. Paint, cleaning supplies, gardening supplies. And yes even parts for your Weber grill, I have a 12 year old grill that the ignition button went out on it. I called my husband to look up the part number online to be sure, but while I was on the phone with him I was immediately offered help by a helpful hardware guy saying that he could look it up for me. He said if they didn't have it they could check the warehouse, so I'm guessing that even though this place has a smaller retail footprint than the regular Ace, or heaven forbid one of those MEGA STORES, yes you have to capitalize that, because we're talking big, after all, they will be able to get what your looking for.This place opened up about a month ago, please if you live in the area support this business, businesses like this are needed and they've been going away. I wish these folks all the best in this venture.

10.description: been here about a dozen times.I make this my destination of choice when i'm not on a time crunch - because driving to this place means i pass about 5 other little hardware stores...but this place is top notch. very clean. very welcoming.the staff is friendly and actually knowledgeable, and when they actually don't know the answer, they won't pretend to know, but will get someone who does and/or figure out what's up.dan, the main guy there, is probably the nicest person i've ever had to deal with...don't let his rhinocerous-like stature tell you otherwise.cheers.

4.description: After today I will never shop there again. I always shop at this ace for all my home needs. I bought a Gallon of paint which they mixed the color wrong. I then tried to return it for them to tell me that it's not there fault not would they mix me a new one.  The paint color is clearly not the one On the color chart I picked but they still insisted with an attitude from both the manager and lady behind the register as if I'm the one who mixed it wrong that they are not at fault.  It's a shame that hard working people who spend there money at this ace are treated this way for them to save a few bucks. I advise everyone who shops there to make sure on there purchases because they will give you a hard time.

6.description: Love the tons of parking. Staff is friendly. They often give coupons for Ace at Jewel.  Even without coupons appears to be fairly priced!

0.description: First time to go here, not busy at all on Leap Day...From outside it looks like a very small store but it definitely has quite a variety of household, hardware items. They have a key cutter! Prices are reasonable and service was quick and good!

5.description: Another  a great location and a great selection of stuff very friendly salespeople will help you find what you're looking for.. Watch out for the speeding camera right before the store

13.description: Great store, knowledgeable and helpful staff, advertised products in stock, excellent coupons if you sign up for email and Ace Rewards. The few times I have needed to make a return, the clerk was accommodating and capable. I make it my first choice for hardware, paint, lawn and garden supplies, and some cleaning supplies. I would say that because of the periodic coupons, I almost always make purchases here rather than going to Home Depot or Lowes.

11.description: I'm so happy this Ace opened in my neighborhood.   The employees are great and more then willing to help.   They also have a little parking lot off Northwest Highway.   A great neighborhood place to shop!

8.description: Great staff but overpriced on certain items. I don't shop for much hardware items but more for essential household products. C'mon. Almost 4 bucks for bounty paper towels and 10 bucks for a small bag of cat food???? Some items you guys could lower in price. Your not a small neighborhood corner store. But I do like the comfort of having them around the area.

14.description: staff is ok and the checkout girl is nice,but the prices are crazy high.if all you need is a switch or couple screws this place is fine.but anything else they are twice the price.the better brands of caulk,for instance,they wanted $8 dollars a tube here...you can go to home depot and get the same caulk,but a *four pack* of it for $12.even the sale stuff is way higher than menards or home depot.

7.description: Awesome store, friendly staff, what I really like, they don't have some stooge selling furnaces and patio room enclosures at every aisle  head, like the big box stores.Bring your money back to your neighbor hoods.

58.description: Just found this restaurant while working in this area. Their lunch special has to be one of the best values around!

56.description: Everything here is made to order.  Persian food is fresh and thw pita bread is soft as a pillow!   Falafel is delish!! Lots if kynch specials until 3pm. You won't go hungry here. Carl the guy that takes your order is friendly and remembers your name if your a regular.  Byob.

29.description: I have been going to NOK for about 6months now. Never a bad experience. Great value for healthy delicious meal.

42.description: Our food tonight was spectacular. Not putting it together with the restaurant on Kedzie, I told the owner he was missing 2 things, the tablecloth and the price that goes  with it. Price and portions are great. This hidden gem right out in the open serves some of the most flavorful Persian food. Don't confuse this place with pita stands or kabob houses. The Persian influence adds a twist to the cuisine. The rice is as light as a feather, it doesn't leave you with that weighted down feeling. The steak was tender and was cut into perfect bite size pieces, no need for a knife. The falafel wrap had mild flavor and the falafel themselves were cooked perfectly. We are thrilled that we are in delivery distance from there however we will probably dine in more often. The restaurant is very comfortable.

23.description: I love this place. You order at the counter here. I order the koubideh whenever I come here because it is excellent.

47.description: I think I have a new Mediterranean place to become a regular @. Came in it not knowing what to get ended up getting the lunch special and because of yelp also took the free appetizer offer( I took the hummus) and everything tasted delicious! The salad dressing with the mint YUM! Refreshing flavor... The cost for the amount of food you get is unbalanced in a good way if your hungry and on a tight budget, so good for the consumer...I hope this place stays and is successful! It's really good!

8.description: First time eating at this Persian restaurant... The menu was very detailed with descriptions and pics. The food was phenomenal! We got the combo plates of marinated choice tenderloin steak and koubideh plate,joujeh koubideh plate, and the salmon plate and pomegranite chicken wings. Service was good. Oh the chairs were comfy and they have a table with some board games to pass the time while waiting!

31.description: Weekday lunch special is a great deal - get some of the xcellent hummus on the side.  Nice to have this middle eastern option now in the neighborhood

34.description: I am so excited NOK opened in my neighborhood.   They have excellent food at a great value.  I like to get the grilled chicken dinner which comes with dill rice and an excellent side salad.  Everyone who works there is super nice!

16.description: This place has bomb lamb shank!!! It falls off the bone and is so tender. The price was around $13--which is an amazing price for lamb shank. Nok also serves a healthy potion of  basmati rice and carrots which is also delicious. Also, if you want to relax after or before dinner there's a variety of board games which my girlfriend and I had fun with.

13.description: The food is Persian, so do not let that turn you away if you are afraid of ethnic foods. Everything you order will always be delicious. The food here is always delightful every time that I have visited. Fresh tasting. The staff is always great full to help you if you have any questions. The place is always kept clean. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who is visiting the neighborhood.

11.description: Great place for lunch ($5.95 lunch specials) and dinner. Plus it's BYOB. Had the chicken and seasoned ground sirloin (koubidech). Also tried the falafel and i found it a bit dry. Did love the hot Persian tea on a nice brisk day. Would come back for sure.

39.description: Wow. We live no where near this place but if you are wondering if I would make the 50 min- and hour drive to eat there again... You bet I would! I can eat here every day! The best most tender chenjeh I have ever had... And that says a lot since I was born and raised in Iran and have ate Chenjeh about 600 thousand times! The staff is so friendly too and we had a great night with great food!

37.description: First time eating at this Persian restaurant... The menu was very detailed with descriptions and pics. The food was phenomenal! We got the combo plates of marinated choice tenderloin steak and koubideh plate,joujeh koubideh plate, and the salmon plate and pomegranite chicken wings. Service was good. Oh the chairs were comfy and they have a table with some board games to pass the time while waiting!

0.description: I have been into Middle Eastern Cuisine for a long time,  I generally am not a fan of the quick serve places (I do NOT care for Pita Inn or Naf Naf) but frequent more authentic places like  Reza's, Afghan Kabob and Detroit Kabob,NOK is a a tad slower than quick serve because everything is made fresh.  They serve high quality Middle eastern food and have killer weekday specials.   They do not have an expansive menu, but what they do they do very well.The food is on-point and the hot components are served hot and cold components are cold and fresh (no brown lettuce).Also, it is probably the healthiest way to get a great lunch on the north-side if you want more than a salad.  The chicken dishes are moist and delicious and they many healthy apps.The one improvement I could see if them adding a vegetarian meal, I mean you can get the falafel plate or build a meal from veggie apps, but it would be nice to see a mean with multiple veggie components.A great place for a satisfying meal!

38.description: At the top of my list is Salmon and Tenderloin Steak. Delish! Their dill and white rice are good too

51.description: How is it that I check-in here more than anywhere else and I've reviewed?  Well, I cannot begin to tell yoy how excited I was when NOK opened!  My favorite place to get my Persian on is Noon O Kabob, in Albany Park, and they open up a quick service place in Gladstone, 15 minutes from my 'hood... it doesn't get any better than that!  It's an abbreviated menu compared to their full service restaurant, but the food is fabulous, as is the service.  We have never had any problems with the food, the staff or the owners.BEST HUMMUS!  (Check-in on Yelp! for a free appetizer too!)  My daughter doesn't even like hummus and eats it at NOK.  Husband and daughter love the Dolmeh too.Cannot beat their koubideh!  Perfect rice!Love their baklava too!Will keep coming back because it's a great deal for great quality food!

27.description: It was my first time here, I was certainly content. This was my first time having Persian food but the menu displayed on the wall had pictures so it made my food choices easy and painless. Once I ordered my food I poured my fountain drink and maybe waited 10 minutes before they served my plate of food. I ordered the "koobideh" with dill rice and the portions I was served left me bursting out of my clothes FULL! Overall I was content.

32.description: This review is for the amazing food and service at NOK! My husband and I frequent the Milwaukee ave location and decided to order some of this delicious Persian food for a party. We did a lot of the cooking ourselves, but wanted to offer something else to supplement our own cuisine.  The price is amazing, the food is fresh and SO delicious and the service is very friendly and professional.  We received RAVES from our guests adults and children alike- Thank you to Noon o Kabob for giving our party some added spark!

54.description: Just had dinner at N.O.K.  Is was fabulous. The owner was friendly and explained everything to us. Very clean, great service. Since it was our first time he gave us three free appetizers. Then since it was someones birthday gave us dessert and tea.  We had soup only 2.50 that was delicious. We ordered way too much.  We are definitely going back!

48.description: Food is amazing and the guys that work there are all really nice. I usually go to the one on Kedzie but ever since this opened up I haven't been.

44.description: Great place for lunch ($5.95 lunch specials) and dinner. Plus it's BYOB. Had the chicken and seasoned ground sirloin (koubidech). Also tried the falafel and i found it a bit dry. Did love the hot Persian tea on a nice brisk day. Would come back for sure.

24.description: This place has excellent food. Their Persian rice puts up a big competition against the pita inn. Their chicken was cooked perfect and the kabob was just perfect. It took a little longer than usual to get our food, but the excellent fresh crispy falafel to the Persian rice it was great. Prices are excellent & very affordable. Who would eat at McDonalds when NOK is across the.street. Must try.

7.description: It gets even better. You can't beat the lunch special.I can't recommend this place more. If your cheap, (yes, I'm talking about you) or you want a great meal, fresh food, delicious food in a pleasant atmosphere that's BYOB, check out this place for a great Middle Eastern food delight.Listen or "I kill you."!!
