49.description: The local Norwood Park neighborhood was IN GREAT NEED of a good restaurant option and we sure were glad to receive N.O.K. and their delicious Persian food.  The lunch special can't be beat at $5.95 - the marinated chicken and beef kebabs are so tender and juicy, the dill and yellow rice are very tasty, the falafels, charbroiled tomatoes and veggies so fresh and refreshing, the Baba Ghanoush and KashKe eggplant sides and the pomegranate and tahini sauces add a kick and variety of flavor.  N.O.K. continues to be our local restaurant selection of choice and one we never get tired of.  TWO THUMBS UP !!!!!

40.description: This place is a gem!first time here, n will defly come back.good ambiance,very accessible.I've ordered the lunch special and its defly worth the buck$ loaded with proteins,greens n carbs!manager was pretty cool to,had us seated by the TV while the cubs are playing!

53.description: I came in for the $5.95 lunch and I'll definitely be back. 5 starts for great food at a great value. The lamb kabob was very tender. Definitely some love put into it. Service was very friendly and the manager went out of his way to ask me how I enjoyed the aash soup. I got the impression that it's not commonly ordered, but it's nice for a cold winter day.

30.description: The food is Persian, so do not let that turn you away if you are afraid of ethnic foods. Everything you order will always be delicious. The food here is always delightful every time that I have visited. Fresh tasting. The staff is always great full to help you if you have any questions. The place is always kept clean. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who is visiting the neighborhood.

46.description: The food is good at this restaurant but it is hard to enjoy your meal when they start mopping the floors with bleach right near your table one full hour before closing. Very poor service. It appears that males get better service than females and I do not understand why. I had to walk to the counter to ask for another cup of tea while the waitress catered to the male patrons excessively. The manager is very rude and refuses to honor free appetizer from yelp check in arguing he cannot give items away for free. I do not recommend this restaurant.

1.description: First time really having Persian food with my boyfriend.Hummus and pita was delicious and so was the babaganoush! First time I have had that, and it was fantastic. Will be back for that!I ordered the chicken entree with jasmine rice! Next time, I want to try the falafel dinner! The food is relatively inexpensive as well!

55.description: Food is good quality, somewhat tasty. Didnt try the lunch special. Service ok. Rice is not a big deal. I wished I was at Pita Inn.

9.description: My Persian friend first brought me here more than a few years ago. I was new to Persian food & he said this is the place to go.This place opened my eyes to their way of cooking meats & roasted veggies. The spices & care put into the dishes really made me appreciate middle eastern food.I've tried everything from the babaghanoush, koubideh ground beef, chunks of sirloin steak, & cubes of chicken. Everything came out tender & juicy. The rice had a nice saphron spice on it that blended all the flavors together, also nice & al dente. I loveed the side of tomatoes & onions, the fact they char grilled them brought out their natural sweetness even more.The prices are so decent & the new location is easy to get to. I wish to try some desserts next time!!

26.description: N.O.K. Fine Persian Food @ the intersection of Elston & Milwaukee Ave.  I live about 1 1/2 miles from here and have driven by many times.  This is the first time I have stopped in.  The food is ok, but nothing exceptional. The special comes with chicken (which was delicious), beef kifta (ehh tasted like hamburger, no seasoning to differentiate the flavor, persian rice, salad & falafel.  The falafel was kind of different then any falafel I had before.  It was fried and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, but lacked seasoning.

25.description: The lunch special is tasty and a great deal, $5.95! I can usually make it last for 2 meals. I love the pomegranate wings as well, it's a unique flavor. My whole office is hooked on this place!

12.description: Unlike Noon O Kabob, which is the sister restaurant to N.O.K., there is no table service. You order at the counter and then take a pick of seats. Playing it safe, I ordered the joujeh plate for a main dish and bamieh with Persian tea for the finale. The joujeh were tender cubes of chicken breast served over Persian rice with salad. Each bite was an explosion thanks to the chicken being juicy, but without being undercooked. The bamieh were little doughnuts that had been accented with honey, very rich, and extremely delectable. Accompanied with a glass of Persian tea, they were perfect as a wrap-up for a Saturday afternoon lunch.

59.description: I gave this place 5 stars because the taste and value truly deserves 5 stars. Now this isn't a Michelin grade ambiance but my goodness, the food is AMAZING! I know I can be a little cheap giving out really high grades in my reviews but see for yourself! Must HAVE: chicken kabob-- juicy, lots of flavor, tender. Beef kabob-- perfectly spiced and juicy.  The mix of regular and dill rice is superb too. Side salad--- awesome dressing. Not too tangy. $5.95 for the lunch special that includes everything I mentioned on the Must have gives this place 5 stars. The cashier was friendly, the food came out very fast and fresh AND it's a clean place. This place is a HOME RUN! Skip: baba ghanoush was ok. I'll try the wings the next time I go back =)

21.description: Everything is great at this location, except when my parents or I call to place an order for either pick up or delivery they can never get the order right which is a little frusterating. My mom always has to check now if she goes to pick it up.

17.description: This place is a great addition to the Gladstone park neighborhood. Staff was friendly and professional. Man at the front gave me a comp hot tea! Nice gesture for sure. Lentil soup came out hot and was flavorful. I would highly recommend for a quick lunch or a family dinner. Added bonus It byob too!

10.description: Oh my gosh. This place is sooooo good. I got the hummus and a falafel wrap. Hands down. Best hummus and wrap ever. The hot sauce is delicious too. I just moved in the hood so i will be back!!!!

5.description: After being on a three month hiatus due to a job relocation, I can't tell you how happy I was to be back at N.O.K.  Unfortunately since my last visit the customer service and quality in food has substantially deceased. I called in to place my regular lunch special pick up order. To my surprise I was a bit taken a back when the female who answered the phone said " hello what do you want ? At first I was initially confused, did I dial the wrong number? Who answers the phone without even stating the business name???  I should have hung up, but instead I asked her if this was N.o.k.? She said , "yea what do you want"??? In my book of common courtesy she already receives a F for horrible phone skills. I  placed my order and not only did she not ask for my name but she did not tell me my price total or how long the wait would be. I let this slide and decided to show up 15 minutes after placing my order. I show up and not only is it completely empty, but my order is not ready. Shocking..... Upon entering I received crap customer service. I didn't get a hello or a smile, instead I got a " do you need something"? Ummmmmm yes,  "my food that I called in for a pick up " was my answer. After 10 minutes of waiting she coldly grabs my food from behind the counter. I immediately inspect the food by opening up the box and what do you know??? No pita bread, side salad, or complimentary sauces that are ALWAYS given.  Not only that but the food looks like it was literally tossed into the white styrofoam box. "Yuck" . Presentation is the key to success. Of course I ask for all the sides that are missing and she couldn't have looked anymore confused. It was as if she didn't understand a word I was saying.  It was truly one of the most bizarre food ordering experiences I have ever encountered. Really disappointed in N.o.K. Also, as if the service didn't suck enough the food was totally under cooked. The most edible thing was the rice. I threw almost all of the food out. Sooooo disappointed in N.o.k.  Will not return regardless of the fact I live 2 blocks away. Save you're time and money and go to Pita Inn in Park Ridge!!! You won't be let down.

3.description: Knock knock. Who's there? NOK NOK. NOK NOK who? NOK NOK is one of the best meals for under $10 you'll get anywhere in Chicago. The Joujeh Plate is deliciously marinated chicken breast, a side salad, and rice for only $7.95. That Persian Lamb plate with the same sides? $9.95 and the meat is fall off the bone. Knock Knock jokes never lie. Very friendly service and free board game entertainment as well. Noon O Kabab is an inexpensive date that doesn't cheap out.

35.description: We used to frequent their other restaurant on Kedzie, but this location is closer and the dining experience is more relaxed.  I think the prices are cheaper here, but the quality and taste remain very good and it's prepared in just 5 or so minutes.My favorite dish is the Chenjeh and I always order their hummus.  I wish they had more hot sauce or at least had it easier to get. I feel like bit of a mooch when I need to ask for more hot sauce.If you're looking for Persian food you can't really go wrong here.

19.description: It's ok, prices reasonable and portions generous. It might be a good idea to edit out the word "authentic" from the sign outside. If you're expecting authentic Persian kabob try the downtown location.

28.description: Unlike Noon O Kabob, which is the sister restaurant to N.O.K., there is no table service. You order at the counter and then take a pick of seats. Playing it safe, I ordered the joujeh plate for a main dish and bamieh with Persian tea for the finale. The joujeh were tender cubes of chicken breast served over Persian rice with salad. Each bite was an explosion thanks to the chicken being juicy, but without being undercooked. The bamieh were little doughnuts that had been accented with honey, very rich, and extremely delectable. Accompanied with a glass of Persian tea, they were perfect as a wrap-up for a Saturday afternoon lunch.

45.description: I've eaten here so many times I'm starting to get free Belly rewards!All of their food is fresh and healthy.  I never feel sick or bloated after eating a huge amount.  I usually get the ground sirloin kabob and the meat is always juicy and never dry.   You get a salad and pita bread with your entree.  They also have wraps which are huge and loaded with a skewer of meat, pickles, and sauce.  Their hummus is some of the best I've ever had.  It's super creamy and the flavor is spot on.  It was served with pitas fresh out of the oven with delicious crispy ends. The restaurant is very clean and decorated nicely.  The employees are really  friendly and accommodating.  If you like middle eastern food like Pita Inn, I would highly suggest giving this a try. It's a little different with different flavors, especially the rice which is loaded with dill.  (If you don't like dill flavor you can get plain rice)

33.description: The 5.95 lunch special is literally unbeatable. I don't know of any eatery that gives you more bang for your buck. Everything was fresh and seasoned to perfection. I couldn't have been more pleased.

43.description: Food is super delish, and there are plenty of tables.  BYOB which is also great.They have a few board games too if that tickles your fancy.A few times that I have gone in, though, there were tons of dirty tables.  I know it is a small business so I let it pass.  Great food.

2.description: One of the few places I can get sorrell soup.  To be more accurate, it has cilantro (the woman at the counter said) and other ingredients and they call it Aash Soup.  It is so delicious!  My mom used to make sorrell soup which I miss very much.  My friend has the lentil saffron soup.  She loved it.  Food is very reasonable and delicious.  You get a lot.  Service is friendly.  The parking lot can get crowded so you might have to park on the street.  But that's no problem, either.

18.description: How is it that I check-in here more than anywhere else and I've reviewed?  Well, I cannot begin to tell yoy how excited I was when NOK opened!  My favorite place to get my Persian on is Noon O Kabob, in Albany Park, and they open up a quick service place in Gladstone, 15 minutes from my 'hood... it doesn't get any better than that!  It's an abbreviated menu compared to their full service restaurant, but the food is fabulous, as is the service.  We have never had any problems with the food, the staff or the owners.BEST HUMMUS!  (Check-in on Yelp! for a free appetizer too!)  My daughter doesn't even like hummus and eats it at NOK.  Husband and daughter love the Dolmeh too.Cannot beat their koubideh!  Perfect rice!Love their baklava too!Will keep coming back because it's a great deal for great quality food!

41.description: I have been here twice with the BF. He enjoys it far more than I do, but as he is gluten intolerant  there is a limited number of things he can order. The staff is pleasant and friendly. Service is pretty fast and the place is clean. There are games at the front table for people who plan to stay awhile! The servings are ample. The first time we were there I had the chicken which I thought was a bit dry but they gave us a cup of lamb sauce which helped. The next time I tried the lamb special which was good. Hopefully this place does better than other place that have been here. I used to live about 8 blocks away and in the 10 years I was in that neighborhood, it was  4 different restaurants. IN fact, I only stumbled upon it because we were in the area and I was going to go to the Mexican pace that used to be there - and found NOK in its place! Being wedged in an odd location where Milwaukee and Elston merge, it suffers from a small odd shaped parking lot. There is street parking available also.

52.description: I cant say enough about the food very very good and very reasonable price love  the rice the meat and chicken the sweets where great especially the tulumba

50.description: So good!!! The lentil soup is amazing and I always get the Kashk with pits. Great prices and the food is delicious. This could be the place that survives this spot on the corner. Just go.

4.description: The lunch special is definitely what gained my attention. For $5.95 (without tax) you get chicken, beef, falafel, rice and salad. Since I don't eat meat I asked if I could instead receive more falafel. I was told no by the cashier and ended up paying more for a separate order of falafel. I took a seat and then overheard a different cashier tell the one that took my order that I do in fact receive extra falafel in substitution of meat. Yes this little mix up was annoying, but I'm guessing the first cashier was new. I also added a small order of hummus which came with pita for a grand total of $12. Not incredibly expensive, but it would've been a few bucks cheaper if not for the mix up. (Who doesn't love to save money?)The rice and hummus was good, the falafel lacked in flavor, and the salad was basic. Overall I feel that my purchase was worth it, and even have enough food left over for dinner. To my non meat eaters, just make sure you clarify what items you get extra before paying for them, especially if you are substituting meat.

6.description: N.O.K. Fine Persian Food @ the intersection of Elston & Milwaukee Ave.  I live about 1 1/2 miles from here and have driven by many times.  This is the first time I have stopped in.  The food is ok, but nothing exceptional. The special comes with chicken (which was delicious), beef kifta (ehh tasted like hamburger, no seasoning to differentiate the flavor, persian rice, salad & falafel.  The falafel was kind of different then any falafel I had before.  It was fried and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, but lacked seasoning.

22.description: My husband & I come here often. The food is delicious, and for the price you can't beat it. I have met many friends here for lunch as well. I like their chicken and my husband has the beef, their hummus is good too.

15.description: Great place in a good location. The decor is updated and the place is always clean and inviting. They have a bunch of board games you can play as well as a charging station which is awesome! Some of the female cashiers are a little strange but the male cashier was very respectful and helpful. The food is always ready on time! The food is fresh and tasty all the time but sometimes my Koubideh is a little charred on the bottom but always full of spices and yummy. The lunch special deal is outstanding for such a large portion! It's only about 5.95 monday-friday and it comes with your choice of meat, your choice of rice and some grilled veggies and pita bread!

57.description: Rarely review restaurants but this food was incredible! Under 12.00 and having to take some home!

20.description: Great place. Devine food. We catered several times from there and they sent us good quality generous portions. I'll recommend this place to all.

36.description: One more reason to love N O K.  While I was waiting for my take out order to be prepared I stepped aside and saw that they had a "charging station" for cell phones!  How clever is that.  It just so happened that my iPhone was running low so I plugged in for a few minutes.  Oh yeah their food is excellent!   Conveniently located for us Northwest Siders.  They don't have the same selection as their main restaurant on Kedzie but for lunch it is just fine.  Clean and cheerful as well.  I'll be back!

14.description: I gave this place 5 stars because the taste and value truly deserves 5 stars. Now this isn't a Michelin grade ambiance but my goodness, the food is AMAZING! I know I can be a little cheap giving out really high grades in my reviews but see for yourself! Must HAVE: chicken kabob-- juicy, lots of flavor, tender. Beef kabob-- perfectly spiced and juicy.  The mix of regular and dill rice is superb too. Side salad--- awesome dressing. Not too tangy. $5.95 for the lunch special that includes everything I mentioned on the Must have gives this place 5 stars. The cashier was friendly, the food came out very fast and fresh AND it's a clean place. This place is a HOME RUN! Skip: baba ghanoush was ok. I'll try the wings the next time I go back =)

3.description: Nice place.  Friendly waitresses.I came for one of those breakfast at dinner time.Was tasty.  Place clean and bacon well done as requested.I would like to come back for a sandwich however I keep ordering breakfast!

1.description: I was beyond upset today eating at this restaurant. If you have young children in diapers please save yourself the frustration and do not go here. How can a family restaurant not have a changing table? So on a freezing cold day I had to bundle my daughter back up, walk across the street and change her in my vehicle. I'd that doesn't deter you, the food will. Tasteless and beyond lackluster. My husband asked what the difference between two items on the menu and the waitress said "pretty much nothing they are basically the same".$30 for two crappy meals and extreme frustration.

0.description: I'd been here a few times but I'd only recommend the breakfast.  Had lunch and was not tasty, breakfast is fantastic and would be coming back.  Waitress was nice

2.description: Yummy food, friendly staff, and most importantly, right across the street from the nursing home where my uncle is.

5.description: This place is nothing like I remember from a few years back. Chicken  sandwich tasted like cardboard. Ruben sandwich looked nothing like ruben more like a piece of cheap ham. Soup was so faul smelling it made me nauseous. Overall it was terrible wouldn't come back.

6.description: Gave this place 2 chances. First chance was under old management and I got their Irish breakfast. Everything on the plate was bad. I just about ate 1 pudding 1 sausage 1 bacon ect ect. Instead of the waitress asking me what was wrong with the food or how did I like it, she just assumed that I couldn't eat anymore cause of there being so much food. Either ways it saved the restaurant an embarrassing moment cause it really was that bad!!!!The second time was under new management and their downfall was leaving me hanging on the phone for to long so I just hung up. So in truth I hope their Irish breakfast has improved but I won't be going there again and I just live round the corner.

7.description: Very good.   The only reason I didn't give it five stars was the staff seemed overwhelmed.  Food was excellent, got it quick and was cheap.  I had to remind the waitress about my coffee, there was no menu, water or silverware.  But all that's easy enough.  I borrowed the menu and silverware.  It was clear they needed a set up person.  Odd thing, the waitresses were running ragged, while one staff strangely stood around doing little.  Maybe that was a visiting relative trying to help out.  If that's the case, they just need to either hire a "set up" person, or re-arrange staff to have one.   Otherwise, really terrific.  I will be going back.

8.description: Reading the previous Yelp reviews, I wasn't going to give this place a try, but I saw the sign that said under new management so I figured I'd give it a try. The food was good, service was quick and friendly. The food is expensive. It was $10.00 for a basic ham and cheese omelette. The omelette was good...but geez $10.00? Also the table next to us ordered an iced tea and miraculously we had an iced tea at our table. We asked the couple behind us if anyone had ordered an iced tea and yes they did. Lastly, I mentioned this in the tip portion, but I had to change my daughter on the floor because there was no changing table in the bathroom. Is this or is this not a family restaurant? We probably will not be going back unless they put in a changing table in the bathroom. I hope the managers read the reviews on here.

9.description: The prices were higher than the greasy spoon diner food quality. I would try somewhere else in the neighborhood before coming back here. I have a feeling there are better quality options for the price range. The diner did seem clean, and I would come back just to grab coffee.

10.description: Much improved...food is fresher, service was great, and the remodel looks clean and comfortable. I've had the turkey dinner, and the baked chicken so far, both were as good as if my mom made them.

4.description: It seems this place is always "under new management". My impression was that it's an entirely average family restaurant. The booth we sat in had a half eaten cracker in between the seat. Service was quick, friendly, and we always had fresh coffee. Our food was good but not excellent. Like I said, totally average. My pecan and peaches waffle was just a normal waffle with pecans and cold canned peaches on top. Prices were a little high for what we got. I don't think I'll be coming back here unless I'm in a pinch.

3.description: My favorite dive bar in the area. Really cheap drinks. A lot of tv's, where you can watch any ongoing sports event. Staff is very friendly. A lot of events: karaoke, dj, live bands, and a comedy show now.

1.description: How do you go from 5 to 1 star? I really try to like this place.  The staff is super friendly and fun.BUT. They have NO CONTROL of the belligerence of their patrons.  I had a floral shirt in last night and I literally had 40 year old drunk man say "aloha" to me like over 10 times. Not only were they being annoying but we're being down right openly racist. Latin girl walks up to jukebox,  "don't play bachata" African american guy walked up to jukebox "don't play rap"The patrons of this bar are completely out of control.  I think the bar doesn't like the confrontation,  and I'm  sure they need the money from these jerks, BUT THIS IS THE REASON THERE ARE NO WOMEN IN THIS BAR. We literally at one point felt so uncomfortable and unsafe that we waited for those guys to finish smoking their cigarette outside so that we can leave. I just can't do it anymore.  I need a new local dive. Sorry Frank.

2.description: I stop in here from time to time because it is the closest dive bar for me.  But, honestly, if it wasn't close I wouldn't ever come here.  If it were 5 feet further I wouldn't come here.First of all, this place looks like it used to be a dirty taco joint.  It has Taco Bell windows in the front, and a filthy kitchen in the back that you can see into.  They don't serve food, which is a blessing because the kitchen is really something from a horror movie.The men's bathroom is pretty nasty.  Dive bars are supposed to have some character.  The only decoration in the bathroom (none would be better) is a framed Facebook E card thing.  My intelligence is insulted every time I pee here.  Kitsch is rarely so contrived and poorly done.  Also, the sink doesn't have hot water, the faucet has like 4 years of nasty grime on it.  I wonder if it's been tested for Legionnaires disease?  Oh, and don't forget that the old men who are regulars don't know how to aim and they never mop this place, so you will undoubtedly be standing in urine.  Fun.But, that said, I love me some dive bars and I have a pretty high tolerance for grossness.  I can deal with that.What I cannot deal with is what they allow their regulars to say and do.  There is outward RACISM in this place.  All the extreme words and everything.  Instead of telling these drunk patrons to shut up or leave, I've heard bartenders join in the conversation and agree.  I've seen regulars get into fights with each other.  At a normal place, if you throw a punch, you're out (usually forever).  Not at this place.  You're told to calm down and bought a beer to sip while you sober up.  Yes, the regulars here get so out of control and are so overserved they sober up with beer.Will I return?  Probably.  But will I do so with self respect?  Absolutely not.

9.description: The new owners are great. Very welcoming! Drink prices are very reasonable and the locals are a nice friendly bunch. Good neighborhood watering hole. The owners are planning on some upgrades that will make it even better.

10.description: New owners, for the normal crowd who don't piss on themselves or answer the voices in their heads, BUY them a drink on the house especially when they spend cash

4.description: I was staying at the Renaissance around the corner when I saw this place while driving home from Elly's pancake house.  We went Sat night to check it out and loved it.  Super friendly locals crowd with karaoke and drink specials for St. Patty's day weekend.  Jenn, one of the owners, was great.   Highly recommend if you like local friendly watering holes.

6.description: I used to live right down the street. My old roommate still lives in the old place so I have seen the drastic changes over time. Now they have flat screen for the games to go with the regulars that are always in this place. Please tell me, if you ever find out, how to get involved in their slot machine game they always play. Someone keeps the books on the whole ordeal and they all seem to be in cahoots... interesting enough to keep this place interesting for a strip mall dive!

12.description: I was really hoping for a Northwoods feel that included a warm friendly feeling, lots of shit hanging on the walls, and some taxidermy involved.  This was not quite what I found.  There were a couple other dudes in the bar, they seemed miserable.  No nod, no smile, nothing.  This doesn't really bother me since I did not come in to make friends, but maybe you will be.The space itself looks like the bare bones version of what could be a good northwoods feeling bar.  The wood paneling was there, check.  Some beer signs on the walls, check.  But there was a lot of bare space on the walls and the place came off boring.  I was done looking at the walls in about 5 minutes.  I had seen everything there was to see.  The interaction with the bartender was painfully awkward.  She came off bitchy.  Not in a good way.  She actually argued with one of my buddys about some joke he made.  I wish I could remember it now to provide some context, but I forgot.About halfway through my 3 beers there, some dude came in and started playing gangster rap extremely loud on the jukebox.  I enjoy some gangster rap, but it was very odd and out of place at this "northwoods" establishment.  It was loud to the point of almost not being able to hear my party talk.  The other patrons seemed fairly disgusted.Bottom line, I went in there to get a buzz and I left with one, they get 2 stars for that.  If you are looking for anything more, you can skip this place.

5.description: Sometimes it's just one of those days and you need to run away from your cubicle.My co-worker and I made that day Thursday.We were a little nervous going there because of the seedy appearance, but boy were we WRONG. Walking in, the bartender, Carl, greeted us and told us what the specials were. My friend orders a PBR and I order a Miller (both on tap) and he sits them in front of us. "That'd be $5.50." WHAT? I thought this was supposed to be a dive bar? $5.50 for a Miller draft?!"But if it's separate then $2.75 each."Dang, Carl. You really got me.LOVE this place- between how friendly Carl is, how cheap the beers are, and how you can bring in your own food- Northwoods will remain our Thursday spot.p.s. CASH ONLY!

11.description: Good place if you want to chill and drink a cold one.  This place gets 4 stars since it's only 2 min walk from my house and i love the atmosphere.**UPDATE**Did you know that John Wayne Gacy used to go to this bar????!??!?!  that is insane!

8.description: I also live a few minutes from Northwoods but it really isn't that great of a bar.  They do have fairly cheap beer. $2.75 for domestic and $3.75 for a cocktail.  So they got that going for them.  They also got free wifi for the connected alcoholic.  Do the 40-60 year old dudes that come here really need to IM their buddies?  Maybe they're checking out the classifieds section of CL.  Service was friendly and quick.  Just lacking some charm.

0.description: Cool people. Always happy to see a familiar face. My boyfriend loves this place and it's getting a special place in my heart too. Easy, quick place to drop by for a few cheap drinks at the end of the day.

7.description: Great bar. Great staff. Had a blast there this weekend and didn't have to spend a lot. In fact, the prices were so good, it made me never want to go back to the city. Jen and Frankie are fun and hilarious! GO!

12.description: Being a former Marine the first thing that popped out about this place was how organized everything is and how clean it is. Everthing is price pretty phenomenally and the staff was really friendly and knowledgeable. I'm pretty sure I'll be back to visit.

7.description: I really like this store. I've never been there in the morning so I can't comment on the depts opening late but when I'm there I really enjoy my shopping experience.  The prices are good and the product is good too. They have an olive bar which is about a dollar less then Caputos and better too. The meats are good and their ethnic sections are very good.  Awesome craft beer selection.  My only gripe would be their frozen food section is a bit small.

3.description: Great store many choices. Even have a hot food bar with a seating area. Foods are fresh and tasty. Many comfort foods too! Prices are amazing. I shopped at Jewel and spent 160. Had dinner meat for only one night. Shopped here and spent 114 and had dinners for 5 nights! Friendly staff, helpful too. Meats are fresh and has a nice bakery.  Very nice produce section also.

1.description: "Shop & Save Market" is a neighborhood grocery store located in Norwood Park, diagonally across from that famous "Super Dawg."  I believe my goal of "shop" was accomplished, but how about "save?"  I have to say that savings here may not be as significant as other competitors can offer.  Nevertheless, the items they sell at S&SM is pretty solid, with products imported from Poland and Eastern European countries as their primary focuses.  Rosa J. loves herring fish, so she went straight to the smoked/pickled fish section and picked up a can that was on sale for the week.  Grocery shopping for me is like playing a video game.  Traps and temptations are everywhere to get cha!  Other than the sushi station by the fresh produce department, the chef's homemade dinner counter almost had me owned.  The sensible Rosa J. realized that the price wasn't that wonderful (average $15 per entree), and she could have one of those at a restaurant.  Stay vigilant, girly!  Don't defeat the purpose of grocery-shopping.  I quickly peeked through the meat and seafood departments.  Everything was clean, nearly-merchandised, and fresh.  I was able to shop here peacefully since the store wasn't busy at approximately 1100 hour on a Friday.  The store was fully-staffed and my groceries were bagged in a timely manner as I was paying.  Parking is available on the strip-mall lot.  If you're fond of utilizing public transportation, #86 (Narragansett/Ridgeland) bus is available and the nearest stop is Nagle/Milwaukee.

2.description: After much todo and months of waiting the big Grand Opening finally happened. (Several months ago)  Like most stores upon opening they had some great deals, but the prices quickly returned to normal retail prices.  You can still get some good deals, but you have to know your prices.   In general Shop & Save isn't my go to store unless there are specific items I need that are on sale.  They do have whole salmon for $3.99/lb right now (11/14/15), but their prices are middle of the road.  They have a deli as you walk in, but it's a poor example of displaying the foods.  They don't look that appetizing the way it's presented although I have never had the want or need to buy their prepared foods with the cornucopia of options available in Chicago & Chicagoland suburbs (sorry Shop & Save). There isn't much appeal for me to try their foods

9.description: If you enjoy spending your Sunday afternoon shopping here and listening to Gin and Juice, as well as Tootsie Roll on the intercom, then by all means. Shop here! But if you'd rather have a more dignified shopping experience, then go to Marianos. This place is a joke. A ton of their shit was expired on their shelves, and way too much Polish food. Bye!

18.description: I was so excited when this store finally opened.  Let's just say, if you were a loyal Domincks FAN, or a Jewell fan, you may end up going back . This store is heavily European, very little, if any everyday item's. The isles are poorly marked, the help is not very friendly, and are difficult th o understand, or they don't understand English. A bottle of wine was purchased, and it was spoiled. I will say their home made foods are very Good.  Soups are great!! And other take out as well. The odor in the store is awful. I will stop by for some takeout, but would never go there for a shopping for a family, or holiday dinners.

10.description: I stopped in for the first time last week and while I wasn't disappointed I wasn't super thrilled either.  It's bigger and cleaner than Butera but not as big as Tony's.  It is mostly Polish which makes sense in this neighborhood.  PROS:Delicious hot prepared food station with great prices for a meal.  It is almost exclusively Polish and I enjoyed everything, especially the potato pancakes.Large cold case of prepared salads, soups, pierogies, blintzes, etc.  Again, almost all Polish.Great produce section with a large variety of "unusual" and ethnic stuff you won't find at Jewel.Nice bakery case with homemade pastries.  Brownie and apple slices were awesome!Decent and clean butcher section.  Large deli that reminds me of Tony's at Dempster and Greenwood.  CONS:The smell of rotten fish was overwhelming and I was literally covering my face and retching while I walked past.  Why is the seafood section right next to the bakery?  I was gagging while looking at cakes and brownies and could only stay there for a few minutes.  Sorry but seafood should NOT smell like that!  The rest of the store was smaller than I expected, and the aisles of canned and dry food were similar to Butera.  Not a huge variety and everything was average price. In a nutshell, I probably would not do my weekly grocery shopping here but it's great for the fresh stuff like prepared foods, deli, and produce.

13.description: Terrible service counter- Mary name tag yelling at employees in front of customers forgetting breaks no union or full time, taking advantage of young help, no training just yelling

16.description: It was a bummer to lose Dominicks and I was skeptical at first of Shop & Save but I've been pleasantly surprised by the produce and prices!

17.description: I think this store is amazing.  Such selection and good prices on some stuff.  Items not found at jewel and alike. Love it.

15.description: Glad to see Shop and save open in my neighborhood.   Very good produce section.  The premade soups are delicious.  I took a star off because there are many things on my shopping list that they don't carry.   They have a heavy selection of polish foods that I'm  not interested in but I'm sure others will love.

0.description: I'm surprised at some of the bad reviews, oh well goes to show you everything is an individual experience. As for me I know I can spend a lot of time in this store and purchase much more than what was on my list of needed items. This store does concentrate on Polish and Eastern European goods, and it's one of the things I love, it lets me get my Polish on. I feel like I get the convenience of a small Polish specialty store and deli with a small American grocery store wrapped around it.The produce looked great and there were many prepared meals for when you don't have time to cook, and soups, Polish soups, mushroom, barley, split pea and don't forget the borscht, nothing like having soup that reminds you of your childhood when it's below zero out with the windchill. I didn't run across anything with expired dates on the packaging, and I bought dated items, milk, cottage cheese, yogurt and more. Can't comment too much on the center of the store, as I shop the perimeter for the fresh goods and stay away from canned and boxed stuff. Maybe I'll check those areas out when I want to spend even more time shopping.I wish this store was closer to my home instead of my MIL's house, I'd be able to make it a regular stop, however I will make it a point to stop in if I'm on my way home after a visit to what I call the far side of town.

5.description: This Shop & Save is the best one yet for the Niles/Des Plaines area. It took over the former Dominick's space on Devon & Milwaukee and transformed it into a grocery store/cafe. They got the usual awesome deli selection just like the other stores on Greenwood or River Road. However, they have the added bonus of so much open floor space that they could afford themselves a vast open space for produce and cheese, adjacent to a dining area with sandwiches and other ready to eat meals.The aisles of the store are full of imported foods from Europe, Asia, Mexico and Middle East at a more reasonable price than in other stores. Another added bonus for this store is the expanded liquor section that has a variety of lesser known beers and hard ciders available. You won't find these at the other Shop & Saves.The setup steals plenty of ideas from Mariano's but applies it to a predominantly Polish and Eastern European supermarket. While you can buy pretty much the same items at the other locations, this one has the completeness the others lack. Definitely worth a visit.

11.description: I want to love this new store in my neighborhood and I know any tenant is better than a huge empty space, but it's been pretty disappointing so far.PROS: I like the large deli selection, variety of international groceries, wide aisles and overall layout. Also, most of the employees are very friendly and helpful (a notable exception being the cashier named Desiree, who moves in slow motion and can't pretend to care when huge lines form at her register).CONS: The place stinks. Whichever door you walk in, you're almost knocked over by the smell of cleaning solution that's trying (unsuccessfully) to cover up for the seafood department odor. And if you're going to say you're open at a certain time, the departments should be at least partly set up for the day ... twice I've been there early to beat the crowd and found the meat counter and deli are still unpacking and setting up cases a half hour later. Finally, I was disappointed to see so many displays of single beer cans prominently displayed at a discount. Do they expect repeat business attracting customers who stumble in for 99-cent tall boys of Ice House?I'll probably keep shopping at S&S for emergency items, but when the alternative is a short drive to Mariano's (a gleaming palace by comparison), the new place needs to up their game.

8.description: Ok no, I take that back do not get the discounted 50% sushi, it is very very dry.

4.description: So happy I discovered this store. Wide variety of produce, fresh and very nice display. I love the selection at the "ready food" section.  If I buy 2 meals + 2 sides deal, I get food for 3 days for $7.99. And it's a real food, not processed corn product shaped into meal.  Plus the young lady working there is a sweetheart. Wide selection at the deli department. Tried sushi many times, always good. I also buy cakes for the special occasions there, no complaint, very tasty. Amazing deals on fresh fish and meat. I shop there once a week and didn't run into anything that would be expired or old. The overall price level is definitely lower than other big stores such as Jewel of Mariano's and you can run into really great deals. I like the fact they carry so many products imported from Europe, because of strict food regulations there. No need to worry about high fructose corn syrup.

14.description: Was excited for a new independent grocery to open in the area - my excitement quickly turned to disappointment and disgust after my first visit.  Purchased a large amount of produce - when going through the tomatoes there were several that were completely covered in white mold, dripping all over the other tomatoes.   Since those were unediable I purchased yellow cherry tomatoes - while checking out I noticed those were also moldy.  I purchased over a dozen packs of strawberries - no mold, however once I arrived home & began prepping them I realized that at least 25% of them were rotten - soft and brown.   Complete waste of my money.  The only interaction I had with staff was the cashier who was completely miserable.  A woman in her late 40s early 50s -that seemed completely unhappy with life.  She never spoke a word besides to ask me how many pieces of zucchini were in the bag. She looked displeased with the size of my order and simply topped off the bad experience.  I'll never be back again - there's too many other options in the area where you can get quality produce, lower prices and friendlier service.

6.description: Cashiers need more training on how to use vouchers for purchases. Too much time spent in line on multiple occasions because staff is unfamiliar with program guidelines or simply does not know how to process for payment. This is extremely embarrassing and managers do not apologize for the inconvenience. I live in the neighborhood and am able to walk here with my child, but I will not continue to shop here with vouchers as I have had better experiences at Jewel and elsewhere.

0.description: Nobody does nails like Aga!!!!

58.description: Placed an order through GrubHub for Blaze-N-Grill last night after getting back to my new apartment WAY too late, and having a sick, hungry boyfriend waiting for me.  I was feeling like a steak sandwich, and Blaze-N-Grill had decent reviews.  Can't say I was disappointed!We had:1 ribeye steak sandwich on garlic bread1 double merkt's cheddar burger with everything1 cheesy dog with everything2 orders of cheese friesI will say, the burger was BOMB.  When my boyfriend opened it, I immediately had to taste a bite, because it looked way better than my piddly little steak sandwich.  And boy, WAS IT.  I would definitely order Blaze-N-Grill for burgers again!  I'd skip the steak sandwich though.The cheese fries were just okay, I'm pretty sure I asked for the sauce on the side, but it came on top, which makes the fries soggy.  I'm sure asking for well done fries would fix that.  Also, I figured since they had a Merkt's burger, that they used Merkt's cheese on their fries, but it was just regular nacho cheese.  Oh well.Definitely a solid 4 stars.  Delivery was fast, the driver was friendly (our buzzer isn't set up yet.)Thanks, Blaze-N-Grill!

56.description: Some of the best service ever. I had the ribs with slaw salad and garlic bread. The food is good. Probably 3.75 stars worth. However I had this at 930pm so given the time it's probably 4 star food earlier. The food is flavorful but not too mich sauce. Also they grilled it later which makes it crunchy and tasty

29.description: Best carry-out burger in town. They ask you how you want your burger cooked and if you want grilled onions - who does that!? Blaze-N-Grill does! LEGIT!

42.description: I like this place.  Food is good. Portions are big amd the food is fast.  Also staff is friendly amd place is clean.  Their lunch specials are a great deal.  Got a gyros and Merkts cheese fries and a drink for less than $10.Negatives: the register girl did not appear to be remotely interrsted in engaging in sexual intercourse with me.  And my table was a little wobbly.  I fixed the table with a match book.  Your move Blaze-N-Grill.  Set the register girl straight

23.description: This is a gem the food was amazing the people here were very friendly the tiny Asian girl at the register was cut funny, I did not know what to order so I asked about the Philly steak and she practically jumped over the counter with excitement just to say how good it was so I took her lead and ordered it she recommended all the fixings and I was very pleased I think they should let them have their day to suggest meals to customers lol if the food was not great I would come back just because of the friendly faces that greeted me , but the food was Awesome so I give this place 10 big thumbs up

47.description: Great tasting hamburgers and more.  I've dined in a couple times in the past many months since last summer.  They offer thrifty meal deals and can pair them with different sides (i.e. salad or fries, etc) or drinks (not just soda).  I like that their salads come in a handy plastic container.  I can add the dressing, shake it up and then enjoy.  I also dig that they offer Mekt's cheddar and give an ample amount for a cheddar burger sandwich.  Unlike one of their burger competitors from across the forest preserve that cheaps' out with a nil serving.Service is helpful and often offered with a smile.  It's worth the bookmark and the visit.  My visits have always been "dine-in" and I've been thoroughly satisfied.

8.description: The best ribs  OMG.  You won't be disappointed.  They are the best Ive had!  Staff is friendly and makes you feel welcomed.  Even ordering on the phone is fun with them.  I got to chat with the Owner Haseem   (I hope I didnt make a mess of yr name Sir) when I called in a phone order.  Super pleasant man to chat with.   Food is out of this world!!  My wife ordered the Chicken sandwich and she raved about it!!   You will not be disapointed!

31.description: The regular (not the merkts) cheeseburger is delicious. I think what makes the burger so good are the very fresh toppings. Their fries are okay, nothing special. My fiancé thinks they have the best hot dog he has ever had. Definitely recommend the burger. The one thing I didn't like about this place is that the girl Behind the counter had long hair and it was not pulled back at all, just hanging straight down. Back in the day I used to waitress for several establishments and worked in a bakery as well and it was always rule of thumb whenever you work with food hair needs to be pulled back. Very gross. Thank god I didn't find a long blond hair in my food.

34.description: Owner is super nice. The best burger ever again. Juicy thick and I love their onion rings. I've been there four times maybe more because I love a good burger and this is the place

16.description: The food is usually good however they can't seem to get an order correct. Missing food, wrong quantities, and incorrect cooking temps. And their people skills are dreadful.

13.description: Great tasting hamburgers and more.  I've dined in a couple times in the past many months since last summer.  They offer thrifty meal deals and can pair them with different sides (i.e. salad or fries, etc) or drinks (not just soda).  I like that their salads come in a handy plastic container.  I can add the dressing, shake it up and then enjoy.  I also dig that they offer Mekt's cheddar and give an ample amount for a cheddar burger sandwich.  Unlike one of their burger competitors from across the forest preserve that cheaps' out with a nil serving.Service is helpful and often offered with a smile.  It's worth the bookmark and the visit.  My visits have always been "dine-in" and I've been thoroughly satisfied.

11.description: Food is tasty but 2 times in a tow my order has been delivered incorrectly. They can't seem to get the orders right. I wind up paying for things I don't receive and never get what I actually want,

39.description: Their Bacon Cheeseburger is delicious.  I've only been here twice and both times picked up the Bacon Cheeseburger.  I have to agree with "Ashour R" for the price, I can't justify going back to Lead Belly.  Don't get me wrong, I like Lead Belly, but for the price why?  The burger is a meal in in itself.  Their fries seasoned well and served crispy.Several friends have recommended other food items on their menu, but for me it will be difficult not to order their burgers.

37.description: The food is good but do not have it delivered you have to eat it there.  Unless you want to wait over 2 hours and get a cold food.

0.description: Always consistent . The Char burgers are excellent, and fries are hand cut and always good. Staff is friendly. Careful, from the outside it looks like it is closed but it is not. Look for the flashing OPEN  signs in the windows. . . . . . then go in and enjoy !

38.description: The gal at the register was very professional, on point and super cute... Which never hurts ;). I summarize my stay by saying this:Best. Burger. I have had in YEARS and arguably ever. I cannot say enough. Brilliant.

51.description: I like this place a lot. No bells or whistles, but what they do they do well! They're open late, which is awesome. The fries are always really great! I typically get a philly cheese steak or a burger, and they're both good. The baklava is also really good, if you get there before they run out!

27.description: I came here in late April. I got a bacon cheeseburger with no bun. It was a bit charred, but otherwise okay. When I went home and took a nap I couldn't sleep. I was having severe abdominal pain. Then started the vomiting and diarrhea. It got so bad I went to the hospital. I was admitted, and was there for 36 hours on an IV and meds. The burger was the only thing I had eaten that day. I will NEVER eat here again.

32.description: Great place for fast food. There cheeseburgers are amazing taste also gyros is always fresh. Stop by and check this place out.. Great people and fast service check it out..

54.description: With superdawg across the street, this place has some serious competition within throwing distance.  The burger is FANTASTIC.  If I had a choice to go to superdawg or blaze-n-grill for a burger, I would chose the latter.

48.description: At no piont did I ever think this little stand-alone would be an outstanding all-round go-to lunch and/or dinner stop. I passed by it many times heading home from Lincolnwood to Elmhurst . i am like "ok, ill try it for shits and giggles"...but what a great decision to stop! Start with the outstanding service. My experience was looking at a couple "perty" girls serving a beef sandwich or a burger...but they were so much more. This place is filled with great personality and awesome food. It reminds me of Brooster's in Lombard. How do they get such quality chicken and beef at such great value and wonderful flavor. If you're riding down Milwaukee (or anywhere close), make it point to enjoy the fine food. I'd go as far to say, if you are not looking to just try Superdawg across the street, hit Blaze-n-grill first because the food is far superior than that goofy "dog on a stick". DO NOT pass the chance for a great meal at Blaze-n-grill, regardless of the superdawg legend, because you will passed by a great belly filling opportunity!

44.description: I guess my advice for take-out would be to check your food before leaving. I ordered cheese dog with EVERYTHING & got just the dog & cheese. Hot dog was good, bun was fresh & warm - could have been so much better. Just disappointed in the service.

24.description: I went back here recently and the food and service is amazing! Love the full slab of baby back ribs, gyros, caesar salad, italian beef, and double bbq bacon burger!

7.description: Food is really good and fresh like their chicken salads.. but their delivery has been 30 to 40 min late in the 3 times we have ordered from there. So we order at 11 40am, email says we will get it by 12:40. The food actually  gets here at 1:20 pm. . Not good!

49.description: .. so it takes more than two hours & fifteen minutes for Blaze-N-Grill to acknowledge a GrubHub order placed during the standard dinner hour on an ordinary Saturday night.. and the only reason the order WAS acknowledged at two hours & fifteen minutes and counting, was because GrubHub made a phone call to the lacking establishment, to check the status of my order.... & that was just after I made a phone call to GrubHub, asking why it takes over two hours for a restaurant no more than ten minutes away from me to deliver an order that should take a successful restaurant no more than twenty minutes to prepare in their kitchen.GrubHub promptly called me back, letting me know that Blaze-N-Grill had not seen the order until GH's phone call, but offered a twenty dollar gift certificate if I still wanted the order to be placed..  as if to speculate that I would even entertain the thought of looking out my living room window for a third hour with my fiance & newborn son, while placing bets in my head on whether or not I'll get a phone call with some other excuse as to why my order still remains somewhere other than at my front doorstep.See, my time is valuable, and I'm sure that applies to the general population of the world.. and with that in mind, I think I speak for the general population of the world, when I say they've gotta be out of their damn minds, if they think a twenty dollar discount on a fifty dollar order in a three hour time bracket is gonna seal the deal and make things better.Twenty dollars, ay? Twenty dollars, to buy me off? That's your solution, for a first-time customer? Listen,  I can absolutely understand if an order doesn't get immediately processed because of a busy dinner rush. It happens, everywhere, I totally sympathize. I can see where it could take an extra fifteen minutes to be processed. Maybe a half hour. Forty-five minutes, even. Hell, even an hour, at this point, I get it... but over two hours?What if I hadn't called GrubHub to get the status of my order.How much longer would I have waited..Apparently Blaze-N-Grill's open 'til midnight, on a Saturday night.Would I have gotten a knock at my door at twelve thirty in the morning, by some delivery guy with my order in his left hand and a twenty dollar gift certificate in his right hand, while he practices a verbal apology that truly had nothing to do with him, in the first place?.. well.. needless to say, I asked GrubHub to decline Blaze-N-Grill's amateur attempt at Customer Service 101. While Blaze-N-Grill may very well have a quality menu, I will never know this to be true, as tonight would've been my first order, and after an experience like this, I don't care to give the place another chance at repeating the same sequence of events as tonight's display of how not to operate.Oh, and.. after completing my final phone call with GrubHub, I threw on a jacket, took a seven minute drive to a different restaurant, placed the same order as I did at Blaze-N-Grill, and was back at my front doorstep within thirty minutes.Thirty minutes, ladies & gentlemen.... but now, a conclusion:To any restaurant wanting to succeed:If you're gonna partner with a service like GrubHub, be sure you're able to follow through with the process. A bigger online ordering presence means nothing if the online orders sit motionless & unnoticed until someone working at your restaurant suddenly remembers that you do, in fact, partner with an online ordering service.Blaze-N-Grill will never again be a dining choice of mine.I hope this review goes noticed, appreciated and helpful to the consumer, as well as the business.  Thank you for your time.

40.description: Went for lunch with coworkers  had the italian beef was very very delicious  but there wasnt much meat on it was mostly bread but everyone  i know who ate hete loves it im gonna go back and try it  again and there  very resonable to

53.description: First off, I must say the service at this place was exceptionally friendly. I feel bad writing a bad review because the phone and delivery service people were very nice.I ordered a burger and a salad from this place. The burger was inedible. I ordered it medium, and got it burnt to hell--a little meat hockey puck. It also had this strange flavor that I can't describe, as if the burger retained the taste of something that had been grilled right before it. The cheese was akin to nacho cheese and unevenly spread at that. I liked that they used romaine instead of iceberg lettuce, but that was the only good part of the burger. I would recommend avoiding the burgers at this place, unless you like your buns injected with disappointment. Some people are into that, so to each his own.The salad was supposed to come with garlic bread, didn't get it. Can't say the salad was bad, but how can you really f*** up a salad?Other people I was with ordered gyros and said they were "eh." If you want good Chicago gyros on the NW side go to Nick's.Overall I was sad because I was hungry and could't get past the first few bites (no worries, it didn't go to waste because my dad will eat a shoe if you dress it up nice, though he agreed it was funky). I feel like I wasted my money on something subpar.I would also like to add that their breakfast menu should be all day because who doesn't love breakfast for dinner?

30.description: Amazing grilled chicken and pita!!! And the service is great! The salad was amazing and the chicken was grilled perfectly nice and juicy!!!

46.description: Good food, especially anything with the great merkt's cheddar.  Love their chicken Philly on garlic bread.

1.description: Wanting to explore new restaurants in the area, I decided to try Blaze-N-Grill for the first time after reading through Yelp reviews.  Pro:  their menu is available on their website which allowed me to place my order over the phone for pick-up.  I was told it'll be ready in 15-20 minutes.By the time I arrived (approximately 30 minutes later), a staff member was placing the final pieces of my order into the plastic bag.  Seeing how tiny the dressing container was, I asked for another one about which she didn't seem too thrilled.Side story:  As I was walking out the door, I heard 3 staff members yell, "Excuse me!".  As soon as I turned around, I see 2 out of the 3 wave their hand at me while saying, "Oh, no, it's okay.  You're good.", while the one who chased after me just stood there next to me, looking confused.So, I go home and unpack the bags.  I immediately noticed my Greek salad was missing the main ingredients:  olives and feta cheese.  I was quite annoyed as I even requested for extra olives when I placed my order.  When I called the restaurant, I was offered a $6.00-store credit which I declined as I do not have any plans of going back there ever again.  After being placed on hold for several minutes and having to explain the issue to 2 different persons, the cost of the salad was then refunded to my debit card.My husband ordered the regular gyro platter with a side of rice and minestrone soup - he said everything was mediocre; and so were the chicken tenders and onion rings.  All this, despite not having high expectations in the first place.Bottom line is - regardless of the overall experience - I find absolutely nothing special about this place.  Sorry.

55.description: I would love if you would serve a killer streak sandwich, not the crap that(everyone else) serves, but a real thick juicy cut of steak,I haven't tried yours yet but everything I have had is great. Keep up the great job and welcome to the neighborhood.

9.description: Ribeye Philly not worth the extra $. Bacon cheddar burger has cheese the consistency of the stuff you get with crackers and a Lil red stick. Fries were greasy and limp. Dengeos has better phillies.

26.description: I had to go to the DMV today and that means..Bring back lunch! So we asked a co-worker if he knew of someplace different nearby. He highly recommended this place. All of us had burgers with fries. OMG simply amazing!! They grill it your way. I ordered medium rare with grilled onions, no cheese on a tasty bun with fresh cut fries. My co-workers had the Merkts cheeseburger and fries and the Bacon burger. The price was great with the "Lunch Special". When I arrived to pick it up, they were just packing it up. NO pre-cooking here. Hot right off the grill and stayed that way until I arrived at the office. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is now our "Go To" place for burgers. Great Food, Great price and Great People!

25.description: I have stopped her about six times.  The food is tasty but just left me sorry I ate there today.  First the girl at the counter had a very hard time getting my order straight.  She kept getting it wrong because she didn't pay attention.   You could see she was distracted.   Does she have to whisper everything? Also there is something wrong when the girl taking your order and getting your food had an infected piercing on her cheek with a band aide that looks ready to fall off into your lunch.    I asked for a cheese burger with mayo, lettuce and red onion.   Came with no onion.  She asked how I wanted it done and they brag about how they only cook to order.  So should a med/rare burger come out well done?  Here it does.  When you have table service shouldn't the meals come out close together and not five minutes apart?  Also she forgot our drinks.   The tables needed to be cleaned and were sticky.  The food although not done as asked for was good but the staff need to better focus on their job.  This place could be great but they need to loose the girl with the nose ring and two studs in her face.  Either that or train her properly.

12.description: This place is amazing!!! The owners and staff are always helpful and friendly!!! My kids and I love this place and frequently visit once a week since they first opened. If your looking for a bs fast food stop move on cause these people cook fresh and to order which I truly appreciate.  Hot, fresh and awesome!!!

59.description: Okay so I was disappointed with my first visit but my second one was 10 times better. I offer get a bacon burger with mozzarella stick & it was literally one of the best burgers I ever had! It tasted like a whooper but without the mystery meat guilt. The burger was so big I couldn't finish it in one sitting. (I'm only 120lb) I will definitely become a loyal customer to them now! A special thanks to the manager who helped me chang my mind! :)

21.description: I'm so happy that there's finally a business in this spot, bonus that it's a good place to eat! Great burgers, chicken sandwiches, and Italian beef. Hand cut fries. Lunch special gets you fries and a drink for $1 with any burger etc. A great deal!

17.description: Top 5 burgers in the city, everything on the menu I have tasted is crazy delicious. Great service as well.

10.description: I went back here recently and the food and service is amazing! Love the full slab of baby back ribs, gyros, caesar salad, italian beef, and double bbq bacon burger!

5.description: So prior to this visit today the restaurant was at 2 reasons the first time I had ordered a chicken sandwich and fries The chicken was as hard as a dogs chew toy the fries (fresh cut) were soggy and oily and threw them out Thank god I wait till my second visit for my review New front staff friendly and attentive. I order simple menu items 3 layer fries mozzarella sticks and pizza puff They brought it to my table fresh hot and loved the fries minus the fact some of the fries were rock hard! Seriously pic of them on the sideThe environment is very friendly and chill

3.description: So my family of five came to eat at this location.  The staff was extremely friendly from the moment we walked in the door.My boys were "starving" and my daughter "the picky eater" wanted some food, we ordered "doubles" for the boys and a "single" for the picky eater. The server was like are you sure you want a double they are huge.  Please keep in mind, I have football players and they never get full, but these burgers did not disappoint.  My boys were completely STUFFED and my picky eater who NEVER finishes her food ate every morsel.  The fries were freshly cut and perfectly cooked.  We recently moved here from California and this place was the closest we have found to our favorite burger joint.  Most definitely our new "Go to".

35.description: Yum. Delicious, fresh food, fast. How's that for a novel concept. The burgers were cooked to order and the fries came out piping hot. Just what the area needed!

19.description: The gal at the register was very professional, on point and super cute... Which never hurts ;). I summarize my stay by saying this:Best. Burger. I have had in YEARS and arguably ever. I cannot say enough. Brilliant.

28.description: Amazing job on fries and burgers. Great service anyone complain is just shady to hit up a business for a free meal. Will bring back my business here always. Tops super dawg any day.

45.description: Let me start with the best part.  The burgers are delicious. You get two stars for that.I will state for the record that this is a burger place with burgers.  That is the only reason to try it.You may experience (as I have):Poor service. Order a coke and not get one or worse they are out of Coke syrup, on a Friday night, at 8pm.  Their Coke rep would not put up with that.Long wait time. I love burgers. I love fresh made burgers. 15 to 20 minutes is grill management, not patience for each made fresh.Pricey. 12 bucks for a double cheese and fries. I've been four times over the past four months.  I will try it again and check.  Not hopeful as there are other burger options not too far.

33.description: I must say that the quality of the food is excellent from the huge juicy tasty merks bacon cheddar burgers. To thier superb gigantic gyros,to thier suckulent ribs oh my god. Thier merks cheddar cheese fries. Great shakes and killer crispy fries. Great atmosphere,great prices.food made to order.  I will be letting people know about this spot. Keep up the good work guys nice job see you soon

43.description: I would always order from here and although the wait was long I didn't mind much but I recently ordered food for delivery and after an hour wait they insisted I said pick-up. After another 20 minute wait my food comes to me cold, and best part was not one thing was correct. The big philly was a small philly and the gyro came plain (when it should of had cheese onion and sauce) when I called to let the manager know of what happened, there wasn't one on duty and wouldn't be there for the rest of the day...I called the next day and once again, no manager or boss for the whole day. I would always order from here but not anymore they lost a customer.

2.description: This place is the bomb! They just recently remodeled new paint job and made the tables, chairs & booths all the proper heights. Believe me, it was totally off before. But now they are rockin'! Back to the FOOD! Everything is fresh and delicious. I live for their grilled chicken! I get the grilled chicken sandwich on garlic bread. So good! Fries are good too, and they do NOT skimp, always more than i can eat. They also deliver but since everything is made fresh, be prepared to wait. But in all honesty...just go in. The food tastes 100% better in the restaurant. They have Coke products here, free refills and also have SEVERAL milk shake flavors here.

18.description: Hope you are not too interested in getting what you ordered.  Two cheeseburgers one with fries one with a baked potato.  No fries and one burger only had 1/2 the condiments I requested.  Seriously, how hard is it to take 2 burger orders and get them right.  I called and the girl said she would call right back which did not happen.  I'll go to Superdawg  next time.

41.description: Now I was really surprised by this place because the corner where it sits has been vacant for a long time. One thing the neighborhood was really lacking was a regular fast food place that was hands down above the rest. I think that Blaze n Grill is it. First off, fresh cut fries, Boom! That's a great start. Their burgers are the real thing. Good size patty, brioche bun, Merkt's cheddar all make this burger better than most of your typical places in the area. They have a large menu and deliver too. Prices are reasonable especially for the quality of the food. People inside are always nice, and my kids like it. This is my new go to place for a quick meal that actually tastes like they took some time to make it.

52.description: First time here tonight. Ordered a bacon cheese burger and fries with drink. Great tasting food! Service was great and was helped out as a newcomer. Will try something else next time. Thanks! :)

50.description: Placed an order for delivery. Was very excited since this place seemed to have good reviews. Then the order arrived I was so disgusted. First of the kids meal was missing the beverage and small fry. For the regular fries they were loaded with hair. When I called to tell them they told me that next time I order they would give me free fries. There won't be a next time. I have added photos be check before ordering.

4.description: I have driven by Blaze-N-Grill dozens of times.  They have solid reviews so I thought I would check it out.  It's a small restaurant on a triangular site where Milwaukee Ave intersects with Devon.  As the name suggests they have a ton of different grilled foods.  Everything from burgers, ribs, gyros, chicken, Philly cheesesteak, Italian beef, Italian sausage, steak sandwiches.  They also have salads and hand cut friesBlaze-N-Grill has a lunch special from 11am-3pm.  If you buy a sandwich for an extra dollar you can get either hand cut fries or salad along with a soda drink or bottle water.  One healthier the other not so healthy.When I went in the I was the only one there as it was about 1/2 an hour before noon.  The girl working the register was very nice and helpful in making suggestions about what to order when she found out I was a virgin (yes it was my first time there).  They are known for their burgers so I decided to try a cheddar bacon cheese burger.  After I placed my order and was waiting the place began to fill up with hungry customers.  Now burger places are a dime a dozen with a far range of different toppings that can go on the burger.  There burgers are fairly simple in addition the cheese & bacon I got lettuce, tomato & grilled onions.  Even though they are fairly simple they are delicious.  The meat quality is very good.  The beef is grass fed organic beef.  Their burgers are very good.

6.description: This place was good. Stopped in today for lunch with the kids I nanny for, they got the burger and I got the gyro wrap...I ended up getting the regular gyro. They messed up my order but it wasn't that big of a deal. It was still very yummy gyro meat was great. The girl that took my order was super friendly with me and the kids. We will for sure go back!

22.description: Great hamburgers and salads. Everything seems fresh and cooked well. Affordable prices with great service.

15.description: Visited after the remodel and glad we did.  Owner is super nice and very friendly service.  Aleena was da best.  Thanks for the free ice cream.  Definitely helps out a busy mom feed a family affordable.  Nice atmosphere too.   My 8yo and the 70yo granny all loved the food.  Perfect fries.  Better than 5 Guys.  Definitely will be back.

57.description: Excellent fast service, combo upgrade at lunchtime is great value. Burger cooked medium rare was excellent with full charbroiled flavor. Hand cut fries crispy just how I love 'em!

20.description: They get a big up for the fresh cut fries and the friendly staff. But the problem with this place is cleanliness. The table I sat at was very sticky. Sticky to the point that it needed to be sanded down and re-sealed. It's why wooden cutting boards are a bad idea. The bacteria gets into the wood and never comes out. Ketchup/catsup squeezer was the same. Sticky. And dirty. An automatic dishwasher is a must, especially when who knows how many customers come in with dirty hands, and then they touch their food, their mouth, etc. Those bottles should be emptied and washed daily. Or better yet, get individual packets. Maybe more money, but more hygienic.As for the food, I had a gyro. It was pretty good, but that's really a matter of not letting the meat dry out. The fries were ok, but burned. I could have gone to Superdawg across the street, but I'm not a fan of their dogs, either.

36.description: The place has big portions but the service was not friendly . We had to constantly repeat out order to her as she couldn't grasp simple sentence . Not highly impressed by this place

14.description: They get a big up for the fresh cut fries and the friendly staff. But the problem with this place is cleanliness. The table I sat at was very sticky. Sticky to the point that it needed to be sanded down and re-sealed. It's why wooden cutting boards are a bad idea. The bacteria gets into the wood and never comes out. Ketchup/catsup squeezer was the same. Sticky. And dirty. An automatic dishwasher is a must, especially when who knows how many customers come in with dirty hands, and then they touch their food, their mouth, etc. Those bottles should be emptied and washed daily. Or better yet, get individual packets. Maybe more money, but more hygienic.As for the food, I had a gyro. It was pretty good, but that's really a matter of not letting the meat dry out. The fries were ok, but burned. I could have gone to Superdawg across the street, but I'm not a fan of their dogs, either.

12.description: I had wrote a review for this place a long time ago the day after going to the salon and was overjoyed at first. However it wasn't a week later before that joy turned to sadness. I am editing my review years later because I simply forgot I had a yelp account and don't want to leave false reviews.I went into to get Pravana Vivid Coloring done. I wanted to do a blonde on top and a hot pink under. Alex was very nice and welcomed me in with out a problem. She did mention that they didn't really have any of the colors I wanted but they did have this deep pink. She informed me that it would look awful for me to do the top blond and under pink even thought my hair is this washed out brown color at the time. It took convincing but she talked me out of getting the blonde and pink and just getting the pink. I watched as she began to work on my hair. Placing foil down under the hair and only placing the bleach on the top part of the hair and then folding the rest up into the foil. She did this with every part of my hair that she was going to dye pink. When she washed that part out getting ready to put the dye in I could see the horrible sight of failed bleach orange about half way down the hair. This should have been a sign. She dyed it and didn't even dry it. She "trimmed" my hair and I paid $90 for my hair and another $60 or so for the special shampoo and conditioner. Now I understand that bright colors don't last long and I was following her instructions to the letter. This included cold showers. The color washed out almost with in a week. A friend of mine went to get hers done with blue and her hair turned green. She didn't properly divide the hair and the dye got on the rest of her hair so it looked like a spatter paint art project. I would never go to this location again to get my hair done.When i was there four people came in to get touch ups on their hair that had gotten done less than a week before.OVERPRICED. Alex again was very nice but I wish she hadn't talked me out of what i wanted to do. Prices are outrageous. It is a full service salon at least it was the last time I went. I was a walk in to that was a plus to this place.Pros: Nice staff, friendly. Informative. Full Service Salon. Easy to find location. High end products. Beautiful environment. Accepts walk ins.Cons: Over Priced, average cuts that are not worth the price. I want to say Lazy but i think this is a mean way to put it but it just seems like they just don't try. It's as thought they make enough money to not care if they do a good job. Like they think oh they are paying a shit ton even if it looks like shit they will come back and pay us again to fix it. Will not be going to the salon again.

3.description: I had a Brazilian blowout here two years ago. I've tried to unsubscribe from their email list four times but they don't take me off. Don't give them your email or you will receive their emails FOREVER.

1.description: Jenny is awesome! She did my brazilian blowout and a trim a few weeks back and I seriously can't get over how great it looks! Jenny is super friendly and knows what she's doing. I'm glad I found her!

2.description: Jenny is the best! My hair has never looked so good. I highly recommend her and the Brazilian blow out.

9.description: Cute little salon tucked away, almost hidden unless you know it's there. Very personable, and friendly stylists. Alex was recommended to me by a friend, and I am so glad to have found her and Salon 51. I told her what I was looking for as far as cut and color, and she accommodated me to the T. Very happy to have found a salon in my area that can take care of my needs.
