10.description: I've been coming to Salon 51 for about 5 years.  It is an upbeat modern full service salon.  The staff is friendly and even though I'm there every 6-10 weeks, they still remember me by name! I feel very welcome when I'm there. Kim is my stylist and she's super patient and will work with you in terms of your style. She's a perfectionist and will make sure that you are fully satisfied with your cut and style.   She also has great suggestions for latest trends and styles if you are just not sure what you want done.  I wasn't going to the place when it was owned by the previous owner, so I can't echo what the other reviewer states.  It's not an uptight feeling to me.

4.description: Salon 51 is the place to go!!  I have been coming here for a couple of years and it's hard to believe anyone would have anything negative to say about this place.  I can always count on Salon 51 to offer the best and the newest services such as hair color, extensions, hair treatments and the list goes on.  This really isn't your average hair spot, they have this great vibe as soon as you walk in, great music, the cutest decorations for holidays and the highest level of quality hair products.  Customer service is top notch!  My stylist is Alex and I can always count on her for last minute services.  She's fun, very understanding and most importantly she LISTENS!!  Don't waste time going anywhere else, this salon is the place to be!!!!!

6.description: I went to Salon 51 ten days ago for my first no-chip (Shellac) mani & a regular pedicure.  I saw them listed as one of the salons using this new nail technology on the CND website & remembered I was pleased with a haircut from them a year ago.CND Shellac brand boasts a 14 day no chip guarantee.  2 days later, one finger chipped (peeled to be accurate.)  Hey, nothing's for certain in life. ; )  But, my contention is that it has been 10 days and I still can't get a repair one finger.  1.) she was all booked up  2.) Next, she was sick  3.) no one else in the salon can repair a manicure (4.) next, she's sicker than we first thought (strep)  (5.) They're closed Sundays, Mondays, and don't open until 12:30pm on Tuesdays; open only for 4 hours on Wednesdays.  Are they semi-retired over there?  Hmm, think the event already passed that I got my manicure for?  You bet.  My issue isn't with the Shellac, or the smudged big toes (b/c they rushed me out in my flip flops so they could close.)  My issue is that I spent over $90 and I'm not even asking for my money back.  I just want one f***g finger repaired!!! Is that so demanding?!?   I'm not looking for a world-famous neuro-surgeon to be flown into Chicago... just a nail technician to fix the work [rolling my eyes.]   Are they really in such a high demand field of work that they can't have anyone else?To sum it up, great haircut a year ago; small mishap on the no chip Shellac; but atrocious hours and negligible customer service to mop up their own workNot sure if I'm going to buy my own equipment for the Shellac manicure [I have better hours, Lol], or just go somewhere else that has better hours [which would be, umm... anywhere.]

0.description: I see Kate for cut and color. She is awesome at what she does and I have referred many of my friends and patients to her.

5.description: I love getting my hair done at Salon 51 with Alex! She does an amazing job. She is very talented, you can show her a picture of what you want your hair to look like.. and POOF by the time you walk out of the salon, your hair will look like what you asked. She has tacked ombres, highlights, bangs, inverted bobs, bobs, layers, you name it.. she will deliver. Also she does a great job styling your hair after the cut (major bonus).Not only is Alex amazing at doing hair cuts for women.. she can do cuts/styles for men too! I send my boyfriend to Alex, and again.. I told her I wanted his hair to look like Justin Timberlake slicked back side part (trendy now in mens hairstyles) and she did it! His hair looks great, and it's a style you could NOT get done at a super clips (sorry boys). Alex is amazing and I would recommend her to anyone with confidence!

13.description: Place is great, stylist know what they are doing, your hair is in great hands at that location! pedi/mani are a little on the high end so just stick to the hair cuts. One thing for sure is that if you pay with a credit card for every service they charge one dollar...crazy..example you get a hair cut and color plus mani you pay for your charges along with $3 ($1 for each service..wth!)

11.description: Not a good place to go! staff is unfriendly, hours are crazy! Donna worked there and was my stylist it was the only reason i went. does anyone know where she went?

8.description: I was referred to Salon 51 by a friend who has been going to them for a while now and loves this salon. I moved to the Norridge area from Chicago so I wanted to find a salon closer to home and my hunt for a place I like was not so successful. I went to Salon 51 for the first time and made an appointment with anyone they had available for highlights and a hair cut. My appointment was with Jenny. She turned out to be great. She knew exactly what I wanted by having a conversation with me and gave me suggestions that I loved. I was happy with my highlights and my cut. I also had her cut my 5 year old daughter's hair as well. However a hair cut for a child is way too expensive. However it was worth the money for my own services.I think I paid $130 for both myself and my daughter's hair plus tip.

14.description: great salon, very up to date on how they cut and style your hair. I love LIZ she is great i used to go to Gallery of Hair but that was outrageous with prices and drastic changes, they fried my hair there! but now at salon 51 LIZ sold this salon to someone else and now the prices are highed and things seem to be a little more uptight. But still the same, i would recommend to go here.

7.description: Warning: Do not trust Salon 51 on your wedding day! A few weeks before my wedding my mom and sister, my MOH, changed their minds and wanted to get their hair done with the bridal party.  Upon asking, while getting a trial done WITH my sister, I let them know if they did not have the availability, it was no big deal and they'd just find somewhere else.  Alex thought about it and said she'd come in early that day to do their hair: they should arrive b/f salon opens at 8:30am and I was to arrive at 9.  Let me stress, I would have never agreed to arrive earlier than 9 so they could get their hair done, I am NOT a morning person. So on my wedding day I overslept, totally not my fault, and I was stressed and devastated.  I arrive only 15 min late amd find my stylist Alex had just begun, minutes before, on another bridesmaids hair.  No call or anything.  Needless to say, when my mom and sister arrived at 8:30 the salon and void of any employees.  I waited for well over an hr.  causing me to be late getting ready, my mom not even getting her hair done, and I did not get one pre-wedding bridal party pic.  Alex was blatently rude while styling my hair and put little effort into her work.  She scolded me saying that she didn't appreciate my mom and sis walking in and asking for her as they were "not even in her books" and I was to be there at 8:15.  This place has absolutely no idea how to communicate with customers or how to provide quality customer service.  They have a computer system that sends a text msg reminder for appointments.  Mine says "don't forget about your upcoming appointment with Alex at 9am for an updo".  Not 8:15.  Obviously they have no idea how to use this appointment system which likely was a big expense incurred to improve overall customer service.  She was stressed because her salon overbooked the day and she took it out on a very stressed out bride.  Her attitude and snarky comments directed towards me and the whole situation on my wedding day ruined my mood on what should've been the happiest day of my life.  I'd like to add that we did not make a scene or act inappropriately as I had my whole bridal party there waiting to have their hair done.   My mom had to leave to keep it from coming to this--and called my fiancée crying her eyes out thinking she ruined my day.  All I would've wanted was a refund for poor service and an apology along with well wishes for the day.  Id like to thank these crabby people for this experience and for letting it show in their work.  Please stay tuned for pictures of how my hair resembled a rats nest while cutting my cake.  I hope Salon 51 reads this and learns to improve their customers experience and the quality of their work and accountability for their shortcomings.  On her wedding day, the salon is the first place a bride encounters-- make it a good one and you'll have a lifetime customer and an opportunity for referrals.

0.description: Good location and plenty of parking. Good stock on items also. They registers are always staffed. Helpful employees.

28.description: I was again at Resurrection Hospital, but I needed to obtain a CTA transit pass on swift notice. I knew the closest place I could get one was a CVS Pharmacy store.There are _two_ CVS' near the intersection of Foster, Higgins, & Nagle. The one in the former Golden Flame restaurant location _does not sell them_. The one which was the former Osco one block east of it _does_.After obtaining the pass, I opted to eat here at Nick's.I elected to opt for the gyros combination meal ($7.35).The two-star rating is solid.The gyros got cold [temperature] rather swiftly. There was a lot of meat though. The french fries were institutional (crinkle-cut), and needed ketchup. However, they were also unsalted, which is unusual for a stand like this.I think the prices here are artificially high because, for some bizarre reason, it has a flat screen television subscribed to Comcast cable. This venue *does not need* cable television. It is not a destination in and of itself. You're going to spend a maximum of forty minutes in here, if you eat in here (I did).Concentrate on the food, please. Cook the gyros on the roll so that it doesn't get cold that quickly. Disconnect the cable, and lower your prices accordingly. I probably will not be back here again.Transit options: The #88 Higgins bus runs here all the time the venue is open. The #86 Narragansett bus runs only weekdays until 9:35 pm.

1.description: Great food great people, and great prices. Elizabeth is great she is such a nice person

9.description: awesome greek salads! i would highly recommend this place for lunch, dinner or a simple snack.

29.description: Nick's has really good food (especially the cheese fries), but there are definitely better options out there.  The owner and his son (usually working the register) can be rude and pretentious, and if you're a female eating in, the cooks will often stare and talk about you in Spanish (yes I understand it).For the price, it's good, but it's a relatively mediocre place.

23.description: Old school greasy goodness at decent prices.  It's pretty no frills but the menu is pretty extensive with all the Chicago favorites.  Stop by if your in the neighborhood.

5.description: Solid gyro. The baklava is made in house and is most excellent. The younger guy who is usually taking your order is very nice. The cook with the glasses always seems kinda pissed but that could just be the way he always looks.

31.description: Mmm. HUGE menu. Huge Portions. Teeny Prices. Never super-duper crowded.This is my favorite Nicks location. I never thought the gyro plate on paper was a weird thing, as mentioned below... I mean, its a gyro place. The whole plate costs you like 6 bucks... hmm. Anyway, Gyro plate is my FAVORITE: comes with fries, tzatziki, onions, pita, and meat. Order extra pitas (cheap) and it can EASILY feed 2 people. They do not have chicken gyros if that is your thing, but they DO have, like, everything else, all huge portions. The food is greasy... I want to point out that it is called "Nicks GYROS". Not "Nicks Health Food". That is all.

25.description: Places like this remind me of my dads when I was younger, a greek resturaunt where the food was good...I had a skirt steak sandwhich with fries and drink.  Good, filling and made me sleepy.Cashier was tlakative and the other funny thing was that one of the spanish guys working there used to work for my dad back in the day.  So added nostalgia.  Flat screen tv in there was nice if you wanted to relax.On the NW corner in a small strip mall with a subway there and across from the CVS.  Not bad for a last minute stop.  Don't remember if they have breakfast so I am not putting it down there.  But you can call if you really want to know.

12.description: Me and the boyfriend were in the area looking for a relatively quick bite to eat, and this certainly hit the spot. Nick's kind of reminds me of a joint that doesn't get recognized all that often because it lacks flair and could probably use a makeover (there was a... hole in one side of the window that could use some repair) but when you're in the mood for some typical Greek fare this is a good choice and won't break the bank. The menu is kind of vast and it can be hard to sort out exactly WHAT you want if you try to read it all. Had some barbecue chicken (half) and gyros here and the chicken was done perfectly, the sauce was tasty and so were the gyros. Chicken was served with some garlic bread which is smashed (on purpose it looks like) and had a good flavor to it as well. I would come back here again, though the area you have to drive through just to get here is way too congested on a daily basis.

21.description: I hate that this place is at the end of my block and their food isn't good. I was hoping for a fast convenient place but it really isn't any good. Italian beef is disgusting! It was thick and chewy like rubber. Gyros aren't good and their soup,everytime, is like water. Tonight, I ended up back there for another less than pleasing meal. Why? Well, its the night of the big Chicago winter storm and on my way to a restaurant on Harlem, every street light and business lost power(on Harlem). I was ready to just go home and unfortunately he suggested just going here since we didn't have anywhere else.Do yourself a favor and don't waste the $25. If you want great beef, go to Mr. Beef at Irving park and Harlem.

16.description: Places like this remind me of my dads when I was younger, a greek resturaunt where the food was good...I had a skirt steak sandwhich with fries and drink.  Good, filling and made me sleepy.Cashier was tlakative and the other funny thing was that one of the spanish guys working there used to work for my dad back in the day.  So added nostalgia.  Flat screen tv in there was nice if you wanted to relax.On the NW corner in a small strip mall with a subway there and across from the CVS.  Not bad for a last minute stop.  Don't remember if they have breakfast so I am not putting it down there.  But you can call if you really want to know.

17.description: I've lived in the area for over 10 years and always go back to Nick's Gyross. They have the best gyros I've ever had. I'm definitely going to keep going there for 10 more years.

10.description: Best gyro I ever had. Won't go anywhere else. Been coming here since I was little with my dad and uncle. I used to come here a lot in high school. Now I come here once in a while with my boyfriend, always when in the mood for a gyro. Other food is good too. The staff is friendly. Love that its walking distance from my home. Will miss it when I move!

11.description: If you like greasy fast food that's reasonable in price come here. My husband loves the gyros and the cheeseburgers are good too.

26.description: Nick's has been my favorite place in Chicago for gyros and Greek Chicken for going on 20 years.  They used to be on Crawford, but then I started going to their Harlam and Nagle locations.  The food is always fresh and consistently good!  Its fast food, but the quality easily rivals and exceeds "sit down fare" that is 2-4 times the price.Nick, don't every change a thing!PS Chili Cheese Dogs are some of the best tasting anywhere as well

27.description: This review is for THE GYROS ONLY.So I was in the neighborhood and kinda hungry.  I pulled over and asked this guy who looked like lead singer of Def Leppard, "Yo, where's a decent place to eat ova he?" He suggested Nick's but warned me that it was expensive.  It actually was pricey for a fast food joint, but you get what you pay for.I ordered a gyros sandwich to go.  The only other place I'd grab a gyro is Hub's, but now I have two places. The meat was perfectly cooked, not thrown on the grill to finish it off (I HATE PLACES THAT DO THAT!) and really, really tasty.  It was a little over $5, but it was well worth it. Heck, it may be worth the drive back to Norwood Park!

0.description: First time here. I ordered just a gyro with everything. I wasn't sure how it was going to be. I rushed to get home to eat it and found myself with a great big smile! It was delicious! Very hot and tasty! Definitely will be back and try other items!

20.description: I will be back sooner or later but only because of a lack of a better choice in the neighborhood. This place is definitely the epitome of a "mediocre fast food joint". The food is always a disappointment but on the bright side its close by.

19.description: Nick's has been my favorite place in Chicago for gyros and Greek Chicken for going on 20 years.  They used to be on Crawford, but then I started going to their Harlam and Nagle locations.  The food is always fresh and consistently good!  Its fast food, but the quality easily rivals and exceeds "sit down fare" that is 2-4 times the price.Nick, don't every change a thing!PS Chili Cheese Dogs are some of the best tasting anywhere as well

33.description: I'm a big fan of Nick's. I've been coming here for years. The soups are great and the food always hits the spot. The staff is always the same, and they actually are nice. They just don't talk much to customers (Non-Greek ones anyways). Sometimes just getting my food is fine.

2.description: Awesome pizza puff! Fresh crisp french fries! It's hoppin in here and I see why! Nom nom nom

32.description: I ordered a gyro plate to go and when i got home it was on a cheap flimsy paper plate.  The food was ok but i will pass on Nick's from now on.

18.description: I've been stopping by here for Gyros for years as they have the best ones in the neighborhood. (I cant say anything about the other food choices as I have never tried anything else).  I tend to basically have a craving for a gyro once in a while, and if I go anywhere else I'm always disappointed as I compare it to the ones I get here. It's not too cheap (about $7 for a gyro with fries) but they really pack it in there. I hate places that give you like 4 slices of meat (sometimes just grilled lol).

13.description: I've been going here since I was 13 years old...I'm 34 now (I'm old, awesome). Nick's has never let me down. They're my "go-to" clutch fast food joint when I'm yearning for a gyro and crinkle-cut fries.Please don't ever go out of business, if you do - I will resort to a life of crime. I don't want that to happen, you don't want that to happen. Please let's not let that happen.Keep making your delicious gyros. Thank you.

4.description: love this place! I can't get enough of the gyro plate and the chicken bbq!

24.description: This place is my favorite place to go for Itallian Beef, it's sooo good!  And they get bonus points for having skirt steak.  However, the place is always empty and I don't think the rest of the food is all that wonderful, I know the fries are just so-so, which for Chicago, we all know there are 50 places that have supurb fries when we crave them.  The guy gets a little crabby often and the prices are a bit higher than most hot dog places.

6.description: I remember this place to be good growing up. I was craving a gyro dinner plate recently and went here only be met with disappointment. The crinkle cut, soggy-like fries, gyro meat that was cut too thin, and tzatziki sauce that was way too runny and not very flavorful. I'll be taking my gyro cravings elsewhere!

22.description: Good greasy food, but guy behind the counter obviously doesn't like people. This is your typical Greek fast food place. There are plenty of tables for their busy lunch time. However, the young guy who works behind the counter always seems bothered by everyone who walks in. Maybe he's Nick Jr., and hates his job... who knows. The food is just OK, so they should do something about the attitude situation to keep people coming back.

15.description: I hate that this place is at the end of my block and their food isn't good. I was hoping for a fast convenient place but it really isn't any good. Italian beef is disgusting! It was thick and chewy like rubber. Gyros aren't good and their soup,everytime, is like water. Tonight, I ended up back there for another less than pleasing meal. Why? Well, its the night of the big Chicago winter storm and on my way to a restaurant on Harlem, every street light and business lost power(on Harlem). I was ready to just go home and unfortunately he suggested just going here since we didn't have anywhere else.Do yourself a favor and don't waste the $25. If you want great beef, go to Mr. Beef at Irving park and Harlem.

7.description: Very good homade gyro and good bbq chicken they have the best homade bbq sause and the owner is a friendly no nonsence guy who takes pride in his cooking

8.description: I absolutely love love LOVE this place! Excellent food and excellent service! Usually I go with a cheeseburger but their Italian beef is awesome. The large fries are a generous amount. Just moved to the area and by far, this is one of our favorite places.

30.description: Good food,reasonable prices,but sometimes the breads aren't that fresh,so ask for fresh bread?

3.description: Meat was dry and burnt. Staff is nice ...But ..I will not return , periodSave your money and try central gyros

14.description: It was cold and rainy so I came to eat here. Food is greasy and cheap. Tasted pretty good overall. Had a cheeseburger and some cheese fries. Very authentic tasting good food . Better than others around there like natalies on nagle

1.description: old school, unbelieveable stuff. everything i have had has been terrific. in fact, i live on the far south side, and drive an hour to shop here. a butcher shop that smokes meats smells funky? that would be like being surprised a gas station smelled like gas.

0.description: My mother-in-law sent me to Harczak's to pick up sausage for Thanksgiving Dinner in 1964 and I have been making several trips each year to stock up as I now live in Minnesota and winter in Arizona .Each time I make the trip I need to buy lots of the nice treats they have in the deli case.Last October I purchased more then 100 lbs to take back to my MN neighbors and even transported 50 lbs the 1800 miles to AZ for family and friends.Harczak's is easy to deal with as I call ahead to place my order and it is packed and ready for pickup.Try their Smoked Polish Sausage as it is the best I have every tasted.Mike AdamsExecutive ChefLake Geo Travel PlazaDexter, MN

3.description: Very nice little yarn shop.  Owner was very friendly and greatly helpful.  There was a class being held while I was shopping.  I will definitely go back.  On street parking available.

1.description: I visited this shop on a little bought of "yarn store tourism" and thought it was nice. It was evidently Knit Night when I got there, which was fun. I was promptly greeted by someone on staff and was offered help. The shop is very cute and located in a cute area. I gave this store only 3 stars because although I was greeted warmly, I felt a little like an alien wandering around looking and touching yarns under the gaze of the locals. It felt strange. Also, nothing was labeled with prices. I don't like to have to guess how much a yarn costs. Sadly, I left without buying a thing (which is not like me at all!)

2.description: This store is closed when it's supposed to be open. I took a taxi to get here from O'Hare on a layover. Very unhappy. Small. Wouldn't return.

0.description: This place is great!  I took some knitting class here a couple years ago and I keep coming back because Brigitte has a great shop.  She has an open knit night  as well and lots of ladies congregate until pretty late.The service is amazing and she has a great selection of yarns.

4.description: I needed some double-points, so I thought I'd head to this shop and check it out. It's a very charming little shop located in Norwood Park. There were people gathered there to knit (3-4), and she had a class starting soon. The shop was clean, easy to move around in and had a good amount of yarn. It even had baby alpaca, which is quickly becoming my favorite yarn.The person who was working (the owner?) was helpful and friendly, and when she couldn't find the size needles I needed outside, she went to the back to find them. The parking was a breeze - it was street parking, but there was plenty of it. The ease of parking is a draw for me - parking for Arcadia and Loopy is horrendeous! Though they don't carry my favorite brand of needles (Crystal Palace; I love the smooth, soft feel of them), I think the warm, comfortable feel of the shop, coupled with the nice selection of yarns they carry, will encourage me to visit this shop again when I feel another project coming on.

3.description: Gotta love Dandy Dollar! They have just about everything you need. Manicure kits, paper plates/cups, plastic cutlery, balloons ($2), placemats, toys, candy, jewelry. You name it, they've got it. Support this local business and be reminded the value of a dollar.

1.description: You know, it wasn't until this dollar store opened that I realized just how dollar store deficient this area is. Is there another dollar store in Lakeview? I'm not sure? Dandy, welcome...A night full of scrolling through DIY crafts on Pinterest led me to Dandy. And then, as per usual with dollar stores, I found myself carrying around a bunch of stuff I didn't really need. I have spoons, I have glass cleaner, I have trash bags, I have tiny compact mirrors, but I didn't buy any of that stuff for a dollar. Bargains! Anywho, I did find what I needed for my crafts, now all I need is motivation to actually get crafty. Dandy is rather small but well stocked, a welcome addition to an area that's used to paying more than it should for...well...just about everything.

2.description: I was in Dandy Dollar in Lakeview today and I have to say...I love, love, LOVE this place.  It is a REAL Dollar Store where everything is just $1.  The only exception and they do point it out, is that they have a special section where one featured item of something high quality, (like the candle currently presented), is over $1, but is MUCH less expensive than the comparable item at Pier 1.The store is not that big, but you wouldn't know it from the vast amount of items they carry.  Even some of the jewelry is nicer than you would imagine...especially for just $1.  I will make a point of shopping here on a regular basis.

0.description: While dollar stores now sell some things for more than just one dollar, they do still sell everything at amazingly significant discounts.  Prices are so low that sometimes I wonder how they can do it and still stay in business!Stop in any day for a wide variety of your typical household needs.  Today I picked up laundry detergent, bleach, Drain-o, and some garbage bags for a whopping $9.00......That's a serious bargain!They accept cash, debit or credit cards.  All it's all so cheap you'll be kick yourself for paying full-price anywhere else.

4.description: cute little dollar store in the neighborhood! I've gone here for birthday party supplies and they were able to supply me with everything I needed, along with some random odds and ends like home stuff and cleaning supplies. The man who was working was extremely friendly as well. Definitely worth popping in just to see what dollar finds you can get!

12.description: Absolutely loved Ms. Z Nails! They did an amazing job on my nails and the employees were super kind. Definitely going back again, and again!

3.description: Anna is the best and super sweet!

1.description: I came to visit for a wedding & the ladies took my mom daughter and myself quick with no rush and convenient pricing .

2.description: I don't normally write reviews but I really wanted to get a good word out for these guys. I went to rainbow nails earlier today for a no-chip and I absolutely hated it. I decided to stop in to ms. Z nails to have them fix it. Steven redid everything for me. He even pointed out that they didn't cut my cuticles and that they got nail polish on my skin.. He took his time and made sure everything was perfect. The color I chose looked a little weird when we first put it on so he got a few others and we sampled them to see which one was good. I could tell he enjoys his job and isn't just doing it for the money. I would highly recommend this place. And on top of that, everyone there is extremely friendly!!

9.description: I really can't say anything but good things about this place! It's clean, reasonable and everyone is super friendly and accommodating. There is a discount if you pay with cash. They do a really good job on pedicures especially. Highly recommended by me!

10.description: My 3rd visit and last. I went in the afternoon and they were a bit busy which is expected.  there was no sign-in sheet and no one paying attention to the order of people coming in. So when it was my turn, another lady tried to jump in. They could not help match my nochip and pedi color. It took 3 women to finish my nails.  The first woman who did my pedi did a half *ss job. My nails are crooked and she didn't even massage my feet. The 2nd woman who took over for the no chip had trouble removing my old nochip polish so another lady had to take over. Again, she forgot to massage my hands when she was done. The only pro here is the $30 nochip special. If you're looking for a basic mani/pedi, then this place is for you.  Unfortunately, I am taking my business elsewhere.

4.description: This place is awesome! They care about the job they do. This is my neighborhood nail salon and I will continue to go here! Highly recommended!!

6.description: Very clean, Lin the owner did my pedicure. She was excellent right down to the pressure points, exfoliating and massage. You will be very happy to have your nails done here.

15.description: Just had an awesome mani-pedi done in mint green. This place is clean, plain, and has an awesome $18 pedicure special. The staff is professional and very friendly. They give you a stamp card as you're leaving (4 stamps and you get $5 off, 9 stamps and you get a free pedicure). In my book, that's as good as it gets! You also get 10% off if you have a student ID.

0.description: Best nail salon in the neighborhood! Waiting time is never crazy long without  an appointment and not only that the nail techs are wonderful! They always give me the most perfect shape and the best cleanup. I have never left disappointed and I have noticed my manicures last much longer than the previous salon I was going to for years (rose nails) I love this place so much I brought my mom and it has also became her go to spot. Give this place a try! You won't be disappointed:)

5.description: It's so nice,very professional and have good price!!!'

13.description: Very disappointed. My best friend comes here and said they were decent so i went to get a basic manicure. After it was finally my turn, i tried making conversation with the lady doing my nails but she was on the phone or watching the tv. I asked for square nails and they turned out round. She also used an extremley old buffer, like the sandpaper was rubbed off from the use. She was super harsh on my cuticles and the hand massage was no massage at all. Just rubbed in the lotion on the top of my hands. She took like a quarter size amount and tried using it to cover both my hands. Lastly after she finished the color the topcoat had bubbles in it. And it wasnt an authentic opi base coat  since their base coat in the opi bottle was green when the base coat from opi is a light pink. I was really disappointed and was expecting more.

11.description: This nail salon opened about 2 months ago and I've been here twice so far.  All I can say is this place is great!  Everyone is so nice and friendly.  This isn't the kind of place where you walk in and the foreign language and giggles start.  They're very respectful.  It's also so great to have a nice and clean nail salon in the neighborhood.  Everyone needs to try this place, you won't be sorry!

8.description: First time there and I was impressed. Jenny gave me a pedicure and no chip manicure. My nails look great. The place is pretty new and very clean. The prices are decent too. I read some review she didn't get massaged but I did...both hands and feet. I'm glad I found a nice new place:)

14.description: Great new shop in the neighborhood!  Got the grand opening special for $30 mani/pedi.  Nice massage chairs, clean place & friendly ladies with a great selection of colors too. There was no skimping on both the leg & hand massage either which is obviously the best part!  This will be my new go to spot from now on!

7.description: Great service. Very clean place. Very happy with them. And they have $1 off each $10 you spend if you pay cash :) Love it

3.description: Always outstanding service and quality products throughout the store.  If you are a serious fisherman or are looking to get quality equipment for the fisherman in your life, this is the place.  Most trustworthy people that will not sell, but educate.Want to get into fly fishing?  This is the place to buy the gear you will need and which you will be proud to hand down to the next generation.  Broken rod, missing guide or need your reels cleaned?  This is the place.Lastly, want to be part of a neighborhood fishing store where you can go to learn how to fly fish, make a bamboo fly rod, tie flies... this is the place.  Store is in Chicago but there is always street parking either in front on within 100 feet of shop.  FYI, if you are into fishing and have not been to Corens, you should go just to check it out.  People from around the world visit this shop when they are touring Chicago.  This is like an Orvis shop but with better service.

1.description: Great service and excellent work. Taken care of while I waited.

0.description: Awesome shop! Had my tiptops fixed while I waited and talked fishing with guys. I could have stayed all afternoon. True experts. Thank you

2.description: What a great little shop. Eric the owner is one of the nicest men I have ever met. Gave him old reels that had not been used in decades to clean up and get working again. All I can say is magnificent. One reel was Dad's and the other Grandpa's. One bought in '55, the other is even older. You would think they were brand new. New and used rods and reels and always quality stuff. Teaches rod building classes and fly tying. What an art. Look forward to my next visit.

5.description: This place is an absolute rip off.  To start, the guy who runs it is probably the most arrogant human being I have ever met in my life.  If he is on the phone when you walk in - normally with personal calls about fishing trips hes returned from - you have to wait until he gets off to get served. He has a comment for anything/everything you ask of him, especially as it pertains to reel repairs.  For example, I was told once "you must have leaned on it, or stepped on it" like a disappointed father when I asked him to fix a spool.  Recently, I dropped 3 reels off to be "cleaned" - no repairs needed.  Just a simple once over with some lube because I am busy at work, and have a tournament this weekend.  Someone else picked them up for me because I didn't have time to get there, and it was $30/reel.  I have been calling non stop with no answer to let him know what an absolute joke I find that.   Don't waste your time in here unless you want to talk to an old man about his fly fishing experiences, while paying handsomely for being in his presence.This gets better:  The spinning reel was returned without the handle.  After I spoke with him on the phone, he said "I made a note on the form that it didnt have a handle." - he claims the note was written after I left, since it wasnt while I was there.  I was with him when we wrote the form.  He looked at all three reels (all had handles), and asked what I needed done.  He then wrote the ticket, and told me to pick them up 9 days later.  He cleaned a reel I wasnt able to use for my tournament, and returned it missing a piece.  Save your money, and go anywhere/everywhere else.

6.description: Great Store, and great service.   Came in for the first time today with a spinning reel that I thought was a bail spring problem.   They immediately opened it up, and fixed it while I waited, with total professionalism and expertise.   I was very impressed.  They also have a good supply of muskie lures, and the raw materials to make your own lures from fly fishing to Muskie.  As well, they have a great selection of refurbished rods and reels at incredibly reasonable pricing.    Will definitely be back!

7.description: This little shop sells fishing gear, but specializes in equipment for the fishing rod builder.  In addition, they do rod repairs and restoration as well.  If you've got a vintage bamboo flyrod and want somebody to repair or restore it in the Chicagoland area, these are the only guys in town who can set you up.  If you want to repair it yourself and need the tools, they can help as well.  A nice, highly specialized, high-end shop run by a couple well respected guys.

8.description: Can't say enough good things about Coren's. Eric and the whole crew are outstanding!

9.description: Why give your money to the big guys? Special orders, custom rods, reel  repairs, and friendly service.It's all here. Loses a star for hiring Don Chin.

10.description: Nice shop ... repaired a broken rod for me no problems. Nice folks, nice stuff.

4.description: This is the place to go in Chicagoland if you need anything rod/reel related, whether it's a cleaning, repair or some new equipment. Eric is extremely knowledgable, does expert craftsman work, has extensive travel fishing experience and can set you up with everything you need. He does fly, spin and conventional equipment but is a fly fishing expert.If you normally shop at a Bass Pro or Cabela's, this might not be your place because it's much more specialized, but they'll have what most guys need and the advice to go along with it.

3.description: Went with my Husband today (7-27-15) Did not know fully what to expect.The outter sign says 28.00 for an hour foot massage. Yet the receptionist told me that was for a combo. We opted to still get the foot massage but it was 28 for 45 mins..no worries tho.However I guess the gentlemen whom were assigned to us weren't told that and they proceeded to give us the combo. 45 mins for 24.00.All in all it was very relaxing...and well worth it.My legs can not with stand much pressure, and my guy rubbed really hard (ouch) but he noticed I grimised and lighted up.They start out with massaging your face and neck and head.Then your shoulders. Then your feet...tgen you flip over and they massage your back...legs...shoulders arms..very effective and very relaxing.Price is very affordable. Salon is very therapeutic, abeyance is very relaxing ,quiet music playing extremely  professional.

1.description: Been many times after my last incident with the sharing of towels...The last time I went I noticed a hand written note at the cashiers stating nothing less then a $10.00 tip really!I drove by yesterday and no cars in front. They have new owners and did a little more privacy stuff,but you can't really ask for a tip.I usually give 20% but don't tell me how much I have to tip.I will find another place.As for the language barrier it was better this time with the woman in front.The combo was ok I had a woman and she was good.

2.description: Enjoyed the 45 min foot massage.  Next time, I'll have to remember to wear looser pant though; this time I wore skinny jeans which cut off my circulation when rolled up.

9.description: Although the business name states "Happy Feet," this establishment also does an excellent and thorough head to toe massage! After pulling a back muscle early in the morning, I called to inquire if they only specialize in feet. The gentleman that answered assured me that they also do head, neck, and back and welcomed me to come in. They were extremely accommodating with a 10 minute notice, and the lady that worked on me made sure I was comfortable. It is an open space area, where you remain fully clothed, and they play relaxing music. The technique is different from other massages I've had (Swedish, deep tissue, etc.) at high end salons, but you definitely get much more value here at their rates! Even though my target area I needed work on was my back, I was well overdue for a foot massage and almost forgot how bad I needed a scalp massage. They soak your feet in warm water prior to the massage, and my hair did get messy and out of control for the scalp massage, but who cares?! I needed it!!!I am so glad that I've found a new place to go to, and it's so close to home! I have already mentioned this place to friends and will continue to spread the word! I will definitely be back!

10.description: Had a coupon  so i thought i would try it out and im glad i did got a excellent  head to toe massage left feeling  refreshed and brand new and there prices are resonable and ther and there staff is friendly  and attentive

4.description: I love Happy Feet! We have been on a Groupon twice now and each time had a wonderful experience. First of all, their foot massages (which are actually head to to massages) are wonderful. They are relaxing and a great way to relax after a difficult week. It's extremely easy to get an appointment during your desired time, and they are always so pleasant. Because of the language/accent barrier, sometimes it's harder to get across what you want them to focus on more, so don't go expecting to explain all of your ailments and have this private session all catered to you. That's not what this is about. You've got to go for a personal one-on-one massage for that. This is communal and they have a routine that they go through. They sometimes ask if there are areas you want them to focus on more,  but even when I told them, they still did the same routine, which was a-okay by me! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a bit of work on their body and a bit of R&R.

6.description: Got a gift certificate as a bday present. It was a great relaxing hour, fully body massage. I like this place because they don't make you change out of your clothes, but you still get all the benefits of the massage. They have you start with your feet in warm water while they work on your face, neck and arms. Then they pay a great deal of attention to your feet. You then lay on your stomach and they go head to toe again. Very soothing and calming. Well worth the trip.

12.description: This place is definitely worth the money! A hidden gem as when I arrived on Sunday afternoon around 2, I was the only one there. But, by the time I left 4 or 5 other people had arrived. The room is large and clean and I will definitely be back!

5.description: This definitely deserves 5 stars... or as Yelp likes to say Woohoo! As good as it gets!  Let me start out with my initial impression of HF, on the outside it appears to be just an ordinary brick building on the corner of Milwaukee and Medina.  However, once I stepped inside my perception of it completely changed... and I mean that in a good way!  It's big inside, a lot more spacious and airy than you would think.  Another plus was how warm and welcoming the owner Ann is, she has a very calm, cool and collected demeanor. When I asked to use the washroom I looked around and I couldn't help but notice how clean everything was.  Wish more places, especially spas, took pride in the appearance of their washroom's and their place of business.  Once I stepped into the massage room area there had to of been at least 10 (or maybe more) tables all comfortably spaced out, giving it a roomy feel and an adequate amount of privacy.  Soft music plays in the background, not loud, but soothing.  Walls were freshly painted with a deep lavender color and added to the calming atmosphere. No excessive ornamentation either and I appreciated that it wasn't cluttered with cheap bric a brac you see at some of these spas. Now on to the show! Once I started to get the massage I began to really relax, which only reinforced my initial impression of this place, once again, calm and relaxed.  My masseuse gave me an all over deep tissue massage, including my head, that left me feeling afterwards..... relaxed.  So my overall experience with HF was positive, including the rock bottom price.  I've never had a full body massage for $28, even though they list it on their menu as a foot massage??  I don't care if they call it a pinky massage, my experience at HF was spot on and I guarantee if you go there you'll come out feeling a lot better than when you came in!

13.description: Super clean, excellent massage. Very friendly staff. I've been back 3 times and never been disappointed. $25 for an hour massage! Other places charge 2 or 3 times that. Great find!

11.description: My husband and I have been multiple times and I have been VERY happy with the massage and wonderful price! I have been fortunate to get the same young gentleman who is excellent. My husband has had different massage people at various levels. We need to figutpre out how to request certain people for him I think. But really overall excellent service for the price. I want them to stay in business! Please go see them great quality overall; respectful massage!

8.description: their prices have slightly gone up but not by much. i was able to pay massages for my parents and still leave a $15 tip for each masseuse (still very affordable compared to other massage places no way i would be able to pay for my parents massages too). nice family outing

0.description: Initially was going there for a foot massage since I spent the weekend at lollapalooza. Little did I know I was going to get a deep tissue body massage! Amazing service, price was exceptional!!! Because of great pricing I left my masseuse a generous tip! Well worth it! Will come back soon!

7.description: WTH? I don't expect perfect English but not 1 word. Like not even ONE! We asked for the 30 minute back massage ( politely & slowly) & the two disheveled guys that were scratching their nether regions looked at us as though we had 6 heads. One of them showed me a card & had me point to the service I wanted & then he gazed at me, mouth agape, like a confused German Shepherd. The space appeared clean but the staff... Not so much. Save yourself the exercise in futility & have your mom rub your back. November 19th 1:30.

0.description: The quality of the uniforms and polo blouses is very poor I have skirts that have developed those little "balls" and fuzzes and the white blouses are the same and do not come clean at all.

29.description: Pizza is good and so are the side items. Prices are pretty high and side items aren't worth it. I got 6 onion rings in my order. I wish they were a little more generous with the sides for what they are charging. If i do order from here again it will only be pizza.

42.description: The pizza here is always very good, we love the Chicago Pan and the thin crust. They also have extra thin, stuffed and a regular pan. The variety is really nice, the service is good and most of the time deliver times are reasonable. A must try if you are in the area but keep in mind seating is very limited and they are mostly a take out restaurant.

23.description: A guy like me needs three - essential - things.1. A good barber.2. A good car mechanic. And - most of all -3. A good pizza joint.Having found Papa Joe's lemme tell you numero tres is now covered.  The thin crust cheese - I'm a simple guy - was working man delicacy good.I had to honestly pace myself; I didn't want to get to the last piece - squares too none of that wedge cut nonsense - hey this is Chicago. Pizza capital of the world!  Papa Joe's serves up bona fide neighborhood Chi-town pizza. If you're reading this before visiting the Windy Cityt,, take it from a life long resident, find this place and make the trip up to the far northwest side.  Nothing fancy just authentic neighborhood "pizza joint" style pizza.  You won't regret it AND you'll experience real - as in middle class - life in the greatest city in the world. I guess this review started out local and kinda went national or even international, but I am telling Papa Joe's pizza is world class!

47.description: My dad loves this place and has us order from here all the time. For me its good pizza, but not 5 star worthy!. We always pick up our orders and whenever they say 30 minutes it comes out to be 40, I don't think there was a time that the pizza was ready when we came in. Their cheesy bread is great, the chicken wings are OK.  We always get the thin crust, haven't tried any other crust! Until my dad finds a new place that he likes we're gonna keep coming here!

8.description: DO NOT...I repeatDO NOT SLEEP ON PAPA JOE'S SPECIALTY PIZZAS. I've been having Papa Joe's pies now for just about a year. I've pretty much had every specialty they offer. Do yourself a favor and skip your boring cheese/sausage or pepperoni unimaginative creation. Joe's offers a well done Hawaiian which most people I know stay away from to a packed meat lovers. If you want to venture out some more I recommend the Western, Ranchero, and Bacon Burger. All three my personal favorites. They blend the ingredients perfectly and I applaud the onions being thoroughly cooked and not crunchy. The Western has a bbq sauce and the Ranchero has a ranch based sauce. They are all damn good. They're so good I never bother checking out their dishes which may be an injustice but I'll continue to be ignorant... for now. I've only had delivery and have yet to encounter any mishaps or rude service. Also I've learned that the location has been remodeled and looks good but it is small. I always look forward to Joe's pizza even on those weekends where all I had was pizza everyday during the week. My only beef is that there isn't a location near Logan Square and it's definitely not in delivery range. Good thing Jefferson Park is like a second neighborhood for me. Just DO NOT like I said up top.

31.description: Awesome pizza, every time.   They use the best ingredients around, hands down. Always fast, always HOT!  The owner is genuinely concerned about the product, and it shows. I've never had an issue that wasn't met with sincere concern, and an amiable remedy.

34.description: Great mom and pop pizza joint. Perfect crispy thin crust and the double crust is an old fashioned thick crust. Skip the cannoli though. I've had better.

16.description: Only ever had the pizza, but only because it's so good.  Pan and thin are both the best in the area.

13.description: The pizza is really good, a bit overpriced but, still good.  The customer service is HORRIBLE!  Over the last 10 years we've probably ordered between 200-250 pizzas.  Most of the time everything is fine but, today was not one of those times.  Our order took 1:45 to get to us after being told that it would be an hour.  At about the 70 minute mark, we called to find out what the status of the order was and it was still there!  We asked if we would get anything off since we order from there a lot and it was already over the hour mark and the phone girl said, "We weren't going to."  She asked a manager and they gave loyal customers $1.80 off!  Thank you???  We waited for the pizza to get here and after it did, I called and asked to talk to the manager or the owner.  When I was transferred from the girl who answered the phone to another lady I asked who I was speaking with after I introduced myself and she replied, "Someone who works here!"  Finally I found out that her name was "Jessica" and she professed to be a manager.  After I explained the situation to her she said that the owner only OK'd a 15% discount and that I could call back in 2 weeks when the owner would be available.  2 weeks???  I let "Jessica" know that it was not an acceptable option and that we would be taking our business elsewhere.Long story short, they don't care about their customers, even long time, loyal customers.

11.description: Ordered 2 BREADED chicken sandwiches and a pizza. Well, the delivery came and the receipt stated grilled. Called. Was told that they would bring us the sandwiches, we live a block away. It has now been two hours since I originally placed the order and an hour since I called. Customer service over the phone is ridiculous. Girls are very rude. It's a shame, this is the third time they've messed up on my order but I have kept giving them chances. I will not be returning.

39.description: Living in Jefferson Park, I feel lucky to be so close to Papa Joe's Pizza.  Papa Joe's has been consistently good since my wife and I first tried it.  We like the thin crust.  They make their own dough and sauce fresh every day and the toppings are always top quality and of generous quantity.  It's a classic Chicago pizza place, just better than most others.  Walking in to pick up my order on a warm summer night, swinging open that light-as-air screen door to the aroma of pizza ready to take home, there's nothing quite like it.  Support local small businesses, try Papa Joe's.

37.description: I really like their pizza, the thin crust.  We do not order anything else, perhaps a side order or a salad, so I cannot comment on the sandwiches or other offerings.I have only one negative thing to say or perhaps a warning is better, I think that they have plain cheese pizzas basically premade and sitting in the back warming.  I could be wrong, perhaps I am, but I know when we have ordered two pizzas (one cheese and the other with different toppings) they were different temperatures and tasted different.  This has happened more than once and it is always the cheese only pizza that tastes more flat.  So my technique is to order a half-cheese and half-something else.  That way I know it had to be made to order.

0.description: Love the great pizza, Never tried any of the other menu items.They always hand out coupons with every order which is great.

38.description: Honestly, this pizza is the best I've ever had. Can't get enough of their thin crust cheese pizza! I've been ordering pizza from Papa Joe's ever since I can remember, and I've always been as pleased as can be. Their prices are great, their food is delicious, and their service is wonderful. The pizza always comes hot & fresh, and never fails to please my taste buds. It's great hot AND cold. I always get coupons with each order, and sometimes even get surprised with coupons coming in the mail. I can't say enough good things about this place. Definitely worth all 5 stars!

51.description: Papa Joe's fills a niche in the Gladstone Park area that has been empty for some time. Ever since Father & Son's pizza closed, there hasn't been a good neighborhood pizza joint in that area. Papa Joe's has quality pizza for a good price and a very nice staff. Definitely worth trying out if you live in the area.

27.description: I have been to a lot of pizza spots in Chicago. This pizza place is my favorite! I'm so picky and I just moved in this area with my husband so I gave it a try. Best pizza I've ever had so far. I eat here at least every week.

32.description: I'm back to being a delivery-regular. The orders are back to being accurate and they have some of my favorite thin-crust pizza around.

48.description: Good pizza but was overdone (black on the bottom). Good flavor, good price, but with Phil's a block away I wouldn't order from here again. 3.5/5

44.description: I ordered a pizza while at a bar that was down the street from Papa Joe's, I had ordered from them before, so they had my address in the system, but  I told them to deliver it to the "three counties," the bar I was at and gave them the address. They called me maybe an hour later and asked me where I was, because they said they had gone by my house and no one was there. ??? I told them again that I wasn't home but at the bar I had told them earlier.I waited another half hour and called them back wondering what was taking so long, it took an hour and a half(bear in mind that both the Bar and my house are only a few blocks away), and they hung up on me. I never got the pizza. What kind of a place hangs up on a customer? I tired calling again, but they wouldn't pickup the phone.

24.description: It is really hard to find consistent, yummy pizza anywhere, thank you Papa Joe's for being our great neighborhood pizza place!

7.description: All I can say is thank you Yelp! I live in the neighborhood and never thought of ordering pizza from Papa Joes before! ( shame on me). My family and I have always been Phil's pizza people, but recently food and customer service went down the drain in that establishment. Desperate for a quick pizza fix, Papa Joes was the first pizza place to pop up in my yelp search. When I called in to place my order I actually couldn't believe how nice and pleasant the girl taking my order was. Its sad when you are used to rude, speed talking people take your order over the phone :( (Phil's pizza). Nonetheless our pizza arrived and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. The thin crust did not disappoint. Half cheese half pepperoni  no frills pizza hit the spot.  Safe to say Papa Joes is my new go to pizza joint.

49.description: We have been ordering from Papa Joe's for years.  The pizza is decent-we get it for the convenience. Recently I ordered a pizza before my son's graduation.  I placed the order at 4:30-knowing we had to be at the graduation by seven.  Well 6:00 came around and still no pizza-an hour and a half later.  I called up and asked about the pizza and was told, "well, we are really busy."  Sorry-this is Chicago-if you can't deliver a pizza in an hour in a half I don't think you should have a business.  Finally the pizza delivery guy came and said-traffic is really bad and I had a lot of stops.  We now waited two hours for a pizza.  We work out next door to the place and travel there at least four times a week and it never takes more than ten minutes to get there.  If this guy had walked it would be understandable-but this was ridiculous!  I tried to e-mail the owner-but guess what-no e-mail.  Guess we will go to one of the 100 other places on the NW side for a good pizza.

40.description: Their food is ALWAYS hot, delicous and delivered faster than jimmy johns!!The pizza is consistently good, and the service is professional, and courteous!! Love this place!!

30.description: Just moved into the neighborhood, saw this pizza joint and heard good things from the neighbors, thought I would give it a shot....  Great place for carry out, pizza was fantastic!!!  Haven't tried anything else yet but they do have a nice selection on there menu!!

46.description: Dammit, I would have easily gave this place 5 stars! I finally found "my pizza place", which I have been desperately searching for since I moved to the neighborhood 4 years ago. I ordered a Windy City Thin Crust, amazing toppings and you can taste the quality of them, great cheese and great sausage. The crust was great and had a nice crispy bottom and not soggy at all. They did mess up my order, the windy city comes with pepperoni, and my pizza came without it. Disappointed because I am a pepperoni lover, but the pizza was so good that I didn't complain to them. I also think the sauce was a little lacking. I can't wait to order a pizza again and ask for extra sauce and also try the extra thin crust, pan and stuffed pizza's.

1.description: Pizza is alright but over priced. Service and (lol) delivery leave much up to the imagination. Oh and if they do make a mistake don't even bother calling them about it.

9.description: Ummmm. Ordered a pizza over 2 hours ago. Where is it?  Called twice already.  It's on the way. And it's NOT what I ordered.Food finally arrived. Got charged for a sausage and pepperoni pizza and I got a cheese. They are refusing to comp or even take the difference off the bill.DONE!

26.description: I got the Italian beef deluxe and it was delicious and huge! Lots of meat! The coleslaw was creamy and fries were crispy. yum.  :-) the delivery only took 30 minutes. I'll be ordering from here again!

25.description: Excellent thin crust Joe's Special tonight--prepared as requested, a bit thinner and a bit well done.  THANKS!

12.description: Damn!   That's some good pizza!   I was at a bar hanging out & the bartender & i got hungry.   I've never had their pizza before & well, it didn't last long, for I got the 18" which fed her, I, & the customers!   There was even leftovers.   But man was it good.

21.description: All of our orders from Papa Joe's have arrived hot and on time.  I really hope Papa Joe's doesn't change a thing. We've been so disappointed with our local pizza take- out locations, but after 3-4 orders from PJ's, we are hooked. I've driven past PJ's and it's a small space, two tables that I wonder if people even eat at or are if the tables more for folks waiting for their orders. Our usual order is the thin crust sausage and mushroom, but we've also had their "Fantastic Four" pizza--sausage, pepperoni, mushroom and black olives.  We loved them both. Nice sturdy, yet thin crust, flavorful sauce, good sauce to crust ratio and good serving of toppings--no bald spots!Their fried calamari is really good too.  It really holds up during the travel time and still arrives hot and a little crispy (LOVE).  Their cocktail sauce is really good too--I'd swear there's a little BBQ sauce in it too, but not sure, it's just really good. A few days after our orders, I always receive coupons in the mail from them thanking us for our order.  I've never ever had that kind of customer service from a pizza joint.

17.description: Don't waste your time or money. No customer service! Been ordering for years.  Recently called to order wings and asked for no drumettes. Was told they can't do that???? How hard is to separate the flat wings from the drumettes??? Well they have just lost a long time customer!!! I guess they don't realize that there are quite a lot of places that do accommodate customer's requests.By the way I called 5 other pizza places, incl Papa Johns, and none had any problems with my request.

10.description: Good pizza, but a little overpriced.

5.description: All of our orders from Papa Joe's have arrived hot and on time.  I really hope Papa Joe's doesn't change a thing. We've been so disappointed with our local pizza take- out locations, but after 3-4 orders from PJ's, we are hooked. I've driven past PJ's and it's a small space, two tables that I wonder if people even eat at or are if the tables more for folks waiting for their orders. Our usual order is the thin crust sausage and mushroom, but we've also had their "Fantastic Four" pizza--sausage, pepperoni, mushroom and black olives.  We loved them both. Nice sturdy, yet thin crust, flavorful sauce, good sauce to crust ratio and good serving of toppings--no bald spots!Their fried calamari is really good too.  It really holds up during the travel time and still arrives hot and a little crispy (LOVE).  Their cocktail sauce is really good too--I'd swear there's a little BBQ sauce in it too, but not sure, it's just really good. A few days after our orders, I always receive coupons in the mail from them thanking us for our order.  I've never ever had that kind of customer service from a pizza joint.

3.description: Well someone screwed up. I placed my order at 6:23pm was told should take 25 minutes. Arrived at 6:47 Right now it's about 7:20pm no pizza in my hands. No one even bothered to inform me that the pizza was not even put into the oven until I just arrived. I wouldn't be upset if they'd only have told me there was a mishap. Instead of making me stand there and wait like an idiot.Pizza is good, don't get me wrong. But what happened to the girl who always greeted you with a smile and was kind even when you were leaving?. I'm sure she would have told me there was a mishap.

35.description: I ordered a thin 12" half cheese, half sausage & green peppers from here.  The sausage is ok, the sauce is good, but it is greasy.  The crust is like cardboard with no flavor, and I agree with an earlier review that they must have these pre-made waiting in the back. The cheese side dough is thicker than the ingredient side, which makes no sense.  Also, I ordered and antipasto salad and this was defiantly pre made from a couple days ago, the lettuce was slimy and the ingredient's old and nasty.  There are better places to order from around the area.

19.description: Really great pizza on the NW side. The xtra large is enough for my family of four (a 2 yr old and a 5 yr old mind you).

28.description: Their pizza is pretty good. Nothing outstanding, tastes like every other pizza joint I've been to in the suburbs.

45.description: Reasonable prices and pretty good fast/ delivery food. We dined in because we had just moved to the area and had not unpack anything yet. I got a slice of cheese pizza, which they made fresh and my boyfriend got the Italian beef sandwich which he really liked the seasoning on. My friend got a bowl of chicken noodle soup and it was a HUGE bowl. She said it was really good, it had great taste and fresh veggies... not just microwaved out of a can. I wasn't a huge fan of the pizza because of the crust. I was expecting thin crust it it was somewhere in the middle crust. Next time, I will order a whole pizza and reevaluate! Slow (because everything was made on the spot) but great service.

33.description: So decided to give this place another shot a couple of months ago and thankfully didn't see the same face or so-called manager. Rather saw another manager, I believe her name was Ravan. Told her about my previous experience and she promptly apologized and was very courteous and I was happy with the order. I will have to wait and see till I get some food delivered to give them a better rating. I will probably order a delivery order in the near future.

43.description: I've been ordering from Papa Joe's a long time have never been disappointed! Everything I have had there has been great! Prices are great , panzorotti'a are the best! They make their own cheese sticks not from a bag like most places. I don't like my pizza's cut in squares and it's never a problem to cut it my way pie sliced. If you haven't tried Papa Joe' s give them a try you won't regret it!!!!

2.description: First the positives. I really enjoy the thin crust, mushroom Sausage or pepperoni.  Good balance of cheese and sauce. I'll stick with the pizza. On the lasagna, it was just weak. The meat, the sauce and cheese. None of it worked. Meat was bland and the cheese didn't help. The sauce sure doesn't seem like the same as the pizza sauce. The garden salad was iceberg lettuce, green pepper slices, a few slices of mushroom and a well under riped tomato. It was obvious very obvious. Salad dressing equally crap. A pack of Kraft salad dressing. The cannoli. I asked if it had crunch or was soft (shell) because prestuffed it gets soft. They assured me it was crunchy. It certainly was not. It's bought like most items on the menu from Sysco or whoever their food distributor is. I now feel much of the items are bought from the food distributor cooked and served. Time to strive harder. I called to echo my disappointment to the manager and she said. I'll be sure to let them know. No offers or resolution to regain my confidence. And that's a goodbye. Stick to the pizza.

18.description: Yum.Their Chicago thin crust is great, but the other this crust they do with the dollops of sauce on top of the slices is heaven. Sliced in traditional triangles instead of the Chicago square pieces, it's delicious. Quick delivery, super nice employees. Quickly became our go-to for pizza night.Yum.

41.description: I love this place!  The thin crust pizza is always fresh & piping hot.  Cooked just the way it should be:  never overcooked. The delivery is fast (but slow enough so you know its made from scratch!) & friendly.  I highly recommend Papa Joe's

52.description: Good pizza. very homemade style. Fast delivery. Friendly service.

50.description: Yay!  We finally found a good pizza place in our new hood!  My husband and I had been through 3 others before finding Papa Joe's.  We've ordered 3 times now, and it hasn't disappointed once, so I figured it was time to take the next step and officially commit to Papa Joe's via Yelp.  Delivery is fast and hot, delivery dudes are competent and friendly, the thin and pan are equally good.  Done, done, and done.

4.description: Ordered hawaiin pizza from the internet menu. Went to pick up and price was almost 3 dollars more. Asked why the diff. Price I got attitude. At the same time another person complained she was overcharged also. Customer service is not good. I will be using Phils pizza from now on.

6.description: My God! Ordered delivery on a cold day, did not expect much, I confess, only to be pleasantly surprised. BEST veal parmigiana I've ever had. Fast and friendly delivery. Will order again!

22.description: DO NOT...I repeatDO NOT SLEEP ON PAPA JOE'S SPECIALTY PIZZAS. I've been having Papa Joe's pies now for just about a year. I've pretty much had every specialty they offer. Do yourself a favor and skip your boring cheese/sausage or pepperoni unimaginative creation. Joe's offers a well done Hawaiian which most people I know stay away from to a packed meat lovers. If you want to venture out some more I recommend the Western, Ranchero, and Bacon Burger. All three my personal favorites. They blend the ingredients perfectly and I applaud the onions being thoroughly cooked and not crunchy. The Western has a bbq sauce and the Ranchero has a ranch based sauce. They are all damn good. They're so good I never bother checking out their dishes which may be an injustice but I'll continue to be ignorant... for now. I've only had delivery and have yet to encounter any mishaps or rude service. Also I've learned that the location has been remodeled and looks good but it is small. I always look forward to Joe's pizza even on those weekends where all I had was pizza everyday during the week. My only beef is that there isn't a location near Logan Square and it's definitely not in delivery range. Good thing Jefferson Park is like a second neighborhood for me. Just DO NOT like I said up top.

15.description: It was extremely mediocre at best.  The meat on their pizza burger reminded me unpleasantly of the cafeteria fare I had in high school.  The broccoli soup was thick and unfavorable.  The bread for the burger and with the soup reminded me of wonder bread.  Serving sizes were below average in comparison to competitors in the local area.  I've had their pizza before and that too was average at best.  There are better places in the local area.

20.description: It was extremely mediocre at best.  The meat on their pizza burger reminded me unpleasantly of the cafeteria fare I had in high school.  The broccoli soup was thick and unfavorable.  The bread for the burger and with the soup reminded me of wonder bread.  Serving sizes were below average in comparison to competitors in the local area.  I've had their pizza before and that too was average at best.  There are better places in the local area.

36.description: We've been living in the area and have been pretty loyal to another nearby pizza spot but they had started slipping. Delivery confusions over pickup/delivery, wrong toppings, not adding coupons... you name it.And just at the right time, a friend recommended Papa Joes and we haven't gone back to our old place since. Papa Joes has some of the nicest delivery guys.. they're extremely quick and they have tons of promotions/coupons. Highly recommend Papa Joes!! Sidenote.. coupons required for pickup orders. They cant give you a courtesy coupon since its required for the register!

14.description: Owner asked for my debit card PIN number to process my order. I refused and stated that I would come around back like I have before to enter my PIN. Owner then proceeded to argue with me. Buyer beware. This is how fraud happens.

3.description: I cannot recommend Lech enough.  My 18 year old daughter is a hockey goalie and was having alot of problems with her hips.  We went to trainers, chiropractors, naprapaths and others.  Nothing helped.  I happened upon Reach for Health when I was looking for a good massage near our house for my husband.  From my first contact with Eva I knew I had found a great place.  They are delightful and passionate about what they do.  His knowledge of the body and ability to detect problems is amazing.  2 months later my daughter is pain free!  Their facility is so welcoming and relaxing I looked forward to sitting and talking with Eva while my daughter received her treatment.   Give them a try-you will not regret it!

1.description: I am so disappointed. My husband gave me a massage for my birthday and I have left voice mail messages asking for an appointment since July 28. No on has ever called me back. In addition, I have called several times and the phone just rings. No response and no answer machine. Are you sure they are still in business?

2.description: I had a problem with the sciatic nerve, so bad I was almost paralyzed. Went here for a sciatic nerve therapy seminar, was walking like nothing ever happened! Their natural ways include hot stones, essential oils, and so on, works wonders. would recommend anyone and everyone to go here!

5.description: Lech is the best massage therapist I have ever had in my life!  He does deep tissue massage, reflexology, and even reike.  A session with him is a very unique experience.  I always feel relaxed after I see him and the atmosphere is very personal.  Lech cares about me as a client and knows all of his clients very well.  He takes an interest in what we really need and uses his knowledge for our optimum health.  Also, Petra does biofeedback here and she is wonderful!  She also does aura readings for a unique and fun experience.  Biofeedback is proven to improve your overall health, as any physician will agree.  Check out this place!!!

6.description: My wife and I came in after finishing the marathon, pretty beat up. The massages were incredible. The treatment was exceptional. This is where to go for a truly therpeutic massage.

7.description: My friend recommended this place when I was visiting in Chicago.  I have a very stressful job and was in need of a serious massage.  I'm usually very skeptical of most massage therapists.  It's due to the reason that I've been to many and the majority disappoint me, but this is the first time that I was truly impressed.  Lech is the massage therapist here and he gave a deep tissue and he focused on the problem areas instead of going through these scripted motions that most massage therapists seem to go through.  This place is a hidden gem.  I have yet to find someone as good in LA.

8.description: I went to see Lech because I wanted to find someone local for massage. Hands down he is the best massage therapist I have been to see. He has helped me with a lot of my issues. He really has a sense of what is going on with your body and offers suggestions to make you better. He is thorough. One of the best!

9.description: I have been everywhere for a massage but here is where I received my all time best massage. I will definitely be returning!  Thank you for showing me what a massage is supposed to be like.

0.description: Lech is truly miracle worker ! I Had problem with my lower back for 2 years , steroid shots , pain killers , chiropractor, etc ! 5 sections of massages helped me ! I still can't believe it ! I'm pain free ! Can't thank him enough !

4.description: Excellent full 90 minute massage by Lech.  Great attention and focus with deep tissue strokes and hot stones.  The essential oils used are excellent and I will definitely return for another session.  Highly recommended.

3.description: This is one of my favorite stores to go to. Their selection is very big. I can find almost anything I need. I buy Lots of party supplies here. Yes, the parking situation is not the greatest but what do u expect? It's a dollar store, not sams club. The purpose for this store is for you to go in and grab what you need at the lowest price ever. It's goal is to save you money. Not give you a pleasant experience with awesome service and awesome parking. If you want that go to Victoria ' s Secret. Or some other store where people kiss your ass. Mind you, your paying extra for that ass kissing. Anyway, this store gets the job done so I don't see why people wrote so many negative reviews. Also, I do not work here or know anybody who does. This is just coming from honesty and my experience.

1.description: This place is a dump. The parking lot looks like it was removed from a slum in India with all the trash. Workers are rude. The manager is leading the charge to drive customers away.

2.description: I understand it is a Dollar Store but come on!   The whole time he rang me up he spoke Spanish to the co-worker and ignored me.  When he finished he looked at me as if I know the amount.  Pay up!  I told him I do not know how much it is.  So he proceeded to point to the price on the register and said you can look here.When I asked him if he speaks to the customers and if he could say hello...He looked at me as if it were a foreign concept.  His mouth just gapped and he looked surprised.Now I see why Dollar General are ahead of them in profits.Gosh!  Dollar General is just down Harlem.  Think I will go there.

5.description: Awesome Dollar Tree. Always have everything I need. Parking is HORRIBLE though.

6.description: There's typically no parking but the staff is very friendly and you can pretty much get anything you need! Great for people on a budget.

7.description: my underage daughter was a victim of theft  by an employee named emilia on Wed May 15, 2013.  emilia, the employee, pockets the change that is due to underage customers then tells the kids they didnt give her what they claimed, i returned to the store to claim the money that was stolen from my daughter and  the manager carlos handed it right to me; he knew emilia had stolen that money and luckily a witness saw it all and is helping me with loss prevention dept. carlos the manager told me to do whatever i wanted when i told him i was going to report this. i think he was covering up for emiliabe careful sending kids into this store alone

0.description: No parking and the staff is a little "meh" about life, but when you are an hourly employee at the Dollar Tree I don't expect you to be all sunshine and rainbows.  The store is usually pretty tidy and has the stuff one needs.  All in all, not bad.
