4.description: I don't think I have ever experienced a more horrific parking situation.  If you want ulcers, attempt to visit this Dollar Tree.Upside: friendly staff.

3.description: Love it. Good for balloons, cards or any other party supplies. You even get a small discount when paying cash.

1.description: First, you will never step into this store without someone greeting you the second you walk in.Prices for cards are great (.59) - there is a good selection. Being the animal lover, I especially appreciate that they have a good selection of cute animal cards.They have every party item you will need.  My last visit they even had girl scout cookies for purchase.  BONUS!!!!

2.description: This place has great service and the balloons we got for a party three weeks ago are still totally "heliumed" flying around!!!  I ordered them to pick up the morning of the party because I was afraid they'd loose their boost if I bought them the day before, but seriously THREE WEEKS LATER these balloons are still flying high.  I will ALWAYS go here for balloons.  Not only is it fun to have them still around, but it eases my mind to know I could get them a few days in advance.  I also like the way their store is organized by event purpose and think some of the fun costume items are a nice little thing to pick up from time to time for our kids to play dress up.

5.description: I went in this store for the first time to get NYE party favors and was happy with their selection and pricing. I was a little bummed that they didn't have a couple things I was looking for but overall, I was very impressed.

6.description: Absolutely love this place. Went here for the first time yesterday to find party supplies for my daughter's party. I found everything I needed for pretty cheap. I will defiantly go back for more party supplies.

7.description: Never expected this place to be big.  Reasonable prices.  Better than the chain stores to buy balloons.  Good customer service over the phone and in person.

8.description: Always do a nice job with balloon orders. Party supplies decoration is a hit or miss but usually good

0.description: Went in there last weekend for last minute balloons for my boyfriends 30th birthday and it was an incredible experience!! The girls were giving me their opinions, helping me hands on, and made the arrangements beautiful. I got so many compliments and the balloons lasted a very long time. The girls working there are incredible and deserve a shout-out of their own. They are very personable and go the extra mile to help out the customer.

4.description: This place has everything you need for parties, decorations, etc. It is very reasonable too.

29.description: A great traditional neighborhood bar (I mean Public House) on the far north side.  Daily food and drink specials (starting at just $2), wall-to-wall flat panels with access to games you'd be surprised they'd have availability (YES network, etc.) and plenty of seating for what you'd expect looking from the outside in.Most comments were fair/accurate in that it's 20-40 somethings, has great trivia nights, as well as exceptional food for a bar.  One thing I didn't come across was a comment on the girl/guy ratio - it's awful (any night of the week).  It's not a bad thing, nor a deal breaker, but I wouldn't get your hopes up on walking out with any numbers, yet alone get a chance to talk to a girl on some nights. I'd expect that's due to it being a local establishment that caters to sport enthusiasts. You're not going to find many other options on the far north side (that doesn't make you feel that you might get stabbed), yet alone a spot like Jet's.  To borrow a line from Cheers, it's literally a place where everyone "can" know your name.  Also, it's refreshing to still have a place to go where $20 will get you a good meal, great conversation and an even better buzz.

42.description: Jet's, what happened to you, brother?Time was I couldn't envision regularly frequenting any other bar in the area. Sure, half of the reason was that there aren't many good alternatives, but Jet's had it all right there for me. Familiar faces from the neighborhood, Miller Lite on tap for two bucks, delicious burgers and a jukebox where I could abuse Appetite for Destruction in its entirety.Jet's is that old friend you've fallen off with, and when you finally get together again you realize why the friendship started fading in the first place.It began with $2 Miller Lite drafts that vanished, temporarily returned, then vanished for good.  Strike one.The old jukebox is gone as well.  In its place stands a new digital box that not only costs more but may or may not play your song by last call.  All it takes to ruin your night is one drunken asshole burying $20 into the machine and hitting "play it next" a bunch of times. Strike two.Now, those delicious burgers I mentioned in my old review are a memory as well.  I went to Jet's for lunch last week and was shocked to receive a dry and thin patty sandwiched between too much toasted bread.   Strike three!I kept trying to give Jet's chances in recent times, returning there on occasion to rekindle the old magic of the joint. But I guess I've long outgrown it. And you know, it isn't just because of the Miller Lite or just because of the jukebox. Those are tangible things I can point toward that stacked up and led to a little disappointment. It's the intangible I'm having trouble with. Maybe I'm just older. Maybe the crowd changed. Whatever it is, it just ain't what it used to be.

23.description: Love, Love, Love this place.  The staff is awesome, the food is good and the prices are the best!  Wish we had stumbled in sooner!

47.description: I went here on the advice of a friend of mine who was out of her mind. She claimed that the Burgers here ranked up with Kuma's? What was she smoking? Jet's is an Oasis in the Baron desert that is known as Norwood park. The interior is nice, the food is decent, but the burger was not on the same planet as Kuma's. Not that I'm complaining about a $3 burger and a $2 pint of Guinness. On the merit of the food, I give it three stars. I take one star away for the fact that whomever did the scheduling that night was incompetent. What knucklehead bar manager only has one person working on Black Wednesday. The day before Thanksgiving is one of the busiest drinking days of the year. I'm giving one star back for the one guy who was working. He did a kick ass job. He handled a full bar and about a dozen tables with ease. Even though he was swamped, he was courteous and fast. He deserves a raise. Jet's is a decent place to watch a ballgame and enjoy some decent bar food. Since it's the only decent place in Norwood park, we will definitely go back.

8.description: Bartenders were really nice and service was great. However, I asked the bartender to put my credit card under my receipt on my tab at the bar; they leave them out in the open. By the time I went to pay it had been put back on top of my receipt, which made my uncomfortable. I'm sure I have nothing to l worry about and it was just the other staff switching it to know my tab was open. Either way, I didn't like that.Second - neither bar tender could tell me about 3 different beers on their craft beer list which made me settle for a beer I knew, when looking to try a new one with a recommendation. Food was good and service was friendly, but the CC and beer things caused the 3-star rating as opposed to a 4-5 star.

31.description: Awesome specials!!! Trivia night is a blast on Wednesdays.

34.description: Went here to meet some of my wife's friends and a friend of mine in two separate groups. It was alright. Food was great - no complaints. Bartender was also the waitress in many events so you may have to wait standing at the bar for a few moments. No biggie. I would give it another shot with a crowd of my own. Sports mostly on the tv's - nothing new for bars in this area.

16.description: This is a good place to go to if you want to watch a game, no matter where you sit, there's a TV to see. The only thing I was disappointed with was the place was so crowded, that I had to walk up to the bar to order food. There were servers, but they couldn't see us.

13.description: Updating review since there are new owners now. Not a very friendly place anymore unfortunately. The bartenders make you feel like you are bothering them by ordering a drink. Guess I will bring my business elsewhere.

11.description: It took over 30 minutes for a sandwich and chicken fingers.

39.description: We come here quite often when we want a decent burger and a beer after work.  Wednesday night is trivia night, which is always fun.  Thursday nights they have $1 sliders and $2 well drinks.  Usually we just have beer, but last night we decided to try the well drinks since they were only $2.  They were pretty strong (or else I'm more of a light weight than I thought).  We also had sliders (which is also a deviation from our normal burger order).  They were really good!  I actually liked them better than the regular burgers and you could choose from some different ones.  I had a regular (burger) slider and a meatball slider.  They were both great!  The burger one had a really good pickle on it and some cheese.  They meatball one had a huge meatball, some sauce, cheese, green peppers, and onions on it.  We also split a bucket of tater tots.  It was huge and only $3.  The two of us only ate about 1/2 of the tots.  It's always clean and nice in there.  They also have some outdoor seating in the summer.  Unlike some bar restrooms, the restroom at Jet's is always clean.  There is seldom parking available on Milwaukee Avenue, but we have always found parking on the side streets either to the north or the south.

37.description: I really like coming to Jet's.  I just wish more people did, because it is often dead.  I went here last Thursday and was very happy to find out they had $2 wells... I am so sick of places only having beer specials... The bathrooms are always clean... another thumbs up! I also really enjoy the games they have stored in the back... a drunken game of taboo is always a great time... the one thing I do not like is that Thursday night is Karaoke night and now I have to listen to drunken guys sing the wrong words to songs... very off key... but I guess that could be considered entertainment as well!

0.description: Fun, friendly, service is fast, chicken wings are tasty and jukebox was great.

38.description: They have good specials. The menu is good. The chili is great and I order it even though I'm prone to getting heart burn. This is a neighbor hood place and I often find myself there if I want a quick unhealthy meal because their fried foods are delicious oh and they have tater tots. Recently they started selling Rusty Sangria which they use to carry at their sister restaurant that has since closed down. I can drink pitchers of the stuff which can be dangerous but is so good. So good I know what I'm drinking tonight.

51.description: This is a very nice local bar. I had the burger and it was very good.  The burger was cooked just right. Very good flavor. It was a Sunday night, so it was pretty quiet inside the bar. Friendly people.The bar is filled with nice HDTV's and this time it seemed they were actually showing an HD signal.  Half the time you go into places that have widescreen TVs and they are showing regular stretched TV signals. Thumbs up to the person who runs this place!I will be returning again.

27.description: I came here to have a couple of drinks with a friend in town for work. It was crowded, which we later learned was due to trivia night. The bartenders were friendly, the patrons were pretty social and they have different food and drink specials which is a bonus. My real excitement came from the variety of beer they had on draft and how my Shandy was $4.. SCORE! You can tell that its a neighborhood bar with a cool feel. If I lived in the area, I could see this growing into a regular spot I'd visit.

32.description: Nice environment.  Decent music selection and good specials.  Thursday karaoke is always a plus!

48.description: If you go on a Wednesday night they have $2 Guinness and a $3 burger.  Cant complain about the $2 Guinness, and the $3 burger is just that - a decent $3 burger.  While it is a far cry better than what you could buy for $3 at McDonalds, I cant say I would pay more for it on a non-special night.  Decent for what it is.

44.description: This place is two blocks from my house (no driving after this place!) so I stopped in.  Let's just say I've spent evenings here that I can barely remember. Josh is a nice guy and unfortunately I don't know the bouncer's name but he is also a big sweetheart. I was very sad to see the Rusty Armadillo go though. I'm not sure what happened. The chips and salsa are 2 bucks and worth 10. Awesome!

24.description: New owners in August 2014, it seems mostly the same, prices are up slightly.  Previous owner put in a new cooler and more taps a couple of months ago.  My old review seems to hold up:Great staff, food, and specials.  Avoid the $4 Reuben special though, it is very light on the corned beef.  Some of the food is very spicy, which is cool for me, the Thai wings are killer.  Very crowded during Bears and Blackhawk games.

7.description: We initially went to the Garage to watch the Blackhawk's game with a total of 5 in our party, but that place had no more seating. So we walked over to Jet's. There just happened to be two high top tables and we were able to grab unused chairs from other places. We sat in the corner by the bathroom which was a terrible location to put tables. Every time someone came out of the bathroom, they were only a few inches away from us and we had to move. So we moved the table over a bit, but then we were in the way of the bus boy's path from the kitchen to the bar. Anyway, they eventually squeezed through the little path we gave them. It took maybe 20 min before the bus boy gave us our menus. Then another 30 min before we finally went to the bar to ask for the server. The bartender said there were no servers and we were supposed to come up there if we wanted to order- but that she would come over this one time. You would think the bus boy would have told us that when he gave us the menus???Anyway, my husband and I both got the Patty Melts. Mine came with tots and his came with waffle fries. We both thought the patty melts were good! I was very surprised to be honest because I don't like rye bread and it came on rye bread. I thought the tots were good and my husband thought the cajun seasoned waffle fries were good! Our friends got the nacho fries as well- I wasn't a fan- didn't think it tasted much like anything but my husband and friends liked it.The place had a bunch of board games which I thought was cool. Overall, the place was aiight! =)

49.description: I've only been to Jet's once, but I'll definitely go back. A friend and I stopped in during a weeknight and were very impressed. The bartender was friendly and answered some questions that we had patiently, even though he was really busy. The food was very good. We both had a barbecue cheeseburger. The burgers have different side options, which included tater tots. That was great! How often as an adult do you get tater tots as a side dish choice?!? My friend said that it was one of the best burgers she's ever had at a restaurant and I would agree. Plus, the decor and atmosphere at Jet's is good too. It's definitely the best bar in the neighborhood

40.description: This palce is theplace you go on a Friday night or for a game when you just want to hang with your buds and not be bothered.  The food is tasty, the people are nice and I particularly like the fried macaroni and cheese that I cant seem to find anywhere.

30.description: This bar is usually packed with people in the front and outside. I finally got a time where it was dead and ventured inside. it must be the neighborhood youngster bar compared to the other Irish bars in the neighborhood that draw older crowds. i really don't see what is so special about this place. It seems like a good place to watch television as there are many screens. the problem I have with this place is there are hundreds of boring bars like this throughout the city and burbs. the food was bland and about the only good thing to say about this place is that they have alot of beer on tap. Aside from that this is not really a place the should be this croded at most times.

46.description: I stopped by this place a few times after work at the suggestion of a friend. It turned out to be a nice surprise. The crowd I've witnessed is a mix of young 20 to 40-somethings. And since there are a couple other bars nearby this place can, and does, get a sizable crowd. Even on a late Sunday night. They have a good amount of HDTV's if you want to come here to watch a game. The staff is great and the bartender is awesome and answered all my questions I had to ask. Even when he's busy with a full house, he still manages to take care of you in a timely fashion. I've only had the appetizers but they were on par with what bar food should be, so I have no complaints there. And they have great specials just about every night of the week, so those with limited funds can still drink it up. I think this is one of the better bars in this far out part of the city. And since it is just northwest of my place, I definitely will be back.

1.description: Added one star- I appreciate the apologies I received. I won't be back but am glad to know they are concerned with bad experiences their customers have and don't normally run their business that way. --------Left after a brief and unpleasant experience here. I've usually avoided Jets before because clientele reminds me a bit too much of a trailer park. Tonight I gave them a try after a couple rounds at The Garage next door, which is a friendly neighborhood bar. After I walked into Jets I was pushed three time by the same person and after finally saying something I was told, "Well, she's the bartenders girlfriend so she kind of does what she wants". Three time I was pushed with two hands by the same person who can't hole their booze and was looking for trouble. I moved to a different area each time but each time (I get it, sometimes people are drunk and need the benefit of the doubt) but each time she found me.If you need to take care of your drunk friend and relatives, put them somewhere private where they can act like a mess without running everyone else's night, ok?  I shouldn't  have to play nice while being harassed because your employee's girlfriend can't handle her liquor.

9.description: I'm really not understanding the bad reviews or the two dollar signs for pricing. The staff at Jets as well as the customers are FANTASTIC. Susie the bartender is super sweet and friendly. They have specials almost everyday and the $3 burgers on Wednesday are delish. It's a huuuge burger with a side for 3 bucks. Plus they have local brews and nothing on the menu is over 8 bucks. My husband and I just started coming here this past year and it has definitely become one of our favorite and comfortable local bars. DEFNITELY order the fried cheese plate (mozzarella sticks, jalepeno poppers, cheese curds and fried mac and cheese -$6) so so so so so so good!!!!

26.description: They advertise $10 domestic beer buckets, but it's a LIE. What they mean is only CHEAP domestics. Apparently 312 is not domestic enough (funny bc you can't get more domestic than being in Chicago, ordering a beer brewed in Chicago). They also advertise bloody marys for $3 online, but raise the price at the bar. I don't appreciate false advertisement and being ripped off when I order a domestic beer and get charged double for something falsely advertised. At least have your bartenders notify the customer beforehand if it's not considered "domestic" to your bar standards.  Honestly it's complete b.s. and horrible business ethics. I don't support businesses with poor business ethics. On top of that, your blonde older bartender is disgusting. She doesn't know how to properly make drinks, and prepares food without washing her hands after handling money. Where is your sanitary standards? Do you not realize you can make people sick by neglecting to wash your hands??? Especially when handling cash! In addition, the server ignores tables so you have to go up to the bar either way. Congratulations Jets, you just lost a recurring local customer.

25.description: This place has amazing food and is within walking distance from my house, but I refuse to go there. The staff is rude, the patrons are snobby and the prices are too expensive for a Milwaukee Avenue bar. A few years ago someone thought it would be a good idea to save their seat with their cell phone. Needless to say, their cell phone was stolen. The bar tender accused the group I was with of stealing it, then began questioning us like we were on trial for murder. This place is a joke. Go to The Garage next door instead.

12.description: So sad that we have been coming here since they opened and because they changed hands that the new owners family members decide to act as if they own the bar!  A child about 22 told my friend to speak when spoken to and started a confrontation only to be asked to leave.  The bar used to have flair.  It was fun and upbeat.  A game day meant a great time.  Now?  Not so much!  This place is going downhill and fast!  The food, the guests, the entire vibe!  They made the biggest mistake of getting rid of their manager, Sarah.  Sad.  I wouldn't have given this place a 10 star rating a few months ago.  Now?  I don't even want to give it a 1 but there isn't an option!

21.description: Best neighborhood bar around!! Cheap drinks, great food and great service. All of the bartenders I have encountered have been very nice. Coming here to watch any Chicago sports team play is always awesome.

17.description: Jet's Bar is in a great area.  Owners and staff are fantastic people.  Drinks, food and atmosphere is fantastic.  I highly recommend this place....

10.description: I had an overall great experience here the last few times I went. New owners and staff seem very friendly. Great food and drinks! It's always a fun time whether its during the week or the weekend, always something going on. Love their trivia and karaoke nights!!!

5.description: DO NOT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, ORDER WINE HERE!! Seriously sooooo bad. I even told the bar tender(older woman) and she said I should order something else, and still charged me for the ones I had to struggle to keep down. I even made the mistake to order a different types of wine thinking it was just that type, yet I was still tempted to spit right back out. It was that bad... The amount they charge for a glass is probably more than they spend on the whole bottle. I'm not expecting them to have high end $70 bottles of wine, but come on! Albeit I only come when The Garage is too crowded and friends and I are already parked... I'll continue to stick to Budweiser when here.

3.description: Fun Neighborhood place!  3.5 stars, rounded up to 4 for the fact that they cut fresh sweet potatoes to make fries.Decent beer selection - $3.50 burger and fries specials on Wednesdays (upcharges for cheese and side subs.)Gets crowded during hockey season, but plenty of TV's.  During Hawks games they raffle off jerseys - in order to get a raffle ticket you have to buy a shot!Service was attentive.

35.description: It is still a great place but I fear that I am too old for it now.  When I was in my early 20's I remember it being a blast.  Now that I'm knocking on 30's door I found myself generally annoyed with the early-20-somethings that were wasted (and throwing up).

19.description: New owners in August 2014, it seems mostly the same, prices are up slightly.  Previous owner put in a new cooler and more taps a couple of months ago.  My old review seems to hold up:Great staff, food, and specials.  Avoid the $4 Reuben special though, it is very light on the corned beef.  Some of the food is very spicy, which is cool for me, the Thai wings are killer.  Very crowded during Bears and Blackhawk games.

28.description: Jet's is a fun place.  The menu is bar food BUT it's delicious!  The service is fast and friendly.  People come from all over to Jet's, so you have a good, diverse crowd.

45.description: I grew up in the neighborhood and remember dragging my dad out of there when it was Wally's Polish Pump Room. Good Times....I was surprised to find a more "Wicker Park" feeling bar in the old neighborhood. I think they did a fantastic job with the place and the audio/video is great for catching a game and downing a brew and sandwich. Burgers are good but only a little over average. the staff seems friendly and the place is clean, a big plus for me. I'll definately be back for the specials when I see a place to park.

33.description: They have great drink specials from Skyy vodka, Karaoke on Wednesdays and Sundays- always a hoot. This is a more Irish-Nashville style bar. Not much hip-hop, or new beats. They also have good food! Limited seating.

43.description: I don't know how my friends found this place, but I'm glad they did. Thursday nights are $3 bombs, $2 Miller bottles. I do not like Miller, I'm totally allergic to crappy beer; however, the bombs are cheap and include every bomb (yay, car bombs!) The food looks good, but I've never had it, and their beer selection is pretty good. It's a nice laid back bar but seems a little out of place in the area but for cheap booze I'm not raising any other complaints.

2.description: Disappointed. They say they are wheelchair accessible but have a 5 inch step at the front doorway. I know my wheelchair cannot make that jump. Please correct your posting or make appropriate changes.Hawks Win!

18.description: Best neighborhood bar!  The food is great, the atmosphere is so comfortable, and the prices are low!  I not only go as a customer, but I have also had a couple group parties at Jet's.  I received so many compliments from friends who attended the parties!  Outstanding bar, great prices, and an overall fun place to go out!

41.description: I used to live right around the corner from here and have stumbled home many a nights.I know live a mile away and happily cab there!Drinks are effective and reasonable. The food is great, typical greasy bar food.I have had a few parties here and everyone is helpful down to the bouncer at the door!

50.description: We went here after we closed out The Rusty Armadillo and it was a very nice place.  Not the typical joint for this neighborhood and I had to keep reminding myself I was in Jefferson Park and not Uptown where I used to live...great ratio for single girls if you are looking for a date.  Drinks are very reasonable and the night I was there it was packed.  I will definitely go back here when I need a place to wet my whistle.

4.description: My sister and friend used to frequent this place 3 to 4 nights a week! The atmosphere is great, the crowd was great and the old bartenders were great!  It's new ownership now so things have changed a lot and I cant say that it has changed for the good. I guess you get used to things and sometimes you just don't like change!Aside from the beer, the sliders are AMAZING, the fries are AMAZING and the ranch dressing (I know that's weird) is AMAZING!!!!!!! Make sure you try them!!!

6.description: Jets is a small bar, its dive-ish atmosphere works if your trying to come here to watch sports, especially the blackhawks. I was here when they won the Stanley cup and it was rocking. I recently came here for a Bulls playoff game, it was pretty empty but, they have plenty of TVs no matter what angle you sit at. When it comes to food and beer list Garage next door has them beat no doubt. Garage I would say is more of a social place, less TV's, no sport audio, and nice rooftop. But if you wanna go out and Watch and Hear the game this is a nice spot.

22.description: One the best bars for food. Chicken wings are excellent and you get a lot. Also the sliders are amazing. Everything tastes fresh. Come early cause the place gets packed.

15.description: Really popular around the neighborhood.  Really exciting sports bar. Good deals. They havr karakoke nights on Sundays I believe.  Come on in n check it out Also good specials on wings!

20.description: I always love going to this place. The staff is so nice and friendly. The food is good, especially the sliders. The only thing is they need to get a better recipe for guacamole. To hot and too chunky! You can't even eat it. Otherwise, this is a great place to hangout with your friends or even meet up with your friends. Plenty of TV's to watch sports. And good daily specials. Monday is 1/2 price apps. Wednesday is 1/2 price burgers.

36.description: Love jets, great drink deals, chill clientele, great place to watch a bears game.  Excellent wings and super cheap food.  Heavy police and fire crowd but very good local bar.

14.description: Went to a birthday party on Saturday night.  Everything was great. Even though the bar was crowded with other customers, the staff went out of their way to take care of our group. Food was delicious and was served hot which is great when a place is that busy.  I'd recommend Jet's.

28.description: I'd give them a 3.75 stars. I went on a Tuesday night for a one hour Swedish massage. They had ample slots when I called the night before. Don't be misled by the Google map street shots. The place has been renovated since. It was clean and bright. I was a few minutes late (thanks rush hour traffic) so I went right into the treatment room. My therapist quickly introduced herself and got to work. It was a good massage. I feel like she had a very good understanding of anatomy/musculature. Some therapists feel a need to bludgeon you into a pulp, but she used smooth, medium-pressure. I don't know how to describe it except that it felt very accurate. She didn't chat with me too much, which I prefer. The cons: The music was at times really weird -- very synthetic -- which distracted me. I found it odd that there was no intake, no asking about specific needs or medical conditions.My massage was $65, which didn't feel like a rip off. It wasn't the best massage I've ever had, but it was far from the worst. I'd say this is a good choice if you live really close to it and like a straight-forward service-driven salon experience. If you're looking for a destination relaxation/spiritual spa experience where you get a fluffy robe and flavored water and chill out post massage reading magazines -- this place is not it. Like the massage, I'd characterize it as "proficient."

1.description: Great location, (only 3 blocks from my house!) Clean. Took me on the spot as a walk-in. Very bright and welcoming coming in. The rooms were well keep. Plan on coming back for a scalp massage and possibly a facial!

9.description: All I can say is this place is absolutely horrible for massages. Just trust me when I say...pass on this place.

29.description: This is my fav place to get a massage in Chicago. The salon is a bit unasuming on Milwaukee/Elston intersection..but it's fantastic inside. It's just as beatuful, professional, as Exhale or any other place downtown.  Massage is around 70, and 10 if you want to use the steamroom. Great layout hereReal treat for Northsiders. Ann is my favorite! She is the only person I will let massage my back. I sit a lot at work and she always knows the knots I have and my back/neck/shoulders feel incredible afterwards.I've gone to other places if I have a coupon or deal somewhere..but I haven't found anyone who knows how to get rid of pain/knots as well as Ann. I just went today..and I feel fantastic!!!!!

23.description: I went there for facial and manicureFacial was OK, i had better but this one was not bad at all.But the manicure was horrible. I am not even sure that they dispose all the tools, ive got cut twice and it was kinda painful. So i will not go there for second time.

5.description: I just had an amazing sports massage! The spa staff was beyond amazing. They dealt with my husband and my crazy work schedules and we're absolutely more than willing to accommodate us. My massage therapist was absolutely delightful as well as educated. She knew names of muscles and used her expertise to heal my poor legs! She was absolutely amazing!!! I will FOR SURE  be back!!!!

31.description: Really please with the atmosphere at this neighborhood spa. I went with a friend on a Sunday afternoon and it was quiet and relaxing. The hours are great - how could you NOT find a time to get in. The owner is really nice and the products are all top notch. I had a manicure and she made my sad hands look great. I will definitely be back!

25.description: LOVE that spa is open on Sundays! Had excellent massage from Tiffany on mothers day and used their steam room. Had seen some comments that steam extra cost, etc but for $10 was worth it as it is a PRIVATE steam room which is nice and different from catch-as-catch can with some other big name salons downtown. They also seemed pretty liberal with the time allowed in steam room. There's a shower, locker and similar set up you might find at an Urban Oasis or similar but without the same price tag.Think their pricing is completely reasonable and they frequently run specials (mothers day pkgs, etc.) which make it an easier choice to treat yourself. Again, the hours seem to accommodate a working mom's schedule with the Sunday hours.  I'm a fan!

12.description: I love this place. I have been going here for over 4 years now (maybe longer) and cannot imagine going anywhere else. I love a good massage but always hated going to to those chain type places, they were so impersonal and far from my house. I did my research and found this place within a mile from my house. And I am so glad I did. I have not been anywhere else since. I don't just go for massages, I also go for waxing, pedicures, facials, and mud wraps. Each experience has been pleasant and personal. As of recently, I have had to go there for scar tissue massages from a recent ankle injury. Not only are they professional, they are personal too. When they heard I broke my ankle, they made sure to check on me and give me well wishes. I have taken a few family members here as well for spa day celebrations for their birthdays, and they have always enjoyed themselves too. They also run a great Bears promotion, if they Bears win, they have $50 massges the next day. What a way to get me into the Bears. There are always Mother's Day promotions as well. And if you want to create your own spa day, they will work with you to create a package for you and your guest to enjoy. I also know some people who have tried other places after trying thee european spa, and they always come back. I highly recommend them.

37.description: This is THEE place for a massage!!  After trying other places I have found that Ann (an older Polish woman) at Thee European Spa is the ONLY person that has the strength to massage my aches, pains and stress away.  I have had several massages here and everyone is good but not everyone can fix my aching back.  I highly recommend this place if you have deep muscular pain from sports or the gym or anything like that.  I'm going there today!!!

21.description: I was really hankering for a good massage last minute and I called Thee European Spa and they were able to take me in 15 minutes. As I lived only 10 minutes away I was ecstatic about this. When I got there the girl at the front desk checked me in and had me fill out the paper work. At the bottom of the form was a space to provide your credit card number and I told her that I was not comfortable leaving my number so she said she had to charge me before the massage took place, which I have never experienced at a spa before. The space was decent and looked clean. The room I got my massage in was OK as well, but the massage table was definitely low grade as it was creaking loudly during my massage. Not only that, there was a bolt or something sticking out of the face holder and made it very uncomfortable on my face. Before the massage started, my therapist asked me what areas bothered me the most and I told her my lower back and a little of my shoulders. I would say she probably spent 98% of the massage on my shoulders 1% on my limbs and 1% on my aching, soar lower back. I was VERY disappointed with my massage. I paid nearly $100 for it including tip and have to say that I have received better massages at the MALL for way less! Not going to go back to this place. Two stars for taking my appointment on late notice and for the cleanliness, 0 stars for the quality of massage.

16.description: I am way behind in posting this, as my massage was probably 8 months ago.  However, I had a fantastic one last night which reminded me of this not so great experience.This was, by far, the worst massage I've ever received.  I asked for deep tissue, I am accustomed to it after years of back issues.  The massage I received from Ann quite honestly felt like someone running baseball bats up and down (and side to side) my back, legs, arms and the bottom of my feet.  I actually thought she was going to pull my arms out of my sockets.  I have never been so uncomfortable and in so much pain after a massage.  It took me four days to recover.  Normally, about 24 hours after deep tissue, I feel great!  But her force way over does her capacity to even find tight muscles.  This was the worst money I've ever spent on a massage.  The facility is nice and the receptionist accommodating.  But that's not what I came for.I asked her four times to ease up - she said 'you do not like my technique?'  and I said it was uncomfortable, and that I didn't care for the constant rubbing up and down directly on my spine.  She said 'you will get used to it!'  Really?

17.description: I went there for facial and manicureFacial was OK, i had better but this one was not bad at all.But the manicure was horrible. I am not even sure that they dispose all the tools, ive got cut twice and it was kinda painful. So i will not go there for second time.

10.description: Sadly, a friendly receptionist and cute decor did not make up for the fact that this was the worst Brazilian ever :-(

11.description: Loved my massage. Had hot stone massage felt great, just enough pressure.The salon was very clean, professional staff. And they were very accomadating on a last minute appointment. I will definitely be coming again.

26.description: I don't know whether this is the place I would have gone had I researched massage therapists, etc. for several months, but after pulling a muscle in my upper back/neck while working-out this morning, I needed someone to save me from the constant pain and immobility of my neck. I was very pleasantly surprised, and will definitely go back. First, it's convenient, being just a few miles away and parking is great. It looks like a little nail salon, but once you go back to the rooms, it is nice and clean and comfortable and the woman who did my massage was absolutely perfect. She really seemed to know what she was doing and was very thorough. I say "seemed" because I have only had a few massages, so I am no authority. She was also very nice and professional. I will definitely be going back.

27.description: I love this place!  The spa is so charming and super clean.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  Prices are great.  Had a couples massage with my hunny for Valentine's Day and both of us felt wonderfully relaxed when we left.  Go there!  You will not be dissappointed!

35.description: Price was good, but massage was mediocre at best.  I asked for combination Swedish/Deep tissue massage.  Told her where I was in need of work.  She proceeded to grind her elbows into my back.  Skinny little young Polish girl - not enough hand/arm strength, so she used elbows.

8.description: I went for a facial and have had much better. More time was spent on the massage of my shoulders and neck then on my face.

0.description: Thee best massage in the city!Those of us who really know Chicago realize that you have to get out of Lakeview once and a while, especially when you seek top notch service at a reasonable price. That is what Thee European spa delivers in terms of massage therapy. Please understand that is truly therapeutic treatment for your muscles. It's not all that fancy or romantic. If you want fancy head up to Kohler and if you want romance go ask your loved one for a back rub.I went to Ann about 10 years ago and just recently returned for treatment. Ann and her staff give a deep, vigorous massage. No soft tickle treatment.  I was really sore the next day, and I think that's a good sign.  In terms of a gratuity, I'd suggest a generous 20%. This is a personal service and I think the providers should be rewarded for good work.

38.description: This is the kind of massage that smacks the health back into you.  Do not plan to do much the rest of the day except drink water.  They healed my heel pain without my even mentioning that I had a problem.  They expanded recently & have a gorgeous mani pedi room  - best pedi chair I've ever cuddled up in.

20.description: My third. time here.  Massages no matter which one.......Awesome!  Facials & Pedicures are also Awsome. I Love how clean it is and how professional and caring the staff is.  You feel like an old friend is taking care of you:). It is reasonably priced, close to home, and has free street parking.  City living benefits @ its best!

19.description: Nice facilities, friendly staff, good hours, and if you want the best deep tissue massage on the planet, ask for Ann.  She's the best.  I always feel like a new person when I am done with my massage.

33.description: I want to like this place even after several times of going but I would really like it if they didn't charge you for using their steam room for $10 for 20 minutes!  At Heavenly Massage in Morton Grove if you get a massage the steam room is complimentary.  The massages are good but would not recommend the mani/pedi. The lady who did my mani/pedi the two different times I had, did a strange unconventional way of removing my old nail polish. She used a nail file to file away the polish!  I had to tell her to stop it and use nail polish remover and then she was really rough with the way she filed my nails and pushed my cuticles too hard. I've gone here because I get gift certificates from my family plus it's close to home and convenient but I would like to try other massage places hopefully near home because I feel like mush and so relaxed afterward all I want to do is nothing!  :o)

2.description: This review is way overdue but I'm a busy working mom, which made my experience at Thee European Spa that much more frustrating.  I went for a facial around Christmas time because I had some Spa Finder gift cards and my trusty aesthetician whom I'd been going to for years had moved out of state. The receptionist was very sweet, which was the only positive. I cannot remember the aesthetician's name,  though I'm not sure she was actually a real aesthetician now that I think about it. Worst. Facial. Ever.  I have finally found a great aesthetician at Essence Medispa, and she and I laugh about this story because it is so bad. I was taken to a room with horrible pink sheets on the bed, though I would have been okay with that. She put the steam on me and left the room. For twenty minutes.  I kid you not.  I heard her starting a pedicure or something on the other side of the door.  When she finally came back, she proceeded to tell me that her favorite part of doing a facial was the extractions. Then she extracted every single particle out of my poor face,  massaged it for about 30 seconds, and put this cheap cucumber mask on me. I swear to God it was one of those 99 cent masks in a pouch you can buy at Walgreens. It was sticky and I found pieces of it in my hairline until I showered. Then,  SHE LEFT AGAIN.  FOR HALF AN HOUR. She was definitely performing another service because I could hear her with another customer. This was seriously one of the most ridiculous experiences of my life.  If I had not had those gift cards and had spent my hard earned money on this joke of a facial, I probably would have lost my cool.  I was angry enough that I'd spent my precious "me" time in the pink room waiting for a facial that never came, but I just left quietly.  I will never go back. Never.

34.description: Wow.  I just came from a massage here and am still in awe.  Seriously.  Especially considering I've been searching for a good massage therapist for several months since moving back to Chicago from Portland and this place is only two miles from me.  After about four months without a massage, I went to Chicago Touch only a week ago and my experience was so completely awful that I needed to go again. This was SO good that halfway through my hour massage I asked if there was any way to extend it to 90 minutes.  Cindy said she would ask another girl if she could continue for another 30 minutes--she could.  And Jordana might have even been more amazing.  I had a deep tissue/Swedish combination and they primarily worked on my IT band and neck/shoulder areas.  They were really professional, sweet, thorough, responsive, and STRONG.  I completely recommend this place.

32.description: I get deep tissue massages regularly and had tried many places until I found Thee European Spa.  This is the only place I go now because I know I'll get a consistently excellent massage, regardless of the therapist.  I think this has a lot to do with the fact that it is a family owned business and the owner herself is a massage therapist who takes a personal interest in the quality of service.

18.description: Sam gave an amazing Swedish massage! Loved the warm towels she covered each section with after being massaged and the bonus foot reflexology. Perfect amount of pressure and wonderful attention to neck/head and face. Aaahhh...totally relaxed.  Always love my treatments at this local gem!

13.description: I came here on a Saturday with a last minute booking for a couples massage with my boyfriend and it was a pretty ok experience. We were looking for something close to home and we found this place. It was $140 for both and it seems like a pretty good deal for what you get. The place was very clean, a bit cold though for a massage place. The music was pretty odd, I wouldn't really say relaxing but more like belly dancing music. It made it a bit hard to relax. My massage therapist was a woman, maybe in 30s? I completely forgot her name, but she was great. She asked about the pressure and asked what I did want and didn't. So I appreciated that a lot. My boyfriend said his therapist which was a thin blonde young woman was okay but not so great when it came to the legs. He seemed skeptical about it from the beginning so maybe it was just bc he wasn't comfortable? Not sure. My biggest complain is that the room we were in was downstairs so we could hear LOUD water pipe noises.. That pretty much  killed any relaxation. It was loud and lasted for maybe a 30sec too long. They do have specials if the bears win, they have massages for $50 the following day which is pretty cool. I probably would not come again just because I've been to other places, like massage envy and I fall asleep because of how relaxed I am..I'm looking more for that and quietness and warmth in a massage salon/place. I guess I'd probably go back only if I couldn't get a booking for massage envy. The extra $ from them is pretty worth it after trying this place out.

4.description: I have been a customer at this business for a number of years All the services are wonderful. I am sorry to say I don't get over there enough. Last week my brother-in-law hurt his back. He called me and asked for Ann's number in hopes that a massage would help him. He came back later to pick my sis up and he looked and felt so much better than he did before the massage. I think he was amazed at Ann's skill.Love ya Ann-there is no one like you!20 stars for the European Spa.

24.description: Great massage, very professional,will be back!

6.description: This place was great. Me and 2 of my friends went in for a spa day.  We had a massage, pedicure, facial and eyebrow wax. It was a great day. The staff was very accommodating and nice. The facility is very clean. It wasn't even that expensive. We will go back for sure!UPDATE: Since this review, I have been back 5 times. Same excellent service every time!

22.description: I went here two days before my wedding for a facial and mani/pedi.  My best friend (and maid of honor) went with me.  We were both excited because the prices sounded terrific, we had coupons, and it's in the old neighborhood where we grew up.  Our appointments were scheduled at the same time, and, as it was a Wednesday afternoon, I guess there were only 2 people working because it's not too busy. I would have preferred being able to sit and chat with my friend as we got our nails done, but they had to split us up.  (Not a big deal, and definitely not why I'm rating this place so low.)  I will say the place was nice and clean, and the masseuse was very polite and friendly.  The esthetician (whose name I'm incredibly frustrated that I can't remember) not so much, but I'll get there.  The facial was okay.  Not something I'd make a point to go back there for, but not bad.  My only caveat was having my nose and cheeks pinched and squeezed "to get any extra oil that might be in there out".  I'm pretty sure a Biore strip would have been sufficient.  My friend told me as we left she actually stopped the girl mid-pinching and told her to move on.  While my friend was getting her facial, I got my nails done.  As I mentioned, this was right before my wedding, and I wanted to make sure the nailpolish would hold up for the next two days (at the least).  Both my friend and I asked the esthetician for a no-chip manicure.  Here's where the trouble started.  The esthetician said they only had one no-chip topcoat, and carried on with the manicure.  Gentle is not a word that comes to mind, by the way.  I've had dozens of manicures before, and never once has anyone cut me.  This lady ripped my cuticles down so low I had dried blood under one cuticle bed for days.  When I noticed I was bleeding, I asked for something to wipe it off with and she just shrugged and said it would wash right off.  Initially, the manicure looked great.  Once my friend and I left, I didn't give it much more thought until the next day when I saw the polish on my nails was already cracked.  Not something one expects to see with a no-chip manicure less than 24 hours after it's done.  I only had the no-chip put on my hands, and today, nearly 3 weeks after, my toes still look like they were done yesterday.  I guess I should have skipped the topcoat, but with 2 kids at home, I didn't want to take the chance.  My friend had the same problem, and was furious.  She went back to the spa the following day before heading to our rehearsal.  She was coolly informed by the esthetician that the no-chip topcoat we asked for "doesn't work with OPI" but because we asked for it, she didn't say anything.  She wasn't surprised that the manicures already looked cracked and were starting to chip.  She told my friend that's "just what happens when you use the wrong topcoat".  And obviously, this is where my issue with the place stems from.  At no point did this esthetician inform either of us that the no-chip topcoat they had would not work with the OPI polish they had. Why they didn't have a no-chip topcoat that DOES work with OPI (since anywhere else I've been seems to), I don't exactly understand, but that's neither here nor there.  She also never offered an alternative.  And, as neither my friend or I are estheticians, how the **** should we know what works with what?  I'm always amazed-- and not in a good way-- at how some people screw up and blame the person on the receiving end of their mistake.No, nobody noticed my jacked up nails at my wedding.  Not even me, as I had such a wonderful time.  Afterward, however, I found I could not remove the polish with acetone, or anything for that matter.  I had to chip at it and scratch it off, which as any girl knows is not the best idea.  An added surprise?  My nails are stained from the polish (a first for me).  They'll grow out and so will the stain, I know, but for now I have coral-stained nails and no desire to return to Thee European Spa.  Ever.

15.description: The massage was one of the best I have ever received. She knew exactly what to do and where to hit. I asked her her name a few times, but alas I was so relaxed that I forgot before I had a chance to write this review. Camille? Cassandra? Sorry!!The pedicure was not so great -- no dryer to speak of so my toes were totally smudged when I got in the car.The place is super clean and quiet. The girl at the front desk seemed a little dingy, FYI.

7.description: NOW they are LYING about what happened!  I specifically stated EXACTLY what I was told. This;"Ma'aam, I know you are upset, but people are getting massages, and it's hard to relax."   They have decided to state that  my "newborn" (she's 9 months old) was there and that is why I was told to keep it down. This is a full on LIE!  Why is this place still in business?

36.description: To prepare for the new job, my friend and I decided to indulge in a full body massage.  We found a special, $50 for an hour.  Whoooo-hooo!!!  You can't get a massage for less than $110 in SF, so I was excited.  I'm not counting the cheap-y Chinese places where you can hear the women squawking at each other in the neighboring rooms.  It's not Burke Williams, but it definitely had a nice ambiance and my masseuse Anna was great!  Her hands were strong, and It was painful, but a good pain.

30.description: I went when they had the special, and I am now a fan! This place is great. The people were so nice and took my friend and I last minute. Really clean. I can't wait to go back!

3.description: Best massages in town hands down. Also the best, fastest and most painless waxing ever. Just an all around great place. If your looking for a ladies day- they have a kitchen, beautiful deck and fantastic massage chairs for mani/pedis too. It's honestly the best spa around and fair prices. Everyone that I've met that works here, from the receptionist to the masseuse peeps, to the waxing professional are so nice and professional. Great place! Can't stress that enough.

14.description: The girl that did my nails was friendly, and the salon was clean and nicely decorated, however, my mani/pedi was horrible. It was so bad that later I went to another nail salon to have a polish change. My nails looked like a 5 year old painted them, and I left with polish all over my skin despite asking multiple times to remove it. She also did not put a top coat on one of my nails and after an hour the nail still wasn't dry and kept smudging. I requested a refund which they said they would give, but I have yet to receive it (a week later). I wont be returning to this spa.

3.description: In October of 2013, my wife and I purchased an RC beginners mode helicopter which cost around $100 for my 10 year old son. After using it only one day it started malfunctioning. I couldn't find the time to take it in for the RC tech Chris to rake a look at it.Finally in February of 2015 I was able to bring it in. Chris inspected it and tried numerous part replacements on a motor and  blade gear. After attempting to fix it and couldn't resolve or pinpoint the exact problem, Chris replaced the copter with no extra charges for a brand new one. Needless to say I am extremely satisfied with the quality if service, I didn't even have to argue my point and was surprised that after more than a few months they still honored the warranty and replacement hassle free.Hats off to Chicagoland Hobby, I will definitely be hoping there again for an upgrade and highly recommend them!

1.description: Friendly and knowledgeable staff meets great prices and good stock. Got into Scalextric slot cars recently and they helped me get into a set I love at a great price. Returning for more track of course but that's a good thing!

2.description: I've only been here once and it was amazing! I loved how they had everything set up, very clean and organized. I don't remember the name of the man that helped me but he was very sweet and patient. He didn't rush me or try to sell me what I didn't need. I will definitely go back.

9.description: It proved a challenge for me to hold my tongue when I walked into Chicagoland Hobby.  See, I started out flying an E-flite mCX helicopter that I purchased about a year ago from HobbyTown USA in Orland Park.  Seeing as it was time to upgrade to something a little more advanced, I did my requisite research online, and was almost ready to order something from xheli.com when I thought, "nah, any hobby shop in the Chicago area should carry a selection of E-flite that would suit my needs."  I walked in there on Saturday, October 24 2009 and wasn't greeted at all.  Maybe a cursory glance, but that was about it.  And you'd think, "hey, maybe they're busy with the trade show that's in town," or "hey, maybe they have a lot of customers that they need to help."  And...you'd be wrong.  There were 2 people working in the front of the store: a teenager that was trying his best to grown a scraggly beard, and an older man that looked like Santa Claus.  They were REALLY busy because they couldn't figure out how to save a picture to the hard drive or something like that (presumably for upload to their "awesome" website.)  That should have been my first hint that this experience was going to be TURRRRRRRRRIBLE.  Another sales person was working in the back, and I think that for the 10 minutes I was there, I saw one customer come in.  Ratio's looking pretty good right?  WRONG.  I noticed a sparse collection of heli's, but I decided to be proactive so I walked up to the counter and asked Santa Claus, "Do you have any other 4 channel co-ax helicopters here?"  And he looked at me like I was squawking at him in Chinese or something.  And for those of you who know me, you'll know that my English is the stereotypical flat midwestern drawl.  So I said it again.  And maybe Santa Claus might have been hard of hearing, but it was probably just because he was incompetent.  Finally, teen werewolf understand what I'm trying to say and says, "Oh, most of our heli's are at the trade show, but the ones that we have are sitting up there."  Thanks buddy - maybe if I were blind I would not have noticed that "the ones you had were sitting up there..." No offer to explain the differences, no offer to even talk to me about anything else.  Presumptively, he was still having a hard time figuring out how to save photos to the hard drive.  Which is astonishing because you'd think that a teen werewolf working in a HOBBY SHOP would have LOTS of experience saving pictures to the hard drive when he's at home.  If you catch my drift.So I went back downtown for a little, had lunch in Skokie, and then drove up to HobbyTown USA in Northbrook.  And get this - the heli I ended up getting was sitting right there in Chicagoland Hobby all along.  It's just that no one bothered to try to sell it to me.Across multiple media and end user, this place is WORSE than Gilbertson Clybourn, which for a long time I thought would be the worst customer service I'd ever experienced.Good job, Chicagoland Hobby - when the recession kicks your ass and you lose your lease on the place, Santa Claus will have to apply for a job as a, well, Santa Claus at the local mall.  But honestly, I couldn't give a rat's ass as to what happens to this shop.  I hope that the flooring company across the street gets the space so they can expand.

10.description: Preamble: Like many people in Chicago, I am originally from south east michigan. I grew up with a number of good hobby stores. I never thought about how nice they were until I came to chicago.I am only into RC stuff so it is quite possible that this location is better for other hobbies. I have only been to this place once and that visit was quite short. I may have just had a poor experience that one timeSubstantive: Inventory: This place sucks. They have very few products and their sales staff do not seem to know anything about what they carry. Sales staff: I asked for a simple prop for my RC plane. The sales people had no idea what I was talking about when I mentioned the size. They did not even know where their own inventory was located (Not that it even made a diference since they did not have anything close to what I needed). They probably have just one guy that knows about each thing. It is nice to have a specialist in a retail location but the non-experts should be at least competent in areas that they do not specialize in.Prices: I did not stay long enough to compare themRedeeming qualities: noneOverallThis place is even worse then strictly RC. If you live in the north side of chicago and like R/C then you should probably stick to buying online.

4.description: Awesome place, need I say more.

6.description: Chicagoland Hobby has become even more significant now that we have lost several old school high customer service hobby shops in the last year.  Greg Bosak and his shop are a source for out of production model RR equipment in a market that is increassingly becoming limited production buy it now or never see it again.  Greg is the kind of hobby shop owner who makes a real attempt to help you the customer track down the model item that when  it was common was of no interest to you but now has become your passion and even obsession..  Greg really does try to connect model RR hobbyists  who have items they are ready to part with with hobbyists who are extremely frustrated with their inability to find an item that has captured their imagination.  We traction modelers are a small community and most hobby shops ignore us, within the reason of inventory control Greg has continued to stock and make available trolleys, interurbans, el cars, trolley poles, books and magazines and all those things that allow one to nurture an interest in traction.  And then go down the list in other types of HO/N/Lionel/G/ equipment and then plastic, die cast and RC and then you see a hobby shop that is making a major effort to be inclusive of any many people as possible in hobbies.  Greg , his staff and his shop really does embody the  philosophy of "HOBBIES FOR HEALTH."  This shop is a rare throwback to the golden age of hobbies and hobby shops.

12.description: LIONEL TRAINS. 5 stars.That's what you go there for. it's quite obvious the moment you walk through the door that this place caters PRIMARILY to the Lionel train crowd. That being said, I'll break it down Barney-style for some of our slower reviewers- Chicagoland Hobbies DOES NOT cater to the RC Helicopter crowd. Yes, they have some stuff, as well as slot cars, model airplanes and such, as does any respectable hobby shop, but they primarily specialize in LIONEL TRAINS. If you want knowledgeable help in RC Helicopters, go to a shop that specializes in RC Helicopters (Try Al's Hobby Shop in Elmhurst- if you don't have wheels, no sweat. Metra drops you off 1 block away. Worth the trip). If you need Lionel, come here.

5.description: This place is great, I am so happy I finally found a place with modest employees who won't gloat about how many different cars they have and how much better their brushless system is. I walked in and a guy named Paul, helped me out. Found a good car and motor upgrade, and purchased it on the spot. They even showed me some other cool stuff, but I passed and will probably come back later on. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone that is new or looking for awesome customer service!

13.description: I have been back 2 times since my last review and both times I had exceptional customer service! I bought a starter rocket kit the first time (waiting for a great non rainy day to launch it), and starter model kits the 2nd time in. I am really happy with the gentleman that helped me both times. I almost positive he is the owner. I will find out the next time I see him.

11.description: I like Chicagoland Hobby.I'm one of those guys who actually liked making models and had one of those huge model train layouts as a child.  As I got older, my interest in the hobby waned and it all went into boxes in the attic.So, we've actually got the room *gasp* to start building a decent train layout in Chicago.  I brought all of my stuff home, went to Chicagoland Hobby, and dropped about $400 on track and track supplies for my O-Scale layout.  (Easy to do.)  I got going on my layout, then did some more homework on the advancements in the hobby in the past twenty years.  Long story short, I just feel priced out of the hobby and wanted to switch back to a smaller scale.  I called them, explained what my problem was, and they said "No problem...just bring the stuff back."  I thought that was pretty awesome, as it had been probably a year since I purchased that stuff, and I didn't have a receipt. It's a hobby shop for train hobbyists, mostly.  Sure, they sell all of the other stuff and can tell you all about it, (rockets, planes, boat kits, scouting stuff etc, etc.), but the specialty and real enthusiasm here seems to be for trains.  The folks at the counter aren't terribly gregarious, but most serious hobbyists I know aren't.  If you ask them a question, they'll give you a good answer and some options.  (Re: I asked about some ideas on a complex layout wiring problem, and the guys took the time to draw it out and provide me with some options.  Sold me the stuff I needed, told me if it didn't work to bring it back.)  I like coming on weeknights when it's a little less busy.  As with any shop, the guys are more willing to "talk shop" with you, let you know what's coming from your favorite manufacturers, etc.The prices are fair, but Chicago prices nonetheless.  Sure, you can get it online cheaper, but where do you go to talk to somebody about it when you want a tip or a trick which can save you time or money?  Definitely beats the pants off of Des Plaines hobbies, "The Home of Full Retail."  The selection, especially for O scale, is wonderful.  They do a lot of consignment stuff too, so you can catch some really good deals if you hit it at the right time.  I thought the O-Scale stuff, specifically the locomotives, were more competitively priced than the N-Scale stuff.  Some of it is actually even cheaper than you can get it online, believe it or not.In sum, it's a good local hobby shop and I'm glad we have it.  I highly recommend them and hope that you check them out.

8.description: Great store with a great owner. The selection of trains is amazing. They have expanded their plastic model selection and have a good selection of beginner r/c planes and helicopters. Probably one of the best hobby shops left in Chicago.

0.description: Popped into the store this evening to pick up a Cub Scout uniform for my son.  Both the men working were really friendly and helpful.  My son loved looking around the store.  So much stuff!  Will definitely go back again to check out the cool model planes, trains, cars, etc.

7.description: This place is amazing. Chris in the RC section spent a lot of time helping a noob like me pick out a quadcopter. Selection was pretty decent, though as a beginner, I don't know everything that's out there. Owner Greg was very helpful on our second trip there. If you can, do business directly with Greg. You can tell he loves what he does.

1.description: This place is full of chraracter and characters. Every time I've stopped in here for a drink (and their selection of beverages now runs the gammit, from Coors Light to Lagunitas and Revolution), I've made drinking buddies for the evening with some guy or gal who reminds me of a happy-go-lucky drunk relative. The new owner is a down-to-earth sweetheart, and the remodeling makes the place feel like you are drinking in your basement bar. Don't miss this gem!

2.description: This bar has been here forever (aparently) but has been closed for the past couple of years (as long as I've lived in the neighborhood).  Recently they have made renovations and re-opened and it is fabulous. The owner/bartender Evie is a delight without being too nice, very down to earth but accomodating at the same time.  If you're in the neighborhood and want a quaint little spot to have a beer or cocktail, The Little Bar is the place.

0.description: The" Little Bar" is Little. ok I expected that from it's name, but it's very Cozy, a great get a way from your every day nonsense. they have fair prices, friendly neghiborhood atmosphear. I will be back who knows? Maybe today?

58.description: The Garage is one of the mainstays on our rotation of places to go when we don't want to cook or feel like getting out of the house.  I'm also so Jaked that warmer weather is coming and looking forward to being able to enjoy the rooftop, which is probably one of the benefits this bar has over the other nearby places. The food is delicious, generous portions, and a fairly diverse menu selection for a bar.  The beer menu alone will take a few minutes for you to process and the bloody marys are perfect: not so strong that your throat choaks on Vodka, but certainly not so weak that you wonder if these were secretly bloody virgins.I've never had a bad meal here and they have lots of alternatives to the usual burgers and fries at most bars.  The portions are about right -- not over board but definitely not small at all -- and they have an outstanding large selection of craft beers.  The wait staff is friendly and fast.  I do feel sorry that they don't have a dumb waiter and our poor waitress had to carry heavy trays up to the roof, but hey she's gonna have awesome quads and gluts!the only downside is the rooftop is zoned for smoking.  Smoking is permitted upstairs, though it isn't entirely clear if it is the entire outside area or just beyond the sign.  And frankly, when it comes to cigarette smoke, it doesn't really make a difference.  As the joke goes, having a smoking section next to the non-smoking section is like having a non-peeing section in a pool.  But hey they have the right to smoke especially if The Garage is zoned for it and all I can do is make fun of them on this site.

56.description: Fun place to watch any game, they have an awesome outdoor patio & always have good specials on food and drinks. Highly recommending checking this place out, the parking situation on the other hand can be a little better

29.description: What an awesome place in the neighborhood! The service is excellent, as well as the food and drink. If you are looking for a change of scenery come to the garage, you have the option of sitting on a rooftop patio which is completely unique to the area. They have a food menu with plenty of options for everyone and very large beer selection. You won't be disappointed!

42.description: My husband and I had a late Sunday lunch on the rooftop terrace. The food was good and the beer selection was great! Loved the outdoor space and the spice was good too.

23.description: The food is great here.  Everything was delicious and looks amazing. It's a little pricey but worth it!

47.description: Dayummm this place was amazing! I got some chicken focaccia sandwich, and my friends got a burger, and some fish tacos. Everything was delish. In addition we got a side order of fries and quesadillas. Even if you just got the entrées, you would have been filled to the brim, so the starters really stuffed us. Great place, would come back in a heartbeat if I wanted a big ol' burger and a tall glass of beer.

8.description: One of my favorite places but please, no kids!  Makes for a totally different experience

31.description: We've been here many times and decided to host my ends-with-a-zero birthday party here on the rooftop. Never had a private event here and the staff did an amazing job. This place is SUCH a hidden gem! Gorgeous space. We lucked out with a perfect evening. Crazy good food (ginormous pretzels, spicy mac and cheese, freakin' amazing quesadillas, heirloom/mozzarella caprese salad is dreamy... oh, I could go on!). Accommodated my all-vegetarian request without batting an eye. Excellent service (thank you so much Lisa and Dina), a great time had by everyone, many of whom had never been there and are planning to return again and again.

34.description: I love this place for beers and the rooftop in the summer... But food wise the last few food menu items have not been good at all... The pizza... Something frozen from Jewel is better, and as for the Mac & cheese... It was disgusting. How bad can you mess up pizza & Mac N Cheese? They definitely need to reduce the menu or get a new chef

16.description: The Garage is one of the mainstays on our rotation of places to go when we don't want to cook or feel like getting out of the house.  I'm also so Jaked that warmer weather is coming and looking forward to being able to enjoy the rooftop, which is probably one of the benefits this bar has over the other nearby places. The food is delicious, generous portions, and a fairly diverse menu selection for a bar.  The beer menu alone will take a few minutes for you to process and the bloody marys are perfect: not so strong that your throat choaks on Vodka, but certainly not so weak that you wonder if these were secretly bloody virgins.I've never had a bad meal here and they have lots of alternatives to the usual burgers and fries at most bars.  The portions are about right -- not over board but definitely not small at all -- and they have an outstanding large selection of craft beers.  The wait staff is friendly and fast.  I do feel sorry that they don't have a dumb waiter and our poor waitress had to carry heavy trays up to the roof, but hey she's gonna have awesome quads and gluts!the only downside is the rooftop is zoned for smoking.  Smoking is permitted upstairs, though it isn't entirely clear if it is the entire outside area or just beyond the sign.  And frankly, when it comes to cigarette smoke, it doesn't really make a difference.  As the joke goes, having a smoking section next to the non-smoking section is like having a non-peeing section in a pool.  But hey they have the right to smoke especially if The Garage is zoned for it and all I can do is make fun of them on this site.

13.description: The Garage gets CROWDED when it comes to hockey (HAWKEY!)Be aware, they do not take reservations (and when they get as crowded as they do, I don't blame them!) and it is highly advised you arrive 2 hours to game time.  I showed up an hour before and had to get scrappy for a table.For being so busy, service was very good.  Drink refills were offered as often as our glasses got low, and our server was upfront about a back-up in the kitchen.After perusing the entire menu more than once, I hastily settled on the tuna tacos in an effort to remain somewhat healthy.  On the side I had elote and sweet potato fries.Everything that we saw coming out of the kitchen looked amazing, but my tuna tacos left me wanting more.  I shoud've gone with the burger.I'd say it is safe to say I'll be back to try again.

11.description: Always a pleasure. A great place to relax and share your time with good food, good drinks and welcoming atmosphere. Can't say enough about the industrial look of the place.

39.description: I love this bar for several reasons: #1THE FOOD IS AMAZING!!! #2 GREAT beers on tap (local selections) that are always changing; as well a vast beer list! #3 Bartenders are fast and very knowledgeable at what they do!! I can always ask their opinions on different beers & suggestions. And LASTLY, i would like to mention here in this review that i both commend AND APPRECIATE that they turn away patrons with young chrildren after dark (approx 8/9pm) -ish. This is a B-A-R...a great bar, that I as an adult enjoy. People need to stop for a second and realize that the last thing i want to do is unwind, relax, kick back, hangout, or sit around while being subjected to, nor tortured by your annoying snot eating obnoxious creature of a child because you cant find a babysitter or weren't considerate enough to wear a condom to prevent such an atrocity to be birthed into humanity. Thank you, also try the wings they are hella good :)

37.description: Service is great and the drinks are good. The outdoor patio was nice for the neighborhood

0.description: This place continues to impress. Service with a smile and a whole lotta competence. Most gracious and accommodating even at closing time. Beer selection is one of the best on the street. This visit was a California stout that was smooth and creamy. The beer paired well with my chipotle chicken sandwich that was on a bakery fresh tomato focaccia that reminded me of Italy...and I've never been to Italy! Needless to say, owners on property who work it with a passion always makes me smile. Bravo Garage, you are a well run joint!

38.description: The Garage Burger is the best I've had in the neighborhood. They have Not Your Father's Rootbeer on tap. Rooftop patio is great for catching some sun. Gets busy sometimes, but thankfully has a great beer menu to keep us occupied. Can really tell that the staff loves this place.

51.description: We checked out this spot on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't too packed which was a nice surprise. I just had drinks but my friends that ate said it wasn't anything special. Our drinks were fine and the spot is ok. I'm glad we checked it out but not sure if I'll be back.

27.description: Never fails us! We bring our kid, our friends, our in-laws;sit rooftop or restaurant- food is always excellent as well as service. It is our go to for a great easy bar meal and drinks.

32.description: Great food - can't wait to go back. Our only complaint is the location - we wish it was closer to the city. ;)

54.description: Not sure how the bar is, but the food is terrible. I ordered a jibarito from this place and they gave me the thickest most undercooked tostone that was so dry that I couldn't even eat it.

48.description: Awesome food. The giant pretzel is a great appetizer and the mushroom sandwich is amazing. The atmosphere is great and the servers and bartenders are so much fun. Great place to hang out.

44.description: In the past, I have enjoyed bringing family and friends to The a Garage Bar & Sandwiches for its good food, and because it's close to where we live. I have also brought out of town guests. That's why I was absolutely shocked when we were recently turned away for having a child in our party after arriving a bit after 8 pm on a summer night when the restaurant had plenty of empty tables. We had gone to an event in the neighborhood and were looking forward to again bringing guests here for dinner. An employee informed us we "probably wouldn't be finished eating by 9 pm" at which point they were apparently prepared to kick us out for simply having a child dining with us. She confirmed it didn't matter which area of the not-very-busy eatery we sat in, it's just "this bar" that doesn't allow anyone under age 21 after 9 pm, regardless of when you arrive.
