I was offended, and instead had dinner at another bar and restaurant in the neighborhood with my party and was more than happy to give them my business instead. After learning that this has happened to other former regular customers, I've decided I will never give this place my business again. This is a family neighborhood. Know your customers.

24.description: Went first time right before Halloween. Good food , great service and good drinks. We tried many times to go there but our timing was was always bad. We tried always before they were open. We finally got timing right and it was a great lunch. The servers had their hands full with a family with twin boys that left a big mess. That was just rude parents. But the servers took care of everyone and the clean up . It took three servers to clean up after those slobs. They apologized for them and they didn't have to. The servers were great on trying to keep everyone happy and served well. The sweet potato fries were to die for! The "Garage Burger" is a must try. We will be going back.

7.description: Great food, great drinks, just remember that this is a bar and gets crowded quickly!  I have be never had a bad meal here, even with all my kiddos in tow!

49.description: Honestly this place is FLAAAAAME af. Best food and staff in the neighborhood. Krystin is the bomb! CARMELA CARMELA CARMELA CARMELA!!!!!!! Sooooo good. Also they play great music when no one is playing songs on touch tunes. I love it when my song El Sonidito comes on.

40.description: I was there tonight with my husband and 3 daughters.  We had the ginormous pretzel app and burgers, pizza, mac n cheese, and a shredded chicken sandwich.  All of it was very good!! The amount of food offered for the price was excellent!  We brought home several containers of leftovers - lunch tomorrow.  Our server Joan was attentive and kept our glasses filled without issue.We did not try any beer tonight, but we'll definitely be back without our girls for a date night.  My only regret is that we just became aware of this great place.  We thought it was a "new" restaurant, but I see it's been open for quite awhile. We'll be back for sure.

53.description: A great local bar. Great atmosphere and a HUGE beer selection. Their food is not just the usual bar snacks. They have clearly put a lot of thought into each of their menu items, which changes every few months or so. It consists of mostly sandwiches and salads but the quality of the ingredients is great. The bread is fresh from local bakeries and the soups are made from scratch. Like I said, not the usual frozen-then-fried bar snacks. It's a great place to grab dinner and drink or enjoy watching a Blackhawks game. And in the summer time, their patio is great place to hang out with friends. The waitresses and bartenders are always friendly. Overall, just a really great place.

30.description: I have to say our food was very good. I had the Alforno sandwhich with sweet potato fries. My husband had The Malecon Sandwhich with Mac & cheese. Both were delicious! Problem was first the service, we were ignored for quite some time by the bartender. Finally he took our drink order. The mojito is a nice size, but had no liquor. I ordered 2 and didn't even catch a buzz. Finally I order a Long Island it was horrible. They should just serve beer or give some lessons  to their bartenders on how to make a drink. It was way too loud for a Sunday night, some of the clientele were obnoxiously loud. Definitely not a place for kids, glad we didn't bring them. Won't be going back anytime soon.

46.description: My family and I were regulars at The Garage Bar until Saturday night when we were turned away at the door AT 8:15 PM for the awful crime of (gasp) having some elementary-age kids with us. We will never return to this business after that experience, and I hope the owner of this establishment reads this review to learn about how ridiculous his/her "no kids" policy is. Feel free to dine here in on date night, but if you bring your kids for the quesadillas, pizza, or mac and cheese on the menu, well F-off. We had friends visiting from out of town with their daughter and had just finished up watching Shakespeare in the Park at Wilson Park. We always had a good experience at The Garage Bar so we suggested we go there for dinner. We were a party of eight people. We have well behaved kids. We walked in the door just after 8:15 pm and the server who came to greet us at the door looked at the kids, gave us a disappointed look and said "We have a policy that nobody under 21 is allowed in here after 9 pm.""It's 8:15," we said. "Yes, but you probably won't have time to eat your food by 9 p.m.," she said. "And I'm worried I'll get in trouble."We looked around the bar. There were maybe three tables with people at them, and at least 8-10 tables open. It was about 25 percent full."But the place is nearly empty. Are you saying you don't want our business? We're going to order eight meals and drinks," we say."Sorry, that's our owner's policy. It's just this bar," she says, acknowledging the owners are apparently clueless. "Nobody under 21 after 9 pm.""Again, it's 8:15 pm," I said. "Ok, I guess we won't be coming back here ever again."So, owner of The Garage Bar, you might want to revisit this "no kids after 9 pm" rule you have. While I can understand why you don't want kids in the place during late-night drinking hours, in this case we were TURNED AWAY AT 8:15 PM ... apparently because you'd have the waitress kick us out at precisely 9 pm whether we had finished our meal or not. Anyway, we went up the street to the Iron Horse Ale House on North Northwest Highway and had a great meal and good beer. Our meal took about an hour and we spent more than $120 there. Next time you're looking for a good meal on the NW side and (God forbid) have children with you, go to the Iron Horse Ale House instead. The Garage Bar is apparently doing so well that the owner has the luxury of refusing a party of eight on a Saturday night when the bar is almost completely empty. Good luck with that business plan, Garage Bar. You're going to do great in a neighborhood of families. I guess the empty tables on a Saturday should have told us what we needed to know. Jeff and Gladstone Park folks, don't bother with this place.***Please note the "Shame on you" attitude of this owner's response for bringing our family to dine at their establishment at 8:15 on a Saturday before the sun even set. Criminal. Sorry to bother you during business hours.

1.description: "pretty" is a good adjective for this place. the food is pretty okay, the service is pretty slow, and the beer list is pretty alright, but most of the actual good stuff is gone by the time you visit this spot.at essentially $3 a mac and cheese empanada ($9 appetizer supplies three), i was neither utterly disappointed nor utterly impressed. i thought the mac and cheese was very flavorful, but the empanada crust was too weighted. the ranch on the side is nice, though.the ginormous pretzel is really quite ginormous. it's served with a honey mustard that's pretty good, but i much preferred the jalapeño queso dip. the beer cheese was just okay. the pretzel was cooked perfectly.i ordered the white rabbit pizza: 10" thin crust with garlic roasted wild mushrooms, gorgonzola, mozzarella, pesto, and tomatoes. i thought it was pretty tasty, but found it to be even better cold the next day. please be warned: the garlic STICKS! i love garlic, but i brushed my teeth twice AND rinsed with mouthwash to remove all my self-consciousness about the situation.i tried both the pork belly blt and the drunken monte, and both were pretty tasty as well. the best part of the s'mores dessert is the graham cracker. make sure you fight your way to the bottom of the dish!likely not going to rush back any time soon, as there wasn't anything particularly impressive with the food or drink. their rooftop looks like it would be fun in the summer, though.

55.description: This place is way overrated ! Food was mediocre, service was terrible .  Nobody greeted us upon arrival, or when we left, although the bartender looked up and there was a waiter working the floor. We proceeded upstairs to deck, again nobody greeted us, so we asked a waiter at the drink station if we should seat ourselves. He seemed irritated and pointed us to a table. After a good ten minutes  someone took our drink order. Huge beer list, only one brand of wine, Woodbridge.The waitress told us that the kitchen was backed up, but couldn't tell us how long the wait would be for food because she was afraid to ask the cooks since they were busy cooking . Weird.  So we got the pretzel appetizer which was enough for four,  and with tasty dips.  The waitress was scarce, I would have had another 2 drinks if she had checked in regularly.  As it was,   I had to ask for water twice, then ask for a refill. C'mon you're not that busy .Mac and cheese was spicy,but the menu didn't advise that. Pulled pork was blah. And this is one of those places that give you chips or charge you an extra $3 for fries. Just charge 12 dollars instead of nine dollars for the sandwich and throw some fries on the plate. No one  wants your stale chips. Decor was cute, outside area was lovely.  So if you go here, skip the food and just grab a bottled  beer . I don't care, you won't be running into me there!

9.description: I've been here once before on a weekend night for drinks.  I recall this place having "Not Your Father's Root Beer" on tap and decided to grab a late lunch/early dinner and some root beer beer with friends.  This visit was also St. Patrick's Day weekend.  We arrived around 3:30...a few tables were open.  They have an extensive beer list, and a drinks specials list, and their food list... all looked pretty fab.  I was debating between a chicken sandwich and burger... burgers were huge!!! My friends ordered those while I decided on a chicken sandwich...also good.  We substituted our fries with tater tots... can't go wrong with a place which offers tots!  Love me some tots!!!!Not Your Father's Root Beer is a rare find... so I'm always pleased to find a bar which offers this!  So so good!!!Of course we had to get the big pretzel as an appetizer...when they say this thing feeds four, it feeds FOUR people for sure!!! We got all three dipping sauces - mustard, white queso, and beer cheese, all were very tasty.  We definitely enjoyed this appetizer.This is your typical city bar with a neighborhood feel to it, but not a dive bar... just a bar with some great atmosphere!  I no longer live in the area but I will keep this place in mind when visiting again in the future in seek of drinks and eats.

26.description: Hands down my go to bar for literally every occasion. It has a nice atmosphere for casual drinks and food, and a rich sports influence that you can't not experience at least once. Food is always on point..I try to get something new every time i go, especially when the menu changes..and have yet to be disappointed. The beer menu is also a key highlight, when i go i try at least 1 or 2 beers i never have before, which adds to return business. Between a great unique menu for food and beer, you can literally have a different experience time and time again going to the same warm welcoming bar that they have established in the Jefferson Park area. If you have ever driven past this place and never gone in, you are missing out big time. A big plus note for nice weather is the upstairs patio. That is the spot in spring and summer espically if you are on a date or just hanging out watching the game. Overall this bar can cover all bases of a night out no matter what the occasion.

25.description: They have the ultimate BLT there and apparently it's only available on Saturdays. But when we went on a Tuesday, the waitress offered to ask the kitchen to make it. And they did! The bacon was a little bit fatty for me, but still had a nice crunch, balanced out with a good amount of bread and lettuce/tomato.Service overall was good and we got checked-up on regularly. I have to lower my rating a star because when we were somewhat ready to pay and leave, we were asked to either move to another table, as there was a party of 7, and they wanted to use our table to Voltron and combine with another table. It's not like we were lingering and talking forever, but they wanted to accomadate others, I suppose.

12.description: I have enjoyed the Garage on several occasions, even having a retirement party there.  But after last nites experience, it will be my last.  After ordering drinks one in our party did not like the taste of her beer.  After asking for a new one, the waitress said that we would still be charged for the bad beer.  My friend drinks this beer regularly and wasn't changing her mind, the beer just didn't taste right.  I spoke to the bartender and he explained to me that its bottled beer and it was not possible that the beer was bad.  So after ordering apps and one round of drinks we quickly canceled our food and paid our bill and left.   It's too bad, we have spent plenty of money there and many of our friends too.  I can no longer recommend the Garage and will be spreading the word to others in the neighborhood.

59.description: Good food, great service. All of the staff were very welcoming on a early Sunday afternoon. I was there with 4 rugrats and the crew kept them happy and well fed, Raquel was especially helpful. Will certainly be back

21.description: Always a pleasure. A great place to relax and share your time with good food, good drinks and welcoming atmosphere. Can't say enough about the industrial look of the place.

17.description: Delicious everything pretty much! God service and fast. Always have a good music selection and atmosphere.

10.description: The service here was great, but I kind of expected more from the food. Overall, it was a good experience but I'm not sure I would return for anything other than a drink.

5.description: If you wanted a bar that defines "local, neighborhood bar", this would be it. Their extensive beer list and great bar food which includes deviled eggs and a list of burgers, this place is great to meet up with friends for a low key, fun evening out. They have flat screen TVs all over the place with multiple games going on which definitely makes it easy to pick and watch any game you want. And if a Chicago team is playing... well... everyone gets involved. Loud cheers ring out every time they do well, which adds to this bar's unique ambience.

3.description: Great food and fantastic service.  We had the dragon burger with ghost pepper cheese and the phat Italian.  Both were delicious.  If you are worried about the ghost pepper, the cheese just gives the burger a big kick.  Erin our server was super friendly and very informative.  If you are looking for fancy this is not your place.  If you are looking for good food, good drinks (150 beers!) and great service in a child atmosphere, this place is for you!

35.description: I love this pub.  It's very nice and the rooftop is really quite excellent.  I enjoyed the food I got here and I would definitely return.  I do not love the smoking that is permitted on the roof, but I guess if you are a smoker, that may attract you to this bar.  Also-they have some decent specials each day.

19.description: Incredible food and service with a unique menu and insane beer list. A hidden gem! One of the BEST bars in Chicago

28.description: This is a great neighborhood bar on the northwest side where similar spots are sort of lacking.  Excellent beer selection and a more impressive menu than I was expecting. I had the mussels (yum!) and a salad with goat cheese and prosciutto and both were delicious.  I tried some new beers on this visit and enjoyed them both. Prices here are reasonable too. Glad we checked it out.

45.description: My wife and I enjoyed the Garage several times on our own, but when we showed up one evening with our kids, we discovered the staff's terrible negative bias toward children. Families stay away.

33.description: I really like The Garage. It has good food, a big selection of beer (craft, locals ) and the service is always good.  On our most recent visit I had the Garage burger with tater tots. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked, delicious. Anytime tater tots are offered, I'm happy.  This place has a roof top deck, darts and plenty of tvs to watch the game. It can get crowded on the weekends but still a great little place to enjoy a drink. Definitely will keep coming back.

43.description: Great selection of beer on tap and bottled. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable of good being served.

2.description: Pros: the atmosphere, the service, the pretzel, the Margarita, Cons: the old fashioned, the veggies that came w the wings (they seemed soggy)Went to watch the NFL playoffs. It was packed. Got the last table. Looks like they open the front during the summer and have a rooftop. Place was inviting. Service was very friendly and often, even with the crowd.Drinks clearly used something natural for mixers in some form which was great but the old fashioned was weak.The giant pretzel is worth it. Comes with a good mustard and a cheese that reminded me of lox because it uses smoked gouda. Wings were good and 50 cent special on Sundays.

18.description: Amazing sandwiches that melt in your mouth.  I recommend "the Dolly" sandwich if you want something with just the right amount of soccer.  The atmosphere feels great and our waiter was on point as was the entire staff. If your looking for a feel good place this is it.  Will definitely come here again and show other people about here.

41.description: After hearing great reviews of The Garage since moving nearby last fall, we finally tried and it didn't disappoint. The upstairs patio was crowded on a nice summer Saturday night but the staff separated a long run of tables so we didn't have to wait long. Our waitress was clearly busy, but we never felt unattended. The seared tuna app was really good, as was my pizza and my wife's burger. I only have one complaint, but it's enough to take it from 5 stars to 3: STOP  PERMITTING SMOKING on the roof deck!! Smokers will patronize your bar even if they have to go outside to puff like everywhere else in Chicago. The only thing you do by accommodating the 10% of your customers who smoke is inconvenience the other 90%. Let them ruin others' dining experience someplace else. A repeal of this policy would make it much easier for us to return and recommend to others.

52.description: Easily one of my FAVORITE spots to enjoy a cocktail on their rooftop deck or catch a sports game! A huge selection of beers and a menu that never seems to disappoint! Everything that I have ever ordered has been very good! If you are on the northside of chicago and want to enjoy an nice spring/summer day or evening go the Garage you will not regret it.

50.description: Hubby and I heard great things about this place. The Garage did not disappoint. I had the Garage burger and elotes and he had the same with tater tots.Our burgers were exactly as ordered and the elotes was darn good! Tots were plentiful, which was awesome cuz he shared lol. He had a few brews with his meal, while I stuck with ice water.Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant  (Erin) she checked on us as needed but never over bearing. We never felt rushed nor wanting for anything.We sat upstairs and it was lively and spacious. The cook rocked our meal...the waitress made us feel very welcomed and *home* The decore is warm and the prices will not stretch your wallet..most def. A new fav on our lunch/dinner/ grab a brew list.I haven't written a review in a while. I felt it is important to let others know of the locally owned ,small places with big tastes and welcoming repore in the hub bub of our neighborhoodsNot a chain...nor fast food grab..just a fun place with much postive engery. :)

4.description: Amazing place!!! Food is exceptional with a rotating menu. Rooftop patio is a great place just hang out in the spring or summer. Crew is always curious and prompt with our orders. My go to spot when in need of a great meal or if I just want to hang with friends. Would rate 10 stars if I could!!!

6.description: They have the ultimate BLT there and apparently it's only available on Saturdays. But when we went on a Tuesday, the waitress offered to ask the kitchen to make it. And they did! The bacon was a little bit fatty for me, but still had a nice crunch, balanced out with a good amount of bread and lettuce/tomato.Service overall was good and we got checked-up on regularly. I have to lower my rating a star because when we were somewhat ready to pay and leave, we were asked to either move to another table, as there was a party of 7, and they wanted to use our table to Voltron and combine with another table. It's not like we were lingering and talking forever, but they wanted to accomadate others, I suppose.

22.description: Hands down the worst customer service that I have ever experienced and/or endured. For the moment that I walked in the front door with my family, it was immediately apparent that we were not wanted by the owners nor the bartender.  It's such a shame that a neighborhood bar AND restaurant would be so rude to its customers. I could never recommend this establishment to others.

15.description: Woah, ho ho!!! What a burger this was!My wife got the garage burger and I got the Thai chili chicken pizza. My pizza was good. A little too thin on the crust for my tastes. Additionally, if something has the word "Thai" in it, there should be a little zest to it. This had not. On to the basket of sweet potato fries. They were awesome and thick cut. I never knew sweet potato fries tasted this good with ketchup. At this size, I could try.Now, as for the garage burger. It was awesome. Best burger I've had in years. The bun was properly toasted, the egg perfectly fried, the cheese melted oh so delicious, and the burger cooked to perfection. They put avocado on it, which I'm at odds with. On one side, I love avocado. I mean, who doesn't? People that suck. That's who. But, when you have a gooey burger with a slippery layer of avocado on the bottom, it makes for some difficult eating. Hands down: get this burger. The chips they serve are spicy and delicious.As for the service, it was on par. The decor is awesome. They had some garage band-ish music. Oh, and free street parking. Win, win, win.I'll be back.

57.description: The Garage gets CROWDED when it comes to hockey (HAWKEY!)Be aware, they do not take reservations (and when they get as crowded as they do, I don't blame them!) and it is highly advised you arrive 2 hours to game time.  I showed up an hour before and had to get scrappy for a table.For being so busy, service was very good.  Drink refills were offered as often as our glasses got low, and our server was upfront about a back-up in the kitchen.After perusing the entire menu more than once, I hastily settled on the tuna tacos in an effort to remain somewhat healthy.  On the side I had elote and sweet potato fries.Everything that we saw coming out of the kitchen looked amazing, but my tuna tacos left me wanting more.  I shoud've gone with the burger.I'd say it is safe to say I'll be back to try again.

20.description: This place is always on the ball, whether it's drinks or food! Can't ever go wrong, any day of the week.

36.description: they have an awesome beer selection, a cool menu, and an awesome patio. def want to visit this place again! my only complaint is that I felt like the server was kind of pushing me out at the end of the night when there was still 30 min to close, but I will still come back,

14.description: I ended up at Garage Bar one night unexpectedly. I was nearby and hungry and thought I'd stop in.The food was good. I ordered one of the sandwiches and gobbled it up, along with the delicious sweet potato fries. I had the Sailor Jerry to drink, which was only $3.50 on special that night, and thought it was quite refreshing. They offer different food and drinks specials each night, and all sounded good. I regret not trying the wings - they looked good when the next table over had some brought to their table.Unfortunately, it was still a bit too cold for the rooftop to be open, but I will need to check it out soon.Service was quick and friendly. If you grew up in the area, you're sure to see a friendly face there any night of the week. I'll be sure to head back soon.
